definition: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).|This is acknowledged to be a bundled term but retained here because of its usefulness in practice. Ear length is determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear. If only length is increased the term Long ear should be used.

name: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
label: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.

name: Recurrent otitis media
label: Recurrent otitis media
definition: Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.

name: Conductive hearing impairment
label: Conductive hearing impairment
definition: An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.|A conductive hearing impariment with greater than 90 dB loss.

name: Sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.|Hearing loss caused by damage or dysfunction of the auditory nerve (cranial nerve VIII, also known as the cochlear nerve).

name: Progressive sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Progressive sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A progressive form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Mixed hearing impairment
label: Mixed hearing impairment
definition: A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Protruding ear
label: Protruding ear
definition: Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).

name: Atresia of the external auditory canal
label: Atresia of the external auditory canal
definition: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.

name: Bulbous nose
label: Bulbous nose
definition: Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose.|This is a bundled term, but as it is useful in practice it is kept here. This alteration of size and shape may be limited to the tip, but may involve the lower third of the nose. If only the width of the nasal tip is increased this should be coded as Broad nasal tip.

name: Abnormality of the choanae
label: Abnormality of the choanae
definition: Abnormality of the choanae (the posterior nasal apertures).

name: Narrow nasal ridge
label: Narrow nasal ridge
definition: Decreased width of the nasal ridge.|This feature may be accompanied by narrow nasal bridge and narrow nasal base, which should be coded separately.

name: Abnormality of the nasal septum
label: Abnormality of the nasal septum
definition: An abnormality of the nasal septum.

name: Short nasal septum
label: Short nasal septum
definition: Reduced superior to inferior length of the nasal septum.

name: Epistaxis
label: Epistaxis
definition: Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.

name: Abnormality of the nasal bridge
label: Abnormality of the nasal bridge
definition: Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.|The nasal root is the most depressed, superior part of the nose along the nasal ridge.

name: Prominent nasal bridge
label: Prominent nasal bridge
definition: Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.|A prominent nasal bridge can occur irrespective of the width of the nasal bridge, and the width should be assessed separately. The nasal bridge becomes more prominent with age. Although the nasal root may be anteriorly placed without increasing the space between the eyes, prominence of the nasal bridge may be accompanied by Telecanthus or ocular Hypertelorism. If such findings are present these should be coded separately. Deep-set eyes may lead to the impression of a prominent nasal bridge, but this finding should be coded separately.

name: Abnormality of the nasal alae
label: Abnormality of the nasal alae
definition: An abnormality of the Ala of nose.|The nasal ala is the tissue comprising the lateral boundary of the nose, inferiorly, surrounding the naris.

name: Underdeveloped nasal alae
label: Underdeveloped nasal alae
definition: Thinned, deficient, or excessively arched ala nasi.|The alae nasi are the lateral portions of the nose or the wings of the nostrils, which partly encircle the nostrils (nares). They are usually about the width of the columella, but vary greatly depending on the shape of the nostril. Note that individuals may be described as having a Cleft ala nasi, but have a severely underdeveloped ala nasi. In an underdeveloped ala the continuity of the tissue encircling the nostril is undisturbed while in a cleft it is disrupted. With severe hypoplasia of the nasal alae, the nasal tip may appear depressed.

name: Wide nasal bridge
label: Wide nasal bridge
definition: Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).|Care should be taken to distinguish between increased width of bone and Fullness of paranasal tissue. A wide nasal bridge should be distinguished from Telecanthus and Hypertelorism. A wide nasal bridge can be either prominent or depressed, which should be coded separately.

name: Nasal mucosa telangiectasia
label: Nasal mucosa telangiectasia
definition: Telangiectasia of the nasal mucosa.

name: Abnormality of the nasal tip
label: Abnormality of the nasal tip
definition: An abnormality of the nasal tip.|The nasal tip is located at the junction of the inferior margin of the nasal ridge and the columella. Commonly, it is the part of the nose furthest from the plane of the face. In rare circumstances, such as markedly prominent and convex nasal profiles, other parts of the ridge may be further removed from the facial plane.

name: Depressed nasal tip
label: Depressed nasal tip
definition: Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base.|This often accompanies a Short columella, Overhanging nasal tip, and Underdeveloped nasal tip, but these should be assessed and coded separately.

name: Convex nasal ridge
label: Convex nasal ridge
definition: Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.

name: Wide nose
label: Wide nose
definition: Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.

name: Narrow nasal bridge
label: Narrow nasal bridge
definition: Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.|The narrowness may be accompanied by a sharp, keel-shaped appearance. The nasal bridge may narrow with age.

name: Prominent nose
label: Prominent nose
definition: Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.

name: Choanal stenosis
label: Choanal stenosis
definition: Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

name: Choanal atresia
label: Choanal atresia
definition: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

name: Broad nasal tip
label: Broad nasal tip
definition: Increase in width of the nasal tip.|Nasal tip width is assessed at the anterior junction of the alae and the tip. This is easier in persons with a somewhat squared shape of the nasal tip. This may be best viewed from the inferior aspect of the nose. No objective measures are available. See Bulbous nose for a related term.

name: Bifid nasal tip
label: Bifid nasal tip
definition: A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.|This is a rare congenital deformity due to failure of the paired nasal processes to fuse to a single midline organ during early gestation.

name: Depressed nasal ridge
label: Depressed nasal ridge
definition: Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.|The adjective 'depressed' here does not indicate an active process but a status. The feature should be assessed in a profile view. This finding is typically associated with a Short columella, but this should be assessed separately.

name: Anosmia
label: Anosmia
definition: An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.

name: Narrow nose
label: Narrow nose
definition: Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.|Note: a small nose has both decreased height and a decreased width. These should be coded separately.

name: Anteverted nares
label: Anteverted nares
definition: Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip).|The tip of the nose is upturned and is positioned superiorly to the nasal base, allowing the nares to be easily visualized from the front. With maturation and growth of the nasal ridge and tip, the nares usually become more downwardly directed.

name: Abnormality of the neck
label: Abnormality of the neck
definition: An abnormality of the neck.

name: Webbed neck
label: Webbed neck
definition: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.

name: Neck muscle weakness
label: Neck muscle weakness
definition: Decreased strength of the neck musculature.

name: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
label: Increased adipose tissue around the neck
definition: An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.

name: Short neck
label: Short neck
definition: Diminished length of the neck.

name: Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia
label: Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia
definition: Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Long neck
label: Long neck
definition: Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.

name: Torticollis
label: Torticollis
definition: Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.|The word torticollis comes from Latin words meaning twisted neck. Spasmodic torticollis is a focal dystonia that affects the neck and sometimes the shoulders, leading to involuntary contractions of the neck muscles, abnormal movements and postures of the head and neck. The abnormal movements can have both tonic and clonic components and can results in pain and discomfort. Spasmodic torticollis is the most common focal dystonia.

name: Thickened nuchal skin fold
label: Thickened nuchal skin fold
definition: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (PMID:16100637).|A thickened nuchal fold should be distinguished from cystic hygroma, in which the skin in this area has fluid-filled loculations. A thickened nuchal fold should not be confused with nuchal translucency, which is a specific measurement of fluid in the posterior aspect of the neck at 11 to 14 weeks gestation (see practice guidelines at http://www.sogc.org).

name: Broad neck
label: Broad neck
definition: Increased side-to-side width of the neck.

name: Cystic hygroma
label: Cystic hygroma
definition: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.|Cystic hygroma refers to a cystic lymphatic lesion, that can in principle occur anywhere in the body, but is most commonly seen in the head and neck region. The term 'Cystic hygroma' alone is generally used to refer to cystic hygroma of the neck.

name: Abnormality of the eye
label: Abnormality of the eye
definition: Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.

name: Abnormal retinal morphology
label: Abnormal retinal morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the retina.

name: Retinal coloboma
label: Retinal coloboma
definition: A notch or cleft of the retina.

name: Abnormal cornea morphology
label: Abnormal cornea morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.

name: Microcornea
label: Microcornea
definition: A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.|Note that the cornea's diameter is normally about 9.5-10.0 mm at birth and reaches 10.0-12-5 mm in adulthood.

name: Astigmatism
label: Astigmatism
definition: A type of astigmatism associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea.|The irregular curvature associated with astigmatism means that the optical system is not symmetric about the optical axis. Most commonly the cornea is affected such that the refractive power in one meridian is less than that of the perpendicular axis. Astigmatism of significant degree causes blurry vision.

name: Hyperopic astigmatism
label: Hyperopic astigmatism
definition: A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.

name: Megalocornea
label: Megalocornea
definition: An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.

name: Strabismus
label: Strabismus
definition: A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.

name: Retinopathy
label: Retinopathy
definition: Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.

name: obsolete Abnormality of globe location or size
label: obsolete Abnormality of globe location or size

name: Deeply set eye
label: Deeply set eye
definition: An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.|This finding should be distinguished from a prominent supraorbital ridge or inferior orbital margin. In Deeply set eyes, the globe is recessed in comparison to the overall prominence of the face. There is no known objective measurement, and diagnosing this feature depends heavily on the experience of the observer.

name: Keratitis
label: Keratitis
definition: Inflammation of the cornea.

name: Abnormal eyelid morphology
label: Abnormal eyelid morphology
definition: An abnormality of the eyelids.

name: Abnormal foveal morphology
label: Abnormal foveal morphology
definition: An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.

name: Downslanted palpebral fissures
label: Downslanted palpebral fissures
definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.

name: Recurrent corneal erosions
label: Recurrent corneal erosions
definition: The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.

name: Abnormality of eye movement
label: Abnormality of eye movement
definition: An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.

name: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction
label: Globe retraction and deviation on abduction

name: Blepharitis
label: Blepharitis
definition: Inflammation of the eyelids.

name: Abnormal eyelash morphology
label: Abnormal eyelash morphology
definition: An abnormality of the eyelashes.

name: Glaucoma
label: Glaucoma
definition: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.|The feature that differentiates glaucoma from other causes of visual morbidity is a characteristic pattern of damage to the optic nerve head. This is most easily recognised at the superior and inferior poles of the optic disc. The vertical cup:disc ratio (VCDR) has proved to be a simple, relatively robust index of glaucomatous loss of the neuroretinal rim. As with intraocular pressure, VCDR is a continuous variable within the population.

name: Abnormal conjunctiva morphology
label: Abnormal conjunctiva morphology
definition: An abnormality of the conjunctiva.|The conjunctiva is a thin, sparsely vascularized transparent membrane that covers and protects the sclera (the bulbar conjunctiva), and forms the inner lining of the eyelids (the tarsal conjunctiva).

name: Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels
label: Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels
definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.

name: Abnormality of vision
label: Abnormality of vision
definition: Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).

name: Visual impairment
label: Visual impairment
definition: Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.

name: Telecanthus
label: Telecanthus
definition: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.|Dystopia canthorum (also called telecanthus) describes a subtle but unusual facial feature in which the inner corners of the eyes (canthi) are spaced farther apart than normal, yet the eyes (pupils) themselves are not necessarily widely spaced.

name: Ptosis
label: Ptosis
definition: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).

name: Conjunctivitis
label: Conjunctivitis
definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva.

name: Rod-cone dystrophy
label: Rod-cone dystrophy
definition: An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.|Retinitis pigmentosa is a group of hereditary diseases of the eye. However, the term retinitis pigmentosa has also been used to describe the retinal findings characteristic of these diseases but also seen on other diseases such as Usher syndrome. It is preferable to describe the findings precisely if possible, but this term is kept for convenience.

name: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
label: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.|Vertical gaze palsies can manifest as selective limitation of upgaze or downgaze.

name: Abnormal electroretinogram
label: Abnormal electroretinogram
definition: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.|The electrical responses of the photoreceptors (rods and cones), inner retinal cells (bipolar and amacrine cells), and the ganglion cells can be assessed by ERG.

name: Slow saccadic eye movements
label: Slow saccadic eye movements
definition: An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.|Saccades are rapid eye movements that align the fovea with the target.

name: Abnormality of the lens
label: Abnormality of the lens
definition: An abnormality of the lens.

name: Cataract
label: Cataract
definition: A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule.|Note that some ophthalmologists call any opacity in the lens a cataract, while others restrict the term to lens opacities that impair vision. We use the term to refer to the first meaning (any lens opacity).

name: Developmental cataract
label: Developmental cataract
definition: A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.|In general, congenital cataracts are bilateral and that is the assumption with the terms in this cataract subhierarchy.

name: Proptosis
label: Proptosis
definition: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.|Some sources define "exophthalmos" as a protrusion of the globe greater than 18 mm and "proptosis" as a protusion equal to or less than 18 mm. Others define "exophthalmos" as protusion secondary to endocrine dysfunction and "proptosis" as any non-endocrine-mediated protusion (Source: Wikipedia). This finding should be distinguished frm underdevelopment of the supraorbital ridge or maxilla/zygoma. In proptosis, the globe is anteriorly protuberant to the overall plane of the face.

name: Alacrima
label: Alacrima
definition: Absence of tear secretion.|Alacrima is generally a congenital deficiency.

name: Subcapsular cataract
label: Subcapsular cataract
definition: A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens.

name: Conjunctival telangiectasia
label: Conjunctival telangiectasia
definition: The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.

name: Abnormality iris morphology
label: Abnormality iris morphology
definition: An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

name: Aniridia
label: Aniridia
definition: Abnormality of the iris characterized by, typically bilateral, complete or partial iris hypoplasia. The phenotype ranges from mild defects of anterior iris stroma only to almost complete absence of the iris.

name: Long eyelashes
label: Long eyelashes
definition: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).|Measurement should be done on the longest lashes, which are usually at the center of the lid. Normal values are 7.99 - 1.05 mm in boys and 7.76 - 1.03 mm in girls. Note that Eyelash trichomegaly is defined as increase in length (12 mm or more), curling, pigmentation or thickness of eyelashes.

name: Anophthalmia
label: Anophthalmia
definition: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

name: Progressive visual loss
label: Progressive visual loss
definition: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.

name: Abnormal chorioretinal morphology
label: Abnormal chorioretinal morphology
definition: An abnormality of the choroid and retina.|The choroid is the vascular layer of the eye, located between the retina and the sclera.

name: Chorioretinal atrophy
label: Chorioretinal atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.|Choroidal sclerosis is a descriptive term applied to the ophthalmoscopic appearance of prominent white choroidal vessels in which the blood columns are not seen or are sheathed by white lines. Choroidal sclerosis is a term used to describe a group of genetically heterogeneous retinal dystrophies that share a common funduscopic phenotype of scalloped, well-circumscribed, and confluent chorioretinal atrophic lesions that extend beyond the macula. The term choroidal sclerosis was initially coined because of the sclerotic appearance of choroidal vessels which frequently appear white or light-yellow. However, histologic studies have demonstrated the term to be a misnomer as the principle abnormality is the loss of choriocapillaris, retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), and the outer retina in the absence of abnormal sclerotic changes in the choroidal vasculature. Therefore, we are making choroidal sclerosis a synonym of chorioretinal atrophy.

name: Abnormal eyebrow morphology
label: Abnormal eyebrow morphology
definition: An abnormality of the eyebrow.

name: Sparse and thin eyebrow
label: Sparse and thin eyebrow
definition: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs.|Sparseness can be regional (medial, central, lateral) or total. These modifiers should be incorporated into the term, when appropriate.

name: Epicanthus inversus
label: Epicanthus inversus
definition: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

name: Pseudopapilledema
label: Pseudopapilledema
definition: Apparent optic disc swelling in the absence of increased intracranial pressure.|Papilledema is disc edema secondary to increased intracranial pressure.

name: Abnormality of refraction
label: Abnormality of refraction
definition: An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.

name: Hypermetropia
label: Hypermetropia
definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.|The American Optometric Association subdivides hypermetropia into (i) low (up to +2D), moderate (2 to 5D), and high (over 5D).

name: Retinal detachment
label: Retinal detachment
definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.

name: Impaired ocular adduction
label: Impaired ocular adduction
definition: Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.|Contraction of the medial rectus pulls the eye towards the nose (adduction or medial movement).

name: Optic disc pallor
label: Optic disc pallor
definition: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.|Optic disc pallor can be judged clinically with serial color photographs or by comparison to the other eye. The pallor reflects replacement of dead axons by glial tissue. The loss of the small capillaries within the nerve accounts for the shift from orange-pink to white.

name: External ophthalmoplegia
label: External ophthalmoplegia
definition: Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.

name: Myopia
label: Myopia
definition: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.

name: Retinal degeneration
label: Retinal degeneration
definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells.

name: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
label: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
definition: Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.

name: Undetectable electroretinogram
label: Undetectable electroretinogram
definition: Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.

name: Color vision defect
label: Color vision defect
definition: An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.

name: Tritanomaly
label: Tritanomaly
definition: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.

name: Abnormal uvea morphology
label: Abnormal uvea morphology
definition: An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball.

name: Uveitis
label: Uveitis
definition: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.|The uvea is the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.

name: Leukocoria
label: Leukocoria
definition: An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection.|The word leukocoria literally means white pupil, but leukocoria is not an abnormality of the pupil. Rather, leukocoria can be caused by cataract, retinal detachment, retinopathy of prematurity, retinal malformation, endophthalmitis, retinal vascular abnormality, and intraocular tumor (e.g., retinoblastoma).

name: Retinal dystrophy
label: Retinal dystrophy
definition: Retinal dystrophy is an abnormality of the retina associated with a hereditary process. Retinal dystrophies are defined by their predominantly monogenic inheritance and they are frequently associated with loss or dysfunction of photoreceptor cells as a primary or secondary event.

name: Buphthalmos
label: Buphthalmos
definition: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) associated with glaucoma.|Buphthalmos refers to a congenital open-angle glaucoma of the eye. The term buphthalmos (from Greek 'bous' or ox and 'ophthalmos' or eye) is descriptive of an enlarged eyeglobe resulting from increased intraocular pressure. The eyeglobe is especially prone to distension in newborns and infants because its collagen filaments are not as rigid as in adults and may easily be stretched.

name: Rieger anomaly
label: Rieger anomaly
definition: A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.|Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the iris as well as iris strands to the peripheral cornea.

name: Absent eyelashes
label: Absent eyelashes
definition: Lack of eyelashes.|Often this finding is congenital and associated with alopecia universalis, but this should be coded separately.

name: Keratoconus
label: Keratoconus
definition: A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea characterized by the presence of corneal distortion secondary to thinning of the apex.|Keratoconus is an entity characterid by several phenotypic findings such as corneal distortion (secondary to thinning of the apex) and either Fleischer's ring or Vogt's striae. This HPO term intends to denote the finding of corneal distortion and bulge.

name: Lacrimal duct atresia
label: Lacrimal duct atresia
definition: A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.

name: Esotropia
label: Esotropia
definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed') to a relatively severe degree, usually defined as 10 diopters or more.|Esotropia is analogous to but more severe thatn esophoria. Affected children are more likely to have amblyopia or require corrective eye muscle surgery than children with esophoria.

name: Chorioretinal coloboma
label: Chorioretinal coloboma
definition: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.

name: Microphthalmia
label: Microphthalmia
definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.

name: Abnormal saccadic eye movements
label: Abnormal saccadic eye movements
definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.|Fast (saccadic) eye movements comprise voluntary or involuntary refixation movements, the fast phase of vestibular nystagmus, optokinetic nystagmus, and microsaccades.

name: Hypometric saccades
label: Hypometric saccades
definition: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

name: Visual loss
label: Visual loss
definition: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain timepoint in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that).

name: Retinal hemorrhage
label: Retinal hemorrhage
definition: Hemorrhage occurring within the retina.|The type of retinal hemorrhage and its clinical appearance depends on its location within the retina.

name: Thick eyebrow
label: Thick eyebrow
definition: Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs.|Thickness can be regional (medial, middle/central, lateral) or total.

name: Scotoma
label: Scotoma
definition: A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

name: Centrocecal scotoma
label: Centrocecal scotoma
definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.

name: Exotropia
label: Exotropia
definition: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.

name: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
label: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
definition: Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

name: Pigmentary retinopathy
label: Pigmentary retinopathy
definition: An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.

name: Blepharophimosis
label: Blepharophimosis
definition: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures.|When the palpebral fissures are severely shortened, they cannot be widely separated, actively or passively.

name: Upslanted palpebral fissure
label: Upslanted palpebral fissure
definition: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.

name: Band keratopathy
label: Band keratopathy
definition: An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.

name: Shallow orbits
label: Shallow orbits
definition: Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.

name: Abnormality of the optic nerve
label: Abnormality of the optic nerve
definition: Abnormality of the optic nerve.|The optic nerve, which is also known as cranial nerve II, transmits visual information from the retina to the brain. The term 'optic disc' is frequently used to describe the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

name: Optic nerve coloboma
label: Optic nerve coloboma
definition: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.|A congenital, unilateral or bilateral congenital condition caused by incomplete closure of the embryonic fissure.

name: Coloboma
label: Coloboma
definition: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.

name: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
label: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
definition: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.|Progressive external ophthalmoplegia (PEO) can be regarded as a diagnosis, or as a feature of several other syndromes. The latter is the meaning of this term.

name: Abnormal sclera morphology
label: Abnormal sclera morphology
definition: An abnormality of the sclera.

name: Blue sclerae
label: Blue sclerae
definition: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.

name: Abnormal anterior chamber morphology
label: Abnormal anterior chamber morphology
definition: Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.

name: Shallow anterior chamber
label: Shallow anterior chamber
definition: Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.

name: Ophthalmoparesis
label: Ophthalmoparesis
definition: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.

name: Abnormality of the ear
label: Abnormality of the ear
definition: An abnormality of the ear.|Either a morphological abnormality or hearing deficit. This should be split more cleanly in the future.

name: Abnormality of the frontal hairline
label: Abnormality of the frontal hairline
definition: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the forehead, that is, the border between skin on the forehead that has head hair and that does not.

name: Abnormality of the pharynx
label: Abnormality of the pharynx
definition:
An anomaly of the pharynx, i.e., of the tubular structure extending from the base of the skull superiorly to the esophageal inlet inferiorly.|The pharynx is tubular structure extending from base of skull superiorly
to esophageal inlet inferiorly, and is composed of three distinct areas: the nasopharynx, the oropharynx, and the hypopharynx, with the pharyngeal walls being composed of the superior, middle, and inferior pharyngeal constrictor muscles. It is part of the digestive system and of the conducting zone of the respiratory system.

name: Hypotelorism
label: Hypotelorism
definition: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).

name: Ophthalmoplegia
label: Ophthalmoplegia
definition: Paralysis of one or more extraocular muscles that are responsible for eye movements.

name: Central scotoma
label: Central scotoma
definition: An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.

name: Supranuclear gaze palsy
label: Supranuclear gaze palsy
definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

name: Abnormality of the periorbital region
label: Abnormality of the periorbital region
definition: An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

name: Macular degeneration
label: Macular degeneration
definition: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells of the macula lutea.

name: Optic nerve hypoplasia
label: Optic nerve hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve.

name: Abnormal choroid morphology
label: Abnormal choroid morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the choroid.

name: Iris coloboma
label: Iris coloboma
definition: A coloboma of the iris.

name: Photophobia
label: Photophobia
definition: Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light.|Note that the term photodysphoria is used to describe extreme photophobia.

name: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
label: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
definition: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.|The nasolacrimal system consists of the puncta, canaliculi, lacrimal sac, and nasolacrimal duct.

name: Abnormal pupil morphology
label: Abnormal pupil morphology
definition: An abnormality of the pupil.

name: Miosis
label: Miosis
definition: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil.

name: Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
label: Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
definition: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.|Tracking eye movements consist of two different components, namely, smooth pursuit and saccades. Smooth pursuit, or just pursuit, is a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion. Saccades are rapid eye movements that align the fovea with the target. Slow-pursuit eye movements are involved in tracking a slowly moving target after the saccadic system has placed the image of the target on the fovea.

name: Blindness
label: Blindness
definition: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degress in radius around central fixation.|Various scales have been developed to describe the extent of vision loss and define blindness. Total blindness is the complete lack of form and visual light perception and is clinically recorded as NLP (no light perception). Blindness is frequently used to describe severe visual impairment with residual vision. Those described as having only light perception have no more sight than the ability to tell light from dark and the general direction of a light source.

name: Impaired convergence
label: Impaired convergence
definition: Reduced ability to turn the eyes inward in order to focus on a nearby object.|Vergence alters the angle between the two eyes to adjust for changes in distance from the visual target.

name: Dacryocystitis
label: Dacryocystitis
definition: Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac.|Dacrocystitis is frequently caused by nasolacrimal duct obstruction or infection, which often results from stagnation of tears in a pathologically closed lacrimal drainage system. Note also that dacryocystistis has often been misspelled as dacrocystitis in the literature, but the correct spelling is dacryocystitis.

name: Entropion
label: Entropion
definition: An abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid (usually the lower) towards the globe. Entropion is usually acquired as a result of involutional or cicatricial processes but may occasionally be congenital.|The inward turned eyelid margin increases the potential for mechanical irritation of the eye by eyelashes. Entropion is to be distinguished from epiblepharon.

name: Blurred vision
label: Blurred vision
definition: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.|This is a very nonspecific term and it is preferable to describe the correlates of blurred vision with the corresponding terms if possible.

name: Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia
label: Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia
definition: A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.

name: Eyelid coloboma
label: Eyelid coloboma
definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid.|The lateral segment of the lower eyelid is most commonly involved. As the milder forms of this finding are clearly subjective and no boundary of subjective and objective is defined, the term is considered subjective. The term eyelid coloboma has been replaced because the word coloboma should be used only for defects at the site of fusion of embryologic structures, which is not the case here. Modifiers to designate the location of the cleft may be added, such as lower and lateral.

name: Posterior embryotoxon
label: Posterior embryotoxon
definition: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.|Schwalbe's line is the anatomical line found on the interior surface of the cornea, and delineates the outer limit of the corneal endothelium layer. Specifically, it represents the termination of Descemet's membrane. Up to 30% of the population has posterior embryotoxon as an isolated normal variant.

name: Periorbital fullness
label: Periorbital fullness
definition: Increase in periorbital soft tissue.

name: Retinal arterial tortuosity
label: Retinal arterial tortuosity
definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.

name: Lacrimation abnormality
label: Lacrimation abnormality
definition: Abnormality of tear production.

name: Decreased lacrimation
label: Decreased lacrimation
definition: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears.

name: Impaired ocular abduction
label: Impaired ocular abduction
definition: An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).

name: Blue irides
label: Blue irides
definition: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

name: Upper eyelid coloboma
label: Upper eyelid coloboma
definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid.

name: Long palpebral fissure
label: Long palpebral fissure
definition: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.

name: Nystagmus
label: Nystagmus
definition: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.

name: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
label: Gaze-evoked nystagmus
definition: Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

name: Dysmetric saccades
label: Dysmetric saccades
definition: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.

name: Red-green dyschromatopsia
label: Red-green dyschromatopsia
definition: Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.

name: Blepharospasm
label: Blepharospasm
definition: A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.

name: Amblyopia
label: Amblyopia
definition: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.|Ambylopia can result from visual deprivation during the critical period of development of visual abilities which lasts to about the age of 8 years. Thus, ambylopia can result from strabismus, anisometropia, or high hypermetropia in there is a failure to form a focused image in one or both eyes.

name: Sclerocornea
label: Sclerocornea
definition: A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.

name: Optic atrophy
label: Optic atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.|The diagnosis of optic atrophy is made when the optic disc loses its normal orange-pink color. Optic atrophy is an end stage that arises from myriad causes of optic nerve damage anywhere along the path from the retina to the lateral geniculate. Some of the most common etiologies are advanced glaucoma, optic neuritis, arteritic or non-arteritic ischaemic optic neuropathy or a compressive lesion.

name: Abnormality of visual evoked potentials
label: Abnormality of visual evoked potentials
definition: An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.|The terms visually evoked potential (VEP), visually evoked response (VER) and visually evoked cortical potential (VECP) are equivalent.

name: Abnormal amplitude of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
label: Abnormal amplitude of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials

name: Diplopia
label: Diplopia
definition: Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.

name: Lower eyelid coloboma
label: Lower eyelid coloboma
definition: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid.

name: Sparse eyelashes
label: Sparse eyelashes
definition: Decreased density/number of eyelashes.

name: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
label: Decreased light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram amplitude
definition: Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.

name: Ectropion
label: Ectropion
definition: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.|Ectropion is frequently associated wit overexposure of the palpebral and scleral conjunctiva and cornea. It usually involves the lower eyelid.

name: Oculomotor apraxia
label: Oculomotor apraxia
definition: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.|Oculomotor apraxia leads defective or absent horizontal voluntary eye movements with head thrusting to look at objects to the side as well as jerky, abnormal eye movements.

name: Peters anomaly
label: Peters anomaly
definition: A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.

name: Lipemia retinalis
label: Lipemia retinalis
definition: A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.|Lipemia retinalis is thought to be directly correlated with the serum triglyceride level; typically, the retinal findings do not occur until the triglyceride level reaches 2500 mg per deciliter (28.2 mmol per liter).

name: Nyctalopia
label: Nyctalopia
definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light.

name: Synophrys
label: Synophrys
definition: Meeting of the medial eyebrows in the midline.

name: Horizontal nystagmus
label: Horizontal nystagmus
definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.

name: Phthisis bulbi
label: Phthisis bulbi
definition: Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.|Phthisis bulbi refers to atrophy and degeneration of a blind eye.

name: Hypodontia
label: Hypodontia
definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by a reduced number of teeth, whereby up to 6 teeth are missing.|Hypodontia refers to a reduced number of primary or permanent teeth. Hypodontia may affect either both primary and permanent teeth or only the permanent teeth. Wisdom teeth (the third secondary maxillary and mandibular molar teeth) are not included in this count.

name: Carious teeth
label: Carious teeth
definition: Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.|It should be noted that it is not always possible to rule out environmental influences and that reports of association between hereditary diseases and susceptibility to dental caries should be regarded with caution.

name: Anodontia
label: Anodontia
definition: The congenital absence of all teeth.|Anodontia can affect both primary and permanent teeth. Alternatively, there can be anodontia of just the permanent teeth. Anodontia must be distinguished from non-erupted teeth.

name: Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor
label: Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor
definition: Increased size of the maxillary central secondary incisor tooth.

name: Abnormality of the incisor
label: Abnormality of the incisor
definition: An abnormality of the Incisor tooth.

name: Oligodontia
label: Oligodontia
definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by a reduced number of teeth, whereby more than 6 teeth are missing.|The diagnosis of oligodontia requires a radiograph, as is true for anodontia and for the other designation of tooth agenesis, hypodontia. The terms hypodontia and oligodontia are sometimes used interchangeably in the literature while on other occasions hypodontia is used for selective agenesis of six or less missing teeth while oligodontia is applied when there are more than six missing teeth. Tooth agenesis or oligodontia/hypodontia can be mistaken for delayed eruption and again a radiograph is needed for diagnosis. Absence of teeth may be congenital (tooth agenesis) or acquired. The incidence of congenital absence of teeth is different depending on the type and position of the tooth [Gorlin et al, 2001].

name: Dental crowding
label: Dental crowding
definition: Overlapping teeth within an alveolar ridge.

name: Taurodontia
label: Taurodontia
definition: Increased volume of dental pulp of permanent molar.|Body of the tooth and pulp chamber is enlarged.

name: Delayed eruption of primary teeth
label: Delayed eruption of primary teeth
definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the primary dentition.

name: Abnormality of dental enamel
label: Abnormality of dental enamel
definition: An abnormality of the dental enamel.|The dental enamel is the external layer of the teeth, being a highly mineralized substance consisting primarily of hydroxylapatite.

name: Grayish enamel
label: Grayish enamel
definition: A grey discoloration of the dental enamel.|Grey enamel may be seen in dentinogenesis imperfecta, but dentinogenesis imperfecta should be coded separately if present.

name: Delayed eruption of teeth
label: Delayed eruption of teeth
definition: Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.|This term should not be used in a patient with Gingival overgrowth. There are established norms for the timing of eruption in both deciduous and permanent teeth [Garn and Rohmann, [1966]; Lunt and Law, [1974]; McDonald et al. [2004]]. Eruption is defined by the appearance of a tooth that has pierced the gum.

name: Hypoplasia of teeth
label: Hypoplasia of teeth
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of teeth.

name: Widely spaced teeth
label: Widely spaced teeth
definition: Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.|Wide spacing can be secondary to increased room by an unusually large dental arch, microdontia or mixed primary and secondary dentition. It should be carefully noted that slight spacing between the primary teeth is normal, so experience in evaluation is important in determining this feature. This descriptor must be distinguished from Diastema.

name: Dental malocclusion
label: Dental malocclusion
definition: Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.

name: Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor
label: Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor
definition: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor and maxillary lateral secondary incisor.

name: Microdontia
label: Microdontia
definition: Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.|Standard reference has means and standard deviations by gender [Moyers et al, 1976]. It is easy to measure the width of teeth, for which reason the definition of microdontia can be made with reference to the width of the tooth. However, microdontia means that the overall size of the tooth is decreased. In microdontia, the gaps between the teeth, particularly the anterior upper and lower teeth, are increased, creating diastemata. This should be assessed and coded separately.

name: Misalignment of teeth
label: Misalignment of teeth
definition: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.

name: Shell teeth
label: Shell teeth
definition: A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.

name: Natal tooth
label: Natal tooth
definition: Erupted tooth or teeth at birth.

name: Delayed eruption of permanent teeth
label: Delayed eruption of permanent teeth
definition: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the secondary dentition.

name: Conical tooth
label: Conical tooth
definition: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.

name: Diastema
label: Diastema
definition: Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.|Usually there is contact between the lateral aspects of the permanent teeth, at their broadest point. Diastema can apply to any pair of teeth and the term should be modified by a descriptor of the involved teeth. This descriptor must be distinguished from Widely spaced teeth.

name: Periapical bone loss
label: Periapical bone loss
definition: Radiolucency (reflecting a reduction in the bony substance) around the apex (the tip of the dental root).|Periapical radiolucencies can be seen with periapical granuloma, cysts, ameloblastoma, odotogenic keratatoycsts, and other lesions.

name: Dentinogenesis imperfecta
label: Dentinogenesis imperfecta
definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin.|This term is kept for convenience since it is often used to refer to the phenotype of discolored, fragile teeth in the medical literature. Dentinogenesis imperfecta is a disorder of tooth development. This condition causes the teeth to be discolored (most often a blue-gray or yellow-brown color) and translucent. Teeth are also weaker than normal, making them prone to rapid wear, breakage, and loss.

name: Inflammation of the periodontium.
label: Inflammation of the periodontium.
definition: Inflammation of the periodontium.

name: Amelogenesis imperfecta
label: Amelogenesis imperfecta
definition: A developmental dysplasia of the dental enamel.|Amelogenesis imperfecta (AI) is a term for a clinically and genetically heterogeneous group of diseases that affect the dental enamel, occasionally in conjunction with other dental, oral and extraoral tissues. This term has often been used to describe the phenotype associated with AI, but for new annotations it is recommended to describe the individual manifestations.

name: Unerupted tooth
label: Unerupted tooth
definition: The presence of one or more embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt.

name: Abnormality of the nervous system
label: Abnormality of the nervous system
definition: An abnormality of the nervous system.|The nervous system comprises the neuraxis (brain, spinal cord, and ventricles), the autonomic nervous system, the enteric nervous system, and the peripheral nervous system.

name: Behavioral abnormality
label: Behavioral abnormality
definition: An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities.

name: Psychosis
label: Psychosis
definition: A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs.

name: Hyperorality
label: Hyperorality
definition: A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth.

name: Restlessness
label: Restlessness
definition: A state of unease characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion subject to limited control, nonproductive or disorganized behavior, and subjective distress.

name: Emotional lability
label: Emotional lability
definition: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or out of proportion to events and circumstances.

name: Agitation
label: Agitation
definition: A state of exceeding restlessness and excessive motor activity associated with mental distress or a feeling of inner tension.

name: Depressivity
label: Depressivity
definition: Frequent feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; difficulty recovering from such moods; pessimism about the future; pervasive shame; feeling of inferior self-worth; thoughts of suicide and suicidal behavior.

name: Autism
label: Autism
definition: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).|The term refers to the diagnosis of autism and is left for convenience. However, it is preferable to annotate the exact phenotypic abnormalities rather than merely the diagnostic category autism.

name: Aggressive behavior
label: Aggressive behavior
definition: Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself.

name: Mood swings
label: Mood swings
definition: An exaggeration of emotional affects such as laughing crying, or yawning beyond what the person feels.

name: Obsessive-compulsive behavior
label: Obsessive-compulsive behavior
definition: Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV).

name: Restrictive behavior
label: Restrictive behavior
definition: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities.

name: Dementia
label: Dementia
definition: A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.

name: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
label: Impaired ability to form peer relationships

name: Autistic behavior
label: Autistic behavior
definition: Persistent deficits in social interaction and communication and interaction as well as a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest as well as repetitive patterns of behavior.|This term can be used to refer to autism spectrum disorder as a phenotypic feature that can be a component of a disease. Autism spectrum disorder range from a severe form, called autistic disorder, to a milder form, Asperger syndrome.

name: Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals
label: Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals

name: Stereotypy
label: Stereotypy
definition: A stereotypy is a repetitive, simple movement that can be voluntarily suppressed. Stereotypies are typically simple back-and-forth movements such as waving of flapping the hands or arms, and they do not involve complex sequences or movement fragments. Movement is often but not always rhythmic and may involve fingers, wrists, or more proximal portions of the upper extremity. The lower extremity is not typically involved. Stereotypies are more commonly bilateral than unilateral.|An abnormality of behavior characterized by one or more stereotyped and restricted patterns of behavior such as inflexible adherence to specific, nonfunctional routines or rituals, stereotyped and repetitive motor mannerisms (e.g., hand or finger flapping or twisting, or complex whole-body movements), or persistent preoccupation with parts of objects. The behaviour does not serve an observable goal. In general the movements are not aimed at the environment, but at the person itself. Stereotypical behaviour is seen especially in children with sensory, intellectual and/or cognitive handicaps.

name: Disinhibition
label: Disinhibition
definition: A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment.|Disinhibition affects motor, instinctual, emotional, cognitive and perceptual aspects with signs and symptoms similar to the diagnostic criteria for mania. Hypersexuality, hyperphagia, and aggressive outbursts are indicative of disinhibited instinctual drives.

name: Impaired social interactions
label: Impaired social interactions
definition: Difficulty in social interactions related to an impairment of characteristics such as eye contact, smiling, appropriate facial expressions, and body postures and characterized by difficulty in forming peer relationships and forming friendships.

name: Short attention span
label: Short attention span
definition: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

name: Hallucinations
label: Hallucinations
definition: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.

name: Anxiety
label: Anxiety
definition: Intense feelings of nervousness, tenseness, or panic, often in reaction to interpersonal stresses; worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities; feeling fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty; fears of falling apart or losing control.

name: Episodic paroxysmal anxiety
label: Episodic paroxysmal anxiety
definition: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, whose occurence is not restricted to any particular situation or set of circumstances and is therefore unpredictable.|An anxiety attack may manifest with one or more of the following symptoms: (i) breathing difficulty; (ii) palpitations; (iii) a feeling  of unreality; (iv) pains or tightness in the chest; (v) trembling, dizziness or feeling unsteady; (vi) sweating; (vii) a feeling of faintness; (viii) a fear of dying; (ix) a feeling of losing control; (x) tingling in hands and feet (parasthesiae); (xi) choking or smothering feelings.

name: Frontal release signs
label: Frontal release signs
definition: Primitive reflexes traditionally held to be a sign of disorders that affect the frontal lobes.

name: Low frustration tolerance
label: Low frustration tolerance
definition: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs if a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration characterized by crying or temper tantrums (in children) or aggressive or other undesirable behaviors.

name: Diminished motivation
label: Diminished motivation
definition: A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.

name: Delusions
label: Delusions
definition: A belief that is pathological and is held despite evidence to the contrary.

name: Delayed speech and language development
label: Delayed speech and language development
definition: A degree of language development that is significantly below the norm for a child of a specified age.|Language delay can be characterized by a failure to meet the developmental milestones for language development, an inability to follow directions, or slow or incomprehensible speech after the age of three years, as well as with severe problems with syntax or articulation.

name: Personality changes
label: Personality changes
definition: An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.|This term refers to changes in personality that are perceived as being abnormal. It does not refer to the usual gradual personality changes that tend to accompany aging and certain life situations.

name: Hyperactivity
label: Hyperactivity
definition: Hyperactivity is a state of constantly being unusually or abnormally active, including in situations in which it is not appropriate.

name: Agoraphobia
label: Agoraphobia
definition: A type of anxiety disorder characterized by avoidance of public places, especially where crowds gather.

name: Impaired use of nonverbal behaviors
label: Impaired use of nonverbal behaviors
definition: Reduced ability to use nonverbal behavior for communication, such as eye-to-eye gaze, facial expression, body posture, and gestures.

name: Abnormal peripheral nervous system morphology
label: Abnormal peripheral nervous system morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the peripheral nervous system, which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system. This includes the cranial nerves (olfactory and optic nerves are technically part of the central nervous system).|The peripheral nervous system is divided into autonomic and somatic components, which both include afferent (sensory) and efferent (motor) nerves.

name: Decreased nerve conduction velocity
label: Decreased nerve conduction velocity
definition: A reduction in the speed at which electrical signals propagate along the axon of a neuron.|Nerve conduction velocity is usually measured with surface electrodes placed on the skin over nerves at various locations. Following stimulation at one electrode, the speed at which the signal is propagated to other electrodes is recorded. Abnormal values may suggest demyelination, a conduction block, or axonopathy.

name: Sensory neuropathy
label: Sensory neuropathy
definition: Peripheral neuropathy affecting the sensory nerves.

name: Peripheral axonal degeneration
label: Peripheral axonal degeneration
definition: Progressive deterioration of peripheral axons.|This finding is typically demonstrated by nerve biopsy.

name: Abnormality of the thorax
label: Abnormality of the thorax
definition: Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).

name: Abnormality of the sternum
label: Abnormality of the sternum
definition: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.

name: Pectus excavatum
label: Pectus excavatum
definition: A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest ("pectus") a caved-in ("excavatum") appearance.

name: Pectus carinatum
label: Pectus carinatum
definition: A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.

name: Abnormality of the breast
label: Abnormality of the breast
definition: An abnormality of the breast.

name: Gynecomastia
label: Gynecomastia
definition: Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement.

name: Abnormality of the ribs
label: Abnormality of the ribs
definition: An anomaly of the rib.

name: Short ribs
label: Short ribs
definition: Reduced rib length.

name: Narrow chest
label: Narrow chest
definition: Reduced width of the chest from side to side, associated with a reduced distance from the sternal notch to the tip of the shoulder.

name: Abnormality of the diaphragm
label: Abnormality of the diaphragm
definition: Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.

name: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
label: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
definition: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.|Diaphragmatic hernia is the result of a developmental defect causing an abnormal opening in the diaphragm, through which abdominal organs (stomach, spleen, liver, and intestines) can protrude into the thoracic cavity. This usually causes respiratory distress in the newborn period.

name: Abnormality of the thymus
label: Abnormality of the thymus
definition: Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation.

name: Hypoplasia of the thymus
label: Hypoplasia of the thymus
definition: Underdevelopment of the thymus.

name: Abnormality of the scapula
label: Abnormality of the scapula
definition: Any abnormality of the scapula, also known as the shoulder blade.

name: Nephrolithiasis
label: Nephrolithiasis
definition: The presence of calculi (stones) in the kidneys.|Urinary stone disease is caused by supersaturation of the urine by stone forming substances including calcium, oxalate, and uric acid. Crystals or foreign bodies can act as a nidus for further stone formation. THe resulting kidney stones (calculi) lead to symptoms if they become impacted in the ureter.

name: Hematuria
label: Hematuria
definition: The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine).

name: Uric acid nephrolithiasis
label: Uric acid nephrolithiasis
definition: The presence of uric acid-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
label: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
definition: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity

name: IgA deposition in the glomerulus
label: IgA deposition in the glomerulus
definition: The presence of immunoglobulin A deposits in the glomerulus.

name: Abnormality of the urethra
label: Abnormality of the urethra
definition: An abnormality of the urethra, i.e., of the tube which connects the urinary bladder to the outside of the body.

name: Urethral obstruction
label: Urethral obstruction
definition: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the urethra.

name: Oligospermia
label: Oligospermia
definition: Reduced count of spermatozoa in the semen, defined as a sperm count below 20 million per milliliter semen.

name: Renal steatosis
label: Renal steatosis
definition: Abnormal fat accumulation in the kidneys.

name: Impotence
label: Impotence
definition: Inability to develop or maintain an erection of the penis.

name: Renal cortical cysts
label: Renal cortical cysts
definition: Cysts of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Xanthine nephrolithiasis
label: Xanthine nephrolithiasis
definition: The presence of xanthine-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Enuresis
label: Enuresis
definition: Lack of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination at an age where control of the bladder should already be possible.

name: Penoscrotal hypospadias
label: Penoscrotal hypospadias
definition: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.

name: Urinary tract atresia
label: Urinary tract atresia
definition: Congenital absence of the normal opening of a structure of the urinary tract.

name: Abnormal internal genitalia
label: Abnormal internal genitalia
definition: An anomaly of the adnexa, uterus, and vagina (in female) or seminal tract and prostate (in male).

name: Bicornuate uterus
label: Bicornuate uterus
definition: The presence of a bicornuate uterus.|Uterus with two horn-shaped branches.

name: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
label: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
definition: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.

name: Abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism
label: Abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism
definition: An abnormality of the tricarboxylic acid cycle.

name: Poor eye contact
label: Poor eye contact
definition: Difficulty in looking at another person in the eye.|Eye contact, define as the meeting of the gaze between two people during a conversation, is an important form of nonverbal communication.

name: Abnormality of the endocrine system
label: Abnormality of the endocrine system
definition: An abnormality of the endocrine system.|The endocrine system is composed of glands that secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream and includes the following glands: thyroid, parathyroids, adrenals, pancreas, gonads (testicles and ovaries), and pituitary. Many other organs, such as the kidney, liver, and heart, have secondary endocrine functions.

name: Diabetes mellitus
label: Diabetes mellitus
definition: A group of abnormalities characterized by hyperglycemia and glucose intolerance.

name: Abnormality of the thyroid gland
label: Abnormality of the thyroid gland
definition: An abnormality of the thyroid gland.

name: Hypothyroidism
label: Hypothyroidism
definition: Deficiency of thyroid hormone.

name: Hypertension
label: Hypertension
definition: The presence of chronic increased pressure in the systemic arterial system.|Hypertension is sustained elevation of resting systolic BP (140 mm Hg or higher), diastolic BP (90 mm Hg or higher), or both.

name: Delayed puberty
label: Delayed puberty
definition: Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.|The age at which delayed puberty may be diagnosed in a person without signs of secondary sexual development is 13 years in a girl or 14 years in a boy.

name: Growth hormone deficiency
label: Growth hormone deficiency
definition: Insufficient production of growth hormone, which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland. Growth hormone is a major participant in control of growth and metabolism.|The effects of growth hormone are mediated almost exclusively by insulin-like growth factor 1(IGF-1), which is produced primarily in the liver. Growth hormone deficiency refers to inadequate levels of GH (and therefore IGF-1), resulting in growth retardation in children and metabolic disturbances in adults.

name: Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia
label: Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia
