definition: Recurrent or persistent superficial Candida infections of the skin, mucous membranes, and nails.|The most commonly involved Candida species is Candida albicans. Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis (CMC) is usually confined to the cutaneous surface without systemic dissemination. CMC does not represent a specific disease, but rather a phenotypic feature of several immunologic, endocrinologic, and autoimmune disorders.

name: Follicular hyperplasia
label: Follicular hyperplasia
definition: Lymphadenopathy (enlargement of lymph nodes) owing to hyperplasia of follicular (germinal) centers.|Lymphadenopathy can be defined as enlargement of lymph nodes. It is just a sign accompanying a great variety of entities with multiple etiologies: acute vs. chronic, benign vs. malignant. One of the most commonly seen histological pictures is lymphadenopathy owing to hyperplasia of follicular (germinal centers) but this one is by far not the only one (See Gaddey HL et al. Unexplained Lymphadenopathy: Evaluation and Differential Diagnosis. Am Fam Physician. 2016 1;94:896-903 and Weiss LM. et al. Benign lymphadenopathies. Mod Pathol. 2013;26 Suppl 1:S88-96).

name: Chronic noninfectious lymphadenopathy
label: Chronic noninfectious lymphadenopathy
definition: A chronic form of lymphadenopathy that is not related to infection.

name: Decreased lymphocyte apoptosis
label: Decreased lymphocyte apoptosis
definition: A reduction in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.|Apoptosis, a form of programmed cell death, is an important mechanism that prevents uncontrolled proliferation of activated lymphocytes and regulates lymphocyte homeostasis.

name: Lymph node hypoplasia
label: Lymph node hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the lymph nodes.

name: Abnormality of the lymph nodes
label: Abnormality of the lymph nodes
definition: A lymph node abnormality.

name: Hypoplastic frontal sinuses
label: Hypoplastic frontal sinuses
definition: Underdevelopment of frontal sinus.

name: Recurrent E. coli infections
label: Recurrent E. coli infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to infections with Escherichia coli, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.

name: Recurrent Serratia marcescens infections
label: Recurrent Serratia marcescens infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to Serratia marcescens infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Serratia marcescens infection.

name: Recurrent Klebsiella infections
label: Recurrent Klebsiella infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to Klebsiella infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Klebsiella infection.

name: Recurrent enteroviral infections
label: Recurrent enteroviral infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.

name: Bilateral cleft lip and palate
label: Bilateral cleft lip and palate
definition: Cleft lip and cleft palate affecting both sides of the face.

name: Oral leukoplakia
label: Oral leukoplakia
definition: A thickened white patch on the oral mucosa that cannot be rubbed off.|The definition of oral leukoplakia states that the lesion be characterized clinically or histologically as any other condition, and is not associated with any physical or chemical causative agent except tobacco. Leukoplakia is a precancerous lesion, i.e. a morphologically altered tissue in which cancer is more likely to occur than in its apparently normal counterpart.

name: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
label: Respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness

name: Rickets
label: Rickets
definition: Rickets is divided into two major categories including calcipenic and phosphopenic. Hypophosphatemia is described as a common manifestation of both categories. Hypophosphatemic rickets is the most common type of rickets that is characterized by low levels of serum phosphate, resistance to ultraviolet radiation or vitamin D intake. There are several issues involved in hypophosphatemic rickets such as calcium, vitamin D, phosphorus deficiencies. Moreover, other disorder can be associated with its occurrence such as absorption defects due to pancreatic, intestinal, gastric, and renal disorders and hepatobiliary disease. Symptoms are usually seen in childhood and can be varied in severity. Severe forms may be linked to bowing of the legs, poor bone growth, and short stature as well as joint and bone pain. Hypophosphatemic rickets are associated with renal excretion of phosphate, hypophosphatemia, and mineral defects in bones. The familial type of the disease is the most common type of rickets.

name: Osteomalacia
label: Osteomalacia
definition: Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets.

name: Delayed skeletal maturation
label: Delayed skeletal maturation
definition: A decreased rate of skeletal maturation. Delayed skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

name: Kyphoscoliosis
label: Kyphoscoliosis
definition: An abnormal curvature of the spine in both a coronal (lateral) and sagittal (back-to-front) plane.

name: Thin bony cortex
label: Thin bony cortex
definition: Abnormal thinning of the cortical region of bones.

name: Osteomyelitis
label: Osteomyelitis
definition: Osteomyelitis is an inflammatory process accompanied by bone destruction and caused by an infecting microorganism.|Osteomyelitis can be acute or chronic and can be caused by a variety of microbial agents.

name: Pathologic fracture
label: Pathologic fracture
definition: A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondary to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.

name: Recurrent fractures
label: Recurrent fractures
definition: The repeated occurrence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).|This term will be made obsolete. The annotations need to be checked.

name: Osteoarthritis
label: Osteoarthritis
definition: Degeneration (wear and tear) of articular cartilage, i.e., of the joint surface. Joint degeneration may be accompanied by osteophytes (bone overgrowth), narrowing of the joint space, regions of sclerosis at the joint surface, or joint deformity.

name: Generalized joint laxity
label: Generalized joint laxity
definition: Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body.

name: Multiple exostoses
label: Multiple exostoses
definition: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Abnormal cartilage morphology
label: Abnormal cartilage morphology
definition: Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.

name: Abnormal trachea morphology
label: Abnormal trachea morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the trachea.

name: Bronchomalacia
label: Bronchomalacia
definition: Weakness or softness of the cartilage in the walls of the bronchial tubes.

name: Upper airway obstruction
label: Upper airway obstruction
definition: Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

name: Recurrent lower respiratory tract infections
label: Recurrent lower respiratory tract infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to lower respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent lower respiratory tract infections.

name: Tracheobronchomalacia
label: Tracheobronchomalacia
definition: Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways.

name: Tracheal calcification
label: Tracheal calcification
definition: Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the tracheal tissues.

name: Recurrent upper respiratory tract infections
label: Recurrent upper respiratory tract infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent upper respiratory tract infections (running ears - otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

name: Tachypnea
label: Tachypnea
definition: Very rapid breathing.|In adults, a beathing rate of between 12-20 breaths per minute is normal and tachypnea is present with a ventilatory rate greater than 20 breaths per minute.

name: Hypoventilation
label: Hypoventilation
definition: A reduction in the amount of air transported into the pulmonary alveoli by breathing, leading to hypercapnia (increase in the partial pressure of carbon dioxide).|Not to be confused with Hypopnea, where the partial pressure of carbon dioxide can remain normal.

name: Reduced vital capacity
label: Reduced vital capacity
definition: An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung.

name: Abnormal pattern of respiration
label: Abnormal pattern of respiration
definition: An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.

name: Functional respiratory abnormality
label: Functional respiratory abnormality
definition: This category describes not-primarily structural lesions.

name: Osteolysis
label: Osteolysis
definition: Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium.|Osteolysis may be a feature of neoplastic, infectious, metabolis, vascular, and joint disorders and is also a component of many hereditary diseases. Osteolysis may be highly localized or more diffuse. This term is meant to group the more specific osteolysis terms.

name: Congenital contracture
label: Congenital contracture
definition: One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.

name: Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita
label: Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita
definition: Multiple congenital contractures in different body areas.|Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita (AMC) consists of several conditions of different etiology and mixed clinical features, including multiple congenital contractures in multiple body areas. Here, we use the term to refer solely to the multiple congenital contractures. It is related to fetal akinesia owing to fetal neurogenic, muscle, or connective tissue disorders or occasionally to maternal conditions. AMC can be associated with polyhydramnios, pulmonary hypoplasia, micrognathia, ocular hypertelorism, and short umbilical cord. AMC is a feature of a heterogeneous group of disorders, some of which have the phrase 'arthrogryposis multiplex congenita' as a part of their name (for instance, Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita, distal type 1 or AMCD1). This term refers to the finding of multiple joint contractures found throughout the body at birth rather than to the disease entities of which this is a clinical feature.

name: Kyphosis
label: Kyphosis
definition: Exaggerated anterior convexity of the thoracic vertebral column.

name: Coxa vara
label: Coxa vara
definition: Coxa vara includes all forms of decrease of the femoral neck shaft angle (the angle between the neck and the shaft of the femur) to less than 120 degrees.|The Latin word 'coxa' refers to the hip, and varus is a term for the inward angulation of the distal segment of a bone or joint. The normal range of the angle between the ball and the shaft of the femur is 120 to 135 degrees. Coxa vara can be congenital, developmental, or acquired.

name: Abnormality of limb bone morphology
label: Abnormality of limb bone morphology
definition: Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.

name: Abnormality of the lower limb
label: Abnormality of the lower limb
definition: An abnormality of the leg.

name: Abnormality of the knee
label: Abnormality of the knee
definition: An abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

name: Genu recurvatum
label: Genu recurvatum
definition: An abnormally increased extension of the knee joint, so that the knee can bend backwards.|Individuals with genu recurvatum may experience knee pain, display an extension gait pattern, and have poor proprioceptive control of terminal knee extension.

name: Abnormality of the upper limb
label: Abnormality of the upper limb
definition: An abnormality of the arm.

name: Abnormality of the radius
label: Abnormality of the radius
definition: An abnormality of the radius.

name: Abnormality of femur morphology
label: Abnormality of femur morphology
definition: Any anomaly of the structure of the femur.|The femur (plural: femora) is the thigh bone.

name: Caudal appendage
label: Caudal appendage
definition: The presence of a tail-like skin appendage located adjacent to the sacrum.

name: Halberd-shaped pelvis
label: Halberd-shaped pelvis
definition: An anomalous radiographic appearance of the developing pelvis, in which the greater ischiadic noth (incisura ischiadica major) is shallow and the pelvis takes on the appearance said to resemble a halberd (a weapon especially of the 15th and 16th centuries consisting typically of a battle-ax and pike mounted on a handle).

name: Hip dislocation
label: Hip dislocation
definition: Displacement of the femur from its normal location in the hip joint.

name: Arthralgia
label: Arthralgia
definition: Joint pain.

name: Calcific stippling
label: Calcific stippling
definition: An abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) pattern of calcifications in soft tissues within or surrounding bones (as observed on radiographs).

name: Cystic angiomatosis of bone
label: Cystic angiomatosis of bone
definition: Disseminated multifocal hemangiomatous or lymphangiomatous lesions of the skeleton. The lesions are lytic, well-defined, round or oval lesions within the medullary cavity, and they have an intact cortex, and manifest variable peripheral sclerosis and may exhibit endosteal scalloping.|The term Cystic angiomatosis is used to describe a disease entity that includes cystic angiomatosis of bone and of visceral organs.

name: Aspiration
label: Aspiration
definition: Inspiration of a foreign object into the airway.

name: Bladder exstrophy
label: Bladder exstrophy
definition: Eversion of the posterior bladder wall through the congenitally absent lower anterior abdominal wall and anterior bladder wall.|Exstrophy of the bladder can be associated with epispadias and bifid penis or in females with bifid clitoris, a bifid uterus, and a septated vagina, each of which should be coded separately.

name: Recurrent bronchitis
label: Recurrent bronchitis
definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchitis.

name: Urinary bladder sphincter dysfunction
label: Urinary bladder sphincter dysfunction
definition: Abnormal function of a sphincter of the urinary bladder.

name: Lymphadenitis
label: Lymphadenitis
definition: Inflammation of a lymph node.

name: Recurrent fungal infections
label: Recurrent fungal infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to fungal infections, as manifested by multiple episodes of fungal infection.

name: Recurrent Burkholderia cepacia infections
label: Recurrent Burkholderia cepacia infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to infections with Burkholderia cepacia, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.

name: Abnormal T cell morphology
label: Abnormal T cell morphology
definition: An abnormality of T cells.|T-cells are lymphocytes whose principle function in the adaptive immune system is to mediate cell-mediated immunity.

name: obsolete Increased proportion of peripheral CD3+ T cells
label: obsolete Increased proportion of peripheral CD3+ T cells

name: Abnormal B cell morphology
label: Abnormal B cell morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of B cells.|B cells are bursal or bone marrow-derived lymphocytes whose principle function in the adaptive immune system is to make antibodies against antigens. A simple definition of B lymphocytes is a population of cells that express clonally diverse cell surface immunoglobulin (Ig) receptors recognizing specific antigenic epitopes. Over 10 B cell-specific cell surface molecules have been identified by monoclonal antibodies, including CD19, which is considered a pan-B cell and possibly follicular dendritic cell marker, and CD20, which is considered to be a marker for mature B cells.

name: Impaired memory B cell generation
label: Impaired memory B cell generation
definition: Impaired production of memory cells, the B cells that persist for years or an entire lifetime and which confer rapid and enhanced response to secondary challenge.

name: Specific anti-polysaccharide antibody deficiency
label: Specific anti-polysaccharide antibody deficiency
definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against bacterial polysaccharides.|Specific anti-polysaccharide antibody deficiency is associated with an increased risk of infection with Streptococcus pneumoniae, Haemophilus influenzae type b, and Staphylococcus aureus.

name: Absence of lymph node germinal center
label: Absence of lymph node germinal center
definition: Absence of germinal centers in lymph nodes. Germinal centers are the parts of lymph nodes in which B lymphocytes proliferate, differentiate, mutate through somatic hypermutation and class switch during antibody responses.

name: Decreased circulating total IgM
label: Decreased circulating total IgM
definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin M (IgM) in blood.

name: Elevated proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative, alpha-beta regulatory T cells
label: Elevated proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative, alpha-beta regulatory T cells
definition: An abnormally increased proportion of CD4-negative, CD8-negative (double negative or DN) alpha-beta regulatory T cells (Tregs) as compared to total number of T cells.

name: Increased proportion of HLA DR+ T cells
label: Increased proportion of HLA DR+ T cells
definition: An elevated proportion of T cells that express human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-DR. HLA-DR is an MHC class II cell surface receptor that presents antigens (peptides of at least 9 amino acids), thereby constituting a ligand for the T-cell receptor. HLA-DR can be upregulated in response to immune stimulation.

name: Genu valgum
label: Genu valgum
definition: The legs angle inward, such that the knees are close together and the ankles far apart.

name: Meningioma
label: Meningioma
definition: The presence of a meningioma, i.e., a benign tumor originating from the dura mater or arachnoid mater.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma
label: Squamous cell carcinoma
definition: The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

name: Melanoma
label: Melanoma
definition: The presence of a melanoma, a malignant cancer originating from pigment producing melanocytes. Melanoma can originate from the skin or the pigmented layers of the eye (the uvea).|A malignant skin tumor of originating from melanocytes, pigment cells normally present in the epidermis and sometimes in the dermis.

name: Bladder carcinoma
label: Bladder carcinoma
definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder.

name: Myelodysplasia
label: Myelodysplasia
definition: Clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by dysplasia (ineffective production) in one or more hematopoietic cell lineages, leading to anemia and cytopenia.

name: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
label: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
definition: The presence of a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Hypoplastic iliac wing
label: Hypoplastic iliac wing
definition: Underdevelopment of the ilium ala.

name: Abnormality of the ilium
label: Abnormality of the ilium
definition: An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.

name: Narrow iliac wings
label: Narrow iliac wings
definition: Decreased width of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

name: Flared iliac wings
label: Flared iliac wings
definition: Widening of the ilium ala, that is of the wing of the ilium, combined with external rotation, leading to a flared appearance of the iliac wing.

name: Obstructive sleep apnea
label: Obstructive sleep apnea
definition: A condition characterized by obstruction of the airway and by pauses in breathing during sleep occurring many times during the night. Obstructive sleep apnea is related to a relaxation of muscle tone (which normally occurs during sleep) leading to partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway with resultant obstruction of the air flow.

name: Central apnea
label: Central apnea
definition: Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow.

name: Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress
label: Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress
definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress.

name: Episodic tachypnea
label: Episodic tachypnea
definition: Episodes of very rapid breathing.

name: Respiratory failure
label: Respiratory failure
definition: A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.|Respiratory failure is classified as type 1 with hypoxemia (arterial partial pressure of oxygen less than 60 mmHg) without hypercapnea, and type 2 with hypoxemia in the present of hypercapnea (partial pressure of carbon dioxide over 50 mmHg).

name: Anisospondyly
label: Anisospondyly
definition: Abnormally increased variability of the size of the vertebral bodies.

name: Sudden episodic apnea
label: Sudden episodic apnea
definition: Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

name: Hyperventilation
label: Hyperventilation
definition: Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

name: Hepatoblastoma
label: Hepatoblastoma
definition: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates from immature liver precursor cells and macroscopically is composed of tissue resembling fetal or mature liver cells or bile ducts.|Hepatoblastoma occurs nearly exclusively in infants and children.

name: Medulloblastoma
label: Medulloblastoma
definition: A rapidly growing embryonic tumor arising in the posterior part of the cerebellar vermis and neuroepithelial roof of the fourth ventricle in children. More rarely, medulloblastoma arises in the cerebellum in adults.|Medulloblastoma is a highly malignant primary brain tumor that originates in the cerebellum or posterior fossa and belonging to the family of cranial primitive neuroectodermal tumors.

name: Vagal paraganglioma
label: Vagal paraganglioma
definition: A tumor that develops in the retrostyloid compartment of the parapharyngeal space, arising from an island of paraganglion tissue derived from the neural crest that is located on the vagus nerve.

name: Ependymoma
label: Ependymoma
definition: The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.|According to MPATH, ependymomas are neoplasms derived from the ependymal cells lining the ventricles and aqueduct of the brain and the central canal of the spinal cord and may be malignant or benign.

name: Thyroid carcinoma
label: Thyroid carcinoma
definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Uterine leiomyosarcoma
label: Uterine leiomyosarcoma
definition: The presence of a leiomyosarcoma of the uterus.|Leiomyosarcoma is a malignant tumor derived form pluripotential mesenchymal stem cells or smooth muscle cells [MPATH].

name: Pituitary adenoma
label: Pituitary adenoma
definition: A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis.|In most cases pituitary adenoma are histologically benign, slow-growing, small neoplasms confined to the sella turcica. Some pituitary adenomas are more aggressive, grow faster, invade surrounding tissues, and cause local symptoms such as visual disturbances, headache, and varying degrees of hypopituitarism.

name: Neoplasm of the pancreas
label: Neoplasm of the pancreas
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.

name: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
label: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
definition: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Neoplasm of the liver
label: Neoplasm of the liver
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the liver.

name: Parathyroid adenoma
label: Parathyroid adenoma
definition: A benign tumor of the parathyroid gland that can cause hyperparathyroidism.

name: Hypokalemia
label: Hypokalemia
definition: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood.

name: Hypocalcemia
label: Hypocalcemia
definition: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the blood.

name: Hyponatremia
label: Hyponatremia
definition: An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the blood.

name: Hyperbilirubinemia
label: Hyperbilirubinemia
definition: An increased amount of bilirubin in the blood.

name: Hyperphosphatemia
label: Hyperphosphatemia
definition: An abnormally increased phosphate concentration in the blood.

name: Microscopic hematuria
label: Microscopic hematuria
definition: Microscopic hematuria detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine.

name: Generalized aminoaciduria
label: Generalized aminoaciduria
definition: An increased concentration of all types of amino acid in the urine.|This abnormality is distinct from aminoacidurias in which the urinary concentration of a single amino acid, or a of single group of amino acids, is increased.

name: Elevated hepatic transaminase
label: Elevated hepatic transaminase
definition: Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.

name: Methylmalonic acidemia
label: Methylmalonic acidemia
definition: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the blood.|Methylmalonic aciduria is a genetically heterogeneous disorder of methylmalonate and cobalamin (cbl; vitamin B12) metabolism.

name: Myoglobinuria
label: Myoglobinuria
definition: Presence of myoglobin in the urine.|Myoglobinuria is usually associated with rhabdomyolysis or muscle destruction.

name: Hyperchloriduria
label: Hyperchloriduria
definition: An increased concentration of chloride in the urine.

name: Abnormality of chromosome segregation
label: Abnormality of chromosome segregation
definition: An abnormality of chromosome segregation.

name: Hypomagnesemia
label: Hypomagnesemia
definition: An abnormally decreased magnesium concentration in the blood.

name: Hypermagnesemia
label: Hypermagnesemia
definition: An abnormally increased magnesium concentration in the blood.

name: Ketonuria
label: Ketonuria
definition: High levels of ketone bodies in the urine.|Acetone is the main component of the ketone bodies.

name: Decreased circulating ACTH level
label: Decreased circulating ACTH level
definition: An abnormal reduction in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.

name: Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid
label: Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid
definition: An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).|The cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is secreted by the choroid plexus, and flows uninterrupted throughout the central nervous system (the central cerebrospinal canal of the spinal cord and through the four interconnected cerebral ventricles in the brain).

name: Increased CSF protein
label: Increased CSF protein
definition: Increased concentration of protein in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Rheumatoid factor positive
label: Rheumatoid factor positive
definition: The presence in the serum of an autoantibody directed against the Fc portion of IgG.

name: Increased thyroid-stimulating hormone level
label: Increased thyroid-stimulating hormone level
definition: Overproduction of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) by the anterior pituitary gland.

name: Abnormality of thyroid physiology
label: Abnormality of thyroid physiology
definition: An abnormal functionality of the thyroid gland.

name: Histidinuria
label: Histidinuria
definition: An increased concentration of histidine in the urine.|Normal urinary histidine total (free and combined form) excretion is around 190 mg per 24 hours.

name: Decreased activity of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex
label: Decreased activity of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex

name: Impaired sensitivity to thyroid hormone
label: Impaired sensitivity to thyroid hormone
definition: Reduced sensitivity of end organs to thyroid hormone characterized by elevated serum levels of free thyroid hormone with nonsuppressed thyroid stimulating hormone.|Impaired sensitivity to thyroid hormone may be accompanied by goiter and no clear symptoms and signs of thyrotoxicosis. The etiologies of this feature include defects in the thyroid hormone receptor, reduced cellular access of the biologically active thyroid hormone, T3 related to defects of thyroid hormone cell membrane transport, and a defect reducing the intracellular metabolism generating T3 from T4.

name: Aldehyde oxidase deficiency
label: Aldehyde oxidase deficiency
definition: A reduction in aldehyde oxidase activity.|Aldehyde oxidase generates carboxylic acids from aldehydes.

name: Ventral hernia
label: Ventral hernia
definition: Ventral hernia refers to a condition in which abdominal contents protrude through a weakened portion of the abdominal wall.

name: Distal sensory impairment
label: Distal sensory impairment
definition: An abnormal reduction in sensation in the distal portions of the extremities.

name: Hemivertebrae
label: Hemivertebrae
definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body.|Lateral hemivertebrae represent a developmental defect resulting from the failure of the contralateral chondral center to develop. Dorsal hemivertebrae result from a developmental defect in which the anterior chondral centers fail to develop, and ventral hemivertebrae result from failure of the posterior centers to ossify. The affected half of the vertebral body may by hypoplastic or absent, as is the pedicle, and (for thoracic vetebrae) the corresponding rib. The affected half of the vertebral body may also show a fusion or segmentation defect.

name: Lumbar hyperlordosis
label: Lumbar hyperlordosis
definition: An abnormal accentuation of the inward curvature of the spine in the lumbar region.

name: Thoracic kyphosis
label: Thoracic kyphosis
definition: Over curvature of the thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

name: Intervertebral space narrowing
label: Intervertebral space narrowing
definition: Decreased height of the intervertebral disk.|A decrease in the height of the intervertebral disks is usually observed as a narrowing of the space between the vertebrae on X-ray examination.

name: Cervical kyphosis
label: Cervical kyphosis
definition: Exaggerated convexity of the cervical vertebral column, causing the cervical spine to bow outwards and take on a rounded appearance.

name: Vertebral fusion
label: Vertebral fusion
definition: A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae.

name: Fused cervical vertebrae
label: Fused cervical vertebrae
definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another.

name: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
label: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
definition: Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Granulomatosis
label: Granulomatosis
definition: A granulomatous inflammation leading to multiple granuloma formation, which is a specific type of inflammation. A granuloma is a focal compact collection of inflammatory cells, mononuclear cells predominating, usually as a result of the persistence of a non-degradable product and of active cell mediated hypersensitivity.|This finding can be demonstrated by tissue biopsy. A granuloma is a compact (organized) collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes (macrophages and/or epithelioid cells) which may or may not be accompanied by accessory features such as necrosis or the infiltration of other inflammatory leukocytes (Adams DO. The granulomatous inflammatory response. Am J Pathol 1976:84:163-192).

name: Immune dysregulation
label: Immune dysregulation
definition: Altered immune function characterized by lymphoid proliferation, immune activation, and excessive autoreactivity often leading to autoimmune/inflammatory complications.

name: Impaired Ig class switch recombination
label: Impaired Ig class switch recombination
definition: An impairment of the class-switch recombination process that normally leads B lymphocytes to produce IgG, IgA, or IgE.|The generation of the antibody repertoire requires two successive steps. The first is antigen- and T-cell-independent; it takes place in the fetal liver and the bone marrow. Immature B lymphocytes rearrange their immunoglobulin-gene variable segments (V segments), diversity segments (D segments) and joining segments (J segments), producing a functionally integrated VDJ segment linked to the mu constant region (C-mu), which determines the primary antibody repertoire composed of IgM antibodies. The second step is antigen- and T-cell-dependent and takes place in secondary lymphoid organs. After encountering antigen, B cells proliferate and form germinal centers. In this unique anatomic formation, two genetic events lead to generation of the secondary antibody repertoire: class-switch recombination (CSR) and somatic hypermutation (SHM). CSR of immunoglobulins occurs by a recombination process between two different switch regions (S regions) located upstream of each C region. Replacement of C-mu by a constant region of another class of immunoglobulin (C-gamma, C-alpha or C-epsilon) ensues and leads to the production of IgG, IgA or IgE.

name: Autoimmunity
label: Autoimmunity
definition: The occurrence of an immune reaction against the organism's own cells or tissues.

name: Dysgammaglobulinemia
label: Dysgammaglobulinemia
definition: Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

name: Abnormal delayed hypersensitivity skin test
label: Abnormal delayed hypersensitivity skin test
definition: Delay in cutaneous immune reaction to specific antigens mediated not by antibodies but by cells. The delayed hypersensitivity test is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a specific antigen and is performed by injecting a small amount of the antigen into the skin. The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.|This is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a certain substance.

name: Cutaneous anergy
label: Cutaneous anergy
definition: Inability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.|Anergy skin testing assesses the responses to skin-test antigens to which a cell-mediated, delayed-type hypersensitivity (DTH) response is expected.

name: Cubitus valgus
label: Cubitus valgus
definition: Abnormal positioning in which the elbows are turned out.

name: Genu varum
label: Genu varum
definition: A positional abnormality marked by outward bowing of the legs in which the knees stay wide apart when a person stands with the feet and ankles together.

name: Absent microvilli on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes
label: Absent microvilli on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes
definition: Absence of the fingerlike protrusive, actin-dependent structures found on the surface of peripheral blood lymphocytes.

name: Reduced delayed hypersensitivity
label: Reduced delayed hypersensitivity
definition: Decreased ability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.

name: Abnormality of the forearm
label: Abnormality of the forearm
definition: An abnormality of the lower arm.

name: Radioulnar synostosis
label: Radioulnar synostosis
definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of tissue in the central nervous system.

name: Bowing of the legs
label: Bowing of the legs
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the leg.

name: Femoral bowing
label: Femoral bowing
definition: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the femur.

name: Abnormality of the calf
label: Abnormality of the calf
definition: An abnormality of the calf, i.e. of the posterior part of the lower leg.

name: Tibial bowing
label: Tibial bowing
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the tibia.|A developmental defect with posteromedial tibial angulation.

name: Micromelia
label: Micromelia
definition: The presence of abnormally small extremities.

name: Hypoplasia of the radius
label: Hypoplasia of the radius
definition: Underdevelopment of the radius.

name: Radial bowing
label: Radial bowing
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the radius.

name: Elbow flexion contracture
label: Elbow flexion contracture
definition: A chronic loss of elbow joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the elbow.

name: Fibular aplasia
label: Fibular aplasia
definition: Absence of the fibula.

name: Abnormality of fibula morphology
label: Abnormality of fibula morphology
definition: An anomaly of the calf bone (fibula), one of the two bones of the calf.

name: Abnormality of tibia morphology
label: Abnormality of tibia morphology
definition: Abnormality of the tibia (shinbone).

name: Abnormality of the ulna
label: Abnormality of the ulna
definition: An abnormality of the ulna bone of the forearm.

name: Patellar dislocation
label: Patellar dislocation
definition: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar dislocation occurs if the patella fully dislocates out of the groove.

name: Breast carcinoma
label: Breast carcinoma
definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the breast.

name: Ganglioneuroma
label: Ganglioneuroma
definition: A benign neoplasm that usually arises from the sympathetic trunk in the mediastinum, representing a tumor of the sympathetic nerve fibers arising from neural crest cells.|Ganglioneuromas and ganglioneuroblastomas are tumors of the sympathetic nervous system. They originate from neural crest sympathogonia, which are completely undifferentiated cells of the sympathetic nervous system.

name: Neuroblastoma
label: Neuroblastoma
definition: Neuroblastoma is a solid tumor that originate in neural crest cells of the sympathetic nervous system. Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.

name: Prolonged bleeding time
label: Prolonged bleeding time
definition: Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding.|The bleeding time test measures the time taken for blood vessel constriction and platelet plug formation to occur. No clot is allowed to form, so that the arrest of bleeding depends exclusively on blood vessel constriction and platelet action. To perform the test, pressure is maintained throughout the test by inflating a sphygmomanometer cuff on the upper arm. The dorsal surface of the forearm is then cleaned, and the bleeding time device placed onto the skin and the trigger is depressed. At 30-second intervals, the flow of blood is blotted with filter paper. The time from puncture to cessation of bleeding is then recorded as the bleeding time. Normal values depend on the device used and other parameters, but are around 2 to 9 minutes.

name: Abnormality of the musculature
label: Abnormality of the musculature
definition: Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.

name: Bulging epiphyses
label: Bulging epiphyses
definition: A morphological abnormality of epiphyses whereby they are abnormally outwardly curving (protuberant).

name: Flared metaphysis
label: Flared metaphysis
definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones.|Figure 11 of PMID:12853662 shows metaphyseal flaring.

name: Metaphyseal widening
label: Metaphyseal widening
definition: Abnormal widening of the metaphyseal regions of long bones.

name: Abnormality of the wrist
label: Abnormality of the wrist
definition: Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.

name: Metaphyseal cupping
label: Metaphyseal cupping
definition: Metaphyseal cupping refers to an inward bulging of the metaphyseal profile giving the metaphysis a cup-like appearance.

name: Hypoplasia of the ulna
label: Hypoplasia of the ulna
definition: Underdevelopment of the ulna.

name: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
label: Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures
definition: Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures.

name: Metaphyseal irregularity
label: Metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphyses.

name: Short long bone
label: Short long bone
definition: One or more abnormally short long bone.|Long bones are also known as tubular bones.

name: Mesomelia
label: Mesomelia
definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.|Shortening of the limbs where the predominant shortness is in the middle bones.

name: Ulnar bowing
label: Ulnar bowing
definition: Bending of the diaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.|Ulnar bowing is usually in the convex posterior direction.

name: Diaphyseal sclerosis
label: Diaphyseal sclerosis
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Enlarged joints
label: Enlarged joints
definition: Increase in size of one or more joints.

name: Fibular hypoplasia
label: Fibular hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the fibula.

name: Humeroradial synostosis
label: Humeroradial synostosis
definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.

name: Elbow dislocation
label: Elbow dislocation
definition: Dislocation of the distal humerus out of the elbow joint, where the radius, ulna, and humerus meet.

name: Abnormality of the shoulder
label: Abnormality of the shoulder
definition: An abnormality of the shoulder, which is defined as the structures surrounding the shoulder joint where the humerus attaches to the scapula.

name: Shoulder flexion contracture
label: Shoulder flexion contracture
definition: Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Abnormal patella morphology
label: Abnormal patella morphology
definition: Abnormality of the patella (knee cap).

name: Radial head subluxation
label: Radial head subluxation
definition: Partial dislocation of the head of the radius.

name: Enlarged metaphyses
label: Enlarged metaphyses
definition: Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.

name: Tetraamelia
label: Tetraamelia
definition: Amelia of all four limbs.

name: Abnormality of the humerus
label: Abnormality of the humerus
definition: An abnormality of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).

name: Patellar hypoplasia
label: Patellar hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the patella.

name: Madelung deformity
label: Madelung deformity
definition: An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.

name: Flattened epiphysis
label: Flattened epiphysis
definition: Abnormal flatness (decreased height) of epiphyses.

name: Hypercalcemia
label: Hypercalcemia
definition: An abnormally increased calcium concentration in the blood.

name: Hypoalbuminemia
label: Hypoalbuminemia
definition: Reduction in the concentration of albumin in the blood.

name: Hyperglycemia
label: Hyperglycemia
definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Hypoproteinemia
label: Hypoproteinemia
definition: A decreased concentration of protein in the blood.

name: Glycosuria
label: Glycosuria
definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the urine.|Glycosuria, the excretion of abnormal amounts of glucose in the urine, generally results in osmotic diuresis.

name: Hyperlipidemia
label: Hyperlipidemia
definition: An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.|Hyperlipidemia is an elevation of the blood levels of lipids including primarily cholesterol, phospholipids and triglycerides and cholesterol esters. The lipids are transported on lipoproteins some of which are commonly used for clinical measurements, including chylomicrons, very-low density lipoproteins (VLDL), intermediate-density lipoproteins (IDL), low-density lipoproteins, and high-density lipoproteins (HDL).

name: Defective DNA repair after ultraviolet radiation damage
label: Defective DNA repair after ultraviolet radiation damage

name: Hydroxyprolinuria
label: Hydroxyprolinuria
definition: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxy-L-proline in the urine.

name: Increased urinary potassium
label: Increased urinary potassium
definition: An increased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

name: Dislocated radial head
label: Dislocated radial head
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint.

name: Fractures of the long bones
label: Fractures of the long bones
definition: An increased tendency to fractures of the long bones (Mainly, the femur, tibia, fibula,humerus, radius, and ulna).

name: Long fibula
label: Long fibula
definition: Disproportionately long fibulae.

name: Acromesomelia
label: Acromesomelia
definition: Small hands and feet.

name: Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
label: Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
definition: Underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Trophic limb changes
label: Trophic limb changes
definition: Trophic changes occurring in a limb.

name: Limited hip extension
label: Limited hip extension
definition: Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward.|Reduced ability to straighten out the femur.

name: Short femur
label: Short femur
definition: An abnormal shortening of the femur.

name: Fibular overgrowth
label: Fibular overgrowth
definition: Relatively increased growth of the fibula compared to that of the tibia.

name: Slender long bone
label: Slender long bone
definition: Reduced diameter of a long bone.

name: Increased carrying angle
label: Increased carrying angle
definition: An abnormal increase in the carrying angle, which is the angle he long axis of the extended forearm as it lies lateral to the long axis of the arm.|Anatomically, the carrying angle in human adults is approximately 10 degrees in men and 13 degrees in women. Increasing the carrying angle may lead to elbow instability and pain during exercise or in throwing activities of sports, may reduce function of elbow flexion, predispose to risk of elbow dislocation, and increase evidence of elbow fracture when falling on the outstretched hand and fracture of the distal humeral epiphysis.

name: Abnormal cortical bone morphology
label: Abnormal cortical bone morphology
definition: An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones.

name: Protuberances at ends of long bones
label: Protuberances at ends of long bones
definition: The presence of multiple protuberances (bulges, or knobs) at the ends of the long bones.

name: Subperiosteal bone resorption
label: Subperiosteal bone resorption
definition: Loss of bone mass occurring beneath the periosteum (the periosteum is the connective-tissue membrane that surrounds all bones except at the articular surfaces). This process may create a serrated and lace-like appearance in periosteal cortical bone.

name: Abnormal circulating cholesterol concentration
label: Abnormal circulating cholesterol concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cholesterol in the blood circulation.

name: Hyperglycinuria
label: Hyperglycinuria
definition: An increased concentration of glycine in the urine.|Normal urinary glycine total (free and combined form) excretion is around 450 mg per 24 hours.

name: Hyperphosphaturia
label: Hyperphosphaturia
definition: An increased excretion of phosphates in the urine.

name: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
label: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
definition: An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.

name: Abnormal blood ion concentration
label: Abnormal blood ion concentration
definition: Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.

name: Abnormality of serum amino acid level
label: Abnormality of serum amino acid level
definition: The presence of an abnormal decrease or increase of one or more amino acids in the blood circulation.

name: Hypochloremia
label: Hypochloremia
definition: An abnormally decreased chloride concentration in the blood.

name: Abnormal EKG
label: Abnormal EKG
definition: Abnormal rhythm of the heart.

name: Abnormal echocardiogram
label: Abnormal echocardiogram
definition: An abnormality detectable by sonography of the heart (echocardiography).|Note that while structural heart anomalies can cause abnormal echocardiograpy findings, structural abnormalities are detectable by multiple imaging modalities and should be coded using terms from the hierarchy under 'Abnormality of cardiac morphology' (HP:0001627).

name: Abnormal circulating hormone level
label: Abnormal circulating hormone level
definition: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the blood.

name: Increased circulating cortisol level
label: Increased circulating cortisol level
definition: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.

name: Abnormal circulating lipid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating lipid concentration
definition: An abnormality in the of lipid metabolism.|According to CHEBI:18059 'Lipids' is a loosely defined term for substances of biological origin that are soluble in nonpolar solvents. They consist of saponifiable lipids, such as glycerides (fats and oils) and phospholipids, as well as nonsaponifiable lipids, principally steroids.

name: Limb joint contracture
label: Limb joint contracture
definition: A contrqacture (chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin) that prevent normal movement of one or more joints of the limbs.

name: Hypercholesterolemia
label: Hypercholesterolemia
definition: An increased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

name: Reduced factor VIII activity
label: Reduced factor VIII activity
definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

name: Low-molecular-weight proteinuria
label: Low-molecular-weight proteinuria
definition: Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD).

name: Hypocalciuria
label: Hypocalciuria
definition: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the urine.

name: Lactic acidosis
label: Lactic acidosis
definition: An abnormal buildup of lactic acid in the body, leading to acidification of the blood and other bodily fluids.|Note that the term acidemia is used to describe the state of low pH in the blood, whereas acidosis is used to describe the processes that lead to acidemia. In medical jargon, however, the two terms are used interchangeably.

name: Abnormal peripheral myelination
label: Abnormal peripheral myelination
definition: An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense.|This finding may be observed upon biopsy of the sural nerve. Myelination, i.e., the presence of a segmented lipid-rich sheath (myelin), enables faster and more energetically efficient conduction of electrical impulses. The sheath is formed by the cell membranes of Schwann cells in the peripheral nervous system (GO:0022011).

name: Cystinuria
label: Cystinuria
definition: An increased concentration of cystine in the urine.|Cystine is a sulfur-containing amino acid.

name: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
label: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
definition: An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.

name: Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction
label: Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction
definition: An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).|A nerve conduction study (NCS) is commonly conducted together with electromyography in order to evaluate muscle disorders. For the NCS, dermal electrodes are placed at intervals over the nerve to be examined, and a low-intensity current is introducted to generate action potentials. The velocity of the action potential is related to the diameter of the nerve fiber and the presence of a myelin sheath. Diseases of the myelin sheath characteristically reduce the nerve conduction velocity (NCV). The amplitude of the response is also measured.

name: Prolinuria
label: Prolinuria
definition: An increased concentration of proline in the urine.|Normal urinary proline total (free and combined form) excretion is around 40 mg per 24 hours.

name: Increased blood urea nitrogen
label: Increased blood urea nitrogen
definition: An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood.

name: Panhypogammaglobulinemia
label: Panhypogammaglobulinemia
definition: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.

name: T-wave inversion in the right precordial leads
label: T-wave inversion in the right precordial leads

name: Increased LDL cholesterol concentration
label: Increased LDL cholesterol concentration
definition: An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Increased serum serotonin
label: Increased serum serotonin
definition: A increased concentration of serotonin in the blood.

name: Decreased adenosylcobalamin
label: Decreased adenosylcobalamin
definition: Decreased concentration of adenosylcobalamin. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.

name: Hypocholesterolemia
label: Hypocholesterolemia
definition: An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

name: Elevated serum acid phosphatase
label: Elevated serum acid phosphatase
definition: Acid phosphatase can free attached phosphate groups from other molecules. It is a lysosomal enzyme.

name: Hyperuricosuria
label: Hyperuricosuria
definition: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the urine.

name: Glutaric aciduria
label: Glutaric aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the urine.

name: Cystathioninuria
label: Cystathioninuria
definition: An elevated urinary concentration of cystathionine.|Cystathionine can be directly interconverted to cysteine. Normal cystathione urinary values are under 150 micromole per gram creatinine.

name: Increased circulating ACTH level
label: Increased circulating ACTH level
definition: An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.

name: Elevated alkaline phosphatase
label: Elevated alkaline phosphatase
definition: Abnormally increased serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.

name: Hyposthenuria
label: Hyposthenuria
definition: An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.|Hyposthenuria may occur with impaired renal concentrating power or upon abnormally low hormonal stimulation, as in diabetes insipidus.

name: Hyperoxaluria
label: Hyperoxaluria
definition: Increased excretion of oxalates in the urine.

name: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin
label: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin
definition: Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.|Human serum transferrin has two N-glycosylation sites, which are normally both fully occupied by disialylated biantennary glycans to generate tetrasialotransferrin.

name: 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvic aciduria
label: 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvic aciduria
definition: Increased concentration of pyruvic acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid
label: Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid
definition: An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.|Delta-aminolevulinic acid synthesis is a rate-controlling step in heme synthesis.

name: Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone level
label: Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone level
definition: An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.

name: Increased urinary taurine
label: Increased urinary taurine
definition: Increased concentration of taurine in the urine.

name: Carnosinuria
label: Carnosinuria
definition: An increased concentration of carnosine in the urine.|Carnosine is the N-(beta-alanyl) derivative of L-histidine.

name: Abnormality of the acetabulum
label: Abnormality of the acetabulum
definition: An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.

name: Abnormality of the pubic bone
label: Abnormality of the pubic bone
definition: An anomaly of the the pubic bone, i.e., of the ventral and anterior of the three principal components (publis, ilium, ischium) of the hip bone.

name: Hypoplastic pubic bone
label: Hypoplastic pubic bone
definition: Underdevelopment of the pubis, which together with the ilium and the ischium, is one of the three bones that make up the hip bone.

name: Abnormality of the ischium
label: Abnormality of the ischium
definition: An anomaly of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.|The ischium, together with the ilium and the pubis, forms the hip bone (os coxae).

name: Hypoplastic ischia
label: Hypoplastic ischia
definition: Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Squared iliac bones
label: Squared iliac bones
definition: A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance.

name: Protrusio acetabuli
label: Protrusio acetabuli
definition: Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.|Protrusion of the acetabulum, which is the socket that together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint. The protrusion is the result of increased depth of the socket and results in medial displacement of the femoral head.

name: Flat acetabular roof
label: Flat acetabular roof
definition: Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.

name: Wide pubic symphysis
label: Wide pubic symphysis
definition: Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones.

name: Decreased hip abduction
label: Decreased hip abduction
definition: Reduced ability to move the femur outward to the side.

name: Short greater sciatic notch
label: Short greater sciatic notch
definition: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a reduction in the height of the notch.

name: Inverted nipples
label: Inverted nipples
definition: The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards.

name: Breast hypoplasia
label: Breast hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the breast.

name: Long nose
label: Long nose
definition: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased length from the nasal root to the nasal base.

name: Cleft ala nasi
label: Cleft ala nasi
definition: The presence of a notch in the margin of the ala nasi.|The alae nasi are the lateral portions of the nose or the wings of the nostrils, which partly encircle the nostrils (nares). They are usually about the width of the columella, but vary greatly depending on the shape of the nostril. Note that individuals may be described as having a cleft ala nasi, but have a severely Underdeveloped ala nasi. In an underdeveloped ala the continuity of the tissue encircling the nostril is undisturbed while in a cleft it is disrupted. The term coloboma has been replaced because a coloboma is a remnant of a physiologically occurring discontinuity of tissue; the alae nasi do not have such a discontinuity.

name: Allergic rhinitis
label: Allergic rhinitis
definition: It is characterized by one or more symptoms including sneezing, itching, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea.

name: Short nose
label: Short nose
definition: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations below the mean, or alternatively, an apparently decreased length from the nasal root to the nasal tip.|Note: a small nose has both decreased height and a decreased width. These should be coded separately.

name: Myopathy
label: Myopathy
definition: A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction.|The diagnosis of myopathy is often confirmed on the basis of myopathic changes in muscle biopsy.

name: Ragged-red muscle fibers
label: Ragged-red muscle fibers
definition: An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.|This finding is demonstrated by muscle biopsy. Note that additionally, muscle fibers with mitochondrial proliferation stain darkly for succinic dehydrogenase (SDH).

name: Rhabdomyolysis
label: Rhabdomyolysis
definition: Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream.

name: Skeletal muscle atrophy
label: Skeletal muscle atrophy
definition: The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy).

name: Impaired oxidative burst
label: Impaired oxidative burst
definition: In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.|The NBT test measures the ability of neutrophils to convert nitroblue tetrazolium (NBT), to a deep blue color. This test can be abnormal in chronic granulomatous disease.

name: Intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
label: Intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
definition: The intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent storage material.|Accumulation of intracellular autofluorescent material or aging pigment has been characterized as a normal aging event. Lipofuscin (from the Greek word for fat and the Latin word for dark), refers to intracellular autofluorescent material that accumulates in aging cells with a excitation wavelength between 320 and 480 nm and an emission wavelength between 460 and 630 nm. Lpofuscin consists of a mixture of oxidized proteins and lipids, carbohydrates and trace amount of metals. Ceroid iss a lipofuscin-like lipopigment that arises from pathological conditions such as disease, malnutrition, and cell stress. Subunit c of mitochondrial ATP synthase makes up approximately 40% of this lipopigment/ceroid accumulation.

name: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
label: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a curved pattern.

name: Arterial calcification
label: Arterial calcification
definition: Pathological deposition of calcium salts in one or more arteries.|Most individuals aged over 60 years have progressively enlarging deposits of calcium mineral in their major arteries. This vascular calcification reduces aortic and arterial elastance, which impairs cardiovascular hemodynamics, resulting in substantial morbidity and mortality in the form of hypertension, aortic stenosis, cardiac hypertrophy, myocardial and lower-limb ischemia, congestive heart failure, and compromised structural integrity.The severity and extent of mineralization reflect atherosclerotic plaque burden and strongly and independently predict cardiovascular morbidity and mortality. (From PMID:18519861).

name: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
label: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a trabecular or fingerprint-like pattern.

name: Decreased pyruvate carboxylase activity
label: Decreased pyruvate carboxylase activity
definition: A decreased rate of pyruvate carboxylase activity.|Pyruvate carboxylase (EC 6.4.1.1) is a nuclear-encoded mitochondrial enzyme that catalyzes the conversion of pyruvate to oxaloacetate, a precursor for the citric acid cycle.

name: Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity
label: Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity
definition: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.|The product of the enzyme, succinyl-CoA, is a key molecule of the TCA (Krebs) cycle. The substrate of the enzyme, methylmalonyl-CoA, is primarily derived from propionyl-CoA, a substance formed from the catabolism of isoleucine, valine, threonine, methionine, thymine, uracil, cholesterol, or odd-chain fatty acids.

name: Increased circulating total IgE level
label: Increased circulating total IgE level
definition: An abnormally increased overall level of immunoglobulin E in blood.

name: Deficient excision of UV-induced pyrimidine dimers in DNA
label: Deficient excision of UV-induced pyrimidine dimers in DNA

name: Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle
label: Prolonged G2 phase of cell cycle

name: Dicarboxylic aciduria
label: Dicarboxylic aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of dicarboxylic acid in the urine.|Dicarboxylic aciduria occurs during increased mobilization or inhibited beta-oxidation of fatty acids, where a number of 3-hydroxydicarboxylic acids are excreted in the urine.

name: Generalized amyloid deposition
label: Generalized amyloid deposition
definition: A diffuse form of amyloidosis.|According to MeSH (D000682), Amyloid is fibrous protein complex that consists of proteins folded into a specific cross beta-pleated sheet structure. This fibrillar structure has been found as an alternative folding pattern for a variety of functional proteins. Deposits of amyloid in the form of amyloid plaques are associated with a variety of degenerative diseases. The amyloid structure has also been found in a number of functional proteins that are unrelated to disease.

name: Hyperglutaminemia
label: Hyperglutaminemia
definition: An increased concentration of glutamine in the blood.|Normal glutamine blood levels are around 550-600 micromole per liter.

name: Oroticaciduria
label: Oroticaciduria
definition: An increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.|Orotic acid is an intermediate in the biosynthesis of pyrimidine nucleotides. Some enzymatic deficiencies can cause the excretion of a large amount of orotic acid in the urine and a defect in pyrimidine biosynthesis.

name: Ethylmalonic aciduria
label: Ethylmalonic aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of ethylmalonic acid in the urine.|Ethylmalonic acid is a dicarboxylic acid obtained by substitution of one of the methylene hydrogens of malonic acid by an ethyl group.

name: Abnormality of chromosome stability
label: Abnormality of chromosome stability
definition: A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

name: Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents
label: Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents
definition: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with DNA cross-linking agents such as diepoxybutane and mitomycin C.|Increased tendency to chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents is typical for the various forms of Fanconi anemia.

name: Decreased methylcobalamin
label: Decreased methylcobalamin
definition: Decreased concentration of methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

name: Increased cellular sensitivity to UV light
label: Increased cellular sensitivity to UV light

name: Reduced coagulation factor V activity
label: Reduced coagulation factor V activity
definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor V.|Factor V is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.

name: Rectilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
label: Rectilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
definition: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a straight or rectilinear pattern.

name: Hypernatremia
label: Hypernatremia
definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.

name: Hypertyrosinemia
label: Hypertyrosinemia
definition: An increased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.|Defect in fumarylacetoacetase.

name: Decreased HDL cholesterol concentration
label: Decreased HDL cholesterol concentration
definition: An decreased concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Decreased plasma carnitine
label: Decreased plasma carnitine
definition: A decreased concentration of carnitine in the blood.|Carnitine is responsible for the transport of fatty acids from the cytosol into the mitochondria.

name: Hypermethioninemia
label: Hypermethioninemia
definition: An increased concentration of methionine in the blood.|Elevated blood methionine levels in the range of 500-2000 micromolar.

name: Elevated serum creatine kinase
label: Elevated serum creatine kinase
definition:
An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase, CPK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CPK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.|'has part' some 
('increased amount' and ('inheres in' some 
(IMR_0002602 and ('part of' some blood))) and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Increased circulating IgG level
label: Increased circulating IgG level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin G in blood.

name: Phosphoethanolaminuria
label: Phosphoethanolaminuria
definition: An increased concentration of phosphoethanolamine in the urine.

name: Increased phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase activity
label: Increased phosphoribosylpyrophosphate synthetase activity
definition: Abnormally elevated activity of the enzyme phosphoribosyl pyrophosphatesynthetase, which catalyzes the synthesis of PP-ribose-P from ATP and ribose-5-phosphate.

name: External genital hypoplasia
label: External genital hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of part or all of the external reproductive organs.|Partial or complete failure of the genitalia to develop, often as a consequence of hypogonadism.

name: Penile hypospadias
label: Penile hypospadias
definition: Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.

name: Prominent scrotal raphe
label: Prominent scrotal raphe
definition: Increased size of the ridge of tissue that extends along the midline of the scrotum.

name: Gonadal tissue inappropriate for external genitalia or chromosomal sex
label: Gonadal tissue inappropriate for external genitalia or chromosomal sex

name: Aplasia of the vagina
label: Aplasia of the vagina
definition: Aplasia of the vagina.

name: Abnormality of DNA repair
label: Abnormality of DNA repair
definition: An abnormality of the process of DNA repair, that is, of the process of restoring DNA after damage.

name: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
label: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
definition: An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators.

name: Elevated serum creatinine
label: Elevated serum creatinine
definition: An increased amount of creatinine in the blood.

name: Hydroxyprolinemia
label: Hydroxyprolinemia
definition: An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood.|Hydroxyproline is an imino acid normally present in human plasma and is derived primarily from endogenous collagen turnover and the breakdown of dietary collagen. Hyperhydroxyprolinemic patients show hydroxyproline blood levels between 150 and 500 micromole per liter. Normal levels are around 10-20 micromole per liter.

name: Increased circulating IgA level
label: Increased circulating IgA level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin A in blood.

name: Smooth muscle antibody positivity
label: Smooth muscle antibody positivity
definition: The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.|Anti smooth muscle antibody (SMA) may be present in a number of conditions including chronic active hepatitis, autoimmune hepatitis, cirrhosis, and infectious mononucleosis.

name: Deficiency of N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase
label: Deficiency of N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase
definition: N-acetylglucosamine-1-phosphotransferase catalyzes the initial step in the synthesis of the mannose 6-phosphate determinant required for efficient intracellular targeting of newly synthesized lysosomal hydrolases to the lysosome.

name: Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia
label: Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia
definition: A type of hyperbilirubinemia with neonatal onset.

name: Reduced orotidine 5-prime phosphate decarboxylase activity
label: Reduced orotidine 5-prime phosphate decarboxylase activity
definition: An abnormal decrease in orotidine 5'-phosphate decarboxylase activity.|The enzyme orotidine-5-prime-phosphate decarboxylase (EC 4.1.1.23) catalyzes the reaction H(+) + orotidine 5'-phosphate = CO(2) + UMP (uridine monophosphate). The enzyme is thusinvolved in pyrimidine biosynthesis.

name: Argininuria
label: Argininuria
definition: A increased concentration of arginine in the urine.|Normal urinary arginine total (free and combined form) excretion is around 30 mg per 24 hours.

name: Abdominal distention
label: Abdominal distention
definition: Distention of the abdomen.|Abdominal distention can be a secondary feature associated with a number of conditions such as bowel obstruction.

name: Visceromegaly
label: Visceromegaly
definition: Abnormal increased size of the viscera of the abdomen.|Visceromegaly is enlargement of the internal organs in the abdomen, including liver, spleen, stomach, kidneys, or pancreas.

name: Abnormality of the hip bone
label: Abnormality of the hip bone
definition: An abnormality of the hip bone.|The hip region comprises the vasculature of hip, skin of hip, superficial fascia of hip, the hip bone, hip joint, and musculature of hip. The hip is part of the pelvic girdle.

name: Hypoplastic acetabulae
label: Hypoplastic acetabulae
definition: Underdeveloped acetabulae.

name: Narrow pelvis bone
label: Narrow pelvis bone
definition: Reduced side to side width of the pelvis.

name: Pelvic bone exostoses
label: Pelvic bone exostoses
definition: A benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface of the pelvis. Exostoses are capped by cartilage, and arise from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Square pelvis bone
label: Square pelvis bone
definition: An abnormally squared appearance of the bony pelvis, a normally rounded or basin-shaped structure.

name: Coxa magna
label: Coxa magna
