definition: Widening of the femoral head and neck.|Coxa magna can occur as a result of developmental dysplasia of the hip, Perthes disease, septic arthritis, Kniest dysplasia, among others.

name: Increased serum ferritin
label: Increased serum ferritin
definition: Abnormal raised concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.|Ferritin levels measured in serum usually have a direct correlation with the total amount of iron stored in the body, but ferritin levels may also be increased with anemia of chronic disease or in the course of an acute phase reaction.

name: Low alkaline phosphatase
label: Low alkaline phosphatase
definition: Abnormally reduced serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.

name: Cystathioninemia
label: Cystathioninemia
definition: An increased concentration of cystathionine in the blood.|Cystathionine can be directly interconverted to cysteine. Cystathionine is not normally detectable in plasma.

name: Abnormality of mitochondrial metabolism
label: Abnormality of mitochondrial metabolism
definition: A functional anomaly of mitochondria.

name: Decreased serum leptin
label: Decreased serum leptin
definition: A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.|Leptin is an adipocyte-secreted hormone with a key role in energy homeostasis.

name: obsolete Impaired FSH and LH secretion
label: obsolete Impaired FSH and LH secretion

name: Hyperthreoninuria
label: Hyperthreoninuria
definition: An increased concentration of threonine in the urine.|Normal urinary threonine total (free and combined form) excretion is around 50 mg per 24 hours.

name: Hyperlysinuria
label: Hyperlysinuria
definition: An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.|Normal urinary lysine total (free and combined form) excretion is around 80 mg per 24 hours.

name: Spina bifida occulta
label: Spina bifida occulta
definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.|May be asymptomatic.

name: Ovoid vertebral bodies
label: Ovoid vertebral bodies
definition: When viewed in lateral radiographs, vertebral bodies have a roughly rectangular configuration. This term applies if the vertebral body appears rounded or oval.

name: Irregular vertebral endplates
label: Irregular vertebral endplates
definition: An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.

name: Spondylolisthesis
label: Spondylolisthesis
definition: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.

name: Spondylolysis
label: Spondylolysis
definition: Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.|The pars interarticularis is one of the bony bridges that connect the upper with the lower facet joints of the vertebra. Lumbar spondylolysis is a common cause of lower back pain. The vast majority of cases of spondylolysis occur at the L5 or L4 levels, and is usually diagnosed radiographically. Over half of patients affected by spondylolysis have associated spondylolisthesis.

name: Block vertebrae
label: Block vertebrae
definition: Congenital synostosis between two or more adjacent vertebrae (partial or complete fusion of adjacent vertabral bodies).

name: Spinal rigidity
label: Spinal rigidity
definition: Reduced ability to move the vertebral column with a resulting limitation of neck and trunk flexion.

name: Hyperlordosis
label: Hyperlordosis
definition: Abnormally increased cuvature (anterior concavity) of the lumbar or cervical spine.

name: Cervical subluxation
label: Cervical subluxation
definition: A partial dislocation of one or more intervertebral joints in the cervical vertebral column.

name: Abnormality of the odontoid process
label: Abnormality of the odontoid process
definition: Abnormality of the dens of the axis, which is also known as the odontoid process.|The dens of the axis is a protuberance of the C2 vertebral body around which the first vertebra rotates.

name: Hypoplasia of the odontoid process
label: Hypoplasia of the odontoid process
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.

name: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
label: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
definition: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

name: Butterfly vertebrae
label: Butterfly vertebrae
definition: In the orthopedic and radiological literature, sagittally cleft vertebra is generally known as a butterfly vertebra.

name: Abnormality of the cervical spine
label: Abnormality of the cervical spine
definition: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

name: C1-C2 subluxation
label: C1-C2 subluxation
definition: A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.|A subluxation affecting the intervertebral joint between the first and second cervical vertebrae.

name: Generalized muscle weakness
label: Generalized muscle weakness
definition: Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature.

name: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
label: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
definition: Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.

name: Myalgia
label: Myalgia
definition: Pain in muscle.

name: Axial muscle weakness
label: Axial muscle weakness
definition: Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs).

name: Hair shafts flattened at irregular intervals and twisted through 180 degrees about their axes
label: Hair shafts flattened at irregular intervals and twisted through 180 degrees about their axes

name: Abnormal bone structure
label: Abnormal bone structure
definition: Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.

name: Increased serum beta-hexosaminidase
label: Increased serum beta-hexosaminidase
definition: This enzyme removes a beta-1,4-linked N-acetylhexosamine residue from the GM2 ganglioside.

name: Elevated circulating catecholamine level
label: Elevated circulating catecholamine level
definition: An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.|Elevated circulating catecholamine level is a common feature in patients with pheochromocytoma.

name: Abnormal enchondral ossification
label: Abnormal enchondral ossification
definition: An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.|This term is intended to describe histological abnormalities of enchondral ossification observed upon bone biopsy.

name: Reduced prothrombin consumption
label: Reduced prothrombin consumption
definition: The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

name: Focal necrosis of right ventricular muscle cells
label: Focal necrosis of right ventricular muscle cells

name: Pyrimidine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
label: Pyrimidine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia that improves upon administration of pyrimidine supplements such as uridylic acid and cytidylic acid.

name: Junctional split
label: Junctional split
definition: The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.

name: Reduced glutathione synthetase activity
label: Reduced glutathione synthetase activity
definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme glutathione synthetase, which catalyzes the last step in the synthesis of glutathione and a deficiency results in low levels of glutathione. Acidosis is due to reduced feedback inhibition of gamma-glutamyl cysteine synthetase in the gamma-glutamyl cycle, which ultimately leads to overproduction and accumulation of 5-oxoproline.

name: Elevated urinary norepinephrine
label: Elevated urinary norepinephrine
definition: An increased concentration of noradrenaline in the urine.

name: Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin
label: Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin
definition: Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.|The response of lymphocytes to PHA is measured by their ability to transform and to undergo mitosis.

name: Hyperalaninemia
label: Hyperalaninemia
definition: An increased concentration of alanine in the blood.|This class referring to the clinical feature Hyperalaninemia and not to the disease entry. Normal alanine blood levels are around 350-400 micromole per liter.

name: Low cholesterol esterification rate
label: Low cholesterol esterification rate
definition: A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.|Cholesterol esterification convers free cholesterol to cholesteryl esters between the carboxylate group of a fatty acid and the hydroxyl group of cholesterol. Esterification allows more cholesterol to be packaged into the interior of lipoproteins. Cholesterol esterification rates can be measured in skin fibroblasts using for instance a non-lipoprotein [3H]cholesterol source.

name: Decreased circulating renin level
label: Decreased circulating renin level
definition: An decreased level of renin in the blood.

name: Endopolyploidy on chromosome studies of bone marrow
label: Endopolyploidy on chromosome studies of bone marrow
definition: An increase in the number of chromosome sets per cell in bone marrow cells.|Endopolyploidy is caused by replication without cell division.

name: Propionyl-CoA carboxylase deficiency
label: Propionyl-CoA carboxylase deficiency
definition: An abnormality of amino acid metabolism characterized by a decreased rate of propionyl-CoA carboxylase activity.|Propionyl-CoA is an important intermediate in the metabolism of several amino acids and is also produced by oxidation of odd-numbered fatty acids.

name: Hyperthreoninemia
label: Hyperthreoninemia
definition: An increased concentration of threonine in the blood.

name: Aminoaciduria
label: Aminoaciduria
definition: An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine.

name: Thymic hormone decreased
label: Thymic hormone decreased
definition: A reduction in the level of thymic horomone.

name: Elevated intracellular cystine
label: Elevated intracellular cystine
definition: An increased concentration of cystine within cells. This finding can be demonstrated on leukocytes, but is not specific to blood cells.|Cystine is a dimeric amino acid formed by the oxidation of two cysteine residues to form a disulfide bond.

name: Decreased urinary sulfate
label: Decreased urinary sulfate
definition: Decreased concentration of sulfate in the urine.

name: Tryptophanuria
label: Tryptophanuria
definition: An increased concentration of tryptophan in the urine.|Normal urinary tryptophan total (free and combined form) excretion is around 40 mg per 24 hours.

name: Increased VLDL cholesterol concentration
label: Increased VLDL cholesterol concentration
definition: An increase in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Abdominal situs inversus
label: Abdominal situs inversus
definition: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen.

name: Arthralgia of the hip
label: Arthralgia of the hip
definition: Joint pain affecting the hip.

name: Abnormality of the femoral neck or head region
label: Abnormality of the femoral neck or head region

name: Abnormality of the femoral neck
label: Abnormality of the femoral neck
definition: An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Abnormality of the femoral head
label: Abnormality of the femoral head
definition: An abnormality of the femoral head.

name: Flat capital femoral epiphysis
label: Flat capital femoral epiphysis
definition: An abnormal flattening of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis
label: Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis
definition: An abnormal enlargement of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Narrow greater sciatic notch
label: Narrow greater sciatic notch
definition: A narrowing of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.|The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a reduction in the lateral dimension of the notch.

name: Steppage gait
label: Steppage gait
definition: An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.

name: Axonal degeneration/regeneration
label: Axonal degeneration/regeneration
definition: A pattern of simultaneous degeneration and regeneration of axons (see comment).|This finding is typically demonstrated by nerve biopsy. Following focal damage to an axon, the part of the axon that is distal to the lesion invariably degenerates, a process that is known as anterograde (or Wallerian) degeneration. During Wallerian degeneration, often a microenvironment is created that can allow successful regrowth of nerve fibres from the proximal nerve segment.

name: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
label: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
definition: A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).|This finding can be demonstrated by nerve biopsy.

name: Onion bulb formation
label: Onion bulb formation
definition: Repeated episodes of segmental demyelination and remyelination lead to the accumulation of supernumerary Schwann cells around axons, which is referred to as onion bulb formation. This finding affects peripheral nerves.|This feature is characteristic of chronic demyelinating neuropathies as well as certain hereditary neuropathies. Onion-bulb formation may be observed in electron microscopic examinations of peripheral nerve biopsy material. Often, this examination is performed on the sural nerve.

name: Peripheral axonal atrophy
label: Peripheral axonal atrophy
definition: Atrophic changes of axons of the peripheral nervous system.|This finding is typically demonstrated by nerve biopsy.

name: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
label: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
definition: A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.|This finding can be demonstrated by nerve biopsy.

name: Easy fatigability
label: Easy fatigability
definition: Increased susceptibility to fatigue.|Fatigue describes the inability to continue performing a task after multiple repetitions.

name: Sensory axonal neuropathy
label: Sensory axonal neuropathy
definition: An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.

name: Gowers sign
label: Gowers sign
definition: A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.

name: Thenar muscle atrophy
label: Thenar muscle atrophy
definition: Wasting of thenar muscles, which are located on palm of the hand at the base of the thumb.

name: Muscle spasm
label: Muscle spasm
definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.

name: Syringomyelia
label: Syringomyelia
definition: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

name: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction
label: Generalized hypotonia due to defect at the neuromuscular junction

name: Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
label: Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
definition: Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.

name: Basal lamina onion bulb formation
label: Basal lamina onion bulb formation
definition: A type of onion bulb formation prominently affecting the area of the basal lamina.

name: Paresthesia
label: Paresthesia
definition: Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.

name: Decreased miniature endplate potentials
label: Decreased miniature endplate potentials
definition: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.|Miniature end plate potentials are the small (about 0.5mV) depolarisations of the postsynaptic terminal caused by the release of a single vesicle into the synaptic cleft.

name: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
label: EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation
definition: A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.|The result of this test is abnormal if progressively fewer muscle fibers respond to nerve stimulation during a train of stimuli, thereby yielding a decrementing pattern in the CMAP.

name: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities
label: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities

name: Proximal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
label: Proximal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the proximal metaphysis of the femur.

name: Atlantoaxial abnormality
label: Atlantoaxial abnormality
definition: An anomaly of the atlantoaxial joint, i.e., of the joint between the first (atlas) and second (axis) cervical vertebrae.

name: Atlantoaxial dislocation
label: Atlantoaxial dislocation
definition: Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.

name: Spinal canal stenosis
label: Spinal canal stenosis
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.|Stenosis of the spinal canal can result in neurological symptoms because of compression of the spinal cord or spinal nerve roots, depending on the location of the stenosis in the vertebral column.

name: Coronal cleft vertebrae
label: Coronal cleft vertebrae
definition: Frontal schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.|Coronal cleft vertebrae result when there are two, instead of one, primary ossification centers in a vertebral body. An unossified cartilaginous brdige may be observed radiographically with the shape of a cleft. If the two ossification centers are ventral/dorsal, a coronal cleft is observed, and if the two ossification centers are left/right, than a sagittal cleft is observed.

name: Back pain
label: Back pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.

name: Low back pain
label: Low back pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.

name: Vertebral segmentation defect
label: Vertebral segmentation defect
definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.|The vertebral column derives from somites, transient paired segments of mesoderm that surround the neural tube in the early embryo. The formation of the vertebrar involves many processes including resegmentation of the rostral and caudal regions of adjacent somites that then fuse to form vertebral elements. Disruption of these processes can a cause of severe segmentation defects of the vetebrae. The frequency of segmentation defects of the vetebra has been estimated at 0.5 of 1000 births. The range of segmentation defects includes left-right uneven formation of somites that results in hemivertebrae or wedge vertebrae. Incomplete segmentation can result in fused segments such as block vertebrae. A failure of the process of resegmentation and migration of the sclerotomal compartment can result in a failure of midline fusion, such as butterlfy vertebrae.

name: CNS hypomyelination
label: CNS hypomyelination
definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

name: Decreased motor nerve conduction velocity
label: Decreased motor nerve conduction velocity
definition: A type of decreased nerve conduction velocity that affects the motor neuron.|Newborn infants have values that are approximately half that of adults, and adult values are normally reached by age 3 or 4. Motor nerve conduction is evaluated by recording the compound muscle action potential (CMAP) associated with a mechanical contraction of a given muscle in response to electrical stimulation of the motor nerve fibers supplying that muscle. The CMAP is the sum of all the action potentials occurring individually in the contracting muscle fibers.

name: Prolonged miniature endplate currents
label: Prolonged miniature endplate currents
definition: An abnormal prolongation of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

name: Absent Achilles reflex
label: Absent Achilles reflex
definition: Absence of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can normally be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.

name: Decreased size of nerve terminals
label: Decreased size of nerve terminals
definition: A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.|Nerve terminals are the output region of nerves located presynaptically and (in the case of chemical synapses) containing vesicles of chemical neurotransmitters. Presynaptic nerve terminals normally are larger in diameter than the axon and have the appearance of a bud. This feature can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: EMG: chronic denervation signs
label: EMG: chronic denervation signs
definition: Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.|This is a bundled term that is kept for convenience. It is preferable to annotate the precise clinical abnormalities observed.

name: EMG: neuropathic changes
label: EMG: neuropathic changes
definition: The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).|This is a bundled term. It is preferable to annotate the precise clinical observations, but the term is kept now for convenience.

name: Axonal loss
label: Axonal loss
definition: A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.|This finding can be observed upon nerve biopsy.

name: Decreased sensory nerve conduction velocity
label: Decreased sensory nerve conduction velocity
definition: Reduced speed of conduction of the action potential along a sensory nerve.|The sensory nerve action potential (SNAP) in response to electrical stimulation is recorded from the nerve itself by means of dermal recording electrodes. The SNAP is the sum of all the action potentials generated in sensory nerve fibres by the applied electrical impulse.

name: Cold-induced muscle cramps
label: Cold-induced muscle cramps
definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.

name: Axonal regeneration
label: Axonal regeneration
definition: The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.|This finding is typically demonstrated by nerve biopsy. See the comment of term HP:0003378 for further information.

name: Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation
label: Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation
definition: An increased rate of premature chromosome condensation.

name: Antineutrophil antibody positivity
label: Antineutrophil antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.|Circulating serum antibodies are measured by flow cytometry after incubation with normal neutrophils. Values greater than 2 standard deviations of a normal control population are interpreted as weakly positive and greater than 3 standard deviations as positive.

name: Platelet antibody positive
label: Platelet antibody positive
definition: The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.

name: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
definition: Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.|This feature can be measured in plasma, as well as in cultured fibroblasts of amniocytes.

name: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration
label: Low urinary cyclic AMP response to PTH administration

name: EMG abnormality
label: EMG abnormality
definition: Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).

name: EMG: myopathic abnormalities
label: EMG: myopathic abnormalities
definition: The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.

name: Polyclonal elevation of IgM
label: Polyclonal elevation of IgM
definition: A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

name: Decreased circulating total IgA
label: Decreased circulating total IgA
definition: Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).

name: Increased urinary O-linked sialopeptides
label: Increased urinary O-linked sialopeptides
definition: Excretion of peptides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

name: Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
label: Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
definition: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

name: Paradoxical increased cortisol secretion on dexamethasone suppression test
label: Paradoxical increased cortisol secretion on dexamethasone suppression test

name: Atlantoaxial instability
label: Atlantoaxial instability
definition: Abnormally increased movement at the junction between the first cervical (atlas) and the second cervical (axis) vertebrae as a result of either a bony or ligamentous anomaly.|Neurological deficits ensue if the odontoid process, or posterior arch of the atlas, impinges on the spinal cord.

name: Abnormal vertebral morphology
label: Abnormal vertebral morphology
definition: An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.|A vertebra is one of 33 bony segments that form the spinal column of humans. There are 7 cervical, 12 thoracic, 5 lumbar, 5 sacral and 4 coccygeal vertebrae (the coccygeal vertebrae are fused into one coccyx bone).

name: Peripheral dysmyelination
label: Peripheral dysmyelination
definition: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths. Dysmyelination is distinguished from demyleination where there is destruction or damage of previously normal myelination.

name: Paralysis
label: Paralysis
definition: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.

name: Hypocalcemic tetany
label: Hypocalcemic tetany
definition: Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.

name: Fatigable weakness
label: Fatigable weakness
definition: A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.|This type of weakness is pathognomonic for an abnormality of the neuromuscular junction such as myasthenia gravis. A characteristic form of muscular weakness that worsens after use of affected muscles. Myasthenia is caused by failure of neuromuscular transmission, which results from the binding of autoantibodies to proteins involved in signaling at the neuromuscular junction, including especially the nicotinic acetyl choline receptor (AChR) or, less frequently, a muscle-specific tyrosine kinase involved in AChR clustering.

name: Sensory impairment
label: Sensory impairment
definition: An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.|This term does not include abnormalities of cortical sensation such as two-point discrimination, stereognosis, and graphesthesia.

name: Peripheral axonal neuropathy
label: Peripheral axonal neuropathy
definition: An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.|This abnormality can be assay by electromyography (EMG) or by nerve biopsy.

name: Segmental peripheral demyelination/remyelination
label: Segmental peripheral demyelination/remyelination
definition: A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.

name: EMG: axonal abnormality
label: EMG: axonal abnormality
definition: Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials.|This is a bundled term that is kept for convenience. It is preferable to record the precise clinical observations.

name: Upper limb muscle weakness
label: Upper limb muscle weakness
definition: Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

name: Babinski sign
label: Babinski sign
definition: Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.|A positive Babinski sign can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.

name: Acute episodes of neuropathic symptoms
label: Acute episodes of neuropathic symptoms
definition: Neuropathic symptoms include numbness, dysesthesias, and a characteristic form of pain (neuralgia).

name: obsolete Defective dehydrogenation of isovaleryl CoA and butyryl CoA
label: obsolete Defective dehydrogenation of isovaleryl CoA and butyryl CoA

name: Elevated urine pyrophosphate
label: Elevated urine pyrophosphate
definition: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.

name: High urinary gonadotropin level
label: High urinary gonadotropin level
definition:
An elevated concentration of a gonadotropin hormone (stimulating hormone or luteinizing hormone) in the urine, consistent with the diagnosis of primary hypogonadism.|'has part' some 
('increased amount' and ('inheres in' some 
('Gonadotropin (adult human)' and ('part of' some urine))) and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Antinuclear antibody positivity
label: Antinuclear antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.|Antinuclear antibodies (ANAs) are found in patients with a number of different autoimmune diseases, such as systemic lupus erythematosus, Sjogren's syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, polymyositis, scleroderma, Hashimoto's thyroiditis, juvenile diabetes mellitus, Addison disease, vitiligo, pernicious anemia, glomerulonephritis, and pulmonary fibrosis. ANAs can display various staining patterns such as homogeneous or diffuse; speckled; nucleolar; and peripheral or rim.

name: obsolete Loss of heterozygosity, multiple chromosomes
label: obsolete Loss of heterozygosity, multiple chromosomes

name: GM2-ganglioside accumulation
label: GM2-ganglioside accumulation
definition: Cellular accumulation of GM2 gangliosides.|Gangliosides are the main glycolipids of neuronal cell plasma membranes which ensure normal cellular activities. GM2-gangliosidosis can be caused by mutations in three genes: HEXA, HEXB, and GM2A. In patients with HexA deficiency GM2 ganglioside accumulates inside lysosomes, which form characteristic inclusions within the cells, so called membranous cytoplasmic bodies, which are enlarged lysosomes filled with gangliosides. The highest concentration of GM2 ganglioside is found in neuronal cells, therefore, the HexA deficiency primarily affects the nervous system, causing mental and motor developmental delay in patients. Later, progressive destruction of neurons, proliferation of microglia and accumulation of complex lipids in macrophages are observed in the brain tissue.

name: Increased circulating IgM level
label: Increased circulating IgM level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.

name: Disproportionate short stature
label: Disproportionate short stature
definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.

name: Mild short stature
label: Mild short stature
definition: A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Proportionate short stature
label: Proportionate short stature
definition: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.

name: Severe short stature
label: Severe short stature
definition: A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.|The term severe short stature is to be preferred over dwarfism, which has been used in the past to refer to individuals with an adult height under 4 feet 10 inches (147 cm).

name: Reduced ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance
label: Reduced ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance
definition: A reduction of the ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance to below 0.01.

name: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b(-245)
label: Deficiency or absence of cytochrome b(-245)

name: Disproportionate short-trunk short stature
label: Disproportionate short-trunk short stature
definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.

name: Decreased methionine synthase activity
label: Decreased methionine synthase activity
definition: A reduction in methionine synthase activity.|Cobalamin-dependent methionine synthase catalyzes the transfer of a methyl group from N5-methyltetrahydrofolate to homocysteine, producing tetrahydrofolate and methionine, i.e., (6S)-5-methyl-5,6,7,8-tetrahydrofolate + L-homocysteine = (6S)-5,6,7,8-tetrahydrofolate + L-methionine.

name: Orotic acid crystalluria
label: Orotic acid crystalluria
definition: Formation of crystals owing to an increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.

name: Hyperprostaglandinuria
label: Hyperprostaglandinuria
definition: An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

name: Elevated calcitonin
label: Elevated calcitonin
definition: Calcitonin is a 32-amino acid polypeptide hormone that is produced primarily by the parafollicular cells of the thyroid. It acts to reduce blood calcium (Ca2+), opposing the effects of parathyroid hormone.

name: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption
label: Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption
definition: An increase in the reabsorption of calcium by the renal tubulus that is not associated with increased parathormone levels.|This feature is seen with familial hypocalciuric hypercalcemia. This disease has three known genetic etiologies, in type 1 there is a loss of function mutation in the calcium-sensing receptor (encoded by CASR), in type 2 there is a gain of function mutation in GNA11, which is involved in calcium-sensing receptor signaling, and in type 3 there is a mutation in AP2S1, which encodes the adaptor-related protein complex 2, sigma 1 subunit, which alters calcium-sensing receptor endocytosis.

name: Glutaric acidemia
label: Glutaric acidemia
definition: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.

name: Ornithinuria
label: Ornithinuria
definition: An increased concentration of ornithine in the urine.

name: Reduced acetaldehyde dehydrogenase activity
label: Reduced acetaldehyde dehydrogenase activity
definition: Decreased activity of acetaldehyde dehydrogenase (ADH). ADH and alcohol dehydrogenase (ALDH) are the primary enzymes involved in alcohol metabolism.|In the liver, alcohol dehydrogenase converts ethanol into acetaldehyde, which is then converted into acetic acid by acetaldehyde dehydrogenase.

name: Reduced xanthine dehydrogenase activity
label: Reduced xanthine dehydrogenase activity
definition: An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase activity.|This enzyme is on the purine degradation pathway and catalzyes the reaction xanthine + NAD+ + H2O = urate + NADH + H+.

name: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria
label: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria
definition: An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.|3-methylglutaconic aciduria describes five different disorders that impair mitochondrial function and resulting in buildup of 3-methylglutaconic acid and 3-methylglutaric acid and consequent increased excretion in the urine.

name: Decreased fumarate hydratase activity
label: Decreased fumarate hydratase activity
definition: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of fumarate hydratase activity.|Fumarate hydratase belongs to the tricarboxylic acid (Krebs) cycle. It catalyzes the conversion of fumarate to malate.

name: Hypouricemia
label: Hypouricemia
definition: An abnormally low level of uric acid in the blood.

name: Increased serum iduronate sulfatase activity
label: Increased serum iduronate sulfatase activity
definition: An increased rate of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.|Iduronate-2-sulfatase is required for the lysosomal degradation of heparan sulfate and dermatan sulfate. Mutations in this X-chromosome gene are associated with Mucopolysaccharidosis Type II. Increased serum iduronate-2-sulfatase is observed in mucolipidosis II alpha/beta.

name: Impaired platelet aggregation
label: Impaired platelet aggregation
definition: An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

name: Urinary glycosaminoglycan excretion
label: Urinary glycosaminoglycan excretion
definition: Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.

name: Increased serum pyruvate
label: Increased serum pyruvate
definition: An increased concentration of pyruvate in the blood.|An abnormal increase in the concentration of pyruvate in the blood. Pyruvate is involved in energy metabolism, forming part of glycolysis and the citric acid cycle.

name: Exercise intolerance
label: Exercise intolerance
definition: A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.

name: Shoulder girdle muscle weakness
label: Shoulder girdle muscle weakness
definition: The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

name: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
label: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
definition: An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.|This finding can be demonstrated by electron microscopy. This finding is typical of mitochondrial myopathies.

name: Abnormality of connective tissue
label: Abnormality of connective tissue
definition: Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

name: Predominantly lower limb lymphedema
label: Predominantly lower limb lymphedema
definition: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.

name: Difficulty climbing stairs
label: Difficulty climbing stairs
definition: Reduced ability to climb stairs.

name: Muscle stiffness
label: Muscle stiffness
definition: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.

name: Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy
label: Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.|This finding can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Muscle fiber splitting
label: Muscle fiber splitting
definition: Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.

name: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
label: Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter
definition: An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.|This finding can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis
label: Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis
definition: Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

name: Muscular dystrophy
label: Muscular dystrophy
definition: The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.|Muscular dystrophy can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Decreased LDL cholesterol concentration
label: Decreased LDL cholesterol concentration
definition: An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.|Beta-lipoprotein cholesterol is a synonym for low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.

name: Folate-dependent fragile site at Xq28
label: Folate-dependent fragile site at Xq28
definition: The presence of a folate sensitive fragile site at chromosome Xq28.|Fragile sites can be defined as heritable specific loci on human chromosomes that exhibit non-random gaps, constrictions or breaks when chromosomes are exposed to specific cell culture conditions. Over 120 different fragile sites have been identified in the human genome. Some of these sites are sensitive to folate, that is, they can be induced by a culture medium deficient in folic acid and thymidine, and hence a medium with lowered levels of dTTP or dCTP, two immediate components of DNA, or by a medium enriched either in methotrexate, an inhibitor of folate metabolism, or in fluorodeoxyuridine, an inhibitor of thymidylate synthesis. The folate-dependent fragile phenotype occurs if more than a critical number of CCG/CGG repeats are present (e.g., > 230 repeats for FRAXA).

name: Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate
label: Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate
definition: An increased erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR). The ESR a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen.

name: Increased serum prostaglandin E2
label: Increased serum prostaglandin E2
definition: An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.

name: Decreased glucosephosphate isomerase activity
label: Decreased glucosephosphate isomerase activity
definition: A decreased rate of glucose-6-phosphate isomerase activity.|Deficiency of glucose-6-phosphate isomerase (EC 5.3.1.9).

name: Molybdenum cofactor deficiency
label: Molybdenum cofactor deficiency
definition: Absence of molybdenum cofactor(2-), a cofactor for enzymes including sulfite oxidase, xanthine oxidoreductase, and aldehyde oxidase.

name: Low plasma citrulline
label: Low plasma citrulline
definition: A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

name: Increased total bilirubin
label: Increased total bilirubin
definition: Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.

name: Positive regitine blocking test
label: Positive regitine blocking test
definition: A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.|Regitine produces an alpha-adrenergic block of relatively short duration. In the regitine blocking test, regitine is injected rapidly and bood pressure is recorded immediately after injection, at 30-second intervals for the first 3 minutes, and at 60-second intervals for the next 7 minutes. A positive response to the reginitine blocking test is present when the blood pressure is reduced more than 35 mmHg systolic and 25 mmHg diastolic. A typical positive response is a reduction in pressure of 60 mmHg systolic and 25 mmHg diastolic. A positive response is suggestive of pheochromocytoma and should generally be confirmed by other diagnostic procedures such as measurement of urinary catecholamines or their metabolites.

name: Increased intracellular sodium
label: Increased intracellular sodium
definition: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the cytosol.

name: Congenital onset
label: Congenital onset
definition: A phenotypic abnormality that is present at birth.|Congenital onset literally means present at birth. Congenital abnormalities are thus generally acquired during fetal development. Congenital abnormalities are often but not always hereditary in nature. Whether a disease manifestation is diagnosed to be intrauterine or congenital may depend on the time at which diagnostic procedures are performed. Thus, most congenital abnormalities are also intrauterine. This term should be used for phenotypic abnormalities or diseases initially observed at the time of birth. For abnormalities observed prior to (e.g., by fetal ultrasound), use the term Antenatal onset (HP:0030674).

name: Adult onset
label: Adult onset
definition: Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.

name: Late onset
label: Late onset
definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms after the age of 60 years.

name: Insidious onset
label: Insidious onset
definition: Gradual, very slow onset of disease manifestations.

name: Infantile onset
label: Infantile onset
definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.|Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 12 months of life.

name: Middle age onset
label: Middle age onset
definition: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.|Middle age is of course not amenable to precise definitions. We suggest using this term for onset of disease symptoms between the age of 40 and 60 years.

name: Absent urinary urothione
label: Absent urinary urothione
definition: Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.|Urothione, a sulfur-containing pterin, is the normal metabolic degradation product of the molybdenum cofactor.

name: 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria
label: 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria
definition: Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.|4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase participates in the tyrosine catabolic pathway by catalyzing the conversion of 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate to homogentisate. A deficiency in this enzyme can result in 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria.

name: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
label: Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies
definition: The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.|Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies are thought to be a hallmark of cellular phospholipidosis, i.e., of the excess accumulation of phospholipids. This abnormality can be assayed by electron microscopy.

name: Fibroblast metachromasia
label: Fibroblast metachromasia
definition: Increased cytoplasmic staining of fibroblasts with toluidine blue.|Cultured fibroblasts from the genetic mucopolysaccharidoses store higher than normal amounts of glycosaminoglyeans. Histochemical stains such as toluidine blue and Alcian blue can be used to detect such intracellular glycosaminoglycans which, being negatively charged, are bound and precipitated by the cationic dyes. Cultured fibroblasts from homozygotes -and heterozygotes for the genetic mucopolysaccharidoses accumulate excessive quantities of glycosaminoglycans. The cytoplasmic staining with toluidine blue is referred to as metachromasia (pink) and orthochromasia (blue) and that with Alcian blue as alcianophilia.

name: Positive ferric chloride test
label: Positive ferric chloride test
definition: If positive, the ferric chloride test indicates an increased concentration of phenols in the urine or blood.|The ferric chloride test indicates presence of high levels of phenylpyruvate in urine, because ferric ion forms a blue-green colored complex with phenylpyruvate. Some other compounds can also lead to a positive ferric chloride test. The ferric chloride test is no longer used in modern clinical practice, but this term is kept for historical reasons. The urine phenylpyruvate concentration is elevated in phenylketonuria.

name: Antiphospholipid antibody positivity
label: Antiphospholipid antibody positivity
definition: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.|This group of autoantibodies comprises anticardiolipin, antiphosphatidylinositol, atiphosphatidylglycerol, and antiphosphatidylserine antibodies.

name: Trimethylaminuria
label: Trimethylaminuria
definition: Increased concentration of trimethylamine in the urine.|Increased concentration of trimethylamine, an organic amino compound with an oder characterized as that of rotting fish, in the urine. Trimethylaminuria is generally caused by impaired oxidation of trimethylamine into the odorless compound trimethylamine N-oxide.

name: Juvenile onset
label: Juvenile onset
definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.

name: Neonatal onset
label: Neonatal onset
definition: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.

name: Amyoplasia
label: Amyoplasia
definition: Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue.

name: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
label: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
definition: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.

name: Reduced 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase activity
label: Reduced 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase activity
definition: An abnormal reduction in 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase activity.|Note: 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase corresponds to EC 1.13.11.27. 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvate dioxygenase participates in the tyrosine catabolic pathway by catalyzing the conversion of 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvate to homogentisate. A deficiency in this enzyme can result in 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria.

name: Elevated urinary epinephrine
label: Elevated urinary epinephrine
definition: An increased concentration of adrenaline in the urine.

name: Foam cells in visceral organs and CNS
label: Foam cells in visceral organs and CNS

name: Hemoglobinuria
label: Hemoglobinuria
definition: The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.|If, following hemolysis, haptoglobins (hemoglobin-binding proteins) are saturated, then free hemoglobin appears in the urine.

name: Type I transferrin isoform profile
label: Type I transferrin isoform profile
definition: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.|There are several methods in use with which this feature can be diagnosed. Using HPLC analysis an increased asialo- and disialotransferrin and reduced tetrasialotransferrin are observed. Using immunoaffinity column analysis, the mono-oligosaccharide/di-oligosaccharide transferrin ratio, and/or the a-oligosaccharide/di-oligosaccharide transferrin ratio are abnormal.

name: Sulfite oxidase deficiency
label: Sulfite oxidase deficiency
definition: Abnormally reduced sulfite oxidase activity.|Sulfite oxidase is responsible for the oxidation of sulfite to sulfate and is the terminal enzyme in the oxidative degradation pathway of sulfur-containing amino acids.

name: Prolonged partial thromboplastin time
label: Prolonged partial thromboplastin time
definition: Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.

name: Bicarbonaturia
label: Bicarbonaturia
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

name: Electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase defect
label: Electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase defect
definition: A deficiency of the electron transfer flavoprotein-ubiquinone oxidoreductase.

name: Lacticaciduria
label: Lacticaciduria
definition: An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.

name: Abnormality of glycoside metabolism
label: Abnormality of glycoside metabolism
definition: Abnormality of glycoside metabolism.|Glycosides are molecules with a suger moiety bound to some other moiety.

name: Foam cells
label: Foam cells
definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.|Foam cells may contain polymorphic cytoplasmic inclusions consisting of lamellar osmiophilic membranes on electron microscopy.

name: Recurrent myoglobinuria
label: Recurrent myoglobinuria
definition: Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.

name: Cellular metachromasia
label: Cellular metachromasia
definition: Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.|This investigation is no longer in common use.

name: Reduced dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity
label: Reduced dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity
definition: An abnormal reduction in dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (NADP+) activity.|Pyrimidine 5-prime nucleotidase catalyzes the dephosphorylation of the pyrimidine 5-prime monophosphates to the corresponding nucleosides.

name: Reduced activity of N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase II
label: Reduced activity of N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase II
definition: An abnormality of glycoprotein metabolism related to a decreased rate of alpha-1,6-mannosylglycoprotein 2-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity.

name: Decreased beta-glucocerebrosidase activity
label: Decreased beta-glucocerebrosidase activity
definition: Reduced activity of the enzyme beta-glucosidase, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of glucosylceramide into ceramide and glucose.|An enzyme that hydrolyzes beta-glucosides in cerebrosides.

name: Hypomethioninemia
label: Hypomethioninemia
definition: A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.|Normal methionine blood levels are around 30 micromole per liter.

name: Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis
label: Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the pelvis.

name: Onset
label: Onset
definition: The age group in which disease manifestations appear.|Adolescent is defined by WHO as a person between 10-19 years of age.

name: Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
label: Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
definition: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).|Normally, the nuclei of muscle cells are located peripherally, immediately under the plasma membrane (sarcolemma).

name: Cytochrome C oxidase-negative muscle fibers
label: Cytochrome C oxidase-negative muscle fibers
definition: An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.|This abnormality can be assayed by muscle biopsy. Cytochrome C oxidase is an enzyme of the respiratory electron transport chain of mitochondria that is located in the mitochondrial membrane.

name: Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions
label: Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions
definition: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).|This feature can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Limb muscle weakness
label: Limb muscle weakness
definition: Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

name: Scapular winging
label: Scapular winging
definition: Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.|The serratus anterior muscle is responsible for controlling the scapula (shoulder blade), and weakness of this muscle (which may be caused by damage to the long thoracic nerve) can manifest as scular winging.

name: Distal amyotrophy
label: Distal amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.|Most polyneuropathies affect distal lower extremity miuscles early on. Polyneuropathies are roughly symmeetric in distribution and tend to affect nerves in a length-dependent manner, with the longest nerves first (stocking-glove distribution).

name: Late-onset proximal muscle weakness
label: Late-onset proximal muscle weakness
definition: Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.

name: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy
label: Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.

name: Generalized amyotrophy
label: Generalized amyotrophy
definition: Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.

name: Proximal muscle weakness
label: Proximal muscle weakness
definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.|Removed logical definition that used anonymous class. Outstanding term request in UBERON for proximal muscle organ.

name: Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy
label: Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy
definition: Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.|Pseudohypertrophy of the calf musculature is commonly seen in certain muscular dystrophies but also with spinal muscular atrophy and other denervating conditions.

name: Exercise-induced muscle cramps
label: Exercise-induced muscle cramps
definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.

name: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy
label: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy
definition: Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells (as opposed to hyperplasia, which refers to an increase in the number of muscle cells).|Increased muscle bulk based on clinical observation.

name: Muscle fiber necrosis
label: Muscle fiber necrosis
definition: Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.

name: Myofibrillar myopathy
label: Myofibrillar myopathy
definition: Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.|This feature is demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Muscle mounding
label: Muscle mounding
definition: Transient swelling of muscle induced by percussion.

name: Generalized muscle hypertrophy
label: Generalized muscle hypertrophy
definition: Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells in a generalized (not localized) distribution.

name: Neck flexor weakness
label: Neck flexor weakness
definition: Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).

name: Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy
label: Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy
definition: Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.

name: EMG: myotonic runs
label: EMG: myotonic runs
definition: Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).|This is a characteristic abnormality seen in the myotonias and periodic paralyses.

name: Quadriceps muscle weakness
label: Quadriceps muscle weakness
definition: Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).

name: Thigh hypertrophy
label: Thigh hypertrophy
definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.|Proximal lower limb hypertrophy

name: Autophagic vacuoles
label: Autophagic vacuoles
definition: The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.

name: Mitochondrial myopathy
label: Mitochondrial myopathy
definition: A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.|This is a bundled term that should not be used for future annotations.

name: Exercise-induced myalgia
label: Exercise-induced myalgia
definition: The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.

name: Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon
label: Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon
definition: Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.

name: Genetic anticipation
label: Genetic anticipation
definition: A mode of inheritance in which the severity of a disorder increases or the age of onset decreases as the disorder is passed from one generation to the next.|This mode of inheritance is characteristic of trinucleotide and some other repeat disorders.

name: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
label: Genetic anticipation with paternal anticipation bias
definition: A type of genetic anticipation observed predominantly upon transmission from affected males.

name: Sporadic
label: Sporadic
definition: Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.

name: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
label: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
definition: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.

name: Increased muscle fatiguability
label: Increased muscle fatiguability
definition: An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.

name: Episodic flaccid weakness
label: Episodic flaccid weakness
definition: Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.

name: Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
label: Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers
definition: The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.|This feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

name: Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
label: Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
definition: A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness.

name: Hypoplasia of lymphatic vessels
label: Hypoplasia of lymphatic vessels
definition: Congenital underdevelopment of lymph vessels.|This feature can be demonstrated by lymphography.

name: Percussion-induced rapid rolling muscle contractions
label: Percussion-induced rapid rolling muscle contractions
definition: Mechanical percussion (i.e., striking a muscle with a reflex hammer) leads to spreading waves of muscle contractions that begin proximally and spread laterally across the muscle.

name: Calcinosis
label: Calcinosis
definition: Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.

name: Uterus didelphys
label: Uterus didelphys
definition: A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.

name: Bruxism
label: Bruxism
definition: Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.

name: Nevus
label: Nevus
definition: A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.|The word Nevus derives from the Latin word Knee-vus meaning birthmark or mole.

name: Psoriasiform dermatitis
label: Psoriasiform dermatitis
definition: A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).|The label Psoriaform dermatitis is used to emphasize that this term is meant to describe the morhpological abnormality of the skin and not all of the manifestations of the disease psoriasis (which can also include itching and nail pitsand other manifestations).

name: Periodic paralysis
label: Periodic paralysis
definition: Episodes of muscle weakness.

name: Pulp stones
label: Pulp stones
definition: Multiple punctate calcifications in the dental pulp.

name: Stage 5 chronic kidney disease
label: Stage 5 chronic kidney disease
definition: A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.|Equivalent with the National Kidney Foundation's definition of stage 5 chronic kidney disease.

name: Pili torti
label: Pili torti
definition: Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.

name: Excessive salivation
label: Excessive salivation
definition: Excessive production of saliva.

name: Eunuchoid habitus
label: Eunuchoid habitus
definition: A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).

name: Decreased CSF homovanillic acid
label: Decreased CSF homovanillic acid
definition: Decreased concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

name: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
label: Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions
definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers.

name: Minicore myopathy
label: Minicore myopathy
definition: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.

name: Short middle phalanx of toe
label: Short middle phalanx of toe
definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.

name: Irregular iliac crest
label: Irregular iliac crest
definition: Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.

name: Limb-girdle muscle atrophy
label: Limb-girdle muscle atrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

name: Nemaline bodies
label: Nemaline bodies
definition:
Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.|This finding can be demonstrated by muscle biopsy, which shows nemaline bodies (rods) on Gomori trichrome staining. Rod bodies characteristically stain red with
MGT. The rods are delicate and accumulate subsarcolemmaly. They stain negative with ATPase, NADH and SDH as they lack myosin and mitochondria. Rods are characteristic of nemaline myopathy but also seen in central core disease and various other diseases which include neurogenic disorders (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, spinal muscular atrophy, undefined), inflammatory myopathies (dermatomyositis, polymyositis, periarteritis nodosa), metabolic myopathy (mitochondrial myopathy), muscular dystrophy (LGMD) and some undefined myopathies (Liouet al; Diagnostic role of nemaline rod in neuromuscular disease. Acta Neurol Sinica 1992;1: 218-23).

name: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction
label: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction

name: Type 1 muscle fiber predominance
label: Type 1 muscle fiber predominance
definition: An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).|This finding is demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Rimmed vacuoles
label: Rimmed vacuoles
definition: Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.|Rimmed vacuoles are characteristic for inclusion-bosy myositis, but are also seen an a number of other diseases. This term implies that rimmed vacuoles are found histologically. In some cases, the majority of muscle fibers are involved, but in others, rimmed vacuoles can be found in only a minority of fibers.

name: Reduced intrathoracic adipose tissue
label: Reduced intrathoracic adipose tissue
definition: An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the thoracic cavity.

name: Neonatal death
label: Neonatal death
definition: Death within the first 28 days of life.

name: Phenotypic variability
label: Phenotypic variability
definition: A variability of phenotypic features.|This term can be applied to disease entities but not to individuals. It may be made obsolete in future versions of the HPO.

name: Death in childhood
label: Death in childhood
definition:
Death in during childhood, defined here as between the ages of 2 and 10 years.|previous def was: 'has part' some 
(premature and ('inheres in' some death) and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Stillbirth
label: Stillbirth
definition: Death of the fetus in utero after at least 20 weeks of gestation.

name: Variable expressivity
label: Variable expressivity
definition: A variable severity of phenotypic features.|This term can be applied to disease entities but not to individuals. It may be made obsolete in future versions of the HPO.

name: Incomplete penetrance
label: Incomplete penetrance
definition: A situation in which mutation carriers do not show clinically evident phenotypic abnormalities.|This term can be applied to disease entities but not to individuals. It may be made obsolete in future versions of the HPO.

name: Age-dependent penetrance
label: Age-dependent penetrance
definition: A situation in which phenotypic abnormalities become evident with age.

name: Shoulder dislocation
label: Shoulder dislocation
definition: A displacement or misalignment of the humerus with respect to the other bones of the should joint. Note that a subluxation is a partial dislocation.

name: Shoulder subluxation
label: Shoulder subluxation
definition: A partial dislocation of the shoulder joint.

name: Soft-tissue ossification around the shoulders
label: Soft-tissue ossification around the shoulders
definition: Formation of calcified tissue in the soft tissues surrounding the shoulder.

name: Abnormality of upper limb epiphysis morphology
label: Abnormality of upper limb epiphysis morphology

name: Delayed upper limb epiphyseal ossification
label: Delayed upper limb epiphyseal ossification
definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones of the upper limbs.

name: Fragmented epiphyses of the upper limbs
label: Fragmented epiphyses of the upper limbs

name: Irregular epiphyses of the upper limbs
label: Irregular epiphyses of the upper limbs

name: Round epiphyses of the upper limbs
label: Round epiphyses of the upper limbs

name: Small epiphyses of the upper limbs
label: Small epiphyses of the upper limbs

name: Wide epiphyseal plates of the upper limbs
label: Wide epiphyseal plates of the upper limbs

name: Cupped metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Cupped metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Flared upper limb metaphysis
label: Flared upper limb metaphysis
definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the arm.

name: Lytic defects in metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Lytic defects in metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Normal density transverse bands in metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Normal density transverse bands in metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Sclerosis with transverse striations in metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Sclerosis with transverse striations in metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Sclerosis of metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Sclerosis of metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Spurred metaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Spurred metaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Upper limb metaphyseal widening
label: Upper limb metaphyseal widening
definition: Increased width (breadth) of metaphyses of the arms.

name: Cortical diaphyseal irregularity of the upper limbs
label: Cortical diaphyseal irregularity of the upper limbs

name: Cortical diaphyseal thickening of the upper limbs
label: Cortical diaphyseal thickening of the upper limbs

name: Diaphyseal sclerosis of the upper limbs
label: Diaphyseal sclerosis of the upper limbs
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses of the arms. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Broad diaphyses of the upper limbs
label: Broad diaphyses of the upper limbs

name: Absent humerus
label: Absent humerus
definition: Missing humerus bone associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Bifid humerus
label: Bifid humerus
definition: Clefting affecting the humerus.

name: Bowed humerus
label: Bowed humerus
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.

name: Humeral exostoses
label: Humeral exostoses
definition: Presence of more than one exostosis originating in one or noth humerus bones. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Humeral lytic defects
label: Humeral lytic defects
definition: Destruction of an area of humerus bone due to a disease process, such as cancer.|Osteolytic defects can be observed by radiology studies such as an X-ray; however, the type of condition that is causing the lesion cannot be fully determined by the X-ray alone.

name: Slender humerus
label: Slender humerus
definition: Reduction in diameter of the humerus.

name: Abnormality of the humeral epiphysis
label: Abnormality of the humeral epiphysis
definition: An anomaly of the humeral epiphysis.

name: Absent humeral epiphyseal ossification
label: Absent humeral epiphyseal ossification
