definition: Lack of formation of bone in the epiphysis of the humerus.|Normally, the proximal humeral epiphysis can be visualized at about 40 weeks of gestation.

name: Advanced ossification of the humeral epiphysis
label: Advanced ossification of the humeral epiphysis
definition: Ossification of the humeral epiphysis at an earlier age than normal.

name: Delayed humeral epiphyseal ossification
label: Delayed humeral epiphyseal ossification
definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the humeral epiphysis.

name: Irregular ossification of the humeral epiphyses
label: Irregular ossification of the humeral epiphyses

name: Stippled calcification of the humeral epiphyses
label: Stippled calcification of the humeral epiphyses

name: Epiphyseal stippling of the humerus
label: Epiphyseal stippling of the humerus
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the humeral epiphysis.

name: Broad humeral epiphyses
label: Broad humeral epiphyses
definition: Increased width of the humeral epiphysis.

name: Wide epiphyses of the upper limbs
label: Wide epiphyses of the upper limbs

name: Abnormality of the humeral epiphyseal plate
label: Abnormality of the humeral epiphyseal plate

name: Broad humeral epiphyseal plate
label: Broad humeral epiphyseal plate
definition: Increased width of the humeral epiphyseal growth plate.

name: Corner fracture of metaphysis
label: Corner fracture of metaphysis
definition: Fracture or fragmentation at the lateral portion of the metaphysis of a long bone. The radiographic appearance is that of a small corner of metaphysis separated from the metaphyseal edge by thin linear radiolucency. This feature can be observed in child abuse but fragmented appearance of the metaphysis or facture-like lesions can also be detected in the setting of certain skeletal dysplasias.|A corner fracture is a subepiphyseal planer fracture through immature metaphyseal bone. The appearance of a corner, avulsion or bucket handle depends on the extent of bone failure and radiographic projection. Bone can fail in this pattern from both shearing and tensile stresses. The weakest area of bone for a given loading condition determines the injury threshold for that structure.

name: Cortical subperiosteal resorption of humeral metaphyses
label: Cortical subperiosteal resorption of humeral metaphyses

name: Flared humeral metaphysis
label: Flared humeral metaphysis
definition: Flaring (increase of width with a splayed appearance) of the humeral metaphysis.

name: Lytic defects of the humeral metaphysis
label: Lytic defects of the humeral metaphysis

name: Normal-density transverse humeral bands
label: Normal-density transverse humeral bands
definition: Normal-density transverse bands of the humerus

name: Sclerotic humeral metaphysis with longitudinal striations
label: Sclerotic humeral metaphysis with longitudinal striations

name: Abnormality of the humeral diaphysis
label: Abnormality of the humeral diaphysis
definition: An anomaly of the humeral diaphysis.

name: Cortical irregularity of humeral diaphysis
label: Cortical irregularity of humeral diaphysis
definition: An abnormal irregularity of the cortical surface of the diaphysis (shaft) of the humerus.

name: Ground glass opacity of humeral diaphysis
label: Ground glass opacity of humeral diaphysis

name: Periosteal new bone of humeral diaphysis
label: Periosteal new bone of humeral diaphysis

name: Wide humeral diaphysis
label: Wide humeral diaphysis
definition: Increased width of the humeral diaphysis.

name: Humeroulnar synostosis
label: Humeroulnar synostosis
definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the ulna and the humerus.

name: Abnormality of the joint spaces of the elbow
label: Abnormality of the joint spaces of the elbow

name: Narrow joint spaces of the elbow
label: Narrow joint spaces of the elbow

name: Irregular articular surfaces of the elbow joints
label: Irregular articular surfaces of the elbow joints

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the elbow
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the elbow

name: Delayed elbow epiphyseal ossification
label: Delayed elbow epiphyseal ossification
definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones that are part of the elbow.

name: Distal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
label: Distal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis at the distal end of the humerus (at the elbow).

name: Sclerotic foci of metaphyses of the elbow
label: Sclerotic foci of metaphyses of the elbow

name: Absent forearm bone
label: Absent forearm bone
definition: Absence of one or more forearm bones associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of forearm
label: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of forearm
definition: A descriptive term for a forearm bone that appears to have an additional bone within it on radiography.

name: Bowed forearm bones
label: Bowed forearm bones
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting either the radius, the ulna, or both.

name: Cortical thickening of the forearm bones
label: Cortical thickening of the forearm bones

name: Lytic defects of the forearm bones
label: Lytic defects of the forearm bones

name: Broad forearm bones
label: Broad forearm bones
definition: Abnormally wide bone of the skeleton of forearm.

name: Absent radius
label: Absent radius
definition: Missing radius bone associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Broad radius
label: Broad radius
definition: Increased width of the radius.

name: Aplasia of the ulna
label: Aplasia of the ulna
definition: Missing ulna bone associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Long ulna
label: Long ulna
definition: Increased length of the ulna.

name: Osteosclerosis of the ulna
label: Osteosclerosis of the ulna
definition: Osteosclerosis (increased density related to increased bone mass) of the ulna.

name: Slender ulna
label: Slender ulna
definition: Reduction in diameter of the ulna.

name: Broad ulna
label: Broad ulna
definition: Increased width of the ulna.

name: Dislocated wrist
label: Dislocated wrist
definition: An injury of the wrist with displacement of any of the eight carpal bones.

name: Cone-shaped distal radial epiphysis
label: Cone-shaped distal radial epiphysis
definition: The distal epiphysis (rounded portion of bone at the far end of the radius distal to the growth plate) has an abnormal cone-shaped appearance.|The phrase chevron-shaped (having the shape of a V or an inverted V) is synonymous.

name: Premature fusion of the radial epiphyseal plates
label: Premature fusion of the radial epiphyseal plates
definition: A premature fusion of the epiphyseal plates of the radius. Epiphyseal plates are located at the distal and proximal ends of the long bones, in this case of the radius and premature fusion will have an effect on the growh of the radial bone, inhibiting or at least disturbing the normal growth and development of the bone.|The epiphyseal plate (or epiphysial plate, physis, or growth plate) is a hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone. The plate is found in children and adolescents; in adults, who have stopped growing, the plate is replaced by an epiphyseal line. The growth plate has a very specific morphology in having a zonal arrangement. The growth plate includes a relatively inactive reserve zone at the epiphyseal end, moving distally into a proliferative and then hyper trophic zone and ending with a band of ossifying cartilage (the metaphysis).

name: Broad radial epiphyseal plate
label: Broad radial epiphyseal plate
definition: Abnormal increase in width of the epiphyseal growth plate of the radius.

name: Flared radial metaphysis
label: Flared radial metaphysis
definition: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the radius.

name: Radial metaphyseal irregularity
label: Radial metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the radius.

name: Irregular ossification of the radial metaphysis
label: Irregular ossification of the radial metaphysis

name: Sclerotic radial metaphysis with longitudinal striations
label: Sclerotic radial metaphysis with longitudinal striations

name: Broad radial metaphysis
label: Broad radial metaphysis
definition: Increase in width (breadth) of the radial metaphysis.

name: Abnormality of radial diaphysis
label: Abnormality of radial diaphysis
definition: An anomaly of the radial diaphysis.

name: Broad radial diaphysis
label: Broad radial diaphysis
definition: Increase in width of the diaphysis of radius.|Increased diameter of the shaft (diaphysis) of the radius.

name: Abnormality of the styloid process of ulna
label: Abnormality of the styloid process of ulna

name: obsolete Bony spicule of ulnar epiphyseal plate
label: obsolete Bony spicule of ulnar epiphyseal plate

name: Ulnar metaphyseal irregularity
label: Ulnar metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis of the ulna.

name: Sloping ulnar metaphysis
label: Sloping ulnar metaphysis
definition: A sloped configuration of the metaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.

name: Wide ulnar metaphysis
label: Wide ulnar metaphysis
definition: Increase in width (breadth) of the ulnar metaphysis.

name: Absent hand
label: Absent hand
definition: The total absence of the hand, with no bony elements distal to the radius or ulna.

name: Advanced ossification of the hand bones
label: Advanced ossification of the hand bones
definition: Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.

name: Delayed ossification of the hand bones
label: Delayed ossification of the hand bones
definition: Ossification of hand bones is less advanced than would be expected according to age-adjusted norms.

name: Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones
label: Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones
definition: Pattern of hand-wrist development does not fit the normal sequence of ossification of the individual bones of the hand.

name: Sclerosis of hand bone
label: Sclerosis of hand bone
definition: Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.

name: Mitten deformity
label: Mitten deformity
definition: Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a "mitten" hand deformity.|Mitten deformity is also referred to as pseudosyndactyly, which should not be confused with true syndactyly (actual and complete fusion of fingers). Antenatally, pseudosyndactyly can be misinterpreted as syndactyly.

name: Radial club hand
label: Radial club hand
definition: Wrist is bent inward toward the thumb because of a congenital defect associated with shortening or absence of the radius.

name: Trident hand
label: Trident hand
definition: A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.|This abnormality is often seen in patients with achondroplasia.

name: obsolete Laterally deviated terminal thumb phalanx
label: obsolete Laterally deviated terminal thumb phalanx

name: obsolete Advanced maturation/advanced ossification of terminal thumb phalanx epiphysis
label: obsolete Advanced maturation/advanced ossification of terminal thumb phalanx epiphysis

name: Deviation of finger
label: Deviation of finger
definition: Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.

name: Macrodactyly
label: Macrodactyly
definition: Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit.|There are no recognized standards for the girth of digits and this finding can vary substantially in the population. This assessment relies on the judgment of the examiner to recognize when the difference between the expected and the observed is significant. The affected digits should be specified. The definition does not mandate the component of the increased size (bone, connective tissue, etc.), but should exclude edema. The requirement that the girth is most, or all, of the digit is intended to distinguish this from broad fingertips. This should be distinguished from Broad fingers or Broad fingertips as the girth is circumferential in macrodactyly, which is not the case for broad fingers or broad fingertips, which are increased only (or predominantly) in their lateral (A/P) width.

name: Abnormal 2nd finger morphology
label: Abnormal 2nd finger morphology
definition: An anomaly of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

name: obsolete Radially deviated index finger phalanges
label: obsolete Radially deviated index finger phalanges

name: Midline nasal groove
label: Midline nasal groove
definition: An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.

name: obsolete Radially displaced proximal index finger phalanx
label: obsolete Radially displaced proximal index finger phalanx

name: Midline defect of the nose
label: Midline defect of the nose
definition: This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.

name: Dimple on nasal tip
label: Dimple on nasal tip
definition: An abnormal indentation of the skin in the region of the nasal tip.

name: obsolete Metaphyseal abnormality of middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: obsolete Metaphyseal abnormality of middle phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: obsolete Flared metaphysis of middle phalanx of index finger
label: obsolete Flared metaphysis of middle phalanx of index finger

name: obsolete Radially deviated terminal index finger phalanx
label: obsolete Radially deviated terminal index finger phalanx

name: obsolete Duplication of terminal index finger phalanx
label: obsolete Duplication of terminal index finger phalanx

name: Abnormal 3rd finger morphology
label: Abnormal 3rd finger morphology
definition: An anomaly of the third finger.

name: obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle finger phalanges
label: obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle finger phalanges

name: obsolete Radially pointed middle finger phalanges
label: obsolete Radially pointed middle finger phalanges

name: obsolete Radially pointed proximal middle-finger phalanx
label: obsolete Radially pointed proximal middle-finger phalanx

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger

name: obsolete Accessory middle phalanx of middle finger
label: obsolete Accessory middle phalanx of middle finger

name: obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle phalanx of middle-finger
label: obsolete Periosteal new bone of middle phalanx of middle-finger

name: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the third finger.

name: obsolete Abnormality of the epiphyses of the terminal phalanx of the middle finger
label: obsolete Abnormality of the epiphyses of the terminal phalanx of the middle finger

name: obsolete Cone-shaped epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
label: obsolete Cone-shaped epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger

name: obsolete Fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
label: obsolete Fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger

name: obsolete Large epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
label: obsolete Large epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger

name: obsolete Prematurely fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger
label: obsolete Prematurely fused epiphysis of terminal phalanx of the middle finger

name: obsolete Bracket epiphyses of the 4th finger
label: obsolete Bracket epiphyses of the 4th finger

name: obsolete Expanded phalanges of the ring finger
label: obsolete Expanded phalanges of the ring finger

name: obsolete Hypoplastic phalanges of the ring finger
label: obsolete Hypoplastic phalanges of the ring finger

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th finger
definition: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.

name: obsolete Short phalanges of the ring finger
label: obsolete Short phalanges of the ring finger

name: Symphalangism of the 4th finger
label: Symphalangism of the 4th finger
definition: Fusion of two or more bones of the 4th finger.

name: obsolete Wide/broad phalanges of the ring finger
label: obsolete Wide/broad phalanges of the ring finger

name: obsolete Expanded proximal phalanx of the ring finger
label: obsolete Expanded proximal phalanx of the ring finger

name: obsolete Lytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger
label: obsolete Lytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger

name: obsolete Short proximal phalanx of the ring finger
label: obsolete Short proximal phalanx of the ring finger

name: Abnormal 5th finger morphology
label: Abnormal 5th finger morphology
definition: An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.

name: Clinodactyly of the 5th finger
label: Clinodactyly of the 5th finger
definition: Clinodactyly refers to a bending or curvature of the fifth finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).|Minor degrees of curvature of the small finger are so common as to be considered normal.

name: Abnormal 5th finger phalanx morphology
label: Abnormal 5th finger phalanx morphology
definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.

name: Curved phalanges of the 5th finger
label: Curved phalanges of the 5th finger
definition: Curved phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 5th finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 5th finger
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the 5th finger.

name: Symphalangism of the 5th finger
label: Symphalangism of the 5th finger
definition: Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger

name: Short middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Short middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the fifth finger.|Brachymesophalangia-V, a short and broad middle phalanx of the fifth digit, is the most common of all skeletal anomalies of the hand. When this feature appears alone, it is clinically known as brachydactyly type A3 (BDA3).

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.

name: Curved distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Curved distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.

name: Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fifth finger.

name: Subluxation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger
label: Subluxation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger
definition: A partial dislocation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger.

name: Carpal bone aplasia
label: Carpal bone aplasia
definition: Congenital absence of a carpal bone.|Radiographically difficult to distinguish between absent ossification of a carpal bone.

name: Accessory carpal bones
label: Accessory carpal bones
definition: The presence of more than the normal number of carpal bones.

name: Advanced ossification of carpal bones
label: Advanced ossification of carpal bones
definition: Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.

name: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of carpal bones
label: Bone-in-a-bone appearance of carpal bones
definition: The bone-in-bone sign is a radiographic finding produced by increased sclerosis (abnormally dense bone) occurring intermittently with zones of relatively normal bone density. This term should be used to describe such a finding in the carpal bones.

name: Irregular carpal bones
label: Irregular carpal bones
definition: Carpal bones with irregular or fragmented margins.

name: Large carpal bones
label: Large carpal bones
definition: Increased size of carpal bones.

name: Stippled calcification in carpal bones
label: Stippled calcification in carpal bones
definition: Point-shaped (punctate) calcifications affecting the carpal bones.

name: Delayed ossification of the scaphoid
label: Delayed ossification of the scaphoid
definition: Formation of bone tissue of scaphoid is less than expected for age.

name: Small scaphoid
label: Small scaphoid
definition: Underdevelopment of the scaphoid.

name: Lunate-triquetral fusion
label: Lunate-triquetral fusion
definition: Osseous fusion of the lunate and triquetrum.|Synostosis of the carpal bones is a rare congenital condition. Lunate and triquetrum are the bones more commonly involved.

name: Abnormality of the trapezium
label: Abnormality of the trapezium
definition: An anomaly of trapezium.

name: Delayed ossification of the trapezium
label: Delayed ossification of the trapezium
definition: Formation of bone tissue of trapezium is less than expected for age.

name: Small trapezium
label: Small trapezium
definition: Underdevelopment of the trapezium.

name: Delayed ossification of the trapezoid bone
label: Delayed ossification of the trapezoid bone
definition: Formation of bone tissue of trapezoid is less than expected for age.

name: Small trapezoid bone
label: Small trapezoid bone
definition: Underdevelopment of the trapezoid.

name: Narrow small joints of the hand
label: Narrow small joints of the hand

name: Osteoarthritis of the small joints of the hand
label: Osteoarthritis of the small joints of the hand

name: Subluxation of the small joints of the hand
label: Subluxation of the small joints of the hand
definition: A partial dislocation of some or all of the small joints of the hand.

name: Exostoses of hand bones
label: Exostoses of hand bones
definition: Abnormal formation of new bone on the surface of a bone of the hand.

name: Synostosis involving bones of the hand
label: Synostosis involving bones of the hand
definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the hand.

name: Short palm
label: Short palm
definition: Short palm.|This term refers to a developmental finding resulting in short palms. This term is reserved for individuals with shortening of all four metacarpals 2-5. Individuals with fewer than four shortened metacarpals (in a eudactylous hand, the metacarpals of F2-5) should be coded as Metacarpal, short. See the entry for Hand, small for a discussion of this finding. "Short hand" should not be used as it is a bundle of two readily separable terms, Fingers, short (which, as noted above, can itself be a bundled term) and Palm, short.

name: Narrow palm
label: Narrow palm
definition: For children from birth to 4 years of age, the palm width is more than 2 SD below the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is below the 5th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately narrow for its length.|Palm width is measured across the palm at the level of the MCPJ (radial aspect of the F2 MCPJ to the ulnar aspect of the F5 MCPJ). Norms are specified in [Hall et al., 2007]. Caution is advised for the subjective assessment as the breadth may be in the normal range with disproportionately increased length, which appears narrow. This finding may be associated with elongated/slender limbs in general, but that finding does not bear on the coding of this feature. Proximal narrowing may indicate small thenar or hypothenar eminences. This term replaces "narrow hands" as that term may leave the impression that it includes the thumb, which it does not.

name: Sclerosis of hand bones with transverse striations
label: Sclerosis of hand bones with transverse striations

name: Synostosis of second metacarpal-trapezoid
label: Synostosis of second metacarpal-trapezoid
definition: Fusion of the second metacarpal-trapezoid.

name: Subluxation of metacarpal phalangeal joints
label: Subluxation of metacarpal phalangeal joints
definition: A partial dislocation affecting some or all of the metacarpophalangeal joints.

name: Abnormality of the gastric mucosa
label: Abnormality of the gastric mucosa
definition: An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane.

name: Abnormality of the biliary system
label: Abnormality of the biliary system
definition: An abnormality of the biliary system.

name: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
label: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
definition: The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.

name: Hernia of the abdominal wall
label: Hernia of the abdominal wall
definition: The presence of a hernia in the abdominal wall.|A hernia refers to a sac formed by the lining of the abdominal cavity (peritoneum). The sac can protrude through a hole or weak area in the abdominal fascia.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
label: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.|Normal human muscle is composed of many individual muscle fibers bundled together by layers of connective tissue that are arranged in a nesting-doll like fashion. The inner most structure, the single muscle fiber, is covered by a thin layer of primarily reticular fibers called the endomysium. The endomysium is quite inconspicuous and muscle fibers appear to be in direct contact with each other. The finest capillaries, nerve twigs and lymphatic capillaries are found within the endomysium. Groups of muscle fibers are bound together by the thicker perimysium, forming structures called fascicles. Capillaries, nerve fibers and lymphatic vessels also track in the perimyseum. Bundles of fascicles are encased within the dense irregular connective tissue of the epimysium. These connective tissue layers provide mechanical protection for the muscle fibers and increase the tensile strength of the muscle. The layers are continuous with the tendon, which provides attachment to bone. Individual muscle fibers are syncytia, formed by embryonic fusion of many myoblasts or later, myosatellite cells. Each muscle fiber contains many nuclei, peripherally positioned immediately adjacent to the sarcolemmal membrane. In healthy muscle only 3-5 percent of fibers contain nuclei that are located internally, within the cell, but many disease processes lead to internal nuclei. Each nucleus provides a segment of the cell with needed translated protein products.

name: Involuntary movements
label: Involuntary movements
definition: Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.

name: Abnormal endocardium morphology
label: Abnormal endocardium morphology
definition: An abnormality of the endocardium.

name: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
label: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
definition: Thickening of the left ventricle wall with congenital onset.

name: Ventricular preexcitation
label: Ventricular preexcitation
definition: An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.|Pre-excitation syndromes are generally caused by accelerated conduction along an accessory pathway, but in some cases there is accelerated conduction through the normal AV node.

name: Abnormal macrophage morphology
label: Abnormal macrophage morphology
definition: An abnormality of macrophages.

name: Abnormal reticulocyte morphology
label: Abnormal reticulocyte morphology
definition: A reticulocyte abnormality.|Reticulocytes are immature erythrocytes that show a basophilic reticulum under vital staining.

name: Decreased antibody level in blood
label: Decreased antibody level in blood
definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.|In humans, immunoglobulins comprise the five antibody isotypes IgA, IgD, IgE, IgG and IgM.

name: Decreased circulating IgG level
label: Decreased circulating IgG level
definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.

name: Decreased circulating aldosterone level
label: Decreased circulating aldosterone level
definition: Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.|Aldosterone is a hormone that is produce by the adrenal cortex and that acts on the distal tubules and collecting ducts to favor retention of sodium excretion of potassium, and increased water retention, thereby tending to increase blood pressure. Aldosterone is sometimes called a mineralocorticoid because of its influence on sodium homeostasis.

name: Vaginal fistula
label: Vaginal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

name: Bladder fistula
label: Bladder fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.

name: Short stature
label: Short stature
definition: A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).

name: Abnormality of body weight
label: Abnormality of body weight
definition: An abnormal increase or decrease of weight or an abnormal distribution of mass in the body.

name: Increased body weight
label: Increased body weight
definition: Abnormally increased body weight.

name: Decreased body weight
label: Decreased body weight
definition: Abnormally low body weight.

name: Cachexia
label: Cachexia
definition: Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.

name: Abnormal vitreous humor morphology
label: Abnormal vitreous humor morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.|The vitreous humor is the clear gel that fills the space between the lens and the retina.

name: Abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
label: Abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
definition: An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).|The anterior segment comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens.

name: Abnormal posterior eye segment morphology
label: Abnormal posterior eye segment morphology
definition: The posterior segment comprises the anterior hyaloid membrane and all of the optical structures behind it: the vitreous humor, retina, choroid, and optic nerve.

name: Increased skull ossification
label: Increased skull ossification
definition: An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

name: Decreased skull ossification
label: Decreased skull ossification
definition: A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte morphology
label: Abnormal lymphocyte morphology
definition: An abnormality of lymphocytes.|A lymphocyte refers to a cell of the B cell, T cell, or natural killer cell lineage.

name: Bone-marrow foam cells
label: Bone-marrow foam cells
definition: The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.

name: Dermal atrophy
label: Dermal atrophy
definition: Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.

name: Myelin outfoldings
label: Myelin outfoldings
definition: The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.|This finding can be demonstrated by nerve biopsy (e.g., sural nerve biopsy).

name: Abnormality of amino acid metabolism
label: Abnormality of amino acid metabolism
definition: Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.

name: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating sulfur amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating sulfur amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sulfur amino acid in the blood circulation.|Cysteine and methionine contain a sulfur atom.

name: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism
label: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism
definition: Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose.

name: Abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism
label: Abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism
definition: An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.|Glycosphingolipids are a subtype of glycolipids containing the amino alcohol sphingosine. A glycosphingolipid is a carbohydrate-containing derivative of a sphingoid or ceramide. It is understood that the carbohydrate residue is attached by a glycosidic linkage to O-1 of the sphingoid.

name: Ganglioside accumulation
label: Ganglioside accumulation
definition: Defects in the lysosomal glycosidases or specific co-activators, result in accumulation of the substrates, such as glycosphingolipids, including gangliosides in GM1 gangliosidosis (Tay-Sachs disease) and GM2 gangliosidosis (Sandhoff disease).|A ganglioside is composed of a glycosphingolipid with one or more sialic acids linked on the sugar chain.

name: Weakness of muscles of respiration
label: Weakness of muscles of respiration
definition: Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

name: Abnormality of bone mineral density
label: Abnormality of bone mineral density
definition: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.

name: Reduced bone mineral density
label: Reduced bone mineral density
definition: A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.

name: Abnormal circulating purine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating purine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a purine in the blood circulation.|Purines are nitrogenous bases including the two nucleotide bases deoxyadenosine and deoxyguanosine.

name: Abnormal circulating pyrimidine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating pyrimidine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a pyrimidine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating carboxylic acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating carboxylic acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.|Carboxylic acid refers to an organic compound that contains a carboxyl group (-COOH).

name: Abnormality of lysosomal metabolism
label: Abnormality of lysosomal metabolism
definition: A major lysosomal function is the breakdown and recycling of macromolecules and organelles into basic precursors.

name: Abnormal circulating leucine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating leucine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of superoxide metabolism
label: Abnormality of superoxide metabolism
definition: NADPH oxidase catalyzes the production of superoxide, which in turn can react to form hydrogen peroxide, HOCl, and hydroxyl radical. Together, these oxygen-derived species participate in bacterial killing.

name: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.|A fatty acid is an aliphatic monocarboxylic acid derived from or contained in esterified form. Natural fatty acids commonly have a chain of 4 to 28 carbons (usually unbranched and even-numbered), which may be saturated or unsaturated. R-COOH. Fatty acids are usually derived from triglycerides or phospholipids.

name: Abnormality of acid-base homeostasis
label: Abnormality of acid-base homeostasis
definition: An abnormality of the balance or maintenance of the balance of acids and bases in bodily fluids, resulting in an abnormal pH.

name: Abnormality of circulating leptin level
label: Abnormality of circulating leptin level
definition: An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

name: Abnormality of enteric ganglion morphology
label: Abnormality of enteric ganglion morphology
definition: An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.

name: Abnormal circulating calcium concentration
label: Abnormal circulating calcium concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of calcium in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating nitrogen compound concentration
label: Abnormal circulating nitrogen compound concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation.|Ammonia (NH3), one of the most clinically important nitrogen compounds in human metabolism, is a substance containing nitrogen resulting from the catabolism of protein. It is converted to the less toxic substance urea prior to excretion in urine.

name: Abnormal circulating tryptophan concentration
label: Abnormal circulating tryptophan concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of glycolysis
label: Abnormality of glycolysis
definition: An abnormality of glycolysis.

name: Abnormality of temperature regulation
label: Abnormality of temperature regulation
definition: An abnormality of temperature homeostasis.

name: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism
label: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism
definition: Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism.|A glycosaminoglycan is any polysaccharide containing a substantial proportion of aminomonosaccharide residues. Glycosaminoglycan (GAG) are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit. Among the most common GAGs are chondroitin sulfate, dermatan sulfate, chondroitin sulfate, keratan sulfate, heparan sulfate, and hyaluronan.

name: Focal dystonia
label: Focal dystonia
definition: A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

name: Hemiplegia/hemiparesis
label: Hemiplegia/hemiparesis
definition: Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

name: Neoplasm of the nervous system
label: Neoplasm of the nervous system
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.

name: Neuroblastic tumor
label: Neuroblastic tumor
definition: A family of tumours arising in the embryonal remnants of the sympathetic nervous system, which includes neuroblastoma, ganglioneuroblastoma, and ganglioneuroma.|Along with neuroblastomas, ganglioneuromas and ganglioneuroblastomas are collectively known as neuroblastic tumors.

name: Hematological neoplasm
label: Hematological neoplasm
definition: Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).

name: Abnormality of the anus
label: Abnormality of the anus
definition: Abnormality of the anal canal.|The anal canal is continuous proximally with the rectum and distally terminates with the anus.

name: Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase activity
label: Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase activity
definition: An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase activity.|Note that the alkaline phosphatase family has four isoenzymes in humans, each of which additionally can have different isoforms. The primary clinical importance of measuring alkaline phosphatase is to check the possibility of bone disease or liver disease.

name: Aortic valve calcification
label: Aortic valve calcification
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.

name: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
label: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
definition: A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.

name: Mitral valve calcification
label: Mitral valve calcification
definition: Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.

name: Hypoplastic left heart
label: Hypoplastic left heart
definition: Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.|Hypoplastic left heart syndrome is an unsatisfactory term describing lethal underdevelopment of the left ventricle (LV). It represents the more severe end of a spectrum of LV hypoplasia, mandating single-ventricle palliation or cardiac transplantation. Less severe borderline ventricular hypoplasia may instead allow various biventricular therapeutic strategies and better long-term outcomes.

name: Type I truncus arteriosus
label: Type I truncus arteriosus
definition: Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries.|According to the Van Praagh classification (PMID:2856609). The Van Praagh classification additionally specifies the presence (subtype A) or absence (subtype B) of a ventricular septal defect.

name: Gastrointestinal inflammation
label: Gastrointestinal inflammation
definition: Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.

name: Enterocolitis
label: Enterocolitis
definition: An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).

name: Microcolon
label: Microcolon
definition: A colon of abnormally small caliber.

name: Intestinal pseudo-obstruction
label: Intestinal pseudo-obstruction
definition: A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.

name: Hamartomatous polyposis
label: Hamartomatous polyposis
definition: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.|Patients with Cowden-Syndrom for example often have multiple hamartomatous gastrointestinal polyps.

name: Prune belly
label: Prune belly
definition: A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants.|Wrinkly folds of skin covering the abdomen as a result of partial or complete lack of abdominal muscles.

name: Ectopic anus
label: Ectopic anus
definition: Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.

name: Peptic ulcer
label: Peptic ulcer
definition: An ulcer of the gastrointestinal tract.|A peptic ulcer is defined as an erosion of the mucosa of the gastrointestinal tract, and can occur as esophageal ulcer, gastric ulcer, duodenal ulcer, and Meckel's Diverticulum ulcer.

name: Congenital pyloric atresia
label: Congenital pyloric atresia
definition: Congenital atresia of the pylorus.

name: Abnormality of the pylorus
label: Abnormality of the pylorus
definition: An abnormality of the pylorus.

name: Meconium ileus
label: Meconium ileus
definition: Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.|Obstruction of the intestine is known as ileus.

name: Abnormal nipple morphology
label: Abnormal nipple morphology
definition: An abnormality of the nipple.

name: Abnormality of the sense of smell
label: Abnormality of the sense of smell
definition: An anomaly in the ability to perceive and distinguish scents (odors).

name: Hyposmia
label: Hyposmia
definition: A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).

name: Deviated nasal septum
label: Deviated nasal septum
definition: Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.

name: Abnormality of the pulmonary artery
label: Abnormality of the pulmonary artery
definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

name: Pulmonary artery stenosis
label: Pulmonary artery stenosis
definition: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.|Stenosis, or narrowing, of the branches of the pulmonary artery is a type of congenital heart disease that, if left untreated, may lead to significant complications. Ideally, interventions to treat stenosis occur before significant complications or long-term sequelae take place, often within the first 2 years of life.

name: Intermittent claudication
label: Intermittent claudication
definition: Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still.|Vascular intermittent claudication caused by peripheral arterial disease most often related to severe atherosclerosis.

name: Thrombophlebitis
label: Thrombophlebitis
definition: Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: Recurrent thrombophlebitis
label: Recurrent thrombophlebitis
definition: Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: Arterial thrombosis
label: Arterial thrombosis
definition: The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.

name: Elevated systolic blood pressure
label: Elevated systolic blood pressure
definition: Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.|Normal systolic blood pressure is less than 120 mmHg in adults.

name: Biparietal narrowing
label: Biparietal narrowing
definition: A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).

name: Flat forehead
label: Flat forehead
definition: A forehead with abnormal flatness.

name: Abnormality of the cheek
label: Abnormality of the cheek
definition: An abnormality of the cheek- one of two bilateral soft tissue facial structures in the region of the face inferior to the eyes and between the nose and the ear. "Buccal" means relating to the cheek. The cheek is part of the midface

name: Elfin facies
label: Elfin facies
definition: This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.

name: Recurrent viral infections
label: Recurrent viral infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.

name: Severe combined immunodeficiency
label: Severe combined immunodeficiency
definition: A combined immunodeficiency primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.

name: Complement deficiency
label: Complement deficiency
definition: An immunodeficiency defined by the absent or suboptimal functioning of one of the complement system proteins.

name: Agammaglobulinemia
label: Agammaglobulinemia
definition: Absence or extremely low level of IgA, IgM, and IgM in the circulation.

name: Secretory IgA deficiency
label: Secretory IgA deficiency
definition: Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.

name: C8 deficiency
label: C8 deficiency
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C8 in circulation.|The eighth component of complement (C8) plays an important role in the function of membrane attack complex (MAC) that is generated on target cells upon activation of the complement system. MAC is generated by sequential addition of C5b, C6, C7, C8, and C9 molecules, which results in the transmembrane pore and eventual cell lysis. Individuals with C8 deficiency tend to have recurrent neisserial infections.

name: Cranial hyperostosis
label: Cranial hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.

name: Hyperostosis frontalis interna
label: Hyperostosis frontalis interna
definition: Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the frontal bone.

name: Craniofacial dysostosis
label: Craniofacial dysostosis
definition: A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.|Note: This term is used in the medical literature to describe an appearance of the face of patients with Crouzon syndrome (also called craniofacial dysostosis), which is characterized by acrocephaly, exophthalmos, hypertelorism, strabismus, parrot-beaked nose, and hypoplastic maxilla. This is thus probably mainly used as a bundled term and should be replaced by better descriptions in the future.

name: Coronal craniosynostosis
label: Coronal craniosynostosis
definition: Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.

name: Sagittal craniosynostosis
label: Sagittal craniosynostosis
definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.

name: Lambdoidal craniosynostosis
label: Lambdoidal craniosynostosis
definition: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.

name: Spherocytosis
label: Spherocytosis
definition: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.|Erythrocytes are normally biconcave rather than spherical.

name: Elliptocytosis
label: Elliptocytosis
definition: The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.|Elliptocytes (ovalocytes) are abnormal erythrocytes ranging from slightly oval to elongated cigar-shaped forms.

name: Stomatocytosis
label: Stomatocytosis
definition: The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.

name: Poikilocytosis
label: Poikilocytosis
definition: The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.|General description for abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

name: Fulminant hepatic failure
label: Fulminant hepatic failure
definition: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Preauricular skin furrow
label: Preauricular skin furrow
definition: A groove of the skin immediately in front of the ear.

name: Postauricular skin tag
label: Postauricular skin tag
definition: A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).

name: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
label: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
definition: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).

name: Overfolding of the superior helices
label: Overfolding of the superior helices
definition: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.

name: Dilatated internal auditory canal
label: Dilatated internal auditory canal
definition: The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.

name: Exostosis of the external auditory canal
label: Exostosis of the external auditory canal
definition: A benign bony growth projecting outward from a bone surface within the external auditory canal.

name: Congenital earlobe sinuses
label: Congenital earlobe sinuses
definition: Pits in the earlobes at the location where ears are typically pierced for earrings.

name: Absent brainstem auditory responses
label: Absent brainstem auditory responses
definition: Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.

name: Postauricular pit
label: Postauricular pit
definition: Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

name: Preauricular pit
label: Preauricular pit
definition: Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.|Preauricular cysts and sinuses are ectodermal remnants from an aberrant development of the auditory tubercles, tend to be bilateral and are localized anterior to the tragus of the ear. The preauricular sinus is a benign congenital lesion of the preauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit. It is also known as preauricular pit, preauricular fistula, preauricular tract and preauricular cyst. It can be asymptomatic or present as an infected and discharging sinus. It presents as a small pit adjacent to the external ear usually located at the anterior margin of the ascending limb of the helix. The preauricular sinus is variably also termed a preauricular pit, preauricular fistula, preauricular tract and preauricular cyst.

name: Anomalous tracheal cartilage
label: Anomalous tracheal cartilage
definition: An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).

name: Chronic bronchitis
label: Chronic bronchitis
definition: Chronic inflammation of the bronchi.

name: Atretic occipital cephalocele
label: Atretic occipital cephalocele
definition: A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
label: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.

name: Mandibular hyperostosis
label: Mandibular hyperostosis
definition: Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the mandible.|This bundled term will be made obsolete in future versions of the HPO.

name: Persistent open anterior fontanelle
label: Persistent open anterior fontanelle
definition: The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
label: Aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area
definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area.

name: Progressive macrocephaly
label: Progressive macrocephaly
definition: The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.

name: Relative macrocephaly
label: Relative macrocephaly
definition: A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.

name: Craniofacial asymmetry
label: Craniofacial asymmetry
definition: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.

name: Cessation of head growth
label: Cessation of head growth
definition: Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.

name: Acrobrachycephaly
label: Acrobrachycephaly
definition: An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.

name: Macrocephaly at birth
label: Macrocephaly at birth
definition: The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.

name: Calvarial hyperostosis
label: Calvarial hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth of the calvaria.|The calvaria (skull cap) is made up of the frontal, occipital, right and left parietal, right and left temporal, sphenoid, and ethmoid bones, and thus comprises the upper dome-like part of the skull and does not include the lower jaw.

name: Large posterior fontanelle
label: Large posterior fontanelle
definition: An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.

name: Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
label: Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
definition: An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.|This term indicates that both the fontanelles and the sutures are widely patent and thus represents a severe form of delay in closure of the fontanelles/sutures.

name: Craniofacial hyperostosis
label: Craniofacial hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.

name: Thin anteverted nares
label: Thin anteverted nares
definition: This bundled term will be made obsolete in future versions of the HPO and should not be used for new annotations.

name: Posterior choanal atresia
label: Posterior choanal atresia
definition: Absence or abnormal closure of the posterior portion of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

name: Chronic rhinitis due to narrow nasal airway
label: Chronic rhinitis due to narrow nasal airway

name: Bilateral choanal atresia
label: Bilateral choanal atresia
definition: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).

name: Pancreatic islet-cell hyperplasia
label: Pancreatic islet-cell hyperplasia
definition: Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells.|The islets of Langerhans contain the alpha cells (producing glucagon), beta cells (insulin and amylin), delta cells (somatostatin),PP cells (pancreatic polypeptide), and the epsilon cells (ghrelin).

name: Long eyebrows
label: Long eyebrows
definition: Increased length of the hairs of the eyebrows.

name: Temporal hypotrichosis
label: Temporal hypotrichosis
definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in the temporal region (i.e., around the temples on the side of the skull).

name: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft
label: Large clumps of pigment irregularly distributed along hair shaft

name: Generalized hypotrichosis
label: Generalized hypotrichosis
definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth in a generalized distribution.

name: Sacral hypertrichosis
label: Sacral hypertrichosis
definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the sacral region.

name: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis
label: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis
definition: Anterior cervical hypertrichosis (ACH) or 'hairy throat' refers to the presence of a tuft of terminal hair on the anterior neck, just above the laryngeal prominence.

name: Congenital, generalized hypertrichosis
label: Congenital, generalized hypertrichosis
definition: A confluent, generalized overgrowth of silvery blonde to gray lanugo hair at birth.|Hypertrichosis refers to excessive, abnormal hairiness.

name: Generalized hypertrichosis
label: Generalized hypertrichosis
definition: Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.

name: Cervical platyspondyly
label: Cervical platyspondyly
definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the cervical spine.

name: Increased spinal bone density
label: Increased spinal bone density
definition: Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).

name: Pear-shaped vertebrae
label: Pear-shaped vertebrae
definition: Bulbous appearance of the anterior vertebral bodies, such that the vertebral bodies have the greatest vertical height anteriorly as well as bulbous anterior superior-inferior contours.

name: Beaking of vertebral bodies
label: Beaking of vertebral bodies
definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.

name: Increased vertebral height
label: Increased vertebral height
definition: Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.

name: Anterior wedging of T11
label: Anterior wedging of T11
definition: An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T11 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

name: Sclerotic vertebral endplates
label: Sclerotic vertebral endplates
definition: Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.

name: Anterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
label: Anterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
definition: An excessive concavity of the anterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.|One cause of anterior scalloping is an aortic aneurysm, which because of its pulsatile pressure can cause a convex defect along the anterior surface of an adjacent vertebra body. The defect may have a sclerotic margin.

name: Biconcave vertebral bodies
label: Biconcave vertebral bodies
definition: Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.|This finding has been called fish or codfish vertebra because of the characteristic biconcave form of fish vertebral bodies.

name: Thoracic platyspondyly
label: Thoracic platyspondyly
definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

name: Hump-shaped mound of bone in central and posterior portions of vertebral endplate
label: Hump-shaped mound of bone in central and posterior portions of vertebral endplate

name: Supernumerary vertebral ossification centers
label: Supernumerary vertebral ossification centers
definition: Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.

name: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies
label: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies

name: Spina bifida occulta at L5
label: Spina bifida occulta at L5
definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of the vertebra L5 with intact overlying skin.

name: Cervical C2/C3 vertebral fusion
label: Cervical C2/C3 vertebral fusion
definition: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.

name: Absent vertebral body mineralization
label: Absent vertebral body mineralization
definition: A lack of bone mineralization of the vertebral bodies.

name: Unossified vertebral bodies
label: Unossified vertebral bodies
definition: A lack of ossification of the vertebral bodies.

name: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
label: Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae
definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.

name: Anteriorly placed odontoid process
label: Anteriorly placed odontoid process
definition: Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.

name: Lumbar spinal canal stenosis
label: Lumbar spinal canal stenosis
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the lumbar spinal canal.|Symptoms of lumbar spinal canal stenosis include pseudoclaudication (pain, numbness,, or weakness induced by walking and relieved by rest; the prefix pseudo is used to differentiate this manifestation from claudication, which has similar symptoms but is caused by peripheral artery disease).

name: Spina bifida occulta at S1
label: Spina bifida occulta at S1
definition: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of S1 with intact overlying skin.

name: Cleft vertebral arch
label: Cleft vertebral arch
definition: A discontinuity of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.

name: Butterfly vertebral arch
label: Butterfly vertebral arch
definition: Butterfly vertebrae have a cleft through the body of the vertebrae and a funnel shape at the ends.

name: Enlarged vertebral pedicles
label: Enlarged vertebral pedicles
definition: Increased size of the vertebral pedicle.|The vertebral pedicles are the two short, thick processes, which connect the body of the spinal vertebra to the arch.

name: Progressive intervertebral space narrowing
label: Progressive intervertebral space narrowing
definition: A progressive form of decreased height of the intervertebral disk.

name: Biconvex vertebral bodies
label: Biconvex vertebral bodies
definition: Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.|Note that biconvex vertebral bodies can be a normal finding in newborns.

name: Small cervical vertebral bodies
label: Small cervical vertebral bodies
definition: Reduced size of cervical vertebrae.

name: Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae
label: Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae
definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.

name: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles
label: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles

name: Cervical segmentation defect
label: Cervical segmentation defect
definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of cervical vertebrae during development.

name: Lower thoracic kyphosis
label: Lower thoracic kyphosis
definition: Over curvature of the lower thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

name: Cervical C5/C6 vertebrae fusion
label: Cervical C5/C6 vertebrae fusion
definition: Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.

name: Elevated amniotic fluid alpha-fetoprotein
label: Elevated amniotic fluid alpha-fetoprotein
definition: An elevation of alpha-feto protein measured in the amniotic fluid.|This feature can be found in pregnancies with fetuses affected by a range of abnormalities including for instance encephalocele.

name: Hypoplasia of the nasal bone
label: Hypoplasia of the nasal bone
definition: Underdevelopment of the nasal bone.

name: Hypoplasia of facial musculature
label: Hypoplasia of facial musculature
definition: Underdevelopment of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Frontalis muscle weakness
label: Frontalis muscle weakness
definition: Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).

name: Facial midline hemangioma
label: Facial midline hemangioma
definition: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the midline region of the face.

name: Decreased facial expression
label: Decreased facial expression
definition: A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

name: Deep longitudinal plantar crease
label: Deep longitudinal plantar crease
definition: Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot.

name: Talipes valgus
label: Talipes valgus
definition: Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.|The phrase talipes valgus is derived from the Latin words talus (ankle), pes (poot), and valgus (outward angulation of the distal segment of a bone).

name: Short third metatarsal
label: Short third metatarsal
definition: Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone.

name: Short fourth metatarsal
label: Short fourth metatarsal
definition: Short fourth metatarsal bone.

name: Thickened Achilles tendon
label: Thickened Achilles tendon
definition: An abnormal thickening of the Achilles tendon.

name: 2-3 toe syndactyly
label: 2-3 toe syndactyly
definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two and three.

name: 4-5 toe syndactyly
label: 4-5 toe syndactyly
definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes four and five.

name: Calcaneal epiphyseal stippling
label: Calcaneal epiphyseal stippling
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the calcaneus.

name: Osteoporotic metatarsal
label: Osteoporotic metatarsal
definition: Decrease in mass and density of the metatarsal bones.

name: Short fifth metatarsal
label: Short fifth metatarsal
definition: Short (hypoplastic) fifth metatarsal bone.

name: Renal malrotation
label: Renal malrotation
definition: An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.|The final kidney position in the renal fossa results from the rotation of the kidney with an orientation of the renal pelvis to the medial and the renal calyces to the lateral. Malrotation of the kidney can lead to orientation of the renal pelvis anteriorly, posteriorly and laterally. In most cases, renal malrotation does not cause any symptoms, but, hydronephrosis or stone formation can be observed as complications of renal malformation.

name: Reversible renal failure
label: Reversible renal failure
definition: Acute renal failure with resolution of manifestations.

name: Axial malrotation of the kidney
label: Axial malrotation of the kidney
definition: An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.

name: Hyperechogenic kidneys
label: Hyperechogenic kidneys
definition: An increase in amplitude of waves returned in ultrasonography of the kidney, which is generally displayed as increased brightness of the signal.

name: Thickening of the glomerular basement membrane
label: Thickening of the glomerular basement membrane
definition: Increase in thickness of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.|This finding is demonstrated on renal biopsy.

name: Calcium nephrolithiasis
label: Calcium nephrolithiasis
definition: The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.|The overwhelming majority of renal calculi contain calcium.

name: Impaired renal concentrating ability
label: Impaired renal concentrating ability
definition: A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.|An impairment in renal concentrating ability can be easily recognized by the maximum concentrating ability (Umax) as determined by the urine osmolality reached after a fixed period of dehydration. Inability to maximally concentrate the urine is related to one or both of two basic tubular defects: 1) a failure of maximal free-water generation by the diluting segment in the ascending limb of Henle's loop; and 2) a failure of the distal tubular epithelium to achieve maximum permeability to water during water deprivation.

name: Acute tubulointerstitial nephritis
label: Acute tubulointerstitial nephritis
definition: Acute inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

name: Impaired renal uric acid clearance
label: Impaired renal uric acid clearance
definition: A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.

name: Renal cortical microcysts
label: Renal cortical microcysts
definition: Cysts of microscopic size confined to the cortex of the kidney.

name: Crossed fused renal ectopia
label: Crossed fused renal ectopia
definition: A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.

name: Global glomerulosclerosis
label: Global glomerulosclerosis
definition: Complete and diffuse scarring of glomerulus.|All portions of all glomeruli are affected.

name: Abnormal renal collecting system morphology
label: Abnormal renal collecting system morphology
definition: An abnormality of the renal collecting system.

name: Chronic tubulointerstitial nephritis
label: Chronic tubulointerstitial nephritis
definition: Chronic inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

name: Glomerular subendothelial electron-dense deposits
label: Glomerular subendothelial electron-dense deposits
definition: Electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane,|Subendothelial electron-dense deposits are a characteristc feature of dense-deposit disease.

name: Atrial flutter
label: Atrial flutter
definition: A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.|Atrial flutter can lead to palpitations, fatigue, dyspnea, and chest pain. Atrial flutter can be paroxysmal or persistent.

name: Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia
label: Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia
definition: Episodes of ventricular tachycardia that have a sudden onset and ending.

name: Congenital atrioventricular dissociation
label: Congenital atrioventricular dissociation
definition: A form of atrioventricular (AV) dissociation (i.e., the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers) with congenital onset.

name: Permanent atrial fibrillation
label: Permanent atrial fibrillation
definition: AF that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.|The natural history of atrial fibrillation (AF) is characterized by a gradual worsening with time. AF itself produces changes in atrial function and structure. Note there is no precise definition of the duration of AF required to be regarded as chronic.

name: Supraventricular tachycardia
label: Supraventricular tachycardia
definition: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.|A narrow complex (QRS width less than 120 milliseconds) reflects rapid activation of the ventricles via the normal conduction pathway, i.e. His-Purkinje system, which in turn suggests that the tachycardia originated above the AV node and is thus supraventricular.

name: Ventricular tachycardia
label: Ventricular tachycardia
definition: A tachycardia originating in the ventricles characterized by rapid heart rate (over 100 beats per minute) and broad QRS complexes (over 120 ms).|Ventricular tachycardia (VT) is a potentially life-threatening ventricular arrhythmia that presents as a wide QRS complex tachycardia, and is defined as three or more consecutive QRS complexes with a duration longer than 120 milliseconds (ms) and a rate of 100 beats per minute or more, whereby the complexes have a ventricular origin. VT can be subdivided as follows: (i) sustained VT persists for 30 seconds or more; (ii) non-sustained VT lasts less than 30 seconds; (iii) monomorphic VT displays a uniform QRS morphology; and (iv) polymorphic VT displays QRS morphologies that variy from beat to beat. VT is observed most commonly in individuals with structural heart disease or acute myocardial infarction (MI).
