VT may also be observed in in the setting of drug toxicity or electrolyte abnormalities or in individuals with Mendelian disease.

name: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
label: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
definition: Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.

name: Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardia
label: Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardia
definition: Polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias of varying morphologythat do not exist under resting conditions but appear only upon physical exercise or catecholamine administration.

name: obsolete Nodular calcific aortic valve disease
label: obsolete Nodular calcific aortic valve disease

name: Hypoplasia of right ventricle
label: Hypoplasia of right ventricle
definition: Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells.

name: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
label: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
definition: An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination.|PSVT is a term used to denote intermittent supraventricular tachycardia other than atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter and multifocal atrial tachycardia (AT). The major causes are atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT), atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT), and sinoatrial node reentrant tachycardia (SNRT).

name: Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration
label: Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration
definition: Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view.

name: Sparse anterior scalp hair
label: Sparse anterior scalp hair
definition: Decreased number of head hairs per unit area on the anterior region of the scalp.

name: Brittle scalp hair
label: Brittle scalp hair
definition: Fragile, easily breakable scalp hair.

name: Elbow hypertrichosis
label: Elbow hypertrichosis
definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the elbow region.

name: Hypotrichosis of the scalp
label: Hypotrichosis of the scalp
definition: Reduced or lacking hair growth of the scalp.

name: Duodenal polyposis
label: Duodenal polyposis
definition: Presence of multiple polyps in the duodenum.

name: Juvenile gastrointestinal polyposis
label: Juvenile gastrointestinal polyposis
definition: The presence of multiple juvenile polyps in the stomach and intestine. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands. Juvenile polyps are a specific type of hamartomatous polyps.

name: Malrotation of colon
label: Malrotation of colon
definition: An anatomical anomaly that results from an abnormal rotation of the gut as it returns to the abdominal cavity during embryogenesis.

name: Fulminant hepatitis
label: Fulminant hepatitis
definition: Acute hepatitis complicated by acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy occurring less than 8 weeks after the onset of jaundice.|Note that different definitions of fulminant hepatitis are used in the medical literature.

name: Intestinal lymphedema
label: Intestinal lymphedema
definition: Fluid retention and edema in the intestine caused by a compromised lymphatic system.

name: Lactose intolerance
label: Lactose intolerance
definition: An inability to digest lactose.

name: Hypoplasia of the small intestine
label: Hypoplasia of the small intestine
definition: Underdevelopment of the small intestine.

name: Esophageal ulceration
label: Esophageal ulceration
definition: Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.

name: Rectoperineal fistula
label: Rectoperineal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula between the perineum and the rectum.

name: Malrotation of small bowel
label: Malrotation of small bowel
definition: A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.|Malrotation results not only in the malposition of the bowel but also in the malfixation of the mesentery. The normally broad mesenteric attachment is shortened to a narrow pedicle that predisposes the patient to the complication of midgut volvulus.

name: Hamartomatous stomach polyps
label: Hamartomatous stomach polyps
definition: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.

name: Multiple small bowel atresias
label: Multiple small bowel atresias
definition: The presence of multiple areas of atresia affecting the small intestine.

name: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract
label: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract
definition: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Episodic hemolytic anemia
label: Episodic hemolytic anemia
definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that occurs in repeated episodes.

name: Congenital hemolytic anemia
label: Congenital hemolytic anemia
definition: A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset.

name: Acute myeloid leukemia
label: Acute myeloid leukemia
definition: A form of leukemia characterized by overproduction of an early myeloid cell.

name: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia
label: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia
definition: Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies.|Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia occurs following fetomaternal transfusions leading to generation of alloreactive antiplatelet antibodies.

name: Congenital hypoplastic anemia
label: Congenital hypoplastic anemia
definition: A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.|In this condition, hematopoiesis must have been inadequate in fetal life. Affected infant have marked pallor and reticulocytopenia or absence of red blood cell precursors in an otherwise normally cellular bone marrow. This term does not refer to a particular diagnosis or etiology (or which several are known) but to the phenotypic feature.

name: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
label: B Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
definition: A type of ALL characterized by elevated levels of B-cell lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the blood.

name: Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia
label: Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia
definition: Sudden onset of thrombocytopenia (reduced platelet count) within 5-10 days of the transfusion of blood products. The clinical presentation is post-transfusion purpura (PTP), wigth severe thrmbocytopenia, epistaxis, and hemorrhages.|Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia is thought to be related to platelet-specific alloantibody from prior transfusion/pregnancy.

name: Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia
label: Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia
definition: A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans.|Persons with glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase (G6PD) deficiency are susceptible to fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia because of the oxidative stress induced by compunds in Fava beans (thought to be vicine and isouramil). The same underlying defect can make affected persons susceptible to hemolysis induced by a number of mediciations.

name: Drug-sensitive hemolytic anemia
label: Drug-sensitive hemolytic anemia
definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs.

name: Normocytic hypoplastic anemia
label: Normocytic hypoplastic anemia
definition: A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits).

name: Acute myelomonocytic leukemia
label: Acute myelomonocytic leukemia
definition: An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors.

name: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei
label: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei
definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil.|Neutrophils usually display 3-4 nuclear lobes. Hypersegmented neutrophile nuclei display 5 or more lobes. This feature can be seen in vitamin B12 or folate deficiency or with other etiologies.

name: Anisopoikilocytosis
label: Anisopoikilocytosis
definition: A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.

name: Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity
label: Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity
definition: An abnormal increase in the binding affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen.

name: Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia
label: Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia
definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia that does not improve upon administration of folate. Since vitamin B12 acts by promoting recycling of folate, administration of vitamin B12 also does not improve this type of anemia.

name: Refractory anemia with ringed sideroblasts
label: Refractory anemia with ringed sideroblasts
definition: A type of myelodysplastic syndrome characterized by less than 5% myeloblasts in the bone marrow, but with 15% or greater red cell precursors in the marrow being abnormal iron-stuffed cells called ringed sideroblasts.

name: Recurrent thromboembolism
label: Recurrent thromboembolism
definition: Repeated episodes of obstruction of blood flow due to an embolus, i.e., blood clot that has traveled from its point of origin within the blood stream.

name: Microspherocytosis
label: Microspherocytosis
definition: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped and reduced in size.

name: Acute promyelocytic leukemia
label: Acute promyelocytic leukemia
definition: A type of acute myeloid leukemia in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.

name: Pyropoikilocytosis
label: Pyropoikilocytosis
definition: A form of severe hemolytic anemia characterized by erythrocyte morphology reminiscent of that seen in patients after a thermal burn.

name: Hypochromic microcytic anemia
label: Hypochromic microcytic anemia
definition: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.

name: Reduced factor XII activity
label: Reduced factor XII activity
definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XII. Factor XII (fXII) is part of the intrinsic coagulation pathway and binds to exposed collagen at site of vessel wall injury, activated by high-MW kininogen and kallikrein, thereby initiating the coagulation cascade.

name: Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia
label: Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia
definition: A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive.|The Coombs test measures a coating of immunoglobulin or complement on the red cell surface.

name: Acute monocytic leukemia
label: Acute monocytic leukemia
definition: The accumulation of transformed primitive hematopoietic blast cells, which lose their ability of normal differentiation and proliferation.

name: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
label: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
definition: Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.

name: Ph-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia
label: Ph-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia
definition: A subset of acute lymphoblastic leukemia that results from a reciprocal translocation between the ABL-1 oncogene and a breakpoint cluster region (BCR), resulting in a fusion gene, BCR-ABL, that encodes an oncogenic protein with constitutively active tyrosine kinase activity.

name: Recurrent deep vein thrombosis
label: Recurrent deep vein thrombosis
definition: Repeated episodes of the formation of a blot clot in a deep vein.

name: Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia
label: Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia
definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of folate.

name: Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
label: Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
definition: A decreased alkaline phosphatase activity measured within leukocytes.

name: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
label: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
definition: Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.

name: Reduced protein S activity
label: Reduced protein S activity
definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C.|Protein S functions as a cofactor to Protein C in the inactivation of Factors Va and VIIIa in the coagulation pathway. Therefore, a defect in protein S is associated with an increased risk of thrombosis.

name: Normochromic microcytic anemia
label: Normochromic microcytic anemia
definition: A type of anemia characterized by an normal concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.

name: Hyperchromic macrocytic anemia
label: Hyperchromic macrocytic anemia
definition: A type of anemia characterized by abnormally large erythrocytes with abnormally high amounts of haemoglobin.

name: Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
label: Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
definition: Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

name: Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
label: Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia
definition: A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of thiamine.

name: Refractory sideroblastic anemia
label: Refractory sideroblastic anemia
definition: A type of sideroblastic anemia that is not responsive to treatment.

name: Impaired ADP-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired ADP-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal platelet response to ADP as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ADP.

name: Chronic hemolytic anemia
label: Chronic hemolytic anemia
definition: An chronic form of hemolytic anemia.

name: Perineal fistula
label: Perineal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula between the bowel and the perineum.|The perineum is the diamond-shaped region of the body between the pubic arch and the anus.

name: Incisional hernia
label: Incisional hernia
definition: An abdominal hernia that occurs at a site of weakness in the abdominal wall resulting from an incompletely-healed surgical wound.

name: Spontaneous neonatal pneumothorax
label: Spontaneous neonatal pneumothorax
definition: Pneumothorax occurring neonatally without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

name: Intercostal muscle weakness
label: Intercostal muscle weakness
definition: Lack of strength of the intercostal muscles, i.e., of the muscle groups running along the ribs that create and move the chest wall.

name: Intermittent hyperventilation
label: Intermittent hyperventilation
definition: Episodic hyperventilation.

name: Respiratory infections in early life
label: Respiratory infections in early life
definition: Increased susceptibility to respiratory infections in early life, as manifested by recurrent episodes of respiratory infections.

name: Respiratory failure requiring assisted ventilation
label: Respiratory failure requiring assisted ventilation
definition: A state of respiratory distress that requires a life saving intervention in the form of gaining airway access and instituting positive pressure ventilation.

name: Intermittent episodes of respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
label: Intermittent episodes of respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness

name: Elevated pulmonary artery pressure
label: Elevated pulmonary artery pressure
definition: An abnormally elevated blood pressure in the circulation of the pulmonary artery.

name: Recurrent infections due to aspiration
label: Recurrent infections due to aspiration
definition: Increased susceptibility to infections due to aspiration, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infections due to aspiration.

name: Stress/infection-induced lactic acidosis
label: Stress/infection-induced lactic acidosis
definition: A form of lactic acidemia that occurs in relation to stress or infection.

name: Persistent lactic acidosis
label: Persistent lactic acidosis
definition: A continuous form of lactic acidemia.

name: Severe lactic acidosis
label: Severe lactic acidosis
definition: A severe form of lactic acidemia.

name: Exercise-induced lactic acidemia
label: Exercise-induced lactic acidemia
definition: A form of lactic acidemia that occurs following exercise or exertion.

name: Congenital lactic acidosis
label: Congenital lactic acidosis
definition: A form of lactic acidemia with congenital onset.

name: Maturity-onset diabetes of the young
label: Maturity-onset diabetes of the young
definition: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.

name: Low levels of vitamin A
label: Low levels of vitamin A
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin A.

name: Episodic metabolic acidosis
label: Episodic metabolic acidosis
definition: Repeated transient episodes of metabolic acidosis, that is, of the buildup of acid or depletion of base due to accumulation of metabolic acids.

name: Intermittent lactic acidemia
label: Intermittent lactic acidemia
definition: An intermittent (discontinuous) form of lactic acidemia.

name: Recurrent infantile hypoglycemia
label: Recurrent infantile hypoglycemia
definition: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood occurring during the infantile period.

name: Impairment of galactose metabolism
label: Impairment of galactose metabolism
definition: An impairment of galactose metabolism.

name: Abnormal magnesium concentration
label: Abnormal magnesium concentration
definition: An abnormality of magnesium ion homeostasis.

name: Hyperphenylalaninemia
label: Hyperphenylalaninemia
definition: An increased concentration of L-phenylalanine in the blood.

name: Abnormal oral glucose tolerance
label: Abnormal oral glucose tolerance
definition: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.

name: Chronic lactic acidosis
label: Chronic lactic acidosis
definition: A chronic form of lactic acidemia.

name: Orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic dysfunction
label: Orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic dysfunction

name: Pulmonary artery dilatation
label: Pulmonary artery dilatation
definition: An abnormal widening of the diameter of the pulmonary artery.

name: Arteriosclerosis of small cerebral arteries
label: Arteriosclerosis of small cerebral arteries
definition: Arteriosclerosis (increased thickness, increased stiffness, loss of elasticity) of the small arteries of the brain.

name: Ascending aortic dissection
label: Ascending aortic dissection
definition: A separation of the layers within the wall of the ascending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.|According to the Stanford classification, type A aortic dissection affects the ascending aorta and arch.

name: Vascular calcification
label: Vascular calcification
definition: Abnormal calcification of the vasculature.

name: Pulmonary artery atresia
label: Pulmonary artery atresia
definition: A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.|Pulmonary artery atresia means that unoxygenated blood in the right ventricle can not be effectively pumped into the lung for oxygenation.

name: Venous thrombosis
label: Venous thrombosis
definition: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

name: Pulmonary artery aneurysm
label: Pulmonary artery aneurysm
definition: An aneurysm (severe localized balloon-like outward bulging) in the pulmonary artery.

name: Tortuous cerebral arteries
label: Tortuous cerebral arteries
definition: Excessive bending, twisting, and winding of a cerebral artery.

name: Generalized arterial calcification
label: Generalized arterial calcification
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts, affecting arteries distributed throughout the body.

name: Extrahepatic portal hypertension
label: Extrahepatic portal hypertension
definition:
Increased pressure in the pre-hepatic portal vein.|Hypertension in the portal venous tree proper.

previous def: 'has part' some 
('increased pressure' and ('inheres in' some 
('arterial blood' and ('part of' some 'Pre-hepatic portal vein (adult human)'))) and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Aortic aneurysm
label: Aortic aneurysm
definition: Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter.|Aneurysm is considered a severe (pathological) form of dilatation of a segment of a blood vessel. In clinical practice, dilatation and aneurysm are occasionally used interchangably. In this subhierarchy, we therefore use aneurysm as the primary label and list dilatation as a broad synonym.

name: Accelerated atherosclerosis
label: Accelerated atherosclerosis
definition: Atherosclerosis which occurs in a person with certain risk factors (e.g., SLE, diabetes, smoking, hypertension, hypercholesterolaemia, family history of early heart disease) at an earlier age than would occur in another person without those risk factors.

name: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
label: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
definition: The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Extracranial internal carotid artery dissection
label: Extracranial internal carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the extracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.

name: Arteriovenous fistula
label: Arteriovenous fistula
definition: An abnormal connection between an artery and vein.

name: Vascular tortuosity
label: Vascular tortuosity
definition: Abnormal twisting of arteries or veins.

name: Peripheral arterial stenosis
label: Peripheral arterial stenosis
definition: Narrowing of peripheral arteries with reduction of blood flow to the limbs. This feature may be quantified as an ankle-brachial index of less than 0.9, and may be manifested clinically as claudication.|The ankle-brachial index (ABI; the ratio of systolic blood pressure in the ankle to that in the arm), is a measure of occlusion of peripheral arteries in the leg. Peripheral arterial stenosis may be observed with atherosclerosis and with increased intima media thickness as seen in diseases such as pseudoxanthoma elasticum. The most common cause of peripheral arterial stenosis in patients over 40 years of age is atherosclerosis. Cerebral and coronary arteries are by definition not included in peripheral artery disease.

name: Pulmonary arteriovenous fistulas
label: Pulmonary arteriovenous fistulas
definition: A rare vascular anomaly with a direct communication between pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary bed.

name: obsolete Dilatation of the descending aorta
label: obsolete Dilatation of the descending aorta

name: Generalized arterial tortuosity
label: Generalized arterial tortuosity
definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries affecting most or all arteries.

name: Descending thoracic aorta aneurysm
label: Descending thoracic aorta aneurysm
definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta.

name: Absent pulmonary artery
label: Absent pulmonary artery
definition: A congenital defect with aplasia (absence) of one of the right or left pulmonary artery.|This is a rare feature that has been observed in recessive lethal osteogenesis imperfecta with mutation in CRTAP.

name: Pulmonary artery sling
label: Pulmonary artery sling
definition: An anomalous origin of the left pulmonary artery, such that it arises from the posterior aspect of the right pulmonary artery and passes between the trachea and esophagus to reach the left hilum.

name: Thoracic aorta calcification
label: Thoracic aorta calcification
definition: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the thoracic aorta.

name: Calcification of the aorta
label: Calcification of the aorta
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the aorta.|Note that the phrase "aortic calcification" is mainly used to describe calcification of the aortic valve rather than of the aorta itself.

name: Pulmonary arterial medial hypertrophy
label: Pulmonary arterial medial hypertrophy
definition: Increase in mass of the tunica media of the arteries in the pulmonary circulation.

name: Medial calcification of large arteries
label: Medial calcification of large arteries
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of large (conduit) arteries.

name: Recurrent cerebral hemorrhage
label: Recurrent cerebral hemorrhage
definition: Recurrent bleeding into the parenchyma of the brain.

name: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
label: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
definition: Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.

name: Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm
label: Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm
definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the tubular part of the ascending aorta.|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Pulmonary artery hypoplasia
label: Pulmonary artery hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the pulmonary artery.

name: Elevated mean arterial pressure
label: Elevated mean arterial pressure
definition: An abnormal increase in the average blood pressure in an individual during a single cardiac cycle.

name: Coarctation of abdominal aorta
label: Coarctation of abdominal aorta
definition: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the abdominal aorta.

name: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs
label: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs
definition: Flaring of distal femur.

name: Bilateral radial aplasia
label: Bilateral radial aplasia
definition: Missing radius bone on both sides associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Metaphyseal sclerosis
label: Metaphyseal sclerosis
definition: Abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.

name: Metaphyseal rarefaction
label: Metaphyseal rarefaction
definition: Reduction in density of metaphyseal bony tissue.

name: Mesomelic leg shortening
label: Mesomelic leg shortening
definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the leg in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

name: Rhizomelic arm shortening
label: Rhizomelic arm shortening
definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the arm (i.e. the humerus).

name: Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses
label: Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses
definition: Reduced diameter of a long bone with a more pronounced reduction of the diameter of the diaphysis of the long bones.

name: Multicentric ossification of proximal humeral epiphyses
label: Multicentric ossification of proximal humeral epiphyses

name: Recurrent patellar dislocation
label: Recurrent patellar dislocation
definition: Patellar dislocation occurring repeated times.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Flattened proximal radial epiphyses
label: Flattened proximal radial epiphyses
definition: An abnormally flat form of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.

name: Femoral bowing present at birth, straightening with time
label: Femoral bowing present at birth, straightening with time
definition: Congenital onset bending or abnormal curvature of the femur that normalizes with age.|This feature can be diagnosed based on the medical history of congenital femoral bowing with spontaneous improvement.

name: Dumbbell-shaped humerus
label: Dumbbell-shaped humerus
definition: The humerus is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

name: Osteomyelitis leading to amputation due to slow healing fractures
label: Osteomyelitis leading to amputation due to slow healing fractures

name: Mesomelic arm shortening
label: Mesomelic arm shortening
definition: Shortening of the middle parts of the arm in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

name: Dysplastic distal radial epiphyses
label: Dysplastic distal radial epiphyses
definition: Abnormally developed (dysplastic) distal epiphysis of the radius.

name: Hypoplastic distal humeri
label: Hypoplastic distal humeri
definition: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the humerus.

name: Distal ulnar hypoplasia
label: Distal ulnar hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the ulna.

name: Shortening of all phalanges of the toes
label: Shortening of all phalanges of the toes
definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of all phalanges of the foot.

name: Unilateral ulnar hypoplasia
label: Unilateral ulnar hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the ulna on only one side.

name: Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis
label: Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis
definition: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.

name: Multiple long-bone exostoses
label: Multiple long-bone exostoses
definition: Multiple exostoses originating in long bones.

name: Irregular capital femoral epiphysis
label: Irregular capital femoral epiphysis
definition: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth capital femoral epiphysis.

name: Proximal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
label: Proximal humeral metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphysis at the proximal end of the humerus (at the shoulder).

name: Diaphyseal cortical sclerosis
label: Diaphyseal cortical sclerosis
definition: An elevation in bone density of the cortex of one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Anterolateral radial head dislocation
label: Anterolateral radial head dislocation
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterolateral direction.

name: Metaphyseal spurs
label: Metaphyseal spurs
definition: Bony outgrowths that extend laterally from the margin of the metaphysis.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses fused within their metaphyses
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses fused within their metaphyses

name: Proximal fibular overgrowth
label: Proximal fibular overgrowth
definition: Overgrowth of the proximal part of the fibula.

name: Proximal radial head dislocation
label: Proximal radial head dislocation
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an proximal direction.

name: Hyperextensibility at wrists
label: Hyperextensibility at wrists
definition: The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Anterior radial head dislocation
label: Anterior radial head dislocation
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterior direction.

name: Limited knee flexion/extension
label: Limited knee flexion/extension
definition: A limited ability of the knee joint extension and flexion.

name: Abnormal metaphyseal trabeculation
label: Abnormal metaphyseal trabeculation
definition: An abnormality of the pattern of trabecula (small interconnecting rods of bone) in a metaphyseal region of bone.

name: Lateral femoral bowing
label: Lateral femoral bowing
definition: A lateral bending or abnormal curvature of the femur.

name: Streaky metaphyseal sclerosis
label: Streaky metaphyseal sclerosis
definition: The presence of streaks (bands) of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.

name: Absent proximal radial epiphyses
label: Absent proximal radial epiphyses
definition: Absence of the proximal radial epiphysis.

name: Distal femoral bowing
label: Distal femoral bowing
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the femur.

name: Premature birth following premature rupture of fetal membranes
label: Premature birth following premature rupture of fetal membranes

name: High-frequency hearing impairment
label: High-frequency hearing impairment
definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the higher frequencies of sound (3,000 to 6,000 Hz).|High frequency hearing impairment often involves loss of ability to hear consonants such as s, f, t, and z, even though vowels can be heard normally.

name: Cochlear degeneration
label: Cochlear degeneration
definition: Deterioration or loss of the tissues of the cochlea.

name: Calcification of the auricular cartilage
label: Calcification of the auricular cartilage
definition: Ossification affecting the external ear cartilage.

name: Hypoplastic nasal septum
label: Hypoplastic nasal septum
definition: Underdevelopment of the nasal septum.

name: Abnormal nasal morphology
label: Abnormal nasal morphology
definition: This is a category for overall abnormal morphology that may be replaced later with more exact descriptions.

name: Abnormality of the vertebral endplates
label: Abnormality of the vertebral endplates
definition: Any abnormality of the vertebral end plates, which are the top and bottom portions of the vertebral bodies that interface with the vertebral discs.

name: Abnormal sacrum morphology
label: Abnormal sacrum morphology
definition: An abnormality of the sacral bone.|The sacrum is the large, roughly triangular bone at the base of the verterbal column that is formed by fusion of the five sacral vertebrae S1 to S5.

name: Abnormality of the intervertebral disk
label: Abnormality of the intervertebral disk
definition: An abnormality of the intervertebral disk.|Any abnormality of the fibrocartilaginous structures that are located between adjacent vertebral bodies.

name: Abnormality of the Achilles tendon
label: Abnormality of the Achilles tendon
definition: An abnormality of the Achilles tendon.

name: Atrial fibrillation
label: Atrial fibrillation
definition: An atrial arrhythmia characterized by disorganized atrial activity without discrete P waves on the surface EKG, but instead by an undulating baseline or more sharply circumscribed atrial deflections of varying amplitude an frequency ranging from 350 to 600 per minute.|The ventricular response to atrial fibrillation is irregularly irregular because of the large number of atrial impulses that transit the atrioventricular node, making the ventricle partially refractory to further impulses. Atrial fibrillation can cause a number of manifestations including excessive ventricular response with angina pectoris or hypotension in susceptible individuals, syncope, systemic embolization, fatigue, or anxiety. These features should be coded separately.

name: obsolete Dilatation of the ascending aorta
label: obsolete Dilatation of the ascending aorta

name: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
label: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the abdominal aorta.

name: Aortic arch aneurysm
label: Aortic arch aneurysm
definition: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch.

name: obsolete Abnormalities of the peripheral arteries
label: obsolete Abnormalities of the peripheral arteries

name: Supraventricular arrhythmia
label: Supraventricular arrhythmia
definition: A type of arrhythmia that originates above the ventricles, whereby the electrical impulse propagates down the normal His Purkinje system similar to normal sinus rhythm.|Supraventricular arrhythmia includes atrial arrhythmias (atrial tachycardia, atrial flutter, atrial fibrillation), atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia, junctional ectopic tachycardia, atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (Wolf-Parkinson-White Syndrome), orthodromic or antidromic. Supraventricular arrhythmia is distinct from ventricular tachycardia, which originates in the ventricles.

name: Arterial tortuosity
label: Arterial tortuosity
definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries.

name: Elevated diastolic blood pressure
label: Elevated diastolic blood pressure
definition: Abnormal increase in diastolic blood pressure.|Normal diastolic blood pressure is less than 80 mmHg.

name: Abnormal cardiac atrium morphology
label: Abnormal cardiac atrium morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.

name: Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
label: Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
definition: An excessive concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.|The posterior vertebral scalloping sign appears on a lateral radiograph of the spine as an exaggeration of the normal concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies. Neurofibromatosis may be associated with marked scalloping of the posterior borders of the vertebral bodies resulting from intraspinal tumors.

name: Pericardial constriction
label: Pericardial constriction
definition: Compression of the heart caused by rigid, thickened, or fused pericardial membranes.

name: Right ventricular dilatation
label: Right ventricular dilatation
definition: Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle.

name: Absence of the pulmonary valve
label: Absence of the pulmonary valve
definition: Refers to the specific combination of defects with a severely dysplastic pulmonary valve and massively dilated branch pulmonary arteries.|The distinctive feature of APVS is the airway obstruction caused by tracheobronchial compression that results from massive dilatation of the main pulmonary artery (PA) and its first- and second-order branches. Consequential tracheomalacia and bronchomalacia determine the timing and severity of respiratory compromise, as well as the morbidity and mortality of these patients.

name: Abnormal T-wave
label: Abnormal T-wave
definition: An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles.

name: Mitral annular calcification
label: Mitral annular calcification
definition: Mitral annular calcification (MAC) results from progressive calcium deposition along and beneath the mitral valve annulus.|MAC is a common degenerative process involving the fibrous annulus of the mitral valve, and is generally an incidental finding associated with aging. This term applies if MAC occurs at a substantially younger age than usual.

name: Anomalous origin of right pulmonary artery from ascending aorta
label: Anomalous origin of right pulmonary artery from ascending aorta
definition: The right pulmonary artery originates from the ascending aorta in the presence of a pulmonary valve and main pulmonary artery.

name: Ventricular septal hypertrophy
label: Ventricular septal hypertrophy
definition: The dividing wall between left and right sides of the heart, thickens and bulges into the left ventricle.

name: Coronary artery stenosis
label: Coronary artery stenosis
definition: Abnormal narrowing of the coronary artery.

name: Cardiac valve calcification
label: Cardiac valve calcification
definition: Abnormal calcification of a cardiac valve.

name: Pulmonary valve defects
label: Pulmonary valve defects
definition: Any defect in the valve connecting the heart and the pulmonary artery.

name: Abnormal atrioventricular conduction
label: Abnormal atrioventricular conduction
definition: An impairment of the electrical continuity between the atria and ventricles.

name: Preductal coarctation of the aorta
label: Preductal coarctation of the aorta
definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized proximal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the preductal region of aortic arch.|Blood flow to the aorta distal to the coarctation may be dependent on a patent ductus arteriosus, and hence closure of the ductus arteriosus can lead to serious ischemia of the affected tissues.

name: Histiocytoid cardiomyopathy
label: Histiocytoid cardiomyopathy
definition: A type of cardiomyopathy characterized pathologically by hamartomatous lesions of cardiac Purkinje cells.|This HPO term intends to refer to the histological changes that characterize histiocytoid cardiomyopthy. The disease entity Histiocytoid cardiomyopathy is a rare arrhythmogenic disorder characterized by incessant ventricular tachycardia, cardiomegaly, and often sudden death by age 2 years.

name: Ventricular escape rhythm
label: Ventricular escape rhythm
definition: A ventircular escape rhythm occurs whenever higher-lever pacemakers in AV junction or sinus node fail to control ventricular activation. Escape rate is usually 20-40 bpm, often associated with broad QRS complexes (at least 120 ms).

name: Hypoplastic left atrium
label: Hypoplastic left atrium
definition: Underdeveloped, small left heart atrium

name: Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
label: Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
definition: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an symmetrical and concentric pattern of hypertrophy.

name: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
label: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
definition: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.|Pulmonary veins drain through abnormal connections to the right atrium.

name: Left ventricular dysfunction
label: Left ventricular dysfunction
definition: Inability of the left ventricle to perform its normal physiologic function. Failure is either due to an inability to contract the left ventricle or the inability to relax completely and fill with blood during diastole.

name: Dysplastic pulmonary valve
label: Dysplastic pulmonary valve
definition: A congenital malformation of the pulmonary valve characterized by leaflet deformation.

name: Shortened PR interval
label: Shortened PR interval
definition: Reduced time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.

name: Elevated right atrial pressure
label: Elevated right atrial pressure
definition: An abnormal increase in magnitude of the pressure in the right atrium.|Elevated mean right atrial pressure (RAP) can be measured by cardiac catheterization.

name: Complete heart block with broad QRS complexes
label: Complete heart block with broad QRS complexes
definition: A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at a relatively low part of the conduction system (below the atrioventricular node), which produces a wide QRS complex.

name: Left posterior fascicular block
label: Left posterior fascicular block
definition: Conduction block in the posterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.

name: Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis
label: Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis
definition: Subvalvular stenosis is caused by a diaphragm-like membrane. The stenosis is clinically manifested like any other form of aortic stenosis but is often associated with some aortic insufficiency.|An important feature in the differential diagnosis between valvular and subvalvular aortic stenosis is the fact that no ejection sound is present in the latter.

name: Dysplastic aortic valve
label: Dysplastic aortic valve
definition: A congenital malformation of the aortic valve characterized by leaflet deformation.

name: Premature arteriosclerosis
label: Premature arteriosclerosis
definition: Arteriosclerosis occurring at an age that is younger than usual.

name: Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes
label: Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes
definition: A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at the atrioventricular node, which produces a narrow QRS complex.

name: Tricuspid regurgitation
label: Tricuspid regurgitation
definition: Failure of the tricuspid valve to close sufficiently upon contraction of the right ventricle, causing blood to regurgitate (flow backward) into the right atrium.|This term should not be applied to Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve (see HP:0010316).

name: Premature coronary artery atherosclerosis
label: Premature coronary artery atherosclerosis
definition: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries before age of 45.

name: Bicuspid pulmonary valve
label: Bicuspid pulmonary valve
definition: The presence of a bicuspid pulmonary valve.|The pulmonary valve normally has three cusps (flaps), that is, it is normally tricuspid.

name: Pericardial lymphangiectasia
label: Pericardial lymphangiectasia
definition: An abnormal dilatation of lymph vessels in the pericardium.

name: Prolonged QTc interval
label: Prolonged QTc interval
definition: A longer than normal interval (corrected for heart rate) between the Q and T waves in the heart's cycle. Prolonged QTc can cause premature action potentials during late phase depolarizations thereby leading to ventricular arrhythmias and ventricular fibrillations.

name: Global systolic dysfunction
label: Global systolic dysfunction
definition: A reduced ejection fraction and an enlarged left ventricle chamber, the latter by an increased resistance to filling with increased filling pressures. Systolic dysfunction is clinically associated with left ventricular failure in the presence of marked cardiomegaly.

name: Flattened metatarsal heads
label: Flattened metatarsal heads
definition: Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metatarsal bones.|The metatarsal heads articulate with the proximal phalanges of the toes.

name: Generalized morning stiffness
label: Generalized morning stiffness
definition: A sensation of stiffness in the joints that occurs following waking up in the morning.

name: Stiff interphalangeal joints
label: Stiff interphalangeal joints
definition: Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

name: Aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
label: Aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
definition: Absence of the abdominal musculature.

name: Helicobacter pylori infection
label: Helicobacter pylori infection
definition: A recurrent infection of the GI tract with helicobacter pylori, a gram-negative, microaerophilic bacterium usually found in the stomach.|The bacterial pathogen Helicobacter pylori has co-evolved with humans and colonizes approximately half of the human population, but only causes overt gastric disease in a subset of infected hosts.

name: Spontaneous esophageal perforation
label: Spontaneous esophageal perforation
definition: The occurrence of the full-thickness tear (perforation) of the wall of the esophagus.|Esophageal perforation can lead to retained gastric contents, saliva, bile, and other substances entering the mediastinum, resulting in mediastinitis, which in turn may lead to sepsis.

name: Pancreatic pseudocyst
label: Pancreatic pseudocyst
definition: Cyst-like space not lined by epithelium and contained within the pancreas. Pancreatic pseudocysts are often associated with pancreatitis.

name: Gastric hypertrophy
label: Gastric hypertrophy
definition: Hypertrophy of the stomach.

name: Secretory diarrhea
label: Secretory diarrhea
definition: Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between ion and water secretion and absorption.

name: Intrahepatic bile duct cysts
label: Intrahepatic bile duct cysts
definition: The presence of cyst of the intrahepatic bile duct.

name: Hypoplastic colon
label: Hypoplastic colon
definition: Underdevelopment of the colon.

name: Anal mucosal leukoplakia
label: Anal mucosal leukoplakia
definition: Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.

name: Pancreatic calcification
label: Pancreatic calcification
definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition lesions in the pancreas.

name: Intestinal obstruction
label: Intestinal obstruction
definition: Blockage or impairment of the normal flow of the contents of the intestine towards the anal canal.

name: Frequent Giardia lamblia infestation
label: Frequent Giardia lamblia infestation
definition: Increased susceptibility to Giardia lamblia infection of the intestine, as manifested by a medical history of multiple episodes of Giardia lamblia intestinal infection.

name: Impaired mastication
label: Impaired mastication
definition: An abnormal reduction in the ability to masticate (chew), i.e., in the ability to crush and ground food in preparation for swallowing.|Chewing and swallowing are interrelated. The act of chewing plays a fundamental role in the process of swallowing food. Mastication prepares food for swallowing by breaking it into small particles. Accordingly, loss of teeth has been associated with swallowing difficulties. Chewing difficulties may be caused by loss of teeth, partial dentures, or by tooth pain. Swallowing difficulties, in contrast, are often characterized by difficulties swallowing liquids, reflux, throat spasms, choking on dry food, or dysphagia.

name: Anoperineal fistula
label: Anoperineal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula (abnormal tunnel) between the anal canal and the perineum.

name: Absence of intrinsic factor
label: Absence of intrinsic factor
definition: Absence of gastric intrinsic factor, which is normally produced by the parietal cells of the stomach, and is required for the absorption of vitamin B12.|This feature can be ascertained by immunoassay of gastric juices.

name: Bowel diverticulosis
label: Bowel diverticulosis
definition: The presence of multiple diverticula of the intestine.

name: Rectal abscess
label: Rectal abscess
definition: A collection of pus in the area of the rectum.

name: Intestinal edema
label: Intestinal edema
definition: Accumulation of cell free, noninflammatony fluid within the wall of the intestinal tract producing uniform thickening of the mucosal folds.|This finding can be observed upon abdominal radiography. The bowel lumen may be slightly dilated. Secondary to the fluid accumulation, there are anatomic and motor alterations in the intestine which are reflected in the roentgenogram.

name: Adenomatous colonic polyposis
label: Adenomatous colonic polyposis
definition: Presence of multiple adenomatous polyps in the colon.

name: Biliary tract obstruction
label: Biliary tract obstruction
definition: Obstruction affecting the biliary tree.

name: Chronic gastritis
label: Chronic gastritis
definition: A chronic form of gastritis.

name: Pancreatic dysplasia
label: Pancreatic dysplasia
definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the pancreas.|Dysplasia is defined in MPATH as a distortion or deficiency of the tissue or cellular architecture.

name: Hypoplasia of the gallbladder
label: Hypoplasia of the gallbladder
definition: The presence of a hypoplastic gallbladder.

name: Jejunal atresia
label: Jejunal atresia
definition: A developmental defect resulting in abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the jejunum.

name: Chronic calcifying pancreatitis
label: Chronic calcifying pancreatitis
definition: A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification.

name: Degenerative liver disease
label: Degenerative liver disease
definition: The presence of degenerative changes of the liver.

name: Total intestinal aganglionosis
label: Total intestinal aganglionosis
definition: A congenital defect characterized by the lack of ganglion cells in the entire intestine, i.e., the aganglionic segment comprises the entire large and small bowel.

name: Extrahepatic biliary duct atresia
label: Extrahepatic biliary duct atresia
definition: Atresia in the extrahepatic bile duct.

name: Partial abdominal muscle agenesis
label: Partial abdominal muscle agenesis
definition: Failure to form of portions of the abdominal musculature.

name: Intestinal hypoplasia
label: Intestinal hypoplasia
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the intestine.

name: Giant hypertrophic gastritis
label: Giant hypertrophic gastritis
definition: A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds.

name: Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
label: Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature
definition: Underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature.

name: Intrahepatic biliary atresia
label: Intrahepatic biliary atresia
definition: Atresia in the intrahepatic bile duct.

name: Absence of pectoralis minor muscle
label: Absence of pectoralis minor muscle
definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor.

name: Unilateral absence of pectoralis major muscle
label: Unilateral absence of pectoralis major muscle
definition: Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

name: Abnormal facility in opposing the shoulders
label: Abnormal facility in opposing the shoulders

name: Joint hemorrhage
label: Joint hemorrhage
definition: Hemorrhage occurring within a joint.

name: Gastritis
label: Gastritis
definition: The presence of inflammation of the gastric mucous membrane.

name: Abnormality of the gallbladder
label: Abnormality of the gallbladder
definition: An abnormality of the gallbladder.

name: Abnormality of the jejunum
label: Abnormality of the jejunum
definition: An abnormality of the jejunum, i.e., of the middle section of the small intestine.

name: Intestinal polyp
label: Intestinal polyp
definition: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

name: Premature delivery because of cervical insufficiency or membrane fragility
label: Premature delivery because of cervical insufficiency or membrane fragility

name: Spontaneous abortion
label: Spontaneous abortion
definition: A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 20th week of pregnancy.

name: Prominent nasolabial fold
label: Prominent nasolabial fold
definition: Exaggerated bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion, or commissure).

name: Absent nasal septal cartilage
label: Absent nasal septal cartilage
definition: Lack of the cartilage of the nasal septum.

name: Depressed nasal bridge
label: Depressed nasal bridge
definition: Posterior positioning of the nasal root in relation to the overall facial profile for age.|The adjective "depressed" here does not indicate an active process but a status. A depressed nasal bridge can occur irrespective of the width of the nasal bridge, and the width should be assessed independently. In infancy, the nasal bridge is relatively more posterior than in the older person. The term depressed nasal bridge should only be used when the bridge is more posterior than is typical for age and ethnic background.

name: Abnormality of the nares
label: Abnormality of the nares
definition: Abnormality of the nostril.

name: Intimal thickening in the coronary arteries
label: Intimal thickening in the coronary arteries

name: Arterial dissection
label: Arterial dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of an artery.

name: Pseudocoarctation of the aorta
label: Pseudocoarctation of the aorta
definition: Pseudocoarctation is a congenital anomaly of kinking, or buckling, of the aorta without a pressure gradient across the lesion. It is characterized by elongation and kinking of the aorta at the level of the ligamentum arteriosum.|Note that the ligamentum arteriosum, which develops from the ductus arteriosus, is attached to the superior surface of the pulmonary artery and the inferior surface of the aortic arch.

name: Premature occlusive vascular stenosis
label: Premature occlusive vascular stenosis
definition: Peripheral arterial stenosis with onset before the age of 50 years.

name: obsolete Atrioventricular canal defect with right ventricle aorta and pulmonary atresia
label: obsolete Atrioventricular canal defect with right ventricle aorta and pulmonary atresia

name: Persistent left superior vena cava
label: Persistent left superior vena cava
definition: A rare congenital vascular anomaly that results when the left superior cardinal vein caudal to the innominate vein fails to regress.

name: Carotid artery tortuosity
label: Carotid artery tortuosity
definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the carotid arteries.

name: Aortic arch calcification
label: Aortic arch calcification
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the arch of aorta.

name: Cerebral venous thrombosis
label: Cerebral venous thrombosis
definition: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

name: Capillary hemangioma
label: Capillary hemangioma
definition: The presence of a capillary hemangioma, which are hemangiomas with small endothelial spaces.

name: Large vessel vasculitis
label: Large vessel vasculitis
definition: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) affecting large arteries such as the aorta and branches of the aorta.

name: Pulmonary aterial intimal fibrosis
label: Pulmonary aterial intimal fibrosis
definition: Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries in the pulmonary circulation.|Some causes of intimal fibrosis are hypertension, intimal fibroplasia, arterial atheroma, and CADASIL syndrome.

name: Arterial fibromuscular dysplasia
label: Arterial fibromuscular dysplasia
definition: An arterial lesion that is characterized by either intimal fibroplasia, with neointimal lesions of cells and matrix deposition, or medial fibroplasia, in which there is loss of smooth muscle cells and increased deposition of collagen and proteoglycans in the medial layer.|Fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD) is distinct from atherosclerotic lesions in that FMD lesions do not contain inflammatory cells or lipids. Instead, the pathology of FMD. FMD can result in arterial stenosis or occlusion, and less commonly, arterial dissection or aneurysm formation. FMD can affect almost any artery but most commonly affects the renal arteries, presenting as hypertension, and the carotid and vertebral arteries, leading to ischemic stroke, transient ischemic attacks, headaches, and pulsatile tinnitus.

name: Anomalous branches of internal carotid artery
label: Anomalous branches of internal carotid artery

name: Increased pulmonary vascular resistance
label: Increased pulmonary vascular resistance
definition: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) more than 3 wood units, as defined by the current definition of pulmonary hypertension. 95% of individuals have a PVR of less than 2.4 wood units.

name: Cerebral vasculitis
label: Cerebral vasculitis
definition: Inflammation of the blood vessels within the brain.

name: Mandibulofacial dysostosis
label: Mandibulofacial dysostosis
definition: A type of craniofacial dysostosis associated with abnormalities of the external ears, mirognathia, macrostomia, coloboma of the lower eyelid, and cleft palate. This is a bundled term that is left in the HPO now for convenience with legacy annotations but should not be used for new annotations.

name: Hemifacial hypertrophy
label: Hemifacial hypertrophy
definition: Unilateral overgrowth of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin.

name: Disturbance of facial expression
label: Disturbance of facial expression
definition: An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.

name: Extension of hair growth on temples to lateral eyebrow
label: Extension of hair growth on temples to lateral eyebrow
definition: A pattern of hair growth in which there is hair extending from the temples to the lateral eyebrows.

name: Hypoplastic philtrum
label: Hypoplastic philtrum
definition: Underdevelopment of the philtrum.

name: Progeroid facial appearance
label: Progeroid facial appearance
definition: A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance.

name: Recurrent mandibular subluxations
label: Recurrent mandibular subluxations
definition: Recurrent partial dislocations of the mandible.

name: Sparse lateral eyebrow
label: Sparse lateral eyebrow
definition: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of lateral eyebrow hairs.|Abnormal sparseness of the eyebrows laterally.

name: Abnormality of complement system
label: Abnormality of complement system
definition: An abnormality of the complement system.|The complement system represents a family of over 25 serum proteins and cell surface receptors that act in a cascade manner leading to innate functions such as inflammation and enhancement of adaptive immunity. Three general pathways, i.e. classical, lectin and alternative, activate the complement system.

name: Autonomic bladder dysfunction
label: Autonomic bladder dysfunction
definition: Abnormal bladder function (increased urge or frequency of urination or urge incontinence) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Hypoplasia of the bladder
label: Hypoplasia of the bladder
definition: Underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.

name: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
label: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches.

name: Abnormal vena cava morphology
label: Abnormal vena cava morphology
definition: An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

name: Inspiratory stridor
label: Inspiratory stridor
definition: Inspiratory stridor is a high pitched sound upon inspiration that is generally related to laryngeal abnormalities.

name: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis
label: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis
definition: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.

name: Severe T-cell immunodeficiency
label: Severe T-cell immunodeficiency
definition: A primary immune deficiency that is characterized by defects or deficiencies of T-lymphocytes that causes specific susceptibility to intracellular micro-organisms.|Several diseases are classified as severe T cell immunodeficiencies: severe combined immunodeficiency syndrome (SCID), reticular dysgenesis, thymic dysplasia (Nezelof syndrome), combined immunodeficiency disease (CID), and Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome (WAS).

name: Recurrent herpes
label: Recurrent herpes
definition: Increased susceptibility to herpesvirus, as manifested by recurrent episodes of herpesvirus.

name: Lack of T cell function
label: Lack of T cell function
definition: Complete inability of T cells to perform their functions in cell-mediated immunity.

name: Decreased serum complement factor I
label: Decreased serum complement factor I
definition: A reduced level of the complement component Factor I in circulation.

name: Defective B cell differentiation
label: Defective B cell differentiation
definition: Reduced functionality of the process in which a precursor cell type acquires the specialized features of a B cell. A B cell is a lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive and capable of B cell mediated immunity.

name: Aplasia of the thymus
label: Aplasia of the thymus
definition: Absence of the thymus. This feature may be appreciated by the lack of a thymic shadow upon radiographic examination.

name: Susceptibility to chickenpox
label: Susceptibility to chickenpox
definition: Increased susceptibility to chicken pox, as manifested by recurrent episodes of chicken pox.

name: Humoral immunodeficiency
label: Humoral immunodeficiency
definition: A general term referring to a defect in immunity resulting from impaired antibody production.|If possible it is preferable to use a precise description of the observed manifestations leading to the inference of humoral immunodeficiency.

name: Severe B lymphocytopenia
label: Severe B lymphocytopenia
definition: A severe form of B lymphocytopenia in which the count of B cells is very low or absent.

name: Recurrent streptococcus pneumoniae infections
label: Recurrent streptococcus pneumoniae infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to streptococcus pneumoniae infections as manifested by a history of recurrent infections by streptococcus pneumoniae.

name: Abnormality of humoral immunity
label: Abnormality of humoral immunity
definition: An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.

name: Decreased serum complement factor H
label: Decreased serum complement factor H
definition: A reduced level of the complement component Factor H in circulation.

name: Abnormality of B cell physiology
label: Abnormality of B cell physiology
definition: An abnormality of the physiological functioning of B cells.|This term refers to any abnormality of the B cells, which play a role in the humoral immune response. The main functions of B cells are to produce antibodies, to perform the role of antigen presenting cells, and to develop into memory cells.

name: Cellular immunodeficiency
label: Cellular immunodeficiency
definition: An immunodeficiency characterized by defective cell-mediated immunity or humoral immunity.

name: Recurrent Haemophilus influenzae infections
label: Recurrent Haemophilus influenzae infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to Haemophilus influenzae infections as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by Haemophilus influenzae.

name: Recurrent meningococcal disease
label: Recurrent meningococcal disease
definition: Recurrent infections by Neisseria meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis), which is also known as meningococcus.

name: Defective B cell activation
label: Defective B cell activation
definition: A reduced ability of a B cell to become activated, i.e., the change in morphology and behavior of

name: Recurrent protozoan infections
label: Recurrent protozoan infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to protozoan infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of protozoan infection.

name: Combined immunodeficiency
label: Combined immunodeficiency
definition: A group of phenotypically heterogeneous genetic disorders characterized by profound deficiencies of T- and B-cell function, which predispose the patients to both infectious and noninfectious complications.

name: Depletion of components of the alternative complement pathway
label: Depletion of components of the alternative complement pathway
definition: An abnormal reduction in the components of the alternative complement pathway, such as the C3 protein or its cleavage products.

name: Recurrent opportunistic infections
label: Recurrent opportunistic infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to opportunistic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by opportunistic agents, i.e., by microorganisms that do not usually cause disease in a healthy host, but are able to infect a host with a compromised immune system.

name: Susceptibility to coronavirus 229e
label: Susceptibility to coronavirus 229e
definition: Increased susceptibility to coronavirus 229e, as manifested by recurrent episodes of coronavirus 229e.

name: Reduction of neutrophil motility
label: Reduction of neutrophil motility
definition: An abnormal reduction of the cell motility of neutrophils.

name: Recurrent candida infections
label: Recurrent candida infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to candida infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of candida infections.

name: Decrease in T cell count
label: Decrease in T cell count
definition: An abnormally low count of T cells.

name: Increased B cell count
label: Increased B cell count
definition: An abnormal increase from the normal count of B cells.

name: Recurrent bacterial skin infections
label: Recurrent bacterial skin infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections of the skin, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infectious dermatitis.|Infectious dermatitis may manifest as impetigo, multiple purulent blisters, erythema, lymphadenopathy near the site of infection.

name: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive T cells
label: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive T cells
definition: A decreased proportion of circulating CD4-positive helper T cells relative to total T cell count.

name: obsolete Markedly reduced T cell function
label: obsolete Markedly reduced T cell function

name: Chronic intestinal candidiasis
label: Chronic intestinal candidiasis
definition: Persistent overgrowth of Candida albicans in the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Increased alpha-globulin
label: Increased alpha-globulin
definition: An abnormally increased level of circulationg alpha-globulin. Alpha globulins are a group of serum proteins defined by their mobility on serum electrophoresis. The alpha1-protein fraction is comprised of alpha1-antitrypsin, thyroid-binding globulin, and transcortin. Ceruloplasmin, alpha2-macroglobulin, and haptoglobin contribute to the alpha2-protein band. The alpha2 component is increased as an acute-phase reactant.

name: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive T cells
label: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive T cells
definition: A decreased proportion of circulating CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells relative to total number of T cells.

name: Decreased serum complement factor B
label: Decreased serum complement factor B
definition: A reduced level of the complement component factor B in circulation.

name: Decreased T cell activation
label: Decreased T cell activation
definition: Decreased or impaired activation of T cells in response to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

name: Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections
label: Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to infection by gram-negative bacteria, as manifested by a medical history of repeated or frequent infections by these agents.|Gram-negative bacteria have a unique outer membrane, a thinner layer of peptidoglycan compared to gram-positive bacteria, and a periplasmic space between the cell wall and the membrane.

name: Decreased serum complement C3
label: Decreased serum complement C3
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C3 in circulation.

name: Absence of CD8-positive T cells
label: Absence of CD8-positive T cells
definition: Lack of detectible CD8-positive T cells

name: Dysfunctional alternative complement pathway
label: Dysfunctional alternative complement pathway
definition: An abnormality of the functioning of any aspect of the alternative complement pathway.

name: Absent specific antibody response
label: Absent specific antibody response
definition: Absence of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism.

name: Recurrent sinopulmonary infections
label: Recurrent sinopulmonary infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to infections involving both the paranasal sinuses and the lungs, as manifested by a history of recurrent sinopulmonary infections.

name: Recurrent systemic pyogenic infections
label: Recurrent systemic pyogenic infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to systemic pyogenic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of systemic pyogenic infections.

name: Recurrent Neisserial infections
label: Recurrent Neisserial infections
definition: Recurrent infections by bacteria of the genus Neisseria, including N. meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis).

name: Transient hypogammaglobulinemia of infancy
label: Transient hypogammaglobulinemia of infancy
definition: At birth, newborns are endowed with maternal antibodies. IgG production normally begins at the age of two months. A delay in recovery from this physiological hypogammaglobulinemia between the 3rd and the 6th month of life, and of recovery period between 18 and 36 months defines transient newborn hypogammaglobulinemia.

name: Impaired T cell function
label: Impaired T cell function
definition: Abnormally reduced ability of T cells to perform their functions in cell-mediated immunity.

name: Recurrent infections in infancy and early childhood
label: Recurrent infections in infancy and early childhood
definition: Recurrent infections at an early age with improvement in later childhood.

name: Maxillozygomatic hypoplasia
label: Maxillozygomatic hypoplasia
definition: Hypoplasia of the maxillozygomatic complex.

name: Sclerotic cranial sutures
label: Sclerotic cranial sutures
definition: An increased density in the cranial sutures following obliteration.

name: Widely patent coronal suture
label: Widely patent coronal suture
definition: The presence of a coronal suture (the cranial suture that separates the frontal and parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.

name: Obtuse angle of mandible
label: Obtuse angle of mandible
definition: Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal.|See PMID:17213440 Figure 1G for an example of an obtuse mandibular angle.

name: Calvarial osteosclerosis
label: Calvarial osteosclerosis
definition: An increase in bone density affecting the calvaria (roof of the skull).

name: Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses
label: Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses
definition: Aplasia or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinuses.

name: Absent ethmoidal sinuses
label: Absent ethmoidal sinuses
definition: Lack (aplasia) of the ethmoidal sinus.

name: Premature closure of fontanelles
label: Premature closure of fontanelles
definition: Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.

name: Calcification of falx cerebri
label: Calcification of falx cerebri
definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.

name: Craniofacial osteosclerosis
label: Craniofacial osteosclerosis
definition: Abnormally increased density of craniofacial bone tissue.

name: Facial hyperostosis
label: Facial hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth (overgrowth) of the facial bones, that is of the facial skeleton.

name: Hypoplasia of the frontal bone
label: Hypoplasia of the frontal bone
definition: Underdevelopment of the frontal bone.

name: Flat occiput
label: Flat occiput
definition: Reduced convexity of the occiput (posterior part of skull).|Reduced convexity of the occiput gives an appearance of flattening. There are no objective measures for convexity of the occiput, and evaluation depends heavily on the experience of the observer. This finding may or may not be accompanied by Brachycephaly (which should be coded separately), and may be observed more frequently when an infant is placed to sleep on his/her back. Occipital plagiocephaly can result from fusion or sclerosis of the lambdoid suture. If unilateral, this is accompanied by unilateral occipital flattening and bulging of the ispilateral frontal bone.

name: Fusion of middle ear ossicles
label: Fusion of middle ear ossicles
definition: Bony fusion of malleus, incus, and stapes.

name: Decreased calvarial ossification
label: Decreased calvarial ossification
definition: Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).

name: Widely patent sagittal suture
label: Widely patent sagittal suture
definition: The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.

name: Progressive sclerosis of skull base
label: Progressive sclerosis of skull base
definition: Progressively increasing bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.

name: Decreased circulating total IgE
label: Decreased circulating total IgE
definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in blood.

name: Abnormality of the alternative complement pathway
label: Abnormality of the alternative complement pathway
definition: A deviation in any aspect of the alternative complement pathway.|The alternative complement pathway is one of three complement pathways, which is an innate component of the immune system's natural defense against infections. The alternative complement pathway has three unique components, factor B, factor D, and properdin.

name: Abnormal epiglottis morphology
label: Abnormal epiglottis morphology
definition: An abnormality of the epiglottis.

name: Postnatal microcephaly
label: Postnatal microcephaly
definition: Head circumference which falls below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender because of insufficient head growth after birth.

name: Small fontanelle
label: Small fontanelle
definition: A fontanelle that is small for age.

name: Prominent metopic ridge
label: Prominent metopic ridge
