definition: Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead.|The ridge may extend from the hairline to the glabella or may be partial. The frontal suture of the skull is a dense connective tissue structure that divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and usually undergoes closure by the age of six years. A persistent frontal suture is known as a metopic suture or sutura frontalis persistens. This can lead to a ridged appearance of the forehead.

name: Postnatal macrocephaly
label: Postnatal macrocephaly
definition: The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly).

name: Metopic suture patent to nasal root
label: Metopic suture patent to nasal root
definition: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.|This feature is a characteristic of Schinzel-Giedion midface retraction syndrome.

name: Midline skin dimples over anterior/posterior fontanelles
label: Midline skin dimples over anterior/posterior fontanelles

name: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
label: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
definition: A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.

name: Hemoglobin Barts
label: Hemoglobin Barts
definition: Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues.|Hb Bart is normally not present in adult blood. It makes up about 85-90 percent of hemoglobin in Hb Bart hydrops fetalis syndrome, and about 2-5 percent in HbH disease.

name: Monoclonal immunoglobulin M proteinemia
label: Monoclonal immunoglobulin M proteinemia
definition: Presence of a monoclonal immunoglobulin M protein in the serum.|This is a characteristic feature of Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia (WM), which is defined as a B-cell lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma, characterized by monoclonal immunoglobulin M protein in the serum and infiltration of bone marrow with lymphoplasmacytic cells.

name: Transient erythroblastopenia
label: Transient erythroblastopenia
definition: A transient reduction in the number of erythroblasts in the circulation.|An erythroblast, the immediate precursor of a normal erythrocyte which, still retains a cell nucleus.

name: Heinz body anemia
label: Heinz body anemia
definition: Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells.

name: Impaired neutrophil killing of staphylococci
label: Impaired neutrophil killing of staphylococci
definition: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill the gram-positive bacteria, staphylococcus, which is commonly known as staph.

name: Increased megakaryocyte count
label: Increased megakaryocyte count
definition: Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.

name: T-cell lymphoma/leukemia
label: T-cell lymphoma/leukemia
definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma in which cancerous T-cells may present in the blood (leukemia), lymph nodes (lymphoma), skin or in multiple areas.|T-cell lymphoma/leukemia is linked to infection by the human T-cell lymphotropic virus 1 (HTLV-1).

name: Increased mean corpuscular volume
label: Increased mean corpuscular volume
definition: Larger than normal size of erythrocytes.|Macrocytosis refers to a mean cell volume (MCV) greater than 100 fL. If macrocytosis is an isolated abnormality, the amount of hemoglobin in the cell increases proportionately, so the mean cell hemoglobin concentration (MCHC) remains within normal limits.

name: Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation
label: Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation
definition: A chronic form of disseminated intravascular coagulation in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.

name: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
label: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
definition: Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.|DIC is a complex syndrome in which there is pathological generation of thrombin and diffuse intravascular clot formation. DIC may occur as acute decompensated or chronic compensated form. In acute decompensated DIC, there is a sudden massive exposure of tissue factor over a brief time period; Intravascular coagulation can also compromise the blood supply to organs and, in conjunction with hemodynamic and metabolic derangements, may contribute to the failure of multiple organs. At the same time, the use and subsequent depletion of platelets and coagulation proteins resulting from the ongoing coagulation may induce severe bleeding. Chronic DIC, also known as compensated DIC, results from a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus. Under such conditions, destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.

name: Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia
label: Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia
definition: A type of sideroblastic anemia that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment.

name: Lymphoid leukemia
label: Lymphoid leukemia
definition: A malignant lymphocytic neoplasm of B-cell or T-cell lineage involving primarily the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. This category includes precursor or acute lymphoblastic leukemias and chronic leukemias.

name: Reduced kininogen activity
label: Reduced kininogen activity
definition: Reduction in the amount of kininogen, which functions as a cofactor in the contact phase of the intrinsic blood coagulation cascade.|Kininogen is cleaved into the following 6 chains: 1) Kininogen-1 heavy chain; 2) T-kinin; 3) Bradykinin; 4) Lysyl-bradykinin; 5) Kininogen-1 light chain; and 6) Low molecular weight growth-promoting factor.

name: Bone marrow hypocellularity
label: Bone marrow hypocellularity
definition: A reduced number of hematopoietic cells present in the bone marrow relative to marrow fat.

name: Biphenotypic acute leukemia
label: Biphenotypic acute leukemia
definition: A type of actue leukemia with features characteristic of both the myeloid and lymphoid lineages. These leukemias are for this reason are designated mixed-lineage, hybrid or biphenotypic acute leukemias.

name: Transient myeloproliferative syndrome
label: Transient myeloproliferative syndrome
definition: A unique clonal neoplastic disorder that is linked to trisomy 21, is restricted to neonatal period, and spontaneously regresses. It often has characteristics of megakaryocytic lineage and is associated with GATA1 mutations in myeloblasts.

name: Exercise-induced hemolysis
label: Exercise-induced hemolysis
definition: A form of hemolytic anemia that can be triggered by exertion.

name: Decreased mean platelet volume
label: Decreased mean platelet volume
definition: Average platelet volume below the lower limit of the normal reference interval.|Mean platelet volume (MPV) is a measure of the average size of platelets, with a typical reference range of 7.5 to 11.5 femtoliters (fL).

name: T cell chronic lymphocytic lymphoma/leukemia
label: T cell chronic lymphocytic lymphoma/leukemia
definition: A form of lymphoid leukemia or lymphoma in which too many T-cell lymphoblasts are found in the blood, bone marrow, and tissues. Leukemia or lymphoma classification depends on which feature is more prominent.

name: Red blood cell keratocytosis
label: Red blood cell keratocytosis
definition: A form of poikilocytosis in which the abnormally shaped erythrocytes have notches that results in projections that look like horns.|Kerato- is derived from the Greek word for horn.

name: Congenital agranulocytosis
label: Congenital agranulocytosis
definition: Congenital onset of a marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.

name: Prolonged whole-blood clotting time
label: Prolonged whole-blood clotting time
definition: An abnormal prolongation (delay) in the time required by whole blood to produce a visible clot.

name: Reduced protein C activity
label: Reduced protein C activity
definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.|Protein C can function as an anticoagulant by irreversibly proteolytically inactivating Factor Va and Factor VIIIa. Therefore, a defect in protein C is associated with an increased risk of thrombosis.

name: Myeloproliferative disorder
label: Myeloproliferative disorder
definition: Proliferation (excess production) of hemopoietically active tissue or of tissue which has embryonic hemopoietic potential.|There are four main myeloproliferative disroders, 1) chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML); 2) Polycythemia vera; 3) Essential thrombocytosis; and 4) Myelofibrosis.

name: Megakaryocytopenia
label: Megakaryocytopenia
definition: A reduced count of megakaryocytes.|Megakaryocytes are giant cells in the bone marrow. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes.

name: obsolete Congenital neutropenia
label: obsolete Congenital neutropenia
definition: A form of neutropenia with congenital onset.|This term was obsoleted - for annotation of congenital neutropenia, please use the class HP_0001875 Neutropenia and the Modifier Congenital Onset.

name: Chronic lymphatic leukemia
label: Chronic lymphatic leukemia
definition: A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.

name: Abnormality of the metopic suture
label: Abnormality of the metopic suture
definition: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a "metopic suture".

name: Abnormality of the zygomatic arch
label: Abnormality of the zygomatic arch
definition: An abnormality of the zygomatic arch, also known as the cheek bone.|The zygomatic arch is formed by the zygomatic process of temporal bone and the temporal process of the zygomatic bone.

name: Chronic leukemia
label: Chronic leukemia
definition: A slowly progressing leukemia characterized by a clonal (malignant) proliferation of maturing and mature myeloid cells or mature lymphocytes. When the clonal cellular population is composed of myeloid cells, the process is called chronic myelogenous leukemia. When the clonal cellular population is composed of lymphocytes, it is classified as chronic lymphocytic leukemia, hairy cell leukemia, or T-cell large granular lymphocyte leukemia.

name: Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis
label: Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis
definition: Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia.|While imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis can be inferred from other findings including those of hemoglobin electrophoresis, the determination of this feature requires investigation of hemoglobin synthesis in vitro, e.g., by incubation of washed peripheral blood erythrocytes and bone marrow cells with radioactively labeled leucine followed by column chromatography.

name: Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
label: Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
definition: An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow.

name: Multiple renal cysts
label: Multiple renal cysts
definition: The presence of many cysts in the kidney.

name: Decreased numbers of nephrons
label: Decreased numbers of nephrons
definition: A reduction in the count of nephrons per kidney.

name: Absence of renal corticomedullary differentiation
label: Absence of renal corticomedullary differentiation
definition: A lack of differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.

name: Reduced renal corticomedullary differentiation
label: Reduced renal corticomedullary differentiation
definition: Reduced differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.

name: Renal magnesium wasting
label: Renal magnesium wasting
definition: High urine magnesium in the presence of hypomagnesemia.

name: Non-acidotic proximal tubulopathy
label: Non-acidotic proximal tubulopathy
definition: A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption without bicarbonate loss.

name: Tubulointerstitial fibrosis
label: Tubulointerstitial fibrosis
definition: A progressive detrimental connective tissue deposition (fibrosis) on the kidney parenchyma involving the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.|This finding is usually shown by renal biopsy. Fibrosis involves an excess accumulation of extracellular matrix and usually results in loss of function when normal tissue is replaced with scar tissue. Tubulointerstitial renal fibrosis, characterized as a progressive detrimental connective tissue deposition on the kidney parenchyma, appears to be a harmful process leading inevitably to renal function deterioration, independently of the primary renal disease which causes the original kidney injury. Epithelial to Mesenchymal Transition (EMT) of tubular epithelial cells which are transformed to mesenchymal fibroblasts migrating to adjacent interstitial parenchyma constitutes the principal mechanism of renal fibrosis along with local and circulating cells. (PMID:20011086)

name: Impaired reabsorption of chloride
label: Impaired reabsorption of chloride
definition: Any impairment of reabsorption of chloride by the kidney in order to not lose too much chloride in the urine.

name: Duplication of renal pelvis
label: Duplication of renal pelvis
definition: A duplication of the renal pelvis.

name: Tubular basement membrane disintegration
label: Tubular basement membrane disintegration
definition: DIsruption and breaking up of the basement membrane of the tubules of the kidney.|Throughout the rest of the nephron, tubule epithelial cells are attached to the tubular basement membrane that overlies the subjacent interstitial connective tissue. The disruption of cell-basement membrane adhesion results in loss of cell orientation, abnormal cell function, and can lead to tissue destruction.

name: Renal cell carcinoma
label: Renal cell carcinoma
definition: A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule.|Renal cell carcinoma (also known as hypernephroma) is the most common form of kidney cancer arising from the proximal renal tubule. The tissue of origin for renal cell carcinoma is the proximal renal tubular epithelium. Renal cell carcinoma can be classified as 1) clear cell carcinoma, 2) papillary carcinoma, 3) chromophobe renal carcinoma, and 4) collecting duct carcinoma.

name: Patchy palmoplantar keratoderma
label: Patchy palmoplantar keratoderma
definition: A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in which only certain areas of the palms and soles are affected.|Patchy palmoplantar keratoderma may develop at sites of recurrent friction.

name: Giant melanosomes in melanocytes
label: Giant melanosomes in melanocytes
definition: The presence of large spherical melanosomes (1 to 6 micrometer in diameter) in the cytoplasm of melanocytes.|Giant melanosomes can be seen in cafe-au-lait spots and other melanocytic disorders. Giant melanosome and giant melanosome are synonymous. Macromelanosomes can be detected by electron microscopy of the skin.

name: Macular hypopigmented whorls, streaks, and patches
label: Macular hypopigmented whorls, streaks, and patches

name: Congenital alopecia totalis
label: Congenital alopecia totalis
definition: Loss of all scalp hair with congenital onset.

name: Facial telangiectasia in butterfly midface distribution
label: Facial telangiectasia in butterfly midface distribution
definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin in a butterfly midface distribution.

name: Congenital giant melanocytic nevus
label: Congenital giant melanocytic nevus
definition: The giant congenital nevus is greater than 8 cm in size, pigmented and often hairy. A giant congenital nevus is smaller in infants and children, but it usually continues to grow with the child.|Between 4% and 6% of these lesions will develop into a malignant melanoma.

name: Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins
label: Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins
definition: Large hypermelanotic macules with jagged borders.|This type of lesionk is observed in McCune Albright syndrome. The cafe-au-lait macules are larger than those seen in neurofibromatosis, and have more irregular borders. The borders of these macules have been compared to the coast of Maine, whereas the cafe-au-lait spots in neurofibromatosis type 1 have been compared to the coast of California.

name: Bilobate gallbladder
label: Bilobate gallbladder
definition: The presence of a bilobed gallbladder, related to a duplication of the gallbladder primordium.|During the fifth or early sixth embryonic week, occasionally, the gallbladder primordium bifurcates and results in duplication of gallbladder. Duplication results from a split primordium whilst a true accessory gallbladder results from an extra primordium. There are no specific symptoms or signs associated with multiple gallbladders.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the femur
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the femur
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the femur.

name: Accelerated skeletal maturation
label: Accelerated skeletal maturation
definition: An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

name: Thoracolumbar kyphosis
label: Thoracolumbar kyphosis
definition: Hyperconvexity of the thoracolumbar spine producing a rounded or humped appearance.

name: Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
label: Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
definition: The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Broad long bones
label: Broad long bones
definition: Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately.

name: Absent ossification of calvaria
label: Absent ossification of calvaria
definition: Absent ossification of the calvaria (vault of the skull).

name: Osteoporosis of vertebrae
label: Osteoporosis of vertebrae
definition: Osteoporosis affecting predominantly the vertebrae.

name: Posterior fusion of lumbosacral vertebrae
label: Posterior fusion of lumbosacral vertebrae
definition: Bony fusion of the posterior part of the L5 vertebral body with the sacrum.

name: Type D brachydactyly
label: Type D brachydactyly
definition: This type of brachydactyly is characterized by short and broad terminal phalanges of the thumbs and big toes.

name: Decreased anterioposterior diameter of lumbar vertebral bodies
label: Decreased anterioposterior diameter of lumbar vertebral bodies

name: Hyperextensible hand joints
label: Hyperextensible hand joints
definition: The ability of the joints of the hand to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Short 3rd toe
label: Short 3rd toe
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the third toe.

name: Intervertebral disk calcification
label: Intervertebral disk calcification
definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition of the intervertebral disk.

name: Bilateral ulnar hypoplasia
label: Bilateral ulnar hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the ulna on both sides.|May be a symmetric finding.

name: Cutaneous syndactyly between fingers 2 and 5
label: Cutaneous syndactyly between fingers 2 and 5
definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the second to the fifth fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.

name: Cortical sclerosis
label: Cortical sclerosis
definition: Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity.

name: Moderate generalized osteoporosis
label: Moderate generalized osteoporosis
definition: Moderate osteoporosis.

name: Multiple digital exostoses
label: Multiple digital exostoses
definition: Multiple exostoses originating in the fingers and toes.|This feature is characteristic of metachondromatosis (MIM:156250).

name: Positional foot deformity
label: Positional foot deformity
definition: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the muscle and soft tissue. In contrast if the bones of the foot are affected the term structural foot deformity applies.

name: Salmonella osteomyelitis
label: Salmonella osteomyelitis
definition: Osteomyelitis caused by infection with the bacteria, salmonella.

name: Massively thickened long bone cortices
label: Massively thickened long bone cortices
definition: Extreme thickening of the cortex of long bones.

name: Os odontoideum
label: Os odontoideum
definition: Separation of the odontoid process from the body of the axis.|With os odontoideum, the caudal fragment of the odontoid process may provide deficient stability for the atlantoaxial joint and lead to subsequent instability or dislocation and neurological deficits.

name: Bilateral intracranial calcifications
label: Bilateral intracranial calcifications
definition: Deposition of calcium salts on both sides of the brain.

name: Dupuytren contracture
label: Dupuytren contracture
definition: An abnormality of the hand resulting from contracture of the palmar fascia with a fixed flexion deformity of the metacarpophalangeal (MCP) joints and the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints.|A Dupuytren contracture usually affects the fourth and fifth digits (the ring and small fingers). Affected persons are not able to extend the 4th and 5th fingers.

name: Tongue-like lumbar vertebral deformities
label: Tongue-like lumbar vertebral deformities
definition: A tongue-like protusion from the anterior aspect of lumbar vertebral bodies.

name: Distal arthrogryposis
label: Distal arthrogryposis
definition: A form of arthrogryposis primarily affecting the hands and the feet.

name: Patchy osteosclerosis
label: Patchy osteosclerosis
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Dysplastic distal thumb phalanges with a central hole
label: Dysplastic distal thumb phalanges with a central hole

name: Joint hyperflexibility
label: Joint hyperflexibility
definition: Increased mobility and flexibility in the joint due to the tension in tissues such as ligaments and muscles.

name: Partial fusion of proximal row of carpal bones
label: Partial fusion of proximal row of carpal bones

name: Postaxial polydactyly type A
label: Postaxial polydactyly type A
definition: Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand with a complete extra finger and extra metacarpal.

name: Increased bone density with cystic changes
label: Increased bone density with cystic changes

name: Bilateral triphalangeal thumbs
label: Bilateral triphalangeal thumbs
definition: A bilateral form of triphalangeal thumb.

name: Shortening of all metacarpals
label: Shortening of all metacarpals
definition: Abnormal reduction in length of all metacarpal bones.

name: Hyperextensible thumb
label: Hyperextensible thumb
definition: The ability of the thumb joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Nonopposable triphalangeal thumb
label: Nonopposable triphalangeal thumb
definition: A form of triphalangeal thumb that cannot be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

name: Cortical irregularity
label: Cortical irregularity
definition: An abnormal irregularity of cortical bone.

name: Spinal stenosis with reduced interpedicular distance
label: Spinal stenosis with reduced interpedicular distance
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal related to a reduction in the interpedicular distance (i.e., the distance measured between the pedicles on frontal [coronal] imaging).|The pedicles are two short, thick processes that connect the body of the vertebrae to the arch.

name: Short tibia
label: Short tibia
definition: Underdevelopment (reduced size) of the tibia.

name: Posterior subluxation of radial head
label: Posterior subluxation of radial head
definition: Partial dislocation of the head of the radius in the posterior direction.

name: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
label: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
definition: Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature.|In medical parlance, this is often referred to as Legg Calve Perthes disease. Here, the name 'Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis' is preferred to emphasize that the term refers to a phenotypic feature rather than a disease entity. Avascular necrosis of the femoral head may result in pain in the hip, limp, stiffness and reduced range of motion, and some degree of atrophy of the affected leg. The phrase Legg Perthes syndrome or Legg Calve Perthes disease is also used to refer to a number of diseases, including the idiopathic form and a form that is related to mutation in the COL2A1 gene (MIM 150600). Legg-Calve-Perthes disease usually occurs in boys 4 to 10 years old, and is clinically characterized by limping, hip stiffness, limited range of motion, and can result in restriction of growth of the affected leg and wasting of the muscles of the upper thigh.

name: obsolete Generalized osteoporosis with pathologic fractures
label: obsolete Generalized osteoporosis with pathologic fractures

name: Osteosclerosis of the base of the skull
label: Osteosclerosis of the base of the skull
definition: An increase in bone density affecting the basicranium (base of the skull).|Bundled term. Consider obsoleting it and splitting of osteosclerosis of base of skull.

name: Contractures of the joints of the lower limbs
label: Contractures of the joints of the lower limbs

name: Neonatal epiphyseal stippling
label: Neonatal epiphyseal stippling
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses during the neonatal period.

name: Basilar impression
label: Basilar impression
definition: Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum.

name: Small flat posterior fossa
label: Small flat posterior fossa
definition: An abnormally small and flat configuration of the posterior cranial fossa.

name: 2-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly
label: 2-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly
definition: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 2, 3, and 4.

name: Fifth finger distal phalanx clinodactyly
label: Fifth finger distal phalanx clinodactyly
definition: Bending or curvature of the distal phalanx of little finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tibia
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tibia
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tibia.

name: Short forearm
label: Short forearm
definition: Underdevelopment of both forearm bones, the ulna and the radius, resulting in a shortened forearm.

name: Absent fourth finger distal interphalangeal crease
label: Absent fourth finger distal interphalangeal crease
definition: Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fourth finger.

name: Lumbar platyspondyly
label: Lumbar platyspondyly
definition: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the lumbar spine.

name: Generalized osteosclerosis
label: Generalized osteosclerosis
definition: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density with generalized involvement of the skeleton.

name: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
label: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
definition: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones.

name: Short humerus
label: Short humerus
definition: Underdevelopment of the humerus.

name: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the toes
label: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the toes
definition: Abnormally short distal phalanx of toe of all toes.

name: Posterior radial head dislocation
label: Posterior radial head dislocation
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an posterior direction.

name: Absent distal phalanges
label: Absent distal phalanges
definition: Aplasia (absence) of the distal phalanges.

name: Supernumerary ribs
label: Supernumerary ribs
definition: The presence of more than 12 rib pairs.

name: Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot
label: Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot
definition: Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe).

name: Short middle phalanx of finger
label: Short middle phalanx of finger
definition: Short (hypoplastic) middle phalanx of finger, affecting one or more fingers.

name: Clinodactyly of the 2nd toe
label: Clinodactyly of the 2nd toe
definition: Bending or curvature of a second toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Flexion contracture of toe
label: Flexion contracture of toe
definition: One or more bent (flexed) toe joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Dysharmonic delayed bone age
label: Dysharmonic delayed bone age
definition: A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

name: obsolete Joint swelling onset late infancy
label: obsolete Joint swelling onset late infancy

name: obsolete Joint dislocations in young adult
label: obsolete Joint dislocations in young adult

name: Calcific stippling of infantile cartilaginous skeleton
label: Calcific stippling of infantile cartilaginous skeleton

name: Rounded middle phalanx of finger
label: Rounded middle phalanx of finger
definition: An abnormally round shape of the middle phalanx of the finger.

name: Diffuse cerebral calcification
label: Diffuse cerebral calcification
definition: Generalized deposition of calcium salts within the brain.

name: Multiple prenatal fractures
label: Multiple prenatal fractures
definition: The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before.

name: Ulnar radial head dislocation
label: Ulnar radial head dislocation
definition: A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an ulnar direction.

name: Type E brachydactyly
label: Type E brachydactyly
definition: In type E brachydactyly, shortening of the fingers is mainly in the metacarpals and metatarsals.

name: Pseudoarthrosis
label: Pseudoarthrosis
definition: A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or "false joint").

name: Opposable triphalangeal thumb
label: Opposable triphalangeal thumb
definition: A form of triphalangeal thumb that can be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

name: Metaphyseal enchondromatosis
label: Metaphyseal enchondromatosis
definition: An enchondroma is a benign growth of cartilage that develops within the medullary cavity of bone. Enchondromatosis refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas, and this term refers to the presence of multiple enchondromas within the medulla of metaphyseal bone. Radiographically an enchondroma presents a an oval, linear, or pyramidal osteolytic (radiolucent) lesion with well defined margins.

name: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
label: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
definition: An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.|The term metaphyseal chondrodysplasia is usually used to describe a disease but is often also used to describe the corresponding phenotypic appearance. This use is retained in the HPO for convenience, but if possible a precise phenotypic description is preferred.

name: Brachytelomesophalangy
label: Brachytelomesophalangy
definition: Disproportionately short middle and distal phalanges compared to the hand/foot.

name: Polysyndactyly of hallux
label: Polysyndactyly of hallux
definition: Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the great toe.

name: Progressive flexion contractures
label: Progressive flexion contractures
definition: Progressively worsening joint contractures.

name: Enlarged sagittal diameter of the cervical canal
label: Enlarged sagittal diameter of the cervical canal

name: Congenital finger flexion contractures
label: Congenital finger flexion contractures
definition: Multiple bent (flexed) finger joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Metacarpophalangeal synostosis
label: Metacarpophalangeal synostosis
definition: Fusion of a metacarpal bone with the proximal phalanx of the finger distal to it across the corresponding metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Absent ossification of cervical vertebral bodies
label: Absent ossification of cervical vertebral bodies
definition: A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of cervical vertebra.

name: Aphalangy of the hands
label: Aphalangy of the hands
definition: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a finger.

name: Hyperostosis cranialis interna
label: Hyperostosis cranialis interna
definition: Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the calvaria and the base of skull.

name: Progressive forearm bowing
label: Progressive forearm bowing
definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the forearm skeleton.

name: Double first metacarpals
label: Double first metacarpals
definition: Duplication of the metacarpal I bones.

name: Radial deviation of thumb terminal phalanx
label: Radial deviation of thumb terminal phalanx

name: Severe generalized osteoporosis
label: Severe generalized osteoporosis
definition: Severe degree of osteoporosis.

name: Metaphyseal dysostosis
label: Metaphyseal dysostosis
definition: Abnormal mineralization of the metaphyseal area of bones.

name: Fifth metacarpal with ulnar notch
label: Fifth metacarpal with ulnar notch
definition: Presence of an angular or V -shaped indentation on the ulnar side of the fifth metacarpal bone (i.e., on the sides towards the fifth finger).

name: Abnormal cervical curvature
label: Abnormal cervical curvature
definition: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Delayed pneumatization of the mastoid process
label: Delayed pneumatization of the mastoid process
definition: An abnormally reduced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th finger middle phalanx
label: Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th finger middle phalanx
definition: Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th (little) finger middle phalanx.

name: Biliary atresia
label: Biliary atresia
definition: Atresia of the biliary tree.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the metacarpal bones
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the metacarpal bones
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the metacarpal bones.

name: Abnormal metacarpal morphology
label: Abnormal metacarpal morphology
definition: Irregularly shaped metacarpal bones of varying degree.

name: Supernumerary metacarpal bones
label: Supernumerary metacarpal bones
definition: The presence of more than the normal number of metacarpal bones.

name: Abnormal finger phalanx morphology
label: Abnormal finger phalanx morphology
definition: Abnormalities affecting the phalanx of finger.|This category is a supercategory for abnormalties affect phalanges of the hand.

name: Abnormal epiphysis morphology of the phalanges of the hand
label: Abnormal epiphysis morphology of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand. Note that this includes the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

name: obsolete Abnormal ossification of hand bones
label: obsolete Abnormal ossification of hand bones

name: Abnormal hand morphology
label: Abnormal hand morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the hand.|This is a category to be used for general descriptions of hand dysmorphology. In time, it should be replaced by more accurate descriptions.

name: Abnormalities of the metaphyses of the hand
label: Abnormalities of the metaphyses of the hand

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hand
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hand
definition: Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the phalanges or metacarpal bones.

name: Abnormalities of the diaphyses of the hand
label: Abnormalities of the diaphyses of the hand

name: Abnormality of hand cortical bone
label: Abnormality of hand cortical bone
definition: An anomaly of the outer shell (cortex) of a hand bone.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the hand
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the hand
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the hand.

name: Abnormality of epiphysis morphology
label: Abnormality of epiphysis morphology
definition: An anomaly of epiphysis, which is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk.

name: Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation
label: Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation
definition: An abnormality of corticomedullary differentiation (CMD) on diagnostic imaging such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography, or sonography. CMD is a difference in the visualization of cortex and medulla.|On T1-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, the signal intensity of the normal renal cortex is typically higher than medulla, resulting in easily visualized corticomedullary differentiation (CMD). Loss of CMD can be seen in disorders such as glomerulonephritis, acute tubular necrosis, end-stage chronic renal failure, obstructive hydronephrosis, and acute allograft rejection.

name: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
label: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology
definition: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the motile cilium.

name: Bilateral lung agenesis
label: Bilateral lung agenesis
definition: Bilateral lack of development of the lungs.

name: Laryngeal obstruction
label: Laryngeal obstruction
definition: Blockage of the upper airway at the level of the larynx often accompanied by respiratory distress.

name: Ventilator dependence with inability to wean
label: Ventilator dependence with inability to wean

name: Decreased sensitivity to hypoxemia
label: Decreased sensitivity to hypoxemia
definition: Reduced tendency to respond to a reduced concentration of oxygen in the blood by increasing respiration.|Note that hypoxia is defined as lack of oxygen in tissues. Hypoxia is usually preceded by hypoxemia (decreased concentration of oxygen in blood).

name: Multiple pulmonary cysts
label: Multiple pulmonary cysts
definition: The presence of multiple lung cysts.|Emphysematous changes sometimes can be mistaken for multifocal lung cysts. In contrast to true cysts, the cystlike lucencies caused by the destruction of lung parenchyma in emphy-sema do not have walls. Nevertheless, emphysema can be accompanied by multiple cysts, such as bullae, or in association with LCH.

name: Apneic episodes in infancy
label: Apneic episodes in infancy
definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring during infancy.

name: Laryngeal web
label: Laryngeal web
definition: A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords.|Manifestations may appear at any age (hoarse or weak voice and frequent upper respiratory infections) but onset usually occurs during infancy (respiratory distress, stridor and an unusual cry).

name: Anteroposteriorly shortened larynx
label: Anteroposteriorly shortened larynx
definition: Abnormal shortening of the larynx in the anteroposterior (front to back) axis.

name: Impaired gluconeogenesis
label: Impaired gluconeogenesis
definition: An impairment of gluconeogenesis.

name: Hypoargininemia
label: Hypoargininemia
definition: A decreased concentration of arginine in the blood.

name: Intermittent hypothermia
label: Intermittent hypothermia
definition: Episodes of reduced body termperature.

name: Temperature instability
label: Temperature instability
definition: Disordered thermoregulation characterized by an impaired ability to maintain a balance between heat production and heat loss, with resulting instability of body temperature.

name: Respiratory acidosis
label: Respiratory acidosis
definition: Acidosis because of respiratory retention of carbon dioxide.

name: Episodic ketoacidosis
label: Episodic ketoacidosis
definition: Intermittent episodes of ketoacidosis.

name: Type II diabetes mellitus
label: Type II diabetes mellitus
definition: A type of diabetes mellitus initially characterized by insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia and subsequently by glucose interolerance and hyperglycemia.|Persons with type II diabetes mellitus rarely develop ketoacidosis.

name: Reduced phenylalanine hydroxylase activity
label: Reduced phenylalanine hydroxylase activity
definition: A reduction in phenylalanine 4-monooxygenase activity.

name: Elevated maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
label: Elevated maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein
definition: An elevation of alpha-feto protein in the maternal serum.

name: Multinodular goiter
label: Multinodular goiter
definition: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to multiple nodules in the thyroid gland.

name: Congenital muscular torticollis
label: Congenital muscular torticollis
definition: A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.|Congenital muscular torticollis is thought to result from injury to the sternocleidomastoid muscle during birth trauma, resulting in fibrosis and unilateral shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle. Congenital muscular torticollis is thus etiologically and phenotypically distinct from spasmodic torticollis.

name: Redundant neck skin
label: Redundant neck skin
definition: Excess skin around the neck, often lying in horizontal folds.|With age and increased vertical growth of the neck, excess nuchal skin may disappear and the neck may become broad or webbed. If the skin folds are vertical or paravertical, the term Neck webbing should be used.

name: Thyroid hypoplasia
label: Thyroid hypoplasia
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the thyroid gland.

name: Nodular goiter
label: Nodular goiter
definition: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to one or more nodules in the thyroid gland.

name: Decreased adipose tissue around neck
label: Decreased adipose tissue around neck
definition: Reduced amount of adipose tissue in the region of the neck.

name: Restricted neck movement due to contractures
label: Restricted neck movement due to contractures

name: Ureteral atresia
label: Ureteral atresia
definition: A developmental defect defined by the failure of the formation of the lumen (tube) of the ureter.

name: Ureteral obstruction
label: Ureteral obstruction
definition: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the ureter.

name: Hypotrophy of the small hand muscles
label: Hypotrophy of the small hand muscles

name: Broad phalanx
label: Broad phalanx
definition: Increased side-to-side width of one or more phalanges of the fingers or toes.

name: Cuboidal metacarpal
label: Cuboidal metacarpal
definition: Severely shortened metacarpal with a cuboidal appearance.|The metacarpals are normally tubular in appearance.

name: Delayed phalangeal epiphyseal ossification
label: Delayed phalangeal epiphyseal ossification
definition: Delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more phalanx.

name: Metaphyseal cupping of metacarpals
label: Metaphyseal cupping of metacarpals
definition: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the metacarpal bones.

name: Y-shaped metacarpals
label: Y-shaped metacarpals
definition: Y-shaped metacarpals are the result of a partial fusion of two metacarpal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.

name: Distal widening of metacarpals
label: Distal widening of metacarpals
definition: Abnormal increase in width of the distal region of the metacarpal bones.

name: Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses
label: Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones.

name: Multiple carpal ossification centers
label: Multiple carpal ossification centers
definition: A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones.

name: Metacarpophalangeal joint contracture
label: Metacarpophalangeal joint contracture
definition: A chronic loss of joint motion in metacarpophalangeal joints due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.|In the literature this has been called metacarpophalangeal camptodactyly, but the term camptodactyly should be researved for a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.

name: Absent proximal finger flexion creases
label: Absent proximal finger flexion creases
definition: Absence of the proximal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.

name: Malaligned carpal bone
label: Malaligned carpal bone
definition: Malalignement of carpal bone angles either with respect to each other, to the corresponding metacarpals or with respect to the wrist (radius and ulna).

name: 3-4 finger syndactyly
label: 3-4 finger syndactyly
definition: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three and four.

name: Metacarpophalangeal joint hyperextensibility
label: Metacarpophalangeal joint hyperextensibility
definition: Increased mobility of one ore more metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Finger syndactyly
label: Finger syndactyly
definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

name: Fingerpad telangiectases
label: Fingerpad telangiectases
definition: Telangiectasia (small dilated blood vessels) located in the fingerpads at the tips of the fingers.

name: Tapered metacarpals
label: Tapered metacarpals
definition: Metacarpal that becomes thinner toward the distal end.

name: Absent phalangeal crease
label: Absent phalangeal crease
definition: Absence of one or more interphalangeal creases (i.e., of the transverse lines in the skin between the phalanges of the fingers).

name: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the fingers
label: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the fingers
definition: Short, hypoplastic middle phalanx of finger, affecting all fingers.

name: Expanded phalanges with widened medullary cavities
label: Expanded phalanges with widened medullary cavities

name: Multiple palmar creases
label: Multiple palmar creases
definition: The presence of multiple creases on the palm of the hand (more than the normal three major creases (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, and thenar crease).

name: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the fingers
label: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the fingers
definition: Hypoplasia of all of the distal phalanx of finger.

name: Proximal tapering of metacarpals
label: Proximal tapering of metacarpals
definition: Some or all of the metacarpal bones (i.e., metacarpal II to V) have a pointed proximal appearance.

name: Acral ulceration
label: Acral ulceration
definition: A type of digital ulcer that manifests as an open sore on the surface of the skin at the tip of a finger or toe.

name: Long proximal phalanx of finger
label: Long proximal phalanx of finger
definition: Increased length of the proximal phalanx of finger.

name: Drumstick terminal phalanges
label: Drumstick terminal phalanges
definition: Rounding and broadening of the tufts of the distal phalanges.|This designation is supposed to refer to the widening of the meaty end of a chicken drumstick (lower leg).

name: Enlarged metacarpal epiphyses
label: Enlarged metacarpal epiphyses
definition: Abnormally large size of the metaphyseal epiphyses.

name: Premature fusion of phalangeal epiphyses
label: Premature fusion of phalangeal epiphyses
definition: Fusion of the epiphysis and metaphysis of one or more phalanges prior to the normal age or stage of growth.

name: Shortening of all proximal phalanges of the fingers
label: Shortening of all proximal phalanges of the fingers
definition: Congenital hypoplasia of proximal phalanx of finger or all fingers.

name: Central Y-shaped metacarpal
label: Central Y-shaped metacarpal
definition: A central Y-shaped metacarpal is the result of a partial fusion of two central metacarpals (i.e., metacarpals 2-4) of the hand, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Central Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen as a result of a central polydactyly with partial fusion of the duplicated metacarpal.

name: Broad metacarpal epiphyses
label: Broad metacarpal epiphyses
definition: Increased side-to-side width of the metacarpal epiphyses.

name: Swan neck-like deformities of the fingers
label: Swan neck-like deformities of the fingers
definition: A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

name: Proximal symphalangism of hands
label: Proximal symphalangism of hands
definition: The term proximal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the proximal interphalangeal finger creases.

name: Long phalanx of finger
label: Long phalanx of finger
definition: Increased length of multiple or a single phalanx of finger.

name: Ulnar deviation of thumb
label: Ulnar deviation of thumb
definition: Bending or curvature of a thumb towards the ulnar side (towards the ring finger).

name: Mesoaxial hand polydactyly
label: Mesoaxial hand polydactyly
definition: The presence of a supernumerary finger (not a thumb) involving the third or fourth metacarpal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Irregular metacarpals
label: Irregular metacarpals
definition: Irregular morphology of one or more metacarpal bones.

name: Short metacarpals with rounded proximal ends
label: Short metacarpals with rounded proximal ends

name: Soft tissue swelling of interphalangeal joints
label: Soft tissue swelling of interphalangeal joints

name: Chess-pawn distal phalanges
label: Chess-pawn distal phalanges
definition: A morphological abnormality of distal phalanges such that they have the appearance of chess pawns.

name: Flattened, squared-off epiphyses of tubular bones
label: Flattened, squared-off epiphyses of tubular bones

name: Metacarpal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
label: Metacarpal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
definition: Increase in bone density in the diaphyseal (shaft) region of a metacarpal bone.

name: Two carpal ossification centers present at birth
label: Two carpal ossification centers present at birth

name: Decreased palmar creases
label: Decreased palmar creases
definition: Poorly defined or shallow palmar creases.

name: Deep palmar crease
label: Deep palmar crease
definition: Excessively deep creases of the palm.

name: Tapered phalanx of finger
label: Tapered phalanx of finger
definition: Phalanges of the fingers becoming thinner toward the distal end.

name: Thimble-shaped middle phalanges of hand
label: Thimble-shaped middle phalanges of hand
definition: The middle phalanx of finger resembles a thimble, a small metal cap to protect the finger while sewing that has a broad (proximal) base and narrower top, whereby both base and top are flat.

name: Decreased movement range in interphalangeal joints
label: Decreased movement range in interphalangeal joints

name: Irregular phalanges
label: Irregular phalanges
definition: Alteration of the normally smooth radiographic contour of phalanges producing an irregular appearance.

name: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of second finger
label: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of second finger
definition: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.|This anomaly is characteristic for brachydactyly type C.

name: Metaphyseal cupping of proximal phalanges
label: Metaphyseal cupping of proximal phalanges
definition: Metaphyseal cupping affecting the proximal phalanges.

name: Thin proximal phalanges with broad epiphyses of the hand
label: Thin proximal phalanges with broad epiphyses of the hand
definition: removed the logical def: 'has part' some (('decreased thickness' and ('inheres in' some 'proximal phalanx of manus') and ('has modifier' some abnormal)) and ('has part' some ('increased width' and ('inheres in' some 'epiphysis of proximal phalanx of manus'))) and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Single interphalangeal crease of fifth finger
label: Single interphalangeal crease of fifth finger
definition: Presence of only one (instead of two, as normal) interphalangeal crease of the fifth finger.

name: Limited mobility of proximal interphalangeal joint
label: Limited mobility of proximal interphalangeal joint

name: Tapering pointed ends of distal finger phalanges
label: Tapering pointed ends of distal finger phalanges
definition: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end such that the tip of the phalanx comes to a point (this feature can be observed on radiograms).

name: Osteoarthritis of the first carpometacarpal joint
label: Osteoarthritis of the first carpometacarpal joint

name: Expanded metacarpals with widened medullary cavities
label: Expanded metacarpals with widened medullary cavities

name: Osteoarthritis of the distal interphalangeal joint
label: Osteoarthritis of the distal interphalangeal joint

name: Osteolysis involving tarsal bones
label: Osteolysis involving tarsal bones
definition: An increased resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts leading to bony defects involving the tarsal bones.

name: Slender metacarpals
label: Slender metacarpals
definition: Decreased width of the metacarpal bones (that is, reduced diameter).

name: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the toes
label: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the toes
definition: Abnormal shortening of all middle phalanges of toes.

name: Limited wrist movement
label: Limited wrist movement
definition: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the wrist.

name: Elevated alpha-fetoprotein
label: Elevated alpha-fetoprotein
definition: An increased concentration of alpha-fetoprotein.|An elevation of alpha-feto protein, which is produced by the fetal liver and the yolk sac and may be increased in the serum of pregnant women with a fetus with some types of developmental anomaly such as open neural tube defects and omphalocele.

name: Abnormal phalangeal joint morphology of the hand
label: Abnormal phalangeal joint morphology of the hand

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th finger
definition: A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic 5th finger.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger
definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 2nd finger.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd finger
definition: A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic 2nd finger.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of fingers
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of fingers
definition: Small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic fingers.

name: Small placenta
label: Small placenta
definition: Reduced size of the placenta.

name: Large placenta
label: Large placenta
definition: Increased size of the placenta.

name: Fluctuating splenomegaly
label: Fluctuating splenomegaly
definition: Intermittently increased size of the spleen.

name: Hypoplastic spleen
label: Hypoplastic spleen
definition: Underdevelopment of the spleen.

name: Pancreatic lymphangiectasis
label: Pancreatic lymphangiectasis
definition: The presence of lymphangiectasis in the pancreas.

name: Reduced pancreatic beta cells
label: Reduced pancreatic beta cells
definition: Reduced number of beta cells in the pancreatic islets of Langerhans.|The beta cells are responsible for producing insulin and amylin.

name: Pancreatic hyperplasia
label: Pancreatic hyperplasia
definition: Hyperplasia of the pancreas.|Hyperplasia is defined in MPATH as an increase in cell numbers in comparison to normal as a consequence of increased cell proliferation. Hyperplasia is a non -neoplastic process.

name: Ectopic pancreatic tissue
label: Ectopic pancreatic tissue
definition: The presence of pancreatic tissue outside the normal pancreas, in many cases along the foregut and proximal midgut.

name: Chronic pancreatitis
label: Chronic pancreatitis
definition: A chronic form of pancreatitis.

name: Generalized hypoplasia of dental enamel
label: Generalized hypoplasia of dental enamel
definition: A generalized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

name: Multiple unerupted teeth
label: Multiple unerupted teeth
definition: The presence of multiple embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt.

name: Hypomineralization of enamel
label: Hypomineralization of enamel
definition: A decreased amount of enamel mineralization.

name: Advanced eruption of teeth
label: Advanced eruption of teeth
definition: Premature tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD earlier than the mean eruption age.|There are established norms for the timing of eruption in both deciduous and permanent teeth [Garn and Rohmann, [1966]; Lunt and Law, [1974]; McDonald et al. [2004]]. Eruption is defined by the appearance of a tooth that has pierced the gum.

name: Agenesis of central incisor
label: Agenesis of central incisor
definition: Agenesis of one or more central incisors, i.e., of lower secondary incisor, lower primary incisor, upper secondary incisor, or of upper central primary incisor.

name: Discolored lateral incisors
label: Discolored lateral incisors
definition: The presence of discolored lateral incisors.

name: Marked delay in eruption of permanent teeth
label: Marked delay in eruption of permanent teeth

name: Abnormality of dental eruption
label: Abnormality of dental eruption
definition: An abnormality of tooth eruption.|The average ages for eruption of the primary teeth are: 6 months: lower central incisor, 7 months: upper central incisor, 8 months: upper lateral incisor, 9 months: lower lateral incisor, 12 months first molars, 18 months, canines, 2 years, second molars.

name: Agenesis of maxillary central incisor
label: Agenesis of maxillary central incisor
definition: Agenesis of upper secondary incisor or of upper central primary incisor.

name: Hypoplasia of dental enamel
label: Hypoplasia of dental enamel
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.|Note that the term enamel dysplasia was previously used for this feature but is no longer recommended.

name: Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction
label: Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction
definition: Prolonged bleeding post dental extraction sufficient to require medical intervention.

name: Dagger-shaped pulp calcifications
label: Dagger-shaped pulp calcifications
definition: Dagger-shaped calcifications in the dental pulp.

name: Generalized microdontia
label: Generalized microdontia
definition: A generalized form of microdontia.

name: Widely spaced primary teeth
label: Widely spaced primary teeth
definition: Increased space between the primary teeth. Note this phenotype should be distinguished from increased space due purely to microdontia.

name: Single median maxillary incisor
label: Single median maxillary incisor
definition: The presence of a single, median maxillary incisor, affecting both the primary maxillary incisor and the permanent maxillary incisor.|If a single maxillary central incisor is present but not positioned in the midline, this could be hypodontia, but this cannot be evaluated without a radiograph.

name: Irregularly spaced teeth
label: Irregularly spaced teeth
definition: Irregular distribution of the teeth along the dental arch, i.e., and irregular spatial pattern of teeth.

name: Premature loss of primary teeth
label: Premature loss of primary teeth
definition: Loss of the primary (also known as deciduous) teeth before the usual age.|The primary teeth are usually shed and replaced by the permanent teeth, usually by the age of six years. With premature loss of primary teeth, there is a delay between the loss of the primary teeth and the eruption of the permanent teeth.

name: Alveolar process hypoplasia
label: Alveolar process hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the alveolar process (also known as alveolar bone).|The alveolar process is a thickened ridge of bone that contains the tooth sockets on the mandible and maxilla.

name: Supernumerary maxillary incisor
label: Supernumerary maxillary incisor
definition: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, maxillary incisor, either the primary maxillary incisor or the permanent maxillary incisor.

name: Crowded maxillary incisors
label: Crowded maxillary incisors
definition: A type of dental misalignment with crowded central incisors, i.e., of maxillary secondary incisor, or of maxillary central primary incisor.

name: Hypoplasia of the primary teeth
label: Hypoplasia of the primary teeth
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the primary teeth.

name: Persistence of primary teeth
label: Persistence of primary teeth
definition: Persistence of the primary teeth beyond the age by which they normally are shed and replaced by the permanent teeth.|The primary teeth are usually shed and replaced by the permanent teeth, usually by the age of six years. Persistence of primary teeth may be related to agenesis of the permanent teeth. Molar primary teeth may be persistent because of the agenesis of the premolars.

name: Short dental roots
label: Short dental roots
definition: Short dental root.

name: Premature eruption of permanent teeth
label: Premature eruption of permanent teeth
definition: Premature tooth eruption of the permanent dentition.

name: Malformation of mandibular premolar
label: Malformation of mandibular premolar
definition: An abnormality of the morphology of secondary premolar tooth.

name: Conical mandibular incisor
label: Conical mandibular incisor
definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the primary or permanent mandibular incisors.

name: Peg-shaped maxillary lateral incisors
label: Peg-shaped maxillary lateral incisors
definition: Peg-shaped upper lateral secondary incisor tooth.

name: Abnormality of primary molar morphology
label: Abnormality of primary molar morphology
definition: An abnormality of morphology of primary molar.

name: Screwdriver-shaped incisors
label: Screwdriver-shaped incisors
definition: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth in which the tooth is shaped like a screwdriver blade, i.e., having a rhomboid shape.

name: Microdontia of primary teeth
label: Microdontia of primary teeth
definition: Decreased size of the primary teeth.

name: Agenesis of permanent teeth
label: Agenesis of permanent teeth
definition: A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.

name: Obliteration of the pulp chamber
label: Obliteration of the pulp chamber
definition: Obliteration of the pulp chambers owing to mineralization of the dental pulp.

name: Failure of eruption of permanent teeth
label: Failure of eruption of permanent teeth
definition: Lack of tooth eruption of the secondary dentition.

name: Hypoplasia of the tooth germ
label: Hypoplasia of the tooth germ
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the tooth germ, i.e., of the structure that forms in odontogenesis that will develop into a tooth.

name: Agenesis of mandibular central incisor
label: Agenesis of mandibular central incisor
definition: Agenesis of lower secondary incisor or lower primary incisor.

name: Premature loss of permanent teeth
label: Premature loss of permanent teeth
definition: Premature loss of the permanent teeth.

name: Shovel-shaped maxillary central incisors
label: Shovel-shaped maxillary central incisors
definition: Incisors with a thick marginal ridge surrounding a deep lingual fossa are termed shovel-shaped incisors.

name: Crumpled long bones
label: Crumpled long bones
definition: An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as if the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta.

name: Irregular patellae
label: Irregular patellae
definition: An alteration of the normally relatively smooth margins of the kneecap in radiographic images leading to an irregular contour.

name: Distal ulnar epiphyseal stippling
label: Distal ulnar epiphyseal stippling
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the distal epiphysis of the ulna.

name: Broad long bone diaphyses
label: Broad long bone diaphyses
definition: Increased width of the diaphysis of long bones.

name: Dumbbell-shaped femur
label: Dumbbell-shaped femur
definition: The femur is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

name: Proximal tibial hypoplasia
label: Proximal tibial hypoplasia
definition: Removed logical definition that used anonymous class. Requested new term from UBERON: 'proximal tibia'

name: Knee flexion contracture
label: Knee flexion contracture
definition: A bent (flexed) knee joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Rudimentary fibula
label: Rudimentary fibula
definition: Absent or nearly absent fibula. (Does not include aplastic)

name: Progressive bowing of long bones
label: Progressive bowing of long bones
definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.

name: Club-shaped distal femur
label: Club-shaped distal femur
definition:
An abnormal conformation of the femur that becomes gradually enlarged towards the distal end. This feature affects the distal femoral metaphysis and epiphysis.|previous def: 'has part' some 
(clavate and ('inheres in' some 'Distal end of femur (adult human)') and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Short lower limbs
label: Short lower limbs
definition: Shortening of the legs related to developmental hypoplasia of the bones of the leg.

name: Hypoplastic distal radial epiphyses
label: Hypoplastic distal radial epiphyses
definition: Underdevelopment of the distal epiphysis of the radius.

name: Wide distal femoral metaphysis
label: Wide distal femoral metaphysis
definition: Increased width of the distal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.

name: Anterior tibial bowing
label: Anterior tibial bowing
definition: An abnormal anterior bending or curvature of the tibia.

name: Overtubulated long bones
label: Overtubulated long bones
definition: Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones.

name: Increased density of long bones
label: Increased density of long bones
definition: An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones.

name: Limited pronation/supination of forearm
label: Limited pronation/supination of forearm
definition: A limitation of the ability to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces anteriorly (supination) and to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces posteriorly (pronation).

name: Flat distal femoral epiphysis
label: Flat distal femoral epiphysis
definition: An abnormal flattening of the distal epiphysis of femur.

name: Club-shaped proximal femur
label: Club-shaped proximal femur
definition:
An abnormal conformation of the femur that becomes gradually enlarged towards the proximal end. This feature affects the proximal femoral metaphysis and epiphysis.|previous def: 'has part' some 
(clavate and ('inheres in' some 'Proximal end of femur (adult human)') and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Irregular distal femoral epiphysis
label: Irregular distal femoral epiphysis
definition: Anomaly of the contour of the Distal epiphysis of femur such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.

name: Progressive leg bowing
label: Progressive leg bowing
definition: Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the leg.

name: Distal tibial bowing
label: Distal tibial bowing
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the tibia.

name: Cortically dense long tubular bones
label: Cortically dense long tubular bones
definition: Increased density of the compact bone of long bone.|Note that compact bone and cortical bone are synonymous.

name: Asymmetric radial dysplasia
label: Asymmetric radial dysplasia
definition: The presence of asymmetric developmental dysplasia of the radius.

name: Peg-like central prominence of distal tibial metaphyses
label: Peg-like central prominence of distal tibial metaphyses

name: Elongated radius
label: Elongated radius
definition: Increased length of the radius.

name: Broad femoral neck
label: Broad femoral neck
definition: An abnormally wide femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Proximal femoral metaphyseal abnormality
label: Proximal femoral metaphyseal abnormality
definition: An anomaly of the metaphysis of the proximal femur (close to the hip).

name: Radial dysplasia
label: Radial dysplasia
definition: Radial dysplasia, also known as radial longitudinal deficiency, includes radial clubhand and is a disfiguring, and potentially disabling, congenital limb anomaly. The entire upper limb may be involved, although the defect is most evident in the forearm and hand. Affected children suffer a variable degree of hypoplasia or absence of the preaxial skeleton and soft tissues, in particular the thumb, radius, and dorsoradial soft tissues. The hand is usually radially deviated and subluxated off the distal aspect of the ulna, the ulna may be shortened and have a bow-shaped deformity, and there is no true wrist (radiocarpal) joint in Bayne2 type-III and IV radial dysplasia.

name: Hypoplasia of proximal radius
label: Hypoplasia of proximal radius
definition: Proximal radial shortening owing to a congenital defect of development.

name: Disproportionate prominence of the femoral medial condyle
label: Disproportionate prominence of the femoral medial condyle

name: Enlargement of the distal femoral epiphysis
label: Enlargement of the distal femoral epiphysis
definition: An abnormal enlargement of the distal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Increased density of long bone diaphyses
label: Increased density of long bone diaphyses

name: Hypoplasia of proximal fibula
label: Hypoplasia of proximal fibula
definition: Underdevelopment or shortening of the end of the fibula (calf bone) nearest the knee.

name: Patellar aplasia
label: Patellar aplasia
definition: Absence of the patella.

name: Multicentric ossification of proximal femoral epiphyses
label: Multicentric ossification of proximal femoral epiphyses

name: Lateral displacement of the femoral head
label: Lateral displacement of the femoral head
definition: A developmental anomaly with lateral displacement of the femoral head.

name: Delayed patellar ossification
label: Delayed patellar ossification
definition: Formation of bone in the patella later than normal.|The patella initially ossifies at between three and five years, commencing as multiple foci that rapidly coalesce. As the patellar ossification center enlarges the expanding margins may be irregular and associated with accessory ossification centers. These are most common superolaterally and may lead to the development of a bipartite patella. The bipartite patella has cartilaginous continuity despite the appearance of osseous discontinuity. The patella expands to all cartilaginous contours during late adolescence when the epiphyseal ossification centers around the knee are also in the final stages of maturation. The only cartilage not replaced is that occupying the superior two-thirds of the articular surface (the lower one-third is covered by the fat pad). The subchondral plate does not assume the actual articular contours until the late stages of osseous maturation (after ten to twelve years). Accordingly, typical measurements such as medial and lateral angulation cannot be accurately done prior to the final stages of patellar ossification expansion and maturation (PMID:6729496).

name: Irregular proximal tibial epiphyses
label: Irregular proximal tibial epiphyses
definition: Anomaly of the contour of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.

name: Dorsal subluxation of ulna
label: Dorsal subluxation of ulna
definition: Partial dislocation of the ulna in the dorsal direction.

name: Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis
label: Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis
definition: Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt.

name: Generalized bone demineralization
label: Generalized bone demineralization
definition: A generalized decrease in bone mineral density.|The terms Osteopenia or Osteoporosis should be prefered to this term, which may be obsoleted in the future.

name: Periosteal thickening of long tubular bones
label: Periosteal thickening of long tubular bones
definition: Thickening of the periosteum of long bone.

name: Ankle flexion contracture
label: Ankle flexion contracture
definition: A chronic loss of ankle joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the ankle.

name: Limited shoulder movement
label: Limited shoulder movement
definition: A limitation of the range of movement of the shoulder joint.

name: Thin long bone diaphyses
label: Thin long bone diaphyses
definition: Decreased width of the diaphysis of long bones.

name: Anterior bowing of long bones
label: Anterior bowing of long bones
definition: An abnormal anterior curvature of a long bone.

name: Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells
label: Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells
definition: An abnormality of the islet of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells. These are the alpha cells, which produce glucagon, the beta cells, which produce insulin and amylin, the delta cells, which produce somatostatin, the PP cells, which produce pancreatic polypeptide, and the epsilon cells, which produce ghrelin.

name: Abnormality of the alveolar ridges
label: Abnormality of the alveolar ridges
definition: Any abnormality of the alveolar ridges (on the upper or lower jaws). The alveolar ridges contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth.

name: Abnormality of the dental pulp
label: Abnormality of the dental pulp
definition: An abnormality of the dental pulp.

name: Premature loss of teeth
label: Premature loss of teeth
definition: Premature loss of teeth not related to trauma or neglect.

name: Abnormality of primary teeth
label: Abnormality of primary teeth
definition: Any abnormality of the primary tooth.|Primary teeth are also called temporary teeth or deciduous teeth.

name: Abnormality of dental morphology
label: Abnormality of dental morphology
definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the tooth.

name: Abnormal number of teeth
label: Abnormal number of teeth
definition: The presence of an altered number of of teeth.|Humans usually have 20 primary teeth (also called deciduous teeth) and 32 permanent teeth. This term comprises anomalies with too many or too few teeth.

name: Agenesis of incisor
label: Agenesis of incisor
definition: Agenesis of incisor.|Failure of one or more incisors to develop.

name: Abnormality of the dental root
label: Abnormality of the dental root
definition: An abnormality of the dental root.

name: Bowing of the long bones
label: Bowing of the long bones
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.|Curvatures of a long bone such as femur, tibia, or fibula.

name: Bowing of the arm
label: Bowing of the arm
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the arm.

name: Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis
