label: Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis
definition: An anomaly of the femoral metaphysis.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fibula
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fibula
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the fibula.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the lower limbs.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the feet

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ulna
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ulna
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the ulna.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the upper limbs.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the patella
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the patella
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the patella.

name: Abnormality of femoral epiphysis
label: Abnormality of femoral epiphysis
definition: An anomaly of a growth plate of a femur.

name: Abnormality of lower limb epiphysis morphology
label: Abnormality of lower limb epiphysis morphology
definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or both legs.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the radius
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the radius
definition: A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic radius.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the carpal bones
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the carpal bones
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the carpal bones.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving forearm bones
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving forearm bones
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more forearm bones.

name: obsolete Anomaly of the limb diaphyses morphology
label: obsolete Anomaly of the limb diaphyses morphology

name: Abnormality of limb epiphysis morphology
label: Abnormality of limb epiphysis morphology
definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of a limb.|An epiphysis is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the humerus
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the humerus
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the humerus.

name: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
label: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
definition: An anomaly that is characterized progressive airflow obstruction that is only partly reversible, inflammation in the airways, and systemic effects or comorbities.|COPD is usually conceptualized as a disease entity. It is heterogeneous histologically and pathogenically, and conventionally includes emphysema and chronic bronchitis, It is included as a phenotype term as COPD is often annotated as a feature of other diseases.

name: Laryngeal stridor
label: Laryngeal stridor
definition: An abnormal high-pitched noisy sound, occurring during inhalation or exhalation caused by the incomplete obstruction in the throat.|The laryngeal stridor sound is usually heard during inspiratory phase, also called inspiratory stridor, and may accompanied by inspiratory difficulty in breathing. It may be due to abnormal flaccidity of the epiglottis or arytenoids.

name: Alveolar proteinosis
label: Alveolar proteinosis
definition: Abnormal accumulation of surfactant-like, periodic acid-schiff-positive lipoproteinaceous material in macrophages within the alveolar spaces and distal bronchioles. This results in gas exchange impairment leading to dyspnea and alveolar infiltrates.

name: Pulmonary venous occlusion
label: Pulmonary venous occlusion
definition: Substantial narrowing or blockage of small pulmonary veins as a result of disorganized smooth muscle hypertrophy and collagen matrix deposition.|This feature can be observed by histological examination of lung tissue. The feature can be seen in pulmonary veno-occlusive disease (PVOD). PVOD is characterised by diffuse occlusion of the pulmonary veins by fibrous tissue, pulmonary venous congestion and associated complications including severe pulmonary hypertension (pHTN), non-cardiogenic pulmonary oedema, hypoxia and right-ventricular failure. Clinical presentation is typically non-specific, including dyspnoea, fatigue and cough.

name: Alveolar cell carcinoma
label: Alveolar cell carcinoma
definition: Adenocarcinoma of the Bronchus.

name: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
label: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
definition: Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

name: Lymphoid interstitial pneumonia
label: Lymphoid interstitial pneumonia
definition: A lymphocyte-predominant infiltration of the lungs characterized by bibasilar pulmonary infiltrates with dense interstitial accumulations of lymphocytes and plasma cells.|Associated clinical manifestations often include fever, cough, and shortness of breath.

name: Chronic lung disease
label: Chronic lung disease
definition: According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities.

name: Abnormal pulmonary lymphatics
label: Abnormal pulmonary lymphatics
definition: An abnormality of the pulmonary lymphatic chain.

name: Interstitial pulmonary abnormality
label: Interstitial pulmonary abnormality
definition: Abnormality of the lung parenchyma extending to the pulmonary interstitium and leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis.

name: Recurrent pneumonia
label: Recurrent pneumonia
definition: An increased susceptibility to pneumonia as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of pneumonia.|Recurrent pneumonia is defined as two or more episodes in a single year, or at least three episodes ever, with radiographic clearing of densities between occurrences.

name: Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage
label: Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage
definition: A recurrent hemorrhage occurring within the lung.

name: Obstructive lung disease
label: Obstructive lung disease
definition: Obstruction of conducting airways of the lung.

name: Recurrent bronchopulmonary infections
label: Recurrent bronchopulmonary infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchopulmonary infections as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchopulmonary infections.

name: Chronic obstructive airway disease from birth
label: Chronic obstructive airway disease from birth

name: Extrapulmonary sequestrum
label: Extrapulmonary sequestrum
definition: A type of pulmonary sequestration that is completely enclosed in its own pleural sac, occurring above, within, or below the diaphragm, and without communication with the tracheobronchial tree.|Extrapulmonary sequestra nearly all appear on the left side.

name: Acute hepatic failure
label: Acute hepatic failure
definition: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as acute if there is onset of encephalopathy within 8 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Diffuse hepatic steatosis
label: Diffuse hepatic steatosis
definition: A diffuse form of hepatic steatosis.

name: Decreased mitochondrial complex III activity in liver tissue
label: Decreased mitochondrial complex III activity in liver tissue
definition: Decreased activity of complex III of the mitochondrion in the liver.|Complex III, also known as ubiquinol-cytochrome c oxidoreductase or cytochrome bc1 complex, is a multisubunit integral membrane complex of the mitochondrial transport chain, which catalyzes electron transfer from ubiquinol to cytochrome c and couples this process to electrogenic translocation of protons across the mitochondrial inner membrane. Mitochondrial complex III is integrated in the inner mitochondrial membrane.

name: Hepatic calcification
label: Hepatic calcification
definition: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition in the liver.

name: Biliary hyperplasia
label: Biliary hyperplasia
definition: Hyperplasia of the biliary tree, as manifested by increased size of bile ducts, dilated lumen, and histologically by an increased number of epithelial cells or hyperplasia.

name: Viral hepatitis
label: Viral hepatitis
definition: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with a virus.

name: Malformation of the hepatic ductal plate
label: Malformation of the hepatic ductal plate

name: Fluctuating hepatomegaly
label: Fluctuating hepatomegaly
definition: Intermittently increased size of the liver.

name: Increased hepatocellular lipid droplets
label: Increased hepatocellular lipid droplets
definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intracellular lipid droplets in hepatocytes.|Lipid droplets, rich in triglycerides and cholesterol esters, are cellular ipid storage organelles.

name: Increased hepatic glycogen content
label: Increased hepatic glycogen content
definition: An increase in the amount of glycogen stored in hepatocytes compared to normal.|Glycogen acts as secondary long-term energy storage in the liver and other organs. Its intracellular concentration can be increased in some disease states such as obesity.

name: Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts
label: Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts
definition: The presence of reduced numbers of intrahepatic bile duct than normal.

name: Acute hepatic steatosis
label: Acute hepatic steatosis
definition: An acute form of hepatic steatosis.

name: Macronodular cirrhosis
label: Macronodular cirrhosis
definition: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of large regenerative nodules.|In macronodular cirrhosis (post-necrotic cirrhosis), the nodules are larger than 3 mm.

name: Prolonged neonatal jaundice
label: Prolonged neonatal jaundice
definition: Neonatal jaundice refers to a yellowing of the skin and other tissues of a newborn infant as a result of increased concentrations of bilirubin in the blood. Neonatal jaundice affects over half of all newborns to some extent in the first week of life. Prolonged neonatal jaundice is said to be present if the jaundice persists for longer than 14 days in term infants and 21 days in preterm infants.

name: Portal fibrosis
label: Portal fibrosis
definition: Fibroblast proliferation and fiber expansion from the portal areas to the lobule.|Portal fibrosis can be seen in viral hepatitis and other types of liver disease.

name: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in liver
label: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in liver
definition: An abnormal reduction in the number of mitochondria in hepatocytes.

name: Reye syndrome-like episodes
label: Reye syndrome-like episodes
definition: Repeated occurrences of acute noninflammatory encephalopathy and fatty degenerative liver failure.|This feature has been observed in individuals withe mitochondrial DNA depletion syndrome-6 (MTDPS6), also known as Navajo neurohepatopathy [MIM:256810].

name: Congenital pseudoarthrosis of the clavicle
label: Congenital pseudoarthrosis of the clavicle
definition: The two portions of the clavicle (corresponding to the two primary ossification centers of the clavicle) are connected by a fibrous bridge that is contiguous with the periosteum, and a synovial membrane develops, resulting in a clavicle with a bipartite appearance radiographically. Congenital pseudarthrosis of the clavicle generally presents as a painless mass or swelling over the clavicle.|In congenital pseudarthrosis of the clavicle, the two primary ossification centers fail to unite, probably due to a disruption of diaphyseal membranous ossification. See PMID:22295044, Figure 1, for the radiographic appearance of this feature.

name: Straight clavicles
label: Straight clavicles
definition: An abnormally straight configuration of the clavicle, a tubular bone which normally is doubly curved .

name: Premature sternal synostosis
label: Premature sternal synostosis
definition: Prematurely closed sternal sutures.

name: Absent glenoid fossa
label: Absent glenoid fossa
definition: Lack of development of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

name: Scapulohumeral synostosis
label: Scapulohumeral synostosis
definition: Bony fusion between the humerus and scapula, leading to an impairment in mobility of the affected shoulder joint.

name: Diaphragmatic paralysis
label: Diaphragmatic paralysis
definition: The presence of a paralyzed diaphragm.|Loss of the ability to move the diaphragm for respiratory motions. Patients with complete diaphragm paralysis complain of gross orthopnoea, disturbed sleep and early morning headaches. They have shortness of breath on minimal exertion and, because they sleep poorly, they experience daytime fatigue.

name: Irregular ossification at anterior rib ends
label: Irregular ossification at anterior rib ends

name: Irregular chondrocostal junctions
label: Irregular chondrocostal junctions
definition: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth border between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.|The first seven pairs of ribs are connected with the sternum; the next three ribs are each articulated with the lower border of the cartilage of the preceding rib; the last two ribs have pointed extremities, which do not connect with the sternum.

name: Precocious costochondral ossification
label: Precocious costochondral ossification
definition: Early ossification of the costochondral junction, which is the joint between the ribs and costal cartilage in the front of the rib cage.|The costal cartilage typically calcifies with advancing age and is therefore easier to identify on radiographs obtained in older patients.

name: Midclavicular hypoplasia
label: Midclavicular hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the middle portion of the clavicle.

name: Wide intermamillary distance
label: Wide intermamillary distance
definition: A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

name: Decreased number of sternal ossification centers
label: Decreased number of sternal ossification centers
definition: A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.

name: Absent in utero rib ossification
label: Absent in utero rib ossification
definition: Lack of formation and mineralization of the ribs in utero.

name: Anterior rib punctate calcifications
label: Anterior rib punctate calcifications
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in point-like foci within the anterior portion of one or more ribs.

name: Costochondral joint sclerosis
label: Costochondral joint sclerosis
definition: Abnormal increase in density of the tissue at the costochondral junctions.

name: Multifocal breast carcinoma
label: Multifocal breast carcinoma
definition: Breast carcinoma that is bilateral or otherwise multifocal.

name: Absent sternal ossification
label: Absent sternal ossification
definition: Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.

name: Glenoid fossa hypoplasia
label: Glenoid fossa hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the glenoid fossa, which is the cavity in the lateral part of the scapula which articulates with the head of the humerus.

name: Osteosclerosis of ribs
label: Osteosclerosis of ribs
definition: Osteosclerosis of ribs (increased density related to increased bone mass).

name: Midclavicular aplasia
label: Midclavicular aplasia
definition: Developmental defect resulting in congenital absence of the middle portion of the clavicle.

name: Multiple rib fractures
label: Multiple rib fractures
definition: More than one fracture of the ribs.

name: Thin clavicles
label: Thin clavicles
definition: Abnormally reduced diameter (cross section) of the clavicles.

name: Costal cartilage calcification
label: Costal cartilage calcification
definition: Calcification of the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage found at the anterior ends of the ribs which serve to prolong the ribs forward and contribute to the elasticity of the walls of the thorax.

name: Costochondral pain
label: Costochondral pain
definition: Chest wall pain in the area of the costochondral junctions.|Costochondral pain is in the differential diagnosis of chest pain, being a relatively benign cause compared to myocardial ischemia. Costochondral pain can be caused by costochondritis.

name: Thickening of the lateral border of the scapula
label: Thickening of the lateral border of the scapula

name: Aplastic clavicle
label: Aplastic clavicle
definition: Absence of the clavicles as a developmental defect.

name: Coat hanger sign of ribs
label: Coat hanger sign of ribs
definition: An abnormal morphology of the ribs consisting of shorted, abnormally curved ribs. On posteroanterior chest radiography, the ribs show a curvature resembling that of a coat hanger (clothes hanger).|The coat hanger abnormality of the ribs is said to be a useful diagnostic marker of paternal uniparental disomy of chromosome 14.

name: Prolonged QRS complex
label: Prolonged QRS complex
definition: Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec.

name: Granulomatous coronary arteritis
label: Granulomatous coronary arteritis
definition: Inflammation of the coronary arteries involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.|A granuloma is a compact (organized) collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes (macrophages and/or epithelioid cells) which may or may not be accompanied by accessory features such as necrosis or the infiltration of other inflammatory leukocytes (Adams DO. The granulomatous inflammatory response. Am J Pathol 1976:84:163-192).

name: Ventricular extrasystoles
label: Ventricular extrasystoles
definition: Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node.|A premature ventricular contraction may be perceived as a skipped beat or as palpitations.

name: Abnormal ventricular filling
label: Abnormal ventricular filling
definition: An abnormality of filling of a ventricle with blood during diastole.|Two diastolic properties, the rate of ventricular relaxation and the ventricular compliance are especially important determinants of ventricular filling.

name: Ventricular preexcitation with multiple accessory pathways
label: Ventricular preexcitation with multiple accessory pathways
definition: A form of ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of multiple accessory pathways for cardiac conduction.

name: Endocardial fibrosis
label: Endocardial fibrosis
definition: The presence of excessive connective tissue in the endocardium.

name: Aortic tortuosity
label: Aortic tortuosity
definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the aorta.

name: Bacterial endocarditis
label: Bacterial endocarditis
definition: A bacterial infection of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.

name: Myocardial calcification
label: Myocardial calcification
definition: Calcium deposition in the myocardium.|Calcification affecting the muscle layer of the heart.

name: Short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve
label: Short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve
definition: Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve.|The chordae tendineae connect the papillary muscles to the tricuspid valve and the mitral valve.

name: Myocardial steatosis
label: Myocardial steatosis
definition: Steatosis in the myocardium.

name: Early progressive calcific cardiac valvular disease
label: Early progressive calcific cardiac valvular disease

name: Atrioventricular canal defect
label: Atrioventricular canal defect
definition: A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart.|During atrioventricular valvuloseptal morphogenesis, the endocardial cushions expand as they are infiltrated by extracellular matrix secreted from the surrounding myocardium. The cushions then fuse and are remodeled to form the atrioventricular valves and septa. Failure of this process results in AVSD, with the degree of severity dependent on the stage at which the developmental failure occurs. AVSD are a spectrum of cardiac malformations that result in a persistent common atrioventricular canal.

name: Dilatation of the ventricular cavity
label: Dilatation of the ventricular cavity
definition: A localized outpouching of ventricular cavity that is generally associated with dyskinesia and paradoxical expansion during systole.|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation. Ventricular aneurysms may have rim of calcium in the affected regions of the ventricular wall (which can become fibrotic). Thromboembolism is a potential complication. Ventricular aneurysms can be diagnosed by ventriculography.

name: Premature atrial contractions
label: Premature atrial contractions
definition: A type of cardiac arrhythmia with premature atrial contractions or beats caused by signals originating from ectopic atrial sites.

name: Coronary artery dissection
label: Coronary artery dissection
definition: Acute occurrence of a dissection (tear within the tunica intima and entry of blood into the tunica media) of a coronary artery.

name: Abnormal coronary artery morphology
label: Abnormal coronary artery morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the coronary arteries.

name: Abnormal atrioventricular valve morphology
label: Abnormal atrioventricular valve morphology
definition: An abnormality of an atrioventricular valve.

name: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
label: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
definition: An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the clavicles
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the clavicles
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the clavicles (collar bones).

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the thorax
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the thorax

name: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
label: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
definition: A form of acute leukemia characterized by excess lympoblasts.

name: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
label: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
definition: The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

name: T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemias
label: T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemias
definition: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia of T-cell origin. It comprises about 15% of childhood cases and 25% of adult cases. It is more common in males than females.

name: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
label: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
definition: The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2
label: Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2
definition: A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma in which the papillae are covered by large eosinophilic cells with pleomorphic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and nuclear pseudostratification.|Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2 is a common feature of hereditary leiomyomatosis and renal cell cancer; HLRCC (OMIM 150800).

name: Acute megakaryocytic leukemia
label: Acute megakaryocytic leukemia
definition: A rare subtype of acute myeloid leukemia evolving from primitive megakaryoblasts.

name: Renal cortical adenoma
label: Renal cortical adenoma
definition: The presence of an adenoma in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Extraadrenal pheochromocytoma
label: Extraadrenal pheochromocytoma
definition: Pheochromocytoma not originating from the adrenal medulla but from another source such as from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
label: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
definition: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is a malignant tumor of squamous epithelium.

name: Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder
label: Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder
definition: The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder with origin in a transitional epithelial cell.

name: Adrenocortical carcinoma
label: Adrenocortical carcinoma
definition: A malignant neoplasm of the adrenal cortex that may produce hormones such as cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen, or testosterone.

name: Adrenal pheochromocytoma
label: Adrenal pheochromocytoma
definition: Pheochromocytoma originating from the adrenal medulla.

name: Neoplasm of the stomach
label: Neoplasm of the stomach
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the stomach.

name: Cutaneous leiomyosarcoma
label: Cutaneous leiomyosarcoma
definition: The presence of leiomyosarcoma of the skin.

name: Malignant genitourinary tract tumor
label: Malignant genitourinary tract tumor
definition: The presence of a malignant neoplasm of the genital system.

name: Renal pelvic carcinoma
label: Renal pelvic carcinoma
definition: The presence of a carcinoma in the renal pelvis.

name: Chondrosarcoma
label: Chondrosarcoma
definition: A slowly growing malignant neoplasm derived from cartilage cells.

name: Papillary renal cell carcinoma
label: Papillary renal cell carcinoma
definition: The presence of renal cell carcinoma in the renal papilla.

name: Pituitary prolactin cell adenoma
label: Pituitary prolactin cell adenoma
definition: A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.

name: Clear cell renal cell carcinoma
label: Clear cell renal cell carcinoma
definition: A subtype of renal cell carcinoma thought to originate from mature renal tubular cells in the proximal tubule of the nehpron.

name: Duodenal adenocarcinoma
label: Duodenal adenocarcinoma
definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the duodenum.

name: Renal angiomyolipoma
label: Renal angiomyolipoma
definition: A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.|Angiomyolipoma is a benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.

name: Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma
label: Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma
definition: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary.

name: Multiple myeloma
label: Multiple myeloma
definition: A malignant plasma cell tumor growing within soft tissue or within the skeleton.

name: Benign genitourinary tract neoplasm
label: Benign genitourinary tract neoplasm
definition: A non-malignant neoplasm of the genitourinary system.

name: Parathyroid carcinoma
label: Parathyroid carcinoma
definition: A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.

name: Hurthle cell thyroid adenoma
label: Hurthle cell thyroid adenoma
definition: A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells.|Oxyphil cells of thyroid, defined by the Cell Ontology as oncocytes located in the thyroid, are also known as Hurthle cells.

name: Paranasal sinus hypoplasia
label: Paranasal sinus hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses.

name: Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy
label: Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy
definition: Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders).

name: Loss of ability to walk in first decade
label: Loss of ability to walk in first decade

name: Abnormal anterior horn cell morphology
label: Abnormal anterior horn cell morphology
definition: Any anomaly of the anterior horn cell.|Anterior horn cells are efferent neurons that passes from the central nervous system or a ganglion toward or to a muscle. They conduct nerve impulses that lead to movement of muscles.

name: Cerebral hypomyelination
label: Cerebral hypomyelination
definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system.

name: White mater abnormalities in the posterior periventricular region
label: White mater abnormalities in the posterior periventricular region

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: 4-layered lissencephaly
label: 4-layered lissencephaly
definition: A form of lissencephaly in which the cortex is thickened and has four more or less disorganized layers rather than six normal layers resulting from incomplete neuronal migration during brain development. At neuropathological examination, a 4-layered cortex consists of an upper molecular layer, a second thin cellular layer containing pyramidal neurons usually observed in layer V, a third pale poorly cellular layer and a fourth thick deep layer made up of neurons which had failed to migrate. Radiologocally would manifest as agyria or pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm.

name: Frontal polymicrogyria
label: Frontal polymicrogyria
definition: A type of polymicrogyria with a gradient of severity (anterior more severe than posterior) extending from frontal poles posteriorly to precentral gyrus and inferiorly to frontal operculum.

name: Pallor of dorsal columns of the spinal cord
label: Pallor of dorsal columns of the spinal cord

name: Severe muscular hypotonia
label: Severe muscular hypotonia
definition: A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone.

name: obsolete Severe neonatal hypotonia in males
label: obsolete Severe neonatal hypotonia in males

name: Developmental stagnation at onset of seizures
label: Developmental stagnation at onset of seizures
definition: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills, following the onset of epilepsy.

name: Congenital Horner syndrome
label: Congenital Horner syndrome
definition: A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset.

name: Absent patellar reflexes
label: Absent patellar reflexes
definition: Absence of the knee jerk reflex, which can normally be elicited by tapping the patellar tendon with a reflex hammer just below the patella.

name: Hypoplasia of the ventral pons
label: Hypoplasia of the ventral pons
definition: Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons.

name: Symmetric spinal nerve root neurofibromas
label: Symmetric spinal nerve root neurofibromas
definition: Multiple neurofibromas of the spinal nerve roots with a symmetric distribution.

name: Episodic generalized hypotonia
label: Episodic generalized hypotonia
definition: The occurrence of repeated episodes of generalized muscular hypotonia.

name: Cerebellar vermis atrophy
label: Cerebellar vermis atrophy
definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum.|This sign can be visualized with brain MRI.

name: Impaired distal proprioception
label: Impaired distal proprioception
definition: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position occuring at distal joints.

name: Severe expressive language delay
label: Severe expressive language delay
definition: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

name: Sensorimotor polyneuropathy affecting arms more than legs
label: Sensorimotor polyneuropathy affecting arms more than legs

name: Lobar holoprosencephaly
label: Lobar holoprosencephaly
definition: A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally.

name: Cerebral hypoplasia
label: Cerebral hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the cerebrum.

name: Symmetrical progressive peripheral demyelination
label: Symmetrical progressive peripheral demyelination
definition: A symmetric and progressive loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Pontocerebellar atrophy
label: Pontocerebellar atrophy
definition: Atrophy affecting the pons and the cerebellum.

name: Cerebellar hemangioblastoma
label: Cerebellar hemangioblastoma
definition: A hemangioblastoma of the cerebellum.

name: Diffuse peripheral demyelination
label: Diffuse peripheral demyelination
definition: A diffuse loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Impaired distal vibration sensation
label: Impaired distal vibration sensation
definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the distal portions of the limbs.

name: Intellectual disability, progressive
label: Intellectual disability, progressive
definition: The term progressive intellectual disability should be used if intelligence decreases/deteriorates over time.

name: Intellectual disability, borderline
label: Intellectual disability, borderline
definition: Borderline intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 70-85.|We choose to define the concept of borderline intellectual disability onthe basis of the commonly used range of 70-85 (IQ), but note that in DSM-5, IQ boundaries are no longer part of the classification.

name: Frontotemporal cerebral atrophy
label: Frontotemporal cerebral atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.

name: Congenital intracerebral calcification
label: Congenital intracerebral calcification
definition: The presence of calcium deposition within brain structures that is present already at the time of birth.

name: Frontal cortical atrophy
label: Frontal cortical atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the frontal cortex.

name: Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
label: Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
definition: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material within axons.

name: Abnormal aggressive, impulsive or violent behavior
label: Abnormal aggressive, impulsive or violent behavior

name: Axial muscle stiffness
label: Axial muscle stiffness
definition: Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature.

name: Unilateral polymicrogyria
label: Unilateral polymicrogyria
definition: Excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of one side of the brain.

name: Hypoglycemic encephalopathy
label: Hypoglycemic encephalopathy
definition: Brain damage related to a lowering of blood glucose below a critical level (around 30 mg/dl), which may lead to confusion, lethargy and delirium followed by seizures and coma. Prolonged hypoglycemia may lead to irreversible brain damage.

name: Frontoparietal cortical dysplasia
label: Frontoparietal cortical dysplasia
definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cortex of frontal lobe and the cortex of parietal lobe.

name: Congenital nystagmus
label: Congenital nystagmus
definition: Nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

name: Impaired distal tactile sensation
label: Impaired distal tactile sensation
definition: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation) on the skin of the distal limbs. This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

name: Impaired vibration sensation at ankles
label: Impaired vibration sensation at ankles
definition: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration at the ankles. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to the malleoli of the ankles.

name: Abolished vibration sense
label: Abolished vibration sense
definition: A complete loss of the ability to perceive vibration.

name: Recurrent meningitis
label: Recurrent meningitis
definition: An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.

name: Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia
label: Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia
definition: Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

name: Abnormal auditory evoked potentials
label: Abnormal auditory evoked potentials
definition: An abnormality of the auditory evoked potentials, which are used to trace the signal generated by a sound, from the cochlear nerve, through the lateral lemniscus, to the medial geniculate nucleus, and to the cortex.|Auditory brainstem response audiometry typically uses a click stimulus that generates a response from the basilar region of the cochlea.

name: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy
label: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy
definition: Proximal spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

name: Choroid plexus calcification
label: Choroid plexus calcification
definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the choroid plexus.

name: Gait instability, worse in the dark
label: Gait instability, worse in the dark

name: Necrotizing encephalopathy
label: Necrotizing encephalopathy
definition: A type of encephalopathy (brain disease, damage, or malfunction accompanied by an altered mental state) that is characterized by evidence of necrosis of brain tissue.|The disease acute necrotizing encephalopathy is characterized by acute onset encephalopathy with rapid, progressive neurologic deterioration, seizures and symmetric multifocal brain lesions. This term is kept for convenience. For new annotations, it is recommended that the specific phenotypic abnormalities be noted.

name: Sleep-wake cycle disturbance
label: Sleep-wake cycle disturbance
definition: Any abnormal alteration of an individual's circadian rhythm that affects the timing of sleeping and being awake.

name: Progressive leukoencephalopathy
label: Progressive leukoencephalopathy
definition: Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.

name: Distal sensory loss of all modalities
label: Distal sensory loss of all modalities

name: Alobar holoprosencephaly
label: Alobar holoprosencephaly
definition: A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged.

name: Dysplastic corpus callosum
label: Dysplastic corpus callosum
definition: Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.

name: Myelin-dependent gliosis
label: Myelin-dependent gliosis
definition: A type of gliosis that occurs in the vicinity of injured neurons.

name: Basal ganglia gliosis
label: Basal ganglia gliosis
definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.|Gliosis refers to a proliferation of astrocytes in an area of damage of nervous tissue.

name: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis
label: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis

name: Motor axonal neuropathy
label: Motor axonal neuropathy
definition: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.|Distal motor neuropathy is a bundled term that should not be used if more detailed information about the phenotype is available.

name: Cavitation of the basal ganglia
label: Cavitation of the basal ganglia
definition: The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.|This feature can be observed in tissue upon autopsy or in magnetic resonance tomography (MRI) images.

name: Poor fine motor coordination
label: Poor fine motor coordination
definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of small muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Fine motor skills are required to mediate movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, feet, and toes.

name: Fourth cranial nerve palsy
label: Fourth cranial nerve palsy
definition: Paralysis of the fourth cranial (trochlear) nerve manifested as weakness of the superior oblique muscle which causes vertical diplopia that is maximal when the affected eye is adducted and directed inferiorly.|The fourth cranial nerve crosses as it exits the midbrain dorsally and may be injured along its course through the intracranial space, cavernous sinus, superior orbital fissure, or orbit.

name: Poor gross motor coordination
label: Poor gross motor coordination
definition: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

name: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
label: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
definition: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.

name: Pain insensitivity
label: Pain insensitivity
definition: Inability to perceive painful stimuli.|The word Anesthesia is occasionally used to refer to lack of pain sensation, although it is more usually used to denote a medical procedure design to relieve pain.

name: Antenatal intracerebral hemorrhage
label: Antenatal intracerebral hemorrhage
definition: Cerebral hemorrhage that occurs before birth.

name: Pseudobulbar paralysis
label: Pseudobulbar paralysis
definition: Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.

name: Poorly formed metencephalon
label: Poorly formed metencephalon
definition: A morphological abnormality of the metencephalon.|The metencephalon comprises the pons and the cerebellum; contains a portion of the fourth ventricle; and the trigeminal nerve, abducens nerve, facial nerve, and a portion of the vestibulocochlear nerve. The metencephalon is part of the hindbrain.

name: Cerebral berry aneurysm
label: Cerebral berry aneurysm
definition: A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.|Saccular aneurysms are often said to have a berry-shaped appearance, whence the name.

name: Cerebellar dysplasia
label: Cerebellar dysplasia
definition: The presence of dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) of the cerebellum. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome.|Any part of the cerebellum can be dysplastic, from small focal regions within one hemisphere to abnormal foliation throughout the cerebellum. Hypoplastic cerebella are frequently also dysmorphic, as observed in tubulinopathies and cobblestone malformations.

name: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia
label: Symmetric lesions of the basal ganglia

name: Chronic lymphocytic meningitis
label: Chronic lymphocytic meningitis
definition: Meningitis that persists for more than 4 weeks, and lymphocytes are present in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Atrophy of the dentate nucleus
label: Atrophy of the dentate nucleus
definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of dentate nucleus.

name: Large basal ganglia
label: Large basal ganglia
definition: Increased size of the basal ganglia.

name: Generalized cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia
label: Generalized cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia
definition: Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.

name: Aplasia of the inferior half of the cerebellar vermis
label: Aplasia of the inferior half of the cerebellar vermis

name: Progressive language deterioration
label: Progressive language deterioration
definition: Progressive loss of previously present language abilities.

name: Disorganization of the anterior cerebellar vermis
label: Disorganization of the anterior cerebellar vermis

name: Proximal limb muscle stiffness
label: Proximal limb muscle stiffness
definition: Removed logical definition that used an anonymous class. Requested new term in UBERON: proximal musculature of limb

name: Distal peripheral sensory neuropathy
label: Distal peripheral sensory neuropathy
definition: Peripheral sensory neuropathy affecting primarily distal sensation.

name: Inferior vermis hypoplasia
label: Inferior vermis hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Thick corpus callosum
label: Thick corpus callosum
definition: Increased vertical dimension of the corpus callosum. This feature can be visualized by sagittal sections on magnetic resonance tomography imaging of the brain.

name: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
label: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
definition: Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).|This is a classic type of extrapyramidal movement disorder.

name: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
label: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
definition: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Dilated third ventricle
label: Dilated third ventricle
definition: An increase in size of the third ventricle.|The thrid ventricle is midline between the two lateral ventricles, and it communicates between them and the fourth ventricle.

name: Facial-lingual fasciculations
label: Facial-lingual fasciculations
definition: Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the face.

name: Frontoparietal polymicrogyria
label: Frontoparietal polymicrogyria
definition: An excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of the brain in the frontoparietal region.

name: Paroxysmal choreoathetosis
label: Paroxysmal choreoathetosis
definition: Episodes of choreoathetosis that can occur following triggers such as quick voluntary movements.

name: Arnold-Chiari type I malformation
label: Arnold-Chiari type I malformation
definition: Arnold-Chiari type I malformation refers to a relatively mild degree of herniation of the posteroinferior region of the cerebellum (the cerebellar tonsils) into the cervical canal with little or no displacement of the fourth ventricle.

name: Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
definition: A darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

name: Infantile encephalopathy
label: Infantile encephalopathy
definition: Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period.

name: Segmental peripheral demyelination
label: Segmental peripheral demyelination
definition: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers from segments of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Demyelinating peripheral neuropathy
label: Demyelinating peripheral neuropathy
definition: Demyelinating neuropathy is characterized by slow nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of sensory/motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.

name: Temporal cortical atrophy
label: Temporal cortical atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the temporal cortex.

name: Subcortical dementia
label: Subcortical dementia
definition: A particular type of dementia characterized by a pattern of mental defects consisting prominently of forgetfulness, slowness of thought processes, and personality or mood change.

name: Proximal amyotrophy
label: Proximal amyotrophy
definition: Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature.|Proximal amyotrophy usually has a roughly symmetric distribution.

name: Acute demyelinating polyneuropathy
label: Acute demyelinating polyneuropathy
definition: Acute progressive areflexic weakness and mild sensory changes resulting from myelin breakdown and axonal degeneration.|This is a bundled term used to refer to the symptomatology associated with the Guillain-Barre syndrome.

name: Pallidal degeneration
label: Pallidal degeneration
definition: Neurodegeneration involving the globus pallidus,a part of the basal ganglia that is involved in the regulation of voluntary movement.

name: Distal upper limb amyotrophy
label: Distal upper limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy of distal arm muscles.

name: Asymmetric limb muscle stiffness
label: Asymmetric limb muscle stiffness
definition: Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in an asymmetric pattern.

name: Progressive extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
label: Progressive extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
definition: A progressive degree of muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

name: Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter
label: Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter
definition: A diffuse loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

name: obsolete Corticospinal tract disease in lower limbs
label: obsolete Corticospinal tract disease in lower limbs

name: Periventricular heterotopia
label: Periventricular heterotopia
definition: A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.|Periventricular gray matter heterotopia can be seen for example in patients with Smith-Lemli-Opitz-Syndrome.

name: Paroxysmal dyskinesia
label: Paroxysmal dyskinesia
definition: Episodic bouts of involuntary movements with dystonic, choreic, ballistic movements, or a combination thereof. There is no loss of consciousness during the attacks.

name: Absent smooth pursuit
label: Absent smooth pursuit
definition: A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

name: Interosseus muscle atrophy
label: Interosseus muscle atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the interosseus muscles (including the palmar interossei that lie on the anterior aspect of the metacarpals, the dorsal interosseus muscles of the hand, which lie between the intercarpals, the plantar interosseus muscles, which lie underneath the metatarsal bones, and the dorsal interossei, which are located between the metatarsal bones.|This term needs disambiguation. Palmar, plantar, or dorsal interosseus muscles.

name: Peripheral hypomyelination
label: Peripheral hypomyelination
definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the peripheral nervous system.|This finding can be demonstrated by nerve biopsy.

name: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
label: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
definition: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

name: Focal lissencephaly
label: Focal lissencephaly
definition: A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex.

name: Congenital facial diplegia
label: Congenital facial diplegia
definition: Facial diplegia (that is, bilateral facial palsy) with congenital onset.

name: Neuronal loss in the cerebral cortex
label: Neuronal loss in the cerebral cortex

name: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening
label: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening
definition: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening are a form of Generalized tonic-clonic seizures that occur upon awaking.

name: Cerebral artery atherosclerosis
label: Cerebral artery atherosclerosis
definition: Atherosclerosis (HP:0002621) of a cerebral artery.

name: Diffuse white matter abnormalities
label: Diffuse white matter abnormalities
definition: This finding is demonstrated by cerebral computer tomography or magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Hemimegalencephaly
label: Hemimegalencephaly
definition: Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.|The affected hemisphere may have focal or diffuse neuronal migration defects, with areas of polymicrogyria, pachygyria, and heterotopia.

name: Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizures
label: Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizures
definition: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures that are triggered by flashing or flickering light.

name: Irregular myelin loops
label: Irregular myelin loops
definition: Presence of irregular redundant loops of focally folded myelin in a peripheral nerve.

name: Facial paralysis
label: Facial paralysis
definition: Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).|Facial paralysis can be caused by compression of the facial nerve.The main difference between facial paralysis and Palsy is cause for the paralysis can be identified, be it a tumor, infection, or nerve damage. Facial paralysis, in most cases, also appears more permanent than Bell's Palsy, with cases lasting for years to life if a patient doesn't seek treatment.

name: Lower limb amyotrophy
label: Lower limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb.

name: Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis
label: Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis
definition: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.

name: Demyelinating motor neuropathy
label: Demyelinating motor neuropathy
definition: Demyelination of peripheral motor nerves.|Demyelinating motor neuropathy demonstrates slow motor nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.

name: Macrogyria
label: Macrogyria
definition: Increased size of cerebral gyri, often associated with a moderate reduction in the number of sulci of the cerebrum.

name: Intracerebral periventricular calcifications
label: Intracerebral periventricular calcifications
definition: The presence of calcium deposition in the cerebral white matter surrounding the cerebral ventricles.

name: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
label: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
definition: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs
label: Spinocerebellar tract disease in lower limbs

name: Clusters of axonal regeneration
label: Clusters of axonal regeneration
definition: Groups of small caliber axons in peripheral nerve biospies indicative of axonal regeneration.

name: Progressive gait ataxia
label: Progressive gait ataxia
definition: A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.

name: Decreased number of small peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
label: Decreased number of small peripheral myelinated nerve fibers

name: Recurrent external ophthalmoplegia
label: Recurrent external ophthalmoplegia
definition: Alternating and recurrent weakness of the external ocular muscles.

name: Abnormal pyramidal sign
label: Abnormal pyramidal sign
definition: Functional neurological abnormalities related to dysfunction of the pyramidal tract.|Presence of these signs can indicate affection of the corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts.

name: Severe demyelination of the white matter
label: Severe demyelination of the white matter
definition: A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

name: Type II lissencephaly
label: Type II lissencephaly
definition: A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers.

name: Symmetric peripheral demyelination
label: Symmetric peripheral demyelination
definition: A symmetric loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Spinocerebellar atrophy
label: Spinocerebellar atrophy
definition: Atrophy affecting the cerebellum and the spinocerebellar tracts of the spinal cord.

name: Absent mesencephalon
label: Absent mesencephalon
definition: Agenesis of the midbrain.|Midbrain and mesencephalon are synonymous.

name: Cerebral dysmyelination
label: Cerebral dysmyelination
definition: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain.

name: Chronic axonal neuropathy
label: Chronic axonal neuropathy
definition: An abnormality characterized by chronic impairment of the normal functioning of the axons.|This feature is assayed with sural nerve biopsy and is generally taken to be indicative of neuropathy in other peripheral nerves.

name: Spinal muscular atrophy
label: Spinal muscular atrophy
definition: Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

name: Atypical absence seizure
label: Atypical absence seizure
definition: An atypical absence seizure has less abrupt onset and offset of loss of awareness than typical absence seizures. They are often associated with other features such as loss of muscle tone of the head, trunk or limbs (often a gradual slump) and subtle myoclonic jerks. Atypical absence seizures often occur in individuals with intellectual impairment.The loss of awareness may be minimal with the patient continuing an activity, but more slowly or with mistakes.

name: Recurrent bacterial meningitis
label: Recurrent bacterial meningitis
definition: An increased susceptibility to bacterial meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of bacterial meningitis.

name: Paucity of anterior horn motor neurons
label: Paucity of anterior horn motor neurons

name: Developmental stagnation
label: Developmental stagnation
definition: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

name: Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis
label: Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis
definition: Paralysis of the facial nerves on the basis of overgrowth of the cranial bones causing impingement upon the seventh cranial nerve.

name: Horizontal jerk nystagmus
label: Horizontal jerk nystagmus
definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.|Pendular nystagmus refers to the situation in which the eye appeared to oscillate with equal speed in either direction, in contrast to jerk nystagmus, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.

name: Limb fasciculations
label: Limb fasciculations
definition: Fasciculations affecting the musculature of the arms and legs.

name: Posterior fossa cyst
label: Posterior fossa cyst
definition: A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

name: CNS demyelination
label: CNS demyelination
definition: A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.|CNS demyelination affects the white matter, which consists mostly of axons with their envelope of myelin, along with two types of neuroglia: oligo-dendrocytes and astrocytes.

name: Deep white matter hypodensities
label: Deep white matter hypodensities
definition: Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the deep cerebral white matter.|See also defintion for "Periventricular white matter hypodensities". These two entities are in contra-distinction to each other.

name: Generalized dystonia
label: Generalized dystonia
definition: A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.

name: Impaired pain sensation
label: Impaired pain sensation
definition: Reduced ability to perceive painful stimuli.

name: Hemifacial seizures
label: Hemifacial seizures
definition: Focal clonic seizures affecting one side of the face.|Used to describe rolandic seizures in familial epilepsy syndromes, such as Autosomal recessive rolandic epilepsy with paroxysmal exercise-induced dystonia and writer's cramp (PMID 10072049).

name: Hypoplasia of the frontal lobes
label: Hypoplasia of the frontal lobes
definition: Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.

name: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures with focal onset
label: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures with focal onset
definition: Bilateral convulsive seizures are focal seizure with secondary bilateral motor phenomena, not primary generalized seizures.

name: Recurrent encephalopathy
label: Recurrent encephalopathy
definition: Recurrent episodes of brain dysfunction that may be triggered by factors such as metabolic disturbances or infections.

name: Hypermetric saccades
label: Hypermetric saccades
definition: A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade.

name: Lower limb muscle weakness
label: Lower limb muscle weakness
definition: Weakness of the muscles of the legs.|Inability to perform rapid, alternating movements.

name: Diffuse swelling of cerebral white matter
label: Diffuse swelling of cerebral white matter

name: Abnormal morphology of the limbic system
label: Abnormal morphology of the limbic system
definition: Any structural anomaly of the limbic system, a set of midline structures surrounding the brainstem of the mammalian brain, originally described anatomically, e.g., hippocampal formation, amygdala, hypothalamus, cingulate cortex. Although the original designation was anatomical, the limbic system has come to be associated with the system in the brain subserving emotional functions. As such, it is very poorly defined and doesn't correspond closely to the anatomical meaning any longer. [BirnLex].

name: Upper limb postural tremor
label: Upper limb postural tremor
definition: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding an arm in a fixed position.

name: Focal-onset seizure
label: Focal-onset seizure
definition: Seizures of which initial semiology indicates, or is consistent with, initial activation of only part of one cerebral hemisphere.|Partial seizures can be classified as simple (consciousness is maintained) or complex (consciousness is impaired or lost).

name: Abnormality of the pons
label: Abnormality of the pons
definition: An abnormality of the pons.|The pons is the portion of the brainstem superior to the medulla oblongata.

name: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system
label: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the central nervous system

name: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the cerebrum
label: Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the cerebrum
definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebrum, also known as the telencephalon, the largest and most highly developed part of the human brain.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

name: Corpus callosum atrophy
label: Corpus callosum atrophy
definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the corpus callosum.

name: Motor neuron atrophy
label: Motor neuron atrophy
definition: Wasting involving the motor neuron.

name: Abnormality of the septum pellucidum
label: Abnormality of the septum pellucidum
definition: An abnormality of the septum pellucidum, which is a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain.

name: Abnormality of the choroid plexus
label: Abnormality of the choroid plexus
definition: An abnormality of the choroid plexus, which is the area in the cerebral ventricles in which cerebrospinal fluid is produced by modified ependymal cells.|The choroid plexus is a structure in the ventricles of the brain where cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is produced.

name: Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials
label: Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials
definition: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

name: Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
label: Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
label: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genitourinary system.

name: Facial telangiectasia
label: Facial telangiectasia
definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp
label: Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp
definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.

name: Hypoplastic sweat glands
label: Hypoplastic sweat glands
definition: Underdevelopment of the sweat glands.

name: Postnatal-onset ichthyosiform erythroderma
label: Postnatal-onset ichthyosiform erythroderma
definition: A type of ichthyosiform erythroderma with postnatal onset.

name: Early cutaneous photosensitivity
label: Early cutaneous photosensitivity
definition: Photosensitivity of the skin occurring early in life.

name: Axillary apocrine gland hypoplasia
label: Axillary apocrine gland hypoplasia
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the apocrine sweat glands in the region of the axilla.

name: Macular atrophy
label: Macular atrophy
definition: Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the macula, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.

name: Areas of hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation that do not follow Blaschko lines
label: Areas of hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation that do not follow Blaschko lines

name: Excessive skin wrinkling on dorsum of hands and fingers
label: Excessive skin wrinkling on dorsum of hands and fingers

name: Tegumentary leishmaniasis susceptibility
label: Tegumentary leishmaniasis susceptibility
definition: Increased susceptibility to infection by the protozan parasite of the genus Leishmania.

name: obsolete Absence of subcutaneous fat over entire body except buttocks, hips, and thighs
label: obsolete Absence of subcutaneous fat over entire body except buttocks, hips, and thighs

name: Palmoplantar hyperhidrosis
label: Palmoplantar hyperhidrosis
definition: An abnormally increased perspiration on palms and soles.

name: Nevus flammeus of the forehead
label: Nevus flammeus of the forehead
definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the forehead.

name: Neonatal wrinkled skin of hands and feet
label: Neonatal wrinkled skin of hands and feet

name: Discoid lupus rash
label: Discoid lupus rash
definition: Cutaneous lesion that develops as a dry, scaly, red patch that evolves to an indurated and hyperpigmented plaque with adherent scale. Scarring may result in central white patches (loss of pigmentation) and skin atrophy.|This lesion is characterstic of discoid lupus erythematosus, but similar lesions may be observed in other diseases.

name: Alopecia totalis
label: Alopecia totalis
definition: Loss of all scalp hair.

name: Spontaneous hematomas
label: Spontaneous hematomas
definition: Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.

name: Telangiectases of the cheeks
label: Telangiectases of the cheeks
definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the cheeks.

name: Telangiectasia of the oral mucosa
label: Telangiectasia of the oral mucosa
definition: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the oral mucosa.

name: Few cafe-au-lait spots
label: Few cafe-au-lait spots
definition: The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules.

name: Generalized edema
label: Generalized edema
definition: Generalized abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

name: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
label: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
definition: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

name: Plaque-like facial hemangioma
label: Plaque-like facial hemangioma
definition: Hemangioma is a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells. This term refers to facial hemangiomas that have a plaque-like morphology.

name: Multiple cutaneous leiomyomas
label: Multiple cutaneous leiomyomas
definition: The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.

name: Mottled pigmentation of the trunk and proximal extremities
label: Mottled pigmentation of the trunk and proximal extremities

name: Partial albinism
label: Partial albinism
definition: Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs.

name: Palmoplantar blistering
label: Palmoplantar blistering
definition: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

name: Increased groin pigmentation with raindrop depigmentation
label: Increased groin pigmentation with raindrop depigmentation

name: Flexural lichenification
label: Flexural lichenification
definition: Lichenification affecting primarily flexural areas of the skin.|The parts of the skin that touch when a joint flexes (bends) are called the flexural surfaces.

name: Prominent veins on trunk
label: Prominent veins on trunk
definition: Prominent thoracic and abdominal veins.

name: Bitot spots of the conjunctiva
label: Bitot spots of the conjunctiva
definition: Keratinization of the bulbar conjunctiva near the limbus (corneoscleral junction), resulting in a raised spot.|Bitot spots can be a feature of vitamin A deficiency.

name: Sparse facial hair
label: Sparse facial hair
definition: Reduced number or density of facial hair.

name: Perifollicular hyperkeratosis
label: Perifollicular hyperkeratosis
definition: Increased amount of keratin (visible as white scales) surrounding hair follicles.

name: Palmoplantar cutis gyrata
label: Palmoplantar cutis gyrata
definition: Cutis gyrata of palms and soles.

name: Periarticular subcutaneous nodules
label: Periarticular subcutaneous nodules
definition: Subcutaneous nodules that are located in the vicinity of joints.

name: Axillary and groin hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation
label: Axillary and groin hyperpigmentation and hypopigmentation

name: Congenital bullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
label: Congenital bullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
definition: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin that presents at birth or shortly thereafter with generalized erythema, blistering, erosions, and peeling. In the subsequent months, erythema and blistering improves but patients go on to develop hyperkeratotic scaling that is especially prominent along the joint flexures, neck, hands and feet.|Epidermolytic hyperkeratosis can refer to the disease caused by mutations in the genes keratin 1 or keratin 10, but is here used to refer to the characteristic skin manifestations as a phenotypic feature.

name: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
label: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
definition: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

name: Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
label: Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
definition: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

name: Decreased sweating due to autonomic dysfunction
label: Decreased sweating due to autonomic dysfunction

name: Absence of subcutaneous fat
label: Absence of subcutaneous fat
definition: Lack of subcutaneous adipose tissue.

name: Diffuse telangiectasia
label: Diffuse telangiectasia
definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) with a diffuse localization.

name: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas
label: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas

name: Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules
label: Discrete 2 to 5-mm hyper- and hypopigmented macules

name: Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
label: Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
definition: Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction.

name: Recurrent staphylococcal infections
label: Recurrent staphylococcal infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to staphylococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of staphylococcal infections.

name: Decreased number of sweat glands
label: Decreased number of sweat glands
definition: The presence of fewer than normal sweat glands.

name: Streaks of hyperkeratosis along each finger onto the palm
label: Streaks of hyperkeratosis along each finger onto the palm

name: Follicular hyperkeratosis
label: Follicular hyperkeratosis
definition: A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum.

name: Congenital absence of skin of limbs
label: Congenital absence of skin of limbs

name: Punctate palmar hyperkeratosis
label: Punctate palmar hyperkeratosis
definition: Tiny bumps of thickened skin (hyperkeratosis) on the palms of the hands.

name: Edema of the dorsum of hands
label: Edema of the dorsum of hands
definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.

name: Redundant skin on fingers
label: Redundant skin on fingers
definition: Loose and sagging skin of the fingers.

name: Palmoplantar cutis laxa
label: Palmoplantar cutis laxa
definition: Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.

name: obsolete Lack of subcutaneous fatty tissue
label: obsolete Lack of subcutaneous fatty tissue

name: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin
label: Yellow subcutaneous tissue covered by thin, scaly skin

name: Congenital posterior occipital alopecia
label: Congenital posterior occipital alopecia
definition: Loss of hair in the occipital region of the scalp with congenital onset.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita of midline scalp vertex
label: Aplasia cutis congenita of midline scalp vertex

name: Severe photosensitivity
label: Severe photosensitivity
definition: A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.

name: Frontal cutaneous lipoma
label: Frontal cutaneous lipoma
definition: Presence of a cutaneous lipoma on the forehead.

name: Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest
label: Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest
definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the anterior chest.

name: Piebaldism
label: Piebaldism
definition: Piebaldism is characterized by stable and persistent, well-circumscribed depigmented patches present at birth affecting the skin of the face, trunk, and extremities in a symmetrical distribution.

name: Palmoplantar keratosis with erythema and scale
label: Palmoplantar keratosis with erythema and scale

name: Desquamation of skin soon after birth
label: Desquamation of skin soon after birth

name: Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin
label: Confetti hypopigmentation pattern of lower leg skin

name: Plantar hyperkeratosis
label: Plantar hyperkeratosis
definition: Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot.

name: Telangiectases in sun-exposed and nonexposed skin
label: Telangiectases in sun-exposed and nonexposed skin

name: Multiple cafe-au-lait spots
label: Multiple cafe-au-lait spots
definition: The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots.

name: Generalized seborrheic dermatitis
label: Generalized seborrheic dermatitis
definition: Seborrheic dermatitis that is not localized to any one particular region.

name: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans
label: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans
