definition: Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans (HLP), also known as Flegel disease, is a keratinization abnormality characterized by small, asymptomatic erythematous papules that leave characteristic punctate bleeding when they become detached. The lesions generally occur symmetrically along the top of the foot and on the legs, appearing more rarely on the arms, forearms, palms, and soles, and even on the oral mucosa.

name: Late onset atopic dermatitis
label: Late onset atopic dermatitis
definition: A form of atopic dermatitis with onset in adulthood characterized by atopic red face, chronic lichenified eczema on the trunk, subacute or psoriasiform dermatitis.

name: Reticular hyperpigmentation
label: Reticular hyperpigmentation
definition: Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
label: Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
definition: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs.|In future versions of the HPO this term will be made obsolete and will be replaced by terms for Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk and a term for Aplasia cutis congenita on the limbs.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over posterior parietal area
label: Aplasia cutis congenita over posterior parietal area

name: Aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands
label: Aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands
definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands.

name: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
label: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
definition: The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain.

name: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
label: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
definition: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

name: Hypoproteinemic edema
label: Hypoproteinemic edema
definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body because of decreased osmotic pressure of plasma (hypoproteinemia).

name: Spinous keratoses of palms and soles
label: Spinous keratoses of palms and soles

name: Nevus flammeus nuchae
label: Nevus flammeus nuchae
definition: Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the neck. This is one of the most common birthmarks and present in approximately 25% of all newborns.|The salmon patch is the most common capillary malformation, occurring in up to 50% of all neonates. It is a pinkish macule that typically affects the back of the neck (stork bite) or the glabella (angel's kiss), although it can affect the eyelids, the nose, the upper lip, and the sacral area.

name: Subcutaneous calcification
label: Subcutaneous calcification
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in subcutaneous tissue (i.e., the the lowermost layer of the integument).

name: Cutaneous leiomyoma
label: Cutaneous leiomyoma
definition: The presence of leiomyoma of the skin.|Cutaneous leiomyomata are benign soft tissue neoplasms that arise from smooth muscle cells in the skin.

name: Mandibular osteomyelitis
label: Mandibular osteomyelitis
definition: Osteomyelitis of the lower jaw.

name: Bilateral microphthalmos
label: Bilateral microphthalmos
definition: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.

name: Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy
label: Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy
definition: An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates.|Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy is caused by infarction of the laminar or retrolaminar portion of the optic nerve head supplied by the short posterior ciliary arteries. Clinically NAION is characterized by sudden, usually painless, loss of vision in one or both eyes. Examination findings include decreased visual acuity, a visual field defect, decreased colour vision, a relative afferent pupillary defect, and optic disc swelling.

name: Dyschromatopsia
label: Dyschromatopsia
definition: A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments.

name: Congenital stationary night blindness
label: Congenital stationary night blindness
definition: A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.|Congenital stationary night blindness is prinicipally the result of dysfunction of the rod photoreceptors.

name: Peripheral tractional retinal detachment
label: Peripheral tractional retinal detachment
definition: Tractional retinal detachment at the periphery of the retina.

name: Absent lower eyelashes
label: Absent lower eyelashes
definition: Lack of eyelashes on the lower lid.

name: Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
label: Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
definition: Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles.

name: Punctate cataract
label: Punctate cataract
definition: A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens.

name: Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
label: Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium
definition: Sharply demarcated, congenital hyperpigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium.|This feature is found in around 3-5% of the population and is of no functional significance.

name: Eversion of lateral third of lower eyelids
label: Eversion of lateral third of lower eyelids

name: Lacrimal gland aplasia
label: Lacrimal gland aplasia
definition: A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland.

name: Diffuse nuclear cataract
label: Diffuse nuclear cataract
definition: Opacity of the entire lens nucleus.

name: obsolete Decreased retinal pigmentation with dispersion
label: obsolete Decreased retinal pigmentation with dispersion

name: Curly eyelashes
label: Curly eyelashes
definition: Abnormally curly or curved eyelashes.

name: Peripheral cystoid retinal degeneration
label: Peripheral cystoid retinal degeneration
definition: Degenerative changes of the peripheral retina consisting of close-packed tiny cystic spaces at the outer plexiform/inner nuclear retinal level. The degeneration is very common in adult eyes and starts adjacent to the ora serrata and extends circumferentially and posteriorly.

name: Abnormal vestibulo-ocular reflex
label: Abnormal vestibulo-ocular reflex
definition: An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.

name: Hypoplasia of the iris
label: Hypoplasia of the iris
definition: Congenital underdevelopment of the iris.

name: Vitelliform-like macular lesions
label: Vitelliform-like macular lesions
definition: Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.

name: Lacrimal duct stenosis
label: Lacrimal duct stenosis
definition: Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).

name: Abnormal pupillary function
label: Abnormal pupillary function
definition: A functional abnormality of the pupil.|It is preferable to describe the functional defect precisely.

name: Unilateral ptosis
label: Unilateral ptosis
definition: A unilateral form of ptosis.

name: Undetectable light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
label: Undetectable light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
definition: Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.

name: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
label: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
definition: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.

name: Hypoplasia of the lower eyelids
label: Hypoplasia of the lower eyelids
definition: Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.

name: Ocular anterior segment dysgenesis
label: Ocular anterior segment dysgenesis
definition: Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.|In anterior segment mesenchymal ocular dysgenesis (ASMOD), multiple tissues are affected, including the iris, cornea, and lens as well as the Schlemm's canal and trabecular meshwork drainage structures located at the anterior segment angle where the iris and cornea meet. These abnormalities may result from a primary defect in the migration and/or differentiation of the mesenchymal cells that contribute to development of the cornea, iris, and drainage structures.

name: Paroxysmal involuntary eye movements
label: Paroxysmal involuntary eye movements
definition: Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements.

name: Congenital aphakia
label: Congenital aphakia
definition: Absence of the crystalline lens of the eye as a result of a developmental defect.

name: Uveal melanoma
label: Uveal melanoma
definition: A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).|WIth intraocular melanoma, the melanoma originates from melanocytic cells in the uveal layer, comprising the iris, ciliary body, and choroid.

name: Chronic irritative conjunctivitis
label: Chronic irritative conjunctivitis
definition: A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes.

name: Flat cornea
label: Flat cornea
definition: Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.

name: Saccular conjunctival dilatations
label: Saccular conjunctival dilatations
definition: Presence of multiple dilatations (sac-like outpouchings) in the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial atrophy
label: Retinal pigment epithelial atrophy
definition: Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.

name: Opacification of the corneal epithelium
label: Opacification of the corneal epithelium
definition: Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium.

name: Congenital miosis
label: Congenital miosis
definition: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset.

name: Iris hypopigmentation
label: Iris hypopigmentation
definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.

name: Chorioretinal dysplasia
label: Chorioretinal dysplasia
definition: Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.

name: Lacrimal gland hypoplasia
label: Lacrimal gland hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.

name: Enlarged lacrimal glands
label: Enlarged lacrimal glands
definition: Abnormally big lacrimal glands.

name: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
label: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
definition: Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).

name: Hypoplasia of the fovea
label: Hypoplasia of the fovea
definition: Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.|A dull foveal reflex is an unusual reflex of the foveal region on fundoscopy that may indicate hypoplasia of the fovea.

name: Macular dystrophy
label: Macular dystrophy
definition: Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.

name: obsolete Slitlike anterior chamber angles in children
label: obsolete Slitlike anterior chamber angles in children

name: Opacification of the corneal stroma
label: Opacification of the corneal stroma
definition: Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.

name: Pericentral scotoma
label: Pericentral scotoma
definition: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point.

name: Retinal telangiectasia
label: Retinal telangiectasia
definition: Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.

name: Deep anterior chamber
label: Deep anterior chamber
definition: Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.|Deep anterior chamber can be seen in disorders such as congenital microphakia and buphthalmos.

name: Optic disc hypoplasia
label: Optic disc hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.

name: Central retinal vessel vascular tortuosity
label: Central retinal vessel vascular tortuosity
definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of retinal blood vessels (arteries, arterioles, veins, venules).

name: Impaired smooth pursuit
label: Impaired smooth pursuit
definition: An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

name: Vitreoretinopathy
label: Vitreoretinopathy
definition: Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.

name: Hypoplasia of the ciliary body
label: Hypoplasia of the ciliary body
definition: Underdevelopment of the ciliary body.

name: Chorioretinal scar
label: Chorioretinal scar
definition: Fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound (i.e., a scar) located in the choroid and retina or the eye.

name: Posterior retinal neovascularization
label: Posterior retinal neovascularization
definition: A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.

name: Cortical pulverulent cataract
label: Cortical pulverulent cataract
definition: A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.

name: obsolete Butterfly retinal pigment epithelial dystrophy
label: obsolete Butterfly retinal pigment epithelial dystrophy

name: Posterior subcapsular cataract
label: Posterior subcapsular cataract
definition: A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule.

name: Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
label: Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium
definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the retinal pigment epithelium present in small, isolated areas.

name: Granular macular appearance
label: Granular macular appearance
definition: Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.

name: Anterior cortical cataract
label: Anterior cortical cataract
definition: A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens.

name: Conjunctival whitish salt-like deposits
label: Conjunctival whitish salt-like deposits
definition: The presence of whitish deposits in the conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis.

name: Increased axial length of the globe
label: Increased axial length of the globe
definition: Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean.

name: Granular corneal dystrophy
label: Granular corneal dystrophy
definition: The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.

name: Monochromacy
label: Monochromacy
definition: Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.|Rod monochromacy is the condition of having only rods in the retina. A rod monochromat is truly unable to see any color and can see only shades of grey.

name: Horizontal pendular nystagmus
label: Horizontal pendular nystagmus
definition: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.|Pendular nystagmus refers to the situation in which the eye appeared to oscillate with equal speed in either direction, in contrast to jerk nystagmus, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.

name: Herpetiform corneal ulceration
label: Herpetiform corneal ulceration
definition: The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.

name: Nongranulomatous uveitis
label: Nongranulomatous uveitis
definition: A form of uveitis that is not associated with the formation of granulomas.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial mottling
label: Retinal pigment epithelial mottling
definition: Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Abnormal distribution of retinal arterioles and venules
label: Abnormal distribution of retinal arterioles and venules

name: Horizontal supranuclear gaze palsy
label: Horizontal supranuclear gaze palsy
definition: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

name: Central heterochromia
label: Central heterochromia
definition: The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.

name: Presenile cataracts
label: Presenile cataracts
definition: Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual.|Presenile cataract is rare. Some cases have a hereditary cause; others result from trauma or chromosomal, endocrine, metabolic, or systemic disorders. Many cases are idiopathic. The term 'presenile' is used differently in the literature. The HPO defines it to mean a cataract that is diagnosed after the age of 20 years but before old age.

name: Lacrimal punctal atresia
label: Lacrimal punctal atresia
definition: Congenital absence or closure of the opening of the lacrimal punctum.

name: Total ophthalmoplegia
label: Total ophthalmoplegia
definition: Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.

name: obsolete Cataracts develop in second or third decade
label: obsolete Cataracts develop in second or third decade

name: Adult-onset night blindness
label: Adult-onset night blindness
definition: Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood.

name: Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
label: Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
definition: Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

name: Progressive cataract
label: Progressive cataract
definition: A kind of cataract that progresses with age.

name: Progressive ptosis
label: Progressive ptosis
definition: A progressive form of ptosis.

name: Long upper eyelashes
label: Long upper eyelashes
definition: Increased length of the upper eyelashes.

name: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
label: Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor
definition: Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.

name: Punctate opacification of the cornea
label: Punctate opacification of the cornea
definition: Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.

name: Chorioretinal lacunae
label: Chorioretinal lacunae
definition: Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina.|A chorioretinal lacuna can have the appearance of a pseudodisk in the retina.

name: Congenital horizontal nystagmus
label: Congenital horizontal nystagmus
definition: Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

name: Retinal calcification
label: Retinal calcification
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in the retina.

name: Restrictive partial external ophthalmoplegia
label: Restrictive partial external ophthalmoplegia
definition: Fibrosis of only some of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position.

name: Choroidal hemangioma
label: Choroidal hemangioma
definition: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.|Choroidal hemangiomas can cause hyperopia or other visual symptoms such as blurred or distorted vision. Some choroidal hemangiomas are asymptomatic.

name: Almond-shaped palpebral fissure
label: Almond-shaped palpebral fissure
definition: A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point.|The almond configuration tends to dissipate with time, as the surrounding tissues (e.g., eyelid, nasal bridge) grow.

name: Congenital blindness
label: Congenital blindness
definition: Blindness with onset at birth.

name: Allergic conjunctivitis
label: Allergic conjunctivitis
definition: Allergic Conjunctivitis is an allergic inflammation of the conjunctiva.

name: Slowed horizontal saccades
label: Slowed horizontal saccades
definition: An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements.|Saccades are rapid eye movements that align the fovea with the target.

name: Absent extraocular muscles
label: Absent extraocular muscles
definition: Congenital absence of the extraocular muscles.

name: Iridescent posterior subcapsular cataract
label: Iridescent posterior subcapsular cataract
definition: A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color.

name: Hypoplasia of the lacrimal punctum
label: Hypoplasia of the lacrimal punctum
definition: Underdevelopment of the lacrimal puncta.

name: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
label: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
definition: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).

name: Retinal nonattachment
label: Retinal nonattachment
definition: Failure of attachment of the retina during development.

name: Vitreous hemorrhage
label: Vitreous hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.|The most common causes include proliferative diabetic retinopathy, vitreous detachment with or without retinal breaks, and trauma. Less common causes include vascular occlusive disease, retinal arterial macroaneurysm, hemoglobinopathies, age-related macular degeneration, intraocular tumors, and others.

name: Paravenous chorioretinal atrophy
label: Paravenous chorioretinal atrophy
definition: Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.

name: Ocular hypertension
label: Ocular hypertension
definition: Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean.

name: Reticular retinal dystrophy
label: Reticular retinal dystrophy
definition: A type of of patterned retinal dystrophy that shows a reticular pattern of pigmentation.

name: Polymorphous posterior corneal dystrophy
label: Polymorphous posterior corneal dystrophy
definition: This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma.

name: obsolete Small anterior lens surface opacities
label: obsolete Small anterior lens surface opacities

name: Tractional retinal detachment
label: Tractional retinal detachment
definition: A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.

name: Lacrimal duct aplasia
label: Lacrimal duct aplasia
definition: A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.

name: Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials
label: Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials
definition: Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.

name: Peripheral retinal detachment
label: Peripheral retinal detachment
definition: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina.

name: Bilateral congenital mydriasis
label: Bilateral congenital mydriasis
definition: Congenital abnormal dilation of the pupil on both sides.

name: Broad lateral eyebrow
label: Broad lateral eyebrow
definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the lateral eyebrow.

name: Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
label: Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia
definition: Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

name: Reticular pigmentary degeneration
label: Reticular pigmentary degeneration
definition: A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus.

name: Blue cone monochromacy
label: Blue cone monochromacy
definition: A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.

name: Internal ophthalmoplegia
label: Internal ophthalmoplegia
definition: Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.|Paralysis of the internal ocular muscles, the iris and ciliary apparatus.

name: Congenital stapes ankylosis
label: Congenital stapes ankylosis
definition: A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.

name: Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure
label: Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure
definition: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.

name: Pericentral retinitis pigmentosa
label: Pericentral retinitis pigmentosa
definition: A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.

name: Dense posterior cortical cataract
label: Dense posterior cortical cataract
definition: A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.

name: Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
label: Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
definition: Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).

name: Corneal opacity
label: Corneal opacity
definition: A reduction of corneal clarity.

name: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression
label: Optic atrophy from cranial nerve compression

name: Pattern dystrophy of the retina
label: Pattern dystrophy of the retina
definition: A spectrum of fundoscopic appearances characterized by the development of a variety of patterns of deposits predominantly in the macular area. The deposits are typically bilateral, relatively symmetrical, yellow/white and associated with changes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium. With time, retinal atrophy may occur. A number of pattern dystrophy subtypes have been described including butterfly-shaped dystrophy, reticular dystrophy (net-like pattern) and fundus pulverulentus (granular, mottled pigmentation).

name: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
label: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.

name: Lamellar cataract
label: Lamellar cataract
definition: A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.

name: Retinal dysplasia
label: Retinal dysplasia
definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.|This feature is a congenital developmental anomaly of the retina characterized by abnormal growth and differentiation. The retina contains numerous tubular structures and rosettes. Retinal dysplasia (synonym: retinal dysgenesis) is often accompanied by retinal detachment and micropthalmos, but the latter features should be coded separately.

name: Hypometric horizontal saccades
label: Hypometric horizontal saccades
definition: Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

name: Cerulean cataract
label: Cerulean cataract
definition: Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary.

name: Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
label: Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
definition: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

name: obsolete Concentric narrowing of visual field
label: obsolete Concentric narrowing of visual field

name: Electronegative electroretinogram
label: Electronegative electroretinogram
definition: A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).|Flashes will elicit an a-wave with an initial negative deflection followed by a b-wave with positive deflection. This feature refers to a reduction in the amplitude primarily of the b-wave.

name: Retinal arteriolar occlusion
label: Retinal arteriolar occlusion
definition: Blockage of retinal arteriole, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina.

name: Macular hypopigmentation
label: Macular hypopigmentation
definition: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

name: Intraretinal exudate
label: Intraretinal exudate
definition: Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself.

name: Hypoplastic iris stroma
label: Hypoplastic iris stroma
definition: Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.

name: Malformed lacrimal duct
label: Malformed lacrimal duct
definition: Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.

name: Peripheral visual field loss
label: Peripheral visual field loss
definition: Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.

name: Decreased corneal reflex
label: Decreased corneal reflex
definition: An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.

name: Foveal hyperpigmentation
label: Foveal hyperpigmentation
definition: Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.

name: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
label: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
definition: Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.

name: Peripheral opacification of the cornea
label: Peripheral opacification of the cornea
definition: Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.

name: Central fundal arteriolar microaneurysms
label: Central fundal arteriolar microaneurysms
definition: Microscopic aneurysms of the retinal arterioles near the central part of the fundus, visible as small round dark red dots on the retinal surface (not arising from visible vessels) that are by definition less than the diameter of the major optic veins as they cross the optic disc.

name: obsolete Depigmented lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium
label: obsolete Depigmented lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium

name: Superior lens subluxation
label: Superior lens subluxation
definition: Partial dislocation of the lens in a superior direction.

name: Cone dystrophy
label: Cone dystrophy
definition: Inherited progressive cone degeneration.

name: Cystoid macular degeneration
label: Cystoid macular degeneration
definition: A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula.

name: Posterior Y-sutural cataract
label: Posterior Y-sutural cataract
definition: A type of sutural cataract in which the opacity follows the posterior Y suture.

name: Abnormal iris pigmentation
label: Abnormal iris pigmentation
definition: Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

name: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa
label: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa
definition: Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is form of retinal degeneration characterized by areas of retinal/chorioretinal degeneration with pigment migration in the macular area (in contrast to retinitis pigmentosa which, at early disease stages, predominantly affects the retinal periphery).

name: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
label: Absent anterior chamber of the eye
definition: Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect.

name: Aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands
label: Aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.

name: Retinal arteriolar constriction
label: Retinal arteriolar constriction
definition: Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.|Usually after the first branch, the retinal arteries contain no elastic fibers and the term retinal arteriole is more appropriate. The main changes seen in diseases such as hypertension affect mainly the retinal arterioles rather than the retinal artery.

name: Abnormal retinal vascular morphology
label: Abnormal retinal vascular morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.

name: Abnormality of the vasculature of the eye
label: Abnormality of the vasculature of the eye

name: Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe
label: Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe
definition: An abnormality of the line of Schwalbe.|Schwalbe's line is the anatomical line found on the posterior surface of the cornea, delineating the outer limit of the corneal endothelium layer.

name: Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
label: Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
definition: An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.|There are six extraocular muscles that control the movements of the eye.

name: Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
label: Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
definition: An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.

name: obsolete Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium
label: obsolete Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

name: Retinal fold
label: Retinal fold
definition: A wrinkle of retinal tissue projecting outward from the surface of the retina and visible as a line on fundoscopy.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the iris
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the iris
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the iris.

name: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
label: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
definition: Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the uvea
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the uvea
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fovea
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fovea
definition: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the lens
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the lens
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the lens.

name: Ichthyosis
label: Ichthyosis
definition: An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.|The ichthyoses are a group of skin diseases characterized by drying and scaling of skin with the accumulation of thick scales and cracks that may be painful or bleed. The abnormality in ichthyosis lies in am imbalance in the normal lifecycle of skin in which growth is matched with dying and shedding of skin cells. In ichthyosis, skin cells reproduce at a rate faster than dead skin cells can be shed or reproduce at a normal rate with a reduction in the rate of shedding. Either abnormality leads to a build up of dry and scaly skin. Note that this term refers to the morphological abnormality of the skin and not the disorder.

name: Abnormal blistering of the skin
label: Abnormal blistering of the skin
definition: The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.|A bulla is a large vesicle described as a rounded or irregularly shaped blister containing serous or seropurulent fluid, equal to or greater than 10mm.

name: Neoplasm of the skin
label: Neoplasm of the skin
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.

name: Sparse hair
label: Sparse hair
definition: Reduced density of hairs.|This term applies if the number of hair shafts per unit area is reduced. The term fine hair is used to describe hair with a reduced diameter.

name: Maternal hypertension
label: Maternal hypertension
definition: Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.

name: Maternal virilization in pregnancy
label: Maternal virilization in pregnancy
definition: Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.

name: Low maternal serum estriol
label: Low maternal serum estriol
definition: An abnormally high concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

name: Progressive pes cavus
label: Progressive pes cavus
definition: The development of Pes cavus that is progressive with age.

name: Osteoporotic tarsals
label: Osteoporotic tarsals
definition: Reduction in bone mineral density affecting any or all of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Absent fifth metatarsal
label: Absent fifth metatarsal
definition: A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence of the fifth metatarsal bone.

name: Hallux varus
label: Hallux varus
definition: Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.

name: Pes valgus
label: Pes valgus
definition: An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.|Valgus refers to the twisting outward of a bone or joint is twisted outward from the center of the body, whereas varus is a twisting toward the center of the body.

name: Nonossified fifth metatarsal
label: Nonossified fifth metatarsal
definition: The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.

name: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
label: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
definition: An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.

name: Short 4th toe
label: Short 4th toe
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.

name: Widely spaced toes
label: Widely spaced toes
definition: An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.|This description is based on the width of the gap between the toes. It is usually used when the width of the toes remains normal rather than to describe a situation where the toes are thin or narrow. This term should not be used for the situation where the finding is limited to a gap between T1,2 (see Sandal gap).

name: Osteolysis of talus
label: Osteolysis of talus
definition: Osteolysis affecting the talus.

name: Medially deviated second toe
label: Medially deviated second toe
definition: Medial deviation of the second toe.

name: Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities
label: Expanded metatarsals with widened medullary cavities

name: Delayed tarsal ossification
label: Delayed tarsal ossification
definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Plantar crease between first and second toes
label: Plantar crease between first and second toes
definition: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.

name: Advanced tarsal ossification
label: Advanced tarsal ossification
definition: Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Metatarsal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
label: Metatarsal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis
definition: Osteosclerosis of the endosteal surface of the diaphyses (shafts) of the metatarsal bones.

name: Clinodactyly of the 3rd toe
label: Clinodactyly of the 3rd toe
definition: Bending or curvature of a third toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Flexion limitation of toes
label: Flexion limitation of toes
definition: Limitation of the ability to bend the toes.

name: Calcaneonavicular fusion
label: Calcaneonavicular fusion
definition: Synostosis of the calcaneus with the navicular bone.

name: Talipes calcaneovarus
label: Talipes calcaneovarus
definition: A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.

name: Bipartite calcaneus
label: Bipartite calcaneus
definition: A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification.

name: Tarsal stippling
label: Tarsal stippling
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones.

name: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus
label: Medial rotation of the medial malleolus

name: Irregular tarsal ossification
label: Irregular tarsal ossification
definition: Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Equinus calcaneus
label: Equinus calcaneus
definition: Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.

name: Delayed calcaneal ossification
label: Delayed calcaneal ossification
definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus.

name: Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.

name: Elevated serum transaminases during infections
label: Elevated serum transaminases during infections
definition: Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

name: Prolonged prothrombin time
label: Prolonged prothrombin time
definition: Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.|The prothrombin time (PT) and the activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) are the most requested tests to investigate patients with congenital or acquired coagulopathies and drug monitoring. They are defined as the time (seconds) needed to clot platelet-poor plasma upon addition of coagulation triggers, such as tissue factor in complex with phospholipids and calcium chloride (in the PT), or negatively charged phospholipids-activators and calcium chloride (in the APTT). They can hence be considered as global coagulation tests sensitive to deficiencies of many coagulation factors. In brief, they are both sensitive to factor X, V, II and fibrinogen, whereas the PT is only sensitive to factor VII deficiency and the APTT is sensitive to pre-kallikrein, high molecular weight kininogen (HMWK), factor XII, XI, IX and VIII deficiencies. Normal plasma in the PT clots approximately within 10-12 s upon triggering coagulation, and the normal reference range is (usually) narrow. PT results have been reported as clotting time, percentage activity, PT-ratio (patient-to-normal clotting time) and as international normalized ratio (INR). The INR scale has been devised to harmonize results stemming from different thromboplastins from patients on treatment with vitamin K antagonists. Some recommend abandoning the approach of using percentage activity to assess PR.

name: Periodic hypokalemic paresis
label: Periodic hypokalemic paresis
definition: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.

name: Mucopolysacchariduria
label: Mucopolysacchariduria
definition: Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.|This finding is suggestive of the diagnosis of a mucopolysaccharidosis.

name: Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia
label: Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia
definition: Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is defined as the combination of a normal low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol in the face of an increased LDL apolipoprotein B (apoB) protein.

name: 3-hydroxydicarboxylic aciduria
label: 3-hydroxydicarboxylic aciduria
definition: An increase in the level of 3-hydroxydicarboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Absent leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
label: Absent leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
definition: A decrease in alkaline phosphatase activity measured within leukocytes below detectable levels .

name: Asymptomatic hyperammonemia
label: Asymptomatic hyperammonemia
definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood not associated with symptoms such as encephalopathy.

name: Decreased circulating cortisol level
label: Decreased circulating cortisol level
definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.

name: Decreased proportion circulating T-helper cells
label: Decreased proportion circulating T-helper cells
definition: Reduced proportion of helper T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Decreased beta-galactosidase activity
label: Decreased beta-galactosidase activity
definition: Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma.

name: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation
label: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation

name: Reduced factor VII activity
label: Reduced factor VII activity
definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X.

name: Decreased Arden ratio of electrooculogram
label: Decreased Arden ratio of electrooculogram
definition: An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.

name: Mildly elevated creatine kinase
label: Mildly elevated creatine kinase
definition:
'has part' some 
('increased amount' and ('inheres in' some blood) and (towards some IMR_0002602) and ('has modifier' some 'mild intensity') and ('has modifier' some abnormal))

name: Abetalipoproteinemia
label: Abetalipoproteinemia
definition: An absence of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.|Beta-lipoprotein cholesterol is a synonym for low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol.

name: Precocious puberty in males
label: Precocious puberty in males
definition: The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys.

name: Adrenocortical cytomegaly
label: Adrenocortical cytomegaly
definition: The presence of large polyhedral cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei in the adrenal cortex.|This feature is common in Beckwith Wiedemann syndrome.

name: Absence of secondary sex characteristics
label: Absence of secondary sex characteristics
definition: No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty.

name: Insulin insensitivity
label: Insulin insensitivity
definition: Decreased sensitivity toward insulin.

name: Thyroid agenesis
label: Thyroid agenesis
definition: The congenital absence of the thyroid gland.

name: Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas
label: Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas
definition: The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas.

name: Congenital hypoparathyroidism
label: Congenital hypoparathyroidism
definition: Deficiency of parathyroid hormone with congenital onset.

name: Primary hyperparathyroidism
label: Primary hyperparathyroidism
definition: A type of hyperparathyroidism caused by a primary abnormality of the parathyroid glands (e.g., adenoma, carcinoma, hyperplasia). Primary hyperparathyroidism is associated with hyercalcemia.

name: Reduced circulating prolactin concentration
label: Reduced circulating prolactin concentration
definition: A reduced level of prolactin in the blood circulation. Prolactin is a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production.

name: Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor
label: Precocious puberty with Sertoli cell tumor

name: Insulin-dependent but ketosis-resistant diabetes
label: Insulin-dependent but ketosis-resistant diabetes
definition: Ketosis-resistant diabetes is a synonym for type II diabetes. This term thus refers to a form of type II diabetes in which patients are dependent on insulin.

name: Primary adrenal insufficiency
label: Primary adrenal insufficiency
definition: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.|Deficiency of both glucocorticoids and mineralocorticoids.

name: Parathyroid hyperplasia
label: Parathyroid hyperplasia
definition: Hyperplasia of the parathyroid gland.|An absolute increase in the mass of the parenchymal cells of the parathyroid gland leading to an enlargement of the parathyroid glands.

name: Premature ovarian insufficiency
label: Premature ovarian insufficiency
definition: Amenorrhea due to loss of ovarian function before the age of 40. Primary ovarian inssuficiency (POI) is a state of female hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It can manifest as primary amenorrhea with onset before menarche or secondary amenorrhea.|The causes of primary ovarian insuficiency (POI) include chromosomal and genetic defects, autoimmune processes, chemotherapy, radiation, infections and surgery, but many are unidentified (idiopathic). The age of 40 is set by convention but is supported by clinical observations. From a statistical point of view, the age limit of 40 is approximately two standard deviations (SD) below the average age at natural menopause (50 plus/minus 4 years).

name: Parathyroid agenesis
label: Parathyroid agenesis
definition: Aplasia of the parathyroid gland.

name: Gonadotropin deficiency
label: Gonadotropin deficiency
definition: A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

name: Decreased serum estradiol
label: Decreased serum estradiol
definition: A reduction below normal concentration of estradiol in the circulation.

name: Adrenal gland dysgenesis
label: Adrenal gland dysgenesis
definition: Abnormal development of the adrenal gland.

name: Adrenal hyperplasia
label: Adrenal hyperplasia
definition: Enlargement of the adrenal gland.

name: Compensated hypothyroidism
label: Compensated hypothyroidism
definition: Condition associated with a raised serum concentration of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) but a normal serum free thyroxine (FT4).

name: Androgen insufficiency
label: Androgen insufficiency
definition: Insufficient amount of androgenic activity.

name: Pituitary resistance to thyroid hormone
label: Pituitary resistance to thyroid hormone
definition: A condition in which the pituitary gland is partially resistant to thyroid hormone, so that it continues to secrete thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) until the blood level of thyroid hormone rises higher than normal.

name: Thyroid lymphangiectasia
label: Thyroid lymphangiectasia
definition: The presence of lymphangiectasis of the thyroid gland.|A stretching and widening of the lymphatic vessels of the thyroid gland.

name: Elevated circulating follicle stimulating hormone level
label: Elevated circulating follicle stimulating hormone level
definition: An elevated concentration of follicle-stimulating hormone in the blood.

name: Decreased circulating progesterone
label: Decreased circulating progesterone
definition: An reduced concentration of progesterone in the blood.|Progesterone is a steroid hormone secreted by the corpus luteum after ovulation during the second half of the menstrual cycle.

name: Hypothalamic hypothyroidism
label: Hypothalamic hypothyroidism
definition:
A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyrotropin-releasing hormone activity.|The simultaneous occurrence a low thyroid hormone level and a normal or low serum level of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) in a patient with hypothyroidism establishes the diagnosis of secondary hypothyroidism. The administration of thyrotropin releasing hormone (TRH), which is normally synthesized and released by the hypothalamus, enables the physician to distinguish between pituitary and hypothalamic causes of hypothyroidism.
TRH will normally cause the release of TSH from the pituitary gland. When the hypothalamus does not synthesize or release TRH, the administration of exogenous TRH will result in prompt rise of serum TSH. To date, the cases reported of pituitary hypothyroidism. Hypothalamic hypothyroidism, on the other hand, may either be idiopathic or result from demonstrable hypothalamic disease.

name: Adrenal medullary hypoplasia
label: Adrenal medullary hypoplasia
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal medulla.

name: Pseudohypoaldosteronism
label: Pseudohypoaldosteronism
definition: A state of renal tubular unresponsiveness or resistance to the action of aldosterone.|Pseudohypoaldosteronism is characterized by hyperkalemia, metabolic acidosis, and normal glomerular filtration rate. This term refers to the phenotypic finding of pseudohypoaldosteronism rather than the disease of idiopathic pseudohypoaldosteronism.

name: Congenital adrenal hypoplasia
label: Congenital adrenal hypoplasia
definition: A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.

name: Pituitary hypothyroidism
label: Pituitary hypothyroidism
definition: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion.

name: Euthyroid hyperthyroxinemia
label: Euthyroid hyperthyroxinemia
definition: An abnormality of thyroid physiology (HP:0002926) characterized by increased levels of thyroxine without evidence of clinical thyroid disease.|Any functional abnormality of the thyroid gland and the systems that control its rate of production of thyroid hormone (hypothalamic-pituitary-thyroid axis) and the peripheral reactivity to thyroid hormone.

name: Thyroid hyperplasia
label: Thyroid hyperplasia
definition: Hyperplasia of the thyroid gland.

name: Congenital goiter
label: Congenital goiter
definition: An enlargement of the thyroid gland with congenital onset.

name: Adrenocortical adenoma
label: Adrenocortical adenoma
definition: Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex.

name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
label: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
definition: A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.

name: Adrenocorticotropin receptor defect
label: Adrenocorticotropin receptor defect
definition: Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in the ACTH receptor.

name: Pancreatic islet cell adenoma
label: Pancreatic islet cell adenoma
definition: The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

name: Thyroid defect in oxidation and organification of iodide
label: Thyroid defect in oxidation and organification of iodide

name: Neutrophil inclusion bodies
label: Neutrophil inclusion bodies
definition: The presence of intracellular inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in neutrophils. Cytoplasmic neutrophil inclusions (oval, basophilic) are also known as Doehle bodies.

name: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress
label: Increased red cell hemolysis by shear stress

name: Abnormal cartilage collagen
label: Abnormal cartilage collagen
definition: Abnormal morphology of collagen fibers in cartilage. In cartilage, collagen II, actually a collagen II:IX:XI heterofibril, is by far the most important type of collagen. A number of abnormalities may be appreciated by electron micrography or biochemical investigations, including sparse collagen fibers in the cartilage matrix.

name: Abnormal blood zinc concentration
label: Abnormal blood zinc concentration
definition: An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.

name: Cerebellar cortical atrophy
label: Cerebellar cortical atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellar cortex.|Cerebellar cortical atrophy may be associated with vacuolated or binucleated Purkinje cells.

name: Acute hyperammonemia
label: Acute hyperammonemia
definition: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood with sudden onset.

name: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia
label: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia
definition: An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.

name: Fasting hyperinsulinemia
label: Fasting hyperinsulinemia
definition: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.

name: Partial complement factor H deficiency
label: Partial complement factor H deficiency
definition: A partial reduction in level of the complement component Factor H in circulation.

name: Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma
label: Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma
definition: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).

name: Long-chain dicarboxylic aciduria
label: Long-chain dicarboxylic aciduria
definition: An increase in the level of long-chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Transient hyperphenylalaninemia
label: Transient hyperphenylalaninemia
definition: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

name: Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine
label: Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine
definition: An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine.|Dermatan sulfate is a a glycosaminoglycan (mucopolysaccharide) found in skin, blood vessels, heart valves, tendons, and lungs.

name: Olivary degeneration
label: Olivary degeneration
definition: Degeneration of the olivary bodies, prominent oval structures in the medulla oblongata.

name: Exercise-induced myoglobinuria
label: Exercise-induced myoglobinuria
definition: Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.

name: Medium chain dicarboxylic aciduria
label: Medium chain dicarboxylic aciduria
definition: An increase in the level of medium chain dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss
label: Spinal cord posterior columns myelin loss

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Decreased plasma free carnitine
label: Decreased plasma free carnitine
definition: A decreased concentration of free (unbound) carnitine in the blood.

name: Abnormal mitochondria in muscle tissue
label: Abnormal mitochondria in muscle tissue
definition: An abnormality of the mitochondria in muscle tissue.|This finding is typically demonstrated by muscle biopsy.

name: Elevated leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
label: Elevated leukocyte alkaline phosphatase
definition: An increased alkaline phosphatase activity measured within leukocytes.

name: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.

name: Reduced factor X activity
label: Reduced factor X activity
definition: Reduced activity of coagulation factor X. The extrinsic and intrinsic pathways converge at factor X (fX). The extrinsic pathway activates fX by means of d factor VII with its cofactor, tissue factor. The intrinsic pathway activates fX by means of the tenase complex (Ca2+ and factors VIIIa, IXa and X) on the surface of activated platelets. Factor Xa in turn activates prothrombin (factor II) to thrombin (factor IIa).

name: Abnormal mitochondrial morphology
label: Abnormal mitochondrial morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the mitochondria.|This feature may be assessed by means of electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
label: Abnormal light- and dark-adapted electroretinogram
definition: An abnormality of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.|The dark-adapted 3.0 ERG can be used to elicit a combined rod-cone response.

name: Reduced circulating vitamin B6 level
label: Reduced circulating vitamin B6 level
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of vitamin B6 in the blood circulation.

name: Microscopic nephrocalcinosis
label: Microscopic nephrocalcinosis
definition: The presence of microscopic crystalline calcium precipitates in the form of oxalate and/or phosphate in the renal parenchyma.|The qualifier microscopic is used to indicate that the nephrocalcinosis cannot be observed on visual or radiologic examination without further magnification (as can macroscopic nephrocalcinosis).

name: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
label: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
definition: Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.|Von Willebrand factor (VWF) is a key hemostatic protein, but documenting its function through laboratory tests is not always straightforward. VWF serves as a carrier protein for factor VIII (FVIII), and also facilitates platelet adhesion through its interaction with platelet GPIb on the platelet surface and through its binding to the subendothelial matrix. This interaction is driven in vivo by shear stress, which induces a conformational change in VWF that allows it to bind platelet GPIb. In vitro, however, this interaction is induced by the antibiotic ristocetin, which enables VWF and platelet GPIb to interact in the absence of shear forces. Laboratory testing of VWF utilizes ristocetin in the VWF ristocetin cofactor activity assay (VWF:RCo), which is a measure of VWF binding to platelets, or by ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation (RIPA).

name: Renal aminoaciduria
label: Renal aminoaciduria
definition: An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine, due to a decreased kidney functionality .|Renal aminoaciduria is characterized by the abnormally elevated levels of amino acids in the urine, and is usually related to genetic mutations of transport proteins result in the defective reabsorption of free amino acids at the proximal renal tubules. This term does not refer directly to the group of corresponding disease entities but rather to the finding of elevated levels of amino acids in the urine which is inferred to be related to a renal defect rather than to a primary defect of aminoacid metabolism on the basis of other findings.

name: Partial functional complement factor D deficiency
label: Partial functional complement factor D deficiency
definition: A partial reduction in level of the complement component Factor D in circulation.

name: Distal renal tubular acidosis
label: Distal renal tubular acidosis
definition: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.

name: Elevated plasma branched chain amino acids
label: Elevated plasma branched chain amino acids
definition: An increased concentration of a branched chain amino acid in the blood.

name: Hypoplasia of the iris dilator muscle
label: Hypoplasia of the iris dilator muscle
definition: Underdevelopment of the dilatator pupillae.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV
definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Decreased circulating IgG2 level
label: Decreased circulating IgG2 level
definition: A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.

name: Impaired platelet adhesion
label: Impaired platelet adhesion
definition: An abnormality of adhesion of thrombocytes. Normally, platelets adhere to collagen in the vascular subendothelium within seconds of injury via a receptor made up of glycoprotein Ia and IIa and GPVI and to vWF via receptor GPIb/IX/V. The adherent platelets then release granules that lead to platelet activation and aggregation.

name: Neutral hyperaminoaciduria
label: Neutral hyperaminoaciduria
definition: The presence of an abnormally increased concentration of neutral amino acids in the urine. The neutral amino acids are tryptophan, alanine, asparagine, glutamine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, phenylalanine, serine, threonine, tyrosine and valine.

name: Factor X activation deficiency
label: Factor X activation deficiency
definition: Reduced ability to transform factor X into its activated form factor Xa.

name: Reduced factor XIII activity
label: Reduced factor XIII activity
definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

name: Hyperprolinemia
label: Hyperprolinemia
definition: An increased concentration of proline in the blood.

name: Neonatal hypoproteinemia
label: Neonatal hypoproteinemia
definition: A neonatal decreased concentration of proteins in the blood.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the hallux
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the hallux
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tarsal bones
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tarsal bones
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tarsal bones.

name: Abnormality of the calcaneus
label: Abnormality of the calcaneus
definition: An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.

name: Abnormality of the talus
label: Abnormality of the talus
definition: An abnormality of the talus.

name: Contractures involving the joints of the feet
label: Contractures involving the joints of the feet

name: Tarsal synostosis
label: Tarsal synostosis
definition: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the tarsus (calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, cuneiiform bones).

name: Abnormal tarsal ossification
label: Abnormal tarsal ossification
definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Abnormal metatarsal ossification
label: Abnormal metatarsal ossification
definition: Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.

name: Slow-growing nails
label: Slow-growing nails
definition: Nails whose growth is slower than normal.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nails
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nails
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the nail.

name: Abnormal toenail morphology
label: Abnormal toenail morphology
definition: An anomaly of the toenail.

name: Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails
label: Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails
definition: Recurrent loss, or shedding, of the nails of the fingers and toes.

name: Dystrophic fingernails
label: Dystrophic fingernails
definition: The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate.

name: Subungual hyperkeratosis
label: Subungual hyperkeratosis
definition: A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails.

name: Congenital curved nail of fourth toe
label: Congenital curved nail of fourth toe

name: Chronic monilial nail infection
label: Chronic monilial nail infection
definition: Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species.

name: Hypoplastic fifth fingernail
label: Hypoplastic fifth fingernail
definition: A nail of the fifth finger that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail of little finger.

name: Circumungual hyperkeratosis
label: Circumungual hyperkeratosis
definition: A thickening of the stratum corneum, the outer layer of the skin, in the region surrounding the nails.

name: Onycholysis of distal fingernails
label: Onycholysis of distal fingernails
definition: Detachment of the distal fingernails from the nail bed.

name: Onychogryposis of toenails
label: Onychogryposis of toenails
definition: Thickened toenails.

name: Ridged fingernail
label: Ridged fingernail
definition: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the fingernail plate.

name: Nail dystrophy
label: Nail dystrophy
definition: Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.|Onychodystrophy is a widely used, yet rarely defined term. Onychodystrophy can be caused by congenital nail diseases, systemic disorders, fungal and nonfungal infections, various noninfectious inflammatory dermatologic diseases of the nail unit and tumors. Onychodystrophy can also occur secondarily to systemic drug use.

name: Vertebral hypoplasia
label: Vertebral hypoplasia
definition: Small, underdeveloped vertebral bodies.

name: Intervertebral disc degeneration
label: Intervertebral disc degeneration
definition: The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.

name: Punctate vertebral calcifications
label: Punctate vertebral calcifications
definition: The presence of punctiform calcification of the bone of the vertebral bodies.

name: Vertebral wedging
label: Vertebral wedging
definition: An abnormal shape of the vertebral bodies whereby the vertebral bodies are thick on one side and taper to a thin edge at the other.

name: Spinal dysplasia
label: Spinal dysplasia
definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the vertebral column.

name: Vertebral clefting
label: Vertebral clefting
definition: Schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.|Cleft vertebrae result when there are two, instead of one, primary ossification centers in a vertebral body. An unossified cartilaginous brdige may be observed radiographically with the shape of a cleft. If the two ossification centers are ventral/dorsal, a coronal cleft is observed, and if the two ossification centers are left/right, than a sagittal cleft is observed.

name: Anterior beaking of lumbar vertebrae
label: Anterior beaking of lumbar vertebrae
definition: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies of the lumbar spine.

name: Anterior wedging of L1
label: Anterior wedging of L1
definition: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L1 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

name: Absent in utero ossification of vertebral bodies
label: Absent in utero ossification of vertebral bodies

name: Vertebral arch anomaly
label: Vertebral arch anomaly
definition: A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.|A vertebral arch is the posterior part of a vertebra and forms the canal through which the spinal cord passes. A vertebral arch consists of (i) a pair of vertebral pedicles, which are short thick processes that extend from the vertebral body to connect the body to the vertebral arch; (ii) a pari of vertebral laminae (broad plates that extending dorsally and medially from the pedicles fusing with one another to complete the roof of the vertebral arch); (iii) the spinous process (a process that is directed backward and downward from the junction of the laminae and to which muscles and ligaments attach); (iv) two superior articular processes and two inferior articular processes that articulate between two adjacent vertebrae); and (v) two transverse processes that extend at either side from the point where the lamina joins the pedicle, between the superior and inferior articular processes and allow the attachment of muscles and ligaments.

name: Lumbar hemivertebrae
label: Lumbar hemivertebrae
definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the lumbar spine.

name: C1-C2 vertebral abnormality
label: C1-C2 vertebral abnormality
definition: Any abnormality of the atlas and the axis.|The atlas is the first cervical vertebral body and the axis is the second vertebral body.

name: Herniation of intervertebral nuclei
label: Herniation of intervertebral nuclei
definition: The presence of one or more herniated nucleus pulposus of intervertebral disk.

name: Vertebral hyperostosis
label: Vertebral hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth of the bones of the vertebral bodies.

name: Posterior wedging of vertebral bodies
label: Posterior wedging of vertebral bodies
definition: An abnormality of the shape of vertebrae, such that they are wedge-shaped (narrow towards the back).

name: Cervical spinal canal stenosis
label: Cervical spinal canal stenosis
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

name: Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance
label: Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance
definition: A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.

name: Lumbar kyphosis
label: Lumbar kyphosis
definition: Over curvature of the lumbar region.

name: Dysplastic sacrum
label: Dysplastic sacrum
definition: A developmental defect of the sacrum characterized by partial or disordered development of the sacrum in which portions of the sacrum, which normally is formed by fusion of five sacral vertebrae S1-S5, fail to form or fail to form normally.

name: C2-C3 subluxation
label: C2-C3 subluxation
definition: A partial dislocation of the intervertebral joint between the second and third cervical vertebrae.

name: Caudal interpedicular narrowing
label: Caudal interpedicular narrowing
definition: Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.

name: Progressive congenital scoliosis
label: Progressive congenital scoliosis
definition: A progressive form of scoliosis with congenital onset.

name: Cervical vertebral agenesis
label: Cervical vertebral agenesis
definition: Agenesis of one or more vertebrae of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Absent spinous processes of lower thoracic and lumbar vertebrae
