label: Absent spinous processes of lower thoracic and lumbar vertebrae

name: Absent vertebra
label: Absent vertebra
definition: A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies.

name: Thoracic hemivertebrae
label: Thoracic hemivertebrae
definition: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the thoracic spine.

name: Abnormal sacral segmentation
label: Abnormal sacral segmentation
definition: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of sacral vertebrae during development.

name: Cervical vertebral dysplasia
label: Cervical vertebral dysplasia
definition: Dysplasia of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Lower thoracic interpediculate narrowness
label: Lower thoracic interpediculate narrowness
definition: A reduction of the distance between the lower thoracic vertebral pedicles.

name: Narrow anterio-posterior vertebral body diameter
label: Narrow anterio-posterior vertebral body diameter
definition: An abnormal reduction of the anterioposterior diameter of the vertebral body.

name: Poorly ossified cervical vertebrae
label: Poorly ossified cervical vertebrae
definition: Decreased ossification of the cervical vertebral bodies, i.e., of the Cervical vertebrae set.

name: Cervical spondylosis
label: Cervical spondylosis
definition: The presence of arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the cervical vertebral column.

name: Cervical vertebral bodies with decreased anteroposterior diameter
label: Cervical vertebral bodies with decreased anteroposterior diameter

name: Thoracolumbar interpediculate narrowness
label: Thoracolumbar interpediculate narrowness
definition: A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles.

name: Lumbar interpedicular narrowing
label: Lumbar interpedicular narrowing
definition: Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column.

name: Spondylolisthesis at L5-S1
label: Spondylolisthesis at L5-S1
definition: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the fifth lumbar vertebral body (L5) onto the sacrum (level S1).

name: Premature anterior fontanel closure
label: Premature anterior fontanel closure
definition: Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.

name: Inferior lens subluxation
label: Inferior lens subluxation
definition: Partial displacement of the lens in the inferior direction.

name: High hypermetropia
label: High hypermetropia
definition: A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters.

name: Median cleft lip and palate
label: Median cleft lip and palate
definition: Cleft lip or palate affecting the midline region of the palate.

name: Moderate sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Moderate sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: The presence of a moderate form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Central posterior corneal opacity
label: Central posterior corneal opacity
definition: Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma.

name: Bilateral conductive hearing impairment
label: Bilateral conductive hearing impairment
definition: A bilateral type of conductive hearing impairment.

name: Abnormality of the vertebral spinous processes
label: Abnormality of the vertebral spinous processes

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sacrum
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sacrum
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the sacral bone.

name: Abnormality of the coccyx
label: Abnormality of the coccyx
definition: An abnormality of the coccyx.

name: Posterior helix pit
label: Posterior helix pit
definition: Permanent indentation on the posteromedial aspect of the helix that may be sharply or indistinctly delineated.|They are usually linear to a narrow oval in shape and may be single or multiple.

name: Congenital sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Congenital sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A type of hearing impairment caused by an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve with congenital onset.

name: Long hairs growing from helix of pinna
label: Long hairs growing from helix of pinna

name: Absence of acoustic reflex
label: Absence of acoustic reflex
definition: Absence of the acoustic reflex, an involuntary contraction of the stapedius muscle that occurs in response to high-intensity sound stimuli.|Note that the acoustic reflex is also referred to as stapedius reflex, attenuation reflex, or auditory reflex.

name: Cleft at the superior portion of the pinna
label: Cleft at the superior portion of the pinna
definition: This term is used for Auriculocondylar syndrome (MIM:602483). Not clear if there is a clean delineation against cleft helix.

name: Low-frequency hearing loss
label: Low-frequency hearing loss
definition: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the low frequencies of sound (125 Hz to 1000 Hz).

name: Microtia
label: Microtia
definition: Underdevelopment of the external ear.|The definitions of microtia follow a widely used, surgically based, classification of ear anomalies outlined by Weerda 1988. As microtia indicates at least both decreased length and width, and in more severe forms it includes abnormal shape of structures, all forms are acknowledged to be bundled terms, but are retained here because they are well established.

name: Cochlear malformation
label: Cochlear malformation
definition: The presence of a malformed cochlea.|A cochlear malformation may include a membranous abnormality, a bony abnormality, or a combination of the two.

name: Absent vestibular function
label: Absent vestibular function
definition: Complete lack of functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

name: Vestibular areflexia
label: Vestibular areflexia
definition: Vestibular areflexia can be measured as the absence of the caloric nystagmus response in electronystagmography.

name: Microtia, second degree
label: Microtia, second degree
definition: Median longitudinal length of the ear more than two standard deviations below the mean in the presence of some, but not all, parts of the normal ear.

name: External ear malformation
label: External ear malformation
definition: A malformation of the auricle of the ear.

name: Low-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Low-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the lower frequencies.

name: Underfolded helix
label: Underfolded helix
definition: Underdevelopment of the helix that either affects the entire helix, or is localized.|Helix folding is highly variable, and the range is illustrated in Figures 29 and 30. To use this term, the affected area must be too long to be considered a Cleft helix. Underdevelopment of part of the helix can lead to the impression that the scaphal area is enlarged.

name: Underfolded superior helices
label: Underfolded superior helices
definition: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a lesser degree than normal.

name: Hypoplasia of the cochlea
label: Hypoplasia of the cochlea
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the cochlea.

name: Mild neurosensory hearing impairment
label: Mild neurosensory hearing impairment
definition: The presence of a mild form of sensorineural hearing impairment.|A neurosensory hearing loss with a deficit of 21-40 dB.

name: Slit-like opening of the exterior auditory meatus
label: Slit-like opening of the exterior auditory meatus
definition: A type of stenosis of the external auditory meatus in which the opening of the external auditory meatus appears as a vertical slit.

name: Hypoplastic helices
label: Hypoplastic helices
definition: Underdevelopment of the helix, i.e., of the outer rim of the pinna.

name: Congenital conductive hearing impairment
label: Congenital conductive hearing impairment
definition: A type of conductive deafness with congenital onset.

name: Prominent antitragus
label: Prominent antitragus
definition: Increased anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

name: Postlingual sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Postlingual sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with onset after the acquisition of speech.

name: Mild conductive hearing impairment
label: Mild conductive hearing impairment
definition: A mild form of conductive hearing impairment.|Conductive hearing impairment with 21-40 dB deficit.

name: Supraauricular pit
label: Supraauricular pit
definition: Benign congenital lesion of the supraauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

name: Progressive conductive hearing impairment
label: Progressive conductive hearing impairment
definition: A progressive type of conductive deafness.

name: Morphological abnormality of the middle ear
label: Morphological abnormality of the middle ear
definition: An abnormality of the morphology or structure of the middle ear.

name: Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.

name: Adult onset sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Adult onset sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: The presence of sensorineural deafness with late onset.

name: Bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A bilateral form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Severe sensorineural hearing impairment
label: Severe sensorineural hearing impairment
definition: A severe form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Abnormality of the stapes
label: Abnormality of the stapes
definition: An abnormality of the stapes, a stirrup-shaped ossicle in the middle ear.

name: Pulsatile tinnitus
label: Pulsatile tinnitus
definition: Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation. Pulsatile tinnitus may be associated with vascular abnormalities such as arterioevenous shunts or glomus tumors or the jugular vein, arterial bruits related to a high-riding carotid artery (close to the auditory areas) or carotid stenosis, or venous abnormalities such as a dehiscent jugular bulb or to hypertension. Finally, in some patients, mechanical abnormalities such a spatulous eustachian tubes, palatomyoclonus (small spasms of muscles in the soft palate area), or idiopathic stapedial muscle spasm may represent the underlying cause of pulsatile tinnitus.

name: Ureteral dysgenesis
label: Ureteral dysgenesis
definition: A developmental anomaly of the ureter.|If possible, a more specific term describing the precise type of ureteral dysgenesis should be chosen.

name: Agonadism
label: Agonadism
definition: Absence of sex glands (gonads are the organs that produce gametes; testis in males and ovary in females).|Gonadal agenesis refers to the lack of development of gonads during fetal development; it may not be possible clinically to determine if gonal tissue was present at any point of development. For this reason, we regard agonadism and gonadal agenesis as synonymous.

name: Hypertrophy of the urinary bladder
label: Hypertrophy of the urinary bladder
definition: Abnormal enlargement of the urinary bladder.

name: Nephroblastomatosis
label: Nephroblastomatosis
definition: Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.

name: Uric acid urolithiasis independent of gout
label: Uric acid urolithiasis independent of gout

name: Autonomic erectile dysfunction
label: Autonomic erectile dysfunction
definition: Impotence (inability to develop or maintain an erection) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Crescentic glomerulonephritis
label: Crescentic glomerulonephritis
definition: A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.

name: Multiple small medullary renal cysts
label: Multiple small medullary renal cysts
definition: The presence of many cysts in the medulla of the kidney.|This feature is the cardinal sign of medullary cystic disease, also known as medullary sponge disease.

name: Renotubular dysgenesis
label: Renotubular dysgenesis
definition: A developmental defect characterized by absence or poor development of proximal renal tubules.|Renotubular dysgenesis is generally accompanied by early onset and persistent oligohydramnios that leads to the Potter sequence.

name: Urethral stenosis
label: Urethral stenosis
definition: Abnormal narrowing of the urethra.

name: Renal sarcoma
label: Renal sarcoma
definition: A sarcoma of the kidney.

name: Clitoral hypertrophy
label: Clitoral hypertrophy
definition: Hypertrophy of the clitoris.|Increased size of the clitoris.

name: Gonadal dysgenesis, male
label: Gonadal dysgenesis, male
definition: Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to an unassigned sex differentiation.

name: Abnormal spermatogenesis
label: Abnormal spermatogenesis
definition: Incomplete maturation or aberrant formation of the male gametes.

name: Calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis
label: Calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis
definition: The presence of calcium- and oxalate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Congenital megaureter
label: Congenital megaureter
definition: A developmental disturbance with extreme ureteral dilatation.|The cause of congenital megaloureter is thought to be aperistalsis of the distal ureter, leading to dilatation. The defect in peristalsis may be due to faulty development of muscle layers of ureter, that is, there is a functional, not a mechanical cause of obstruction.

name: Congenital nephrotic syndrome
label: Congenital nephrotic syndrome
definition: Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life.

name: Renal hypoplasia/aplasia
label: Renal hypoplasia/aplasia
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the kidney.

name: Renal tubular epithelial necrosis
label: Renal tubular epithelial necrosis
definition: Coagulative necrosis of tubular epithelial cells, defined as cells with increased cytoplasmic eosinophilia and nucleus that has a condensed chromatin pattern with fuzzy nuclear contour or has barely visible nuclear basophilic staining. The extent of cortical tubular necrosis is scoredsemiquantitatively as none, mild (less than 25% tubules with necrosis), moderate (25-50 percent), and severe (over 50%).|Renal tubular epithelial necrosis is a histomorphological definition that corresponds to the clinical term of acture tubular necrosis. Acute death of renal tubular cells that usually results from prolonged renal ischemia, nephrotoxins, or sepsis. The clinical course of acute tubular necrosis may be divided into initiation, maintenance, and recovery phases.

name: Enlarged labia minora
label: Enlarged labia minora
definition: Increase in size of the folds of skin between the outer labia.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the uterus
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the uterus
definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the uterus.

name: Bilateral cryptorchidism
label: Bilateral cryptorchidism
definition: Absence of both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

name: Solitary bladder diverticulum
label: Solitary bladder diverticulum
definition: Presence of a single diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

name: Renal hamartoma
label: Renal hamartoma
definition: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.

name: Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
label: Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.

name: Gonadal calcification
label: Gonadal calcification
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in gonadal tissue.

name: Absent scrotum
label: Absent scrotum
definition: Congenital absence of the scrotum.|Both the sac and rugae are absent. This finding may be accompanied by an (Apparently) absent testis and Cryptorchidism, which should be coded separately.

name: Partial development of the penile shaft
label: Partial development of the penile shaft

name: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
label: Benign prostatic hyperplasia
definition: The presence of non-malignant hyperplasia of the prostate.

name: Urethrovaginal fistula
label: Urethrovaginal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.

name: Unilateral renal atrophy
label: Unilateral renal atrophy
definition: A unilateral form of atrophy of the kidney.

name: Unilateral renal dysplasia
label: Unilateral renal dysplasia
definition: A unilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

name: Urethral diverticulum
label: Urethral diverticulum
definition: The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.

name: Gonadal dysgenesis with female appearance, male
label: Gonadal dysgenesis with female appearance, male
definition: Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to a more female sex differentiation.|Very bad term - try to get rid of it later.

name: Hypoplasia of the ovary
label: Hypoplasia of the ovary
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.

name: Hypoplasia of the vagina
label: Hypoplasia of the vagina
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

name: Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype
label: Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype
definition: The presence of female external genitalia in a person with a male karyotype.

name: Renal hypophosphatemia
label: Renal hypophosphatemia
definition: Renal hypophosphatemia is defined as reduced serum phosphate (e.g., below 0.70 mmol/l) and an inappropriately high renal phosphate excretion.|Three primary mechanisms of hypophosphatemia exist: increased renal excretion, decreased intestinal absorption, and movement of phosphate from the extracellular to intracellular compartments. The initial step in diagnosis involves determining whether hypophosphatemia is renal or nonrenal.

name: Decreased testicular size
label: Decreased testicular size
definition: Reduced volume of the testicle (the male gonad).

name: Partially duplicated kidney
label: Partially duplicated kidney
definition: The presence of a partially duplicated kidney.

name: Longitudinal vaginal septum
label: Longitudinal vaginal septum
definition: The presence of a longitudinal vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication.

name: Coronal hypospadias
label: Coronal hypospadias
definition: A mild form of hypospadias in which the urethra opens just under the corona glandis.

name: Abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold
label: Abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold
definition: An abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold.|The aryepiglottic fold is a fold of mucous membrane extending on each side between the lateral border of the epiglottis and the summit of the arytenoid cartilage.

name: Cartilaginous ossification of larynx
label: Cartilaginous ossification of larynx
definition: Ossification affecting the set of cartilages of larynx.|This term describes abnormal ossification affecting one or more of the cartilages of the larnyx (cricoid cartilage, thyroid cartilage, epiglottic cartilage, arytenoid cartilage, corniculate cartilage, cuneiform cartilage, triticeal cartilage, and sesamoid cartilage).

name: Laryngeal hypoplasia
label: Laryngeal hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the larynx.

name: Laryngeal atresia
label: Laryngeal atresia
definition: Congenital absence of the lumen of the larynx.|Laryngeal atresia results from failure of recanalization of the laryngotracheal tube during the third month of gestation. Laryngeal atresia manifests as acute airway obstruction in the newborn immediately following clamping of the umbilical cord and is fatal without immediate airway management with a tracheotomy. Congenital laryngeal atresia is a rare anomaly that is mostly incompatible with life. Most authors claim that this malformation is related to an arrest of the sixth brachial arch at different gestational stages during normal embryologic development. Complete laryngeal atresia results in a desperate emergency during the first few moments of life, and surgical intervention must occur within 2 to 5 minutes of birth to enable respiration. The most dramatic physical finding is that the child is aphonic, with absence of any cry or gasp at birth.

name: Laryngeal cleft
label: Laryngeal cleft
definition: Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esopahagus.|Embryologically, the trachea and esophagus share a common lumen until they are separated by the development of the tracheoesophageal septum. Failure of this fusion and incomplete development of the tracheoesophageal septum may lead to congenital abnormalities such as isolatedlaryngeal cleft, tracheoesophageal fistula, and esophageal atresia, depending on the severity of the abnormality. Patients with laryngeal cleft may present with feeding difficulty, chronic cough, stridor, pneumonia or respiratory distress, depending on the size of the cleft.

name: Laryngeal cartilage malformation
label: Laryngeal cartilage malformation
definition: A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage.

name: Aplasia of the epiglottis
label: Aplasia of the epiglottis
definition: Absence of the epiglottis.

name: Laryngeal calcification
label: Laryngeal calcification
definition: Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the laryngeal tissues.

name: Bowing of the vocal cords
label: Bowing of the vocal cords
definition: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.

name: Unilateral vocal cord paralysis
label: Unilateral vocal cord paralysis
definition: A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.

name: Self-mutilation of tongue and lips due to involuntary movements
label: Self-mutilation of tongue and lips due to involuntary movements

name: Obsessive-compulsive trait
label: Obsessive-compulsive trait
definition: The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ear
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ear
definition: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the external ear
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the external ear
definition: The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the external ear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle ear
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle ear
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the middle ear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the inner ear
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the inner ear
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the inner ear.

name: Abnormal prostate morphology
label: Abnormal prostate morphology
definition: An abnormality of the prostate.

name: Abnormal renal artery morphology
label: Abnormal renal artery morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.

name: Abnormal vocal cord morphology
label: Abnormal vocal cord morphology
definition: An abnormality of the vocal cord.|The vocal cords, also known as the vocal folds, represent a subdivision of the larynx, and consist of twin infoldings of mucous membrane stretched horizontally across the larynx.

name: Wide proximal femoral metaphysis
label: Wide proximal femoral metaphysis
definition: Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.

name: Wide capital femoral epiphyses
label: Wide capital femoral epiphyses
definition: Abnormally wide morphology of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Delayed ossification of pubic rami
label: Delayed ossification of pubic rami
definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone.

name: Iliac crest serration
label: Iliac crest serration
definition: Irregularities of the iliac crest that produce the appearance of a lace border around it.

name: Delayed pubic bone ossification
label: Delayed pubic bone ossification
definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.

name: Cone-shaped capital femoral epiphysis
label: Cone-shaped capital femoral epiphysis
definition: A cone-shaped deformity of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses
label: Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses
definition: Developmental acceleration of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

name: Widened greater sciatic notch
label: Widened greater sciatic notch
definition: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a increase in the lateral dimension of the notch.

name: Limited hip movement
label: Limited hip movement
definition: A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip.

name: Hypoplasia of the lesser trochanter
label: Hypoplasia of the lesser trochanter
definition: Underdevelopment of the lesser trochanter.

name: Hypoplasia of the femoral head
label: Hypoplasia of the femoral head
definition: Underdevelopment of the femoral head.

name: Broad femoral head
label: Broad femoral head
definition: Increased width of the femoral head.

name: Acetabular dysplasia
label: Acetabular dysplasia
definition: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the acetabular part of hip bone.

name: High iliac wings
label: High iliac wings
definition: Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

name: Flattened femoral head
label: Flattened femoral head
definition: An abnormally flattened femoral head.

name: Large iliac wings
label: Large iliac wings
definition: Increased size of the ilium ala.

name: Narrow femoral neck
label: Narrow femoral neck
definition: An abnormally reduced diameter of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Absent ossification of capital femoral epiphysis
label: Absent ossification of capital femoral epiphysis
definition: Lack of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.|The ossification center of the capital femoral epiphysis appears at the end of the first year after birth.

name: Hypoplastic ischiopubic rami
label: Hypoplastic ischiopubic rami
definition: Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium.

name: Hypoplastic iliac body
label: Hypoplastic iliac body
definition: Underdevelopment of the body of ilium.

name: Dislocation of the femoral head
label: Dislocation of the femoral head
definition: Joint dislocation of the femoral head.

name: Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification
label: Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification
definition: Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.|The proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification center normally appears at about age 6 months.

name: Delayed femoral head ossification
label: Delayed femoral head ossification
definition: Delayed ossification of the femoral head.

name: Multicentric femoral head ossification
label: Multicentric femoral head ossification
definition: There is normally one ossification center in the head of the femur. This term applies if there are multiple such centers.|Additionally, the ossification center of the capital femoral epiphysis appears at the end of the first year after birth. This is not what this term refers to.

name: Hypoplastic pelvis
label: Hypoplastic pelvis
definition: Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis.

name: Mesomelic short stature
label: Mesomelic short stature
definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by disproportionate shortening of the medial parts of the extremities (forearm or lower leg).

name: Severe intrauterine growth retardation
label: Severe intrauterine growth retardation
definition: Intrauterine growth retardation that is 4 or more standard deviations below average, corrected for sex and gestational age.

name: Moderately short stature
label: Moderately short stature
definition: A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Severe postnatal growth retardation
label: Severe postnatal growth retardation
definition: Severely slow or limited growth after birth, being four standard deviations or more below age- and sex-related norms.

name: Moderate postnatal growth retardation
label: Moderate postnatal growth retardation
definition: A moderate degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between three and four standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

name: Neonatal short-trunk short stature
label: Neonatal short-trunk short stature
definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with congenital onset recognizable at birth.

name: Failure to thrive secondary to recurrent infections
label: Failure to thrive secondary to recurrent infections
definition: Insufficient weight gain or inappropriate weight loss for a child, that is attributed to an endogenous recurrent infections.

name: Feeding difficulties in infancy
label: Feeding difficulties in infancy
definition: Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.

name: Disproportionate short-limb short stature
label: Disproportionate short-limb short stature
definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short limbs but an average-sized trunk.|A type of dwarfism (marked short stature with adult height below 147 cm) in which the limbs are disproportionatley affected. Note that brachymelia is a general term refering to shortening of the limbs. Micromelia refers to the shortening of entire limbs (in contrast to rhizomelia, mesomelia, and acromelia, which refer to shortening of the proximal, middle, or distal portions of the limbs).

name: Mild intrauterine growth retardation
label: Mild intrauterine growth retardation
definition: Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 2 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 3 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.

name: Adipose tissue loss
label: Adipose tissue loss
definition: A loss of adipose tissue.

name: Postnatal growth retardation
label: Postnatal growth retardation
definition: Slow or limited growth after birth.

name: Rhizomelia
label: Rhizomelia
definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).

name: Childhood-onset truncal obesity
label: Childhood-onset truncal obesity
definition: Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.

name: Neonatal short-limb short stature
label: Neonatal short-limb short stature
definition: A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.

name: Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature
label: Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature
definition: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in childhood.

name: Generalized neonatal hypotonia
label: Generalized neonatal hypotonia
definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.

name: Muscular hypotonia of the trunk
label: Muscular hypotonia of the trunk
definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.

name: Generalized lymphadenopathy
label: Generalized lymphadenopathy
definition: A generalized form of lymphadenopathy.

name: Acute rhabdomyolysis
label: Acute rhabdomyolysis
definition: An acute form of rhabdomyolysis.

name: Distal lower limb amyotrophy
label: Distal lower limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles.|Distal lower limb muscle atrophy is commonly due to peripheral neuropathy.

name: Loss of ability to walk in early childhood
label: Loss of ability to walk in early childhood

name: Pelvic girdle amyotrophy
label: Pelvic girdle amyotrophy
definition: Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.

name: Infantile muscular hypotonia
label: Infantile muscular hypotonia
definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in infancy.|This term should not be used for new annotations. Instead, state the type of onset of hypotonia more exactly.

name: Proximal upper limb amyotrophy
label: Proximal upper limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the arms.

name: Shoulder muscle hypoplasia
label: Shoulder muscle hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the shoulder.

name: Pectoralis major hypoplasia
label: Pectoralis major hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the pectoralis major.|The pectoralis major is a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest.

name: Intrinsic hand muscle atrophy
label: Intrinsic hand muscle atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.

name: Progressive distal muscular atrophy
label: Progressive distal muscular atrophy
definition: Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.

name: Proximal lower limb amyotrophy
label: Proximal lower limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the legs, i.e., of the thigh.

name: Distal upper limb muscle weakness
label: Distal upper limb muscle weakness
definition: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the arms.

name: Calf muscle hypoplasia
label: Calf muscle hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the muscuklature of the calf.

name: Tibialis muscle weakness
label: Tibialis muscle weakness
definition: Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle.|This is a bundled term which should be made obsolete.

name: Nonprogressive muscular atrophy
label: Nonprogressive muscular atrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy that does not display a progression in severity with time.

name: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
label: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
definition: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.

name: Muscle hypertrophy of the lower extremities
label: Muscle hypertrophy of the lower extremities
definition: Muscle hypertrophy primarily affecting the legs.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
definition: Decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

name: Calf muscle hypertrophy
label: Calf muscle hypertrophy
definition: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the calf muscles.|Distal lower limb hypertrophy

name: Neck muscle hypoplasia
label: Neck muscle hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the neck.

name: Increased intramuscular fat
label: Increased intramuscular fat
definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intramuscular fat tissue.

name: Agenesis of the diaphragm
label: Agenesis of the diaphragm
definition: Congenital lack, i.e., aplasia of the diaphragm.|An extremely large diaphragmatic defect, or apparent absence of the hemidiaphragm, is called agenesis of the diaphragm; this defect probably represents the severe end of the Bochdalek hernia spectrum rather than a distinct entity.

name: Pelvic girdle muscle atrophy
label: Pelvic girdle muscle atrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles that attach to the pelvic girdle (the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, adductor magnus, adductor brevis, adductor longus, pectineus, and gracilis muscles).

name: Exercise-induced leg cramps
label: Exercise-induced leg cramps
definition: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles of the leg brought on by physical exertion.

name: Increased intraabdominal fat
label: Increased intraabdominal fat
definition: An abnormal increase in the amount of intraabdominal fat tissue.

name: Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs
label: Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs
definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the legs.

name: Proximal muscle weakness in upper limbs
label: Proximal muscle weakness in upper limbs
definition: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the arms.

name: Pectoralis hypoplasia
label: Pectoralis hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the pectoral muscle.

name: Loss of truncal subcutaneous adipose tissue
label: Loss of truncal subcutaneous adipose tissue
definition: Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the region of the trunk.

name: Increased subcutaneous truncal adipose tissue
label: Increased subcutaneous truncal adipose tissue
definition: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the trunk of the body.

name: Hypoplasia of the musculature
label: Hypoplasia of the musculature
definition: Underdevelopment of the musculature.

name: Weakness of the intrinsic hand muscles
label: Weakness of the intrinsic hand muscles

name: Biceps hypoplasia
label: Biceps hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.

name: Hypoplasia of serratus anterior muscle
label: Hypoplasia of serratus anterior muscle
definition: Underdevelopment of the serratus anterior muscle, which is involved in abduction, upward Rotation, and elevation of the scapula.

name: Upper limb muscle hypoplasia
label: Upper limb muscle hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of muscles of the arm.

name: Loss of gluteal subcutaneous adipose tissue
label: Loss of gluteal subcutaneous adipose tissue
definition: Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the gluteal region.

name: Progressive loss of facial adipose tissue
label: Progressive loss of facial adipose tissue

name: Exercise-induced muscle fatigue
label: Exercise-induced muscle fatigue
definition: An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise.

name: Abdominal wall muscle weakness
label: Abdominal wall muscle weakness
definition: Decreased strength of the abdominal musculature.|This may be associated with protuberance of the abdomen.

name: Increased connective tissue
label: Increased connective tissue
definition: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of connective tissue.

name: Hypoplasia of latissimus dorsi muscle
label: Hypoplasia of latissimus dorsi muscle
definition: Underdevelopment of the latissimus dorsi muscle, which is involved in adduction, extension, internal rotation, and transverse extension of the shoulder and assists in movement of the scapula.

name: Foot dorsiflexor weakness
label: Foot dorsiflexor weakness
definition: Weakness of the muscles responsible for dorsiflexion of the foot, that is, of the movement of the toes towards the shin. The foot dorsiflexors include the tibialis anterior, the extensor hallucis longus, the extensor digitorum longus, and the peroneus tertius muscles.|Dorsiflexion of the foot extends the foot superiorly, as if taking the foot off the gas pedal.

name: Generalized weakness of limb muscles
label: Generalized weakness of limb muscles
definition: Generalized weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

name: Amyotrophy of ankle musculature
label: Amyotrophy of ankle musculature
definition: Atrophy of the muscles of the ankle.

name: Marked muscular hypertrophy
label: Marked muscular hypertrophy
definition: Severe hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle cells.

name: Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis
label: Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis
definition: Rhabdomyolysis induced by exercise.

name: Difficulty running
label: Difficulty running
definition: Reduced ability to run.

name: Peroneal muscle atrophy
label: Peroneal muscle atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the peroneous muscles, peroneus longus (also known as Fibularis longus), Peroneus brevis (also known as fibularis brevis, and Peroneus tertius (also known as fibularis tertius).|The peroneus muscles (longus, brevis, and tertius) originate on the fibula and insert on the metatarsals.

name: Quadriceps muscle atrophy
label: Quadriceps muscle atrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy involving the quadriceps muscle.

name: Increased muscle glycogen content
label: Increased muscle glycogen content
definition: An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

name: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
label: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
definition: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs.|This finding can be due to peripheral neuropathy.

name: Generalized limb muscle atrophy
label: Generalized limb muscle atrophy
definition: Generalized (unlocalized) atrophy affecting muscles of the limbs in both proximal and distal locations.

name: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from upper limbs
label: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from upper limbs

name: Increased muscle lipid content
label: Increased muscle lipid content
definition: An abnormal accumulation of lipids in skeletal muscle.|Increased neutral lipid content may be observed on muscle biopsies specimen with the specific staining of Sudan black or oil red O techniques by optic microscopy.

name: Scapular muscle atrophy
label: Scapular muscle atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the muscles that are responsible for moving the scapula, which are the levator scapulae, the infraspinatus muscle, the teres major, the teres minor, and the supraspinatus muscle.|Need to add new UBERON term for scapula muscle

name: Infantile axial hypotonia
label: Infantile axial hypotonia
definition: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk and with onset in infancy.

name: Progressive distal muscle weakness
label: Progressive distal muscle weakness
definition: Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature.

name: Generalized lipodystrophy
label: Generalized lipodystrophy
definition: Generalized degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

name: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy
label: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy
definition: Progressive spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

name: Inflammatory myopathy
label: Inflammatory myopathy
definition: Chronic muscle inflammation accompanied by muscle weakness.

name: Decreased Achilles reflex
label: Decreased Achilles reflex
definition: Decreased intensity of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.

name: Progressive proximal muscle weakness
label: Progressive proximal muscle weakness
definition: Lack of strength of the proximal muscles that becomes progressively more severe.|Removed logical definition that used anonymous class. Outstanding term request in UBERON for proximal muscle organ.

name: Weakness of long finger extensor muscles
label: Weakness of long finger extensor muscles

name: Midline notch of upper alveolar ridge
label: Midline notch of upper alveolar ridge

name: Alveolar ridge overgrowth
label: Alveolar ridge overgrowth
definition: Increased width of the alveolar ridges.|This finding may or may not be accompanied by increased height of the alveolar ridge. This is not to be confused with Prominent palatal ridges or gingival overgrowth. This distinction of gingival from alveolar ridge overgrowth may be difficult, especially in milder degrees of the finding.

name: Speech articulation difficulties
label: Speech articulation difficulties
definition: Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds.|Speech articulation difficulties can result from abnormalities of the vocal tract (the larynx and the pharyngeal, oral, and nasal cavities).

name: Chronic oral candidiasis
label: Chronic oral candidiasis
definition: Chronic accumulation and overgrowth of the fungus Candida albicans on the mucous membranes of the mouth, generally manifested as associated with creamy white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks, occasionally spreading to the gums, tonsils, palate or oropharynx.

name: Median cleft palate
label: Median cleft palate
definition: Cleft palate of the midline of the palate.

name: Submucous cleft lip
label: Submucous cleft lip
definition: A cleft of the lip with overlying mucous membrane.|Submucous cleft lip may lead to increased nasal resonance.

name: Anterior open-bite malocclusion
label: Anterior open-bite malocclusion
definition: A type of malocclusion in which there is a gap between the anterior teeth (incisors).

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the pubic bone.

name: Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
label: Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
definition: Abnormal ossification (bone tissue formation) affecting the pubic bone, also known as the pubis.

name: Abnormal pelvis bone ossification
label: Abnormal pelvis bone ossification
definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the bony pelvis.

name: Abnormal ossification involving the femoral head and neck
label: Abnormal ossification involving the femoral head and neck

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the femoral head and neck
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the femoral head and neck

name: Denervation of the diaphragm
label: Denervation of the diaphragm
definition: Interruption of the innervation of the diaphragm.

name: Diaphragmatic eventration
label: Diaphragmatic eventration
definition: A congenital failure of muscular development of part or all of one or both hemidiaphragms, resulting in superior displacement of abdominal viscera and altered lung development.

name: Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
label: Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
definition: Congenital absence of the left half of the diaphragm.

name: Diaphragmatic weakness
label: Diaphragmatic weakness
definition: A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm.|Diaphragmatic paralysis is an extreme form of diaphragmatic weakness. Weakness of the diaphragm can result from abnormalities at any site along its neuromuscular axis, although it most frequently arises from diseases in the phrenic nerves or from myopathies affecting the diaphragm itself. Presence of diaphragmatic weakness may be suspected from the complaint of dyspnea (particularly on exertion) or orthopnea; or the presence of rapid, shallow breathing or, more importantly, paradoxical inward motion of the abdomen during inspiration on physical examination.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more components of the skeleton.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving bones of the skull

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the maxilla
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the maxilla
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the maxilla.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of frontal sinus.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the sinuses
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the sinuses
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of a cranial sinus or sinuses.

name: Abnormal axial skeleton morphology
label: Abnormal axial skeleton morphology
definition: An abnormality of the axial skeleton, which comprises the skull, the vertebral column, the ribs and the sternum.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia affecting bones of the axial skeleton
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia affecting bones of the axial skeleton
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of bones of the axial skeleton.

name: Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin
label: Mixed hypo- and hyperpigmentation of the skin

name: Abnormal adipose tissue morphology
label: Abnormal adipose tissue morphology
definition: An abnormality of adipose tissue, which is loose connective tissue composed of adipocytes.

name: Lipodystrophy
label: Lipodystrophy
definition: Degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

name: Increased adipose tissue
label: Increased adipose tissue
definition: An increase in adipose tissue mass by hyperplastic growth (increase in the number of adipocytes) or by hypertrophic growth (increase in the size of adipocytes occurring primarily by lipid accumulation within the cell).

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs
label: Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the extremities
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the extremities

name: Upper limb amyotrophy
label: Upper limb amyotrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the upper limbs.

name: Hand muscle atrophy
label: Hand muscle atrophy
definition: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the hand.|This term can be used to described bilateral amyotrophy of the musculature of the hand.

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the thorax
label: Abnormality of the musculature of the thorax
definition: A disease or lesion affecting the muscles of the thorax.

name: Abnormal tarsal bone mineral density
label: Abnormal tarsal bone mineral density
definition: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density of the tarsal bones, which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone.

name: Osteolysis involving bones of the feet
label: Osteolysis involving bones of the feet

name: Duplication involving bones of the feet
label: Duplication involving bones of the feet

name: Synostosis involving bones of the lower limbs
label: Synostosis involving bones of the lower limbs
definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones lower limbs.

name: Osteolysis involving bones of the lower limbs
label: Osteolysis involving bones of the lower limbs

name: Synostosis involving bones of the feet
label: Synostosis involving bones of the feet

name: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in muscle tissue
label: Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in muscle tissue

name: Duplication of bones involving the upper extremities
label: Duplication of bones involving the upper extremities

name: Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton
label: Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton

name: Abnormal cerebral artery morphology
label: Abnormal cerebral artery morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 5th finger.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger.

label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

name: Absent middle phalanx of 5th finger
label: Absent middle phalanx of 5th finger
definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

name: Abnormal calcification of the carpal bones
label: Abnormal calcification of the carpal bones

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is affected.

name: Broad middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Broad middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the metacarpals
label: Triangular epiphyses of the metacarpals
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals. Thess epiphyses are located at the distal end of the metacarpals.

name: Abnormal 4th finger phalanx morphology
label: Abnormal 4th finger phalanx morphology
definition: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Curved middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 4th finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 4th finger
definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 4th finger.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Patchy increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger.

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th finger
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th finger
definition: Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 5th finger.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 5th finger
label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 5th finger
definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger with another bone.

name: Deviation of the 5th finger
label: Deviation of the 5th finger
definition: Displacement of the 5th finger from its normal position.

name: Ulnar deviation of the 5th finger
label: Ulnar deviation of the 5th finger
definition: Displacement of the 5th finger towards the ulnar side.

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 5th (little) finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

name: Joint contracture of the 5th finger
label: Joint contracture of the 5th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 5th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
definition: Proximal interphalangeal (PIP) flexion deformity of the little finger. That is, the PIP joint of a little finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger
label: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanx of the fifth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Fragmentation of the metacarpal epiphyses
label: Fragmentation of the metacarpal epiphyses
definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the metacarpals
label: Irregular epiphyses of the metacarpals
definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the metacarpals
label: Ivory epiphyses of the metacarpals
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the metacarpals, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Absence or underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the metacarpals
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the metacarpals
definition: A pseudoepiphysis is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis. The normal metacarpal epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones. Accessory epiphyses (which are also known as pseudoepiphyses) can also occasionally be observed at the proximal ends of the metacarpals, usually involving the 2nd metacarpal bone.

name: Small epiphyses of the metacarpals
label: Small epiphyses of the metacarpals
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses located at the distal end of the metacarpals in respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Epiphyseal stippling of the metacarpals
label: Epiphyseal stippling of the metacarpals
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the metacarpals.

name: Absent metacarpal epiphyses
label: Absent metacarpal epiphyses
definition: Absence of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, which are normally located at the distal ends of the metacarpals.

definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanx of the fourth finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the ring finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th finger
definition: A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic 4th (ring) finger.

name: Deviation of the 4th finger
label: Deviation of the 4th finger
definition: Displacement of the 4th finger from its normal position.

name: Joint contracture of the 4th finger
label: Joint contracture of the 4th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 4th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. That is, the PIP joint of a fourth finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 4th finger
label: Contracture of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 4th finger
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Ulnar deviation of the 4th finger
label: Ulnar deviation of the 4th finger
definition: Displacement of the 4th finger towards the ulnar side (i.e., towards the ring finger).

name: Radial deviation of the 4th finger
label: Radial deviation of the 4th finger
definition: Displacement of the 4th finger towards the radial side (i.e., towards the thumb).

name: Short 4th finger
label: Short 4th finger
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the fourth finger, also known as the ring finger.

label: Aplasia of the 4th finger

definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the 4th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 4th finger
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 4th finger
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 4th finger.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the 4th finger

label: Broad phalanges of the 4th finger

name: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the 4th finger
label: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the 4th finger
definition: A fourth finger with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Patchy sclerosis of 4th finger phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of 4th finger phalanx
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fourth (ring) finger.

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 4th finger
label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the 4th finger

name: Absent epiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Absent epiphyses of the 3rd finger

name: Bracket epiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Bracket epiphyses of the 3rd finger
definition: An abnormality of the third finger in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the 3rd finger
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Enlarged epiphyses of the 3rd finger

label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger

label: Irregular epiphyses of the 3rd finger

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd finger
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the 3rd finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the 3rd finger
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the 3rd finger
definition: A secondary ossification center in the third finger that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Ulnar deviation of finger
label: Ulnar deviation of finger
definition: Bending or curvature of a finger toward the ulnar side (i.e., away from the thumb). The deviation is at the metacarpal-phalangeal joint, and this finding is distinct from clinodactyly.

name: Radial deviation of finger
label: Radial deviation of finger
definition: Bending or curvature of a finger toward the radial side (i.e., towards the thumb). The deviation is at the metacarpal-phalangeal joint, and this finding is distinct from clinodactyly.

label: Radial deviation of the 2nd finger
definition: Displacement of the 2nd finger towards the radial side.

name: Abnormality of the hairline
label: Abnormality of the hairline
definition: The hairline refers to the outline of hair of the head. An abnormality of the hairline can refer to an unusually low or high border between areas of the scalp with and without hair or to abnormal projections of scalp hair.

name: Preauricular hair displacement
label: Preauricular hair displacement
definition: An tongue-like extension of hair towards the cheeks, in which hair growth extends in front of the ear to the lateral cheekbones.

name: Hypoplasia of the pharynx
label: Hypoplasia of the pharynx
definition: Underdevelopment of the pharynx.

name: Absent tibia
label: Absent tibia
definition: Absence of the tibia.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Broad distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Broad distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

name: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the second finger.

name: Distal/middle symphalangism of 2nd finger
label: Distal/middle symphalangism of 2nd finger
definition: Fusion of the terminal/distal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

name: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Short distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Short distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the second finger.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of the second finger.

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

name: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the second finger.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 2nd finger
label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 2nd finger
definition: Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

name: Absent middle phalanx of 2nd finger
label: Absent middle phalanx of 2nd finger
definition: Absence of the middle phalanx of the index (2nd) finger.

name: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of the 2nd finger
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of the 2nd finger
definition: Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.

name: Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Curved appearance of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

name: Vestibular Schwannoma
label: Vestibular Schwannoma
definition: A vestibular Schwannoma (also known as acoustic neuroma, acoustic neurinoma, or acoustic neurilemoma) is a benign, usually slow-growing tumor that develops from the VIIIth cranial nerve supplying the inner ear.

name: Bilateral vestibular Schwannoma
label: Bilateral vestibular Schwannoma
definition: A bilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).

name: Unilateral vestibular Schwannoma
label: Unilateral vestibular Schwannoma
definition: A unilateral vestibular Schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).

name: Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve
label: Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve
definition: Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve, the eighth cranial nerve, which is involved in transmitting sound and equilibrium information from the inner ear to the brain.

name: Astrocytoma
label: Astrocytoma
definition: Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.

name: Peripheral Schwannoma
