label: Peripheral Schwannoma
definition: The presence of a peripheral schwannoma.|A Peripheral Schwannoma (also known as neurilemoma) is a benign, usually encapsulated neoplasm derived from Schwann cells.

name: Retinal hamartoma
label: Retinal hamartoma
definition: A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.

name: Occasional neurofibromas
label: Occasional neurofibromas
definition: Neurofibromas present in a smaller number than usually seen in neurofibromatosis type 1.

name: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

name: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal
label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal
definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal.

name: Abnormality of thumb epiphysis
label: Abnormality of thumb epiphysis
definition: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, and distal phalanges of the thumb and/or the 1st metacarpal.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

name: Flexion contracture of thumb
label: Flexion contracture of thumb
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thumb
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thumb
definition: Hypoplastic/small or absent thumb.

name: Abnormality of thumb phalanx
label: Abnormality of thumb phalanx
definition: A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

name: Deviation of the thumb
label: Deviation of the thumb
definition: Displacement of the thumb from its normal position.

name: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side.

name: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Duplication of the 1st metacarpal
label: Duplication of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Partail or complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin. This term applies if the first metacarpal is completely or partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched metacarpal (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the metacarpal), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (in most cases the fused bone resembles a Y-shape), or two separate metacarpal bones appearing side to side.

name: Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones.|Note that with bifid distal phalanx, the terminal phalanx of the thumb is clefted but is still one bone. With duplication of the terminal phalanx of the thumb, the distal phalanx is split into two bones that are located side by side. With triphalangeal thumb, the thumb has three phalanxes located one after the other.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Complete or partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Complete or partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal
label: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal
definition: Complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin, equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits. This term applies if the first metacarpal is completely duplicated. On x-ray two separate metacarpal bones appear side to side. This term applies if the first metacarpal is completely duplicated.

name: Bifid first metacarpal
label: Bifid first metacarpal
definition: Partial duplication of the first metacarpal bone.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin (equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits). This term applies if the first metacarpal is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched metacarpal (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the metacarpal) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In most cases the fused bone resembles a Y-shape.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.|In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: obsolete Radial deviation of the thumb
label: obsolete Radial deviation of the thumb

name: obsolete Ulnar deviation of the thumb
label: obsolete Ulnar deviation of the thumb

name: Distally placed thumb
label: Distally placed thumb
definition: Insertion of thumb at a more distal location than normal.

name: Proximal placement of thumb
label: Proximal placement of thumb
definition: Proximal mislocalization of the thumb.|Thumb placement index greater than 0.55; or, the base of the thumb appears closer to the wrist than is typical. The technique for the thumb placement index is described in detail [Malina et al., 1973; Hall et al., 2007]. Briefly, the thumb placement index is the distance from the proximal crease of the index finger to the angle of the first interdigital space divided by the distance from the proximal crease of the index finger to the wrist flexion crease at the base of the thumb. This term should not be used with Preaxial polydactyly.

name: Contractures of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb
label: Contractures of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is formed by the first metacarpal and the trapezial bone and is also called Articulatio carpometacarpalis pollicis, carpometacarpal articulation of thumb, carpometacarpal joint of thumb or first carpometacarpal articulation. Seldom referred to as thumb saddle joint.

name: Contractures of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb
label: Contractures of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio metacarpophalangealis pollicis.

name: Contractures of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb
label: Contractures of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio interphalangealis pollicis.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is affected.

name: Curved proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Curved proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Osteolytic defect of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Osteolytic defect of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Synostosis of thumb phalanx
label: Synostosis of thumb phalanx
definition: Fusion of a phalanx of the thumb with another bone.

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Absent proximal phalanx of thumb
label: Absent proximal phalanx of thumb
definition: Absence of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Short proximal phalanx of thumb
label: Short proximal phalanx of thumb
definition: Hypoplastic (short) proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal
label: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal
definition: Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb

name: Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Broad distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of thumb.

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the thumb is affected.

name: Curved distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Curved distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Osteolytic defect of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Osteolytic defect of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

name: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Absence of the distal/terminal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Short distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Short distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Bullet-shaped thumb phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped thumb phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the thumb, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved thumb phalanx
label: Curved thumb phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a thumb phalanx.

name: Osteolytic defect of thumb phalanx
label: Osteolytic defect of thumb phalanx
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.|Osteolytic lesions are visible on radiography as demarcated areas of radiolucency ('darkness').

name: Patchy sclerosis of thumb phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of thumb phalanx
definition: An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.

name: Symphalangism of the thumb
label: Symphalangism of the thumb
definition: Congenital fusion (ankylosis) of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb.|Symphalangism is caused by a failure of segmentation that occurs during early fetal development.

name: Triangular shaped thumb phalanx
label: Triangular shaped thumb phalanx
definition: Abnormal shape of one or more phalanges of the thumb such that affected phalanges resemble a triangle.|A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx (in this case metacarpal, see explanation above).

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the thumb
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the thumb

name: Partial absence of thumb
label: Partial absence of thumb
definition: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a thumb.

name: Short phalanx of the thumb
label: Short phalanx of the thumb
definition: Hypoplastic (short) thumb phalanx.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

name: Absent epiphyses of the thumb
label: Absent epiphyses of the thumb
definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the thumb.

name: Bracket epiphyses of the thumb
label: Bracket epiphyses of the thumb
definition: An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the thumb
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the thumb
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the thumb, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

name: Enlarged thumb epiphysis
label: Enlarged thumb epiphysis
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Fragmentation of thumb epiphysis
label: Fragmentation of thumb epiphysis
definition: Epiphysis of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

name: Irregular thumb epiphysis
label: Irregular thumb epiphysis
definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the one or more epiphyses of the thumb.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the thumb
label: Ivory epiphysis of the thumb
definition: Sclerosis of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the thumb
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the thumb
definition: A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

name: Small thumb epiphysis
label: Small thumb epiphysis
definition: Abnormally small size of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Stippling of thumb epiphysis
label: Stippling of thumb epiphysis
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

name: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones
label: Osteolytic defects of the hand bones

name: Finger symphalangism
label: Finger symphalangism
definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the fingers. The synonymous term "symphalangism of the hand" may be translated as fusions of bones of varying digree, that involve at least one phalangeal bone of the hand. If bony fusions are referred to as "Symphalangism" the fusion occurs in a proximo-distal axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a radio-ulnar axis are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly.

name: Metacarpal synostosis
label: Metacarpal synostosis
definition: Fusion involving two or more metacarpal bones (A synostosis of the first metacarpal and the proximal phalanx of the thumb can also be observed, note that the first metacarpal bone corresponds to a proximal phalanx).

name: Carpal synostosis
label: Carpal synostosis
definition: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).

name: Synostosis involving the 1st metacarpal
label: Synostosis involving the 1st metacarpal
definition: Fusion of the 1st metacarpal with another bone. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2 to 5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Chronic CSF lymphocytosis
label: Chronic CSF lymphocytosis
definition: Chronic cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) lymphocytosis is defined as the finding, in at least two serial CSF examinations, of more than 5 cells per cubic millimeter.

name: Increased CSF interferon alpha
label: Increased CSF interferon alpha
definition: Increased concentration of interferon alpha in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Chilblains
label: Chilblains
definition: Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.

name: Retinal capillary hemangioma
label: Retinal capillary hemangioma
definition: A benign vascular tumor of the retina without any neoplastic characteristics.

name: Spinal hemangioblastoma
label: Spinal hemangioblastoma
definition: A hemangioblastoma of the spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of the epididymis
label: Abnormality of the epididymis
definition: An abnormality of the epididymis.|The epididymis is the structure that connects efferent ductules to vas deferens.

name: Papillary cystadenoma of the epididymis
label: Papillary cystadenoma of the epididymis
definition: A cystadenoma, an epithelial tumor, that originates within the head of the epididymis.|Papillary cystadenomas of the epididymis are partially or completely cystic or solid lesions, between 1-3 cm in diameter and arise from the efferent duct epithelium of the head of epididymis.

name: Subependymal nodules
label: Subependymal nodules
definition: Small nodular masses which originate in the subependymal region of the lateral ventricles and protrude into the ventricular cavity. They may represent subependymal hamartomas of tuberous sclerosis or nodular heterotopia of grey matter.

name: Cortical tubers
label: Cortical tubers
definition: Cortical tubers in the brain are hamartomatous lesions typically located at the gray-white matter interface, commonly in the frontal and parietal lobes. Cortical tubers are composed of abnormal glial and neural cells, and the size, number, and location vary among patients.

name: Subependymal giant-cell astrocytoma
label: Subependymal giant-cell astrocytoma
definition: A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.

name: Hypomelanotic macule
label: Hypomelanotic macule
definition: Hypomelanotic macules ("ash leaf spots") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.|While hypopigmentation is a general term that refers to any form of decreased or absent skin pigmentation, hypomelanosis more specifically refers to a reduction of epidermal melanin.

name: Adenoma sebaceum
label: Adenoma sebaceum
definition: The presence of a sebaceous adenoma with origin in the sebum secreting cells of the skin.|Facial angiofibromas, also known as adenoma sebaceum, are reddish papillary lesions (fibrous skin tumors) that are found around the nose, cheeks, and chin and considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.

name: Shagreen patch
label: Shagreen patch
definition: A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled, The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.

name: Dental enamel pits
label: Dental enamel pits
definition: The presence of small depressions in the dental enamel.

name: Abnormality of the subungual region
label: Abnormality of the subungual region
definition: A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.

name: Subungual fibromas
label: Subungual fibromas
definition: The presence of fibromata beneath finger or toenails.

name: Bladder neoplasm
label: Bladder neoplasm
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder.

name: Renal neoplasm
label: Renal neoplasm
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney.

name: Achromatic retinal patches
label: Achromatic retinal patches
definition: Areas of the retina lacking pigmentation. Punched out areas of chorioretinal hypopigmentation less than 1 disc diameter in size and tending to be located in the midperiphery of the retina.

name: Neoplasm of striated muscle
label: Neoplasm of striated muscle
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour) originating in striated muscle, either skeletal muscle or cardiac muscle.

name: Cardiac rhabdomyoma
label: Cardiac rhabdomyoma
definition: A benign tumor of cardiac striated muscle.

name: Rhabdomyoma
label: Rhabdomyoma
definition: A benign tumor of striated muscle.

name: Cerebral hamartoma
label: Cerebral hamartoma
definition: The presence of a hamartoma of the cerebrum.|Hamartomatous lesions (benign focal lesions composed of disorganized tissue elements) affecting and sometimes originating from the cerebrum.

name: Plexiform neurofibroma
label: Plexiform neurofibroma
definition: A neurofibroma in which Schwann cells proliferate inside the nerve sheath, producing an irregularly thickened, distorted, tortuous structure.

name: Glioma
label: Glioma
definition: The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).|Gliomas can be classified as 1) ependymomas, 2) astrocytomas (including glioblastoma multiforme), 3 oligodendrogliomas, and 4) mixed gliomas, such as oligoastrocytomas.

name: Optic nerve glioma
label: Optic nerve glioma
definition: A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.

name: Spinal neurofibromas
label: Spinal neurofibromas
definition: Neurofibromas originating in the spine.|Spinal neurofibromas can affect the spinal cord or the spinal nerve roots. Spinal neurofibromas can occur at cervical, thoracic, lumbar, and sacral levels.

name: Tibial pseudoarthrosis
label: Tibial pseudoarthrosis
definition: Pseudarthrosis, or "false joint" of the tibia is the result of a developmental failure in the tibia progressing to spontaneous fracture and subsequent fibrous nonunion. The fracture is rarely present at birth but commonly develops during the first 18 months of life.

name: Lisch nodules
label: Lisch nodules
definition: The presence of pigmented, oval and dome-shaped raised hamartomatous nevi of the iris..

name: Abnormality of the antihelix
label: Abnormality of the antihelix
definition: An abnormality of the antihelix.|An abnormal form of the antihelix, which is the curved prominence of cartilage, parallel with and in front of the helix, and which divides into the crura antihelicis, between which is a triangular depression, the fossa triangularis.

name: Hypoplasia of the antihelix
label: Hypoplasia of the antihelix
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the antihelix.

name: Aplasia of the parotid gland
label: Aplasia of the parotid gland
definition: Absence of the parotid gland.

name: Nephrosclerosis
label: Nephrosclerosis
definition: Nephrosclerosis refers to thickening or scarring ("sclerosis") resulting from damage to the renal arterioles, also referred to as arteriosclerosis of the kidney arteries.

name: Stiff shoulders
label: Stiff shoulders
definition: Shoulder joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in shoulders when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.

name: Distichiasis
label: Distichiasis
definition: Double rows of eyelashes.|Distichiasis can be defined as the abnormal growth of lashes from the orifices of the Meibomian glands on the posterior lamella of the tarsal plate, resulting in a double row of eyelashes.

name: Abnormal spinal dura mater morphology
label: Abnormal spinal dura mater morphology
definition: An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord.

name: Spinalarachnoid cyst
label: Spinalarachnoid cyst
definition: Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space.

name: Thick nasal septum
label: Thick nasal septum
definition: Abnormally increased thickness of the nasal septum.

name: Lumbosacral hirsutism
label: Lumbosacral hirsutism
definition: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lumbosacral region.

name: Large earlobe
label: Large earlobe
definition: Increased volume of the earlobe, that is, abnormally prominent ear lobules.|All gradations in size of the earlobe may be seen from absent to clearly enlarged compared to average. This finding is highly variable. Lobe size increases throughout adulthood.

name: Aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle
label: Aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle
definition: Absence of the pectoralis major muscle.

name: Cleft in skull base
label: Cleft in skull base
definition: A bony defect in the skull base.

name: Fibrous syngnathia
label: Fibrous syngnathia
definition: Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges.|This finding is associated with severely reduced mobility, or lack of mobility, between the upper and lower jaws. This finding is the severe end of a spectrum that includes oral synechiae.

name: Ankyloblepharon
label: Ankyloblepharon
definition: Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue.|A minimally expressed form, especially when located fully laterally, may be more difficult to ascertain and would be a subjective feature. A band may break and leave no evidence of its presence. Note that the term is distinct from cryptophthalmos.

name: Popliteal pterygium
label: Popliteal pterygium
definition: A pterygium (or pterygia) occurring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee).

name: Intercrural pterygium
label: Intercrural pterygium
definition: A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region.

name: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails
label: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails
definition: Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is a rare and distinctive anomaly seen in popliteal pterygia syndrome.

name: Neck pterygia
label: Neck pterygia
definition: Pterygia affecting the neck.

name: Antecubital pterygium
label: Antecubital pterygium
definition: Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.

name: Anterior clefting of vertebral bodies
label: Anterior clefting of vertebral bodies
definition: Anterior schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

name: Facial wrinkling
label: Facial wrinkling
definition: Excessive wrinkling of the skin of the face.

name: Limb pain
label: Limb pain
definition: Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology.

name: Low hanging columella
label: Low hanging columella
definition: Columella extending inferior to the level of the nasal base, when viewed from the side.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Small or missing phalangeal bones of the fingers of the hand.

name: Broad phalanges of the hand
label: Broad phalanges of the hand
definition: Increased width of the phalanges of the hand.

name: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the hand
label: Bullet-shaped phalanges of the hand
definition: The presence of short and wide phalanges which taper distally ("bullet shaped").

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand
label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the hand.

name: Patchy sclerosis of finger phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of finger phalanx
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand
label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand
definition: Fusion of two or more phalangeal bones of the hand.

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hand

name: Amniotic constriction ring
label: Amniotic constriction ring
definition: Annular constrictions around the digits, limbs, or trunk, occurring congenitally (sometimes causing intrauterine autoamputation) and also associated with a wide variety of disorders. Constrictive amniotic bands are the result of primary amniotic rupture, which can lead to entanglement of fetal tissue (especially limbs) in fibrous amniotic strands.|Pseudoainhum is a rare condition of unknown etiology that produces digital constricting rings, most commonly on the small fingers.

name: Adactyly
label: Adactyly
definition: The absence of all phalanges of all the digits of a limb and the associated soft tissues.|This descriptor does not require absence of the metacarpal or metatarsal bones. A qualifying phrase is added to specify which limb has the attribute of adactyly.

name: Absent thumb
label: Absent thumb
definition: Absent thumb, i.e., the absence of both phalanges of a thumb and the associated soft tissues.

name: Short thumb
label: Short thumb
definition: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.

name: 3-4 toe syndactyly
label: 3-4 toe syndactyly
definition: Syndactyly with fusion of toes three and four.

name: Iliac horns
label: Iliac horns
definition: Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic.

name: Lester's sign
label: Lester's sign
definition: A zone of darker pigmentation around the central part of the iris with a roughly cloverleaf or flower shape.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the biceps
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the biceps
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.

name: Biceps aplasia
label: Biceps aplasia
definition: Absence of the biceps muscle.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the triceps
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the triceps
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.

name: Triceps aplasia
label: Triceps aplasia
definition: Absence of the triceps muscle.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the thigh
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the thigh
definition: Absence or underdevelopment involving the musculature of the thigh.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the quadriceps
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the quadriceps
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.

name: Quadriceps aplasia
label: Quadriceps aplasia
definition: Absence of the quadriceps muscle.

name: Perianal abscess
label: Perianal abscess
definition: The presence of an abscess located around the anus.

name: Hemisacrum
label: Hemisacrum
definition: A hemisacral defect involving the sacral vertebrae S2 to S5. In hemisacrum, the first sacral vertebra is intact and there is agenesis involving only S2-S5.

name: Bifid sacrum
label: Bifid sacrum
definition: Presence of a bifid sacral bone.

name: Teratoma
label: Teratoma
definition: The presence of a teratoma.|Teratomas are germ-cell tumors commonly composed of multiple cell types derived from one or more of the three germ layers. They derive from embryonic pluripotent cells and may have various degrees of maturation, according to which they are classified as mature, immature, and malignant. Teratomas are found with decreasing frequency in the ovaries and testis, mediastinum, retroperitoneal space, sacrococcygeal zone, pineal and other intracranial locations.

name: Presacral teratoma
label: Presacral teratoma
definition: A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma located anterior to the sacrum and entirely inside the body (Altman type IV).|Sacrococcygeal teratomas are thought to originate from multipotential cells in Henson's node, which migrates caudally to rest in the coccyx.

name: Branchial anomaly
label: Branchial anomaly
definition: Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus.|During embryonic development the major head and neck structures are formed from the five pharyngeal arches (bands of tissue). Incomplete, failed or persistent embryonic development of these arches results in several anomalies or defects in the neck.

name: Branchial fistula
label: Branchial fistula
definition: A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft.

name: Branchial cyst
label: Branchial cyst
definition: A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.|Branchial cyst have to be distinguished from the preauricular cysts and sinuses, which are ectodermal remnants from an aberrant development of the auditory tubercles, tend to be bilateral, and are localized anterior to the tragus of the ear.

name: Cholesteatoma
label: Cholesteatoma
definition: Cholesteatoma is a benign but potentially destructive growth consisting of keratinizing epithelium located in the middle ear and/or mastoid process. In cholesteatoma, a skin cyst grows into the middle ear and mastoid. The cyst is not cancerous but can erode tissue and cause destruction of the ear.

name: Euthyroid goiter
label: Euthyroid goiter
definition: A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.

name: Supernumerary spleens
label: Supernumerary spleens
definition: The presence of two or more accessory spleens.

name: Maternal diabetes
label: Maternal diabetes
definition: Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes.

name: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.

name: Short phalanx of finger
label: Short phalanx of finger
definition: Short (hypoplastic) phalanx of finger, affecting one or more phalanges.

name: Reduced number of teeth
label: Reduced number of teeth
definition: The presence of a reduced number of teeth as in Hypodontia or as in Anodontia.|Hypodontia describes a situation when there are fewer than the normal number of teeth, whereby 6 teeth or fewer teeth are missing (oligodontia refers to the condition of missing more than 6 teeth and the congenital absence of all teeth is called anodontia).

name: Low-output congestive heart failure
label: Low-output congestive heart failure
definition: A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.

name: Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
label: Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
definition: A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).

name: Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses
label: Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses
definition: A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm.

name: Abnormality of upper limb metaphysis
label: Abnormality of upper limb metaphysis
definition: An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.

name: Abnormality of the elbow
label: Abnormality of the elbow
definition: An anomaly of the joint that connects the upper and the lower arm.

name: Amelia involving the upper limbs
label: Amelia involving the upper limbs
definition: Amelia of one or both upper limbs.

name: Upper limb phocomelia
label: Upper limb phocomelia
definition: Missing or malformed long bones of the upper limbs with the distal parts (the hands) connected to the variably shortened or even absent upper extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the whole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

name: Upper limb peromelia
label: Upper limb peromelia
definition: Peromelia affecting only the upper limbs. That is, the distal parts of the arm are missing leading to stump formation.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the extremities
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the extremities
definition: Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the extremities.

name: Lower limb undergrowth
label: Lower limb undergrowth
definition: Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.

name: Aplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
label: Aplasia involving bones of the lower limbs

name: Amelia involving the lower limbs
label: Amelia involving the lower limbs
definition: Amelia of one or both legs.

name: Lower limb phocomelia
label: Lower limb phocomelia
definition: Phocomelia affecting only the lower limbs.

name: Lower limb peromelia
label: Lower limb peromelia
definition: Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs. That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation.

name: Forearm undergrowth
label: Forearm undergrowth
definition: Forearm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the forearm.

name: Aplasia involving bones of the upper limbs
label: Aplasia involving bones of the upper limbs

name: Upper limb undergrowth
label: Upper limb undergrowth
definition: Arm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the upper extremity.

name: Aplasia involving bones of the extremities
label: Aplasia involving bones of the extremities

name: Limb undergrowth
label: Limb undergrowth
definition: Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.

name: Amelia
label: Amelia
definition: Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.

name: Peromelia
label: Peromelia
definition: The distal parts of the limbs are missing leading to a stump formation.

name: Phocomelia
label: Phocomelia
definition: Missing or malformed long bones of the extremities with the distal parts (such as hands and/or feet) connected to the variably shortened or even absent extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the hole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

name: Peripheral neuropathy
label: Peripheral neuropathy
definition: Peripheral neuropathy is a general term for any disorder of the peripheral nervous system. The main clinical features used to classify peripheral neuropathy are distribution, type (mainly demyelinating versus mainly axonal), duration, and course.

name: Mononeuropathy
label: Mononeuropathy
definition: A focal lesion of a single peripheral nerve. Damage to a sensory nerve is accompanied by sensory impairment of all modalities in the affected anatomic distribution.

name: Abnormal distal phalanx morphology of finger
label: Abnormal distal phalanx morphology of finger
definition: Any anomaly of distal phalanx of finger.

name: Abnormal middle phalanx morphology of the hand
label: Abnormal middle phalanx morphology of the hand
definition: An anomaly of middle phalanx of finger.

name: Abnormal proximal phalanx morphology of the hand
label: Abnormal proximal phalanx morphology of the hand

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges.

name: Broad distal phalanx of finger
label: Broad distal phalanx of finger
definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanges of the hand
label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanges of the hand
definition: Short and wide distal phalanges that taper distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved distal phalanges of the hand
label: Curved distal phalanges of the hand

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Patchy sclerosis of distal phalanx of finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of distal phalanx of finger
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanges of the hand.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Broad middle phalanx of finger
label: Broad middle phalanx of finger
definition: Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanges of the hand
label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanges of the hand
definition: Any of the middle phalanges with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved middle phalanges of the hand
label: Curved middle phalanges of the hand

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger
label: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger
definition: Fusion of a middle phalanx of a finger with another bone.

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the hand

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Broad proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Broad proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: Increased width of the proximal phalanges of the finger.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: Short and wide proximal phalanges that taper distally . Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Curved proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
label: Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the hand

name: Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait
label: Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait
definition: The presence of cerebellar signs and symptoms such as lack of balance associated with quadrupedal gait (locomotion on all four extremities with a 'bear-like' gait with the legs held straight).

name: Simplified gyral pattern
label: Simplified gyral pattern
definition: An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.

name: Broad distal phalanges of all fingers
label: Broad distal phalanges of all fingers
definition: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger of all fingers.

name: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Short distal phalanx of finger
label: Short distal phalanx of finger
definition: Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.|This term differs from Partial absence of the finger because in that term, the phalanx must be missing, whereas in this term it may be small, but present. Distal phalangeal lengths can be assessed subjectively by comparing that digit segment to the rest of the digit, to other normal digits in that patient, or to typical patients of that age or build. Regarding the subjective definition, for individuals who do not have flexion creases, one may determine this by flexing the DIP joint and estimating the length of the terminal segment of the digit. Alternatively, one may be able to palpate the joint.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
definition: This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Tapered distal phalanges of finger
label: Tapered distal phalanges of finger
definition: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.

name: Trichorrhexis nodosa
label: Trichorrhexis nodosa
definition: Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.

name: Abnormality of hair pigmentation
label: Abnormality of hair pigmentation
definition: An abnormality of hair pigmentation (color).

name: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair
label: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair
definition: Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.

name: Localized hirsutism
label: Localized hirsutism
definition: Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.

name: High anterior hairline
label: High anterior hairline
definition: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the hairline and the glabella.|This feature gives the appearance of a tall forehead, and may or may not include reduction of hair in the temporal areas. This can be distinguished from male pattern baldness as the hairline is the superior boundary of the muscular forehead, which can be actively wrinkled, in contrast to the scalp where no wrinkling can occur. In addition, texture of the skin of the scalp differs from the texture of the skin over the forehead.

name: Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges
label: Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges
definition: Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

name: Anotia
label: Anotia
definition: Complete absence of any auricular structures.|Complete absence of the auricle (external ear). The skin of the cheek passes smoothly over the aural area without definite elevation or depression.

name: Telangiectasia of the ear
label: Telangiectasia of the ear
definition: The presence of telangiectasia of the ear.

name: Thickened ears
label: Thickened ears
definition: Increased thickness of the external ear.

name: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
label: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
definition: An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.

name: Abnormality of the antitragus
label: Abnormality of the antitragus
definition: An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.

name: Horizontal crus of helix
label: Horizontal crus of helix
definition: An abnormal horizontal axis orientation of the crus of the helix. That is, the main axis of the crus of the helix is perpendicular to the medial longitudinal axis of the ear, instead of sloping inferoposteriorly.|The term 'railroad track sign' has been used to describe prominent horizontal crus of the helix in combination with prominent and parallel inferior crus of the antihelix. It is preferable to simply describe each component separately.

name: Underdeveloped crus of the helix
label: Underdeveloped crus of the helix
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the crus of the helix. That is, flatter and/or shorter crus helix than average.

name: Prominent crus of helix
label: Prominent crus of helix
definition: The presence of an abnormally prominent of the crus of the helix. That is, development of the crus helix to the same degree as an average antihelix stem or helix.

name: Unilateral deafness
label: Unilateral deafness
definition: A unilateral absence of sensory perception of sound.|Deafness affecting only one ear.

name: Crumpled ear
label: Crumpled ear
definition: Distortion of the course of the normal folds of the ear and the appearance of supernumerary crura and folds.|This is distinct from Stahl ear and Shell ear, with which the term has sometimes been conflated. The appearance often changes markedly after birth.

name: Cleft helix
label: Cleft helix
definition: A notched form of the helix of the ear. That is, a defect in the continuity of the helix, which may occur at any point along its length.|This may take the form of a sharp cleft or a less well-demarcated area. This should be distinguished from a Question-mark ear. If the defect or notch occurs at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix, it should be coded as Darwin notch of the helix.

name: Conjunctival nodule
label: Conjunctival nodule
definition: Presence of nodules in the conjunctiva of the eye.

name: Prominent ear helix
label: Prominent ear helix
definition: Abnormally prominent ear helix.

name: Thin ear helix
label: Thin ear helix
definition: Decreased thickness of the helix of the ear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the earlobes
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the earlobes
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the ear lobes.

name: Attached earlobe
label: Attached earlobe
definition: Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward.|The earlobe does not have a dependent portion.

name: Anterior creases of earlobe
label: Anterior creases of earlobe
definition: Sharply demarcated, typically linear and approximately horizontal, indentations in the outer surface of the ear lobe.|Shallow grooves or indentations are quite common, especially in large lobes. Ear lobe creases may arise postnatally. Posterior helical pits can be a related finding but should be assessed and coded separately.

name: Uplifted earlobe
label: Uplifted earlobe
definition: An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.|This finding is characteristic of Mowat-Wilson syndrome.

name: Aplasia of the middle ear ossicles
label: Aplasia of the middle ear ossicles
definition: Absence of the middle ear ossicles, malleus, incus, and stapes.

name: Abnormal temporal bone morphology
label: Abnormal temporal bone morphology
definition: Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.

name: Abnormality of the tragus
label: Abnormality of the tragus
definition: An abnormality of the tragus.|The tragus is the small pointed eminence of the external ear, situated in front of the concha, and projecting backward over the auditory canal.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tragus
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tragus
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the tragus.

name: Cyclopia
label: Cyclopia
definition: Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose.

name: Corneal asymmetry
label: Corneal asymmetry
definition: The presence of a size difference between the left and right cornea.

name: Anisocoria
label: Anisocoria
definition: Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease.|Pathologic anisocoria can reflect an abnormality of the musculature of the iris or of the sympathetic or prasympathetic innervation of the iris.

name: Persistent pupillary membrane
label: Persistent pupillary membrane
definition: The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil.|The tunica vasculosa lentis anterior (pupillary membrane) normally undergoes atrophy in the third trimester of pregnancy. If the membrane does not completely atrophy, then remnants of membranous structures can be observed to emrge from the iris.

name: Ectopia pupillae
label: Ectopia pupillae
definition: A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris.

name: Retinoblastoma
label: Retinoblastoma
definition: A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.

name: Nevus of Ota
label: Nevus of Ota
definition: A dermal melanocytic hamartoma that presents as bluish hyperpigmentation on the face along the first or second branches of the trigeminal nerve. Nevus of Ota may involve the sclera.

name: Duane anomaly
label: Duane anomaly
definition: A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction

name: Vascular remnant arising from the disc
label: Vascular remnant arising from the disc
definition: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the nose
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the nose
definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the nose or parts thereof.

name: Epiphora
label: Epiphora
definition: Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye).|Epiphora or tearing is the presence of a watering eye, which is a common complaint for referrals to oculoplastics clinics for evaluation. The etiology of tearing can be divided into two categories: reflex tearing and reduced tear outflow. Reflex tearing is usually secondary to dry eye, inflammation, allergy or other ocular surface disorders, whereas primary hypersecretion of the lacrimal glands is rare. Reduced tear outflow is due to eyelid malposition, tear pump dysfunction caused by eyelid laxity, or obstruction at any portion of the nasaolacrimal drainage system.

name: Aplasia of the nose
label: Aplasia of the nose
definition: Complete absence of all nasal structures.

name: Thick nasal alae
label: Thick nasal alae
definition: Increase in bulk of the ala nasi.

name: Abnormality of the columella
label: Abnormality of the columella
definition: An abnormality of the columella.|The columella is the fleshy external end of the nasal septum.

name: Asymmetry of the nares
label: Asymmetry of the nares
definition: Asymmetry or size difference between the left and right nostril.

name: Enlarged naris
label: Enlarged naris
definition: Increased aperture of the nostril.|The nostrils or nares are typically symmetric, wide openings. They should be assessed with the face at rest to avoid the effect of flared alae nasi that occurs with distress. Note that the nares change with age, from rounded in infancy to elongated at a later age.

name: Single naris
label: Single naris
definition: The presence of only a single nostril.|The single opening may occur in the midline or it can occur on one side, that is, it can be symmetric or asymmetric. Although the columella is invariably absent, this is implicit and does not need to be separately specified.

name: Narrow naris
label: Narrow naris
definition: Slender, slit-like aperture of the nostril.

name: Supernumerary naris
label: Supernumerary naris
definition: The presence of more than two nostrils.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal septum
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal septum
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal septum.

name: Narrow nasal septum
label: Narrow nasal septum
definition: Abnormally narrow nasal septum.

name: Facial hirsutism
label: Facial hirsutism
definition: Excess facial hair.

name: Sunken cheeks
label: Sunken cheeks
definition: Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible.

name: Mandibular aplasia
label: Mandibular aplasia
definition: Absence of the mandible.

name: Asymmetry of the mandible
label: Asymmetry of the mandible
definition: Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible.

name: Asymmetry of the mouth
label: Asymmetry of the mouth
definition: The presence of an asymmetric mouth.

name: Duplication of thumb phalanx
label: Duplication of thumb phalanx
definition: Complete or partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (bifid), two separate bones appearing side to side, or completely duplicated phalanges (proximal and distal phalanx of the thumb and/or 1st metacarpal). In contrast to the phalanges of the digits 2-5 (proximal, middle and distal), the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Complete duplication of thumb phalanx
label: Complete duplication of thumb phalanx
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of thumb phalanx
label: Partial duplication of thumb phalanx
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 2nd finger
label: Duplication of phalanx of 2nd finger
definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 3rd finger
label: Duplication of phalanx of 3rd finger
definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.
