name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
definition: Partial duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 4th finger
label: Duplication of phalanx of 4th finger
definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
definition: Partial duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Duplication of phalanx of 5th finger
label: Duplication of phalanx of 5th finger
definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
label: Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

name: Duplication of phalanx of hand
label: Duplication of phalanx of hand
definition: This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Complete duplication of phalanx of hand
label: Complete duplication of phalanx of hand
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of the phalanx of hand
label: Partial duplication of the phalanx of hand
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand.|As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms), sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

name: Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms) sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of hand
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of hand
definition: This term applies if one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Duplication of the middle phalanx of hand
label: Duplication of the middle phalanx of hand
definition: This term applies if one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

name: Abnormality of the 1st metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the 1st metacarpal
definition: A structural anomaly of the first metacarpal.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits.

name: Abnormality of the 2nd metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the 2nd metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the second metacarpal bone.

name: Abnormality of the 3rd metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the 3rd metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the third metacarpal bone.

name: Abnormality of the 4th metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the 4th metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the fourth metacarpal bone.

name: Abnormality of the 5th metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the 5th metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the fifth metacarpal bone.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits). The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end (as seen in the proximal phalanges of the other digits), whereas the epiphyses of the other metacarpal bones are located at the distal end. This term applies if the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is in any way abnormal, referring to age and gender depending norms, as seen on x-rays.

name: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: An epiphysis that curves around from its transverse orientation to a longitudinal one from proximal to distal along one side of the phalanx, thus resembling the letter 'C' and forming a bracket around the diaphysis. This results in a so called delta phalanx characterized by a triangular or trapezoidal shaped bone with a C-shaped epiphyseal plate.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance.

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal having multiple bony fragments.

name: Irregular epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Irregular epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal.

name: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone although an accessory epiphysis may be located at the distal end of the metacarpal.|This feature can be seen for example in Holt-Oram Syndrome.

name: Small epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Small epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Epiphyseal stippling of the first metacarpal
label: Epiphyseal stippling of the first metacarpal
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the first metacarpal bone.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 1st metacarpal
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

name: Broad 1st metacarpal
label: Broad 1st metacarpal
definition: Increased width of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Bullet-shaped 1st metacarpal
label: Bullet-shaped 1st metacarpal
definition: The presence of short and wide 1st metacarpal which tapers distally ("bullet shaped").

name: Curved 1st metacarpal
label: Curved 1st metacarpal
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of the first metacarpal.

name: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metacarpal
label: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the 1st metacarpal.|Osteolytic lesions are visible on radiography as demarcated areas of radiolucency ('darkness').

name: Patchy sclerosis of the 1st metacarpal
label: Patchy sclerosis of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Uneven increase in bone density within the 1st metacarpal.

name: Triangular shaped 1st metacarpal
label: Triangular shaped 1st metacarpal
definition: This term applies to a triangular shaped 1st metacarpal.|In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx (in this case metacarpal, see explanation above).

name: Short 1st metacarpal
label: Short 1st metacarpal
definition: A developmental defect characterized by reduced length of the first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.|In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Aplasia of the 1st metacarpal
label: Aplasia of the 1st metacarpal
definition: Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.|In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 2nd metacarpal.

name: Aplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
label: Aplasia of the 2nd metacarpal
definition: Absence of the second long bone of the hand.

name: Short 2nd metacarpal
label: Short 2nd metacarpal
definition: Short second metacarpal bone because of developmental hypoplasia.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.

name: Aplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
label: Aplasia of the 3rd metacarpal
definition: Absence of the third long bone of the hand.

name: Short 3rd metacarpal
label: Short 3rd metacarpal
definition: Short third metacarpal bone.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th metacarpal
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th metacarpal
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 4th metacarpal.

name: Aplasia of the 4th metacarpal
label: Aplasia of the 4th metacarpal
definition: Absence of the fourth long bone of the hand.

name: Short 4th metacarpal
label: Short 4th metacarpal
definition: Short fourth metacarpal bone.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th metacarpal
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th metacarpal
definition: Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.

name: Aplasia of the 5th metacarpal
label: Aplasia of the 5th metacarpal
definition: Absence of the fifth long bone of the hand.

name: Short 5th metacarpal
label: Short 5th metacarpal
definition: Short fifth metacarpal bone.

name: Aplasia of metacarpal bones
label: Aplasia of metacarpal bones
definition: Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.

name: Short metacarpal
label: Short metacarpal
definition: Diminished length of one or more metacarpal bones in relation to the others of the same hand or to the contralateral metacarpal.|Short metacarpals can involve any of the metacarpal bones, and the affected ray should be specified. The assessment of isolated short metacarpal can be made by viewing the dorsum of the hand when clenched. Note that if metacarpals F2-5 are affected, the correct term is Short palm.

name: Deviation of the hallux
label: Deviation of the hallux
definition: Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.

name: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: An abnormal shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.|In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the big toe is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
label: Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
definition: An anomaly of the first metatarsal bone.|In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities of the first metatarsal.

name: Broad hallux
label: Broad hallux
definition: Visible increase in width of the hallux without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.|Note that girth may be increased in a broad hallux, but this must be distinguished from Macrodactyly because there the length is also increased. This assessment may be difficult when the hallux is short.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hallux
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hallux

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the hallux
label: Abnormality of the phalanges of the hallux

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hallux
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hallux

name: Broad hallux phalanx
label: Broad hallux phalanx
definition: An increase in width in one or more phalanges of the big toe.

name: Bullet-shaped hallux phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped hallux phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved hallux phalanx
label: Curved hallux phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the big toe.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hallux
label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hallux

name: Patchy sclerosis of hallux phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of hallux phalanx
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hallux
label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hallux

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hallux
label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hallux

name: Duplication of phalanx of hallux
label: Duplication of phalanx of hallux
definition: Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the 1st metatarsal
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of the 1st metatarsal
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Broad first metatarsal
label: Broad first metatarsal
definition: Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Bullet-shaped 1st metatarsal
label: Bullet-shaped 1st metatarsal
definition: An abnormal morphology of the firstmetatarsal bone, which is short and wide and tapers distally, and lacks the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved 1st metatarsal
label: Curved 1st metatarsal
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of the 1st metatarsal bone.

name: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metatarsal
label: Osteolytic defects of the 1st metatarsal
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the first metatarsal.

name: Duplication of the 1st metatarsal
label: Duplication of the 1st metatarsal
definition: A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Broad distal phalanx of the hallux
definition: An increase in width of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

name: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
definition: An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Curved distal phalanx of the hallux
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: Increased width of proximal phalanx of big toe.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Curved proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: Partial or complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

name: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

name: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

name: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Complete duplication of the 1st metatarsal
label: Complete duplication of the 1st metatarsal
definition: A developmental defect consisting in the complete duplication of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Partial duplication of the 1st metatarsal
label: Partial duplication of the 1st metatarsal
definition: A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of part of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Complete duplication of hallux phalanx
label: Complete duplication of hallux phalanx
definition: Complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.

label: Partial duplication of the phalanges of the hallux

label: Short distal phalanx of hallux
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the distal phalanx of big toe.

name: Absent first metatarsal
label: Absent first metatarsal
definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Short first metatarsal
label: Short first metatarsal
definition: Short first metatarsal bone.

name: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Short proximal phalanx of hallux
label: Short proximal phalanx of hallux
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of big toe.

name: Short hallux
label: Short hallux
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the big toe.

name: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hallux
label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hallux

name: Short phalanx of hallux
label: Short phalanx of hallux
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of a phalanx of big toe.

name: Mesoaxial foot polydactyly
label: Mesoaxial foot polydactyly
definition: The presence of a supernumerary toe (not a hallux) involving the third or fourth metatarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Absent hallux epiphysis
label: Absent hallux epiphysis
definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of one or more epiphyses of the big toe.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the hallux
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the hallux

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the hallux
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the hallux

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
definition: In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

name: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
definition: Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux.

label: Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
label: Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
definition: A conical (cone-shaped) appearance of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal of the foot.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal

name: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
label: Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
definition: The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the toes
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the toes

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the toes
label: Abnormality of the phalanges of the toes

name: Absent epiphyses of the toes
label: Absent epiphyses of the toes
definition: Absence of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the toes.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the toes
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the toes

name: Epiphyseal stippling of toe phalanges
label: Epiphyseal stippling of toe phalanges
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the toes.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes

name: Broad phalanx of the toes
label: Broad phalanx of the toes
definition: Increased width of phalanx of one or more toes.

name: Bullet-shaped toe phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped toe phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved toe phalanx
label: Curved toe phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more toe phalanges.

name: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the toes
label: Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the toes

name: Patchy sclerosis of toe phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of toe phalanx
definition: Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the foot.

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the toes
label: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the toes

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the toes
label: Triangular shaped phalanges of the toes

name: Duplication of phalanx of toe
label: Duplication of phalanx of toe
definition: Partial/complete duplication of one or more phalanx of toe.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the toes
label: Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the toes

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the toes
label: Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the toes

name: Abnormality of toe proximal phalanx
label: Abnormality of toe proximal phalanx
definition: A morphological anomaly of one or more proximal phalanges of one or more toes.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges of the toes.

name: Broad distal phalanx of the toes
label: Broad distal phalanx of the toes
definition: Increased width of the distal phalanx of toe of one or more toes.

name: Bullet-shaped distal toe phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped distal toe phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more distal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved distal toe phalanx
label: Curved distal toe phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more distal toe phalanges.

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the toes
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the toes

name: Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the distal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanges of the toes
label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanges of the toes

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the toes
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanges of the toes

name: Duplication of distal phalanx of toe
label: Duplication of distal phalanx of toe
definition: A partial or complete duplication of one or more distal phalanx of toe.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the toes
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle phalanges of the toes

name: Broad middle phalanges of the toes
label: Broad middle phalanges of the toes

name: Bullet-shaped middle toe phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped middle toe phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more middle phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved middle toe phalanx
label: Curved middle toe phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more middle toe phalanges.

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the toes
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanges of the toes

name: Patchy sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanges of the toes
label: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanges of the toes

name: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the toes
label: Triangular shaped middle phalanges of the toes

name: Duplication of middle phalanx of toe
label: Duplication of middle phalanx of toe
definition: Partial or complete duplication of a middle phalanx of toe.

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia of proximal toe phalanx
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia of proximal toe phalanx
definition: Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes.

name: Broad proximal phalanx of toe
label: Broad proximal phalanx of toe
definition: An increase in width of one ore more proximal toe phalanges.

name: Bullet-shaped proximal toe phalanx
label: Bullet-shaped proximal toe phalanx
definition: An abnormal morphology of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

name: Curved proximal toe phalanx
label: Curved proximal toe phalanx
definition: A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of one or more toes.

name: Osteolytic defect of the proximal toe phalanx
label: Osteolytic defect of the proximal toe phalanx
definition: Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal toe phalanx.

name: Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
label: Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the toes
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanges of the toes

name: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the toes
label: Triangular shaped proximal phalanges of the toes

name: Duplication of proximal phalanx of toe
label: Duplication of proximal phalanx of toe
definition: Partial/complete duplication of a proximal phalanx of toe.

name: Flexion contracture of the hallux
label: Flexion contracture of the hallux
definition: One or more bent (flexed) joints of the first (big) toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux
label: Contracture of the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux
definition: Chronic loss of joint motion in the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The tarsometatarsal joints of the feet are also called Lisfranc's joints.

name: Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux
label: Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux
definition: The interphalangeal joint of the big toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contractures of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the hallux
label: Contractures of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the hallux
definition: The joint between the first metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the first (big) toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Structural foot deformity
label: Structural foot deformity
definition: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the second metacarpal bone.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the third metacarpal bone.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal
definition: The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal bone.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 4th metacarpal
definition: The normal epiphysis of the fourth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
definition: Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal bone.

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the 5th metacarpal
definition: The normal epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.

name: Absent epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Absent epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Absence of one or more epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

name: Bracket epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Bracket epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Bracket epiphysis refers to an abnormality in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the fingers of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Enlarged epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Irregular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: A secondary ossification center in the phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Small epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Small epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Epiphyseal stippling of finger phalanges
label: Epiphyseal stippling of finger phalanges
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the fingers.

name: Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
definition: A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers of the hand.

name: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
label: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
definition: Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.

name: Short proximal phalanx of finger
label: Short proximal phalanx of finger
definition: Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.

name: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
definition: Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Absent epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Absent epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Bracket epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Bracket epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: An abnormality of the distal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Enlarged epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Irregular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Irregular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Ivory epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Ivory epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: Distal epiphyses of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
definition: A secondary ossification center in the distal phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Small epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Small epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Triangular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Absent epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Absent epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Bracket epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Bracket epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: An abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Enlarged epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand.

name: Irregular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Irregular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Ivory epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Ivory epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: Epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
definition: A secondary ossification center in the middle phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Small epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Small epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Triangular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
label: Triangular epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Absent epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Absent epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Bracket epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Bracket epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: An abnormality of the proximal phalanges of the hand in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Enlarged epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Enlarged epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Irregular epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Irregular epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Ivory epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Ivory epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: Epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Pseudoepiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
definition: A secondary ossification center in the proximal phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Small epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Small epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

label: Triangular epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Stomatitis
label: Stomatitis
definition: Stomatitis is an inflammation of the mucous membranes of any of the structures in the mouth.

name: Cleft lower lip
label: Cleft lower lip
definition: A gap in the lower lip.

name: Thin lower lip vermilion
label: Thin lower lip vermilion
definition: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lower lip more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).|Normal values for the height of the vermilion are available [Farkas, 1981] but measurements are not commonly used. Most clinicians determine this feature subjectively. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip varies considerably among ethnic groups, and the vermilion should be compared to a population of same ethnic background. If the lower lip vermilion is thin, the inferior border of the vermilion is less curved, and on a profile view, the lower lip vermilion is less convex than usual.

name: Intra-oral hyperpigmentation
label: Intra-oral hyperpigmentation
definition: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the mucosa of the mouth.|Pigmentation of alveolar ridges is common in people with dark skin pigmentation. This term encompasses a range of pigmentary findings, from freckles to generalized hyperpigmentation.

name: Oral synechia
label: Oral synechia
definition: Fibrous band between the mucosal surfaces of the upper and lower alveolar ridges.|These bands must be distinguished from synechiaee between the tongue and palate (glossopalatal ankylosis) and from synechiae arising from the floor of the mouth (as in the subglossopalatal membrane), oropharyngeal isthmus (as in persistent buccopharyngeal membrane) or from the lower lip. If there is a complete soft tissue contiguity between the upper and lower alveolar ridges, the term, Fibrous syngnathia should be used instead.

name: Abnormal salivary gland morphology
label: Abnormal salivary gland morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.

name: Abnormality of the submandibular glands
label: Abnormality of the submandibular glands
definition: Any abnormality of the submandibular glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth, superior to the digastric muscles.

name: Abnormality of the sublingual glands
label: Abnormality of the sublingual glands
definition: Any abnormality of the sublingual glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth anterior to the submandibular glands.

name: Cleft of alveolar ridge of maxilla
label: Cleft of alveolar ridge of maxilla
definition: A gap (cleft) affecting one of the alveolar ridges, which are the protuberances in the mouth that contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth. An alveolar cleft can affect all structures of the alveolar ridge, including the gingiva, other mucosa, periosteum, alveolar bone, and teeth.

name: Short hard palate
label: Short hard palate
definition: Distance between the labial point of the incisive papilla to the midline junction of the hard and soft palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased length of the hard palate (subjective).|Objective measurement of the hard palate requires special instrumentation [Hall JG, Froster-Iskenius UG, Allanson JE, Gripp K, Slavotinek A. 2006. Handbook of Normal Physical Measurements. 2nd edition. Oxford Medical, publishers]. A short hard palate may be associated with velopharyngeal incompetence.

name: Prominent palatine ridges
label: Prominent palatine ridges
definition: Increased size and/or number of soft tissue folds on the palatal side of the maxillary alveolar ridge.|Soft tissue folds are typically present on the lateral sides of the palate, especially anteriorly.

name: Absent uvula
label: Absent uvula
definition: Lack of the uvula.|Sometimes accompanies a Submucous cleft palate, but this should be coded separately.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the uvula
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the uvula
definition: Underdevelopment or absence of the uvula.

name: Palate fistula
label: Palate fistula
definition: A fistula which connects the oral cavity and the pharyngeal area via the aspects of the soft palate.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tongue
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tongue
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.

name: Ankyloglossia
label: Ankyloglossia
definition: Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue.|The anterior third of the tongue is usually free or is partially attached to the floor of the mouth by the lingual frenulum. There is a spectrum ranging from fusion of the tongue to the floor of the mouth (ankyloglossia inferiorum) to a lingual frenulum that is short or anchored toward the tip of the tongue (sometimes called tongue tie). Ankyloglossia may be associated with a mild indentation of the tip of the tongue, which should not be coded as a Bifid tongue.

name: Bifid tongue
label: Bifid tongue
definition: Tongue with a median apical indentation or fork.|Bifid tongue can be associated with ankyloglossia, but this should be assessed and coded separately. Small indentations of the tip of the tongue should not be coded as a bifid tongue.

name: Smooth tongue
label: Smooth tongue
definition: Glossy appearance of the entire tongue surface.|This is due to reduction in number and/or size of the filiform papillae. A geographic tongue has localized areas of smoothening, but not sufficient to warrant use of the term Smooth tongue.

name: Abnormality of dentin
label: Abnormality of dentin
definition: Any abnormality of dentin.|Dentin is a calcified tissue of teeth that is covered by enamel on the crown and cementum on the root and surrounds the entire pulp.

name: Abnormally low-pitched voice
label: Abnormally low-pitched voice
definition: An abnormally low-pitched voice.

name: Spinal dysraphism
label: Spinal dysraphism
definition: A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.|Spinal dysraphism, or neural tube defect comprises a heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life and anomalous development of the caudal cell mass. The anatomic features common to the entire group is an anomaly in the midline structures of the back, especially the absence of some of the neural arches, and defects of the skin, filum terminale, nerves, and spinal cord. Open forms of spinal dysraphism include myelocele, meningocele, and myelomeningocele. These open forms are often associated with hydrocephalus and Arnold-Chiari malformation type II and may be classified as spina bifida aperta. Closed forms of spinal dysraphism includ spina bifida occulta.

name: Spinal cord tumor
label: Spinal cord tumor
definition: A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.

name: Abnormal spinal meningeal morphology
label: Abnormal spinal meningeal morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.

name: Spinal meningeal diverticulum
label: Spinal meningeal diverticulum
definition: An outpouching of the spinal meninges.

name: Absence of the sacrum
label: Absence of the sacrum
definition: Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.

name: Short thorax
label: Short thorax
definition: Reduced inferior to superior extent of the thorax.

name: Stridor
label: Stridor
definition: Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.|Stridor is different from wheezing by the following reasons. It is louder over the neck than chest wall. Secondly; stridor is mainly inspiratory. If occurs in expiration, it is usually biphasic. On the other hand; wheeze is mainly expiratory and occurs during both phases. It indicates extrathoracic upper-airway obstruction (supraglottic lesions like laryngomalacia, vocal cord lesion) when heard on inspiration. It occurs in expiration if associated with intrathoracic tracheobronchial lesions (tracheomalacia, bronchomalacia, and extrinsic compression). It occurs in both phases if lesion is fixed, for example, stenosis. Stridor is caused by the turbulent flow passing through a narrowed segment of the upper respiratory tract.

name: Asternia
label: Asternia
definition: The congenital absence of the sternum.

name: Bifid sternum
label: Bifid sternum
definition: The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.|Various degrees of bifid sternum may occur, varying from an enlarged suprasternal notch to complete separation of the two halves of the sternum. Ectopia cordis may or may not accompany this defect in its more severe form.

name: Chylothorax
label: Chylothorax
definition: Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts.

name: Asymmetry of the breasts
label: Asymmetry of the breasts
definition: The presence of asymmetrical breasts.

name: Breast hypertrophy
label: Breast hypertrophy
definition: The presence of hypertrophy of the breast.

name: Premature thelarche
label: Premature thelarche
definition: Premature development of the breasts.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.

name: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
label: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
definition: Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet.|Ebstein's anomaly is often associated with a hypoplastic right ventricle, patent foramen ovale, and a degree of cyanosis dependent on the amount if inadequacy of the tricuspid valve. Ebstein's anomaly may be associated with Wolf-Parkinson-White syndrome or other arrythmias.

label: Scapular aplasia

label: Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Abnormal ventricular septum morphology
label: Abnormal ventricular septum morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.

name: Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage
label: Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage
definition: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

name: Ectopic accessory finger-like appendage
label: Ectopic accessory finger-like appendage
definition: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

name: Polydactyly
label: Polydactyly
definition: A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.

name: Bifid femur
label: Bifid femur
definition: A bifid or bifurcated appearance of the femur as seen on x-rays, possible appearing as a more or less severe bowing of the upper leg. Might be associated with hip dysplasia on the affected side.

name: Pulmonary insufficiency
label: Pulmonary insufficiency
definition: The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole.

name: Primum atrial septal defect
label: Primum atrial septal defect
definition: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.

name: Tricuspid stenosis
label: Tricuspid stenosis
definition: A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart.|Tricuspid stenosis results in characteristic changes in the jugular venous pulse in the form of leisurely V to Y descent and prominent a-waves. The liver is enlarged with a firm edge and is pulsatile in presystole. This is best appreciated with one hand on the liver edge and one on the precordium. Auscultation reveals a low- to medium-pitched diastolic rumble with inspiratory accentuation. This is usually localized to the lower sternal border.

name: Anal fistula
label: Anal fistula
definition: An abnormal connection between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and the perianal skin.

name: Colonic atresia
label: Colonic atresia
definition: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the colon. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the colon.

name: Esophageal stenosis
label: Esophageal stenosis
definition: An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.

name: Ectopia of the spleen
label: Ectopia of the spleen
definition: An abnormal (non-anatomic) location of the spleen.

name: Pelvic bone asymmetry
label: Pelvic bone asymmetry
definition: Pelvic asymmetry refers to asymmetric positioning of landmarks on the two sides of the pelvis and may have a structural or functional etiology.

name: Acetabular spurs
label: Acetabular spurs
definition: The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.

name: Steep acetabular roof
label: Steep acetabular roof
definition: An exaggeration of the normal arched form of the acetabular roof such that it takes on a steep appearance.

name: Abnormal greater sciatic notch morphology
label: Abnormal greater sciatic notch morphology
definition: An abnormality of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

name: obsolete Widening of the sacrosciatic notch
label: obsolete Widening of the sacrosciatic notch

name: Female pseudohermaphroditism
label: Female pseudohermaphroditism
definition: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In female pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is female (XX) and the gonads are ovaries, but the external genitalia are virilized.

name: True hermaphroditism
label: True hermaphroditism
definition: The presence of both ovarian and testicular tissues either in the same or in opposite gonads. Affected persons have ambiguous genitalia and may have 46,XX or 46,XY karyotypes or 46,XX/XY mosaicism.

name: Abnormality of the female genitalia
label: Abnormality of the female genitalia
definition: Abnormality of the female genital system.|Abnormality of the female internal or external genitalia.

name: Abnormality of the male genitalia
label: Abnormality of the male genitalia
definition: Abnormality of the male genital system.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ovary
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ovary
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.

name: Aplasia of the ovary
label: Aplasia of the ovary
definition: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

name: Streak ovary
label: Streak ovary
definition: A developmental disorder characterized by the progressive loss of primordial germ cells in the developing ovaries of an embryo, leading to hypoplastic ovaries composed of wavy connective tissue with occasional clumps of granulosa cells, and frequently mesonephric or hilar cells.

name: Precocious puberty in females
label: Precocious puberty in females
definition: The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the testes
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the testes
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.

name: Absent testis
label: Absent testis
definition: Testis not palpable in the scrotum or inguinal canal.|Absence can be congenital or not (vanishing testis). Definitive assessment can only be made by imaging or surgical studies, in order to exclude an intra-abdominal testis, which should be coded as Cryptorchidism. True absence of a testis can be difficult to prove. Anorchia is true absence of both testes, and can only be determined by imaging or surgical studies.

name: Supernumerary testes
label: Supernumerary testes
definition: The presence of more than two testes.

name: Oligosacchariduria
label: Oligosacchariduria
definition: Increased urinary excretion of oligosaccharides (low molecular weight carbohydrate chains composed of at least three monosaccharide subunits), derived from a partial degradation of glycoproteins.

name: Abnormal circulating porphyrin concentration
label: Abnormal circulating porphyrin concentration
definition: An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.

name: Porphyrinuria
label: Porphyrinuria
definition: Abnormally increased excretion of porphyrins in the urine.|Porphyrins are natural pigments containing a fundamental skeleton of four pyrrole nuclei united through the alpha-positions by four methine groups to form a macrocyclic structure. One of the best-known porphyrins is heme.

name: Bladder stones
label: Bladder stones
definition: Buildups of minerals that form in the urinary bladder.

name: Cloacal exstrophy
label: Cloacal exstrophy
definition: Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the bladder
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the bladder
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.

name: Aplasia of the bladder
label: Aplasia of the bladder
definition: Aplasia (absence) of the urinary bladder.

name: Abnormality of the urachus
label: Abnormality of the urachus
definition: Abnormality of the urachus.|The urachus is a vestigial embryonic structure, a canal that connects the urinary bladder of the fetus with the allantois (a structure involved in the development of the umbilical cord). During embryonic development, the lumen of the urachus is normally obliterated, transforming the urachus into a solid cord.

name: Patent urachus
label: Patent urachus
definition: Persistence of the urachal canal resulting in a canal between the bladder and the umbilicus.

name: Urethral fistula
label: Urethral fistula
definition: The presence of an abnormal connection between the urethra and another organ or the skin.

name: Urethral valve
label: Urethral valve
definition: The presence of an abnormal membrane obstructing the urethra.

name: Acromelia of the upper limbs
label: Acromelia of the upper limbs
definition: Shortening of the arms predominantly affecting terminal parts of the arm in relation to the upper and middle limb segments.

name: Amniotic constriction rings of arms
label: Amniotic constriction rings of arms
definition: Amniotic constriction rings affecting the arms.

name: Hypertrophy of the upper limb
label: Hypertrophy of the upper limb
definition: Abnormal increase in size of the upper limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).

name: Hyperextensibility at elbow
label: Hyperextensibility at elbow
definition: The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.

name: Abnormality of the hypothenar eminence
label: Abnormality of the hypothenar eminence
definition: An abnormality of the hypothenar eminence, i.e., of the muscles on the ulnar side of the palm of the hand (i.e., on the side of the little finger).

name: Small hypothenar eminence
label: Small hypothenar eminence
definition: Reduced muscle mass on the ulnar side of the palm, that is, reduction in size of the hypothenar eminence.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases.

name: Absent palmar crease
label: Absent palmar crease
definition: The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease).

name: Abnormality of the palmar creases
label: Abnormality of the palmar creases
definition: An abnormality of the creases of the skin of palm of hand.

name: Digital constriction ring
label: Digital constriction ring
definition: A narrow segment of significantly reduced circumference of a digit.|The description should specify the hand and digit that is affected and the approximate location of the band relative to the phalanges. It may be described as partial, if it does not involve the entire circumference of the digit.

name: Osseous finger syndactyly
label: Osseous finger syndactyly
definition: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

name: Long metacarpals
label: Long metacarpals
definition: An abnormally increased length of the metacarpal bones.

name: Acromelia of the lower limbs
label: Acromelia of the lower limbs
definition: Shortening of the legs predominantly affecting terminal parts of the leg in relation to the upper and middle arm segments.

name: Amniotic constriction rings of legs
label: Amniotic constriction rings of legs
definition: Amniotic constriction rings affecting the legs.

name: Hypertrophy of the lower limb
label: Hypertrophy of the lower limb
definition: Abnormal increase in size of the lower limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).

name: Sirenomelia
label: Sirenomelia
definition: A developmental defect in which the legs are fused together.

name: Bipartite patella
label: Bipartite patella
definition: A developmental defect that occurs if the two halves of the patella fail to fuse in early childhood.

name: Patellar subluxation
label: Patellar subluxation
definition: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.

name: Hyperextensibility of the knee
label: Hyperextensibility of the knee
definition: The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).

name: Limitation of knee mobility
label: Limitation of knee mobility
definition: An abnormal limitation of knee joint mobility.

name: Fibular bowing
label: Fibular bowing
definition: A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.|A developmental defect with posteromedial fibular angulation.

name: Fibular duplication
label: Fibular duplication
definition: Duplication of the fibula. This may occur as a part of diplopodia (accessory tarsal or metatarsal bone). Diplopodia with double fibula is an extremely rare condition.

name: Increased length of the tibia
label: Increased length of the tibia
definition: An abnormal increase in the length of the tibia.

name: Limitation of movement at ankles
label: Limitation of movement at ankles
definition: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.

name: Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics
label: Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics
definition: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.

name: Foot asymmetry
label: Foot asymmetry
definition: A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot.

name: Metatarsus valgus
label: Metatarsus valgus
definition: A condition in which the anterior part of the foot rotates outward away from the midline of the body and the heel remains straight.

name: Aplasia of the tarsal bones
label: Aplasia of the tarsal bones
definition: Absence of the tarsal bones.

name: Hypermobility of toe joints
label: Hypermobility of toe joints
definition: An ability of the toe joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Long toe
label: Long toe
definition: Toes that appear disproportionately long compared to the foot.|This finding must be distinguished from digits that are thin but of normal length and that of a short mid and hind foot with normal digit lengths. The affected digits should be specified. If only a subset of the digits of a limb is lengthened, the affected digits should be specified.

name: Adrenal calcification
label: Adrenal calcification
definition: Calcification within the adrenal glands.|This condition may occur in a wide variety of pathologies, some serious and some with no obvious consequence. Adrenal hemorrhage may be detected as an incidental finding in children in radiographic studies of the abdomen. Etiologies include hemorrhage into the adrenals at or immediately after birth, neuroblastoma, ganglioneuroblastoma, cortical carcinoma, pheochromocytoma, and cysts.

name: Pituitary calcification
label: Pituitary calcification
