label: Frank breech presentation
definition: A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are extended.

name: Complete breech presentation
label: Complete breech presentation
definition: A kind of breech presentation in which the hips are flexed and the knees are flexed.

name: Incomplete breech presentation
label: Incomplete breech presentation
definition: A kind of breech presentation in which one or both hips are extended and one or both of the fetus' feet are pointing down and entering the birth canal.

name: Delayed fine motor development
label: Delayed fine motor development
definition: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.

name: Receptive language delay
label: Receptive language delay
definition: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

name: Intellectual disability, severe
label: Intellectual disability, severe
definition: Severe mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 20-34.|Persons with severe mental retardation can be taught basic life skills and simple tasks with supervision.

name: Oppositional defiant disorder
label: Oppositional defiant disorder
definition: An enduring pattern of uncooperative, defiant, and hostile behavior toward authority figures that does not involve major antisocial violations, is not accounted for by the child's developmental stage, and results in significant functional impairment. A certain level of oppositional behavior is common in children and adolescents.|Oppositional defiant disorder is basically a persistent pattern of tantrums, arguing, and angry or disruptive behavior that goes beyond what can be considered normal.

name: Abdominal wall defect
label: Abdominal wall defect
definition: An incomplete closure of the abdominal wall.

name: Dyssynergia
label: Dyssynergia
definition: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed. With dyssynergia, a voluntary movement appears broken down into its component parts.

name: Ocular dyssynergia
label: Ocular dyssynergia
definition: A type of dyssynergia affecting eye movements and characterized by the inability to smoothly follow a visual target across the visual field.

name: Asynergia
label: Asynergia
definition: A type of dyssynergy characterized by the lack of the ability to smoothly perform the elements of a voluntary movement in the appropriate order and speed.

name: Sensory ataxia
label: Sensory ataxia
definition: Incoordination of movement caused by a deficit in the sensory nervous system. Sensory ataxia can be distinguished from cerebellar ataxia by asking the patient to close his or her eyes. Persons with cerebellar ataxia show only a minimal worsening of symptoms, whereas persons with sensory ataxia show a marked worsening of symptoms.|Afferent (seonsory) ataxia is caused by lackof proprioceptive feedback during gait and stance. It can be caused by lesions to the peripheral nerves, the dorsal root ganglia, or the spinal cord. It can be distinguished from cerebellar ataxia by (1) heavy dependence of the affected individual on visual guidance; (2) a minor degree of oculomotor deficits; and (3) the absence of dysarthria. Afferent ataxia may be associated with impaired tendon reflexes and sensory deficits.

name: T-wave inversion
label: T-wave inversion
definition: An inversion of the T-wave (which is normally positive).

name: Cervical spinal cord atrophy
label: Cervical spinal cord atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the cervical segment of the spinal cord.

name: Tendon xanthomatosis
label: Tendon xanthomatosis
definition: The presence of xanthomas (intra-and extra-cellular accumulations of cholesterol) extensor tendons (typically over knuckles, Achilles tendon, knee, and elbows).

name: Chaddock reflex
label: Chaddock reflex
definition: A diagnostic reflex elicited by stimulation of the skin over the surface of the lateral malleolus of the foot. The Chaddock refelx is present if there is extension of one or more or all of the toes with or without fanning of them when the external inframalleolar skin is stimulated. The Chaddock sign, similar to the Babinski sign, is taken to be an indication of disease of the spinocortical (pyramidal) tract.

name: Abnormal circulating protein level
label: Abnormal circulating protein level
definition: An abnormal level of a circulating protein in the blood.

name: Monocular strabismus
label: Monocular strabismus
definition: A type of strabismus in which the fixating eye is always the same one, while the other eye is constantly deviated. Monocular strabismus is to be distinguished from alternating strabismus, in which either of the eyes 'squints' at different times.

name: Fetal cystic hygroma
label: Fetal cystic hygroma
definition: The presence during the prenatal period of a cystic mass with multiple septa with multiple, asymmetric, thin-walled cysts near the posterior aspect of the neck. Fetal cystic hygroma can be defined as nuchal translucency with or without septations measuring greater than 3.0 mm.|Upon ultrasound examination, fetal cystic hygroma presents as a cystic mass with multiple septa with multiple, asymmetric, thin-walled cysts related to the posterior aspect of the neck. Cystic hygromas can range from increased nuchal translucency to thin-walled cystic masses that may become larger than the fetal head. The cysts may result from a lymphatic abnormality, possibly one caused by absent or inefficient connections between the lymphatic and venous systems. Depending on the site, the cut off may vary from site to site. Lowest would be 2.5 mm and highest 3.5 mm.

name: Increased nuchal translucency
label: Increased nuchal translucency
definition: The presence of an abnormally large hypoechoic space in the posterior fetal neck (usually detected on prenatal ultrasound examination).|Increased nuchal translucency may be related to a cystic hygroma or to mesenchymal edema. Increased nuchal translucency can be classified into three categories: 1) cardiac abnormalities, combined with abnormal ductus venosus flow velocities, is found, leading to the theory that cardiac failure causes nuchal translucency enlargement; 2) various types of abnormalities are found in the extracellular matrix of the nuchal skin of fetuses with increased nuchal translucency; 3) abnormal lymphatic development is demonstrated in fetuses with increased nuchal translucency.

name: Abnormality of the umbilical cord
label: Abnormality of the umbilical cord
definition: An abnormality of the umbilical cord, which is the cord connecting the developing embryo or fetus to the placenta.

name: Pulmonary valve atresia
label: Pulmonary valve atresia
definition: A congenital disorder of the pulmonary valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.

name: Aortic valve atresia
label: Aortic valve atresia
definition: A congenital disorder of the aortic valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.

name: Acromelia
label: Acromelia
definition: Shortening of the extremities affecting primarily the distal parts of the limbs (hands and feet) in relation to the other segments of the limbs.

name: Avascular necrosis
label: Avascular necrosis
definition: A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply.|The interruption of the blood supply may have many different causes such as rapid growth, heredity causes, trauma or overuse, anatomic conformation, dietary imbalances or secondary effects of other diseases.

name: Osteochondritis Dissecans
label: Osteochondritis Dissecans
definition: A joint disorder caused by blood deprivation in the subchondral bone causing the subchondral bone to die in a process called avascular necrosis. The bone is then reabsorbed by the body, leaving the articular cartilage it supported prone to damage. The result is fragmentation (dissection) of both cartilage and bone, and the free movement of these osteochondral fragments within the joint space, causing pain and further damage.|Joints that are most often affected by Osteochondrosis dissecans are elbow and hip, but also wrist and ankel joints.

name: Morbus Koehler
label: Morbus Koehler
definition: Morbus Koehler is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os naviculare pedis.

name: Morbus Kienboeck
label: Morbus Kienboeck
definition: Morbus Kienboeck is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Os lunatum.|Results most often from a stress-fracture and consecutive devascularisation of the Os lunatum.

name: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter
label: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter
definition: Morbus Osgood-Schlatter is a Juvenile aseptic necrosis affecting the Tuberositas tibiae.|Painfull irritation and localized bony necrosis affecting the Tuberositas tibiae, where tha patellar tendon inserts.

name: Morbus Scheuermann
label: Morbus Scheuermann
definition: A developmental growth retardation of the vertebral end plates that may lead to secondary destruction of the vertebral end plates and protrusion of the nucleus pulposus into the vertebral body (so called Schmorl's nodes as seen on x-rays).|Scheuermann's disease usually manifests during the 2nd decade and leads to the appearance of the so called adolescence kyphosis. Late manifestations may be wedge-shaped vertebrae, platyspondyly and arthrosis affecting the verterbal collum.

name: Abnormal circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a branched chain family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating phenylalanine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating phenylalanine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating serine family amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating serine family amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a serine family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating glycine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating glycine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glycine in the blood circulation.

name: Hypersarcosinemia
label: Hypersarcosinemia
definition: An elevated plasma concentration of sarcosine.|Sarcosine is the N-methyl derivative of glycine.

name: Hypersarcosinuria
label: Hypersarcosinuria
definition: An elevated urinary concentration of sarcosine.

name: Abnormal circulating sarcosine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating sarcosine concentration
definition: An deviation from the normal concentration of sarcosine in the blood circulation.|Sarcosine, which is also known as N-methylglycine, is an intermediate and byproduct in glycine synthesis and degradation.

name: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an aspartate family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating threonine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating threonine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of threonine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating methionine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating methionine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating glutamine family amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating glutamine family amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a glutamine family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating glutamine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating glutamine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine in the blood circulation.|Glutamine is a charge-neutral, polar amino acid.

name: Abnormal circulating histidine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating histidine concentration
definition: An abnormality of a histidine metabolic process.

name: Hyperhistidinemia
label: Hyperhistidinemia
definition: An increased concentration of histidine in the blood.|Blood histidine levels over 500 micromole per liter. Normal blood histidine levels are around 80-90 micromole per liter.

name: Abnormal circulating proline concentration
label: Abnormal circulating proline concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of proline or a proline metabolite in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating lysine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating lysine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating arginine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating arginine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.|Arginine is a charged, aliphatic amino acid.

name: Hypervalinemia
label: Hypervalinemia
definition: An increased concentration of valine in the blood.

name: Hyperleucinemia
label: Hyperleucinemia
definition: An increased concentration of leucine in the blood.|Normal leucine blood levels are around 120-160 micromole per liter.

name: Abnormal circulating isoleucine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating isoleucine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the blood circulation.

name: Hyperisoleucinemia
label: Hyperisoleucinemia
definition: An increased concentration of isoleucine in the blood.|Normal isoleucine blood levels are around 60-80 micromole per liter.

name: Abnormal circulating valine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating valine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal circulation of valine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating pyruvate family amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating pyruvate family amino acid concentration
definition: An abnormality of a pyruvate family amino acid metabolic process.

name: Abnormal circulating alanine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating alanine concentration
definition: An abnormality of an alanine metabolic process.

name: Abnormal circulating tyrosine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating tyrosine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of tyrosine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating cysteine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating cysteine concentration
definition: An abnormality of a cysteine metabolic process.

name: Abnormal circulating homocysteine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating homocysteine concentration
definition: An abnormality of a homocysteine metabolic process.

name: Zonular cataract
label: Zonular cataract
definition: Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens.|Zonular cataracts include specific regions of the lens and include nuclear cataracts, which affect the fetal or embryonic lens nucleus and lamellar cataracts. These tend to affect lens fibers that are formed at the same time, resulting in a shell like opacity. Zonular cataracts can also be characterized as dense or pulverulent (dusty appearing), and can be accompanied by arcuate opacities extending into the lens cortex, called cortical riders.

name: Coralliform cataract
label: Coralliform cataract
definition: A 'coral-like' pattern of opacity in the lens of the eye. That is, a cataract with an irregular, stellate form.

name: Membranous cataract
label: Membranous cataract
definition: A form of cataract in which the lens substance has shrunk, leaving a collapsed, flattened capsule with little or no cortex or epithelium on the lens.

name: Anterior subcapsular cataract
label: Anterior subcapsular cataract
definition: A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.

name: Posterior cortical cataract
label: Posterior cortical cataract
definition: A cataract that affects the posterior part of the cortex of the lens.

name: Aculeiform cataract
label: Aculeiform cataract
definition: A kind of nuclear cataract characterized by fiberglasslike or needlelike crystals projecting in different directions, through or close to the axial region of the lens.|This phenotype is characterized by fiberglasslike or needlelike crystals projecting in different directions, through or close to the axial region of the lens. Some crystals may be 11 mm in length, and their biochemical composition is not known. This type of cataract is considered to be different from the corraliform cataract, which does not show the needlelike projections. This opacity does not appear to respect the sutures or the direction of the lens fibers (Francois 1963) and appears to originate from the fetal and postnatal nuclei, suggesting a congenital origin with some postnatal progression, if any.

name: Abnormal blood inorganic cation concentration
label: Abnormal blood inorganic cation concentration
definition: An abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis.

name: obsolete Increased urinary orotic acid concentration
label: obsolete Increased urinary orotic acid concentration

name: Abnormal blood cation concentration
label: Abnormal blood cation concentration
definition: An abnormality of cation homeostasis.

name: Abnormal blood monovalent inorganic cation concentration
label: Abnormal blood monovalent inorganic cation concentration
definition: An abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis.

name: Abnormal blood sodium concentration
label: Abnormal blood sodium concentration
definition: An abnormal concentration of sodium.

name: Abnormal circulating nucleobase concentration
label: Abnormal circulating nucleobase concentration
definition: An abnormality of a nucleobase metabolic process.|This term is used to refers to abnormality in chemical reactions and pathways involving a nucleobase, a nitrogenous base that is a constituent of a nucleic acid, e.g. the purines: adenine, guanine, hypoxanthine, xanthine and the pyrimidines: cytosine, uracil, thymine.

name: Hyperxanthinemia
label: Hyperxanthinemia
definition: An increased level of xanthine in the blood circulation.|Xanthine is a purine base that is a product of purine degradation.

name: Xanthinuria
label: Xanthinuria
definition: An increased concentration of xanthine in the urine.|Xanthinuria is generally caused by a defect in the xanthine oxidase, an enzyme that catalyzes the oxidation of hypoxanthine to xanthine and can further catalyze the oxidation of xanthine to uric acid. The formation of xanthine stones in the urinary tract is the main evidence of this abnormality.

name: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract
label: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract
definition: An abnormality of the upper urinary tract.|The upper urinary tract is a subdivision of urinary system which consists of the kidney and the ureters.

name: Abnormality of the lower urinary tract
label: Abnormality of the lower urinary tract
definition: An abnormality of the lower urinary tract.|The lower urinary tract is a subdivision of urinary system which consists of the urinary bladder and the urethra.

name: Abnormality of the nasal skeleton
label: Abnormality of the nasal skeleton
definition: An abnormality of the nasal skeleton.

name: Abnormality of the external nose
label: Abnormality of the external nose
definition: An abnormality of the external nose.

name: Abnormality of the nasal bone
label: Abnormality of the nasal bone
definition: An abnormality of the nasal bone, comprising the left nasal bone and the right nasal bone.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal bone
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal bone
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal bone.

name: Aplasia of the nasal bone
label: Aplasia of the nasal bone
definition: Absence of the nasal bone.

name: Echogenic intracardiac focus
label: Echogenic intracardiac focus
definition: A finding of a focus of increased echogenicity upon prenatal ultrasound examination of the fetus. The foci may be present in one or both ventricles. Echogenic intracardiac focus (EICF) is defined as a focus of echogenicity comparable to bone, in the region of the papillary muscle in either or both ventricles of the fetal heart.|An echogenic intracardiac focus (EIF) is generally believed to be a normal variant, observed in 5% of all fetuses during second trimester sonography, but the risk of aneuploidies such as Down syndrome is increased in fetuses with EIF.

name: Echogenic fetal bowel
label: Echogenic fetal bowel
definition: Echogenic bowel is defined as fetal bowel with homogenous areas of echogenicity that are equal to or greater than that of surrounding bone.|Echogenic fetal bowel may be observed in fetuses with normal outcomes, but may also be a marker for diseases such as cystic fibrosis, congenital infection, chromosomal anomalies, and intraamniotic bleeding. This finding can be observed on prenatal ultrasound. The echogenicity has been classified as either focal or multifocal. Grade 2 suggests that echogenicity is equal to bone whereas grade 3 suggests that it is greater.

name: Abnormal renal pelvis morphology
label: Abnormal renal pelvis morphology
definition: An abnormality of the renal pelvis.

name: Fetal pyelectasis
label: Fetal pyelectasis
definition: Mild pyelectasis is defined as a hypoechoic spherical or elliptical space within the renal pelvis that measures at least 5mm and not more than 10 mm. The measurement is taken on a transverse section through the fetal renal pelvis using the maximum anterior-to-posterior measurement.|The renal pelvis is the part of the kidney that collects urine. Fetal pyelectasis is a prenatal ultrasound finding that is diagnosed with enlargement of the renal pelvis from 4 to 10 millimeters. In many cases, fetal pyelectasis resolves spontaneously. Note that dilatation of the renal pelvis to more than 10 mm is referred to as severe pyelectasis or hydronephrosis. Measurements less than 5mm are normal, should not be designated as pyelectasis, and should not be reported (PMID:16100637).

name: Dilatation of the renal pelvis
label: Dilatation of the renal pelvis
definition: The presence of dilatation of the renal pelvis.

name: Abnormality of ductus venosus blood flow
label: Abnormality of ductus venosus blood flow
definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the ductus venosus.|The ductus venosus is a bypass between the umbilical vein and the inferior vena cava in the fetus. The blood flow through this bypass decreases immediately after birth. Functional closure, which is followed by anatomic closure, is virtually complete within a few weeks of birth. The typical abnormal finding in abnormal ductus venosus flow is a reversed a-wave.

name: Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
label: Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
definition: An abnormality of the fetal circulation system or fetal echocardiogram.

name: Abnormality of umbilical vein blood flow
label: Abnormality of umbilical vein blood flow
definition: A first-trimester prenatal ultrasound finding of abnormal blood flow in the umbilical vein.|Umbilical vein blood flow (UVBF) is closely related to the mass of placental cotyledons and is considered an expression of the amount of oxygen and nutrients transferred from the mother to the fetus.

name: Abnormality of the fourth ventricle
label: Abnormality of the fourth ventricle
definition: An abnormality of the fourth ventricle.|The fourth ventricle is the cerebral ventricle that extends from the cerebral aqueduct to the obex, and is located within the pons and the upper part of the medulla oblongata.

name: Abnormality of the third ventricle
label: Abnormality of the third ventricle
definition: An abnormality of the third ventricle.|The third ventricle is the cerebral ventricle that is located in the midline between the left and right lateral ventricles.

name: Mild fetal ventriculomegaly
label: Mild fetal ventriculomegaly
definition: A kind of ventriculomegaly occurring in the fetal period and usually diagnosed by prenatal ultrasound. Cerebral ventriculomegaly is defined by atrial measurements 10 mm or more. Mild ventriculomegaly (MVM) is defined as measurements between 10 and 15 mm. Measurements are obtained from an axial plane at the level of the thalamic nuclei just below the standard image to measure the BPD (PMID:16100637).|A ventricular atrial diameter of more than 10 mm at 20-24 weeks of gestation has been accepted as defining ventriculomegaly because it represents at least 3 standard deviations above the mean (which is roughly 5 mm at 20-24 weeks of gestation). If the diameter is above 15 mm, the ventriculomegaly is considered to be severe. Amongst the most common causes of ventriculomegaly are impaired absorption of CSF, developmental cerebral defects, and destroyed brain tissue.

name: Noncommunicating hydrocephalus
label: Noncommunicating hydrocephalus
definition: A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed.|The most common form of noncommunicating hydrocephalus is obstructive and is caused by intraventricular or extraventricular mass-occupying lesions that disrupt the ventricular anatomy.

name: Hypoplastic right heart
label: Hypoplastic right heart
definition: Underdevelopment of the right-sided structures of the heart.|Hypoplastic right heart syndrome (HRHS) causes inadequate blood flow to the lungs postnatally and thus leads to cyanosis. HRHS involves pulmonary valve atresia, hypoplasia of the right ventricle, hypoplasia of the tricuspid valve, and a small, hypoplastic pulmonary artery. As the ductus arteriosus closes postnatally, infants with HRHS become critically ill.

name: Dilatation of the bladder
label: Dilatation of the bladder
definition: The presence of a dilated urinary bladder.

name: Fetal megacystis
label: Fetal megacystis
definition: Fetal megacystis is an abnormally enlarged bladder identified at any gestational age.|Abnormal enlargement of the fetal bladder can be detected by prenatal ultrasound by fourteen weeks of gestation. In some cases, dilatation of the fetal bladder is transient and resolves without sequelae, and in other cases it is the earliest manifestation of bladder outlet obstruction.

name: Congenital posterior urethral valve
label: Congenital posterior urethral valve
definition: A developmental defect resulting in an obstructing membrane in the posterior male urethra.|Congenital posterior urethral valve is a cause of bladder outlet obstruction in male newborns. It results from a failure of resorption of the caudal end of the Wolffian duct into the primitive cloaca at the site of the future verumontanum in the posterior urethra (Following normal resorption of the posterior urethral valve there remain the posterior urethral folds, also called plicae colliculi).

name: Bilateral renal agenesis
label: Bilateral renal agenesis
definition: A bilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

name: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung
label: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung
definition: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. A CCAM does not have systemic arterial blood supply (in contrast to bronchopulmonary sequenstration). It is a cystic area within the lung that originates from abnormal embryogenesis.|Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) results in a multicystic mass that replaces the normal lung structure. CCAM is usually unilateral and confined to a single lobe of the lung.

name: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
label: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
definition: The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.|Typically, the lung tissue in BPS receives all or most of its blood supply from an anomalous systemic artery, with the origin of this artery being variable.

name: Intralobar sequestration
label: Intralobar sequestration
definition: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is incorporated into the normal surrounding lung.|Intralobar sequestration (ILS) may be diagnosed on antenatal ultrasound screening. ILS can be asymptomatic in later life or can lead to signs and symptoms related to inadequate tracheobronchial drainage caused by the lesion of adjacent atelectatic lung.

name: Extralobar sequestration
label: Extralobar sequestration
definition: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura.|Extralobar sequestration (ELS) may be asymptomatic. Infants with symptomatic lesions may present with respiratory distress, pneumonia, feeding difficulties, hemorrhage, or even congestive heart failure. The sequestered lobe may cause substantial arteriovenous shunting, leading to high-output cardiac failure.

name: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
label: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
definition: By the 14th week of gestation it is nearly always possible to visualized the fluid-filled fetal stomach bubble on prenatal sonography. This term refers to the absence of a normal fetal stomach bubble on fetal ultrasonography performed at around 16 to 20 weeks' gestation.|The absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography can be an indication of malformations such as esophageal atresia, especially in combination with polyhydramnios.

name: Abnormal circulating long-chain fatty-acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating long-chain fatty-acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.|A long-chain fatty-acid is defined as an aliphatic monocarboxylic acid with a chain length of C13 to C18.

name: Abnormal circulating phytanic acid level
label: Abnormal circulating phytanic acid level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phytanic acid in the blood circulation.|Phytanic acid is a branched-chain saturated fatty acid consisting of hexadecanoic acid carrying methyl substituents at positions 3, 7, 11 and 15.

name: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid anion concentration
label: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid anion concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.|A fatty acid anion is the conjugate base of a fatty acid.

name: Abnormal circulating carnitine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating carnitine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation.|L-carnitine (3-hydroxy-4-N.trimethylammonium butyrate) plays a key role in facilitating the transport of long-chain fatty acids from the cytosol into the mitochondrial matrix, where they undergo 13-oxidation.

name: Abnormality of liposaccharide metabolism
label: Abnormality of liposaccharide metabolism
definition: An abnormality of liposaccharide metabolism.

name: Abnormality of glycolipid metabolism
label: Abnormality of glycolipid metabolism
definition: An abnormality of glycolipid metabolism.

name: Blood group antigen abnormality
label: Blood group antigen abnormality
definition: An abnormality of an erythrocyte cell surface molecule.|During development, the human immune system recognizes antigens of the body as 'self' and does not generate antibodies against them.

name: Absence of Lutheran antigen on erythrocytes
label: Absence of Lutheran antigen on erythrocytes
definition: Absence of the Lutheran antigen (a type I integral membrane glycoprotein) from the surface of red blood cells.

name: Anemia of inadequate production
label: Anemia of inadequate production
definition: A kind of anemia characterized by inadequate production of erythrocytes.

name: Abnormal myeloid leukocyte morphology
label: Abnormal myeloid leukocyte morphology
definition: An abnormality of myeloid leukocytes.|A myeloid leukocyte refers to a cell of the monocyte, granulocyte, or mast cell lineage.

name: Abnormal B cell count
label: Abnormal B cell count
definition: A deviation from the normal count of B cells, i.e., the cells that are formed in the bone marrow, migrate to the peripheral lymphatic system, and mature into plasma cells or memory cells.

name: B lymphocytopenia
label: B lymphocytopenia
definition: An abnormal decrease from the normal count of B cells.|Plasma B cells differentiate from B cells and secrete large amounts of antibodies.

name: Abnormal phagocytosis
label: Abnormal phagocytosis
definition: An abnormal functioning of phagocytosis. Phagocytosis is an elegant but complex process for the ingestion and elimination of pathogens, but it is also important for the elimination of apoptotic cells and hence fundamental for tissue homeostasis. Phagocytosis can be divided into four main steps: (i) recognition of the target particle, (ii) signaling to activate the internalization machinery, (iii) phagosome formation, and (iv) phagolysosome maturation.

name: Abnormality of immune system physiology
label: Abnormality of immune system physiology
definition: A functional abnormality of the immune system.

name: Abnormality of lipoprotein cholesterol concentration
label: Abnormality of lipoprotein cholesterol concentration
definition: An abnormal increase or decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.|Lipoproteins transport fats (lipids) in the blood circulation. Lipids are insoluble in water, meaning that they could not be transported in the blood circulation on their own. There are five major types of lipoproteins: (i) chylomicrons; VLDL (very low-density lipoprotein); (iii) IDL (intermediate-density lipoprotein); (iv) LDL (low-density lipoprotein); and (v) HDL (high-density lipoprotein). Clinical measures assess the amount of cholesterol carried by different lipoproteins. For instance, LDL-cholesterol (LDL-C) is the maount of cholesterol carried by LDL.

name: Hyperlipoproteinemia
label: Hyperlipoproteinemia
definition: An abnormal increase in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Hypolipoproteinemia
label: Hypolipoproteinemia
definition: An abnormal decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Polygenic inheritance
label: Polygenic inheritance
definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of many (more than three) gene loci.

name: Oligogenic inheritance
label: Oligogenic inheritance
definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of a few gene loci. It is recommended this term be used for traits governed by three loci, although it is noted that usage of this term in the literature is not uniform.

name: Digenic inheritance
label: Digenic inheritance
definition: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of two gene loci.

name: Gonosomal inheritance
label: Gonosomal inheritance
definition: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the sex chromosomes.

name: Abnormal cellular immune system morphology
label: Abnormal cellular immune system morphology
definition: An abnormality of the morphology or counts of the cells that make up the immune system.

name: Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
label: Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
definition: An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.|The extrinsic pathway is a protein activation cascade that contributes to blood coagulation and consists of the self-limited process linking exposure and activation of tissue factor to the activation of clotting factor X.

name: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
label: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
definition: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.|The intrinsic pathway requires coagulation factors VIII, IX, X, XI, and XII, as well as the proteins prekallikrein (PK) and high-molecular-weight kininogen (HK or HMWK), in addition to calcium ions and phospholipids secreted from platelets.

name: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
label: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
definition: An abnormality of blood coagulation, common pathway.|The common pathway is a protein activation cascade that contributes to blood coagulation and consists of events leading from the formation of activated factor X to the formation of active thrombin, the cleavage of fibrinogen by thrombin, and the formation of cleaved fibrin into a stable multimeric, cross-linked complex.

name: Abnormal morphology of the abdominal musculature
label: Abnormal morphology of the abdominal musculature
definition: An abnormality of the abdominal musculature.

name: Stress urinary incontinence
label: Stress urinary incontinence
definition: Involuntary urine leakage synchronous with exertion, or actions such as sneezing, or coughing.

name: Abnormality of the cerebral subcortex
label: Abnormality of the cerebral subcortex
definition: An abnormality of the cerebral subcortex.|The cerebral subcortex contains the basal ganglia and the cerebral white matter.

name: Abnormal corpus striatum morphology
label: Abnormal corpus striatum morphology
definition: Abnormality of the striatum, which is the largest nucleus of the basal ganglia, comprising the caudate, putamen and ventral striatum, including the nucleus accumbens.|The striatum (also known as the neostriatum or striate nucleus) contains the caudate nucleus and putamen, which are separated from one another by a white matter tract called the internal capsule. The striatum is part of the basal ganglia and receives input from the cerebral cortex. Essentially all cortical areas (sensory, motor and associational) project to the striatum. The other major input to the striatum comes from the thalamus, particularly the intralaminar thalamic nuclei.

name: Abnormal circulating dicarboxylic acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating dicarboxylic acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a dicarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.|A dicarboxylic acid is an oxoacid containing two carboxy groups.

name: Abnormal circulating monocarboxylic acid cocentration
label: Abnormal circulating monocarboxylic acid cocentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionizing radiation
label: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionizing radiation
definition: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with ionizing radiation.|Increased tendency to chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents is typical for several disorders including ataxia teleangiectasia and Nijmegen breakage syndrome.

name: Increased susceptibility to spontaneous sister chromatid exchange
label: Increased susceptibility to spontaneous sister chromatid exchange
definition: An increase in the number of spontaneous sister chromatid exchanges observed in cell culture of lymphocytes or other cells.|Increased susceptibility to spontaneous sister chromatid exchange is characteristic for Bloom syndrome.

name: Increased bone mineral density
label: Increased bone mineral density
definition: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.|This term may be merged with Increased bone density in the future or made obsolete.

name: Osteopetrosis
label: Osteopetrosis
definition: Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal.

name: High myopia
label: High myopia
definition: A severe form of myopia with greater than -6.00 diopters.

name: Abnormal systemic arterial morphology
label: Abnormal systemic arterial morphology
definition: An abnormality of the systemic arterial tree, which consists of the aorta and other systemic arteries.

name: Mixed cirrhosis
label: Mixed cirrhosis
definition: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of regenerative nodules of a variety of sizes.|In mixed cirrhosis, there are regenerating nodules under and over 3 mm in size.

name: Abnormal morphology of the musculature of the neck
label: Abnormal morphology of the musculature of the neck
definition: An abnormality of the neck musculature.

name: Temporal pattern
label: Temporal pattern
definition: The speed at which disease manifestations appear and develop.

name: Acute
label: Acute
definition: Sudden appearance of disease manifestations over a short period of time.|The word acute is applied to different time scales depending on the disease or manifestation and does not have an exact definition in minutes, hours, or days.

name: Chronic
label: Chronic
definition: Slow, creeping onset, slow progress and long continuance of disease manifestations.|According to the U.S. National Center for Health Statistics, a chronic condition is one lasting 3 months or more.

name: Subacute
label: Subacute
definition: Somewhat rapid onset and change of disease manifestations.|Subacute is between acute and chronic.

name: Abnormal circulating polysaccharide concentration
label: Abnormal circulating polysaccharide concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a polysaccharide in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating carbohydrate concentration
label: Abnormal circulating carbohydrate concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a carbohydrate in the blood circulation.|An abnormality of the metabolism (include abnormality of the concentration) of a carbohydrate, including monosaccharides, oligosaccharides and polysaccharides, and substances derived from them.

name: Abnormal glucose homeostasis
label: Abnormal glucose homeostasis
definition: Abnormality of glucose homeostasis.|An abnormality of any process involved in the maintenance of an internal steady state of glucose within an organism or cell.

name: Abnormal blood glucose concentration
label: Abnormal blood glucose concentration
definition: An abnormality of the concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Abnormality of urine glucose concentration
label: Abnormality of urine glucose concentration
definition: An abnormality of the concentration of glucose in the urine.

name: Abnormal cellular physiology
label: Abnormal cellular physiology
definition: An abnormality in a cellular process.

name: Abnormality of the cell cycle
label: Abnormality of the cell cycle
definition: An abnormality of the cell cycle.

name: Abnormality of chromosome condensation
label: Abnormality of chromosome condensation
definition: An abnormality of chromosome condensation.

name: Abnormality of mucopolysaccharide metabolism
label: Abnormality of mucopolysaccharide metabolism
definition: An abnormality of the metabolism of mucopolysaccharide.

name: Abnormal circulating unsaturated fatty acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating unsaturated fatty acid concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of an unsaturated fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating prostaglandin circulation
label: Abnormal circulating prostaglandin circulation
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a prostaglandin in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
label: Abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
definition: An abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Abnormal cardiovascular system physiology
label: Abnormal cardiovascular system physiology
definition: Abnormal functionality of the cardiovascular system.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the vagina
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the vagina
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

name: Abnormal fallopian tube morphology
label: Abnormal fallopian tube morphology
definition: An abnormality of the fallopian tube.|The Fallopian tubes (also known as oviducts, uterine tubes, and salpinges) are ducts that lead from the ovaries into the uterus.

name: Abnormality of blood circulation
label: Abnormality of blood circulation
definition: An abnormality of blood circulation.

name: Internal hemorrhage
label: Internal hemorrhage
definition: The presence of hemorrhage within the body.

name: Abnormal blood transition element cation concentration
label: Abnormal blood transition element cation concentration
definition: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of transition element cation.

name: Abnormality of iron homeostasis
label: Abnormality of iron homeostasis
definition: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of iron cation.

name: Abnormality of fluid regulation
label: Abnormality of fluid regulation
definition: An abnormality of the regulation of body fluids.

name: Impairment of fructose metabolism
label: Impairment of fructose metabolism
definition: An impairment of a fructose metabolic process.

name: Amyloidosis
label: Amyloidosis
definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in one or more tissues. Amyloidosis may be defined as the extracellular deposition of amyloid in one or more sites of the body.|The medical literautre on amyloidosis is confused with clinical and histochemical designations used when the amyloid disease processes were poorly understood. To be designated an amyloid fibril protein, the protein must occur in tissue deposits and exhibit affinity for Congo red and green birefringence when viewed by polarisation microscopy.

name: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
label: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
definition: An abnormality of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Abnormality of renal excretion
label: Abnormality of renal excretion
definition: An altered ability of the kidneys to void urine and/or specific substances.

name: Decreased urine output
label: Decreased urine output
definition: A decreased rate of urine production.|A reduction in the overall amount of urine output.

name: Abnormality of renal resorption
label: Abnormality of renal resorption
definition: An abnormality of renal absorption.

name: Abnormality of the helix
label: Abnormality of the helix
definition: An abnormality of the helix. The helix is the outer rim of the ear that extends from the insertion of the ear on the scalp (root) to the termination of the cartilage at the earlobe.

name: Abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct
label: Abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct
definition: An abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cervical spine
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cervical spine
definition: Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Abnormal blood potassium concentration
label: Abnormal blood potassium concentration
definition: An abnormal concentration of potassium.

name: Abnormality of circulating adrenocorticotropin level
label: Abnormality of circulating adrenocorticotropin level
definition: An abnormal concentration of corticotropin in the blood.|Adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), also known as corticotropin, is a polypeptide hormone produced and secreted by the pituitary gland comprising 39 amino acid residues coupled in a linear sequence. . It is a component of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis and stimulates increased production and release of corticosteroids and cortisol from the adrenal cortex.

name: Abnormal number of permanent teeth
label: Abnormal number of permanent teeth
definition: The presence of an altered number of of permanent teeth.

name: Agenesis of permanent maxillary central incisor
label: Agenesis of permanent maxillary central incisor
definition: Agenesis of upper secondary incisor.|This feature is to be distinguished from single central upper incisor, which is median.

name: Agenesis of primary maxillary central incisor
label: Agenesis of primary maxillary central incisor
definition: Agenesis of upper central primary incisor.|This feature is to be distinguished from single central upper incisor, which is median.

name: Agenesis of primary mandibular central incisor
label: Agenesis of primary mandibular central incisor
definition: Agenesis of lower primary incisor.

name: Agenesis of permanent mandibular central incisor
label: Agenesis of permanent mandibular central incisor
definition: Agenesis of lower secondary incisor.

name: Agenesis of primary maxillary lateral incisor
label: Agenesis of primary maxillary lateral incisor
definition: Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor.

name: Agenesis of permanent maxillary lateral incisor
label: Agenesis of permanent maxillary lateral incisor
definition: Agenesis of one or more upper lateral secondary incisor.

name: Agenesis of premolar
label: Agenesis of premolar
definition: Agenesis of premolar tooth.|Note that premolar teeth occur only in the permanent dentition.

name: Agenesis of maxillary premolar
label: Agenesis of maxillary premolar
definition: Agenesis of maxillary premolar.|Note that premolar teeth occur only in the permanent dentition.

name: Agenesis of mandibular premolar
label: Agenesis of mandibular premolar
definition: Agenesis of mandibular premolar.

name: Agenesis of molar
label: Agenesis of molar
definition: Agenesis of molar tooth.

name: Agenesis of permanent molar
label: Agenesis of permanent molar
definition: Agenesis of secondary molar tooth.

name: Agenesis of first permanent molar tooth
label: Agenesis of first permanent molar tooth
definition: Agenesis of either maxillary first permanent molar or mandibular first permanent molar or both.

name: Agenesis of second permanent molar
label: Agenesis of second permanent molar
definition: Agenesis of either mandibular second permanent molar or maxillary second permanent molar.

name: Generalized periodontitis
label: Generalized periodontitis
definition: A generalized form of periodontitis.

name: Localized periodontitis
label: Localized periodontitis
definition: A localized form of periodontitis.

name: Dentinogenesis imperfecta limited to primary teeth
label: Dentinogenesis imperfecta limited to primary teeth
definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin affecting only the primary dentition.

name: Abnormality of dental structure
label: Abnormality of dental structure
definition: An abnormality of the structure or composition of the teeth.

name: Misalignment of incisors
label: Misalignment of incisors
definition: Misaligned incisor.

name: Abnormality of incisor morphology
label: Abnormality of incisor morphology
definition: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth.

name: Abnormal number of incisors
label: Abnormal number of incisors
definition: The presence of an altered number of the incisor teeth.

name: Conical incisor
label: Conical incisor
definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the incisor tooth.|Conical incisors are incisors that are round in cross-sectional views of the crown or that have a rounded appearance. Conical incisors may have a pointed shape that tapers to a point at the tip of the tooth. One speaks of conical incisor for a conical shaped tooth that is located in the region where incisors normally are.

name: Mesiodens
label: Mesiodens
definition: The presence of a supernumerary tooth in the midline between the maxillary central incisors.|A mesiodens is not a supernumerary incisor (i.e., it does not have the morphology of an incisor). Rather, it is a conoid, extra tooth located between the maxillary central incisors.

name: Odontoma
label: Odontoma
definition: The presence of an odontoma.|MPATH defines odontoma as a hamartomatous malformation of odontogenic tissue. It may vary from nondescript masses of dental tissue (complex odontoma) to multiple well-formed teeth (compound odontoma).

name: Increased number of teeth
label: Increased number of teeth
definition: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, tooth or teeth.|The most frequent supernumerary tooth is a mesiodens, which occurs between the two maxillary central incisors. Often it fails to erupt, but creates a large anterior diastema, and would not be detected on physical examination (requires X-ray evaluation). This designation excludes coexistence of primary and permanent dentition due to delayed loss of the former. Note that this term does not refer to the situation in which two rows of teeth are seen at the time of eruption of permanent dentition before exfoliation of primary teeth, which can be a normal finding.

name: Abnormality of molar morphology
label: Abnormality of molar morphology
definition: An abnormality of morphology of molar tooth.

name: Abnormality of permanent molar morphology
label: Abnormality of permanent molar morphology
definition: An abnormality of morphology of permanent molar.

name: Abnormality of dental color
label: Abnormality of dental color
definition: A developmental defect of tooth color.

name: Localized hypoplasia of dental enamel
label: Localized hypoplasia of dental enamel
definition: A localized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

name: Green teeth
label: Green teeth
definition: A green staining of teeth.|Green teeth are a rare finding in children with neonatal hyperbilirubinaemia due to blood group incompatibility, sepsis-induced cholestasis or biliary atresia. Rarely, green staining of the teeth may be seen with cholestasis and sepsis.

name: Abnormality of premolar
label: Abnormality of premolar
definition: An abnormality of premolar tooth.

name: Abnormality of molar
label: Abnormality of molar
definition: An abnormality of molar tooth.

name: Abnormality of canine
label: Abnormality of canine
definition: An abnormality of canine tooth.

name: Impacted tooth
label: Impacted tooth
definition: A tooth that has not erupted because of local impediments (overcrowding or fibrous gum overgrowth).

name: Abnormality of premolar morphology
label: Abnormality of premolar morphology
definition: An abnormality of morphology of premolar tooth.

name: Incisor macrodontia
label: Incisor macrodontia
definition: Increased size of the incisor tooth.

name: Conical primary incisor
label: Conical primary incisor
definition: An abnormal conical morphology of the primary incisor.

name: Conical maxillary incisor
label: Conical maxillary incisor
definition: An abnormal conical morphology of either maxillary primary incisor tooth or maxillary permanent incisor tooth or both.

name: Hypocalcification of dental enamel
label: Hypocalcification of dental enamel
definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by reduced calcification.

name: Hypomature dental enamel
label: Hypomature dental enamel
definition: A form of hypomineralization of enamel characterized by a chalky appearance of the enamel with orange, brown, or white color.|Radiographically there is normal thickness of enamel and the enamel is slightly more radiolucent than dentin.

name: Dentinogenesis imperfecta of primary and permanent teeth
label: Dentinogenesis imperfecta of primary and permanent teeth
definition: Developmental dysplasia of dentin or both the primary dentition and the permanent dentition.

name: Talon cusp
label: Talon cusp
definition: Talon cusp is an accessory cusp located near the cingulum (the portion of the lingual or palatal aspect of the tooth that forms a convex protuberance at the cervical third of the anatomic crown).

name: Dens in dente
label: Dens in dente
definition: An abnormality of the incisor characterized by invagination of the enamel, giving a radiographic appearance that suggests a tooth within a tooth.|Dens in dente is Latin for tooth inside of tooth.

name: Double tooth
label: Double tooth
definition: A dental anomaly characterized by the presence of a two fused teeth.

name: Fused teeth
label: Fused teeth
definition: The union of two separately developing tooth germs typically leading to one less tooth than normal in the affected dental arch.

name: Gemination
label: Gemination
definition: The development of two teeth from a single tooth bud, leading to a larger fused tooth.|If the fused tooth is counted singly, then the total number of teeth is normal with gemination. Usually, there is a larger dental crown with a single root and single canal.

name: Mulberry molar
label: Mulberry molar
definition: Mulberry molars are irregular teeth generally affecting the first molars and are characterized by a grossly deformed crown imitating, as the name implies, the surface of a mulberry.

name: Molarization of premolar
label: Molarization of premolar
definition: Increased size and molar morphology of premolar tooth.

name: Overbite
label: Overbite
definition: Maxillary teeth cover the mandibular teeth when biting to an increased degree.

name: Overjet
label: Overjet
definition: An abnormal anteroposterior extension of the maxillary teeth beyond the plane of the mandibular teeth upon jaw closure.

name: Peripheral demyelination
label: Peripheral demyelination
definition: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.|This feature is generally diagnosed on the basis of a sural nerve biopsy. Demyelination is associated with slowed nerve conduction, increased refractoriness, and conduction block.

name: Epileptic spasms
label: Epileptic spasms
definition: A sudden flexion, extension or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles which is usually more sustained than a myoclonic movement but not as sustained as a tonic seizure.|The maximum age of onset is between 3 and 12 months, the peak being at 6 months. However, spasms may start from birth, or appear long after the age of 12 months, including into adulthood. Infantile spasms represent a specific type of seizure seen in an epilepsy syndrome of infancy and childhood known as West Syndrome. West Syndrome is characterized by infantile spasms, developmental regression, and hypsarrhythmia (as demonstrated by electroencephalography).

name: Speech apraxia
label: Speech apraxia
definition: A type of apraxia that is characterized by difficulty or inability to execute speech movements because of problems with coordination and motor problems, leading to incorrect articulation. An increase of errors with increasing word and phrase length may occur.|Speech apraxia may co-occur with oral apraxia and limb apraxia.

name: Spastic hemiparesis
label: Spastic hemiparesis
definition: Unilateral paresis (weakness) with spasticity of the affected muscles and increased tendon reflexes.

name: Intestinal atresia
label: Intestinal atresia
definition: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the intestine.|Intestinal atresia is a broad term used to describe a complete blockage or obstruction anywhere in the intestine, in contrast to stenosis, which refers to a partial obstruction that results in a narrowing of the intestinal lumen.

name: Ileal atresia
label: Ileal atresia
definition: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the ileum.

name: Abnormal left ventricular outflow tract morphology
label: Abnormal left ventricular outflow tract morphology
definition: An abnormality of the outflow tract of the left ventricle.

name: Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
label: Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
definition: An abnormality in the amount of volume occupied by intravascular blood.

name: Hypervolemia
label: Hypervolemia
definition: An increase in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.

name: Hypovolemia
label: Hypovolemia
definition: An decrease in the amount of intravascular fluid, particularly in the volume of the circulating blood.

name: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis
label: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis
definition: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.|Recurrent aphthous stomatitis can be classified into three forms, with minor ulcers (over 80% of RAS cases) being less than 1 cm in diameter and self-limiting; major ulcers being over 1 cm in diameter with potential scar formation; and herpetiform ulcers manifesting as recurrent episodes with multiple small ulcers throughout the oral mucosa.

name: Recurrent sinusitis
label: Recurrent sinusitis
definition: A recurrent form of sinusitis.|Recurring inflammation of the paranasal sinuses.

name: Chronic sinusitis
label: Chronic sinusitis
definition: A chronic form of sinusitis.

name: Tonsillitis
label: Tonsillitis
definition: An inflammation of the tonsils.

name: Abnormality of immune serum protein physiology
label: Abnormality of immune serum protein physiology
definition: An abnormality of the concentration or function of circulating immune proteins.

name: Abnormality of serum cytokine level
label: Abnormality of serum cytokine level
definition: Abnormality of the cytokine levels in the blood, i.e., an abnormality of any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells.

name: Abnormality of cytokine secretion
label: Abnormality of cytokine secretion
definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a cytokine (i.e., any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells).

name: Defective production of NFKB1-dependent cytokines
label: Defective production of NFKB1-dependent cytokines
definition: An impairment in the production by leukocytes of NFKB1-dependent cytokines such as tumor necrosis factor-alpha and interferon-alpha.

name: Abnormality of chemokine secretion
label: Abnormality of chemokine secretion
definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a chemokine (a class of cytokines).

name: Abnormality of interferon secretion
label: Abnormality of interferon secretion
definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interferons (a class of cytokines).

name: Abnormality of interleukin secretion
label: Abnormality of interleukin secretion
definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of interleukins (a class of cytokines).

name: Abnormality of tumor necrosis factor secretion
label: Abnormality of tumor necrosis factor secretion
definition: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of tumor necrosis factor.

name: Abnormality of the nasal dorsum
label: Abnormality of the nasal dorsum
definition: An abnormality of the nasal dorsum, also known as the nasal ridge.|The nasal ridge is the midline prominence of the nose, extending from the nasal root to the tip.

name: Concave nasal ridge
label: Concave nasal ridge
definition: Nasal ridge curving posteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip.|A saddle-nose deformity can be congenital or acquired (e.g., traumatic) and is associated with structural compromise of the nasoseptal cartilage leading to decreased dorsal nasal structural support. A depression of the dorsum of the nose with loss of nasal tip support and definition, shortened (vertical) nasal length, overrotation of the nasal tip, and retrusion of the nasal spine and caudal septum.

name: Abnormality of skin morphology
label: Abnormality of skin morphology
definition: Any morphological abnormality of the skin.

name: Abnormality of skin physiology
label: Abnormality of skin physiology
definition: Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.

name: Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
label: Inflammatory abnormality of the skin
definition: The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes.

name: Abnormality of epidermal morphology
label: Abnormality of epidermal morphology
definition: An abnormality of the morphology of the epidermis.

name: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
label: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
definition: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).

name: Nephroptosis
label: Nephroptosis
definition: A significant descent of the kidney as the patient moves from the supine to the erect position.|Nephroptosis is diagnosed if the descent of the kidney is greater than 5 cm or two vertebral bodies on intravenous urogram. The kidney is capable of moving back to the normal position, which differentiates it from an ectopic kidney, which constantly remains in an abnormal position. Nephroptosis may be asymptomatic or may cause symptoms including pain and intermittent ureteric obstruction with hydronephrosis, and ischemia due to elongation, narrowing, or kinking of a renal artery.

name: Perioral eczema
label: Perioral eczema
definition: A type of eczema that occurs in the lips and perioral area.|Perioral eczema mainly affects children.

name: Acute esophageal necrosis
label: Acute esophageal necrosis
definition: A condition characterized by necrosis of the mucosal and submucosal layers of the esophagus not related to ingestion of caustic or other injurious agents. Endoscopically, there is a dark lesion ('black esophagus') distributed in a circumferential manner in the distal one-third of the esophagus with or without exudates. There is involvement of the distal esophagus ending sharply at the gastroesophageal junction.

name: Bilateral fetal pyelectasis
label: Bilateral fetal pyelectasis
definition: A bilateral form of fetal pyelectasis.

name: Abnormal renal calyx morphology
label: Abnormal renal calyx morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the morphology of the major calices or minor calices of the kidney.

name: Perianal rash
label: Perianal rash
definition: The presence of a rash (change of color and texture) of the perianal skin.

name: Chronic furunculosis
label: Chronic furunculosis
definition: A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection.|Note that a confluence of several furuncles results in a carbuncle.

name: Increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation
label: Increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation
definition: An abnormally increased sensitivity to the effects of ionizing radiation.|Ionizing radiation can lead to the production of free radicals, break chemical bonds, and damage DNA; RNA, and proteins. Cellular damage related to low doses such as that received from normal background radiation is rapidly repaired under normal conditions.

name: Low-grade fever
label: Low-grade fever
definition: Mild fever that does not exceed 38.5 degree centrigrade.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sweat glands
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sweat glands
definition: Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the sweat glands.

name: Aplasia of the sweat glands
label: Aplasia of the sweat glands
definition: Absence of the sweat glands.

name: Non-pruritic urticaria
label: Non-pruritic urticaria
definition: Pale reddish slightly elevated papules and plaques of 0.5-3 cm in diameter and not accompanied by pruritus.|Although the English-language names for uritcaria and non-pruritic urticaria are very similar these are treated as distinct lesions. Non-pruritic urticaria should not be considered to be a subclass of urticaria, because the latter is characterized by pruritus.

name: Abnormality of skin adnexa morphology
label: Abnormality of skin adnexa morphology
definition: An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.

name: Gastric duplication
label: Gastric duplication
definition: Gastric duplication is a usually cystic malformation of gastrointestinal tract, usually attached to the greater curvature of the stomach and has no communication with the stomach.|Gastric duplication usually presents as gastric outlet obstruction. They are usually spherical in form, do not communicate with the stomach, and are generally localized at the greater curvature. In some cases they may exhibit adhesion to the pancreas and even communicate with aberrant pancreatic ducts. Gastric duplication is more frequent in females. It is generally either diagnosed in infancy because of symptoms of gastric outlet obstruction or is an incidental finding in adulthood.

name: Gastrointestinal duplication
label: Gastrointestinal duplication
definition: A spherical hollow structure with a smooth muscle coat, lined by a mucous membrane, and attached to any part of the gastrointestinal tract, from the base of the tongue to the anus.

name: Age-related cataract
label: Age-related cataract
definition: A type of cataract (opacification of the lens) that forms during the course of aging.|The lens is formed from ectodermal tissue and contains epithelial cells that give rise to lens fibres throughout life, so with increasing age the lens becomes more compact and thicker.

name: Age-related nuclear cataract
label: Age-related nuclear cataract
definition: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the nucleus of the lens.|As the lens ages, new layers of fibres are added and the lens nucleus is compressed and becomes harder (nuclear sclerosis cataract), with associated yellowing of the lens. Nuclear sclerosis typically progresses slowly.

name: Age-related cortical cataract
label: Age-related cortical cataract
definition: A type of age-related cataract that primarily affects the cortex of the lens.|The cortex of the lens is made of the newest lens fibres. With ageing, discrete opacities can develop within the cortex of the lens that typically cause no visual symptoms unless they involve the visual axis or the entire cortex, in which case the lens becomes white and is said to be mature.

name: Age-related posterior subcapsular cataract
label: Age-related posterior subcapsular cataract
definition: A type of age-related cataract consisting of granular opacities occurring mainly in the central posterior cortex just under the posterior capsule.

name: Symptomatic seizures
label: Symptomatic seizures
definition:
A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed.|While all patients with epilepsy experience seizures, not all individuals with seizures have epilepsy. One or more
epileptic seizures may occur in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic). These events (defined acute symptomatic seizures, provoked seizures, or situation-related seizures) are presumed to be an acute
manifestation of the insult and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase
has elapsed.

name: Typical absence seizure
label: Typical absence seizure
definition: A typical absence seizure is a generalized seizure with abrupt onset and offset of altered awareness which can vary in severity (see specific syndromes). Memory for events during the seizures is usually impaired although there may be some retained awareness particularly for adolescents. Clonic movements of eyelids, head, eyebrows, chin, perioral or other facial parts may occur, most typically at 3Hz. Myoclonus of limbs can rarely occur. Oral and manual automatisms are common and there may be perseveration of behaviors occurring prior to seizure onset.|Typical absences have 2 essential components: (1) clinically the impairment of consciousness (absence), and (2) EEG generalized 3 Hz to 4 Hz (less than 2.5 Hz) spike and slow wave discharges.

name: obsolete Absence seizures with special features
label: obsolete Absence seizures with special features

name: Absence seizure with eyelid myoclonia
label: Absence seizure with eyelid myoclonia
definition: Absence seizures accompanied by brief, repetitive, often rhythmic, fast (4-6 Hz) myoclonic jerks of the eyelids with simultaneous upward deviation of the eyeballs and extension of the head. Seizures are typically very brief (less than 6s in duration) and multiple seizures occur on a daily basis. Mostly awareness is retained.

name: Myoclonic absence
label: Myoclonic absence
definition: Rhythmic myoclonic jerks of the shoulders and arms with tonic abduction that results in progressive lifting of the arms during the seizure. The myoclonic jerks are typically bilateral but may be unilateral or asymmetric. Perioral myoclonias and rhythmic jerks of the head and legs may occur. Seizures last 10-60 seconds and typically occur daily. Level of awareness varies from complete loss of awareness to retained awareness.

name: Obtundation status
label: Obtundation status
definition: Atypical absence lasting for more than 30 minutes.|Obtundation status is often seen in patients with Lennox-Gastaut-Syndrome.

name: Early onset absence seizures
label: Early onset absence seizures
definition: Typical absence seizures starting before the age of 4 years.

name: Focal motor seizure
label: Focal motor seizure
definition: A type of focal-onset seizure characterized by a motor sign as its initial semiological manifestation.|A motor onset seizure involves motor activity (movement) and may be due to either an increase or decrease in contraction in a muscle or group of muscles. Depending on the muscle groups involved and the way they are affected, the movement features of a motor onset seizure may be simple or more complex.

name: Focal autonomic seizure
label: Focal autonomic seizure
definition: Focal seizures with an objectively documented and distinct alteration of autonomic nervous system function involving cardiovascular, pupillary, gastrointestinal, sudomotor, vasomotor and thermoregularity functions.

name: Focal autonomic seizures with altered responsiveness
label: Focal autonomic seizures with altered responsiveness
definition: An autonomic seizure with altered responsiveness.

name: Focal autonomic seizures without altered responsiveness
label: Focal autonomic seizures without altered responsiveness
definition: An autonomic seizure without altered responsiveness.

name: Focal sensory seizure
label: Focal sensory seizure
definition: A focal sensory seizure involves a sensation being experienced at seizure onset, without objective clinical signs of a seizure evident to the observer.

name: Focal sensory auditory seizure
label: Focal sensory auditory seizure
definition: A type of focal sensory seizure that is characterized by elementary auditory phenomena including buzzing, ringing, drumming or single tones.|More complex auditory hallucinations such as voices are considered a focal cognitive seizure. Focal sensory auditory seizures involve auditory cortex in the lateral superior temporal lobe.

name: Epigastric auras
label: Epigastric auras
definition: Auras with abdominal discomfort including nausea, emptiness, tightness, churning, butterflies, malaise, pain, and hunger; sensation may rise to chest or throat. Some phenomena may reflect ictal autonomic dysfunction.

name: Focal sensory gustatory seizure
label: Focal sensory gustatory seizure
definition: Auras with taste sensations including acidic, bitter, salty , sweet or metallic tastes.

name: Olfactory auras
label: Olfactory auras
definition: Auras with sensation of odor, usually disagreeable.

name: Psychic auras
label: Psychic auras
definition: Auras with affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual phenomena including illusory or composite hallucinatory events.|Events may appear alone or in combination. Included are feelings of depersonalisation. These phenomena have subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognised by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.

name: Somatosensory auras
label: Somatosensory auras
definition: Auras with sensation of tingling, numbness, electric shock sensations, pain, sense of movement, or desire to move.

name: Vegetative auras
label: Vegetative auras
definition: A sensation consistent with involvement of the autonomic nervous system, including cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, sudomotor, vasomotor and thermoregulatory functions.

name: Visual auras
label: Visual auras
definition: Auras with sensation of flashing or flickering lights, spots, simple patterns, scotomata, or amaurosis.|Note that there is a distinction between Visual aura and Simple partial occipital seizures. See HPO term HP:0025121 for comments.

name: Focal tonic seizures
label: Focal tonic seizures
definition: Seizures with sustained increase in muscle contraction in parts of the body lasting a few seconds to minutes.

name: Eyelid myoclonias
label: Eyelid myoclonias
definition: Focal seizure with eyelid myoclonia, not eyelid myoclonias in the context of absence seizures.

name: Generalized clonic seizures
label: Generalized clonic seizures
definition: Seizures with regularly repetitive myoclonus, involving the same muscle groups, at a frequency of about 2-3 c/sec.

name: Myoclonic atonic seizures
label: Myoclonic atonic seizures
definition: Seizures with sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone with a preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting one to two seconds or more, involving head, trunk, jaw or limb musculature.

name: Simple febrile seizures
label: Simple febrile seizures
definition: Febrile seizures with generalized tonic-clonic semiology, duration less than 15 minutes, and without recurrence within the next 24 hours.

name: Complex febrile seizures
label: Complex febrile seizures
definition: Febrile seizures with focal semiology, duration of more than 15 minutes, or occurring in a cluster of 2 or more convulsions within 24 hours.|Note that semiology refers to the clinical symptoms of an epileptic seizure.

name: Hypokinetic seizures
label: Hypokinetic seizures
definition: Seizures with a decrease in amplitude and/or rate or arrest of ongoing motor activity.

name: Hyperkinetic seizures
label: Hyperkinetic seizures
definition: Seizures with increase in rate of ongoing movements or inappropriately rapid performance of a movement involving predominantly proximal limb or axial muscles producing irregular sequential ballistic movements, such as pedaling, pelvic thrashing, rocking movements.

name: Versive seizures
label: Versive seizures
definition: Tonic seizures with a sustained, forced conjugate ocular, cephalic and/or truncal rotation or lateral deviation from the midline.

name: EEG with constitutional variants
label: EEG with constitutional variants
definition: An EEG with constitutional variants contains waves that are rare or unusual but not generally pathologic.

name: EEG with 4-5/second background activity
label: EEG with 4-5/second background activity
