name: Midline sinus of philtrum
label: Midline sinus of philtrum
definition: Pit in the midline of the philtral groove.|Although congenital sinuses of the lips generally occur in the lower lip, in rare instances they may appear in the philtrum of the upper lip, commonly close to the insertion of the columella.

name: Narrow philtrum
label: Narrow philtrum
definition: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.|Although congenital sinuses of the lips generally occur in the lower lip, in rare instances they may appear in the philtrum of the upper lip, commonly close to the insertion of the columella.

name: Abnormal oral mucosa morphology
label: Abnormal oral mucosa morphology
definition: Abnormality of the oral mucosa.

name: Deviated nasal tip
label: Deviated nasal tip
definition: Nasal tip positioned to one side of the midline.|There is no specific minimal angle before the tip can be determined to be deviated. The assessment of a mild degree of deviation is highly dependant on the experience of the observer. A deviated nasal septum can accompany a deviated nasal tip.

name: Narrow nasal tip
label: Narrow nasal tip
definition: Decrease in width of the nasal tip.|Nasal tip width is assessed at the anterior junction of the alae and the tip. This is easier in persons with a somewhat squared shape of the nasal tip. This may be best viewed from the inferior aspect of the nose. No objective measures are available.

name: Overhanging nasal tip
label: Overhanging nasal tip
definition: Positioning of the nasal tip inferior to the nasal base.|This finding is often associated with a long nasal ridge. It is best appreciated in profile. This may also coexist with a Depressed nasal tip and Low insertion of the columella and should be coded separately.

name: Moyamoya phenomenon
label: Moyamoya phenomenon
definition: A noninflammatory, progressive occlusion of the intracranial carotid arteries owing to the formation of netlike collateral arteries arising from the circle of Willis.|Cerebral angiography shows puff-of-smoke (moyamoya) collaterals at the base of the brain.

name: Absent scaphoid
label: Absent scaphoid
definition: Congenital absence of the scaphoid..

name: Delayed talus ossification
label: Delayed talus ossification
definition: Delayed maturation and calcification of the talus.

name: Partial IgA deficiency
label: Partial IgA deficiency
definition: Detectable but decreased IgA levels that are more than 2 standard deviations below normal age-adjusted means.

name: Sclerodactyly
label: Sclerodactyly
definition: Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.

name: Abnormal T cell count
label: Abnormal T cell count
definition: A deviation from the normal count of T cells.

name: Abnormality of T cell physiology
label: Abnormality of T cell physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of T cells.

name: Ventricular flutter
label: Ventricular flutter
definition: A potentially lethal cardiac arrhythmia characterized by an extremely rapid, hemodynamically unstable ventricular tachycardia (150-300 beats/min) with a large oscillating sine-wave appearance.|If untreated, ventricular flutter typically progresses to ventricular fibrillation.

name: Abnormality of skeletal morphology
label: Abnormality of skeletal morphology
definition: An abnormality of the form, structure, or size of the skeletal system.

name: Abnormality of skeletal physiology
label: Abnormality of skeletal physiology
definition: An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system.

name: Abnormal appendicular skeleton morphology
label: Abnormal appendicular skeleton morphology
definition: An abnormality of the appendicular skeletal system, consisting of the of the limbs, shoulder and pelvic girdles.

name: Short second metatarsal
label: Short second metatarsal
definition: Short (hypoplastic) second metatarsal bone.

name: Osteoblastoma
label: Osteoblastoma
definition: A benign, painful, tumor of bone characterized by the formation of osteoid tissue, primitive bone and calcified tissue.

name: Giant cell tumor of bone
label: Giant cell tumor of bone
definition: A bone tumor composed of cellular spindle-cell stroma containing scattered multinucleated giant cells resembling osteoclasts.

name: Abdominal colic
label: Abdominal colic
definition: A type of abdominal pain that comes and goes in waves, most often starting and ending suddenly and being of severe intensity.|Colicky abdominal pain can be caused by kidney stones and gallstones, among other etiologies. This type of pain is thought to be caused by spasm, obstruction, or distension of any of the hollow viscera of the gastrointestinal system.

name: Abnormal bone ossification
label: Abnormal bone ossification
definition: Any anomaly in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance.|All bones are formed by the replacement by osteocytes of mesenchyme-derived connective tissue. Intramembranous ossification refers to the direct replacement of primitive mesenchyme with bone, and is responsible for bones such as the calvarium (e.g., frontals, parietals, interparietal) and the clavicula. In endochondral ossification, the mesenchyme differentiates into a cartilaginous intermediate, which serves as a template (anlange) that is subsequently removed and replaced by bone. Most bones are formed via endochondral ossification, including those at the base of the skull, the vertebral column, pectoral and pelvic regions and long bones of the extremities. A reduction in the amount of mineralized bone compared with that expected for a given developmental age. In clinicakl parlance, reduced ossification and delayed ossification are often used synonymously, but in principle a bone delayed ossification in a child can display normal ossification at a later developmental stage. The HPO will therefore treat poor, reduced, and decreased officiation as synonymous, and delayed ossification as a specific kind of reduced ossification.

name: Parotitis
label: Parotitis
definition: Inflammation of the parotid gland.

name: Hemopericardium
label: Hemopericardium
definition: Accumulation of blood within the pericardial sac.

name: Chylopericardium
label: Chylopericardium
definition: Accumulation of chyle (the whitish fluid taken up by the lacteals in the intestine, consisting of an emulsion of lymph and triglyceride fat thatpasses into the veins by the thoracic duct) in the pericardium. Chylopericardium is generally caused by obstruction of or trauma to the thoracic duct.

name: Serous pericardial effusion
label: Serous pericardial effusion
definition: Accumulation of serous fluid (pale yellow and transparent fluid) in the pericardial sac.

name: Hemoperitoneum
label: Hemoperitoneum
definition: Accumulation of blood in the peritoneal cavity owing to internal hemorrhage.

name: Pharyngeal edema
label: Pharyngeal edema
definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid leading to swelling of the pharynx.

name: Pica
label: Pica
definition: An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month.

name: Plasmacytoma
label: Plasmacytoma
definition: A discrete mass of neoplastic monoclonal plasma cells either in the bone marrow or in an extramedullary location.|Plasmacytoma often generalizes to multiple myeloma over the course of several years.

name: Reduced factor IX activity
label: Reduced factor IX activity
definition: Decreased activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.|Severe deficiency of factor IX underlies hemophilia B.

name: Punctate keratitis
label: Punctate keratitis
definition: A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium.

name: Metaphyseal dappling
label: Metaphyseal dappling
definition: The presence of spots or rounded patches of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.|This finding is characteristic of Strudwick type of spondyloepimetaphyseal dysplasia.

name: Bilateral trilobed lungs
label: Bilateral trilobed lungs
definition: Both lungs have three lobes. Normally, the left lung has two lobes, whereas the right lung has three lobes.

name: Abnormal bone collagen fibril morphology
label: Abnormal bone collagen fibril morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity.

name: Abnormal sternal ossification
label: Abnormal sternal ossification
definition: Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum.|The sternum develops from two cartilaginous bars, situated one on either side of the median plane and connected with the cartilages of the upper nine ribs of its own side. During development, the two cartilaginous bars fuse with each other to form the cartilaginous sternum. This in turn is ossified from six centers: one in the manubrium, four in the body of the sternum, and one in the xiphoid process.

name: Elevated plasma pyrophosphate
label: Elevated plasma pyrophosphate
definition: An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the blood. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.

name: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
label: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium
definition: An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally.

name: Sciatica
label: Sciatica
definition: Pain in the lower back and hip radiating in the distribution of the sciatic nerve.

name: Abnormal platelet function
label: Abnormal platelet function
definition: Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes.

name: Impaired arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid.

name: Impaired ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin.

name: Impaired thrombin-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired thrombin-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to thrombin or thrombin mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thrombin (or thrombin mimetics).

name: Abnormal platelet count
label: Abnormal platelet count
definition: Abnormal number of platelets per volume of blood. In a healthy adult, a normal platelet count is between 150,000 and 450,000 per microliter of blood.

name: Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
label: Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
definition: Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin.|A delay of 5-10 days following administration of heparin is common in patients with no previous (or remote) exposure to heparin, but the drop in platelet count may be precipitous in patients with recent exposure. Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia is caused by antibodies against platelet factor 4.

name: Abnormal platelet morphology
label: Abnormal platelet morphology
definition: An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles.

name: Abnormal platelet volume
label: Abnormal platelet volume
definition: Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers.

name: Increased mean platelet volume
label: Increased mean platelet volume
definition: Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval.|Mean platelet volume (MPV) is a measure of the average size of platelets, with a typical reference range of 7.5 to 11.5 femtoliters (fL).

name: Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
label: Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
definition: Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry.

name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V
label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V
definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V.|The glycoprotein Ib-IX-V complex forms a specific platelet membrane adhesion receptor, which binds the adhesive glycoprotein, von Willebrand factor (vWF), in the vessel wall or plasma.

name: Acute disseminated intravascular coagulation
label: Acute disseminated intravascular coagulation
definition: An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed.

name: Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI
label: Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI
definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.|The glycoprotein VI is a glycoprotein receptor for collagen.

name: Decreased platelet P2Y12 receptor
label: Decreased platelet P2Y12 receptor
definition: Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.|The P2Y12 receptor is activated by ADP and plays a central role in platelet activation.

name: Abnormal platelet granules
label: Abnormal platelet granules
definition: An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes.|Platelets contain two classes of granule: the alpha granules and the dense granules. During platelet activation, the contents of the granules are discharged into the lumen of the open canalicular system, from which they are then released to the extracellular space.

name: Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding
label: Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding
definition: Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.

name: Hemorrhage of the eye
label: Hemorrhage of the eye
definition: Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye.

name: Hyphema
label: Hyphema
definition: Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye.

name: Choroid hemorrhage
label: Choroid hemorrhage
definition: Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid.

name: Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion
label: Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion
definition: Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4).

name: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
label: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
definition: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.

name: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
label: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
definition: Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.

name: Post-partum hemorrhage
label: Post-partum hemorrhage
definition: Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child.

name: Low levels of vitamin K
label: Low levels of vitamin K
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin K.

name: Abnormal leukocyte count
label: Abnormal leukocyte count
definition: Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits.

name: Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
label: Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation
definition: Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists.

name: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
label: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
definition: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.

name: Subconjunctival hemorrhage
label: Subconjunctival hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid.

name: Neutrophilia
label: Neutrophilia
definition: Increased number of neutrophils circulating in blood.

name: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
label: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
definition: An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.|Fibrinogen is an essential hemostatic factor that is converted to fibrin (a final product of the hemostatic pathway) by activated thrombin.

name: Hyperfibrinogenemia
label: Hyperfibrinogenemia
definition: Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

name: Hypofibrinogenemia
label: Hypofibrinogenemia
definition: Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

name: Dysfibrinogenemia
label: Dysfibrinogenemia
definition: Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen.

name: Abnormal hemoglobin
label: Abnormal hemoglobin
definition: Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes.

name: HbH hemoglobin
label: HbH hemoglobin
definition: Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia.

name: Persistence of hemoglobin F
label: Persistence of hemoglobin F
definition: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent.

name: Reduced hemoglobin A
label: Reduced hemoglobin A
definition: Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia.

name: Reduced beta/alpha synthesis ratio
label: Reduced beta/alpha synthesis ratio
definition: A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia.

name: Reduced alpha/beta synthesis ratio
label: Reduced alpha/beta synthesis ratio
definition: A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia.

name: Unilateral radial aplasia
label: Unilateral radial aplasia
definition: Missing radius bone on one side only associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Flattened metacarpal heads
label: Flattened metacarpal heads
definition: Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones.|The metacarpal heads articulate with the proximal phalanges of the fingers.

name: Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
label: Shortening of all phalanges of fingers
definition: Abnormal reduction in length affecting all phalanges.

name: Abnormality of metacarpophalangeal joint
label: Abnormality of metacarpophalangeal joint
definition: An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Abnormality of the glenoid fossa
label: Abnormality of the glenoid fossa
definition: An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

name: Lumbar hypertrichosis
label: Lumbar hypertrichosis
definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region.

name: Thoracic hypertrichosis
label: Thoracic hypertrichosis
definition: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region.

name: Cardiovascular calcification
label: Cardiovascular calcification
definition: Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system.

name: Toe extensor amyotrophy
label: Toe extensor amyotrophy
definition: Atrophy of the extensor digitorum longus muscles, which mediate extension of the toes.

name: Short 5th toe
label: Short 5th toe
definition: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fifth toe.

name: Clinodactyly of the 4th toe
label: Clinodactyly of the 4th toe
definition: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Pleural empyema
label: Pleural empyema
definition: Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity.

name: Transudative pleural effusion
label: Transudative pleural effusion
definition: A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.|Transudates result from imbalances in hydrostatic and oncotic forces and are caused by a limited number of recognized clinical conditions such as heart failure and cirrhosis. Less common causes include nephrotic syndrome, atelectasis, peritoneal dialysis, constrictive pericarditis, superior vena caval obstruction, and urinothorax.

name: Exudative pleural effusion
label: Exudative pleural effusion
definition: A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.|Transudates result from pneumonia, malignancy, thromboembolism, and other causes.

name: Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
label: Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
definition: An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
label: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
definition: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.

name: Proximal placement of hallux
label: Proximal placement of hallux
definition: Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position.|Thumb placement index greater than 0.55; or, the base of the thumb appears closer to the wrist than is typical. The technique for the thumb placement index is described in detail [Malina et al., 1973; Hall et al., 2007]. Briefly, the thumb placement index is the distance from the proximal crease of the index finger to the angle of the first interdigital space divided by the distance from the proximal crease of the index finger to the wrist flexion crease at the base of the thumb. This term should not be used with Preaxial polydactyly.

name: Short digit
label: Short digit
definition: One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened.|Note that the term brachydactyly is reserved for specific patterns of short digits, see HP:0001156.

name: Short proximal phalanx of toe
label: Short proximal phalanx of toe
definition: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe.

name: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger
label: Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger
definition: Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the third finger.|This anomaly is characteristic for brachydactyly type C.

name: Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle
label: Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle
definition: An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum.

name: Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle
label: Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle
definition: An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

name: Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle
label: Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle
definition: Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

name: Dilatation of mesenteric artery
label: Dilatation of mesenteric artery
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery or superior mesenteric artery .|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Decreased urinary urate
label: Decreased urinary urate
definition: Decreased concentration of urate in the urine.|Xanthine oxidase oxidizes oxypurines such as xanthine and hypoxanthine to uric acid. Uric acid is the final oxidation product of purine catabolism.

name: Decreased plasma total carnitine
label: Decreased plasma total carnitine
definition: A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.

name: Hypoplastic fifth toenail
label: Hypoplastic fifth toenail
definition: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.

name: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
label: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
definition: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

name: Anterior wedging of T12
label: Anterior wedging of T12
definition: An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T12 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

name: Anterior wedging of L2
label: Anterior wedging of L2
definition: An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).

name: Increased urinary sulfite
label: Increased urinary sulfite
definition: Increased concentration of SO3(2-), i.e., sulfite, in the urine.

name: Increased urinary thiosulfate
label: Increased urinary thiosulfate
definition: Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine.

name: Small vessel vasculitis
label: Small vessel vasculitis
definition: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries.

name: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia
label: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia
definition: Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss.

name: Bronchiolitis obliterans
label: Bronchiolitis obliterans
definition: Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways.|Note that Bronchiolitis obliterans is not to be confused with the similarly named feature Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia.

name: Respiratory tract infection
label: Respiratory tract infection
definition: An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

name: Recurrent acute respiratory tract infection
label: Recurrent acute respiratory tract infection
definition: A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

name: Acute infectious pneumonia
label: Acute infectious pneumonia
definition: Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection.

name: Bronchiolitis
label: Bronchiolitis
definition: Inflammation of the bronchioles.

name: Aspiration pneumonia
label: Aspiration pneumonia
definition: Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

name: Acute aspiration pneumonia
label: Acute aspiration pneumonia
definition: An acute episode of pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

name: Pulmonary lymphoma
label: Pulmonary lymphoma
definition: Lung parenchymal involvement with lymphoma.

name: Nodular regenerative hyperplasia of liver
label: Nodular regenerative hyperplasia of liver
definition: Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.

name: Hepatic granulomatosis
label: Hepatic granulomatosis
definition: The presence of multiple granulomas in the liver as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

name: Intestinal lymphoid nodular hyperplasia
label: Intestinal lymphoid nodular hyperplasia
definition: A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine.

name: Abnormal pectoral muscle morphology
label: Abnormal pectoral muscle morphology
definition: An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major.

name: Retinal perforation
label: Retinal perforation
definition: A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.|Retinal perforations can be cause by inflammation, trauma, degeneration, or other factors, and comprise retinal breaks, tears, dialyses, and holes.

name: Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle
label: Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle
definition: Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

name: Substantia nigra gliosis
label: Substantia nigra gliosis
definition: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

name: Non-obstructive azoospermia
label: Non-obstructive azoospermia
definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

name: Obstructive azoospermia
label: Obstructive azoospermia
definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

name: Pretesticular azoospermia
label: Pretesticular azoospermia
definition: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels.

name: Intermittent painful muscle spasms
label: Intermittent painful muscle spasms
definition: History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.

name: Abnormal circulating citrulline concentration
label: Abnormal circulating citrulline concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.|Citrulline is an alpha-amino acid that is a key intermediate in the urea cycle.

name: Elevated plasma citrulline
label: Elevated plasma citrulline
definition: An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

name: Decreased circulating copper concentration
label: Decreased circulating copper concentration
definition: A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.

name: Feeding difficulties
label: Feeding difficulties
definition: Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.

name: Elevated circulating luteinizing hormone level
label: Elevated circulating luteinizing hormone level
definition: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.

name: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy
label: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy
definition: Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.|Vascular beta-amyloid deposition in the walls of small to medium-sized, blood vessels (mostly arterial) of the central nervous system. Cerebral amyloid angiopathy mostly occurs in the sporadic form in the elderly, while rare familial forms occur in younger patients and are generally lead to more severe clinical manifestations. Extracellular deposition of the amyloid protein in the brain is associated with neurologic and physiological disease progression.

name: Dermatographic urticaria
label: Dermatographic urticaria
definition: An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).

name: Hypoglycorrhachia
label: Hypoglycorrhachia
definition: Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Paroxysmal lethargy
label: Paroxysmal lethargy
definition: Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy.

name: Myelofibrosis
label: Myelofibrosis
definition: Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.

name: Aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss
label: Aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss
definition: Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics.|The ototoxicity of aminoglycoside antibiotics is related to the destruction of sensory hair cells in the cochlea and vestibular labyrinth.

name: Elevated urinary catecholamines
label: Elevated urinary catecholamines
definition: An increased concentration of catecholamine in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary homovanillic acid
label: Elevated urinary homovanillic acid
definition: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary vanillylmandelic acid
label: Elevated urinary vanillylmandelic acid
definition: An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary dopamine
label: Elevated urinary dopamine
definition: An increased concentration of dopamine in the urine.

name: Cholesterol gallstones
label: Cholesterol gallstones
definition: Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.

name: Pigment gallstones
label: Pigment gallstones
definition: Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.

name: Black pigment gallstones
label: Black pigment gallstones
definition: A type of pigment gallstone that is hard and black, containing calcium carbonate and calcium phosphates.

name: Brown pigment gallstones
label: Brown pigment gallstones
definition: A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones.

name: Atretic gallbladder
label: Atretic gallbladder
definition: Failure of formation of the lumen of the gallbladder, often associated with gallbladder hypoplasia.

name: Acholic stools
label: Acholic stools
definition: Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.

name: Ectopic ossification
label: Ectopic ossification
definition: Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist.

name: Ectopic ossification in muscle tissue
label: Ectopic ossification in muscle tissue
definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue.

name: Ectopic ossification in tendon tissue
label: Ectopic ossification in tendon tissue
definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue.

name: Ectopic ossification in ligament tissue
label: Ectopic ossification in ligament tissue
definition: Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.

name: Abnormality of neutrophil physiology
label: Abnormality of neutrophil physiology
definition: A functional abnormality of neutrophils.

name: Abnormal neutrophil count
label: Abnormal neutrophil count
definition: A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.

name: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology
label: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology
definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.

name: Impaired neutrophil bactericidal activity
label: Impaired neutrophil bactericidal activity
definition: A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria.

name: Abnormal atrial septum morphology
label: Abnormal atrial septum morphology
definition: An abnormality of the interatrial septum.

name: Atrial septal dilatation
label: Atrial septal dilatation
definition: A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. In adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography.|Atrial septal aneurysm formation may be secondary to raised interatrial pressure gradients, producing a bulging septal shift toward the low-pressure side. However, it has been also found in patients with normal atrial pressures, suggesting a primary (congenital) malformation.

name: Elevated coagulation factor V activity
label: Elevated coagulation factor V activity
definition: Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.

name: Postprandial hyperlactemia
label: Postprandial hyperlactemia
definition: Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal.

name: Postprandial hyperglycemia
label: Postprandial hyperglycemia
definition: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.

name: Paranoia
label: Paranoia
definition: A persecutory delusion of supposed hostility of others.

name: EEG with generalized spikes
label: EEG with generalized spikes
definition: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: EEG with generalized polyspikes
label: EEG with generalized polyspikes
definition: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: Experiential auras
label: Experiential auras
definition: Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.|See the Glossary of Descriptive Terminology for Ictal Semiology at http://www.ilae.org.

name: Affective auras
label: Affective auras
definition: Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.|See the Glossary of Descriptive Terminology for Ictal Semiology at http://www.ilae.org.

name: Mnemonic auras
label: Mnemonic auras
definition: Auras which reflect ictal dysmnesia such as: feelings as familiarity (deja-vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais-vu).|See the Glossary of Descriptive Terminology for Ictal Semiology at http://www.ilae.org.

name: Deja vu
label: Deja vu
definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before.

name: Jamais vu
label: Jamais vu
definition: A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time.

name: Hallucinatory auras
label: Hallucinatory auras
definition: Auras with creation of composite perceptions without corresponding external stimuli involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory and/or gustatory phenomena.|See the Glossary of Descriptive Terminology for Ictal Semiology at http://www.ilae.org.

name: Illusory auras
label: Illusory auras
definition: Auras with an alteration of actual percepts involving the visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory or gustatory systems.|See the Glossary of Descriptive Terminology for Ictal Semiology at http://www.ilae.org.

name: EEG with central focal spike waves
label: EEG with central focal spike waves
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
label: EEG with frontal focal spike waves
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
label: EEG with occipital focal spike waves
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
label: EEG with parietal focal spike waves
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: EEG with temporal focal spike waves
label: EEG with temporal focal spike waves
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the temporal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: EEG with central focal spikes
label: EEG with central focal spikes
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region.

name: EEG with frontal focal spikes
label: EEG with frontal focal spikes
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

name: EEG with occipital focal spikes
label: EEG with occipital focal spikes
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region.

name: EEG with parietal focal spikes
label: EEG with parietal focal spikes
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region.

name: EEG with temporal focal spikes
label: EEG with temporal focal spikes
definition: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region.

name: Lens luxation
label: Lens luxation
definition: Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye.

name: Right aortic arch
label: Right aortic arch
definition: Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.|The are several types of right aortic arch (RAA). RAA can recognized radiographically by leftward displacement of barium-filled esophagus or of an air-filled trachea. The aortic knob is absent from left side, and the para-aortic stripe returns to left side of spine just above diaphragm.

name: Persistent patent ductus venosus
label: Persistent patent ductus venosus
definition: Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.|The ductus venosus is a bypass between the umbilical vein and the inferior vena cava in the fetus. The blood flow through this bypass decreases immediately after birth. Functional closure, which is followed by anatomic closure, is virtually complete within a few weeks of birth.

name: Congenital portosystemic venous shunt
label: Congenital portosystemic venous shunt
definition: A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver).

name: Galactosuria
label: Galactosuria
definition: Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.

name: Hypergalactosemia
label: Hypergalactosemia
definition: Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.|Hypergalactosemia is used here to mean the increased concentration of galactose in the blood. Note that the word galactosemia is occasionally used with the same meaning but more commonly denotes the disease entity called galactosemia caused by mutations in the galactose-1-phosphate uridyltransferase gene (MIM:230400).

name: Abnormal circulating ornithine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating ornithine concentration
definition: Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.|Ornithine is an amino acid produced in the urea cycle by the splitting off of urea from arginine. Ornithine is a naturally occurring, non-proteinogenic amino acid found in meat, fish, dairy and eggs.

name: Hyperornithinemia
label: Hyperornithinemia
definition: Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood.

name: Laryngeal edema
label: Laryngeal edema
definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.

name: Hepatocellular adenoma
label: Hepatocellular adenoma
definition: A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.

name: Abnormal urine hormone level
label: Abnormal urine hormone level
definition: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.

name: Increased urinary cortisol level
label: Increased urinary cortisol level
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.

name: Lipoma
label: Lipoma
definition: Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous.

name: Sacral lipoma
label: Sacral lipoma
definition: Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum.

name: Liposarcoma
label: Liposarcoma
definition: Malignant neoplasms which probably originate in primitive mesenchymal stem cell populations differentiating down a lipomatous pathway.

name: Steatocystoma multiplex
label: Steatocystoma multiplex
definition: Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities).|Steatocystoma multiplex can present with localized, generalized, facial, acral, or suppurative involvement.

name: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
label: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
definition: Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.

name: Pectoralis amyotrophy
label: Pectoralis amyotrophy
definition: Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.

name: Corneal guttata
label: Corneal guttata
definition: Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.|Corneal guttata are often observed in elderly people and are known to be associated with Fuchs corneal endothelial dystrophy, and also with trauma, congenital glaucoma, and macular dystrophy.

name: Descemet Membrane Folds
label: Descemet Membrane Folds
definition: Presence of folds in the Descemet membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descemet membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.

name: Corneal stromal edema
label: Corneal stromal edema
definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.

name: Aspirin-induced asthma
label: Aspirin-induced asthma
definition: A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction.

name: Pendular nystagmus
label: Pendular nystagmus
definition: Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

name: Seesaw nystagmus
label: Seesaw nystagmus
definition: Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.|Seesaw nystagmus can be a manifestation of lesions of the optic chiasma.

name: Retinal flecks
label: Retinal flecks
definition: Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.

name: Areflexia of upper limbs
label: Areflexia of upper limbs
definition: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.

name: Hemeralopia
label: Hemeralopia
definition: A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.

name: Oromandibular dystonia
label: Oromandibular dystonia
definition: A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.

name: Laryngeal dystonia
label: Laryngeal dystonia
definition: A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.

name: Anasarca
label: Anasarca
definition: An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.

name: Reactive hypoglycemia
label: Reactive hypoglycemia
definition: Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).|Reactive hypoglycemia may be the result of an exaggerated insulin response.

name: Low serum calcitriol
label: Low serum calcitriol
definition: A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

name: Low serum calcifediol
label: Low serum calcifediol
definition: A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.

name: Choroidal melanoma
label: Choroidal melanoma
definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).

name: Ciliary body melanoma
label: Ciliary body melanoma
definition: Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.

name: Cutaneous melanoma
label: Cutaneous melanoma
definition: The presence of a melanoma of the skin.|The phenotypic presentation of melanomas is often described using the ABCDE mnemomic: A) Asymmetry; B) Borders of the lesion are irregular; C) Color changes from one area of the lesion to another, with shades of tan, brown, or black, and sometimes white, red, or blue; D) Diameter of the lesionis usually larger than 6 mm; E) Evolution of the appearance of the lesion with time. These rules do not, however, apply to every melanoma.

name: Superficial spreading melanoma
label: Superficial spreading melanoma
definition: A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.

name: Nodular melanoma
label: Nodular melanoma
definition: A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color.

name: Lentigo maligna melanoma
label: Lentigo maligna melanoma
definition: A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.

name: Acral lentiginous melanoma
label: Acral lentiginous melanoma
definition: A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.

name: Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides
label: Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides
definition: Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

name: Bone cyst
label: Bone cyst
definition: A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.|Many bone cysts are asymptomatic. However, larger cysts can make the bone more susceptible to fracture.

name: Aneurysmal bone cyst
label: Aneurysmal bone cyst
definition: Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Unicameral bone cyst
label: Unicameral bone cyst
definition: A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid.

name: Multiple bony cystic lesions
label: Multiple bony cystic lesions
definition: Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.

name: Increased urinary disaccharide excretion
label: Increased urinary disaccharide excretion
definition: Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.|Excess amount of disaccharides such as mannosyl-N-acetylglucosamine excreted in the urine.

name: Glycopeptiduria
label: Glycopeptiduria
definition: Increased excretion of glycopeptides in the urine. Glycopeptides are peptides with carbohydrate moieties covalently attached to the side chains of the amino acid residues.|This feature is often the result of a defect in glycosidase activate. Glycosidases catalyze the release of sugar moieties.

name: Aspartylglucosaminuria
label: Aspartylglucosaminuria
definition: Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.

name: Keratan sulfate excretion in urine
label: Keratan sulfate excretion in urine
definition: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.|Keratan sulfate is a a glycosaminoglycan.

name: Chondroitin sulfate excretion in urine
label: Chondroitin sulfate excretion in urine
definition: An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine.|Chondroitin sulfate refers to a class of 10-60 kDa glycosaminoglycan sulfates, which are widely distributed in cartilage.

name: Abnormal circulating acetylcarnitine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating acetylcarnitine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.|Carnitine fundergoes reversible esterification of its 3-hydroxyl group producing acylcarnitine, which can enter the mitochondria with the assistance of specific translocases.

name: Aciduria
label: Aciduria
definition: Excretion of urine with an acid pH.

name: Abnormal urinary acylglycine profile
label: Abnormal urinary acylglycine profile
definition: An abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution.|N-acylglycines result from glycine conjugation with exogenous compounds to enhance their excretion in urine. Glycine conjugation is also an effective detoxification system for preventing accumulation of acyl-CoA esters in several inherited metabolic disorders.

name: Tonic pupil
label: Tonic pupil
definition: An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation.

name: Personality disorder
label: Personality disorder
definition: An abnormality of mental functioning affecting the personality and behavioural tendencies of an individual and characterized by a rigid and unhealthy pattern of thinking and behavior. The definition of a personal disorder implies that the abnormality is not the result of damage or insult to the brain or from another psychiatric disorder.|A Personality disorder is generally associated with significant problems and limitations in relationships, social encounters, work and school. It is usually manifest since childhood or adolescence and continues throughout adulthood.

name: Borderline personality disorder
label: Borderline personality disorder
definition: A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable and capricious mood. Affected individuals show a liability to outbursts of emotion and an incapacity to control the behavioural explosions.

name: Histrionic personality disorder
label: Histrionic personality disorder
definition: A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention.

name: Motor conduction block
label: Motor conduction block
definition: Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon.

name: Abnormality of central motor conduction
label: Abnormality of central motor conduction
definition: Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.|Nerve conduction velocity in the central motor pathways of the brain and spinal cord can be studied by methods including transcutaneous electrical stimulation of the cortex, cervical cord, thoracic cord and conus medullaris and determination of motor latencies to various muscles. This measure is thought to represent conduction in large diameter fibres in the corticospinal tracts.

name: Cerebellar granular layer atrophy
label: Cerebellar granular layer atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer.

name: Enlarged cerebellum
label: Enlarged cerebellum
definition: An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.

name: Cerebellar Purkinje layer atrophy
label: Cerebellar Purkinje layer atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.

name: Ubiquitin-positive cerebral inclusion bodies
label: Ubiquitin-positive cerebral inclusion bodies
definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.

name: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
label: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
definition: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.

name: Pyuria
label: Pyuria
definition: The presence of 10 or more white cells per cubic millimeter in a urine specimen, 3 or more white cells per high-power field of unspun urine, a positive result on Gram staining of an unspun urine specimen, or a urinary dipstick test that is positive for leukocyte esterase.

name: Abnormal urinary color
label: Abnormal urinary color
definition: An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color.

name: Abnormal mitochondrial shape
label: Abnormal mitochondrial shape
definition: An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.

name: Abnormal urinary odor
label: Abnormal urinary odor
definition: A deviation from the normal odor of the urine.|Urine does not usually have a strong smell, but the odor may be altered by a number of factors including some diseases. Foul-smelling urine may be due to bacteria that have caused a urinary tract infection. Sweet-smelling urine may be a sign of uncontrolled diabetes or more rarely a disease of metabolism. Liver disease and certain metabolic disorders may cause musty-smelling urine.

name: Arteritis
label: Arteritis
definition: Arterial inflammation.

name: Abnormality of pancreas physiology
label: Abnormality of pancreas physiology
definition: An anomaly of the function of the pancreas.

name: Abnormality of exocrine pancreas physiology
label: Abnormality of exocrine pancreas physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of the acinar gland portion of the pancreas that secretes digestive enzymes.

name: Abnormality of endocrine pancreas physiology
label: Abnormality of endocrine pancreas physiology
definition: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.

name: Abnormal pancreas size
label: Abnormal pancreas size
definition: A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas.

name: Multiple joint dislocation
label: Multiple joint dislocation
definition: Dislocation of many joints.

name: Intracranial epidermoid cyst
label: Intracranial epidermoid cyst
definition: A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from ectodermal cells that normally form skin cells being left behind in the nervous system during development.|See Figure 8 in PMID:16714456. Epidermoid cysts arise from ectodermal inclusion during neural tube closure in the 3rd-5th week of embryogenesis. The microscopic cyst lining consists of stratified squamous epithelium supported by an outer layer of collagenous connective tissue. Cystic contents usually include debris, keratin, water, and cholesterol laid down in a lamellar fashion. Epidermoid cysts do not contain dermal appendages.

name: Intracranial dermoid cyst
label: Intracranial dermoid cyst
definition: A congenital inclusion cysts that arises from the inclusion of ectodermally committed cells at the time of neural tube closure (3rd-5th week of embryogenesis). The capsule of dermoid cysts consists of simple epithelium supported by collagen. In thicker parts, the lining is supplemented with dermis containing hair follicles, sebaceous glands, and apocrine glands.|See Figure 9 in PMID:16714456. These cysts increase in size by means of glandular secretion and epithelial desquamation. Growth can lead to rupture of the cyst contents, causing a chemical meningitis that may lead to vasospasm, infarction, and even death.

name: Edema of the dorsum of feet
label: Edema of the dorsum of feet
definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.

name: Abnormality of circulating catecholamine level
label: Abnormality of circulating catecholamine level
definition: An abnormal catecholamine concentration in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating creatinine level
label: Abnormal circulating creatinine level
definition: An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood.

name: Decreased serum creatinine
label: Decreased serum creatinine
definition: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.

name: Abnormal mitochondrial number
label: Abnormal mitochondrial number
definition: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.

name: Abnormality of the mitochondrion
label: Abnormality of the mitochondrion
definition: An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.

name: Parietal cortical atrophy
label: Parietal cortical atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the parietal cortex.

name: Occipital cortical atrophy
label: Occipital cortical atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the occipital cortex.

name: Rhizomelic leg shortening
label: Rhizomelic leg shortening
definition: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the leg (i.e. the femur).

name: Increased fibular diameter
label: Increased fibular diameter
definition: Increased width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula.

name: Open angle glaucoma
label: Open angle glaucoma
definition: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,|Evidence of optic nerve damage can include s optic disc abnormalities (Vertical cup:disc ratio over the 97. 5th percentile in the normal population), visual field defects. The role of increased intraocular pressure (IOP) in glaucoma is debated, but an IOP exceeding the 99. 5th percentile of the normal population may be considered to support the diagnosis.

name: Angle closure glaucoma
label: Angle closure glaucoma
definition: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).|Evidence of optic nerve damage can include s optic disc abnormalities (Vertical cup:disc ratio over the 97. 5th percentile in the normal population), visual field defects. The role of increased intraocular pressure (IOP) in glaucoma is debated, but an IOP exceeding the 99. 5th percentile of the normal population may be considered to support the diagnosis.

name: Hypoplasia of the pons
label: Hypoplasia of the pons
definition: Underdevelopment of the pons.

name: Abnormality of circulating glucocorticoid level
label: Abnormality of circulating glucocorticoid level
definition: An abnormality of the concentration of a glucocorticoid in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating corticosterone level
label: Abnormal circulating corticosterone level
definition: An abnormality of the concentration of corticosterone in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating creatine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating creatine concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarly for muscle cells.

name: Endometrial carcinoma
label: Endometrial carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma of the endometrium, the mucous lining of the uterus.

name: Hepatitis
label: Hepatitis
definition: Inflammation of the liver.

name: Abnormal albumin level
label: Abnormal albumin level
definition: Deviation from normal concentration of albumin in the blood.

name: Hyperalbuminemia
label: Hyperalbuminemia
definition: Elevation in the concentration of albumin in the blood.

name: Laryngeal carcinoma
label: Laryngeal carcinoma
definition: A carcinoma of the larynx.|Laryngeal carcinoma often is related to a history of smoking and may manifest by hoarseness, a lump in the neck, persistent cough, stridor and other symptoms.

name: Methemoglobinemia
label: Methemoglobinemia
definition: Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.

name: Methylmalonic aciduria
label: Methylmalonic aciduria
definition: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.|Methylmalonic aciduria is a genetically heterogeneous disorder of methylmalonate and cobalamin (cbl; vitamin B12) metabolism.

name: Panuveitis
label: Panuveitis
definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which inflammation affects the anterior chamber, vitreous, retina or choroid.

name: Anterior uveitis
label: Anterior uveitis
definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.

name: Posterior uveitis
label: Posterior uveitis
definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.

name: Intermediate uveitis
label: Intermediate uveitis
definition: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the vitreous.

name: Prostate cancer
label: Prostate cancer
definition: A cancer of the prostate.

name: Stomach cancer
label: Stomach cancer
definition: A cancer arising in any part of the stomach.

name: Uraciluria
label: Uraciluria
definition: Increased concentration of uracil in the urine.

name: Basal ganglia necrosis
label: Basal ganglia necrosis
definition: Death of cells in the basal ganglia.

name: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells
label: Abnormality of bone marrow stromal cells

name: Abnormal erythroid lineage cell morphology
label: Abnormal erythroid lineage cell morphology
definition: An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes.

name: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
label: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
definition: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

name: Erythroid hyperplasia
label: Erythroid hyperplasia
definition: Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

name: Erythroid hypoplasia
label: Erythroid hypoplasia
definition: Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

name: Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology
label: Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology
definition: An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell.

name: Granulocytic hypoplasia
label: Granulocytic hypoplasia
definition: Decreased number of granulocyte precursors in the bone marrow.

name: obsolete Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage
label: obsolete Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage

name: Pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
label: Pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A subtype of ductal pancreatic carcinoma that is thought to originate from squamous metaplasia of pancreatic ductal epithelium.

name: Abnormal megakaryocyte morphology
label: Abnormal megakaryocyte morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of megakaryocytes. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes, which are bone-marrow resident cells.

name: Abnormality monocyte morphology
label: Abnormality monocyte morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of a myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

name: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
label: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow

name: Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
label: Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
definition: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

name: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
label: Reduced quantity of Von Willebrand factor
definition: Decreased quantity of von Willebrand factor.

name: Multiple lineage myelodysplasia
label: Multiple lineage myelodysplasia
definition: Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two or more of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.

name: Bilineage myelodysplasia
label: Bilineage myelodysplasia
definition: Myelodysplasia with dysplastic changes in two of the myeloid lineages: erythroid, granulocytic, megakaryocytic.

name: Single lineage myelodysplasia
label: Single lineage myelodysplasia
definition: Abnormality/dysplasia of a single myeloid cell (erythroid, granulocytic, or megakaryocytic).

name: Hemothorax
label: Hemothorax
definition: The presence of blood in the pleural space.|Hemothorax may result from hemorrhage in the chest wall, lung parenchyma, heart, or great vessels.

name: Foveoschisis
label: Foveoschisis
definition: Splitting of the retinal layers in the macula.

name: Hypotriglyceridemia
label: Hypotriglyceridemia
definition: An decrease in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

name: Anhedonia
label: Anhedonia
definition: Inability to experience pleasure activities usually found enjoyable.

name: Decreased corneal sensation
label: Decreased corneal sensation
definition: Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation.|Corneal sensitivity to touch can be assessed by an aesthesiometer, which measures the corneal touch threshold. Decreased corneal sensation is associated with a decreased corneal reflex (HP:0008000); however, impairment of the corneal reflex can have other causes such as trigeminal nerve compression or a cerebellopontine angle lesion. Well known causes of decreased corneal sensation include Herpes simplex keratitis, neuroparalytic keratitis, leprosy, acoustic neuroma, and absolute glaucoma.

name: Hemophagocytosis
label: Hemophagocytosis
definition: Phagocytosis by macrophages of erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, and their precursors in bone marrow and other tissues.|Hemophagocytosis is a nonspecific phenotypic feature observed in several conditions including hemolytic anemia, malignant disease, infections, and hemophagocytic syndrome (also known as hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis, a rare hyperinflammatory syndrome caused by severe hypercytokinemia due to a highly stimulated but ineffective immune process).

name: Subcortical cerebral atrophy
label: Subcortical cerebral atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the cerebral subcortical white and gray matter, termed subcortical atrophy, reflects loss of nerve cells in the basal ganglia or fibers in the deep white matter.

name: Carotid artery dissection
label: Carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the carotid artery wall.

name: Internal carotid artery dissection
label: Internal carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the internal carotid artery wall.|The internal carotid begins at the bifurcation of the common carotid, opposite the upper border of the thyroid cartilage, and runs perpendicularly upward. It supplies the anterior part of the brain, the eye and its appendages, and sends branches to the forehead and nose. Interstitial hemorrhage into the media of the vessel wall can lead to occlusion of the internal carotid artery and aneurysm formation.

name: Intracranial internal carotid artery dissection
label: Intracranial internal carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the intracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.

name: External carotid artery dissection
label: External carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the external carotid artery wall.

name: Common carotid artery dissection
label: Common carotid artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the common carotid artery wall.

name: Carotid artery dilatation
label: Carotid artery dilatation
definition: A dilatation (balooning or bulging out of the vessel wall) of a carotid artery.

name: Asterixis
label: Asterixis
definition: A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.|The examiner can test for asterixis by asking the patient to extend the arms, spread the fingers, dorsiflex the wrist and observe for the abnormal "flapping" tremor at the wrist. Asterixis represents the failure to actively maintain a position and is caused by the abnormal function of diencephalic motor centers that regulate the tone of the agonist and antagonist muscles involved in maintaining posture.

name: Oligodactyly
label: Oligodactyly
definition: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.

name: Skin-picking
label: Skin-picking
definition: Repetitive and compulsive picking of skin which results in tissue damage.

name: Hair-pulling
label: Hair-pulling
definition: A phenomenon in which persons repetitively pull out their own hair, resulting in noticeable hair loss.

name: Head-banging
label: Head-banging
definition: Habitual striking of one's own head against a surface such as a mattress or wall of a crib.

name: Self-biting
label: Self-biting
definition: Habitual biting of one's own body.|Biting of one's own arms, lip, check, finger etc.

name: Nail-biting
label: Nail-biting
definition: Habitual biting of one's own fingernails.

name: Stereotypical hand wringing
label: Stereotypical hand wringing
definition: Habitual clasping and squeezing of the hands.

name: Stereotypical body rocking
label: Stereotypical body rocking
definition: Habitual repetitive movement of the body.

name: Orthostatic tachycardia
label: Orthostatic tachycardia
definition: An increase in heart rate with standing of 30 beats per minute or more.

name: Glioblastoma multiforme
label: Glioblastoma multiforme
definition: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

name: Resistance to activated protein C
label: Resistance to activated protein C
definition: Poor anticoagulant response to activated protein C. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time assay.|The protein C pathway is a major anticoagulant mechanism that down-regulates the prothrombin- and intrinsic factor X (FX)-activating complexes via inactivation of their respective cofactors, activated factors V (FVa) and VIII (FVIIIa). Cofactor inactivation occurs by limited proteolysis at certain amino acid positions in FVa and in FVIIIa. These reactions are catalyzed by the serine protease activated protein C (APC) and stimulated by the APC cofactor protein S.
