Functional defects of the protein C pathway determine a plasma phenotype known as APC resistance, which is a prevalent and important risk factor for venous thrombosis. A plasma is termed 'APC resistant' when the addition of exogenous APC fails to prolong its clotting time in an activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) assay.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell morphology
label: Abnormal natural killer cell morphology
definition: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell physiology
label: Abnormal natural killer cell physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of the natural killer cell.

name: Reduced natural killer cell activity
label: Reduced natural killer cell activity
definition: Reduced ability of the natural killer cell to function in the adaptive immune response.

name: Craniofacial dystonia
label: Craniofacial dystonia
definition: A form of focal dystonia affecting the face and especially the jaw that is induced by the act of speaking. It is an involuntary contraction of the masticatory muscles, resulting in dysarthria or dysphagia.

name: Cystic medial necrosis
label: Cystic medial necrosis
definition: A disorder of large arteries, in particular the aorta, characterized by an accumulation of basophilic ground substance in the media with cyst-like lesions associated with degenerative changes of collagen, elastin and the vascular smooth muscle cells.|The lesions of cystic medial necrosis are not true cysts.

name: Entrapment neuropathy
label: Entrapment neuropathy
definition: Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.|An entrapment neuropathy is an isolated peripheral nerve injury due to mechanical contriction in a fibrous or fibro-osseous tunnel or to deformation of the nerve by a fibrous band.

name: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
label: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
definition: A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.

name: Hyperplastic colonic polyposis
label: Hyperplastic colonic polyposis
definition: Presence of multiple hyperplastic polyps in the colon. Hyperplastic polyps are generally about 5 mm in size and show hyperplastic mucosal proliferation.

name: Increased HDL cholesterol concentration
label: Increased HDL cholesterol concentration
definition: An elevated concentration of high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL) in the blood.|The major apolipoproteins of HDL are apolipoprotein (apo) A-I and apo A-II, also known as the alpha lipoproteins. Thus, hyperalphalipoproteinemia refers to an elevated concentration of apo A-I and apo A-II.

name: Constrictive median neuropathy
label: Constrictive median neuropathy
definition: Injury to the median nerve caused by its entrapment at the wrist as it traverses through the carpal tunnel. Clinically, constrictive median neuropathy is characterized by pain, paresthesia, and weakness in the median nerve distribution of the hand.|Constrictive median neuropathy is the major clinical feature of carpal tunnel syndrome.

name: Entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve at elbow
label: Entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve at elbow
definition: An entrapment neuropathy of the ulnar nerve in the cubital tunnel (in the elbow) characterized by numbness in the ring and little fingers and weakness of the intrinsic muscles in the hand.

name: Increased erythrocyte protoporphyrin concentration
label: Increased erythrocyte protoporphyrin concentration
definition: An increased concentration of protoporphyrins in erythrocytes.

name: Hyperemesis gravidarum
label: Hyperemesis gravidarum
definition: Excessive vomiting in early pregnancy, leading to the loss of 5% or more of body weight.

name: Hodgkin lymphoma
label: Hodgkin lymphoma
definition: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

name: T-cell lymphoma
label: T-cell lymphoma
definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in T-cells.

name: B-cell lymphoma
label: B-cell lymphoma
definition: A type of lymphoma that originates in B-cells.

name: Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
label: Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma
definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma that exhibits malignant infiltration of the skin.

name: Anaplastic large-cell lymphoma
label: Anaplastic large-cell lymphoma
definition: A type of T-cell lymphoma that is characterized by so-called hallmark cells with a pleomorphic appearance that express the CD30 antigen, are lobulated, and have indented nuclei.

name: Episodic hemiplegia
label: Episodic hemiplegia
definition: Transient episodes of weakness of the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.

name: Irregular respiration
label: Irregular respiration
definition: Uneven rhythm of breathing.

name: Cheyne-Stokes respiration
label: Cheyne-Stokes respiration
definition: An abnormal pattern of respiration characterized by cycles of respiration that are increasingly deeper then shallower with possible periods of apnea. Affected patients may display a 10 to 20 second episode of hypoventilation or apnea, followed by respiration of increased depth and frequency over the course of about one minute. The cycle repeats every 45 seconds to 3 minutes.

name: Insulinoma
label: Insulinoma
definition: A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia.

name: Juvenile colonic polyposis
label: Juvenile colonic polyposis
definition: The presence of more than 5 juvenile polyps of the colon. The term juvenile polyps refer to a special histopathology and not the age of onset as the polyp might be diagnosed at all ages. The juvenile polyp has a spherical appearance and is microscopically characterized by overgrowth of an oedematous lamina propria with inflammatory cells and cystic glands.|A juvenile polyp is a hamartomatous growth that projects from the lining of the intestine. It does not arise from the colonocytes themselves but from the tissues underneath the lining cells.

name: Cluster headache
label: Cluster headache
definition:
A type of headache characterized by repeated attacks of unilateral pain lasting 15 to 180 minutes and associated with local autonomic signs.|According to the International Classification of Headache Disorders (ICHD-II), the diagnosis of cluster headache can be made with at least five attacks fulfilling criteria B-D:
B) Severe or very severe unilateral orbital, supraorbital and/or temporal pain lasting 15-180 minutes if untreated.
C) Headache is accompanied by at least 1 of the following:
(i) Ipsilateral conjunctival injection and/or lacrimation.
(ii) Ipsilateral nasal congestion and/or rhinorrhea.
(iii) Ipsilateral eyelid edema.
(iv) Ipsilateral forehead and facial sweating.
(v) Ipsilateral miosis and/or ptosis.
(vi) A sense of restlessness or agitation.
D) Attacks have a frequency from 1 every other day to 8/day.
Additionally, the headaches cannot attributed to another disorder.

name: Abnormality of prothrombin
label: Abnormality of prothrombin
definition: An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade.

name: Increased serum bile acid concentration
label: Increased serum bile acid concentration
definition: An increase in the concentration of bile acid in the blood.

name: Onychomycosis
label: Onychomycosis
definition: A fungal infection of the toenails or fingernails that tends to cause the nails to thicken, discolor, disfigure, and split.

name: Recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis
label: Recurrent vulvovaginal candidiasis
definition: Recurrent infection involving the vulva, vagina, and adjacent crural areas, whereby the causative agent belongs to the genus Candida.

name: Globozoospermia
label: Globozoospermia
definition: Any structural anomaly of the acrosome resulting in a round sperm head.

name: Abnormal sperm motility
label: Abnormal sperm motility
definition: An anomaly of the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Reduced sperm motility
label: Reduced sperm motility
definition: An abnormal reduction in the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Nonmotile sperm
label: Nonmotile sperm
definition: A lack of mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia
label: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia
definition: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.

name: Abnormal renal morphology
label: Abnormal renal morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the kidney.

name: Abnormal renal physiology
label: Abnormal renal physiology
definition: An abnormal functionality of the kidney.

name: Abnormal glomerular filtration rate
label: Abnormal glomerular filtration rate
definition: An abnormally increased or reduced amount of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.|Glomerular filtration, the first step in urine formation, is the passive process of ultrafiltration of plasma from blood into Bowman's space as it traverses the glomerular capillaries. Because GFR varies by body size, it is indexed relative to an average body surface area (BSA) of 1.73 m2 and expressed as ml/min/per 1.73 m2. GFR cannot be measured directly; it can be assessed from clearance measurements or estimated from serum levels of endogenous filtration markers, such as creatinine or cystatin C. Clearance measurements require either multiple measurements of serum concentrations or timed urine collections and are not routinely performed. GFR is usually estimated from serum concentrations of a marker of filtration using GFR estimating equations.

name: Decreased glomerular filtration rate
label: Decreased glomerular filtration rate
definition: An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.|Renal clearance is defined as the volume of plasma per minute needed to excrete the quantity of a solute appearing in the urine in a minute. Normal values for adults are 97 to 137 ml/min (male) and 88 to 128 ml/min (female). This term refers to a reduction below normal limits in the ability of the kidney to clear creatinine from the bloodstream.

name: Increased glomerular filtration rate
label: Increased glomerular filtration rate
definition: An abnormal rise in the volume of water filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

name: Testicular microlithiasis
label: Testicular microlithiasis
definition: The deposition of calcium phosphate microliths within the seminiferous tubules.

name: Entrapment neuropathy of suprascapular nerve
label: Entrapment neuropathy of suprascapular nerve
definition: An entrapment neuropathy of the suprascapular nerve, presenting with shoulder weakness confined to the supraspinatus muscle (this muscle initiates shoulder abduction) or to the infraspinatus (this muscle externally rotates the arm), as well as with pain in the posterior part of the shoulder and upper periscapular region.

name: Increased urinary porphobilinogen
label: Increased urinary porphobilinogen
definition: Increased concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine.|Increased porphobilinogen (PBG) in urine is pathognomonic of an attack of acute porphyria (acute intermittent porphyria, variegate porphyria, hereditary coproporphyria); the absence of increased urinary PBG in a suspected attack excludes the diagnosis.

name: Alveolar soft part sarcoma
label: Alveolar soft part sarcoma
definition: A type of soft tissue sarcoma with a histological appearance reminiscent of alveoli because of its reticulated fibrous stroma enclosing groups of sarcoma cells, which resemble epithelial cells and are enclosed in alveoli walled with connective tissue.

name: Erythema nodosum
label: Erythema nodosum
definition: An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral.|The nodules of erythema nodosum are located predominantly on the shins with less common occurrence on the thighs and forearms. They undergo characteristic color changes ending in temporary bruise-like areas, and usually subside in 3-6 weeks without scarring or atrophy.

name: Non-caseating epithelioid cell granulomatosis
label: Non-caseating epithelioid cell granulomatosis
definition: The presence of multiple epithelioid cell granulomas consist of highly differentiated mononuclear phagocytes (epithelioid cells and giant cells) and lymphocytes, not exhibiting caseation (a form of necrosis in which the tissue changes into a dry, amorphous mass said to resemble cheese).|This feature is a hallmark of sarcoidosis.

name: Pretibial blistering
label: Pretibial blistering
definition: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the tibial region.

name: Arachnoid hemangiomatosis
label: Arachnoid hemangiomatosis
definition: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the arachnoid.

name: Splenic rupture
label: Splenic rupture
definition: A breach of the capsule of the spleen.

name: Circulating immune complexes
label: Circulating immune complexes
definition: Persistence of immune complexes in the blood circulation.|Immune complexes are formed of interlocking antigens and antibodies and are normally are rapidly removed from the bloodstream by macrophages in the spleen and Kupffer cells in the liver. If they persist abnormally in the circulation, they may become trapped in various tissues and induce inflammatory reactions.

name: Oligodontia of primary teeth
label: Oligodontia of primary teeth
definition: Reduced number of primary teeth.|Primary teeth are also called temporary teeth or deciduous teeth.

name: Ovarian teratoma
label: Ovarian teratoma
definition: The presence of a teratoma in the ovary.

name: Urethral stricture
label: Urethral stricture
definition: Narrowing of the urethra associated with inflammation or scar tissue.|A urethral stricture may result from surgery, disease, or injury. The term should not be used for a congenital narrowing of the urethra (Consider the term Urethral stenosis, HP:0008661).

name: Tension-type headache
label: Tension-type headache
definition: A type of headache that last hours with continuous pain of mild or moderate intensity, bilateral location, a pressing/tightening (non-pulsating) quality and that is not aggravated by routine physical activity such as walking or climbing stairs.

name: CSF pleocytosis
label: CSF pleocytosis
definition: An increased white blood cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
label: Rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
definition: A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Exudative retinal detachment
label: Exudative retinal detachment
definition: A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Shortened QT interval
label: Shortened QT interval
definition: Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

name: Intramuscular hematoma
label: Intramuscular hematoma
definition: Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue.

name: Agranulocytosis
label: Agranulocytosis
definition: Marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.|Agranulocytosis is defined as an absolute neutrophil count less than 500 cells/microliter.

name: Drug-induced agranulocytosis
label: Drug-induced agranulocytosis
definition: A type of agranulocytosis related to ingestion of a specific medication.

name: Elevated sweat chloride
label: Elevated sweat chloride
definition: An increased concentration of chloride in the sweat.|Sweat chloride is notably increased in cystic fibrosis, but also in some other diseases.

name: Urocanic aciduria
label: Urocanic aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of urocanic acid in the urine.

name: Increased circulating chylomicron concentration
label: Increased circulating chylomicron concentration
definition: Increased plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins.

name: Atransferrinemia
label: Atransferrinemia
definition: Absence of transferrin, a protein that transports iron, in the blood.

name: Increased intramyocellular lipid droplets
label: Increased intramyocellular lipid droplets
definition: An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See PMID 20691590 for histological images.|In normal muscle cells, lipid content takes the aspect of small droplets which concentration and size are usually higher in type 1 fibres than in type 2 fibres.

name: Levator palpebrae superioris atrophy
label: Levator palpebrae superioris atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the levator palpebrae superioris, the extraocular muscle that elevates the superior eyelid.

name: Superior rectus atrophy
label: Superior rectus atrophy
definition: Atrophy of the superior rectus, the extraocular muscle whose primary function is to elevate the globe.

name: Abnormal reproductive system morphology
label: Abnormal reproductive system morphology
definition: A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.

name: Abnormal sex determination
label: Abnormal sex determination
definition: Anomaly of primary or secondary sexual development or characteristics.

name: Sex reversal
label: Sex reversal
definition: Development of the reproductive system is inconsistent with the chromosomal sex.|Sex reversal is present if an XX individual develops phenotypically as a male or if an XY individual develops as a female.

name: Oculomotor nerve palsy
label: Oculomotor nerve palsy
definition: Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve).

name: Specific anosmia
label: Specific anosmia
definition: Anosmia for one particular odor.

name: Prolonged PR interval
label: Prolonged PR interval
definition: Increased time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex).|In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.

name: Abnormal ST segment
label: Abnormal ST segment
definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly of the ST segment, which is the segment that connects the QRS complex and the T wave. The ST segment normally has a duration of 80 to 120 ms, is flat and at the same level (isoelectric) as the PR and TP segment.

name: ST segment depression
label: ST segment depression
definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.

name: ST segment elevation
label: ST segment elevation
definition: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line.|ST segment elevation may have multiple causes including myocardial infaction, left ventricular aneurysm, and hyperkalemia.

name: Abnormal respiratory system morphology
label: Abnormal respiratory system morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.

name: Abnormal respiratory epithelium morphology
label: Abnormal respiratory epithelium morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi.

name: Ewing sarcoma
label: Ewing sarcoma
definition: A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.|Histologically, Ewing's sarcoma is composed of a homogeneous population of small round cells with high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratios that are arrayed in sheets. There is scant cytoplasms, which is pale, vacuolated and characterized by faded boundaries. In contrast, the nuclei are clearly visualized by their intense color. Mitotic activity is typically low.

name: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
label: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
definition: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.|The peripheral microtubules in the canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia are studded with dynein arms that contain adenosine triphosphatases and act as molecular motors to effect the sliding of the peripheral microtubular pairs relative to one another.

name: Absent outer dynein arms
label: Absent outer dynein arms
definition: Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Absent inner dynein arms
label: Absent inner dynein arms
definition: Absence of the inner dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
label: Abnormal axonemal organization of respiratory motile cilia
definition: Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the axoneme, which is the cytoskeletal structure that forms the inner core of the motile cilium and displays a canonical 9 + 2 microtubular pattern of motile cilia studded with dynein arms.|Abnormal axonemal organization comprises anomalies such as an eccentric central pair of microtubuli, abnormal radial spokes and nexin links, reduced number of inner dynein arms, and displacement of the outer doublet.

name: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
label: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
definition: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
label: Abnormal central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
definition: A structural anomaly of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.|The central microtubular pair is referred to as the central part of axoneme of cilium.

name: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology
label: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology
definition: Any functional anomaly of the respiratory motile cilia.|Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology may include alterations in ciliary beating pattern or frequency.

name: Abnormal ciliary motility
label: Abnormal ciliary motility
definition: Any anomaly of the normal motility of motile cilia. Evaluation of ciliary beat frequency and ciliary beat pattern requires high-speed videomicroscopy of freshly obtained ciliary biopsies that are maintained in culture media under controlled conditions.|Ciliated epithelial cells bear approximately 200 motile (9 + 2) cilia that move with both intracellular and intercellular synchrony. The pattern of beat in 9 + 2 motile cilia occurs in a waveform having a forward effective stroke followed by a return stroke. The direction of stroke is a function of the directional orientation of the central microtubules. In addition to moving in synchrony, individual cilia in normal cells are very plastic and move fluidly, sometimes deforming briefly upon encountering resistance and/or particles being transported over the mucosal surface. Cilia are embedded in a watery periciliary fluid of low viscosity, which facilitates the rapid beat cycle to move the more viscous overlying layer of mucus. Ciliary beat frequency ranges from approximately 8-20 Hz under normal conditions but may be accelerated by exposure to irritants such as tobacco smoke.

name: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
label: Absent central microtubular pair morphology of respiratory motile cilia
definition: Absence of the two central microtubules of motile cilia with a 9+2 microtubuluar configuration.

name: Ciliary dyskinesia
label: Ciliary dyskinesia
definition: A deviation from the normally well coordinated pattern of intracellular and intercellular synchrony of motile cilia. Dyskinetic cilia usually beat out of synchrony relative to neighboring cilia.|Typically, but not always, dyskinesia is characterized by markedly attenuated ciliary beat frequency.

name: T-wave alternans
label: T-wave alternans
definition: A periodic beat-to-beat variation in the amplitude or shape of the T wave in an EKG.

name: Absent respiratory ciliary axoneme radial spokes
label: Absent respiratory ciliary axoneme radial spokes
definition: Absence of the radial spokes of the axoneme of the respiratory cilium.

name: Myxoid liposarcoma
label: Myxoid liposarcoma
definition: A liposarcoma that contains myxomatous tissue.

name: Abnormal muscle glycogen content
label: Abnormal muscle glycogen content
definition: Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.|Glycogen functions as a secondary short term energy storage in muscle.

name: Decreased muscle glycogen content
label: Decreased muscle glycogen content
definition: A decreased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

name: Episodic upper airway obstruction
label: Episodic upper airway obstruction
definition: Intermittent episodes of increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

name: J wave
label: J wave
definition: The J wave is a positive convex deflection that occurs at the junction of the QRS complex and ST segment, the J-point.|J waves can be seen in hypothermia when the core body temperature falls below 32 degrees C. Then, they occur most prominently in the inferior leads: II, III, and aVF and the precordial leads: V5-V6. J waves can also be observed in other conditions such as some forms of Brugada syndrome.

name: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
label: Increased carotid artery intimal medial thickness
definition: An increase in the combined thickness of the intima and media of the carotid artery.|This feature can be measured by ultrasonography and is thought to be a risk foctor for myocardial infarction and stroke.

name: Autosomal dominant inheritance with paternal imprinting
label: Autosomal dominant inheritance with paternal imprinting
definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with paternal silencing.|Since the paternally inherited copy of such genes is silenced normally, only a maternally transmitted mutation leads to disease in this kind of inheritance.

name: Autosomal dominant inheritance with maternal imprinting
label: Autosomal dominant inheritance with maternal imprinting
definition: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that is imprinted with maternal silencing.|Since the maternally inherited copy of such genes is silenced normally, only a paternally transmitted mutation leads to disease in this kind of inheritance.

name: Digital flexor tenosynovitis
label: Digital flexor tenosynovitis
definition: Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit.|Tenosynovitis refers to inflammation of the protective sheath that surrounds a tendon. Stenosing tenosynovitis, or trigger finger, is diagnosed when a patient presents with a symptomatic locking or clicking of a finger or the thumb. It is caused by a mismatch between the volume of the flexor tendon sheath and its contents. As the flexor tendon attempts to glide through a relatively stenotic sheath, it catches, producing an inability to flex or extend the digit smoothly.

name: Hypoglycinemia
label: Hypoglycinemia
definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of glycine in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating serine concentration
label: Abnormal circulating serine concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.

name: Hyposerinemia
label: Hyposerinemia
definition: Reduced concentration of serine in the blood.

name: Hepatic amyloidosis
label: Hepatic amyloidosis
definition: A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.

name: Chylous ascites
label: Chylous ascites
definition: Extravasation of chyle into the peritoneal cavity.

name: Morbilliform rash
label: Morbilliform rash
definition: An exanthema consisting of widespread pink-to-red macules (flat spots of 2-10 mm in diameter) or papules (red bumps) that blanch with pressure. The macules and papules may cluster and merge to form sheets over several days.|A morbilliform rash is said to resemble the rash of measles, rubella or scarlet fever, thus mimicking viral and bacterial exanthemas.

name: Small distal femoral epiphysis
label: Small distal femoral epiphysis
definition: Reduced size of the Distal epiphysis of femur.

name: Small proximal tibial epiphyses
label: Small proximal tibial epiphyses
definition: Reduced size of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.

name: Abnormal hypothalamus physiology
label: Abnormal hypothalamus physiology
definition: An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.|The hypothalamus is linked vascularly with the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland and thereby controls the secretion of pituitary hormones.

name: Abnormal hypothalamus morphology
label: Abnormal hypothalamus morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.|The hypothalamus is a cone-shaped cerebral structure that projects downward, ending in the pituitary (infundibular) stalk, a tubular connection to the pituitary gland. It is linked vascularly with the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland and thereby controls the secretion of pituitary hormones.

name: Hypothalamic luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone deficiency
label: Hypothalamic luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone deficiency
definition: Decreased secretion of luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone by the hypothalamus.

name: Neoplasm of head and neck
label: Neoplasm of head and neck
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.

name: Facial neoplasm
label: Facial neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the face.

name: Mouth neoplasm
label: Mouth neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the mouth.

name: Fusion of gums
label: Fusion of gums
definition: A congenital defect with an abnormal joining of the gums of the upper and lower jaw.

name: Abnormal genital pigmentation
label: Abnormal genital pigmentation
definition: An abnormal pigmentation pattern of the external genitalia.

name: Abnormality of the occipital bone
label: Abnormality of the occipital bone
definition: Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.

name: Slender middle phalanx of finger
label: Slender middle phalanx of finger
definition: Reduced diameter of the middle phalanx of finger.

name: Slender distal phalanx of finger
label: Slender distal phalanx of finger
definition: Reduced diameter of the distal phalanx of finger.

name: Slender proximal phalanx of finger
label: Slender proximal phalanx of finger
definition: Reduced diameter of the proximal phalanx of finger.

name: Long middle phalanx of finger
label: Long middle phalanx of finger
definition: Increased length of the middle phalanx of finger.

name: Long distal phalanx of finger
label: Long distal phalanx of finger
definition: Increased length of the distal phalanx of finger.

name: Ureteral agenesis
label: Ureteral agenesis
definition: Failure of the ureter to undergo development.

name: Type II transferrin isoform profile
label: Type II transferrin isoform profile
definition: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.|There are several methods in use with which this feature can be diagnosed. Using HPLC analysis increased mono- and trisialotransferrin and reduced tetrasialotransferrin are observed. Using immunoaffinity column analysis, the tri-sialo/di-oligosaccharide transferrin ratio is abnormal.

name: Herpes simplex encephalitis
label: Herpes simplex encephalitis
definition: A severe virus infection of the central nervous system by the herpes simplex virus (HSV).|Although infection with HSV is very common in the population, only a miniscule proportion of infected persons develop encephalitis, so that an occurrence of HSV encephalitis is interpreted as a sign of increased susceptibility to HSV.

name: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
label: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
definition: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

name: Hypoplastic aortic arch
label: Hypoplastic aortic arch
definition: Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.

name: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
label: Coarctation of the descending aortic arch
definition: Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the descending trunk of arch of aorta.

name: Abnormal rib ossification
label: Abnormal rib ossification
definition: An anomaly of the process of rib bone formation.

name: Spatulate ribs
label: Spatulate ribs
definition: Ribs that are increased in width and taper to the posterior ends.|This morphological anomaly of the rib has been compared to a canoe panel or a spatula, whence the name.

name: Decreased serum complement C9
label: Decreased serum complement C9
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C9 in circulation.

name: Cutaneous amyloidosis
label: Cutaneous amyloidosis
definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

name: Abnormal monocyte count
label: Abnormal monocyte count
definition: An anomaly in the number of monocytes, which are myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

name: Monocytosis
label: Monocytosis
definition: An increased number of circulating monocytes.

name: Monocytopenia
label: Monocytopenia
definition: An decreased number of circulating monocytes.

name: Heberden's node
label: Heberden's node
definition: Bony swelling of the distal interphalangeal joint (DIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.|Heberden's nodes are nodular deformities at the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers (usually the middle and index) and are commonly seen in the elderly. The deformity is created by osteophyte formation and synovial thickening at the margin ofan osteoarthritic joint. Significant functional problems are rarely encountered though patients may suffer with stiffness and pain. Surgical intervention is seldom indicated unless there is severe pain or instability. In such cases, a joint fusion may be appropriate.

name: Bouchard's node
label: Bouchard's node
definition: Bony swelling of the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIP) associated with the formation of osteophytes (calcific spurs) of the articular (joint) cartilage that are visible radiographically.|Heberden's nodes are generally a sign of osteoarthritis.

name: Histiocytoma
label: Histiocytoma
definition: A neoplasm containing histiocytes.

name: Fibrous tissue neoplasm
label: Fibrous tissue neoplasm
definition: Any neoplasm composed of fibrous tissue.

name: Sacroiliac arthritis
label: Sacroiliac arthritis
definition: Inflammation of the sacroiliac joint, generally accompanied by lower back pain.

name: Occipital neuralgia
label: Occipital neuralgia
definition: A distinct type of headache characterized by piercing, throbbing, or electric-shock-like chronic pain in the upper neck, back of the head, and behind the ears, usually on one side.|Typically, the pain of occipital neuralgia begins at the base of the head and spreads upward within the distribution of the greater and lesser occipital nerves. Characteristically, it is neuropathic, with paroxysmal episodes of shooting electric shock-like symptoms.

name: Absent pigmentation of the abdomen
label: Absent pigmentation of the abdomen
definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the abdomen.

name: Absent pigmentation of the limbs
label: Absent pigmentation of the limbs
definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the arms and legs.

name: D-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
label: D-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.

name: Perifolliculitis
label: Perifolliculitis
definition: Inflammation surrounding hair follicles.

name: Sleep myoclonus
label: Sleep myoclonus
definition: Myoclonus that occurs during the initial phases of sleep.

name: Myeloid leukemia
label: Myeloid leukemia
definition: A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.

name: Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia
label: Chronic myelomonocytic leukemia
definition: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm which is characterized by persistent monocytosis, absence of a Philadelphia chromosome and BCR/ABL fusion gene, fewer than 20 percent blasts in the bone marrow and blood, myelodysplasia, and absence of PDGFRA or PDGFRB rearrangement.

name: Abnormal celiac artery morphology
label: Abnormal celiac artery morphology
definition: An anomaly of the celiac artery.|The celiac artery (celiac trunk or truncus coeliacus) is the first major branch of the abdominal aorta.

name: Celiac artery compression
label: Celiac artery compression
definition: Compression of the celiac artery.|This feature may be characterized by abdominal pain related to compression of the celiac artery by fibers of the median arcuate ligament.

name: Cementoma
label: Cementoma
definition: An odontogenic tumor of the cementum of tooth.

name: Tufted angioma
label: Tufted angioma
definition: A vascular tumor of the skin and subcutaneous tissues and characterized by slow angiomatous proliferation.

name: Pyelonephritis
label: Pyelonephritis
definition: An inflammation of the kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis and the kidney calices.|Pyelonephritis may be unilateral or bilateral and is often characterized by abdominal pain, fever, nausea, and vomiting.

name: Abnormal autonomic nervous system morphology
label: Abnormal autonomic nervous system morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology
label: Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology
definition: A functional abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Abnormal sudomotor regulation
label: Abnormal sudomotor regulation
definition: An abnormal regulation of the sweat glands by the sympathetic nervous system associated with abnormal perspiration.|Normally, the cholinergic innervation via the sympathetic nervous system activates muscarinic acetylcholine receptors in sweat glands, thereby leading to perspiration. This terms refers to an abnormally increased or decreased activity of this system.

name: Extrahepatic cholestasis
label: Extrahepatic cholestasis
definition: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in large bile ducts outside the liver.

name: Abnormality of folate metabolism
label: Abnormality of folate metabolism
definition: An abnormality of the metabolism of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

name: Abnormal homeostasis
label: Abnormal homeostasis
definition: An anomaly in the processes involved in the maintenance of an internal equilibrium.

name: Abnormal energy expenditure
label: Abnormal energy expenditure
definition: Any anomaly in the utilization of energy (calories).

name: Increased resting energy expenditure
label: Increased resting energy expenditure
definition: An increase in the number of calories used per unit time.

name: Decreased resting energy expenditure
label: Decreased resting energy expenditure
definition: A reduction in the number of calories used per unit time.

name: Microprolactinoma
label: Microprolactinoma
definition: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of less than 10 mm diameter.

name: Macroprolactinoma
label: Macroprolactinoma
definition: A pituitary prolactin cell adenoma of more than 10 mm diameter.

name: Decreased serum ferritin
label: Decreased serum ferritin
definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of ferritin, a ubiquitous intracellular protein that stores iron, in the blood.|Ferritin levels measured in serum usually have a direct correlation with the total amount of iron stored in the body, but ferritin levels may also be increased with anemia of chronic disease or in the course of an acute phase reaction.

name: Morphea
label: Morphea
definition: Isolated patches of hardened skin (scleroderma).

name: Abnormal glycosylation
label: Abnormal glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of a glycosylation process, i.e., a process involved in the covalent attachment of a glycosyl residue to a substrate molecule.

name: Abnormal protein glycosylation
label: Abnormal protein glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of a protein glycosylation process, i.e., of a protein modification process that results in the addition of a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit to a protein amino acid, e.g. the addition of glycan chains to proteins.

name: Abnormal protein N-linked glycosylation
label: Abnormal protein N-linked glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of protein N-linked glycosylation, i.e., an abnormality of the protein glycosylation process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via a nitrogen atom in an amino acid residue in a protein.|Essentially, all proteins (except albumin) that travel through the ER-Golgi network undergo N-linked glycosylation. Glycans promote protein folding, stability, trafficking, localisation, and oligomerisation. They play vital parts in cell-cell interactions and intracellular signalling.

name: Decreased galactosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased galactosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: A reduction in the amount of galactose residues of N-glycans.|The majority of complex and hybrid N-glycans have elongated branches that are made by the addition of a beta-linked galactose residue to the initiating N-acetylglucosamine to produce the ubiquitous building block Gal-beta-linked1-4GlcNAc, referred to as a type-2 N-acetyllactosamine (LacNAc) sequence.

name: Abnormal sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Abnormal sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.|The most common sialic acids is N-acetylneuraminic acid (Neu5Ac).

name: Decreased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Decreased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

name: Increased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Increased sialylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Increased addition of sialic acids to N-linked glycans.

name: Abnormal fucosylation of protein N-linked glycosylation
label: Abnormal fucosylation of protein N-linked glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

name: Decreased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Decreased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

name: Increased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Increased fucosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to N-linked glycans.

name: Abnormal mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Abnormal mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of the addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

name: Decreased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Reduced addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

name: Increased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
label: Increased mannosylation of N-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Increased addition of mannose to N-linked glycans.

name: Abnormal protein O-linked glycosylation
label: Abnormal protein O-linked glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of protein O-linked glycosylation, i.e., of the process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via the hydroxyl group of a serine or threonine residue.

name: Abnormal fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
label: Abnormal fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

name: Decreased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
definition: A reduction of the addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

name: Increased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
label: Increased fucosylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
definition: Increased addition of fucose sugar units to O-linked glycans.

name: Abnormal sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
label: Abnormal sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
definition: An anomaly of the addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.

name: Decreased sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
label: Decreased sialylation of O-linked protein glycosylation
definition: An reduced addition of sialic acids to O-linked glycans.

name: Decreased urinary potassium
label: Decreased urinary potassium
definition: A decreased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

name: Hypophosphaturia
label: Hypophosphaturia
definition: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the urine.

name: Basilar invagination
label: Basilar invagination
definition: Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).

name: Extra fontanelles
label: Extra fontanelles
definition: Bony defects situated along the cranial suture lines or at the junction of the bone plates of the skull.|Extra fontanelles include glabellar, metopic, sagittal (parietal) and cerebellar fontanelles.

name: Flat face
label: Flat face
definition: Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.|A useful guide is to imagine that a line connecting the glabella to the anterior most part of the mandible touches the top of the philtrum where it meets the base of the columella. The glabella is the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose. If the superior philtrum is anterior to this line the face is convex, if the superior philtrum is posterior to this line the face is concave.

name: Abnormality of malar bones
label: Abnormality of malar bones
definition: An abnormality of the malar surface of the zygomatic bone and including the frontal process of maxilla.|The malar bones are a confluence of the convex prominence of the zygomatic bone known as the malar surface, along with the malar process (most medial and superior part) of the maxilla. It forms the medial border of the inferior bony orbit, and is contiguous with the lateral boundary of the nasal bridge.

name: Prominence of the zygomatic bone
label: Prominence of the zygomatic bone
definition: Large or prominent malar surface of the zygomatic bone of the skull, which is convex and forms the prominence of the 'cheek bones'.

name: Hyperplasia of midface
label: Hyperplasia of midface
definition: Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face|This term represents increased size of the maxilla (upper jaw) in length (increased midface height) or anterior-posterior projection (midface prominence). In the presence of normal mandible size, maxillary prominence may give the appearance of retrognathia.

name: Abnormal eye morphology
label: Abnormal eye morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the globe of the eye, or bulbus oculi.|previously: Abnormal globe morphology

name: Abnormal eye physiology
label: Abnormal eye physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of the eye.

name: Chemosis
label: Chemosis
definition: Edema (swelling) of the bulbar conjunctiva.

name: Microphakia
label: Microphakia
definition: Abnormal smallness of the lens.

name: Hemianopia
label: Hemianopia
definition: Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes.

name: Fatigue
label: Fatigue
definition: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.|Fatigue is distinct from muscle weakness.

name: Abnormal enzyme/coenzyme activity
label: Abnormal enzyme/coenzyme activity
definition: An altered ability of any enzyme or their cofactors to act as catalysts. This term includes changes due to altered levels of an enzyme.

name: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase activity
label: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase activity
definition: Reduced carnitine O-palmitoyltransferase activity, i.e., reduced activity of the reaction: palmitoyl-CoA + L-carnitine = CoA + L-palmitoylcarnitine.

name: Delayed self-feeding during toddler years
label: Delayed self-feeding during toddler years
definition: A delay in the development of skills required to feed oneself in the toddler period (between one and three years of age).

name: Left-to-right shunt
label: Left-to-right shunt
definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.

name: Bidirectional shunt
label: Bidirectional shunt
definition: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from both right side of the heart to the left and vice versa.

name: Rhinitis
label: Rhinitis
definition: Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion.

name: Camptodactyly
label: Camptodactyly
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

name: Absent hallux
label: Absent hallux
definition: Aplasia of the hallux, that is, a development defect such that the big toe does not develop.

name: Bronchitis
label: Bronchitis
definition: Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi.

name: Acute bronchitis
label: Acute bronchitis
definition: Inflammation of the large airways of the lung with rapid onset and short course usually associated with cough, mucus production, shortness of breath, wheezing, and chest tightness.

name: Appendicular hypotonia
label: Appendicular hypotonia
definition: Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs.

name: Anal fissure
label: Anal fissure
definition: A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.

name: Hyporeflexia of upper limbs
label: Hyporeflexia of upper limbs
definition: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

name: Jaw hyporeflexia
label: Jaw hyporeflexia
definition: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw.|The jaw jerk is elicited by the examiner placing the tip of the index finger on a relaxed jaw, one that is about one-third open. One then taps briskly on the index finger with the other hand and notes the speed as the mandible is flexed.

name: Allergy
label: Allergy
definition: An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.

name: Iodine contrast allergy
label: Iodine contrast allergy
definition: Allergy to iodine contrast media used in radiological studies.

name: Seasonal allergy
label: Seasonal allergy
definition: An allergy experienced at a particular time of year when trees or grasses pollinate and elicit an allergic reaction.

name: Biliary dyskinesia
label: Biliary dyskinesia
definition: A motility disorder characterized by biliary colic in the absence of gallstones with a reduced gallbladder ejection fraction.

name: Aortic atherosclerotic lesion
label: Aortic atherosclerotic lesion
definition: The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.

name: Peripheral edema
label: Peripheral edema
definition: An abnormal accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs.

name: Pressure ulcer
label: Pressure ulcer
definition: A type of ulcer that is caused when an area of skin is subject to pressure over a prolonged period of time, ranging in range in severity from patches of discolored skin to open wounds that expose the underlying bone or muscle. The most common sites are the sacrum, coccyx, heels and the hips.|Pressure ulcers tend to affect persons with reduced mobility who are bedridden or wheelchair-bound.

name: Abnormal aldolase level
label: Abnormal aldolase level
definition: An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.|The reaction catalyzed by aldolase is a component of the glycolysis pathway.

name: Abnormal urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
label: Abnormal urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
definition: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.|Note that alpha-ketoglutaric acid is also known as 2-ketoglutaric acid, alpha-ketoglutaric acid, 2-xxoglutaric acid, and oxoglutaric acid.

name: Increased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
label: Increased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
definition: A greater than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.|Note that alpha-ketoglutaric acid is also known as 2-ketoglutaric acid, alpha-ketoglutaric acid, 2-xxoglutaric acid, and oxoglutaric acid.

name: Decreased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
label: Decreased urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
definition: A lower than normal concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.|Note that alpha-ketoglutaric acid is also known as 2-ketoglutaric acid, alpha-ketoglutaric acid, 2-xxoglutaric acid, and oxoglutaric acid.

name: Abnormal urine citrate concentration
label: Abnormal urine citrate concentration
definition: A deviation from normal of the concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

name: Hypocitraturia
label: Hypocitraturia
definition: A lower than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

name: Hypercitraturia
label: Hypercitraturia
definition: A greater than normal concentration of citrate(3-) in the urine.

name: Scissor gait
label: Scissor gait
definition: A type of spastic paraparetic gait in which the muscle tone in the adductors is marked. It is characterized by hypertonia and flexion in the legs, hips and pelvis accompanied by extreme adduction leading to the knees and thighs hitting, or sometimes even crossing, in a scissors-like movement. The opposing muscles (abductors) become comparatively weak from lack of use.|Scissor gait is a form of gait abnormality primarily associated with spastic cerebral palsy.

name: Medullary nephrocalcinosis
label: Medullary nephrocalcinosis
definition: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney).

name: Cortical nephrocalcinosis
label: Cortical nephrocalcinosis
definition: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal cortex (the outer portion of the kidney between the renal capsule and the renal medulla).

name: Pure red cell aplasia
label: Pure red cell aplasia
definition: A type of anemia resulting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.|Pure red cell aplasia results from a maturation arrest occurs in the formation of erythrocytes.

name: Premature pubarche
label: Premature pubarche
definition: The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal.

name: Premature adrenarche
label: Premature adrenarche
definition: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.|Adrenarche is an early sexual maturation stage that typically occurs at around 6 to 8 years of age, during which the adrenal cortex begins to secrete increased levels of androgens resulting from the development of the zona reticularis in the adrenal cortex. Note that pubarche refers to the development of pubic hair, axillary hair, and adult sweat gland (apocrine) odor. The physical features associated with pubarche reflect the onset of adrenarche, which refers to the pubertal maturation of the adrenal and is associated with increased secretion of an adrenal hormone called dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate (DHEAS).

name: Notched primary central incisor
label: Notched primary central incisor
definition: The presence of a V-shaped indentation (notch) in the primary central incisor.

name: Duodenal atrophy
label: Duodenal atrophy
definition: Wasting or decrease in size of all or part of the duodenum.

name: Abnormal blood gas level
label: Abnormal blood gas level
definition: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood.

name: Hypercapnia
label: Hypercapnia
definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.

name: Hypocapnia
label: Hypocapnia
definition: Abnormally reduced blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level.

name: Hypoxemia
label: Hypoxemia
definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen.|Note that hypoxemia is defined as a condition where arterial oxygen tension is below normal (80-100mmHg). Hypoxia is defined as the failure of oxygenation at the tissue level. Hypoxia is not measured directly by a standard laboratory value.

name: Hyperoxemia
label: Hyperoxemia
definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen.|Note that hyperoxemia is defined as a condition where arterial oxygen tension is above normal (80-100mmHg). Hyperoxia is defined as increased oxygen tension at the tissue level. Hyperoxia is not measured directly by a standard laboratory value.

name: Meconium stained amniotic fluid
label: Meconium stained amniotic fluid
definition: Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.|Meconium may be expelled into the amniotic fluid before birth in response to fetal distress. If meconium is aspirated by the fetus, it may lead to meconium aspiration syndrome.

name: Congenital absence of foreskin
label: Congenital absence of foreskin
definition: Congenital lack of the skin of prepuce of penis, that is, of the double-layered fold of skin and mucous membrane that covers the glans penis.|Absence of the foreskin can be accompanied by Cryptorchidism and Hypospadias, which should be coded separately.

name: Villous hypertrophy of choroid plexus
label: Villous hypertrophy of choroid plexus
definition: Overgrowth of the choroid plexus.|The most common location for overgrowth is the lateral ventricles. The choroid plexus folds into many villi around capillaries, creating frond-like processes that project into the ventricles. The terms choroid plexus hypertrophy or choroid plexus hyperplasia are used interchangeably to refer to an increase in size of these structures. Diffuse villous hyperplasia of choroid plexus (DVHCP) is a rare condition which is characterized by the presence of diffuse enlargement of the entire choroid plexus throughout the length of the choroidal fissure and overproduction of CSF.

name: Colonic inertia
label: Colonic inertia
definition: The inability of the colon to modify stool to an acceptable consistency and move the stool from the cecum to the rectosigmoid area at least once every three days.

name: Chorioretinitis
label: Chorioretinitis
definition: An inflammation of the choroid and retina.|Chorioretinitis is a form of posterior uveitis. Note that the term Chorioretinitis suggests that the origin of the process is predominantly in the choroid while Retinitis suggests that the process is mainly in the retina.

name: Stercoral ulcer
label: Stercoral ulcer
definition: An ulcer of the colon due to pressure and irritation from retained fecal masses.|Stercoral ulceration is the loss of bowel integrity from the pressure effects of inspissated feces. The lesion usually occurs in constipated, bedridden patients and presents as an isolated lesion in the rectosigmoid area.

name: Optic disc drusen
label: Optic disc drusen
definition: Optic disc drusen are acellular, calcified deposits within the optic nerve head. Optic disc drusen are congenital and developmental anomalies of the optic nerve head, representing hyaline-containing bodies that, over time, appear as elevated, lumpy irregularities on the anterior portion of the optic nerve.|Optic disc drusen can lead to an elevated disc and thus mimic disc swelling (pseudopapilledema).

name: Excessive femoral anteversion
label: Excessive femoral anteversion
definition: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.|Excessive femoral anteversion is a common cause of in-toeing that first presents in early childhood.

name: Prominent calcaneus
label: Prominent calcaneus
definition: Protruding heel bone, or calcaneus.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cerebral white matter
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

name: Cerebral white matter hypoplasia
label: Cerebral white matter hypoplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

name: Episodic fatigue
label: Episodic fatigue
definition: Intermittent and recurrent bouts of a subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.

name: Chronic fatigue
label: Chronic fatigue
definition: Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer.|Note that chronic fatigue can be a symptom of chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS), which is characterized by profound fatigue that is not improved by bed rest and that may be worsened by physical or mental activity. Symptoms of CFS may include weakness, muscle pain, impaired memory, impaired mental concentration, and insomnia, which can result in reduced participation in daily activities.

name: Abnormal social behavior
label: Abnormal social behavior
definition: An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others.

name: Delayed social development
label: Delayed social development
definition: A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior.|This term should be applied to describe a child whose social development is delayed compared to age-related norms. For instance, at the age of 3 months, a child smiles in response to social interaction, at the age of 7 months, a child responds to the facial expressions of others, and at the age of 12 months a child is shy around strangers.

name: Ventral shortening of foreskin
label: Ventral shortening of foreskin
definition: Reduction in length of the ventral (lower) skin of prepuce of penis.

name: Nonocclusive coronary artery atherosclerosis
label: Nonocclusive coronary artery atherosclerosis
definition: Coronary disease that has not progressed to the point of causing significant occlusion (blockage) of the coronary arteries.

name: Abnormal gallbladder morphology
label: Abnormal gallbladder morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder.

name: Abnormal gallbladder physiology
label: Abnormal gallbladder physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of the gallbladder.

name: Abnormal biliary tract physiology
label: Abnormal biliary tract physiology
definition: A functional abnormality of the biliary tree.

name: Abnormal biliary tract morphology
label: Abnormal biliary tract morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the biliary tree.

name: Sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia
label: Sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia
definition: Reduced motility through the sphincter of Oddi, resulting in impedance of bile and pancreatic juice flow from the common bile duct into the duodenum.|The sphincter of Oddi (also known as sphincter of ampulla) is a muscular valve that controls the flow of bile and pancreatic juice through the ampulla of Vater into the second part of the duodenum. Increased tone of the sphincter or disturbance in the coordination of contraction of the biliary ducts prevents normal emptying of the biliary tree. This may result in biliary pain, common bile duct dilation and episodes of pancreatitis.

name: Gallbladder dyskinesia
label: Gallbladder dyskinesia
definition: Reduced motility of the gallbladder with reduced emptying fraction.|Patients with this gallbladder dyskinesia present with biliary-type pain but no evidence of gallstones in the gallbladder. The diagnosis is made by performing a radionuclide investigation of the gallbladder ejection fraction. An abnormal gallbladder ejection fraction has a value less than 40 percent.

name: Abnormality of brain morphology
label: Abnormality of brain morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain.

name: Brain atrophy
label: Brain atrophy
definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of brain tissue that was once present.

name: Decreased CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate concentration
label: Decreased CSF 5-methyltetrahydrofolate concentration
definition: A reduced concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate(2-) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). 5-methyltetrahydrofolate is the active folate metabolite.

name: Abnormal myelination
label: Abnormal myelination
definition: Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons.

name: Delayed myelination
label: Delayed myelination
definition: Delayed myelination.

name: Sacroiliac joint synovitis
label: Sacroiliac joint synovitis
definition: Inflammation of the synovial membrane of the sacroiliac joint.

name: Chronic constipation
label: Chronic constipation
definition: Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation.

name: Acute constipation
label: Acute constipation
definition: Constipation of sudden onset and lasting for less than three months.

name: Restless legs
label: Restless legs
definition: A feeling of uneasiness and restlessness in the legs after going to bed (sometimes causing insomnia).|Restless legs syndrome is a disorder characterized by aching or burning sensations in the legs that occur prior to sleep or may awaken the affected persons. Complying with an irresistible urge to move the affected limbs brings temporary relief. Sleep may become disrupted, resulting in excessive daytime hypersomnolence.

name: Bilateral wrist flexion contracture
label: Bilateral wrist flexion contracture
definition: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.

name: Unilateral wrist flexion contracture
label: Unilateral wrist flexion contracture
definition: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on one side only.

name: Medial arterial calcification
label: Medial arterial calcification
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of arteries.|Medial arterial calcification causes stiffening and decreased compliance of the affected arteries.

name: Medial calcification of medium-sized arteries
label: Medial calcification of medium-sized arteries
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of medium-sized (muscular or distributive) arteries.

name: Medial calcification of small arteries
label: Medial calcification of small arteries
definition: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of small arteries.|The general construction of small arteries is very similar to that of muscular arteries. The media is still muscular and has up to 8-10 layers of smooth muscle cells.

name: Hypnic headache
label: Hypnic headache
definition: A headache disorder that occurs exclusively at night, waking the affected individual from sleep.|Hypnic headache can be unilateral or bilateral, and is often but not always described as throbbing. The pain begins abruptly and can last from 15 minutes to 6 hours, although typically it is about 30-60 minutes.

name: Dysmorphic inferior cerebellar vermis
label: Dysmorphic inferior cerebellar vermis
definition: A structural anomaly of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Bacteriuria
label: Bacteriuria
definition: The presence of bacteria in the urine.|The urine is normally bacteria-free. The term refers to bacteria from the urinary tract and not to bacteria found in the urine because of contamination from the surrounding tissues. Significant bacteriuria is a sign of urinary tract infection.

name: Chin myoclonus
label: Chin myoclonus
definition: Involuntary and irregular twitches of the chin.

name: Elevated transferrin saturation
label: Elevated transferrin saturation
definition: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.|Transferrins are iron-binding blood plasma glycoproteins that control the level of free iron in biological fluids. The transferrin saturation test (TSAT) refers to the ratio of serum iron to total iron-binding capacity, expressed as a percentage. Transferrin saturations of less than 20% indicate iron deficiency, while transferrin saturations of more than 50% suggest iron overload. Note that the results of the TSAT can be influenced by inflammation.

name: Decreased transferrin saturation
label: Decreased transferrin saturation
definition: A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.|Transferrins are iron-binding blood plasma glycoproteins that control the level of free iron in biological fluids. The transferrin saturation test (TSAT) refers to the ratio of serum iron to total iron-binding capacity, expressed as a percentage. Transferrin saturations of less than 20% indicate iron deficiency, while transferrin saturations of more than 50% suggest iron overload. Note that the results of the TSAT can be influenced by inflammation.

name: Elevated hepatic iron concentration
label: Elevated hepatic iron concentration
definition: An increased level of iron in liver tissues.|This abnormality can be measured by liver biopsy or by hepatic magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Chronic respiratory acidosis
label: Chronic respiratory acidosis
definition: Longstanding impairment in ventilation such that the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) is elevated above the upper limit of the reference range (more than 45 mm Hg), with a normal or near-normal pH secondary to renal compensation and an elevated serum bicarbonate levels (more than30 mEq/L).

name: Acute respiratory acidosis
label: Acute respiratory acidosis
definition: Sudden onset of impairment in ventilation such that the removal of carbon dioxide by the respiratory system is less than the production of carbon dioxide in the tissues, leading to an elevation of the partial pressure of carbon dioxide (PaCO2) above the normal limits (more than 45 mm Hg) with an accompanying acidemia (pH less than 7.35).

name: Chronic acidosis
label: Chronic acidosis
definition: Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

name: Infantile spasms
label: Infantile spasms
definition: Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy).

name: Setting-sun eye phenomenon
label: Setting-sun eye phenomenon
definition: An ophthalmologic sign in young children resulting from upward-gaze paresis. In this condition, the eyes appear driven downward, the sclera may be seen between the upper eyelid and the iris, and part of the lower pupil may be covered by the lower eyelid.|Setting-sun eye phenomenon can also be transiently elicited in healthy infants up to 7 months of age by changes of position or removal of light (benign setting-sun phenomenon). When persistent, this sign is one of the most frequent markers of elevated intracranial pressure.

name: Thick vermilion border
label: Thick vermilion border
definition: Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.

name: Eclabion
label: Eclabion
definition: A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips.

name: Tongue atrophy
label: Tongue atrophy
definition: Wasting of the tongue.

name: Carotid artery occlusion
label: Carotid artery occlusion
definition: Complete obstruction of a carotid artery.|Carotid artery occlusion is usually caused by caused by atherosclerosis.

name: Decreased circulating level of specific antibody
label: Decreased circulating level of specific antibody
definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against a specific antigen or microorganism.

name: Specific pneumococcal antibody deficiency
label: Specific pneumococcal antibody deficiency
definition: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.

name: Vocal tremor
label: Vocal tremor
definition: A wavering, unsteady voice that reflects involuntary and approximately sinusoidal oscillation of motor unit firings of laryngeal muscles. Vocal tremor results in low frequency modulations of voice frequency or amplitude and intermittent voice instability.

name: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
label: Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
definition: Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.

name: Temporomandibular joint crepitus
label: Temporomandibular joint crepitus
definition: Noises from the temporomandibular joint during mandibular movement (e.g., chewing). Temporomandibular joint crepitus is often described as a clicking, popping, grating sound.

name: Abnormality of cerebral veins
label: Abnormality of cerebral veins
definition: An anomaly of cerebral veins.

name: Cerebral venous angioma
label: Cerebral venous angioma
definition: A congenital malformation of veins which drain normal brain characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system.|DVA is characterized by a caput medusae or an umbrellalike convergence of multiple venules on a single, or occasionally multiple, enlarged parenchymal or medullary vein, like the trunk of a tree or the shank of an umbrella. This dilated terminal vein penetrates the cortex to drain either (a) superficially to cortical veins or sinuses, (b) deeply to subependymal veins of the lateral ventricle and then into the galenic system, (c) to the fourth ventricle and then to the pontomesencephalic vein, or (d) to the precentral cerebellar vein and into the galenic system.

name: Frontal venous angioma
label: Frontal venous angioma
definition: A venous angioma of the frontal lobe of the brain.

name: Abnormal alpha granules
label: Abnormal alpha granules
definition: Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury.|This feature can be observed by electron microscopy. Alpha granules normally contain a number of proteins including von Willebrand factor, and fibrinogen.

name: Abnormal dense granules
label: Abnormal dense granules
definition: Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium , histamine and serotonin.|This feature can be observed by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal surface-connected open canalicular system
label: Abnormal surface-connected open canalicular system
definition: An anomaly of the invaginations of the surface membrane that form the open canalicular system (OCS). The OCS serve as the pathway for transport of substances into the cells and as conduits for the discharge of alpha granule products secreted during the platelet release reaction.

name: Myelitis
label: Myelitis
definition: Inflammation of the spinal cord.

name: Cerebellopontine angle arachnoid cyst
label: Cerebellopontine angle arachnoid cyst
definition: An arachnoid cyst located at the margin of the cerebellum and pons.

name: Intraventricular arachnoid cyst
label: Intraventricular arachnoid cyst
definition: An arachnoid cyst located within the ventricular system.|Arachnoid cysts very rarely occur within the ventricular system, where no arachnoid tissue exists.

name: Suprasellar arachnoid cyst
label: Suprasellar arachnoid cyst
definition: An arachnoid cyst that progressively enlarges from an abnormality in the membrane of Liliequist or in the interpeduncular cistern, and typically, expands from the prepontine space, displacing the floor of the third ventricle upwards, the pituitary stalk and optic chiasm upwards and forwards, and the mammillary bodies upwards and backwards.|As the cyst increases in size it fills and occludes the third ventricle, and distorts and blocks the aqueduct, which finally results in hydrocephalus.

name: Panniculitis
label: Panniculitis
