definition: A focal cognitive seizure with deja vu / jamais vu characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal aware cognitive seizure with deja vu/jamais vu
label: Focal aware cognitive seizure with deja vu/jamais vu
definition: A focal cognitive seizure with deja vu / jamais vu characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Focal aware sensory seizure with somatosensory features
label: Focal aware sensory seizure with somatosensory features
definition: A seizure characterized by sensory phenomena including tingling, numbness, electric-shock like sensation, pain, sense of movement, or desire to move. Awareness is retained throughout the seizure.

name: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with hallucination
label: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with hallucination
definition: A focal cognitive seizure with hallucination characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with expressive dysphasia/aphasia
label: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with expressive dysphasia/aphasia
definition: A focal cognitive seizure with expressive dysphasia / aphasia characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Generalized atonic seizure
label: Generalized atonic seizure
definition: Generalized atonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by a sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting about 1-2 s, involving head, trunk, jaw, or limb musculature.

name: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with forced thinking
label: Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with forced thinking
definition: A focal cognitive seizure with forced thinking characterized by impairment of awareness at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal aware sensory seizure with gustatory features
label: Focal aware sensory seizure with gustatory features
definition: A seizure characterized by taste phenomena including acidic, bitter, salty, sweet, or metallic tastes.

name: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with somatosensory features
label: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with somatosensory features
definition: A focal sensory seizure with somatosensory features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal aware motor seizure with version
label: Focal aware motor seizure with version
definition: A focal motor seizure with version characterized by retained awareness throughout the seizure.

name: Infection-related seizure
label: Infection-related seizure
definition: Seizure associated with a presumed or proven infection (excluding infection of the central nervous system) or inflammatory state without an alternative precipitant such as metabolic derangement, and regardless of the presence or absence of a fever.

name: Gastroenteritis-related afebrile seizure
label: Gastroenteritis-related afebrile seizure
definition: Afebrile (less than 38.0 degrees Celcius), brief, and generalized seizures accompanying gastroenteritis without an alternative cause.

name: Seizure precipitated by febrile infection
label: Seizure precipitated by febrile infection
definition: Any form of seizure occurring at the time of a fever (temperature at or above 38.0 degrees Celcius) without infection of the central nervous system, and without an alternative cause such as severe metabolic derangement, occurring at any age.

name: Febrile seizure outside the age of 3 months to 6 years
label: Febrile seizure outside the age of 3 months to 6 years
definition: Any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38.0 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in people beyond the typical arrange of 3 months-6 years with no prior history of afebrile seizure.

name: Music-induced seizure
label: Music-induced seizure
definition: Seizure precipitated by listening to music or other complex sounds.

name: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with gustatory features
label: Focal impaired awareness sensory seizure with gustatory features
definition: A focal sensory seizure with gustatory features in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal automatism seizure
label: Focal automatism seizure
definition: A focal seizure characterized at onset by coordinated motor activity. This often resembles a voluntary movement and may consist of an inappropriate continuation of preictal motor activity.

name: Focal orofacial automatism seizure
label: Focal orofacial automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by orofacial automatisms at onset.

name: Focal manual automatism seizure
label: Focal manual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by manual automatisms at onset.

name: Focal pedal automatism seizure
label: Focal pedal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by coordinated bilateral or unilateral movements of the feet or legs at onset. The movement is more reminiscent of normal movements in amplitude, and is less frenetic or rapid in comparison to the movements seen in focal hyperkinetic seizures involving the legs.

name: Focal perseverative automatism seizure
label: Focal perseverative automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by inappropriate continuation of pre-seizure movement or behavior at onset.

name: Focal vocal automatism seizure
label: Focal vocal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive meaningless vocal sounds such as shrieks or grunts at onset.

name: Focal verbal automatism seizure
label: Focal verbal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive words, phrases, or brief sentences at onset.

name: Focal sexual automatism seizure
label: Focal sexual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary sexual behavior at onset.

name: Focal head nodding automatism seizure
label: Focal head nodding automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary head nodding at onset.

name: Focal undressing automatism seizure
label: Focal undressing automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary undressing at onset.

name: Focal aware undressing automatism seizure
label: Focal aware undressing automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary undressing at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal impaired awareness automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness automatism seizure
definition: A focal seizure with automatism in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure.

name: Focal aware automatism seizure
label: Focal aware automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware orofacial automatism seizure
label: Focal aware orofacial automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by orofacial automatisms at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware manual automatism seizure
label: Focal aware manual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by manual automatisms at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware pedal automatism seizure
label: Focal aware pedal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by coordinated bilateral or unilateral movements of the feet or legs at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout. The movement is more reminiscent of normal movements in amplitude, and is less frenetic or rapid in comparison to the movements seen in focal hyperkinetic seizures involving the legs.

name: Focal aware perseverative automatism seizure
label: Focal aware perseverative automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by inappropriate continuation of pre-seizure movement or behavior at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware vocal automatism seizure
label: Focal aware vocal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive meaningless vocal sounds such as shrieks or grunts at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware verbal automatism seizure
label: Focal aware verbal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by the production of single or repetitive words, phrases, or brief sentences at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal aware sexual automatism seizure
label: Focal aware sexual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary sexual behavior at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal impaired awareness orofacial automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness orofacial automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by orofacial automatisms at onset.

name: Focal aware head nodding automatism seizure
label: Focal aware head nodding automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure characterized by involuntary head nodding at onset and during which awareness is fully retained throughout.

name: Focal impaired awareness manual automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness manual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by manual automatisms at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness pedal automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness pedal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by coordinated bilateral or unilateral movements of the feet or legs at onset. The movement is more reminiscent of normal movements in amplitude, and is less frenetic or rapid in comparison to the movements seen in focal hyperkinetic seizures involving the legs.

name: Focal impaired awareness perseverative automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness perseverative automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by inappropriate continuation of pre-seizure movement or behavior at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness vocal automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness vocal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by the production of single or repetitive meaningless vocal sounds such as shrieks or grunts at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness verbal automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness verbal automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by the production of single or repetitive words, phrases, or brief sentences at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness sexual automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness sexual automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism seizure in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is characterized by involuntary sexual behavior at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness head nodding automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness head nodding automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is seizure characterized by involuntary head nodding at onset.

name: Focal impaired awareness undressing automatism seizure
label: Focal impaired awareness undressing automatism seizure
definition: A type of focal automatism in which awareness is partially or fully impaired at some point during the seizure and is seizure characterized by involuntary undressing at onset.

name: Elevated CSF neurofilamant light chain
label: Elevated CSF neurofilamant light chain
definition: Definition: Neurofilament light chain (NfL) is a neuronal cytoplasmic protein highly expressed in large calibre myelinated axons. Its levels increase in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and blood proportionally to the degree of axonal damage in a variety of neurological disorders, including inflammatory, neurodegenerative, traumatic and cerebrovascular diseases.

name: Abnormal chondrocyte morphology
label: Abnormal chondrocyte morphology
definition: Any abnormal structure of a chondrocyte, which is a polymorphic cell that forms cartilage.

name: Lacunar halos around chondrocytes
label: Lacunar halos around chondrocytes
definition: Concentric rings around the chondrocytes.

name: obsolete Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with impaired attention
label: obsolete Focal impaired awareness cognitive seizure with impaired attention

name: Increased circulating pancreatic triacylglycerol lipase level
label: Increased circulating pancreatic triacylglycerol lipase level
definition: An increased level of triacylglycerol lipase in the blood circulation (can be measured in serum or plasma).

name: Airway hyperresponsiveness
label: Airway hyperresponsiveness
definition: An increased sensitivity of the airways to an inhaled constrictor agonist, a steeper slope of the dose-response curve, and a greater maximal response to the agonist.

name: Spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid leak
label: Spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid leak
definition: A spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid leak (SCSFL) is a spontaneous and unexplained leak of the cerebrospinal fluid from the dura surrounding either the brain (cranial leak) or spine (spinal leak).

name: Posterior crocodile shagreen of the cornea
label: Posterior crocodile shagreen of the cornea
definition: Grayish, polygonal pattern of opacities with intervening clear zones across the central cornea that resembles crocodile skin.

name: Intrusion symptom
label: Intrusion symptom
definition: Unintentional reexperiencing a traumatic event comprising symptoms are usually sensory impressions and emotional responses from the trauma that appear to lack a time perspective and a context.

name: Recurrent, involuntary and intrusive distressing memories
label: Recurrent, involuntary and intrusive distressing memories
definition: After suffering psychological trauma, people can repeatedly experience sensory-perceptual impressions of the event, which intrude involuntarily into consciousness. These intrusive memories typically take the form of visual images (e.g., pictures in the mind's eye), but can also include sounds, smells, tastes and bodily sensations, and come with a range of negative emotions associated with the hotspots in the trauma memory.

name: Recurrent trauma-related distressing dreams
label: Recurrent trauma-related distressing dreams
definition: Recurrent distressing dreams in which the content and/or affect of the dream are related to the traumatic event or events.

name: Physiological reactivity to cues
label: Physiological reactivity to cues
definition: Marked physiological reactions to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event(s).

name: Dissociative reaction
label: Dissociative reaction
definition: A disruption and/or discontinuity in the normal integration of consciousness, memory, identity, emotion, perception, body representation, motor control, and behavior. Clinical presentations of dissociation may include a wide variety of symptoms, including experiences of depersonalization, derealisation, emotional numbing, flashbacks of traumatic events, absorption, amnesia, voice hearing, interruptions in awareness, and identity alteration.

name: Intense psychological distress to cues
label: Intense psychological distress to cues
definition: Intense or prolonged psychological distress at exposure to internal or external cues that symbolize or resemble an aspect of the traumatic event or events.

name: Avoidance of stimuli associated with traumatic event
label: Avoidance of stimuli associated with traumatic event
definition: Avoidance of or efforts to avoid distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s). Avoidance of or efforts to avoid external reminders (people, places, conversations, activities, objects, situations) that arouse distressing memories, thoughts, or feelings about or closely associated with the traumatic event(s).

name: Abnormal urine pH
label: Abnormal urine pH
definition: A deviation of urine pH from the normal range of 4.5 to 7.8.

name: Alkaline urine
label: Alkaline urine
definition: Urine pH of 8 or higher.

name: Renal interstitial inflammation
label: Renal interstitial inflammation
definition: Histopathological findings of inflammation of the renal interstitium potentially involving fibrotic as well as non-fibrotic areas, composed of lymphocytes, monocytes, plasma cells.

name: Renal cortical interstitial inflammation
label: Renal cortical interstitial inflammation
definition: Histopathological findings of inflammation of the renal interstitium involving fibrotic as well as non-fibrotic renal cortex, composed of lymphocytes, monocytes, plasma cells.

name: Renal medullary interstitial inflammation
label: Renal medullary interstitial inflammation
definition: Histopathological findings of inflammation of the interstitium of the renal medulla, composed of lymphocytes, monocytes, plasma cells.

name: Renal interstitial fibrosis
label: Renal interstitial fibrosis
definition: The accumulation of collagen and related extracellular matrix (ECM) molecules in the interstitium of the kidney. The interstitium is expanded by the presence of collagen that stain blue on trichrome. Tubules are not back to back, but rather separated by fibrosis and can be atrophic.

name: Renal interstitial calcium phosphate deposits
label: Renal interstitial calcium phosphate deposits
definition: The presence of interstitial aggregates of purple finely granular/laminated calcium- and phosphate deposits.

name: Abnormal renal tubular lumen morphology
label: Abnormal renal tubular lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structure or form of the lumen (opening) of kidney tubules.

name: Renal tubular viral cytopathic changes
label: Renal tubular viral cytopathic changes
definition: Viral cytopathic changes consist of smudgy basophilic intranuclear inclusions with enlarged nuclei of infected cells. Distal tubules are more commonly involved than proximal tubules. There is associated acute tubular injury, often with frank tubular necrosis and destruction, with acute interstitial nephritis, often with a pleomorphic infiltrate composed of lymphocytes, histiocytes, plasma cells, and variable numbers of neutrophils, with interstitial edema and hemorrhage. Tubular destruction may be associated with necrotizing interstitial granulomas. Severe granulomatous tubulointerstitial nephritis appears to be characteristic of adenoviral infection and is quite rare in other viral infections. Focal wedge-shaped necrosis may occur in renal parenchyma. Immunostaining for adenovirus shows strong nuclear and cytoplasmic staining in infected cells.

name: Usual-type tubular atrophy
label: Usual-type tubular atrophy
definition: A type of renal tubular atrophy in which the tubules show thick tubular basement membranes lined by small cuboidal or flat cells. Generally accompanied by fibrosis.

name: Renal tubular cytomegalovirus inclusions
label: Renal tubular cytomegalovirus inclusions
definition: Characteristic intranuclear glassy-appearing basophilic inclusions with surrounding halo (owl's eye-type inclusion) and marked increase in the size of the cell (cytomegaly), particularly in tubular epithelial cells and in endothelial cells. Often accompanied by cytopathic changes including patchy interstitial pleomorphic infiltrate with lymphocytes, plasma cells, and macrophages.

name: Renal tubular adenovirus inclusions
label: Renal tubular adenovirus inclusions
definition: Viral cytopathic changes consist of smudgy basophilic intranuclear inclusions with enlarged nuclei of infected cells. The inclusions stain positive for adenovirus (e.g., Figure 3 of PMID:29273157). Distal tubules are more commonly involved than proximal tubules. Occasionally glomerular visceral and parietal epithelial cells can be infected. There is associated acute tubular injury, often with frank tubular necrosis and destruction, with acute interstitial nephritis, often with a pleomorphic infiltrate composed of lymphocytes, histiocytes, plasma cells, and variable numbersof neutrophils, with interstitial edema and hemorrhage.

name: Renal tubular polyoma virus inclusions
label: Renal tubular polyoma virus inclusions
definition: Renal ltubular nuclear inclusions have a ground-glass appearance with irregular central clearing, or a coarse, vesicular appearance. Distal tubules are involved more often than proximal tubules. There may be only medullary involvement in early stages, and parietal epithelial cells may be involved in later stages of the infection. Infected epithelial cell nuclei stain with antibody to the large T antigen of the SV40 virus, which serves as a surrogate marker of human polyomavirus infection.

name: Renal tubular herpes simplex virus inclusions
label: Renal tubular herpes simplex virus inclusions
definition: Renal tubular nuclear inclusions that stain positive for herpes simplex virus (HSV). HSV is typically associated with multinucleated giant cells with nuclear inclusions and may cause hemorrhagic interstitial nephritis.

name: Dysmorphic hematuria
label: Dysmorphic hematuria
definition: The presence of dysmorphic urinary erythrocytes. This feature can be observed by phase-contrastmicroscopy, differential interference microscopy, and bright-field microscopy. The acanthocyte or G1 cell, which is a doughnut-shaped cell with one or more blebs, is reported to constitute a special form of dysmorphic erythro-cyte (D cell) specific for glomerular hematuria.

name: Urinary oval fat bodies
label: Urinary oval fat bodies
definition: The presence in the urine of desquamated tubular epithelial cells or macrophages filled with lipid droplets.

name: Intratubular calcium oxalate casts
label: Intratubular calcium oxalate casts
definition: Birefringent calcium- and oxalate-containing casts located within the tubuli of the kidney.

name: Intratubular calcium phosphate casts
label: Intratubular calcium phosphate casts
definition: Purple and finely granular/laminated calcium- and phosphate-containing casts located within the tubuli of the kidney.

name: Magnesium ammonium phosphate crystalluria
label: Magnesium ammonium phosphate crystalluria
definition: Magnesium ammonium phosphate crystals in the urine.

name: Tubular microcystic change
label: Tubular microcystic change
definition: Dilated renal tubules (over twice the diameter of a normal proximal tubule) containing eosinophilic amorphous material. This feature is generally accompanied by scalloping of the cast profile. The epithelium lining the microcyst is generally flattened and does not reveal brush border.

name: Complex renal cyst
label: Complex renal cyst
definition: A renal cyst characterized by epithelium lined space (squamous/columnar) with septations.

name: Uric acid crystalluria
label: Uric acid crystalluria
definition: The presence of uric acid crystals in the urine.

name: Interstitial emphysema
label: Interstitial emphysema
definition: Interstitial emphysema is characterized by air dissecting within the interstitium of the lung, typically in the peribronchovascular sheaths, interlobular septa, and visceral pleura. It is most commonly seen in neonates receiving mechanical ventilation. It is rarely recognized radiographically in adults and is infrequently seen on CT scans. It appears as perivascular lucent or low attenuating halos and small cysts.

name: Centrilobular emphysema
label: Centrilobular emphysema
definition: A type of emphysema characterized by destroyed centrilobular alveolar walls and enlargement of respiratory bronchioles and associated alveoli. This is the commonest form of emphysema in cigarette smokers. CT findings are centrilobular areas of decreased attenuation, usually without visible walls, of nonuniform distribution and predominantly located in upper lung zones.

name: Panacinar emphysema
label: Panacinar emphysema
definition: Panacinar emphysema involves all portions of the acinus and secondary pulmonary lobule more or less uniformly. It predominates in the lower lobes and is the form of emphysema associated with1-antitrypsin deficiency. CT scans show a generalized decrease of the lung parenchyma with a decrease in the caliber of blood vessels in the affected lung. Severe panacinar emphysema may coexist and merge with severe centrilobular emphysema. The appearance of feature less decreased attenuation may be indistinguishable from severe constrictive obliterative bronchiolitis.

name: Expiratory air trapping
label: Expiratory air trapping
definition: Abnormal retention of gas within a lung or part of a lung, as a result of airway obstuction of abnormalities in lung compliance. In the classic presentation, the lung will appear normal at inspiration, but on exhalation, the diseased portions of the lung which have lost connective tissue recoil will remain lucent while the healthy portions of the lung will become more dense due to atelectasis. This helps distinguish it from mosaic attenuation due to patchy fibrosis, as occurs with nonspecific interstitial pneumonia, and in early usual interstitial pneumonitis (the hallmark imaging diagnosis of interstitial lung disease) in which there is no change with inspiration and expiration.

name: Traction bronchiectasis
label: Traction bronchiectasis
definition: Distortion of the bronchial airways due to mechanical traction on the bronchi resulting from fibrosis of the surrounding lung parenchyma. CT findings represent irregular bronchial dilatation caused by surrounding retractile pulmonary fibrosis. Dilated airways are usually identifiable as such but may be seen as cysts.

name: Computed tomographic halo sign
label: Computed tomographic halo sign
definition: CT finding of ground-glass opacity surrounding a nodule or mass. It was first described as a sign of hemorrhage around foci of invasive aspergillosis. The halo sign is nonspecific and may also be caused by hemorrhage associated with other types of nodules or by local pulmonary infiltration by neoplasm.

name: Nodular-centrilobular without tree-in-bud pattern on pulmonary HRCT
label: Nodular-centrilobular without tree-in-bud pattern on pulmonary HRCT
definition: A nodular pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography which are anatomically located centrally within secondary pulmonary lobules. Centrilobular nodules may be dense (i.e., solid) and of homogeneous opacity or ground-glass opacity, and may range from a few millimeters to about 1 cm in size. Because of the similar size of secondary lobules, centrilobular nodules often appear to be evenly spaced. Centrilobular nodules are usually separated from the pleural surfaces, fissures, and interlobular septa by a distance of at least several millimeters. They may appear patchy or diffuse in different diseases.

name: Abnormal bronchoalveolar lavage fluid morphology
label: Abnormal bronchoalveolar lavage fluid morphology
definition: Abnormal type or counts of nucleated immune cells and acellular components in bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid. BAL us performed with a fiberoptic bronchoscope in the wedged position within a selected bronchopulmonary segment. BAL is commonly used to inform the differential diagnosis of interstitial lung disease or to monitor therapeutic interventions.

name: Abnormal cellular composition of bronchoalveolar fluid
label: Abnormal cellular composition of bronchoalveolar fluid
definition: Deviation from the commonly in healthy people observe cellular distribution. Normal ranghes are macrophages over 80%, lymphocytes less than 15%, neutrophils less than 3%, eosinophils less than 0.5%, mast cells less than 0.5%.

name: Abnormal bronchoalveolar fluid protein level
label: Abnormal bronchoalveolar fluid protein level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of protein in the bronchoalveolar fluid.

name: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid lymphocyte proportion
label: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid lymphocyte proportion
definition: Usually, Lymphoycytes make up less than 15% of all cells found in the bronchoalveloar lavage fluid. This elevated cell proportion can be induced by virus or drugs, or is associated with specific diseases.

name: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid neutrophil proportion
label: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid neutrophil proportion
definition: Usually, Neutrophils make up less than 3% of all cells found in the broncho-alveloar lavage fluid. In children, standard value of neutrophils is higher depending on their age (children under the age of 5 show a maximum value of 10%). This elevated cell proportion is a sign for acute and chronic infections (HP:0012387, HP:0006538) and can be associated to specific diseases.

name: Lipid-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar fluid
label: Lipid-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar fluid
definition: Accumulation of lipids in alveolar macrophages with droplet-shaped fat inclusions.

name: Hemosiderin-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar fluid
label: Hemosiderin-laden macrophages in bronchoalveolar fluid
definition: Hemosiderin-laden macrophages (HLM) in bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid were originally known as adiagnostic biomarker of alveolar hemorrhage, but have also been observed in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) with histopathological pattern of usual interstitial pneumonia (UIP).

name: Absent bronchoalveolar surfactant-protein C
label: Absent bronchoalveolar surfactant-protein C
definition: Significantly decreased level or failed detection of surfactant protein C in broncho-alveolar lavage fluid. Comment: Pulmonary surfactant is a highly surface-active mixture of proteins and lipids that is synthesized and secreted onto the alveoli by type II epithelial cells. The protein part of surfactant constitutes of four types of surfactant proteins (SP), SP-A, SP-B, SP-C and SP-D. SP-A and SP-D are hydrophilic proteins that regulate surfactant metabolism and have immunologic functions, whereas SP-B and SP-C are hydrophobic molecules, which play a direct role in the organization of the surfactant structure in the interphase and in the stabilization of the lipid layers during the respiratory cycle. Lack of SP-C may result of surfactant metabolism dysfunction and is also observed in patients with other diffuse parenchymal lung diseaes, pathogenetically related to the alveolar surfactant region.

name: Absent bronchoalveolar dimeric surfactant-protein B
label: Absent bronchoalveolar dimeric surfactant-protein B
definition: Significantly decreased level or failed detection of surfactant protein B in broncho-alveolar lavage fluid.

name: Atoll sign
label: Atoll sign
definition: CT finding of central ground-glass opacity surrounded by denser consolidation of crescentic shape (forming more than three-fourths of a circle) or complete ring of at least 2 mm in thicknes. A rare sign, it was initially reported to be specific for cryptogenic organizing pneumonia, but was subsequently described in patients with paracoccidioidomycosis.

name: Abnormal alveolar macrophage morphology
label: Abnormal alveolar macrophage morphology
definition: Alveolar macrophages usually make up the majority of cells in the bronchoalveolar space (over 80%). The may contain intracellular material depending on underlying diseases or due to exposition to inhaled particles.

name: Dust particle inclusion in alveolar macrophages
label: Dust particle inclusion in alveolar macrophages
definition: Accumulation of inhaled, nondigestable particles in macrophages.

name: Smoker-inclusions in alveolar macrophages
label: Smoker-inclusions in alveolar macrophages
definition: In otherwise healthy smokers, characteristic so called smoker-inclusion can be found within the macrophages in the bronchoalveolar fluid. These blue/ black/ round/ oval cytoplasmic inclusions consist of pigmented lipid deposits.

name: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid eosinophil proportion
label: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid eosinophil proportion
definition: Usually, eosinophils make up less than 0.5% of all cells found in the broncho-alveloar lavage fluid. But in eosinophilic lung disease, the eosinophil cell proportion typically represents more than 25%. Comment: An elevated level of eosinophil cells are also a result of infections, or an allergic reaction or can be drug-induced.

name: Persistent head lag
label: Persistent head lag
definition: The Premie-Neuro and the Dubowitz Neurological Examination score head lag in the same manner. Scoring for both is as follows: 0 = head drops and stays back, 1 = tries to lift head but drops it back, 2 = able to lift head slightly, 3 = lifts head in line with body, and 4 = head in front of body. This term applies if head lag persists beyond an expected age at a level of 0 or 1. Persistent head lag beyond age 4 mo has been linked to poor outcomes.

name: Delayed ability to roll over
label: Delayed ability to roll over
definition: Delayed ahcievement of the ability to roll front to back and back to front.

name: Localized pulmonary hemorrhage
label: Localized pulmonary hemorrhage
definition: Circumscribed pulmonary hemorrhage originating from a single bleeding site in the lungs. This can be due to infections, tumorigenesis, foreign bodies, or vascular abnormalities. Patient often feel the site of bleeding, contrast CT scan or angiography may localize the bleeder.

name: Abnormal pulmonary fissure morphology
label: Abnormal pulmonary fissure morphology
definition: An abnormal form or number of the pulmonary fissures.

name: Abnormal pulmonary fissure architecture
label: Abnormal pulmonary fissure architecture
definition: An abnormal form or location of a pulmonary fissure.

name: Abnormal pulmonary fissure count
label: Abnormal pulmonary fissure count
definition: A deviation from the normal number of pulmonary fissures.

name: Supernumerary pulmonary fissure
label: Supernumerary pulmonary fissure
definition: Presence of a lung fissure that does not exist normally. Supernumerary fissures include the superior accessory fissure, the medial basal fissure, the left horizontal fissure, and the azygos fissure form supernumerary lobes.

name: Decreased pulmonary fissure count
label: Decreased pulmonary fissure count
definition: Lack of one or more of the normal pulmonary fissures.

name: Abnormal cystatin C level
label: Abnormal cystatin C level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cystatin C in serum or plasma.

name: Decreased cystatin C level
label: Decreased cystatin C level
definition: A decreased concentration of cystatin C in the blood circulation.

name: Increased cystatin C level
label: Increased cystatin C level
definition: A elevated concentration of cystatin C in the blood circulation.

name: Increased fecal porphyrin
label: Increased fecal porphyrin
definition: Abnormally high concentration of fecal porphyrins in feces.

name: Subglottic laryngitis
label: Subglottic laryngitis
definition: Narrowing of the larynx, commonly occuring during viral respiratory tract infections, in particular in children, leads to symptoms such as hoarseness, a barking cough, stridor, and sometimes dyspnea and respiratory failure.

name: Laryngeal papilloma
label: Laryngeal papilloma
definition: A wart-like lesion (papilloma, i.e., benign epithelial tumors that are caused by infection with the human papilloma virus) located on the larynx.

name: Bronchial papilloma
label: Bronchial papilloma
definition: A wart-like lesion (papilloma, i.e., benign epithelial tumors that are caused by infection with the human papilloma virus) located on a bronchus.

name: Tracheal papilloma
label: Tracheal papilloma
definition: A wart-like lesion (papilloma, i.e., benign epithelial tumors that are caused by infection with the human papilloma virus) located on the trachea.

name: Palmar warts
label: Palmar warts
definition: Multiple verrucous lesions on the skin of the palm. These lesions are raised, have a thickened and rough surface, and may display prominent black dots (thrombosed capillaries). Palmar warts are caused by caused by human papillomavirus (HPV).

name: Plantar warts
label: Plantar warts
definition: Multiple verrucous lesions on the skin of the sole of the foot. These lesions are raised, have a thickened and rough surface, and may display prominent black dots (thrombosed capillaries). Palmar warts are caused by caused by human papillomavirus (HPV).

name: Diffuse alveolar damage
label: Diffuse alveolar damage
definition: Diffuse alveolar damage (DAD) describes a comon histologic injury pattern of the lung. The early stages are characterized by epithelial cell necrosis and sloughing, fibrous exsudate, edema, and hyaline membranes made of surfactant and proteins, filling the alveoli. This results in impaired gas exchange. In later stages, type II cells and myofibroblasts proliferate within the interstitium and airspaces. The corresponding clinical entity is acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). DAD may result from pulmonary drug toxicity, occurs in immunosuppressed, severe viral infections, acute interstial pneumonitis and crack cocaine inhalation.

name: Architectural distortion of the lung
label: Architectural distortion of the lung
definition: Architectural distortion is characterized by abnormal displacement of bronchi, vessels, fissures, or septa caused by diffuse or localized lung disease, particularly interstitial fibrosis. This is visible in lung biopsy and CT scans in a distorted appearance and is usually associated with pulmonary fibrosis and accompanied by volume loss.

name: Increased Z-disc width
label: Increased Z-disc width
definition: Abnormally increased width of the Z-disk of the sarcomere, resulting from splitting or opening of the Z-disc (c.f., Figure 2 of PMID:28732005).

name: Increased fecal coproporphyrin 1
label: Increased fecal coproporphyrin 1
definition: Abnormally high concentration of coproporphyrin 3 in feces.

name: Increased fecal coproporphyrin 3
label: Increased fecal coproporphyrin 3
definition: Abnormally high concentration of coproporphyrin 3 in feces

name: Platystencephaly
label: Platystencephaly
definition: Extreme width of the skull in the occipital region, with anterior narrowing and prognathism.

name: Abnormal salivary metabolite concentration
label: Abnormal salivary metabolite concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a metabolite in saliva.

name: Abnormal salivary cortisol level
label: Abnormal salivary cortisol level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cortisol in saliva.

name: Decreased salivary cortisol level
label: Decreased salivary cortisol level
definition: Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in saliva.

name: Increased salivary cortisol level
label: Increased salivary cortisol level
definition: Abnormally elevated concentration of cortisol in saliva.

name: Chronic decreased circulating IgD
label: Chronic decreased circulating IgD
definition: A lasting reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin D (IgD) in the blood.

name: Transient decreased circulating IgD
label: Transient decreased circulating IgD
definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin D (IgD) in the blood circulation.

name: Chronic absent circulating IgD
label: Chronic absent circulating IgD
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin D (IgD) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgD can be measured.

name: Male reproductive system neoplasm
label: Male reproductive system neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm that affects the male reproductive system.

name: Female reproductive system neoplasm
label: Female reproductive system neoplasm
definition: A neoplasm that affects the female reproductive system.

name: Transient decreased circulating IgE
label: Transient decreased circulating IgE
definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin E (IgE) in the blood.

name: Chronic decreased circulating IgE
label: Chronic decreased circulating IgE
definition: A lasting reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin E (IgE) in the blood.

name: Chronic absent circulating IgE
label: Chronic absent circulating IgE
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities of IgE can be measured.

name: Transient decreased circulating IgA
label: Transient decreased circulating IgA
definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin A (IgA) in the blood circulation.

name: Chronic absent circulating total IgG
label: Chronic absent circulating total IgG
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG can be measured.

name: White oral mucosal macule
label: White oral mucosal macule
definition: A small circumscribed whitish change in the color of the oral mucosa that is neither elevated nor depressed.

name: Retinal peau d'orange
label: Retinal peau d'orange
definition: A pebbly orange appearance of the fundus that is said to resemble the skin of an orange.

name: Anti-U1 ribonucleoprotein antibody positivity
label: Anti-U1 ribonucleoprotein antibody positivity
definition: The presence autoantibodies in the serum that react to proteins (70 Kd, A, C) that are associated with U1 RNA and form U1snRNP.

name: Anti-Jo-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Jo-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to the histidyl-tRNA-synthetase.

name: Anti-glomerular basement membrane-antibody positivity
label: Anti-glomerular basement membrane-antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Hyperpyrexia
label: Hyperpyrexia
definition: An extreme elevation of core body temperature above normal defined as a rectal temperature of 41.1 degrees Celsius (106 degrees Fahrenheit).

name: Triggered by an abusive adult
label: Triggered by an abusive adult
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is induced by an abusive adult (usually a parent).

name: Anti-MDA5 antibody positivity
label: Anti-MDA5 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to Anti-MDA5 (Anti-melanoma differentiation-associated proteine 5).

name: Anti-citrullinated protein antibody positivity
label: Anti-citrullinated protein antibody positivity
definition: The presence autoantibodies in the serum that react do different citrullinated antigens, including filaggrin, fibrinogen, vimentin and collagen.

name: Abnormal Schwann cell morphology
label: Abnormal Schwann cell morphology
definition: Abormality of schwann cells, glial cells that ensheath axons of neurons in the peripheral nervous system and are necessary for their maintenance and function.

name: Decreased nasal nitric oxide
label: Decreased nasal nitric oxide
definition: Reduced level of nasal nitric oxide (nNO). Current American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) guidelines for nNO measurements recommend air aspiration via a nasal probe while the subject exhales through the mouth against resistance in order to maintain velum closure.

name: Anti-RNA-polymerase-III-autoantibody positivity
label: Anti-RNA-polymerase-III-autoantibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to RNA-polymerase III.

name: Increased circulating precipitin level
label: Increased circulating precipitin level
definition: The presence of high titers of antigen-precipitating IgG in the serum.

name: Anti-Sm antibody positivity
label: Anti-Sm antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react to seven proteins that consist of a core of small nuclear ribonucleoprotein (snRNP) particles.

name: Cytokine storm
label: Cytokine storm
definition: Excessive or uncontrolled release of proinflammatory cytokines.

name: Abnormal chorion morphology
label: Abnormal chorion morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the fetal part of the placenta, which is known as the chorion.

name: Edematous chorionic villi
label: Edematous chorionic villi
definition: Swelling of the chorionic villi owing to fluid accumulation.

name: Motor regression
label: Motor regression
definition: Loss of previously achieved motor skills, as manifested by loss of developmental motor milestones.

name: Bipedal edema
label: Bipedal edema
definition: A palpable swelling in both feet and ankles caused by palpable swelling caused by an increase in interstitial fluid volume (excess fulid).

name: Michaelis-Gutmann bodies
label: Michaelis-Gutmann bodies
definition: Basophilic intracytoplasmic inclusions in macrophages. The inclusions have a small, round laminated appearance. Electron microscopy of Michaelis-Gutmann bodies exhibits partially digested bacteria.

name: Body ache
label: Body ache
definition: Body ache is a complaint that is often used to denote vague symptoms of mild fatigue, lethargy, or dull aches. We will define it here to mean a dull and poorly localizable pain that is described by the affected individual to affect multiple joints or body parts or even the entire body.

name: Substantia nigra hypointensity on susceptibility-weighted imaging
label: Substantia nigra hypointensity on susceptibility-weighted imaging
definition: Hypointence (dark) appearance of the substantia nigra inmagnetic resonance imaging using susceptibility weighted imaging (SWI).

name: Globus pallidus hypointensity on susceptibility-weighted imaging
label: Globus pallidus hypointensity on susceptibility-weighted imaging
definition: Hypointence (dark) appearance of the globus pallidus inmagnetic resonance imaging using susceptibility weighted imaging (SWI).

name: Pharyngalgia
label: Pharyngalgia
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the throat.

name: Impaired executive functioning
label: Impaired executive functioning
definition: A disturbance of executive functioning, which is broadly defined as the set of abilities that allow for the planning, executing, monitoring, and self-correcting of goal-directed behavior while inhibiting task-irrelevant behavior. At least some degree of executive skill is needed to complete most cognitive tasks, and deficits in executive abilities are central to many clinical conditions, including fronto-temporal dementia.

name: Psychogenic non-epileptic seizure
label: Psychogenic non-epileptic seizure
definition: Psychogenic non-epileptic seizures (PNES) are an important cause of apparently treatment-resistant epilepsy and remain a major diagnostic challenge in epileptology. The two main PNES groups are panic disorder (also occurring as a reaction in people with epilepsy) and dissociative disorder (pseudoseizure), often developing inpatients with no history of epilepsy. The main markers distinguishing PNES from epileptic seizures are (i) the way the patient tells the story (not focusing on the seizure symptoms, avoidance of the word seizure, etc); (ii) that they are prolonged (many minutes); (iii) associated with hyperventilation and eyes closed; and that they present as treatment-resistant epilepsy despite an often normal intellect and brain imaging.

name: Pseudoseizure
label: Pseudoseizure
definition: Sudden, involuntary seizure-like attacks that, unlike epileptic seizures, are not related to electrographic ictal discharges.

name: Myoclonic tremor
label: Myoclonic tremor
definition: A tremor-like cortical myoclonus. The tremulous movements are in fact small, high-frequency myoclonic jerks, induced by posture or action. They can be mild, but can also be more incapacitating. When present in the lower limbs, these may lead to gait disorders and even drop attacks. These tremor-like movements during action can be mistaken for essential tremor or epileptic seizures.

name: Impaired ability to plan
label: Impaired ability to plan
definition: Impaired ability to anticipate future events, implement instructions or goals, and develop appropriate steps ahead of time in order to carry out a task or activity.

name: Impaired ability to organize
label: Impaired ability to organize
definition: Impaired ability to bring order to information, actions, or materials to achieve a goal or to follow an established organized routine.

name: Decreased serum terminal complement component
label: Decreased serum terminal complement component
definition: Reduced level of one or more components of the the terminal membrane attack complex (MAC) portion of complement, which represents the lytic, pore-forming part of the system. The MAC comprises seven components: C5b, C6, C7, C8 (a heterotrimer composed of C8alpha, C8beta and C8gamma) and multiple copies of C9.

name: Decreased serum complement C7
label: Decreased serum complement C7
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C7 in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased serum complement C6
label: Decreased serum complement C6
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C6 in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased serum complement C5
label: Decreased serum complement C5
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C5 in the blood circulation.

name: Increased factor IX activity
label: Increased factor IX activity
definition: Elevated activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.

name: Abnormal factor IX activity
label: Abnormal factor IX activity
definition: Abnormal activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.

name: Shortened sleep cycle
label: Shortened sleep cycle
definition: A tendency to sleep less hours than usual while feeling well rested.

name: Renal interstitial globotriaosylceramide inclusions
label: Renal interstitial globotriaosylceramide inclusions
definition: Accumulation of globotriaosylceramide (GL-3) in kidney tissues, which can be quantified as the number of globotriaosylceramide (GL-3) inclusions/kidney interstitial capillary (KIC).

name: Mild albuminuria
label: Mild albuminuria
definition: The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as an albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) less than 30 mg/gm (less than 3.4 mg/mmol).

name: Severe albuminuria
label: Severe albuminuria
definition: The presence of severely increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as an albumin-creatinine ratio greater than 300 mg/gm (greater than 34 mg/mmol).

name: Medication crystalluria
label: Medication crystalluria
definition: A variety of drugs may occasionally cause transient crystalluria, in isolation or in conjunction with other urinary abnormalities. Overdose, dehydration, or hypoalbuminaemia, which increases the unbound drug which is ultrafiltrated by the glomerulus, are the factors usally favoring the precipitation of crystals within the tubular lumina. In some cases, medication-induced crystalluria has a distinct phenotypic appearance. For instance, Sulphadiazine crystals appear as strongly birefringent 'shocks of wheat' or 'shells' with an amber colour. Acyclovir crystals are birefringent and needle-shaped, and when present in abundance give to urine a silky and opalescent macroscopic appearance.

name: Renal interstitial IgG4+ plasma cell infiltration
label: Renal interstitial IgG4+ plasma cell infiltration
definition: An increased number of IgG4+ plasma cells in the interstitial space of the kidney.

name: Impaired self monitoring
label: Impaired self monitoring
definition: Impaired ability to track awareness of the effect that one's behavior has on others and how it compares with standards or expectations for behavior.

name: Impaired task monitoring
label: Impaired task monitoring
definition: Impaired ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during performance of a goal.

name: Abnormal macroscopic urine appearance
label: Abnormal macroscopic urine appearance
definition: Anomalous physical appearance (color, cloudiness, clarity) or odor of urine.

name: Urate tophus
label: Urate tophus
definition: Intradermal urate crystal deposits appeared as small, superficial, pustule-like, whitish lesions. The lesions may be the focus of inflammatory episodes with increasing pain, swelling, and erythema of the intradermal tophi.

name: Steroid-responsive anemia
label: Steroid-responsive anemia
definition: Amelioration of anemia upon treatment with a steroid medication.

name: Inappropriately normal thyroid-stimulating hormone level
label: Inappropriately normal thyroid-stimulating hormone level
definition: A normal or elevated serum thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) level in the face of an elevation in circulating FT4 and/or FT3.

name: Abnormal circulating free T4 level
label: Abnormal circulating free T4 level
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of free thyroxine (T4) in the blood circulation. Circulating T4 is almost entirely bound to specific transport proteins such as thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) but it is the unbound (free) fraction that is able to enter tissues and exert effects.

name: Increased circulating free T4 level
label: Increased circulating free T4 level
definition: An elevated concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating free T4 level
label: Decreased circulating free T4 level
definition: A reduced concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thyroid gland
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thyroid gland
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the thyroid gland.

name: Abnormal TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
label: Abnormal TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
definition: Thyrotrophin-releasing hormone (TRH) is a hypothalamic tripeptide synthesised by, stored within and released from the hypothalamus. It stimulates the synthesis and release of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) from the anterior pituitary gland. Following administration of exogenous TRH, a transient increase in serum TSH is expected. This term refers to an abnormal reponse in the TRH stimulation test.

name: Absent TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
label: Absent TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
definition: Failure to increase serum TSH levels in response to a TRH stimulation test.

name: Reduced TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
label: Reduced TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test
definition: A lower than normal TSH response to thyrotrophin-releasing hormone stimulation test.

name: Increased circulating farnesol concentration
label: Increased circulating farnesol concentration
definition: An elevated level of farnesol in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal antral follicle count
label: Abnormal antral follicle count
definition: Any deviation from a count of antral follicles that is normal for age. Antral follicles appear as small fluid-filled sacs that contain an immature egg. Antral follicle count can be measured (usually on day 2-5 of the menstrual cycle) by transvaginal ultrasound. The number of antral follicles may reflect ovarian reserve.

name: Reduced antral follicle count
label: Reduced antral follicle count
definition: A count of antral follicles that is lower than normal for age.

name: Increased antral follicle count
label: Increased antral follicle count
definition: A count of antral follicles that is higher than normal for age.

name: Quotidian fever
label: Quotidian fever
definition: Fever that occurs at daily intervals.

name: Valinuria
label: Valinuria
definition: Urine valine level above the normal range.

name: Branched-chain aminoaciduria
label: Branched-chain aminoaciduria
definition: An increased level of a branched chain family amino acid in the urine.

name: Increased aromatic amino acid level in urine
label: Increased aromatic amino acid level in urine
definition: An elevated level of an aromatic amino acid in the urine.

name: Tyrosinuria
label: Tyrosinuria
definition: An abnormally increased level of tyrosine in the urine.

name: Increased urine succinate level
label: Increased urine succinate level
definition: An increase in the level of succinate in the urine.

name: Increased glutamine family amino acid level in urine
label: Increased glutamine family amino acid level in urine
definition: An elevated level of an glutamine family amino acid in the urine.

name: Increased urine glutamate level
label: Increased urine glutamate level
definition: An increased concentration of glutamate in the urine.

name: Increased sulfur amino acid level in urine
label: Increased sulfur amino acid level in urine
definition: An elevated level of a sulfur-containing amino acid in the urine.

name: Increased aspartate family amino acid level in urine
label: Increased aspartate family amino acid level in urine
definition: An elevated level of an aspartate family amino acid in the urine.

name: Increased urine proteinogenic amino acid derivative level
label: Increased urine proteinogenic amino acid derivative level
definition: An elevated urine level of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

name: Increased urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
label: Increased urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
definition: An increased level in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

name: Increased serine family amino acid in urine
label: Increased serine family amino acid in urine
definition: An increased level of a serine family amino acid in the urine.

name: Increased proteinogenic amino acid level in urine
label: Increased proteinogenic amino acid level in urine
definition: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the urine. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Elevated urine aconitic acid level
label: Elevated urine aconitic acid level
definition: An abnormally increased level of aconitic acid in the urine.

name: Monkey wrench femoral neck
label: Monkey wrench femoral neck
definition: The femoral neck region shows medial metaphyseal beaking and a significant enlargement of the lesser trochanter (with some enlargement also of the greater trochanter), producing a monkey wrench (Swedish key) configuration of the proximal femur. A monkey wrench refers to a type of adjustable wrench with one fixed and one adjustable jaw at right angles to a straight handle.

name: Elevated circulating CHI3L1 level
label: Elevated circulating CHI3L1 level
definition: Increased concentration of chitinase 3-like 1 (CHI3L1) in the blood circulation.

name: Inappropriate absence of fever
label: Inappropriate absence of fever
definition: Failure to develop fever in the presence of an infection that normally would be expected to elicit a febrile response.

name: Interhypothalamic Adhesion
label: Interhypothalamic Adhesion
definition: An abnormal parenchymal band connecting the medial margins of the left and right hypothalami across the third ventricle.

name: Elevated circulating D-dimer concentration
label: Elevated circulating D-dimer concentration
definition: An increased concentration of D-dimers, a marker of fibrin degradation, in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid concentration
definition: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the blood circulation. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid derivative concentration
label: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid derivative concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

name: Abnormal circulating non-proteinogenic amino acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating non-proteinogenic amino acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

name: Elevated circulating alpha-aminobutyric acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating alpha-aminobutyric acid concentration
definition: An abnormally increased level of alpa-aminobutyric acid in the blood circulation. Alpha-aminobutyric acid alpha-amino acid that is butyric acid bearing a single amino substituent located at position 2.

name: 3-hydroxyisovaleric aciduria
label: 3-hydroxyisovaleric aciduria
definition: Concentration of 3-hydroxyisovaleric acid in the urine above the normal range.

name: Elevated circulating apolipoprotein C-III concentration
label: Elevated circulating apolipoprotein C-III concentration
definition: An increased concentration in blood of apolipoprotein C-III, a protein component of triglyceride (TG)-rich lipoproteins (TRLs) including very low density lipoproteins (VLDL), high density lipoproteins (HDL) and chylomicrons.

name: Gallop rhythm
label: Gallop rhythm
definition: In the normal heart cycle, two heart sounds can be heard by auscultation per cycle: S1 and S2. A gallop rhythm refers to the presence of three or four heart sounds per cardiac cycle, which is said to resemble the gallop of a horse.

name: Quadruple gallop rhythm
label: Quadruple gallop rhythm
definition: A type of gallop rhytm in which both the third and the fourth sounds are present.

name: Elevated circulating tenascin-C level
label: Elevated circulating tenascin-C level
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of tenascin-C in the blood circulation.

name: Duodenal gastric metaplasia
label: Duodenal gastric metaplasia
definition: Foci of gastric-type mucus-secreting cells interspersed between duodenal enterocytes. These foci of gastric epithelial cells contain Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive neutral mucin and lack a brush border.

name: Duodenitis
label: Duodenitis
definition: Inflammation of the lining of the upper small intestine (duodenum).

name: Abnormal right ventricular function
label: Abnormal right ventricular function
definition: Anomalous physiology (function) of the right ventricle.

name: Elevated right ventricular systolic pressure
label: Elevated right ventricular systolic pressure
definition: Elevation of right ventricular systolic pressure (RVSP) above normal limits. In adults, RVSP is normally 20-30 mmHg.

name: Nummular eczema
label: Nummular eczema
definition: A type of eczema characterized by pruritic coin-shaped patches on the skin. Nummular eczema most commonly occurs on the extremities, particularly the legs, but may occur anywhere on the trunk, hands, or feet

name: Barking cough
label: Barking cough
definition: A cough with a characteristic sound that has been compared to a seal's bark.

name: Absent P wave
label: Absent P wave
definition: The P wave that normally precedes each QRS complex by a fixed PR interval of 120 to 200 milliseconds is not present.

name: Elevated circulating osteopontin level
label: Elevated circulating osteopontin level
definition: Abnormally increased level of osteopontin in the blood circulation

name: Increased serum sorbitol concentration
label: Increased serum sorbitol concentration
definition: An increased level of sorbitol in the blood circulation.

name: Follicular lymphoma
label: Follicular lymphoma
definition: An indolent B cell lymphoproliferative disorder of transformed follicular center B cells. Follicular lymphoma is characterized by diffuse lymphadenopathy, bone marrow involvement, splenomegaly and less commonly other extranodal sites of involvement.

name: Cutaneous necrosis
label: Cutaneous necrosis
definition: Skin and subcutaneous tissue necrosis (tissue death). Clinically, cutaneous necrosis may present as a painful and extremely tender black eschar (dead tissue found in a full-thickness wound) surrounded by dusky grey-red coloured skin.

name: Abnormality of the musculoskeletal system
label: Abnormality of the musculoskeletal system
definition: An anomaly of the musculoskeletal system, which consists of the bones of the skeleton, muscles, cartilage, tendons, ligaments, joints, and other connective tissue. The musculoskeletal system supports the weight of the body, maintains body position and produces movements of the body or of parts of the body.

name: Delayed ability to crawl
label: Delayed ability to crawl
definition: A failure to achieve the ability to crawl at an appropriate developmental stage. Normal infant motor development is marked by a series of postural milestones including learning to crawl on hands and knees between the ages of 6 and 10 months.

name: Abnormal shoulder physiology
label: Abnormal shoulder physiology
definition: Anopmalous function of the shoulder. The shoulder is a ball-and-socket joint that is made up of humerus, scapula and clavicle, which are connected by the sternoclavicular joint (SC), the acromioclavicular joint (AC), the glenohumeral joint (GH), and the scapulothoracic joint (ST). The GH, AC and SC joints link the upper extremity to the axial skeleton at the thorax and enable movement at the shoulder joint: flexion, extension, and rotation of the arm.

name: Abnormal renal echogenicity
label: Abnormal renal echogenicity
definition: Anomalous echogenicity of the kidney on ultrasound examination.

name: Renal medullary hyperechogenicity
label: Renal medullary hyperechogenicity
definition: Increased echogenecity of the medullary region of the kidney.

name: Renal cortical hyperechogenicity
label: Renal cortical hyperechogenicity
definition: Increased echogenecity of the kidney cortex.

name: Abdominal adhesions
label: Abdominal adhesions
definition: Fibrous bands (i.e., bands of scar-like tissue) that span two or more intra-abdominal organs and/or the inner abdominal wall (i.e. peritoneal membrane).

name: Hepatic infarction
label: Hepatic infarction
definition: Hepatic infarction is defined as areas of coagulative necrosis from hepatocyte cell death caused by local ischemia. Liver infarctions appear as hypoechoic nonvascular regions on conventional and Doppler sonography.

name: Lymph node abscess
label: Lymph node abscess
definition: An inflammed lymph node that is filled with pus.

name: Abnormal pulmonary alveolar system morphology
label: Abnormal pulmonary alveolar system morphology
definition: A structural abnormality of the pulmonary acinus, alveolar parenchyma, or alveoli.

name: Right atrial thrombus
label: Right atrial thrombus
definition: A thrombus (i.e., a blood clot formed in situ within the vascular system) located in the right atrium of the heart.

name: Elevated circulating uracil concentration
label: Elevated circulating uracil concentration
definition: Concentration of uracil in the blood circulation is above the normal range.

name: Blake's pouch cyst
label: Blake's pouch cyst
definition: The presence of an upwardly displaced normal cerebellar vermis, normal appearance of the fastigium, tentorium and size of the cisterna magna.

name: Severe SARS-CoV-2 infection
label: Severe SARS-CoV-2 infection
definition: Unusually severe clinical course of SARS-CoV-2 infection, manifested clinically by features such as dyspnea and hypoxia with diffuse bilateral ground-glass opacities of the lungs on computed tomographic scan with progressive respiratory insufficiency necessitating oxygen supplementation or mechanical ventilation.

name: Long nasal bridge
label: Long nasal bridge
definition: Increased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.

name: Jejunitis
label: Jejunitis
definition: Inflammation of the lining of the middle section of the small intestine.

name: Abnormal circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
label: Abnormal circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
definition: Any deviation of the concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood from the normal range.

name: Increased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
label: Increased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
definition: Elevated concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating methylsuccinic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating methylsuccinic acid concentration
definition: Increased concentration of methylsuccinic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating short-chain fatty-acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating short-chain fatty-acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a short-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating isovaleric acid concentration
label: Increased circulating isovaleric acid concentration
definition: Increased concentration of isovaleric acid, a C5, branched-chain saturated fatty acid, in the blood concentration.

name: Intrahepatic bile duct dilatation
label: Intrahepatic bile duct dilatation
definition: Increased diameter (caliber) of intrahepatic bile ducts (bile ducts that transport bile between the Canals of Hering and the interlobar bile ducts).

name: Anorectal abscess
label: Anorectal abscess
definition: An abscess located at the junction of the anal canal and the rectum.

name: Abnormal pharynx morphology
label: Abnormal pharynx morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the pharynx.

name: Abnormal pharynx physiology
label: Abnormal pharynx physiology
definition: A functional anomaly of the pharynx.

name: Elevated circulating dodecenoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating dodecenoylcarnitine concentration
definition: An abnormally increased circulation of dodecenoylcarnitine, C12:1, in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating deoxypyridinoline concentration
label: Elevated circulating deoxypyridinoline concentration
definition: An increased concentration of lysyl-pyridinoline (deoxypyridinoline) cross-links in the bloood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating L-alloisoleucine concentration
label: Elevated circulating L-alloisoleucine concentration
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of L-alloisoleucine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated urine L-alloisoleucine level
label: Elevated urine L-alloisoleucine level
definition: Abnormally increased level of L-alloisoleucine in the urine.

name: Elevated circulating 3-methylhistidine concentration
label: Elevated circulating 3-methylhistidine concentration
definition: Abnormal increase of the concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced respiratory ciliary beating frequency
label: Reduced respiratory ciliary beating frequency
definition: An abnormal reduction in the number of beats per unit time of the respiratory cilia.

name: Reduced urinary inosine level
label: Reduced urinary inosine level
definition: Decreased level of inosine in urine. Inosine is a purine nucleoside in which hypoxanthine is attached to ribofuranose via a beta-N(9)-glycosidic bond.

name: Decreased urinary guanosine level
label: Decreased urinary guanosine level
definition: Decreased level of guanosine in urine. Guanosine is a purine nucleoside in which guanine is attached to ribofuranose via a beta-N(9)-glycosidic bond.

name: Abnormal urinary purine level
label: Abnormal urinary purine level
definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of a purine compound in the urine. Purines are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring. Two of the four deoxyribonucleotides (deoxyadenosine and deoxyguanosine) and two of the four ribonucleotides (adenosine, or AMP, and guanosine, or GMP) are purines.

name: Abnormal urinary pyrimidine level
label: Abnormal urinary pyrimidine level
definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of a pyrimidine compound in the urine. Pyrimidines and pyrimidine derivatives are compounds containing a pyrimidne ring, which is a six-member aromatic heterocycle which consists of two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 3) and four carbon atoms. The nucleotides cytosine, thymine and uracil are pyrimidines.

name: Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth
label: Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth
definition: An increased number and/or abnormal type of bacteria in the small bowel. Small intestinal bacterial overgrowth has been defined as the presence of greater than one hundred thousand bacteria (i.e. colony-forming units, CFU) per mL of proximal jejunal aspiration. The normal value is ten thousand or few CFU/ml.

name: Focal active colitis
label: Focal active colitis
definition: Focal active colitis (FAC) is characterized by focal crypt damage caused by neutrophils. FAC is characterized by an inflammatory infiltrate consisting of intraepithelial neutrophils and/or neutrophils invading the lumen of the criptae, with no other microscopic alteration of the colonic mucosa and, in particular, without the presence of signs of chronic inflammation.

name: Necrotizing enterocolitis
label: Necrotizing enterocolitis
definition: Inflammation of the intestine leading to bacterial invasion causing cellular damage and death which causes necrosis of the colon and intestine.

name: Recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections
label: Recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections
definition: An increased susceptibility to viral upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent viral upper respiratory tract infections (otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).

name: Neutrophilic urticarial dermatosis
label: Neutrophilic urticarial dermatosis
definition: A neutrophilic interstitial, perivascular and/or perieccrine infiltrate with leukocytoclasia. Notably, leukocytoclastic vasculitis is not present.

name: Reduced mevalonate kinase activity
label: Reduced mevalonate kinase activity
definition: Abnormally reduced activity of mevalonate kinase, ,which is a key enzyme in the mevalonate biosynthetic pathway that leads to the synthesis of both cholesterol and nonsterol isoprenoids.

name: Reduced total lung capacity
label: Reduced total lung capacity
definition: Abnormally reduced volume of air in the lungs upon the maximum effort of inspiration.

name: Abnormal skinfold thickness measurement
label: Abnormal skinfold thickness measurement
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of a skinfold thickness, which quantifies the amount of subcutaneous fat when the skin is pinched by specialized calipers.

name: Abnormal triceps skinfold thickness
label: Abnormal triceps skinfold thickness
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the thickness of the tricpes skinfold, which quantifies the amount of subcutaneous fat when the skin is pinched by specialized calipers.

name: Increased triceps skinfold thickness
label: Increased triceps skinfold thickness
definition: Increased thickness of the triceps skinfold, which is measured halfway down the back of the upper arm is increased.

name: Milky appearance of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
label: Milky appearance of bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
definition: Return of lavage fluid with a milky apperance due to the accumulation of a mixture of pulmonary surfactant, which is a lipoprotein complex, in the alveolar space.

name: Bloody bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
label: Bloody bronchoalveolar lavage fluid
definition: Return of lavage fluid characteristically has a bloody apperance in pulmonary alveolar hemorrhage. This is due to admixture of blood, which typically increases with each consecutive lavage portion. Microscopically erythrocytes can be seen. After 24 to 48 h macrophages contain phagocytosed erythrocytes, indicating previous bleeding.

name: Elevated circulating 5-oxoproline concentration
label: Elevated circulating 5-oxoproline concentration
definition: Concentration of L-pyroglutamic acid in the blood is above the normal range.

name: Submandibular lymph node enlargement
label: Submandibular lymph node enlargement
definition: Increased size of the lymph nodes that are located beneath the mandible (lower jaw).

name: Elevated circulating suberic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating suberic acid concentration
definition: An increased concentration of suberic acid in the blood circulation. Suberic acid is an alpha,omega-dicarboxylic acid that is the 1,6-dicarboxy derivative of hexane.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 8 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 8 concentration
definition: An increased concentration of interleukin-8 in the circulation.

name: Elevated circulating aconitic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating aconitic acid concentration
definition: An increased concentration of aconitic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Torsion of appendix of testis
label: Torsion of appendix of testis
definition: The appendix testis or hydatid of Morgagni, is a vestigial remnant of the Mllerian duct located on the superior pole of the testicle between the testis and epididymis. Although this appendage has no vital function, it is present in 50% of males. Torsion of twisting of this vestigial remnant can be incredibly painful, but usually requires no medical intervention.

name: Spinal epidural abscess
label: Spinal epidural abscess
definition: Spinal epidural abscess (SEA) is caused by a suppurative infection in the epidural space. The mass effect ofthe abscess can compress and reduce blood flow to the spinal cord, conus medullaris, or cauda equina. Left untreated, the infection can lead to sensory loss,muscle weakness, visceral dysfunction, sepsis, and even death. Early diagnosis is essential to limit mor-bidity and neurologic injury.
