The classic triad of fever, axial pain, and neurological deficit occurs in as few as 13 percent of patients, highlighting the diagnosticchallenge associated with SEA.

name: Increased circulating cathepsin D level
label: Increased circulating cathepsin D level
definition: An increase in concentration of cathepsin D in the blood circulation.

name: Bilobed right lung
label: Bilobed right lung
definition: A developmental defect of pulmonary lobation characterized by the presence of only two lobes of the right lung.

name: Triggered by EBV infection
label: Triggered by EBV infection
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by infection by the Epstein-Barr virus.

name: Misalignment of the pulmonary veins
label: Misalignment of the pulmonary veins
definition: The term is commonly used to describe a putative abnormal location of pulmonary vein branches adjacent to pulmonary arteries within the same adventitial sheath. However, evidence has been provided that the vessels in question are not pulmonary veins, however represent dilated bronchial veins.

name: Hyperimidodipeptiduria
label: Hyperimidodipeptiduria
definition: Elevated levels of proline-containing dipeptides in urine.

name: Cystic acne
label: Cystic acne
definition: A severe type of acne characterized by the formation of cysts enclosing a mixture of keratin and sebum.

name: Radiculomegaly
label: Radiculomegaly
definition: Tooth root length more than 2 SD above mean, or subjectively apparently increased tooth root length.

name: Hypertrichotic hyperpigmented patch
label: Hypertrichotic hyperpigmented patch
definition: A large nonpalpable spot of the skin over 1 cm in dimension with increased pigmentation and increased hair growth.

name: Increased circulating selenium concentration
label: Increased circulating selenium concentration
definition: An increased concentration of selenium in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating selenium concentration
label: Decreased circulating selenium concentration
definition: An abnormally reduced concentration of selenium in the blood circulation.

name: Ballooning hepatocyte degeneration
label: Ballooning hepatocyte degeneration
definition: Swelling of the hepatocyte, rounding of its contour, and alteration of the cytoplasm, which takes on a reticulated, rarified, or flocculant quality. The cytoplasm of the ballooned hepatocytes often contains clumps of eosinophilic ropey material known as Mallory-Denk bodies (MDBs) or Mallory hyaline, which is composed of hyperphosphorylated misfolded intermediate filaments, ubiquitin, and ubiquitin-binding protein P62.

name: Perioral erythema
label: Perioral erythema
definition: Erythema (Redness of the skin caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin) localized to the region surrounding the mouth.

name: Perianal erythema
label: Perianal erythema
definition: Erythema (Redness of the skin caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin) localized to the region surrounding the anus.

name: Portal inflammation
label: Portal inflammation
definition: Infiltration of portal fields by inflammatory cells.

name: Hepatic lobular inflammation
label: Hepatic lobular inflammation
definition: Infiltration of inflammatory cells in lobules of the liver. A focus of lobular inflammation can be defined as two or more inflammatory cells (neutrophils, lymphocytes and other mononuclear cells, eosinophils and microgranulomas) within the lobule present within the sinusoids or surrounding injured hepatocytes (ballooned or apoptotic hepatocytes).

name: Triggered by viral infection
label: Triggered by viral infection
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by infection by a virus.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 10 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 10 concentration
definition: An elevation of the concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

name: Triceps hyporeflexia
label: Triceps hyporeflexia
definition: Reduced intensity of the triceps tendon reflex.

name: Biceps hyporeflexia
label: Biceps hyporeflexia
definition: Reduced intensity of the biceps tendon reflex.

name: Brachioradialis hyporeflexia
label: Brachioradialis hyporeflexia
definition: Reduced intensity of the brachioradialis tendon reflex.

name: Brachioradialis hyperreflexia
label: Brachioradialis hyperreflexia
definition: Increased intensity of the brachioradialis reflex.

name: Triceps hyperreflexia
label: Triceps hyperreflexia
definition: Increased intensity of the triceps reflex.

name: Biceps hyperreflexia
label: Biceps hyperreflexia
definition: Increased intensity of the biceps reflex.

name: Hyperactive Achilles reflex
label: Hyperactive Achilles reflex
definition: Increased intensity of the Achilles reflex.

name: Increased proportion autoreactive unresponsive CD21-/low B cells
label: Increased proportion autoreactive unresponsive CD21-/low B cells
definition: Increased proportion relative to B-lymphocytes of a subset of B lymphocytes characterized by dim/low levels of CD21, i.e., CD21-/low, in flow cytometry, and additionally enriched in autoreactive clones as determined for instance by clonse showing rheumatoid factor (anti-IgG) reactivity and antibodies recognizing cytoplasmic and to a lesser extent nuclear structures.

name: Alveolar capillary dysplasia
label: Alveolar capillary dysplasia
definition: A developmental defect of the alveolar airspace during cananicular lung development characterized by a decreased number of pulmonary capillaries located away from the alveolar epithelium, thickened alveolar septae, media hypertrophy of small pulmonary arteries and muscularization of distal arterioles, and in some cases lymphangiectasis.

name: Acinar dysplasia
label: Acinar dysplasia
definition: Arrest of lung development in the pseudoglandular stage (weeks 8 to 16 of human gestation) resulting in small sized lungs, predominantly composed of bronchial and bronchiolar structures embedded in abundant loose mesenchyme that is poorly vascularized. Acinar structures are essentially absent, with no significant formation of saccules and no alveoli.

name: Congenital alveolar dysplasia
label: Congenital alveolar dysplasia
definition: Arrest of lung development in the cananicular stage (weeks 18 to 26 of human gestation) resulting in simplified acinar spaces, frequently with abundant intervening mesenchyme and no alveoli. In later arrest growth stages early saccular formations may be seen. May resemble the lobular maldevelopment often seen in alveolar capillary dysplasia/misaligment of the pulmonary veins without vein misalignment or marked hypertensive changes of the pulmonary arteries.

name: Decreased total iron binding capacity
label: Decreased total iron binding capacity
definition: A reduction in the total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added. The latent (or free) iron binding capacity is the difference between the TIBC and the measured serum iron, corresponding to the transferrin not bound to iron, i.e., free iron binding capacity.

name: Abnormal total iron binding capacity
label: Abnormal total iron binding capacity
definition: Any deviation from the normal total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added.

name: Elevated urine suberic acid level
label: Elevated urine suberic acid level
definition: An increased in the level of suberic acid in the urine above the normal range. Suberic acid is an alpha,omega-dicarboxylic acid that is the 1,6-dicarboxy derivative of hexane.

name: Recurrent viral pneumonia
label: Recurrent viral pneumonia
definition: Increased susceptibility to viral pneumonia, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral pneumonias.

name: Obliterative abnormality of the renal glomerulus
label: Obliterative abnormality of the renal glomerulus

name: Glomerular hyalinosis
label: Glomerular hyalinosis
definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus. Distribution can include vascular pole, perihilar, tip or neither tip, perihilar or vascular.

name: Perihilar glomerular hyalinosis
label: Perihilar glomerular hyalinosis
definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the vascular pole/perihilum.

name: Glomerular hyalinosis at the tubular pole
label: Glomerular hyalinosis at the tubular pole
definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at the tip/tubular pole.

name: Glomerular hyalinosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
label: Glomerular hyalinosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material in the glomerulus at neither tip nor perihilar/vascular poles. Both the vascular and the tubular pole are present in the glomerular cross section.

name: 2-ethylhydracylic aciduria
label: 2-ethylhydracylic aciduria
definition: An increased concentration of 2-ethylhydracylic acid in the urine.

name: Increased CD4:CD8 ratio
label: Increased CD4:CD8 ratio
definition: An abnormal elevation of the relative proportion of CD4+ to CD8+ T cells.

name: Decreased CD4:CD8 ratio
label: Decreased CD4:CD8 ratio
definition: An abnormal reduction of the relative proportion of CD4+ to CD8+ T cells.

name: Abnormal glomerular parietal epithelial cell morphology
label: Abnormal glomerular parietal epithelial cell morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the parietal epithelial cells that line the inside of Bowman's capsule and form an inconspicuous sheet of flat epithelial cells in continuity with the proximal tubular epithelial cells at the urinary pole and with the podocytes at the vascular pole.

name: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hyperplasia
label: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hyperplasia
definition: Increased number of parietal epithelial cells lining Bowman's capsule. Hyperplasia leads to the cells being present in 2 or more layers, often with crowding and multilayering.

name: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hypertrophy
label: Glomerular parietal epithelial cell hypertrophy
definition: An abnormality of the glomerular parietal epithelial cells characterized by (1) Increased parietal epithelial cell size, with or without cytoplasmic protein droplets; or (2) enlarged nuclei with prominent nucleoli. Both features can be present

name: Bowman capsular hyaline drops
label: Bowman capsular hyaline drops
definition: An insudative accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material protruding from Bowman's capsule into the urinary space. Although not always evident by light microscopy, this material is located between Bowman's capsule and the parietal epithelial cells, in some cases associated with newly formed matrix material.

name: Glomerular synechial adhesion
label: Glomerular synechial adhesion
definition: An area of basement membrane continuity between the glomerular tuft and Bowman's capsule, without intervening crescent and not adjacent to an area of segmental sclerosis.

name: Triceps areflexia
label: Triceps areflexia
definition: Inability to elicit triceps tendon reflex.

name: Brachioradialis areflexia
label: Brachioradialis areflexia
definition: Inability to elicit brachioradialis tendon reflex.

name: Biceps areflexia
label: Biceps areflexia
definition: Inability to elicit biceps tendon reflex.

name: Abnormal glomerular mesangial cellularity
label: Abnormal glomerular mesangial cellularity
definition: Abnormal number of its constituent cells of the mesangium of the glomerulus of the kidney.

name: Abnormal glomerular mesangial matrix morphology
label: Abnormal glomerular mesangial matrix morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the glomerular matrix. Mesangial cells generate and embed in their own extracellular matrix. The mesangial matrix is different in composition from the glomerular basement membrane. Its constituents are type IV collagen (but only the alpha1 and alpha2 chains); type V collagen; laminin A, B1, and B2; and considerable amounts of fibronectin, heparan sulfate and chondroitin sulfate proteoglycans, entactin, and nidogen. Furthermore, small amounts of the proteoglycans decorin and biglycan are found in the mesangial matrix.

name: Paramesangial deposits
label: Paramesangial deposits
definition: Mesangial immune deposit located adjacent to the paramesangial glomerular basement membrane.

name: Mesangial hyaline deposition
label: Mesangial hyaline deposition
definition: Extracellular mesangial accumulation of moderately electron-dense, generally homogenous, amorphous-appearing extracellular material.

name: Difficulty descending stairs
label: Difficulty descending stairs
definition: Reduced ability to desscend stairs.

name: Cognitive fatigue
label: Cognitive fatigue
definition: A failure to sustain attention that requires self-motivation to optimize performance.

name: Visceral epithelial cell detachment
label: Visceral epithelial cell detachment
definition: Detachment of visceral epithelial cells (podocytes) from underlying glomerular basement membrane with intervening new loose basement membrane material (pale on Hematoxylin and eosin, periodic acid-Shiff, trichrome, or silver stain) forming a so-called 'halo'.

name: Podocyte microvillous transformation
label: Podocyte microvillous transformation
definition: Cytoplasmic projections into the urinary space from the luminal side of the podocyte.

name: Visceral epithelial cell capping
label: Visceral epithelial cell capping
definition: Layer of hypertrophied visceral epithelial cells overlying a sclerosed segment of the tuft of the glomerulus.

name: Elevated RV/TLC ratio
label: Elevated RV/TLC ratio
definition: An increase in the ratio of residual volume (RV) to total lung capacity (TLC) on pulmonary function testing. RV is the amount of air remaining aftermaximal expiration and TLC is the total amount of air in theungs at full inspiration. These volumes cannot be determined by spirometry, but can be measured by inert gas dilution, nitrogen washout, and (3) body plethysmography. An elevated RV/TLC can be interpreted as a sign of air trapping and hyperinflation.

name: Polyalveolar lobe
label: Polyalveolar lobe
definition: An elevation of the total count of alveoli as determined by microscopic point-counting of randomly taken lung sections, not secondary to abnormalities in number, size and structure of the airways. In polyaveolar lobe, the number of alveoli is generally increased three to fivefold.

name: Horseshoe lung
label: Horseshoe lung
definition: A horseshoe lung is an uncommon congenital abnormality caused by the partial fusion of the bases of both lungs behind the pericardial sac.

name: Pulmonary necrosis
label: Pulmonary necrosis
definition: Cellular death affecting one or more parts of the lung. Necrosis is caused by diverse external and internal factors which result in the unregulated digestion of cell components.

name: Glycogen accumulation in pulmonary interstitial cells
label: Glycogen accumulation in pulmonary interstitial cells
definition: Accumulation of immature interstitial cells containing abundant cytoplasmic glycogen defined by periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) positive cells.

name: Abnormal alveolar type II pneumocyte morphology
label: Abnormal alveolar type II pneumocyte morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of alveolar type 2 (ATII) cells.

name: Type II pneumocyte hypertrophy
label: Type II pneumocyte hypertrophy
definition: Increase in size of type II pneumocytes, characterized by qualitative morphologic alterations, including cuboidal shapes, increased nucleocytoplasmic ratio, enlarged nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and various alterations in their nuclear chromatin.

name: Pulmonary amyloidosis
label: Pulmonary amyloidosis
definition: Extracellular deposition in lung tissue of a proteinaceous material that, when stained with Congo red, demonstrates apple-green birefringence under polarized light and that has a distinct color when stained with sulfated Alcian blue. Viewed with electron microscopy, the amyloid deposits are seen to be composed of a beta-sheet fibrillar material. These nonbranching fibrils have a diameter of 7.5 to 10 nm and are the result of protein misfolding.

name: Multiple pulmonary interstitial hyalinized nodules
label: Multiple pulmonary interstitial hyalinized nodules
definition: Fibrosing nodules, consisting of either unilateral or bilateral central whorled deposits of lamellar collagen hyalin.

name: Focal substantia nigra T2 hyperintensity
label: Focal substantia nigra T2 hyperintensity
definition: Hyperintense lesion in the substantia nigra on magnetic resonance T2 imaging.

name: Nailfold capillary tortuosity
label: Nailfold capillary tortuosity
definition: An increased number of turns of the blood vessels of the nailfold with a charactereistic winded or twisted appearance of the blood vessels.

name: Elevated residual volume
label: Elevated residual volume
definition: Increase in the amount of air remaining in a person's lungs after full exhalation.

name: Palmar hyperlinearity
label: Palmar hyperlinearity
definition: Exaggerated skin markings (dermatoglyphics) on the palms of the hand.

name: Reduced circulating interferon gamma
label: Reduced circulating interferon gamma
definition: A reduction in the concentration of interferon gamma measured in the blood circulation.

name: Anorectal stricture
label: Anorectal stricture
definition: Narrowing of the anorectum associated with inflammation or scar tissue.

name: Congenital lobar overinflation
label: Congenital lobar overinflation
definition: A congenital malformation characterized by an overdistended segment of lung, affecting an party of a lobe or the entire one. It results in progressive overinflation of one or more lobes.

name: Pancolitis
label: Pancolitis
definition: Inflammation of the entire colon.

name: Delayed ability to walk with support
label: Delayed ability to walk with support
definition: A failure to achieve the ability to walk with support (cruise) at an appropriate developmental stage.

name: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy
label: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy
definition: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP) is a sudden, unexpected, witnessed or unwitnessed, non-traumatic and non-drowning death, occurring in benign circumstances, in an individual with epilepsy, with or without evidence for a seizure and excluding documented status epilepticus, in which postmortem examination has not revealed a cause of death.

name: Non-motor seizure
label: Non-motor seizure
definition: A seizure with clinical manifestation but without motor signs (other than possible behavior arrest) as its initial clinical manifestation. The electrographic onset may be generalized, focal, or unknown.

name: Livedo racemosa
label: Livedo racemosa
definition: Livedo racemosa describes a reddish-blue mottling of the skin in an irregular, reticular pattern. It differs from the more common livedo reticularis by its shape. Livedo racemosa consists of broken circular segments resulting in a seemingly larger pattern, as opposed to the fine, regular, complete network of livedo reticularis. Livedo racemosa results from permanent impairment of peripheral blood flow and, unlike livedo reticularis, it persists on warming.

name: Renal artery aneurysm
label: Renal artery aneurysm
definition: Increase in diameter of a segment of the renal artery that can be defined as a focal, isolated dilatation of all three layers of the arterial wall over 1.5 times the diameter of the disease-free proximal adjacent arterial segment.

name: Transphyseal fracture of the distal humerus
label: Transphyseal fracture of the distal humerus
definition: A fracture through the distal humeral physis that separates the entire distal humeral epiphysis from the metaphysis.

name: Absent platelet dense granules
label: Absent platelet dense granules
definition: Lack of platelet dense granules, a type of platelet organelles.

name: Enlarged platelet dense granules
label: Enlarged platelet dense granules
definition: Increased size of platelet dense granules.

name: Podocyte myelin figures
label: Podocyte myelin figures
definition: Lamellated intracytoplasmic lipid inclusions within podocytes.

name: Glomerular pseudocrescent
label: Glomerular pseudocrescent
definition: Visceral epithelial cell hyperplasia with resulting cellular crowding of the the urinary space. In contrast with true crescents, these proliferations lack inflammatory cells and fibrin. The cells are typically plump (not spindle-shaped) and often vacuolated, and Bowman's capsule is usually intact.

name: Abnormal glomerular capillary lumen morphology
label: Abnormal glomerular capillary lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the capillary of the renal glomerulus.

name: Deflation of the glomerular tuft
label: Deflation of the glomerular tuft
definition: Wrinkling and folding of the capillaries without epithelial cell (podocyte) hyperplasia (formerly called ischemic type of collapse) involving o 80% of the glomerular tuft. The wrinkling is generally made by small regular folds of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Glomerular capillary collapse
label: Glomerular capillary collapse
definition: Collapse is generally accompanied by other descriptors such as hypertrophy and hyperplasia of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, halo, protein droplets in podocytes and glomerular parietal epithelial cells (PECs).

name: Glomerular capillary congestion
label: Glomerular capillary congestion
definition: Global distention of glomerular capillaries with intraluminal intact red blood cells.

name: Glomerular capillary microaneurysm
label: Glomerular capillary microaneurysm
definition: Glomerular capillary dilatation due to loosening/detachment of the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) from its anchoring points, usually in the context of mesangiolysis or nodular glomerulosclerosis.

name: Abnormal glomerular endothelial cell morphology
label: Abnormal glomerular endothelial cell morphology
definition: An abnormal structure of the glomerular endothelial cells, which are highly specialized cells with fenestrae and a charged luminal glycocalyx layer that contribute to the filtration barrier.

name: Loss of glomerular endothelial cell fenestration
label: Loss of glomerular endothelial cell fenestration
definition: Loss of round to oval discontinuities normally present in the glomerular capillary endothelial cell cytoplasm.

name: Glomerular endotheliosis
label: Glomerular endotheliosis
definition: Enlargement of glomerular endothelial cells by cytoplasmic swelling with resulting partial or complete occlusion of the lumen.

name: Glomerular endothelial tubuloreticular inclusion
label: Glomerular endothelial tubuloreticular inclusion
definition: Inter-anastomosing tubular structures located within cisternae of endoplasmic reticulum, most often within endothelial cells and associated with exposure to interferon.

name: Glomerular fibrinoid necrosis
label: Glomerular fibrinoid necrosis
definition: Fibrin associated with glomerular basement membrane disruption and/or lysis of the mesangial matrix; this lesion does not require the presence of karyorrhexis.

name: Reduced CD95-induced lymphocyte apoptosis
label: Reduced CD95-induced lymphocyte apoptosis
definition: Reduced amount of programmed cell death in peripheral blood lymphocytes following exposure to CD95 (APO-1/Fas), which is a member of the death receptor family, a subfamily of the TNF-R superfamily. Crosslinking of CD95 with its natural ligand CD95L (CD178) or with agonistic antibodies such as anti-APO-1 induces apoptosis in sensitive cells.

name: Enterocutaneous fistula
label: Enterocutaneous fistula
definition: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the intra-abdominal intestinal tract and the skin.

name: Paratracheal lymphadenopathy
label: Paratracheal lymphadenopathy
definition: Enlargement of lymph nodes surrounding the trachea.

name: Circulating nucleated red blood cells
label: Circulating nucleated red blood cells
definition: The presence of nucleated red blood cells in the peripheral blood circulation.

name: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane morphology
label: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane morphology
definition: Any abnormal sttructure of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Segmentally thickened glomerular basement membrane
label: Segmentally thickened glomerular basement membrane
definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting a segmental and increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by EM. Thickening is measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to an increase in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations greater than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals.

name: Diffusely thickened glomerular basement membrane
label: Diffusely thickened glomerular basement membrane
definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting an diffuse and relativly uniform increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by EM. Thickening is measured from endothelial to visceral epithelial plasma membrane and mainly attributable to an increase in thickness of the lamina densa, generally to an overall thickness more than 2 standard deviations greater than that of the normal mean GBM thickness for health age- and sex matched individuals.

name: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with no electron dense deposits
label: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with no electron dense deposits
definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with no evidence of electron dense deposits by electron microscopy.

name: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with electron dense deposits
label: Thickened glomerular basement membranes with electron dense deposits

name: Glomerular basement membrane lucencies
label: Glomerular basement membrane lucencies
definition: Lucent zones within the glomerular basement membranes. May reflect remote/resolved deposits.

name: Glomerular basement membrane wrinkling
label: Glomerular basement membrane wrinkling
definition: Irregular folding of the glomerular basement membrane with an intact lamina densa.

name: Glomerular subendothelial widening
label: Glomerular subendothelial widening
definition: Expansion of the space between the glomerular endothelium and lamina densa by electron-lucent material.

name: Glomerular karyhorrhectic debris
label: Glomerular karyhorrhectic debris
definition: Apoptotic, pyknotic, and fragmented nuclei within the glomerulus.

name: Glomerular fibrin thrombus
label: Glomerular fibrin thrombus
definition: An aggregate of coagulated blood containing fibrin, with or without entrapped cellular elements, within a glomerular capillary lumen.

name: Glomerular hyaline pseudothrombus
label: Glomerular hyaline pseudothrombus
definition: Intracapillary amorphous, eosinophilic material consisting of immune deposits.

name: Glomerular lipoprotein thrombus
label: Glomerular lipoprotein thrombus
definition: Intracapillary silver-positive material that is finely vacuolated and laminated, and stains with oil red O on frozen sections.

name: Mesangial Immune complex deposition
label: Mesangial Immune complex deposition
definition: Extracellular meangial accumulation of finely granular material corresponding to immunoglobulin and/or complement by immunofluorescence/immunohistochemistry; most typically electron-dense although this may decrease with resorption of the deposit.

name: Binucleated visceral epithelial cells
label: Binucleated visceral epithelial cells
definition: Visceral epithelial cells with 2 nuclei. Can be observed on light or ultrastructral microscopy.

name: Multinucleated visceral epithelial cells
label: Multinucleated visceral epithelial cells
definition: Visceral epithelial cells with more than two nuclei. Can be observed on light or ultrastructral microscopy.

name: Abnormal circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of factor H-related protein 1 (FHR-1)

name: Reduced circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
label: Reduced circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
definition: Decreased level of circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
label: Increased circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration
definition: Elevated level of circulating complement factor H related protein 1 concentration in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating 1-methylhistidine concentration
label: Elevated circulating 1-methylhistidine concentration
definition: An abnormally increased level of 1-methylhistidine in the blood circulation. 1-methylhistidine is a derivative of L-histidine.

name: Elevated circulating 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated urinary monocarboxylic acid level
label: Elevated urinary monocarboxylic acid level
definition: Abnormally increased amount of a monocarboxylic acid in the urine. Monocarboxylic acids are molecules with one COOH functional group.

name: Elevated urine 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid level
label: Elevated urine 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid level
definition: Increased amount of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.

name: Abnormal circulating fetuin A concentration
label: Abnormal circulating fetuin A concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating fetuin A concentration
label: Decreased circulating fetuin A concentration
definition: A reduction below normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating fetuin A concentration
label: Increased circulating fetuin A concentration
definition: An elevation above normal of fetuin A in the blood circulation.

name: Patellar overgrowth
label: Patellar overgrowth
definition: Excessive growth of the kneecap (patella).

name: Ileoileal intussusception
label: Ileoileal intussusception
definition: A type of intussusception of the small intestine in which one part of the ileum invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the ileum.

name: Osmotic diarrhea
label: Osmotic diarrhea
definition: Osmotic diarrhea results from the presence of osmotically active, poorly absorbed solutes in the bowel lumen that inhibit normal water and electrolyte absorption.

name: Abdominal aortic dissection
label: Abdominal aortic dissection
definition: A tear in the intimal layer of the abdominal aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers.

name: Abnormal Bowman space morphology
label: Abnormal Bowman space morphology
definition: Structural anomaly located in Bowman's space, which represents the beginning of the urinary space and is contiguous with the proximal convoluted tubule of the nephron.

name: Urinary space collagenization
label: Urinary space collagenization
definition: Acellular collagenous matrix within Bowman's space, not associated with extracapillary hypercellularity or necrosis, associated with sclerosis or deflation of the tuft.

name: Visceral epithelial cell hyperplasia
label: Visceral epithelial cell hyperplasia
definition: Increased number of visceral epithelial cells (2 or more layers), often with crowding and multilayering, but without continuity with the parietal epithelium.

name: Visceral epithelial hyaline droplets
label: Visceral epithelial hyaline droplets
definition: Round to ovoid, Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, fuchsinophilic cytoplasmic inclusions within visceral epithelial cells.

name: Glomerular crescent formation
label: Glomerular crescent formation
definition: Glomerular crescent refers hyperplastic lesions involving 10% or more of the circumference of Bowman's capsule. Crescents can be composed of a variable mixture of epithelial/leukocyte hypercellularity, fibrous matrix, and fibrin.

name: Cellular crescent
label: Cellular crescent
definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary hypercellularity of greater than two cell layers and involving more than 10% of the capsular circumference, composed of greater than 75% cells with or without fibrin, and less than 25% fibrous matrix.

name: Fibrocellular crescent
label: Fibrocellular crescent
definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary hypercellularity of more than 2 cell layers and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference, composed of 25% to 75% cells with or without fibrin, and the remainder fibrous matrix.

name: Fibrous crescent
label: Fibrous crescent
definition: A type of glomerular crescent characterized by extracapillary fibrosis composed of greater than 75% matrix and of less than 25% cells with or without fibrin, usually associated with disruption of Bowman's capsule and involving over 10% of the capsular circumference.

name: Mesangial cell loss
label: Mesangial cell loss
definition: Loss of mesangial cells segmentally or globally.

name: Glomerular obsolescence
label: Glomerular obsolescence
definition: Globally sclerotic glomeruli are that are small and without hyalinosis and may appear with collapse of the tuft with collagenization of the urinary space. Bowman's capsule is completely or partially absent and there is no periglomerular fibrosis and glomerular size is decreased by more than 50% compared to all other glomeruli in the same biopsy. Obsolescent glomeruli may appear to be receding into the interstitium.

name: Glomerular capillary wall duplication without cellular interposition
label: Glomerular capillary wall duplication without cellular interposition
definition: Double contouring of the original glomerular basement membrane (GBM)/additional layer(s) of overlying basement membrane matrix, with or without endocapillary hypercellularity and no evidence of interposed migrated cells (mesangial, endothelial, monocytes) between the layers of original GBM and de novo GBM.

name: Glomerular capillary wall duplication with cellular interposition
label: Glomerular capillary wall duplication with cellular interposition
definition: Double contouring of the original glomerular basement membrane (GBM)/additional layer(s) of overlying basement membrane matrix with interposed migrated cells (mesangial, endothelial, monocytes) between the layers of original GBM and de novo GBM.

name: Elevated circulating homovanillic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating homovanillic acid concentration
definition: Increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating sebacic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating sebacic acid concentration
definition: Increased concentration of sebacic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating hydroxyphenlyllactic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating hydroxyphenlyllactic acid concentration
definition: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenlyllactic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Nail psoriasis
label: Nail psoriasis
definition: Psoriatic nail abnormality characterized by the presence of neutrophils in the nail bed epithelium, hyperkeratosis with parakeratosis, presence of exudates on the corneal epithelium, focal hypogranulosis and psoriasiform hyperplasia of the nail bed.

name: Type II pneumocyte hyperplasia
label: Type II pneumocyte hyperplasia
definition: Increase in the number of type II pneumocytes.

name: Abnormal postural reflex
label: Abnormal postural reflex
definition: Anomaly of the physiological response to maintain the body's posture when movement and position is altered.

name: Impaired neck-righting reflex
label: Impaired neck-righting reflex
definition: Abnormal neck-righting response, which is said to be a physiological response when a child is placed flat on his or her back and the head is turned 90 degrees to the right or the left. With a normal neck-righting response, there follows a reflected torsion of the vertebral column in the same direction as the induced rotation of the neck. That is, the whole body follows the direction in which the head was turned. The response is present from birth to the age of five years.

name: Acute phase response
label: Acute phase response
definition: Presence of one or more manifestations of the acute phase response. Acute phase proteins (APP) are blood proteins primarily synthesized by hepatocytes as part of the acute phase response (APR). The APR is part of the early-defense or innate immune system, which is triggered by different stimuli including trauma, infection, stress, neoplasia, and inflammation. The APR results in a complex systemic reaction with the goal of reestablishing homeostasis and promoting healing.

name: Elevated circulating amyloid A
label: Elevated circulating amyloid A
definition: An increased concentration of serum amyloid A in the blood circulation.

name: Jaw contracture
label: Jaw contracture
definition: Limitation of motion of the jaw due to structural changes in a muscle such as the massseter responsible for jaw movement.

name: Abnormal embryonic development
label: Abnormal embryonic development
definition: An anomaly in the development of the embryo, that is, of the early developmental stage of development that follows the fertilization of an egg by sperm.

name: Abnormal preimplantation embryonic development
label: Abnormal preimplantation embryonic development
definition: An anomaly in the development of the embryo in a stage prior to implantation.

name: Zygotic cleavage failure
label: Zygotic cleavage failure
definition: Failure of a fertilized oocyte to undergo the first round of cell division.

name: Abnormal gametogenesis
label: Abnormal gametogenesis
definition: An anomaly in the process by a a haploid cell is formed from a diploid cells through meiosis. In males, diploid spermatogonia produce two haploid cells (secondary spermatocytes) in meiosis I and four haploid spermatids in meiosis II. In females, primordial germ cells under meiosis II before birth to form primary oocytes. Once puberty cell begins, these cells form secondary oocytes through meiosis II.

name: Abnormal female meiosis
label: Abnormal female meiosis
definition: Anomalous oocyte meiosis

name: Increased circulating inosine concentration
label: Increased circulating inosine concentration
definition: An increased concentration of inosine in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating guanosine concentration
label: Increased circulating guanosine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of guanosine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating sitosterol concentration
label: Elevated circulating sitosterol concentration
definition: An increased concentration of beta-sitosterol in the blood circulation.

name: Anti-aquaporin 4 antibody positivity
label: Anti-aquaporin 4 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against aquaporin-4.

name: Mucoid diarrhea
label: Mucoid diarrhea
definition: Passage of an increased number of stools containing mucus, a thick fluid substance secreted by mucous membranes.

name: Pleural cobblestoning
label: Pleural cobblestoning
definition: A pleural cobblestone appearance characterized by irregular bumps surrounded by depressed lines in open lung biopsy. Caused by underlying scarring causing retraction of the interlobular septa where they insert on the pleura.

name: Neuralgia
label: Neuralgia
definition: Pain (An unpleasant sensory and emotional experience) along the course of a nerve.

name: Psychic epileptic aura
label: Psychic epileptic aura
definition: Aura with affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual phenomena including illusory or composite hallucinatory events.

name: Cognitive epileptic aura
label: Cognitive epileptic aura
definition: A purely subjective manifestation of an epileptic seizure pertaining to altered cognition.

name: Epileptic aura
label: Epileptic aura
definition: An epileptic aura is a purely subjective clinical manifestation of an epileptic seizure. If an epileptic aura is not followed by loss of awareness or propagation to a bilateral tonic-clonic seizure then it is a type of focal aware non-motor seizure.

name: Seizure cluster
label: Seizure cluster
definition: A fourfold or greater increase of usual seizure frequency within a 3-day period, where the patient demonstrates full recovery between seizure events within the cluster. The seizure cluster should be recognisable by the primary clinician, carer or patient.

name: Elevated forced expiratory volume in one second
label: Elevated forced expiratory volume in one second
definition: An increase in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second, compared to some standard or previous measure of same subject.

name: Candida esophagitis
label: Candida esophagitis
definition: Candida infections of the esophagus are considered opportunistic infections and are seen most commonly in immunosuppressed patients, the most common symptoms being dysphagia, odynophagia, and retrosternal pain.

name: Pulmonary hypertensive crisis
label: Pulmonary hypertensive crisis
definition: Pulmonary hypertensive crisis involves sudden and potentially lethal increases in PAP and PVR that cause acute rise in right atrial and right ventricular end-diastolic pressure accompanied by low cardiac output.

name: Abnormal blood vessel morphology
label: Abnormal blood vessel morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of a blood vessel (artery, arteriole, capillary, venule, or vein).

name: Abnormal urine metabolite level
label: Abnormal urine metabolite level
definition: Any deviation from the normal amount of a metabolite in urine.

name: Increased urine deoxypyridinoline level
label: Increased urine deoxypyridinoline level
definition: An increased level of deoxypyridinoline in the urine. Deoxypyridinoline is a crosslink product of collagen molecules found in bone and excreted in urine during bone degradation, has been described as a marker of bone turnover.

name: Elevated circulating o-phosphoserine concentration
label: Elevated circulating o-phosphoserine concentration
definition: An abnormally increased level of o-phosphoserine in the blood circulation. o-phosphoserine is a derivative of serine.

name: Limited head rotation
label: Limited head rotation
definition: Reduced range of motion turning the head side to side.

name: Abnormal urine osmolality
label: Abnormal urine osmolality
definition: A deviation from the normal range of concentration of particles in urine.

name: Hyperosthenuria
label: Hyperosthenuria
definition: An abnormally high urinary specific gravity, i.e., increased concentration of solutes in the urine.

name: Impaired ability to shift attention
label: Impaired ability to shift attention
definition: A behavioral abnormality whereby a person is unable to move freely from one situation, activity or aspect of aa problem to another as circumstances demand. Key aspects of shifting include the ability to make transitions, problem solve flexibly, switch or alternate attention, and change focus from one mind-set or topic to another. Mild deficits in the ability to shift compromise the efficiency of problem solving, whereas more severe difficulties are reflected in perseverative behaviors. Sometimes this is described as being rigid or inflexible.

name: Nasal ulcer
label: Nasal ulcer
definition: An open sore of the nasal mucosa.

name: Recurrent coughing spasms
label: Recurrent coughing spasms
definition: Repeated occurrence of episodes of coughing, with each episode consisting of at least five minutes of continuous coughing.

name: Hyaline membranes
label: Hyaline membranes
definition:
Hyaline membranes are homogeneous eosinophilic material composed of cellular debris, plasma proteins, and surfactant
plastered against alveolar ducts and alveolar walls. The hyaline membranes are deposited along the walls of the alveoli, where gas exchange typically occurs, thereby making gas exchange difficult.

name: Lipoid pneumonia
label: Lipoid pneumonia
definition: A specific form of lung inflammation that results from accumulation of lipids in the alveoli. Lipoid pneumonia can be either exogenous or endogenous in cause based on the source of the lipid.

name: Endogenous lipoid pneumonia
label: Endogenous lipoid pneumonia
definition: A type of lipoid pneumonia in which the source of the lipids is the body itself. When an airway is obstructed, it is often the case that distal to the obstruction, lipid-laden macrophages and giant cells fill the lumen of the disconnected airspace.

name: Exogenous lipoid pneumonia
label: Exogenous lipoid pneumonia
definition: A type of lipoid pneumonia in which the source of the lipids is external to the body.

name: Orthodeoxia
label: Orthodeoxia
definition: Low level of blood oxygen induced by changing from a recumbent to an upright position.

name: Platypnea
label: Platypnea
definition: A type of dyspnea that occurs when the affected person changes from a recumbent to an upright position.

name: Cavitating leukodystrophy
label: Cavitating leukodystrophy
definition: A type of leukodystrophy characterized by multiple small cavitations typically in the periventricular and deep cerebral white matter. The cavitations are visible as a central cavity with cerebrospinal fluid-like signal intensity.

name: Bronchial telangiectasia
label: Bronchial telangiectasia
definition: Telangiectasias (small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes) located in the trachoebronchial system.

name: Bronchocentric granulomatosis
label: Bronchocentric granulomatosis
definition: Granulomatous inflammation that surrounds the bronchi and bronchioles, replacing bronchial walls and mucosa. In bronchocentric granulomatosis, the lumen of the airway contains necrotic debris, and palisaded histiocytes surround the lumen.

name: Abnormal KCO
label: Abnormal KCO
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of KCO. The KCO is a measurement of the rate constant for alveolar uptake of CO during breath-holding in the single breath measurement of DLCO at full inflation. The DLCO is derived as the product of the KCO and the single breath alveolar volume (VA) divided by PB-PH2O.

name: Increased KCO
label: Increased KCO
definition: Increased diffusion capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide (CO) rate constant (efficiency index).

name: Decreased KCO
label: Decreased KCO
definition: Decreased diffusion capacity of the lung for carbon monoxide (CO) rate constant (efficiency index).

name: Anthracosis
label: Anthracosis
definition: Anthracosis is the deposition of black carbon pigment. It is commonly seen in perihilar lymph nodes as well as within lung parenchyma. There can be prominent storiforming (i.e., spiral patterning) of histiocytes, to such an extent as to mimic a neoplastic lesion histologically. Anthracosis is a common finding in smokers and polluted city dwellers.

name: Alveolar septal thickening
label: Alveolar septal thickening
definition: Increased width of the alveolar septum, which is the structure that separates neighboring alveoli. This finding can be appreciated on histology.

name: Increased airway neuroendocrine cells
label: Increased airway neuroendocrine cells
definition: Presence of increased numbers of bombesin-immuno-positive neuroendocrine cells (NECs) within distal airways. There are no formal criteria for an increase (which is also dependend on the sensitivity of the staining method), findings of neuroendocrine cells in at least 70% of bronchioles by lung biopsy and at least 10% NECs in an individual airway are consistent with the diagnosis of Neuroendocrine cell hyperplasia of infancy in the appropriate clinical setting. Increases are also seen in other clicnial settings. Neuroendocrine neoplasms of the lung encompass NE tumors (NETs), which split into typical and atypical carcinoids, and NE carcinomas (NECs).

name: Increased airway neuroepithelial bodies
label: Increased airway neuroepithelial bodies
definition: Presence of increased numbers of bombesin-immuno-positive neuroendocrine cell cluster (neuroepithelial bodies) in the alveolar ducts.

name: Bilateral superior vena cava
label: Bilateral superior vena cava
definition: The presence of a left and a right superior vena cava.

name: Nasal chondritis
label: Nasal chondritis
definition: Inflammation of the cartilage of the nose.

name: Elevated circulating stearoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating stearoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of O-stearoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating palmitoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating palmitoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Abnormally increased concentration of palmitoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased compound muscle action potential amplitude
label: Decreased compound muscle action potential amplitude
definition: Reduced level of the compound muscle action potential (CMAP), which is recorded following electrical stimulation of a nerve from surface electrodes overlying a muscle supplied by that nerve.

name: Elevated urinary collagen degradation products
label: Elevated urinary collagen degradation products
definition: Increased level in the urine of a metabolite that results from collagen degradation, e.g., a fragment of a collagen produced by a collagenase or serine protease.

name: Elevated urine pyridinoline level
label: Elevated urine pyridinoline level
definition: An increased amount of pyridinoline in the urine.

name: Abnormal circulating collagen degradation product concentration
label: Abnormal circulating collagen degradation product concentration
definition: Abnormal concentration in the blood circulation of a metabolite that results from collagen degradation, e.g., a fragment of a collagen produced by a collagenase or serine protease.

name: Elevated circulating pyridinoline concentration
label: Elevated circulating pyridinoline concentration
definition: An increased concentration of hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline (pyridinoline) in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal bronchial artery morphology
label: Abnormal bronchial artery morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of a bronchial artery.

name: Bronchopulmonary anastomosis
label: Bronchopulmonary anastomosis
definition: Abnormal arterial anastomosis (connection) between bronchial and pulmonary arteries.

name: Bronchial artery dilatation
label: Bronchial artery dilatation
definition: Increased caliber of a bronchial artery, which can be defined as a bronchial artery diameter that exceeds 2 mm.

name: Bronchial artery hypertrophy
label: Bronchial artery hypertrophy
definition: Increase in the volume of bronchial artery wall due to the enlargement of its component cells.

name: Perivascular pre-capillary pulmonary artery inflammation
label: Perivascular pre-capillary pulmonary artery inflammation
definition: Inflammatory cell infiltration surrounding precapillary pulmonary arteries (arterioles; 20-70 micrometer).

name: Irregularly shaped sperm tail
label: Irregularly shaped sperm tail
definition: Irregular or changing caliber (diameter) along the tail of the sperm.

name: Anti-carbonic anhydrase II antibody positivity
label: Anti-carbonic anhydrase II antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against carbonic anhydrase II.

name: Antilactoferrin antibody positivity
label: Antilactoferrin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against lactoferrin.

name: Glomerular extracapillary fibrin
label: Glomerular extracapillary fibrin
definition: Presence of ropey, eosinophilic material (brght red on Trichrome staining) consistent with extracapillary fibrin outside of capillary lumina.

name: Bowman-space proteinaceous debris
label: Bowman-space proteinaceous debris
definition: The presence of eosinophilic Periodic Acid Schiff (PAS)-positive cell free, protein-derived material occupying Bowman's space.

name: Pleural plaque
label: Pleural plaque
definition: Deposits of hyalinized collagen fibres in the parietal pleura (preferentially pleura adjacent to ribs, particularly the sixth through ninth ribs).

name: Persistent fever
label: Persistent fever
definition: Fever that persists longer than expected for an acute infectious disease. No precise threshold exists, and the clinical interpretation of fever is context-dependent, but as a rule of thumb, this term refers to fever that persists longer than 2-3 weeks.

name: Acute abdomen
label: Acute abdomen
definition: A sudden onset of abdominal pain with associated nausea or vomiting. The acute abdomen may be caused by an infection, inflammation, vascular occlusion, or obstruction.

name: Tissue ischemia
label: Tissue ischemia
definition: Ischemia is defined as a restriction of arterial blood supply to a tissue associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolis requirements of the tissue. Depending on the involved tissues, clinical manifestations may include pain, pallor, lack of pulse, coldness, paresthesia, and paralysis. Additional associated manifestations include hemodynamic parameters (reduced blood pressure distal to the site of restricted arterial supply) and angiographic evidence of arterial occclusion.

name: Digital ischemia
label: Digital ischemia
definition: Restriction of arterial blood supply to a digit (finger or toe) associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolic requirements of the digit. Clinical manifestations may include pain, pallor, lack of pulse, coldness, paresthesia, and paralysis.

name: Testicular ischemia
label: Testicular ischemia
definition: Restriction of arterial blood supply to a testis associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolic requirements of the digit. Clinical manifestations may include pain and swelling of the affected testis.

name: Intestinal ischemia
label: Intestinal ischemia
definition: Restriction of arterial blood supply to a testis associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolic requirements of the digit. Acute intestinal ischemia can involve the small or large intestine, and usually presents with sudden severe non-specific abdominal pain.

name: Abnormal circulating organic amino compound concentration
label: Abnormal circulating organic amino compound concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an organic amino compound, defined as a compound formally derived from ammonia by replacing one, two or three hydrogen atoms by organyl groups.

name: Elevated circulating o-phosphoethanolamine concentration
label: Elevated circulating o-phosphoethanolamine concentration
definition: An increased concentration of o-phosphoethanolamine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated urine acetoacetic acid level
label: Elevated urine acetoacetic acid level
definition: Elevated amount of acetoacetic acid in the urine.

name: Elevated circulating acetoacetic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating acetoacetic acid concentration
definition: An increased level of acetoacetic acid in the blood circulation. Acetoacetic acid is one of the predominant ketone bodies.

name: Elevated urinary 2-hydroxybutyric acid
label: Elevated urinary 2-hydroxybutyric acid
definition: An increased amount of 2-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Elevated circulating cartilage oligomeric matrix protein concentration
label: Elevated circulating cartilage oligomeric matrix protein concentration
definition: An increased blood concentration of cartilage oligomeric matrix protein (COMP).

name: Lower extremity akinesia
label: Lower extremity akinesia
definition: Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily in the lower extremities.

name: Upper extremity akinesia
label: Upper extremity akinesia
definition: Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily in the upper extremities.

name: Upper extremity hypokinesia
label: Upper extremity hypokinesia
definition: Abnormally diminished movement of the upper extremities. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.

name: Lower extremity hypokinesia
label: Lower extremity hypokinesia
definition: Abnormally diminished movement of the lower extremities. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.

name: Cardiac tamponade
label: Cardiac tamponade
definition: The accumulation of pericardial fluid with subsequent compression of all cardiac chambers which prevents cardiac filling.

name: Hip adductor weakness
label: Hip adductor weakness
definition: Reduced ability to bring the leg toward the midline of the body.

name: Elevated circulating hydroxybutyric acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating hydroxybutyric acid concentration
definition: An increased concentration in the blood circulation of a hydroxybutyric acid, that is, of a compound comprising a butyric acid core carrying at least one hydroxy substituent.

name: Elevated circulating 2-hydroxybutyric acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating 2-hydroxybutyric acid concentration
definition: Elevation of the 2-hydroxybutyric acid concentration in the blood above the normal range.

name: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxybutyric acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxybutyric acid concentration
definition: Elevation of the 3-hydroxybutyric acid concentration in the blood above the normal range.

name: Pulmonary arterial plexiform lesion
label: Pulmonary arterial plexiform lesion
definition: Focal proliferation of pulmonary artery endothelial cells, leading to the formation of complex capillary-like channels.

name: Pulmonary artery intimal thickening
label: Pulmonary artery intimal thickening
definition: Increased thickness of the intimal layer of the pulmonary artery. Throughout the pulmonary arterial tree, the thin intima consists of a non-fenestrated monolayer of endothelial cells lining the vessel lumen, as well as a sub-endothelial interstitium that extends to the internal elastic lamina. Intimal thickness in human lung ranges from 1-16% of total wall thickness. Pulmonary artery intimal thickening can be defined as a relative intima thickness to the thickness of the vessel wall of over 10%.

name: Pulmonary artery adventitial fibrosis
label: Pulmonary artery adventitial fibrosis
definition: Increased amount of collagen, proteoglycans, and other extracellular matrix proteins resulting in scarring and thickening in the adventia of the pulmonary arterial tree.

name: Pulmonary arterial hypertension with positive acute response to NO challenge
label: Pulmonary arterial hypertension with positive acute response to NO challenge
definition: A form of pulmonary arterial hypertension in which there is a reduction of mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) at leasy 10 mmHg to reach an absolute value of mPAP not more than 40 mmHg with an increased or unchanged cardiac output (CO) in response to inhaled nitric oxide at 10-20 ppm.

name: Pulmonary arterial hypertension with lack of acute response to NO challenge
label: Pulmonary arterial hypertension with lack of acute response to NO challenge
definition: A form of pulmonary arterial hypertension with lack of adequate hemodynamic response to NO challenge (adequate response is defined as a reduction of mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) of at least 10 mmHg to reach an absolute value of mPAP 40 mmHg or less with an increased or unchanged cardiac output (CO) in response to inhaled nitric oxide at 10-20 ppm).

name: Periungual erythema
label: Periungual erythema
definition: Erythema (redness of the skin caused by hyperemia in superficial capillaries) in the region surrounding a fingernail or toe nail.

name: Pulmonary air embolism
label: Pulmonary air embolism
definition: Venous air embolism is a consequence of air being introduced into the venous circulation, and subsequently to the right heart, and pulmonary circulation. When small amounts of air reach pulmonary circulation they can be removed by gas diffusion across the arteriolar wall into the alveoli, amounts of gas exceeding 50 ml can cause pulmonary outflow tract obstruction with or without concomitant arterial embolisation.

name: Pulmonary capillary angioectasia
label: Pulmonary capillary angioectasia
definition: Focal accumulation of dilated pulmonary capillaries.

name: Systemic autoinflammation
label: Systemic autoinflammation
definition: Dysregulation of the innate immune system characterized by systemic pathobiology, i.e., with symptoms that can affect the entire body.

name: Neuroinflammation
label: Neuroinflammation
definition: Activation of the brain's innate immune system in response to an inflammatory challenge and is characterized by a host of cellular and molecular changes within the brain.

name: Non-infectious meningitis
label: Non-infectious meningitis
definition: Inflammation of the layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord (meninges) and of the fluid-filled space between the meninges (subarachnoid space) when it is caused by disorders that are not infections or by drugs or vaccines.

name: Cytomegalovirus colitis
label: Cytomegalovirus colitis
definition: A form of cytomegalovirus infection characterized by infection and inflammation of the colon.

name: Ileocecal ulcer
label: Ileocecal ulcer
definition: An erosion of the mucous membrane in the region connecting the ileum and cecum.

name: Nasal septum perforation
label: Nasal septum perforation
definition: A full-thickness defect of the nasal septum.

name: Abnormal circulating keto acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating keto acid concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of a keto acid in the blood circulation. Keto acids or ketoacids are organic compounds that contain a carboxylic acid group and a ketone group.

name: Elevated circulating 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid concentration
label: Elevated circulating 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid concentration
definition: Abnormal increase of the concentration of 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating myoglobin concentration
label: Elevated circulating myoglobin concentration
definition: An increased blood concentration of myoglobin.

name: Elevated circulating decenoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating decenoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of decenoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating octenoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating octenoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of octenoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating hexanoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating hexanoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of hexanoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating glutarylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating glutarylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of glutarylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating propionylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating propionylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of propionylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating dodecanoylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating dodecanoylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of dodecanoylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating acylcarnitine concentration
label: Reduced circulating acylcarnitine concentration
definition: An abnormally reduced concentration in the blood circulation of acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.

name: Elevated circulating butyrylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating butyrylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of O-butyrylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating isovalerylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating isovalerylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of O-isovalerylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Increased mid-arm muscle circumference
label: Increased mid-arm muscle circumference
definition: Elevation of the midupper arm circumference midway between the acromion and olecranon processes of the ulna with the use of a steel or fiberglass tape. This measure is a proxy for the muscle mass of the upper arm and can be used as a part of the assessment of nutritional status in children.

name: Decreased mid-arm muscle circumference
label: Decreased mid-arm muscle circumference
definition: Reduction of the midupper arm circumference midway between the acromion and olecranon processes of the ulna with the use of a steel or fiberglass tape. This measure is a proxy for the muscle mass of the upper arm and can be used as a part of the assessment of nutritional status in children.

name: Abnormal circulating prealbumin concentration
label: Abnormal circulating prealbumin concentration
definition: Any deviation from normal concentration of albumin in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating prealbumin concentration
label: Increased circulating prealbumin concentration
definition: An elevation above the normal concentration of prealbumin in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating prealbumin concentration
label: Decreased circulating prealbumin concentration
definition: A reduction from the normal concentration of prealbumin in the blood circulation.

name: Limited neck extension
label: Limited neck extension
definition: Reduced abilty to move the head back towards the ceiling so that one is looking upwards.

name: Tube feeding
label: Tube feeding
definition: Feeding problem necessitating food and nutrient delivery via a tube.

name: Elevated urinary dicarboxylic acid level
label: Elevated urinary dicarboxylic acid level
definition: Increased amount of a dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urine keto acid level
label: Elevated urine keto acid level
definition: Increased amount of a keta acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urine 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid level
label: Elevated urine 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid level
definition: Increased amount of 3-methyl-2-oxovaleric acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urine 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid level
label: Elevated urine 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid level
definition: Increased amount of 4-methyl-2-oxopentanoic acid in the urine.

name: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein concentration
label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein concentration
definition: Reduced concentration in the blood circulation of a lipid-transport protein (apoliprotein).

name: Increased circulating apolipoprotein circulation
label: Increased circulating apolipoprotein circulation
definition: Elevated concentration in the blood circulation of a lipid-transport protein (apoliprotein).

name: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxylinoleylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxylinoleylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of 3-hydroxylinoleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating oleylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating oleylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of oleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxypalmitoleylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating 3-hydroxypalmitoleylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of 3-hydroxypalmitoleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating tetradecanolycarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating tetradecanolycarnitine concentration
definition: Elevated circulating tetradecanoyl concentration.

name: Weak grip
label: Weak grip
definition: Reduced grip strength. Gripping is the motion by which the hand tightly grasps an object or other hand.

name: Low 10-minute APGAR score
label: Low 10-minute APGAR score
definition: A normal APGAR score can be coded as 'not Low 10-minute APGAR score'.

name: Limited shoulder abduction
label: Limited shoulder abduction
definition: Decreased ability to move the arm away from the midline of the body.

name: Extractable nuclear antigen positivity
label: Extractable nuclear antigen positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against extractable nuclear components that are referred to as extractable because they can be extracted from cell nuclei with saline solution.

name: Abnormal circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
label: Abnormal circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of lipoprotein lipase in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
label: Increased circulating lipoprotein lipase concentration
definition: Increased concentration of lipoprotein lipase in the blood circulation.

name: Hypobilirubinemia
label: Hypobilirubinemia
definition: Decreased circulation of bilirubin in the blood circulation.

name: Limited lateral neck flexion
label: Limited lateral neck flexion
definition: Reduced range of motion resulting in decreased ability to move the ear toward the top of the shoulder.

name: Limited shoulder flexion
label: Limited shoulder flexion
definition: A reduced ability to flex the shoulder. Shoulder flexion is the motion that moves the arms from a resting position by the side of the body to a position above the head.

name: Podocyte infolding
label: Podocyte infolding
definition: Folding of cytoplasmic processes of podocytes into the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) with thickening of the lamina densa and microspheres and/or microtubular structures within the GBM.

name: Elevated circulating linoleylcarnitine concentration
label: Elevated circulating linoleylcarnitine concentration
definition: Increased concentration of linoleylcarnitine in the blood circulation.

name: Glomerular basement membrane disruption
label: Glomerular basement membrane disruption
definition: A point of rupture in the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) where the discontinuous portions of GBM are still identifiable with a basement membrane stain such as Periodic acid Schiff (PAS) or silver.

name: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane texture
label: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane texture
definition: Anomalous appearance or structure of the surface of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Glomerular basement membranes powdery deposit
label: Glomerular basement membranes powdery deposit
definition: Punctate electron-dense material typically in a band-like distribution along the lamina rara interna and within tubular basement membranes within the subendothelial aspect of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Glomerular endocapillary leukocyte hypercellularity
label: Glomerular endocapillary leukocyte hypercellularity
definition: Increased number of leukocytes internal to the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), but not limited to within glomerular capillaries.

name: Glomerular endocapillary neutrophil hypercellularity
label: Glomerular endocapillary neutrophil hypercellularity
definition: Increased number of neutrophils internal to the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), but not limited to within glomerular capillaries.

name: Glomerular endocapillary foam-cell hypercellularity
label: Glomerular endocapillary foam-cell hypercellularity
definition: Presence of lipid-filled cells, often a macrophage, with a vacuolated appearance in the glomerulus often occupying the endocapillary space.

name: Global mesangial sclerosis
label: Global mesangial sclerosis
definition: A generalized global (over 80%) increase of mesangial matrix that is present throughout the mesangial stalk (with or without associated mesangial hypercellularity).

name: Podocyte cytoskeletal condensation
label: Podocyte cytoskeletal condensation
definition: Reorganization of podocyte cytoskeletal proteins at the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) aspect of the cell, with associated cytoplasmic electron density at the GBM aspect of the podocyte.

name: Mesangial matrix expansion
label: Mesangial matrix expansion
definition: Increased mesangial extracellular material with interspace width of over 2 mesangial cell nuclei, in one or more peripheral mesangial areas.

name: Glomerular basement membrane amyloid spicule
label: Glomerular basement membrane amyloid spicule
definition: Amyloid spicules are projections of typically silver-positive material from the outer aspect of the glomerular capillary wall, perpendicular to the glomerular basement membrane (GBM), most often caused by amyloidosis with the latter confirmed by additional stains.

name: Segmental glomerulosclerosis
label: Segmental glomerulosclerosis
definition: Segmental solidification of the glomerular tuft by increased extracellular matrix, causing glomerular capillary obliteration and can include hyalinosis, foam cells, hypertrophy of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, podocyte depletion, halo and adhesion of the tuft to the Bowman capsule.

name: Perihilar segmental glomerulosclerosis
label: Perihilar segmental glomerulosclerosis
definition: Segmental solidification of the glomerular tuft by increased extracellular matrix, causing glomerular capillary obliteration is present at the vascular pole, involving less than 50% of the tuft. It can be accompanied by other descriptors such as hyalinosis, foam cells, hypertrophy of overlying glomerular epithelial cells, podocyte depletion, halo and adhesion of the tuft to the Bowman's capsule.

name: Tip variant segmental glomerulosclerosis
label: Tip variant segmental glomerulosclerosis
definition: Segmental solidification of the glomerular tuft characterized by an adhesion at the tip of the glomerular tuft abutting the proximal tubular taek-off can be accompanied by increased extracellular matrix, causing glomerular capillary obliteration at the glomerular tip. Features including hyalinosis, foam cells, hypertrophy of overlying glomerular epithelial cells can also be observed.

name: Segmental glomerulosclerosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
label: Segmental glomerulosclerosis away from the vascular and tubular poles
definition: Segmental solidification of the glomerular tuft characterized by increased extracellular matrix, causing glomerular capillary obliteration at neirhter the tubular or vascular poles. Features including hyalinosis, foam cells, hypertrophy of overlying glomerular epithelial cells can also be observed.

name: Glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
label: Glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
definition: Electron-dense deposits in the lamina densa with a ribbon or a sausage structure.

name: Subendothelial glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
label: Subendothelial glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
definition: Electron dense deposits in the glomerular basement membrane (GBM) subendothelial space associated with a prominent GBM reflecting an increase in thickness. This feature can be associated with GBM remodeling along the endothelial aspect.

name: Subepithelial glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
label: Subepithelial glomerular basement membrane electron dense deposits
definition: Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM) reflecting a diffuse and relativly uniform increase in thickness (subjective estimate) with exogenous material deposited between the outer (epithelial) aspect of the GBM and the visceral epithelial cell, with varying degrees of incorporation into the GBM.

name: Abnormal esterified to free carnitine ratio
label: Abnormal esterified to free carnitine ratio
definition: Any deviation from the normal ratio of acylcarnitine (i.e., esterified carnitine) to free carnitine.

name: Elevated CSF fumarate
label: Elevated CSF fumarate
definition: An increased concentration of fumarate, an intermediate in the citric acid cycle, in the cebrebrospinal fluid.

name: Elevated circulating fumarate concentration
label: Elevated circulating fumarate concentration
definition: An increased concentration of fumarate, an intermediate in the citric acid cycle, in the blood circulation.

name: Livedo reticularis
label: Livedo reticularis
definition: Livedo reticularis is characterized by the presence of a bluish purple, mottled or netlike pattern in unbroken circles on the skin. Exposure to cold environments usually intensifies the vascular pattern. Presumably, the condition results from slow or stagnant blood flow, vessel-wall pathology, and decreased oxygen tension.

name: Increased esterified to free carnitine ratio
label: Increased esterified to free carnitine ratio
definition: An elevated ratio of acylcarnitine (i.e., esterified carnitine) to free carnitine.

name: Decreased esterified to free carnitine ratio
label: Decreased esterified to free carnitine ratio
definition: A reduced ratio of acylcarnitine (i.e., esterified carnitine) to free carnitine.

name: EBV meningitis
label: EBV meningitis
definition: Inflammation of the meninges related to infection by Epstein-Barr virus.

name: EBV encephalitis
label: EBV encephalitis
definition: Inflamation of the brain related to infection by Epstein-Barr virus.

name: Cutaneous horn
label: Cutaneous horn
definition: A cutaneous horn is a keratinized non-malignant protrusion on the surface of the skin. Diagnosis is established by biopsy of the horn and biopsy of the horn and the underlying skin.

name: Drug addiction
label: Drug addiction
definition: Chronic compulsive drug seeking and continued use despite harmful consequences.

name: Stimulant addiction
label: Stimulant addiction
definition: Addiction to a stimulant drug, defined as a drug that typically increases alertness, attention and energy while also elevating blood pressure, heart rate and breathing.

name: Cocaine addiction
label: Cocaine addiction
