label: Cross bite
definition: Lingual occlusion of buccal cusps and/or incisal edge of maxillary teeth to the buccal cusps and/or incisal edge of mandibular teeth.

name: Triggered by food ingestion
label: Triggered by food ingestion
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating a certain food.

name: Acral overgrowth
label: Acral overgrowth
definition: Excessive growth of hands and feet (predominantly due to soft tissue swelling). Typical manifestations include shoe size increase, foot enlargment, glove tightness, and hand enlargement.

name: Abnormal leukocyte physiology
label: Abnormal leukocyte physiology
definition: A functional abnormality of a white blood cell.

name: Leukocyte migration defect
label: Leukocyte migration defect
definition: Any abnormality of leukocyte motility in response to chemokines, which is required for the inflammatory response to infections, and for organ development, tissues homeostasis, and vascularization.

name: Impaired leukocyte adhesion
label: Impaired leukocyte adhesion
definition: During states of inflammation, white blood cells (leukocytes) play a key role in maintaining tissue homeostasis through elimination of pathogens and removal of damaged tissue. Leukocytes migrate to the site of inflammation by crawling over and through the blood vessel wall, into the tissue. This term refers to a defect in the attachment of leukocytes to the blood vessel wall, which is a key step required before they can pass through gaps of the endothelial cells of the blood vessel wall to migrate to the site of inflammation.

name: Abnormal circulating sex hormone concentration
label: Abnormal circulating sex hormone concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sex hormone in the blood circulation

name: Blistering by anatomical location
label: Blistering by anatomical location
definition: Blistering (presence of multiple fluid filled blisters) categorized according to the body site where they occur.

name: Blistering by histological location
label: Blistering by histological location
definition: Blistering (presence of multiple fluid filled blisters) categorized according to the layer of the skin in which the blister originates. The skin is divided into three layers. The epidermis (outermost layer, which mainly consists of keratinocytes), the dermis, and a subcutaneous layer. The epidermis is divided into five layers: the basal lamina (innermost layer), the basal cell layer, the stratum spinosum, the stratum granulosum, and the stratum corneum (outermost layer). Cleavage in epidermolysis bullosa (EB) simplex occurs within the basal keratinocytes; in junctional EB, within the lamina lucida; and in dystrophic EB occurs in the sublamina densa, in the upper portion of the dermis (papillary dermis). In Kindler's EB, cleavage can occur in the basal keratinocytes, in the lamina lucida, or below the lamina densa.

name: Intra-epidermal blistering
label: Intra-epidermal blistering
definition: A type of blistering in which the lesions are located within the epidermis with loss of cell-cell adhesion of keratinocytes. In simplex EB, cleave occurs in the basal layer, which is the innermost layer of the epidermis and consists of a single layer of basal germinative cells (mostly epidermal Keratinocytes) that proliferate and thereby produce new cells for other epidermal layers. As the cells move towards the upper layers of the epidermis they mature and eventually form cornified cells. The suprabasal cell layer lies directly above the basal layer and is composed of five to ten layers of cells.

name: Sub-lamina densa cleavage
label: Sub-lamina densa cleavage
definition: A type of blistering in which the cleavage plane of blisters is located below the lamina densa.

name: Subepidermal blistering
label: Subepidermal blistering
definition: A type of blistering in which the lesions are located beneath the epidermis.

name: Non-necrotizing granuloma
label: Non-necrotizing granuloma
definition: A granuloma which is not associated with necrotic changes.

name: Abnormal epidermis stratum granulosum morphology
label: Abnormal epidermis stratum granulosum morphology
definition: An abnormal structure of the stratum granulosum, which is is a thin layer of cells in the epidermis lying above the stratum spinosum and below the stratum corneum.

name: Absent keratohyalin granules
label: Absent keratohyalin granules
definition: Lack of keratohyalin granules, which are normally present in the stratum granulosum of the epidermal layer of the skin.

name: Spermatocele
label: Spermatocele
definition: A cystic structure arising from the epididymis, rete testis or efferent ductuli. These structures are filled with spermatozoa containing fluid that may be milky. These cysts are usually outside the tunica vaginalis and, as with hydrocele, transluminate easily.

name: Increased circulating 17 hydroxypregnenolone concentration
label: Increased circulating 17 hydroxypregnenolone concentration
definition: Increased concentration of 17alpha-hydroxypregnenolone in the blood circulation. 17alpha-hydroxypregnenolone is a 21-carbon steroid that is converted from pregnenolone by steroid 17-alpha-hydroxylase, as an intermediate in the biosynthesis of gonadal steroid hormones and adrenal corticosteroids.

name: Decreased circulating dihydrotestosterone concentration
label: Decreased circulating dihydrotestosterone concentration
definition: A reduced concentration of dihydrotestosterone in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating androstenedione concentration
label: Abnormal circulating androstenedione concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of androstenedione in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating androstenedione concentration
label: Decreased circulating androstenedione concentration
definition: Reduced concentration of androstenedione in the blood circulation.

name: Perilobular
label: Perilobular
definition: Situated or occurring around a lobe of an organ.

name: Paraseptal
label: Paraseptal
definition: Characterized by predominant involvement of the distal alveoli and their ducts and sacs. It is characteristically bounded by any pleural surface and the interlobular septa.

name: Bronchocentric
label: Bronchocentric
definition: Centered in bronchi or bronchioles.

name: Centrilobular
label: Centrilobular
definition: Located in the center of the secondary pulmonary lobules, which are the functional units of the lungs.

name: Miliary
label: Miliary
definition: Characterized by numerous small lesions said to resemble millet seed.

name: Reticular
label: Reticular
definition: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance resembles a net or network-like structure.

name: Perilymphatic
label: Perilymphatic
definition: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance are located at or near lymphatic structures (node or vessel).

name: Apical
label: Apical
definition: Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance are located at the apex of an organ. For instance, apical refers to the superior portion of the lung.

name: Pulmonary mass
label: Pulmonary mass
definition: A mass in the lung seen on chest imaging is defined as an opacity greater than 3 cm in diameter (without regard to contour, border, or density characteristics).

name: Mass on thoracic imaging
label: Mass on thoracic imaging
definition:
A mass is any pulmonary, pleural, or mediastinal lesion seen on chest radiographs as an opacity greater than 3 cm in diameter
(without regard to contour, border, or density characteristics). Mass usually implies a solid or partly solid opacity. CT allows more exact evaluation of size, location, attenuation, and other features.

name: Mediastinal mass
label: Mediastinal mass
definition: A mass in the mediastinum seen on chest imaging is defined as an opacity greater than 3 cm in diameter (without regard to contour, border, or density characteristics).

name: Pleural mass
label: Pleural mass
definition: A mass in the pleura seen on chest imaging is defined as an opacity greater than 3 cm in diameter (without regard to contour, border, or density characteristics).

name: Superior mediastinal mass
label: Superior mediastinal mass
definition: A type of mediastinal mass that is located above the thoracic plane (a horizontal line that runs from the manubriosternal joint (sternal angle or angle of Louis) to the inferior endplate of T4).

name: Inferior mediastinal mass
label: Inferior mediastinal mass
definition: A type of mediastinal mass that is located below the thoracic plane (a horizontal line that runs from the manubriosternal joint (sternal angle or angle of Louis) to the inferior endplate of T4).

name: Anterior mediastinal mass
label: Anterior mediastinal mass
definition: A type of inferior mediastinal mass that is located in front of the pericardium.

name: Middle mediastinal mass
label: Middle mediastinal mass
definition: A type of inferior mediastinal mass that is located withinthe pericardium.

name: Posterior mediastinal mass
label: Posterior mediastinal mass
definition: A type of inferior mediastinal mass that is located behind the pericardium.

name: Hyperdense pulmonary mass
label: Hyperdense pulmonary mass
definition: A type of pulmonary mass with high attenuation.

name: Cavitating pulmonary mass
label: Cavitating pulmonary mass
definition: Thick-walled abnormal gas-filled interstitial mass within a lung with a diameter greater than 30 mm.

name: Livedo
label: Livedo
definition: A reddish-blue mottled condition of skin caused by inflammation of the cutaneous blood vessels.

name: Elevated circulating soluble CD25 concentration
label: Elevated circulating soluble CD25 concentration
definition: Increased concentration of the interleukin-2 receptor alpha-chain (CD25) in the blood circulation. CD25 is shed upon immune activation. Increased levels of soluble CD25, therefore, are an indication of an on-going immune response.

name: Malaise
label: Malaise
definition: A feeling of general discomfort, weakness, or lack of health.

name: Abnormal renal vascular morphology
label: Abnormal renal vascular morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of a blood vessel in the kidney.

name: Abnormal intrarenal artery morphology
label: Abnormal intrarenal artery morphology
definition: An anomalous structure of an artery located in the kidney.

name: Abnormal arcuate artery morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate artery morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of the arc-shaped arteries located at the border of the renal cortex and renal medulla.

name: Dysphoria
label: Dysphoria
definition: A state of feeling very unhappy, uneasy, or dissatisfied.

name: Testicular pain
label: Testicular pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to one or both testes.

name: Postmenopausal bleeding
label: Postmenopausal bleeding
definition: Uterine bleeding that occurs after at least one year of amenorrhea in a woman who is not receiving hormone therapy.

name: Ocular pruritus
label: Ocular pruritus
definition: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching in the region of the eye.

name: Early satiety
label: Early satiety
definition: The condition of being unable to eat a full meal because of a feeling of fullness (satiety), or or feeling very full after eating only a small amount of food.

name: Postprandial fullness
label: Postprandial fullness
definition: Feeling excessively full after meals.

name: Tachyphrenia
label: Tachyphrenia
definition: The sensation that thoughts are moving too quickly.

name: Sense of impending doom
label: Sense of impending doom
definition: A feeling that something life-threatening or tragic is about to occur.

name: Spinal hypomyelination
label: Spinal hypomyelination
definition: Reduced amount of myelin in the spinal cord resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

name: Phantageusia
label: Phantageusia
definition: A form of altered taste sensation in which the affected person perceives a taste, usually an unpleasant one, in the absence of a corresponding stimulus in the environment.

name: Receptive aphasia
label: Receptive aphasia
definition: A type of aphasia that is characterized by impaired language comprehension.

name: Bilingual aphasia
label: Bilingual aphasia
definition: The term bilingual aphasia is used to refer to aphasia in persons who speak two or more languages. When a multilingual speaker has aphasia following a stroke, the languages spoken premorbidly may show comparable or differential patterns of impairment. Differential patterns may manifest as greater impairment in one language compared to another, or as differences in the characteristics of aphasia. Clinical reports of bilingual aphasia show dissociations in the processing of the language learned first (L1) and and second (L2), with one language more impaired than the other. Other cases show a pattern of differential recovery where L2 is recovered only after L1. Another pattern is alternating antagonism; i.e., patients access one language in spontaneous speech and inhibit the other language for alternating periods. This term should be used for a type of aphasia in a person who speaks multiple languages in which the impairment is different for different languages.

name: Coldness
label: Coldness
definition: Relative coldness of a body part to palpitation, often acccompanied by feelings of coldness.

name: Oculomotor synkinesis
label: Oculomotor synkinesis
definition: Elevation of the upper eyelid on attempted downward gaze or adduction, adduction of the eye on attempted upward or downward gaze, and constriction of the pupil on attempted adduction.

name: Abnormal intrarenal vein morphology
label: Abnormal intrarenal vein morphology
definition: Abnormal structure of a vein located inside the kidney parenchyma.

name: Abnormal arcuate vein morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate vein morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the arcuate vein. The arcuate veins cross traverse along the corticomedullary junction (at the border of the kideny cortex and medulla).

name: Abnormal interlobular vein morphology
label: Abnormal interlobular vein morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the interlobular veins of the kidney. An interlobular vein is surrounded by the renal cortex and located between renal lobules (consisting of the nephrons surrounding a single medullary ray and draining into a single collecting duct).

name: Abnormal interlobular vein lumen morphology
label: Abnormal interlobular vein lumen morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly located in the the inside space of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Cholesterol emboli within interlobular vein lumen
label: Cholesterol emboli within interlobular vein lumen
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of interlobular veins. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Intraluminal thrombi within interlobular veins
label: Intraluminal thrombi within interlobular veins
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding vascular lumen of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Organized thrombi within interlobular vein lumen
label: Organized thrombi within interlobular vein lumen
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Abnormal peritubular capillary morphology
label: Abnormal peritubular capillary morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of the capillaries that are derived from the efferent arteriole, forming a capillary network that surrounds the distal portions of the nephron tubule,

name: Abnormal cortical peritubular capillary morphology
label: Abnormal cortical peritubular capillary morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of the peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Multilamellation of cortical peritubular capillary basement membranes
label: Multilamellation of cortical peritubular capillary basement membranes
definition: Duplicated basement membranes of the peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney and arranged in multiple concentric layers.

name: Cortical peritubular capillaritis
label: Cortical peritubular capillaritis
definition: Inflammation of the peritubular capillaries in the cortex of the kidney characterized by Inflammatory cells in over 10 percent of the interstitial capillaries in the cortex with at least some capillaries having three or more luminal cells.

name: Abnormal cortical peritubular capillary lumen morphology
label: Abnormal cortical peritubular capillary lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the peritubular capillary in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Abnormal medullary peritubular capillary morphology
label: Abnormal medullary peritubular capillary morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of the peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney.

name: Medullary peritubular capillaritis
label: Medullary peritubular capillaritis
definition: Inflammation of the peritubular capillaries in the medulla of the kidney characterized by Inflammatory cells in over 10 percent of the interstitial capillaries in the cortex with at least some capillaries having three or more luminal cells.

name: Medullary peritubular capillary erythrocyte congestion
label: Medullary peritubular capillary erythrocyte congestion
definition: Substantially increased numbers of red blood cells within capillaries surrounding tubules in the medulla of the kidney. This feature is assessed in histological images as the presence of numerous erythrocytes in a segment of the capillary such that the vessel appears to be congested (not open).

name: Multilamellation of medullary peritubular capillary basement membranes
label: Multilamellation of medullary peritubular capillary basement membranes
definition: Duplicated basement membranes of the peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney and arranged in multiple concentric layers.

name: Abnormal medullary peritubular capillary lumen morphology
label: Abnormal medullary peritubular capillary lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the peritubular capillary in the medulla of the kidney.

name: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Medullary peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
label: Medullary peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the peritubular capillaries located in the medulla of the kidney.

name: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
label: Medullary peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the peritubular capillaries of the medulla of the kidney.

name: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Cortical peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
label: Cortical peritubular capillary intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the peritubular capillaries located in the cortex of the kidney.

name: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
label: Cortical peritubular capillary lumen organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the peritubular capillaries of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Abnormal arcuate vein lumen morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate vein lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of the arcuate vein of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Arcuate vein lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate veins of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Arcuate vein intraluminal thrombi
label: Arcuate vein intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein lumen organized thrombi
label: Arcuate vein lumen organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Abnormal arcuate vein intima/media morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate vein intima/media morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly located in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein intimal mucoid edema
label: Arcuate vein intimal mucoid edema
definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the inner layer (intima) of arcuate veins of the kidney. The material resembles mucus and appears pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

name: Arcuate vein intimal/medial myxomatous degeneration
label: Arcuate vein intimal/medial myxomatous degeneration
definition: Accumulation of myxoid material (mucus-like material) within the inner or middle layer of the arcuate vein of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein intima/medial amyloidosis
label: Arcuate vein intima/medial amyloidosis
definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney. Amyloidosis stains Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery morphology
label: Abnormal cortical radial artery morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the radial arteries that branch off at right angles from the arcuate artery and carry blood toward the cortex of the kidney.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery lumen morphology
label: Abnormal cortical radial artery lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space of the cortical radial arteries of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Cortical radial artery lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Abnormal arcuate artery intima/media morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate artery intima/media morphology
definition: Anomalous structure of the inner or middle layer of the arc-shaped arteries located at the border of the renal cortex and renal medulla.

name: Cortical radial artery intimal/medial amyloidosis
label: Cortical radial artery intimal/medial amyloidosis
definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the glomerular, interstitial or vascular compartments of the interlobular arteries of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery intima/media morphology
label: Abnormal cortical radial artery intima/media morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the inner or middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Abnormal renal arteriole morphology
label: Abnormal renal arteriole morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the glomerular arterioles. The interlobar arteries of the kidney branch into arcuate arteries, cortical radiate arteries, and then into afferent arterioles. After passing through the renal corpuscle, the capillaries form the efferent arteriole. The afferent and efferent arterioles are difficult to distinguish histologically and are thus both included in this term and its descendents.

name: Abnormal renal arteriole lumen morphology
label: Abnormal renal arteriole lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of renal arterioles.

name: Renal arteriolar lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Renal arteriolar lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arterioles of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Abnormal renal arteriole intima/media morphology
label: Abnormal renal arteriole intima/media morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly located in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriolar lumen organized thrombi
label: Renal arteriolar lumen organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriolar intraluminal thrombi
label: Renal arteriolar intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Abnormal renal arteriole endothelium morphology
label: Abnormal renal arteriole endothelium morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Abnormal arcuate artery lumen morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate artery lumen morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the interior space (lumen) of the arcuate artery of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery lumen cholesterol emboli
label: Arcuate artery lumen cholesterol emboli
definition: Needle-like or slit-like clefts within the interior space of arcuate arteries of the kidney. Cholesterol emboli are visualized as clear spaces (cholesterol clefts) where the cholesterol crystals have been dissolved by routine processing. Acute lesions can be accompanied by inflammation and fibrin.

name: Arcuate artery intraluminal thrombi
label: Arcuate artery intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding the vascular lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery lumen organized thrombi
label: Arcuate artery lumen organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containg fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels located within the lumen of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media amyloidosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media amyloidosis
definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of renal arterioles. Amyloidosis stains Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal arcuate artery endothelium morphology
label: Abnormal arcuate artery endothelium morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the lining (endothelium) of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery endotheliosis
label: Arcuate artery endotheliosis
definition: Enlargement of endothelial cells of the arcuate arteries of the kidney because of cytoplasmic swelling.

name: Arcuate artery endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Arcuate artery endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: Proliferation of endothelial cells (increased number of cells) of the lining (endothelium) of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media hyalinosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media hyalinosis
definition: Accumulation of amorphous, eosinophilic, glassy, periodic acid-Schiff (PAS)-positive, silver-negative material (hyalinosis) in the inner or middle layer of the renal arterioles. This feature may be accompanied by hypertrophy of the media and intima fibrosis.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
definition: Thickening of the intima of the arcuate arteries of the kidney with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

name: Renal intimal/medial arteriolitis
label: Renal intimal/medial arteriolitis
definition: Inflammation of an arteriole of the kidney, which may involve only the intma or can be transmural.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media arteriolosclerosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media arteriolosclerosis
definition: Thickening of the intima of renal arterioles with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

name: Renal arteriole medial atrophy
label: Renal arteriole medial atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of of the middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein medial hypertrophy
label: Arcuate vein medial hypertrophy
definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein medial atrophy
label: Arcuate vein medial atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery medial hypertrophy
label: Cortical radial artery medial hypertrophy
definition: Increased thickness of the middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery medial atrophy
label: Cortical radial artery medial atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal arteriitis
label: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal arteriitis
definition: Inflammation of a the intima or the entire wall of cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media amyloidosis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media amyloidosis
definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate arteries of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy.

name: Arcuate artery intimal mucoid edema
label: Arcuate artery intimal mucoid edema
definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in intima resembling mucus. This feature appears pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

name: Medial/intimal arcuate venosclerosis
label: Medial/intimal arcuate venosclerosis
definition: Thickening of the intima with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina in arcuate veins.

name: Arcuate intimal/medial venulitis
label: Arcuate intimal/medial venulitis
definition: Inflammation of arcuate veins of the kidney, which may involve only the intima or can be transmural.

name: Renal arteriole medial hypertrophy
label: Renal arteriole medial hypertrophy
definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Medial/intimal arcuate venulitis
label: Medial/intimal arcuate venulitis
definition: Inflammation of the inner or middle layer of arcuate venules. This feature may involve only the intima or it can be transmural.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media storage material accumulation
label: Renal arteriole intima/media storage material accumulation
definition: Deposition of storage material other than amyloid (glycogen, glycosphingolipid in Fabry's disease, sphingomyelin in Nieman Pick disease, glucosylceramide in Gaucher's disease, gangliosides, mucopolysaccahrides, phytanic acid in Refsum disease) in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: Abnormal and excessive number of cells (hypercellularity) in the lining (endothelium) of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: A type of renal arteriole endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased number of white blood cells (leukocytes).

name: Renal arteriole foam cell endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Renal arteriole foam cell endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often a macrophage, with a vacuolated appearance in arteriolar lumen.

name: Renal arteriole neutrophil endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Renal arteriole neutrophil endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils within the arteriolar lumen.

name: Renal arteriole lymphocyte endoarterial hypercellularity
label: Renal arteriole lymphocyte endoarterial hypercellularity
definition: A type of renal arteriole leukocytic endoarterial hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the arteriolar lumen.

name: Renal arteriole intimal/medial multilamellation
label: Renal arteriole intimal/medial multilamellation
definition: Myointimal hyperplasia arranged in multiple concentric layers in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity
label: Arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity
definition: Arcuate artery endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased numbers of white blood cells (leukocytes).

name: Arcuate artery endoarterial foam cell hypercellularity
label: Arcuate artery endoarterial foam cell hypercellularity
definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often a macrophage, with a vacuolated appearance in arteriolar lumen.

name: Arcuate artery endoarterial neutrophil hypercellularity
label: Arcuate artery endoarterial neutrophil hypercellularity
definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils withinin the lumen of arcuate artery.

name: Arcuate artery endoarterial lymphocyte hypercellularity
label: Arcuate artery endoarterial lymphocyte hypercellularity
definition: A type of arcuate artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the lumen of arcuate artery.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media necrosis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media necrosis
definition: Death of tissue in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate artery of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the necrotic tissue retains the outlines of the dead (necrotic) structures.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Arcuate vein intimal/medial storage material accumulation
label: Arcuate vein intimal/medial storage material accumulation
definition: Accumulation of material other than amyloid (glycogen, glycosphingolipid in Fabry's disease, sphingomyelin in Nieman Pick disease, glucosylceramide in Gaucher's disease, gangliosides, mucopolysaccahrides, phytanic acid in Refsum disease) in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis
label: Cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis
definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
label: Cortical radial artery intima/media liquefactive necrosis
definition: A type of cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
label: Cortical radial artery intima/media coagulative necrosis
definition: A type of cortical radial artery intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media necrosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media necrosis
definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media liquefactive necrosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media liquefactive necrosis
definition: A type of renal arteriole intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media coagulative necrosis
label: Renal arteriole intima/media coagulative necrosis
definition: A type of renal arteriole intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

name: Granulomatous arteriolitis of the arteriolar intima/media
label: Granulomatous arteriolitis of the arteriolar intima/media
definition: A type of renal intimal/medial arteriolitis characteriezed by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

name: Arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis
label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis
definition: Cell death (necrosis) of the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Arcuate vein medial/intimal coagulative necrosis
label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal coagulative necrosis
definition: A type of arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

name: Arcuate vein medial/intimal liquefactive necrosis
label: Arcuate vein medial/intimal liquefactive necrosis
definition: A type of arcuate vein medial/intimal necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Arcuate intimal/medial granulomatous venulitis
label: Arcuate intimal/medial granulomatous venulitis
definition: A type of arcuate intimal/medial venulitis characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed veins.

name: Arcuate vein intima/media crystal accumulation
label: Arcuate vein intima/media crystal accumulation
definition: Deposition of crystals such as uric acid, oxalate, or cystine in the inner or middle layer of the arcuate veins of the kidney.

name: Renal arteriole intima/media crystal accumulation
label: Renal arteriole intima/media crystal accumulation
definition: Deposition of crystals such as uric acid, oxalate, or cystine in the inner or middle layer of the arterioles of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriitis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media arteriitis
definition: Inflammation of the inner or middle layer of the arcuate arteries of the kidney.

name: Arcuate artery intima/media granulomatous arteriitis
label: Arcuate artery intima/media granulomatous arteriitis
definition: A type of arcuate artery intima/media granulomatous arteriitis characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

name: Cortical radial artery intraluminal thrombi
label: Cortical radial artery intraluminal thrombi
definition: Mixture of fibrin, red blood cells, platelets partly or completely occluding vascular lumen within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery intraluminal organized thrombi
label: Cortical radial artery intraluminal organized thrombi
definition: Thrombi containing fibrous tissue and capillary-like vascular channels within the interior space of cortical radial arteries (interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Abnormal cortical radial artery endothelium morphology
label: Abnormal cortical radial artery endothelium morphology
definition: Abnormal structural characteristics of the lining (endothelium) of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery endotheliosis
label: Cortical radial artery endotheliosis
definition: Enlargement of endothelial cells of the cortical radial arteries (also known as the interlobular arteries) of the kidney because of cytoplasmic swelling.

name: Cortical radial artery hypercellularity
label: Cortical radial artery hypercellularity
definition: Proliferation of endothelial cells (increased number of cells) of the lining (endothelium) of the cortical radial arteries (also known as interlobular arteries) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery leukocyte hypercellularity
label: Cortical radial artery leukocyte hypercellularity
definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial hypercellularity due to increased numbers of white blood cells (leukocytes).

name: Cortical radial artery lymphocyte hypercellularity
label: Cortical radial artery lymphocyte hypercellularity
definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased number of lymphocytes in the lumen of cortical radial arteries.

name: Cortical radial artery neutrophil hypercellularity
label: Cortical radial artery neutrophil hypercellularity
definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of increased numbers of neutrophils in the lumen of cortical radial arteries.

name: Cortical radial artery foam cell hypercellularity
label: Cortical radial artery foam cell hypercellularity
definition: A type of cortical radial artery endoarterial leukocyte hypercellularity due to the presence of lipid-filled cells, often macrophages, with a vacuolated appearance in the lumen of cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney.

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
label: Cortical radial artery intima/media arteriosclerosis
definition: Thickening of the intima of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney characterized by fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina.

name: Cortical radial artery intimal mucoid edema
label: Cortical radial artery intimal mucoid edema
definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the intima of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney. This material resembles mucus and stains pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

name: Cortical radial artery intima/media multilamellation
label: Cortical radial artery intima/media multilamellation
definition: Myointimal hyperplasia of the inner and middle layer of the cortical radial artery (also known as the interlobular artery) of the kidney, arranged in multiple concentric layers.

name: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal granulomatous arteriitis
label: Cortical radial artery medial/intimal granulomatous arteriitis
definition: A type of cortical radial artery medial/intimal arteriitis that is characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed arteries.

name: Abnormal interlobular vein intima/media morphology
label: Abnormal interlobular vein intima/media morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the inner or middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Interlobular intima/media venosclerosis
label: Interlobular intima/media venosclerosis
definition: Thickening of the intima with fibrosis and/or duplication of the elastic lamina in interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Interlobular vein intimal mucoid edema
label: Interlobular vein intimal mucoid edema
definition: Accumulation of edematous extracellular matrix in the intima of the interlobular vein of the kidney. This material resembles mucus and stains pale blue on hematoxylin and eosin staining.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media amyloidosis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media amyloidosis
definition: Amorphous extracellular substance in the glomerular, interstitial or vascular compartments of the interlobular veins of the kidney. Congo-red positive with typically an apple green birerfingence on polarization microscopy, and 8-12 nm fibrils on electron microscopy

name: Interlobular vein intima/media venulitis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media venulitis
definition: Inflammation of the interlobular veins of the kidney which may affect only the intima or may be transmural.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media granulomatous venulitis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media granulomatous venulitis
definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media venulitis that is characterized by circumscribed inflammatory lesions comprised primarily of macrophages present in inflamed veins.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media necrosis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media necrosis
definition: Cell death (necrosis) in the inner or middle layer of the interlobular vein of the kidney.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media liquefactive necrosis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media liquefactive necrosis
definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue breaks down such that cellular detail is no longer recognized.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media coagulative necrosis
label: Interlobular vein intima/media coagulative necrosis
definition: A type of interlobular vein intima/media necrosis in which the dead (necrotic) tissue retains the outlines of the dead structures.

name: Interlobular vein medial atrophy
label: Interlobular vein medial atrophy
definition: Atrophy (wasting, decreased thickness) of the medial layer pf the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Interlobular vein medial hypertrophy
label: Interlobular vein medial hypertrophy
definition: Increased thickness of middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney.

name: Interlobular vein intima/media multilamellation
label: Interlobular vein intima/media multilamellation
definition: Myointimal hyperplasia of the inner and middle layer of the interlobular veins of the kidney, arranged in multiple concentric layers.

name: Absent second fingernail
label: Absent second fingernail
definition: Absence of the fingernail of the index (second) finger.

name: Volar fingernail
label: Volar fingernail
definition: The presence of an extra nail on the palmar (volar, ventral) surface of the finger.

name: Talar aplasia
label: Talar aplasia
definition: Absent talus owing to a congenital defect.

name: Reduced beta-hexosaminidase activity
label: Reduced beta-hexosaminidase activity
definition: Diminished activity of the enzyme beta-hexosaminidase in the blood circulation.

name: Excessive dynamic airway collapse
label: Excessive dynamic airway collapse
definition: Excessive anterior displacement of the tracheal and/or bronchial membranous wall.

name: Paroxysmal tonic upgaze
label: Paroxysmal tonic upgaze
definition: Recurrent episodes of sustained upward deviation of the eyes and incomplete downward saccades, and normal horizontal eye movements without impairment of consciousness.

name: Vertebral artery tortuosity
label: Vertebral artery tortuosity
definition: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the vertebral arteries.

name: Celiac artery dissection
label: Celiac artery dissection
definition: A separation (dissection) of the layers of the celiac artery wall.

name: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein C-II concentration
label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein C-II concentration
definition: Reduced concentration of apolipoprotein C-II in the blood circulation.

name: Increased urinary 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine level
label: Increased urinary 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine level
definition: An elevated amount of 8-oxo-7,8-dihydroguanosine in the urine.

name: Elongated femoral neck
label: Elongated femoral neck
definition: Increased length of the neck of the femur.

name: Tortuous lymphatic vessels
label: Tortuous lymphatic vessels
definition: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of lymphatic vessels.

name: Phosphaturic mesenchymal tumor
label: Phosphaturic mesenchymal tumor
definition: A rare, endocrine active tumor that causes severe renal phosphate wasting, which in turn can lead to critical osteomalacia. Phosphaturic mesenchymal tumors (PMTs) are typically small and mostly benign tumors producing fibroblast growth factor 23 (FGF-23). FGF-23 lowers the expression of sodium/phosphate cotransporters, which are the primary transport proteins responsible for phosphate reabsorption in the kidneys. The paraneoplastic overproduction of FGF-23 lowers reabsorption of phosphate and causes severe paraneoplastic renal phosphate wasting and hypophosphatemia. FGF-23 also affects vitamin D levels by lowering 25-hydroxyvitamin D 1-alpha-hydroxylase in the proximal renal tubules and by increasing the expression of vitamin D 24-hydroxylase, a mitochondrial enzyme responsible for inactivating vitamin D metabolites.

name: Amygdala microinfarct
label: Amygdala microinfarct
definition: An infarct located in the almond-shaped body of basal nuclei anterior to the inferior horn of the lateral ventricle of the brain, within the temporal lobe that can only be observed microscopically.

name: Hippocampal microinfarct
label: Hippocampal microinfarct
definition: An infarct located in the structure of the cerebrum involved with memory storage and spatial navigation that can only be observed microscopically.

name: Cartilaginous tracheobronchomalacia
label: Cartilaginous tracheobronchomalacia
definition: Softening of the tracheal and/or bronchial cartilage resulting in segmental tracheal and/or bronchial weakness.

name: Vasa previa
label: Vasa previa
definition: Vasa previa occurs when the membranes that contain the umbilical cord traverse the membranes overlying the internal os of the cervix. There is a high risk of fetal mortality if not identified perinatally.

name: Chronotropic incompetence
label: Chronotropic incompetence
definition: Inability of the heart to increase its rate commensurate with increased activity or demand.

name: Viral encephalitis
label: Viral encephalitis
definition: An inflammation of brain parenchyma due to infection with a virus. Viral encephalitis can occur as a rare complication of common infections (eg, herpes virus infections) or can occur as a characteristic presentation of rare viruses (eg, rabies virus infection). Encephalitis may be the only neurologic manifestation of infection, or may occur in association with meningitis, myelitis, radiculitis, or neuritis. Viral encephalitis is associated with neurological dysfunction.

name: Dependency on parenteral nutrition
label: Dependency on parenteral nutrition
definition: Inability to ingest sufficient quantities of nutrition by mouth or by tube-feeding with the corresponding requirement for intravenous administration of nutrition.

name: Microvillus inclusions
label: Microvillus inclusions
definition: The presence of vacuoles bearing centripetal microvilli in small gut villus enterocytes.

name: Microvillar PAS-positive secretory granules
label: Microvillar PAS-positive secretory granules
definition: The presenceaccumulationof periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) granules in the subapical region of small intenstinal microvilli, appearing as different kinds of vesicular/tubular structures.

name: Perinuclear cardiomyocyte vacuolization
label: Perinuclear cardiomyocyte vacuolization
definition: Formation of vacuoles, i.e., membrane-bound organelles, in the portion of the cytoplasm near the nucleus within myocytes of the heart.

name: Single-lobed right lung
label: Single-lobed right lung
definition: A developmental defect of pulmonary lobation characterized by the presence of only one lobe of the right lung, which normally has three lobes.

name: Bronchial hemorrhage
label: Bronchial hemorrhage
definition: Bronchial hemorrhage is a focal bleeding located in the bronchial system. It can be diagnosed by tracheobronchoscopy.

name: Tracheal hemorrhage
label: Tracheal hemorrhage
definition: Tracheal hemorrhage is a focal bleeding within the trachea. It be diagnosed by tracheobronchoscopy.

name: Anti-Complement factor H antibody positivity
label: Anti-Complement factor H antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against complement factor H.

name: Anti-phospholipase A2 receptor antibody positivity
label: Anti-phospholipase A2 receptor antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against the phospholipase A2 receptor.

name: Broad medial eyebrow
label: Broad medial eyebrow
definition: Regional increase in the width (height) of the middle portion of the eyebrow.

name: Parosmia
label: Parosmia
definition: Misperception of existing odor, that is, distorted or altered olfactory perception in the presence of known stimuli.

name: Decreased dendritic spine number
label: Decreased dendritic spine number
definition: An abnormal reduction in the amount of spines on a given dendrite.

name: Decreased urinary lysyl-pyridinoline-hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline ratio
label: Decreased urinary lysyl-pyridinoline-hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline ratio
definition: A decreased amount of the urinary cross-links lysyl-pyridinoline (LP, or deoxypyridinoline DPD) as compared to hydroxylysyl-pyridinoline (HP, or pyridinoline PYD). Both are established biochemical markers of osteoclastic bone resorption and collagen degradation.

name: Posterior atrophy of corpus callosum
label: Posterior atrophy of corpus callosum
definition: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the posterior portion of the corpus callosum.

name: Opto-chiasmatic atrophy
label: Opto-chiasmatic atrophy
definition: Wasting (atrophy) of the optic chiasm.

name: Pelvic lipomatosis
label: Pelvic lipomatosis
definition: Overgrowth of fat in the perivesical and perirectal area.

name: Increased megakaryocyte colony forming unit count
label: Increased megakaryocyte colony forming unit count
definition: Increased numbers of megakryocyte precursors (megakaryocyte colony forming units) in the bone marrow.

name: Reduced progressive sperm motility
label: Reduced progressive sperm motility
definition: A reduced proportion of sperm that move in a straight line or large circles; alternatively, an increaed proportion of sperm that move in tight circles or in some other non-linear fashion.

name: Palmoplantar hypohidrosis
label: Palmoplantar hypohidrosis
definition: Decreased sweating on the palms and soles.

name: Curvilinear pericallosal lipoma
label: Curvilinear pericallosal lipoma
definition: A type of pericallosal lipoma that is thin and curves around the posterior end of the splenium of the corpus callosum.

name: Tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma
label: Tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma
definition: A type of pericallosal lipoma with a rounded or lobular appearance and a diameter that is usually above 2 cm. They are anteriorly situated and are associated with extensive callosal and often fronto-facial anomalies. A tubulonodular pericallosal lipoma can extend into the choroid plexus or lateral ventricles.

name: Cavitating pulmonary nodule
label: Cavitating pulmonary nodule
definition: Thick-walled abnormal gas-filled interstitial nodule within a lung.

name: Anti-HLA antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen (HLA).

name: Anti-class I HLA antibody positivity
label: Anti-class I HLA antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a class I human leukocyte antigen (HLA). Class I HLA corresponds to MHC class I (A, B, and C).

name: Anti-class II HLA antibody positivity
label: Anti-class II HLA antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a class I human leukocyte antigen (HLA). Class I HLA corresponds to MHC class II (DP, DM, DO, DQ, and DR).

name: Anti-HLA-A antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-A antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

name: Anti-HLA-A IgG1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-A IgG1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG1 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

name: Anti-HLA-A IgG3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-A IgG3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG3 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-A (HLA-A).

name: Anti-HLA-B antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-B antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

name: Anti-HLA-B IgG1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-B IgG1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG1 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

name: Anti-HLA-B IgG3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-HLA-B IgG3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG3 autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against a human leukocyte antigen-B (HLA-B).

name: Abnormal circulating GABA concentration
label: Abnormal circulating GABA concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated circulating sacchoropine concentration
label: Elevated circulating sacchoropine concentration
definition: An increased concentration of saccharopine in the blood circulation. L-saccharopine is the N(6)-(1,3-dicarboxypropan-1-yl) derivative of L-lysine.

name: Abnormal urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
label: Abnormal urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
definition: Any deviation from the normal amount in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

name: Saccharopinuria
label: Saccharopinuria
definition: Presence of saccharopine in the urine.

name: Hepatic foam cells
label: Hepatic foam cells
definition: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the liver.

name: Lip cyanosis
label: Lip cyanosis
definition: Bluish discoloration of the lips.

name: Facial cyanosis
label: Facial cyanosis
definition: Bluish discoloration of one or more regions of the face.

name: Central cyanosis
label: Central cyanosis
definition: Generalized bluish discoloration of the body and the visible mucous membranes, which occurs due to inadequate oxygenation secondary to conditions that lead to an increase in deoxygenated hemoglobin or presence of abnormal hemoglobin.

name: Peripheral cyanosis
label: Peripheral cyanosis
definition: Bluish discoloration of the distal extremities (hands, fingertips, toes), and can sometimes involve circumoral and periorbital areas. Mucous membranes are generally not involved.

name: Differential cyanosis
label: Differential cyanosis
definition: Differential degree of bluish discoloration between the upper and lower extremities.

name: Pharyngeal exudate
label: Pharyngeal exudate
definition: Fluid exuded from the posterior wall of the pharynx.

name: Pseudo-chilblains on toes
label: Pseudo-chilblains on toes
definition: Inflammatory chilblain-like nodules on the feet and/or toes.

name: Pseudo-chilblains on fingers
label: Pseudo-chilblains on fingers
definition: Inflammatory chilblain-like nodules on the hands and/or fingers.

name: Silent hypoxemia
label: Silent hypoxemia
definition: Abnormally low blood oxygen level without the presence of dyspnea.

name: Ventricular couplet
label: Ventricular couplet
definition: Two consecutive premature ventricular contractions (PVCs) with no intervening normal beats.

name: Bidirectional ventricular tachycardia
label: Bidirectional ventricular tachycardia
definition: Bidirectional ventricular tachycardia (BDVT) is a regular ventricular tachyarrhythmia (VT) with two different QRS morphologies alternating at a rate typically between 140 and 180 bpm.

name: Ventricular ectopy
label: Ventricular ectopy
definition: Ventricular ectopics, also known as ventricular extrasystoles, premature ventricular contractions or complexes (PVC) and ventricular premature depolarisations (VPD) are beats arising from within the ventricles. When they occur in groupings such as bigeminy, trigeminy, couplets and triplets they are referred to as ventricular ectopy.

name: Dorsal hirsutism
label: Dorsal hirsutism
definition: Abnormally increased hair growth in the lskin of the back.

name: Increased fecal bile acid
label: Increased fecal bile acid
definition: Elevated amount of bile acids in the feces.

name: Trident pelvis
label: Trident pelvis
definition: Spurs at the medial and lateral acetabular margin and in the center of the acetabulum gives rise to shape resembling a three-pronged spear known as trident.

name: Angulated muscle fibers
label: Angulated muscle fibers
definition: Normal muscle fibers are polygonal-shaped in cross section, are multinucleated, and have minimal amounts of endomysial connective tissue. In contrast, angulated (also known as angular) muscle fibers have long and narrow vertices (corners) with sharp edges and a pointed tip.

name: Mandibular osteolysis
label: Mandibular osteolysis
definition: Osteolysis (destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium) localized to the mandible.

name: Rib osteolysis
label: Rib osteolysis
definition: Osteolysis (destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium) localized to a rib.

name: Decreased circulating chenodeoxycholic acid concentration
label: Decreased circulating chenodeoxycholic acid concentration
definition: A reduced concentration of chenodeoxycholic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 level
label: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 level
definition: An increased amount of prostaglandin E2 in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 metabolite level
label: Elevated urinary prostaglandin E2 metabolite level
definition: An increased amount of prostaglandin E2 metabolite (PGE-M) in the urine.

name: Hypoplastic anterior limbs of the internal capsule
label: Hypoplastic anterior limbs of the internal capsule
definition: Underdevelopment of the frontal part (anterior crus or anterior limb) of the internal capsule.

name: Impaired toe-walking ability
label: Impaired toe-walking ability
definition: Difficulty or reduced ability to walk on toes. Toe-walking can be tested as a part of the neurological examination. Foot plantar flexion weakness leads to difficulties in walking on toes.

name: Probst bundles
label: Probst bundles
definition: Probst bundles (also known as longitudinal callosal fascicles) are neuroanatomical homologues to the corpus callosum and can occur in association with callosal agenesis. Probst bundles are white matter fibers that normally cross the corpus callosum but (because of the agenesis of the corpus callosum) fail to cross the midline, such that when they reach the corticoseptal boundary, they turn and run parallel to the interhemispheric fissure within the septal leaves, indenting the medial walls of the lateral ventricles.

name: Anti-side-chain cleavage enzyme antibody positivity
label: Anti-side-chain cleavage enzyme antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against cytochrome P450 cholesterol side-chain cleavage enzyme (P450scc), which is encoded by CYP11A1 cytochrome P450 family 11 subfamily A member 1 (Gene ID:1583).

name: Increased fecal calprotectin level
label: Increased fecal calprotectin level
definition: An increased amount of calprotectin in the feces.

name: Fetal anomaly
label: Fetal anomaly
definition: Structural or functional abnormalities of the fetus. Note that this section comprises terms that describe abnormalities that are specific to the fetus or differ from the corresponding general terms. A term from anywhere in the Human Phenotype Ontology can be applied to a fetus if appropriate.

name: Abnormal fetal morphology
label: Abnormal fetal morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the fetus.

name: Abnormal fetal physiology
label: Abnormal fetal physiology
definition: Any functional anomaly of the fetus.

name: Triggered by fava bean ingestion
label: Triggered by fava bean ingestion
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating fava beans.

name: Anti-steroid 17alpha-hydroxylase antibody positivity
label: Anti-steroid 17alpha-hydroxylase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against steroid 17alpha-hydroxylase.

name: Anti-insulin antibody positivity
label: Anti-insulin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against insulin.

name: Anti-islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against tyrosine phosphatase IA-2.

name: Anti-salivary protein antibody positivity
label: Anti-salivary protein antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against salivary protein.

name: Anti-Zinc transporter 8 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Zinc transporter 8 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against zinc transporter 8.

name: Anti-carbonic anhydrase VI antibody positivity
label: Anti-carbonic anhydrase VI antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against carbonic anhydrase VI.

name: Tonofilament clumping
label: Tonofilament clumping
definition: Formation of lumps of tonofilaments, which are bundles of keratin filaments. In some but not all epithelia, keratin filaments are conspicuously bundled as tonofilaments. Inside the cell they braid the nucleus, span through the cytoplasm and are attached to the cytoplasmic plaques of the typical epithelial cell-cell junctions, the desmosomes.

name: Anti-plasminogen binding peptide antibody positivity
label: Anti-plasminogen binding peptide antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against plasminogen binding peptide.

name: Anti-parotid secretory protein antibody positivity
label: Anti-parotid secretory protein antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against parotid secretory protein.

name: Anti-enterocyte antibody positivity
label: Anti-enterocyte antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against enterocytes.

name: Anti-21-hydroxylase antibody positivity
label: Anti-21-hydroxylase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against 21-hydroxylase.

name: Abnormal fetal long-bone echogenicity
label: Abnormal fetal long-bone echogenicity
definition: Any deviation from the normal appearing echogenicity of the fetal bone. Echogenicity refers to the ability of tissue to reflect ultrasound waves back toward the transducer and produce an echo. Whenever there is an interface of structures with different echogenicities, a visible difference in contrast will be apparent on the screen. The higher the echogenicity of tissues, the brighter they appear on ultrasound imaging.

name: Reduced fetal long bone echogenicity
label: Reduced fetal long bone echogenicity
definition: An abnormally decreased echogenicity of fetal long bones in a prenatal sonographic investigation. Ths finding is due to hypomineralization and can be seen in some disorders such as hypophosphatasia, osteogenesis imperfecta, and achondrogenesis.

name: Increased fetal long bone echogenicity
label: Increased fetal long bone echogenicity
definition: An abnormally elevated echogenicity of fetal long bones in a prenatal sonographic investigation. Ths finding is due to hypermineralization.

name: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein B concentration
label: Decreased circulating apolipoprotein B concentration
definition: Reduced circulating level of apolipoprotein B, which is the main apolipoprotein of chylomicrons and low density lipoproteins. It occurs in plasma as two main isoforms, apoB-48 and apoB-100.

name: Anti-ribosome Po antibody positivity
label: Anti-ribosome Po antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ribosome Po.

name: Anti-complement component C1q antibody positivity
label: Anti-complement component C1q antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against C1q.

name: Anti-centromere protein A antibody positivity
label: Anti-centromere protein A antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CENP-A.

name: Anti-centromere protein B antibody positivity
label: Anti-centromere protein B antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CENP-B.

name: Anti-U3 RNP antibody positivity
label: Anti-U3 RNP antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against U3 RNP.

name: Anti-Th/To antibody positivity
label: Anti-Th/To antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Th/To.

name: Anti-bicaudal D2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-bicaudal D2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against bicaudal D2.

name: Anti-nucleolus-organizing region antibody positivity
label: Anti-nucleolus-organizing region antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Nor90.

name: Anti-phosphatidyl ethanolamine antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidyl ethanolamine antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl ethanolamine.

name: Anti-PM-Scl100 antibody positivity
label: Anti-PM-Scl100 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against PM-Scl100.

name: Anti-PM-Scl75 antibody positivity
label: Anti-PM-Scl75 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against PM-Scl75.

name: Anti-U11/U12 RNP antibody positivity
label: Anti-U11/U12 RNP antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against U11/U12 RNP.

name: Anti-Ku antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ku antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ku.

name: Anti-B23 antibody positivity
label: Anti-B23 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against B23.

name: Anti-RuvBL1/2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-RuvBL1/2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against RuvBL1/2.

name: Anti-platelet derived growth factor receptor
label: Anti-platelet derived growth factor receptor
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against platelet derived growth factor receptor.

name: Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide antibody positivity
label: Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against cyclic citrullinated peptide.

name: Anti-Ro52/TRIM21 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ro52/TRIM21 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ro52/TRIM21.

name: Anti-angiotensin receptor type-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-angiotensin receptor type-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against angiotensin receptor type-1.

name: Anti-endothelin-1 type A receptor antibody positivity
label: Anti-endothelin-1 type A receptor antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against endothelin-1 type A receptor.

name: Anti-phosphatidic acid antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidic acid antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidic acid.

name: Anti-phosphatidyl choline antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidyl choline antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl choline.

name: Anti-phosphatidyl glycerol antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidyl glycerol antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl glycerol.

name: Anti-phosphatidyl inositol antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidyl inositol antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl inositol.

name: Anti-phosphatidyl serine antibody positivity
label: Anti-phosphatidyl serine antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phosphatidyl serine.

name: Anti-annexin-V antibody positivity
label: Anti-annexin-V antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against annexin-V.

name: Anti-sphingolipid antibody positivity
label: Anti-sphingolipid antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against sphingolipids.

name: Anti-GM1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM1 antibody positivity
definition: Ganglioside-monosialic acid (GM1) is a type of glycosphingolipid with one sialic acid. GM1 is located on the outer layer of the plasma membrane, and plays a vital role in neurogenesis, nerve development, differentiation and repair after injury

name: Anti-neutrophil elastase antibody positivity
label: Anti-neutrophil elastase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against neutrophil elastase.

name: Anti-transcription intermediary factor-1gamma antibody positivity
label: Anti-transcription intermediary factor-1gamma antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against transcription intermediary factor-1gamma.

name: Anti-Su antigen/argonaute 2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Su antigen/argonaute 2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Su antigen/argonaute 2.

name: Anti-p53 antibody positivity
label: Anti-p53 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against p53.

name: Anti-Y-box protein-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Y-box protein-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Y-box protein-1.

name: Anti-GW182 antibody positivity
label: Anti-GW182 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GW182.

name: Anti-Gerbich phenotype 1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Gerbich phenotype 1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ge-1.

name: Anti-MIT3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-MIT3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against MIT3.

name: Anti-GM1 IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM1 IgG antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GM1.

name: Anti-type I liver-kidney microsomal antibody positivity
label: Anti-type I liver-kidney microsomal antibody positivity
definition: The presence of type I liver-kidney microsomal autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation.

name: Anti-hexokinase-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-hexokinase-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against hexokinase-1.

name: Anti-Kelch like protein 12 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Kelch like protein 12 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Kelch like protein 12.

name: Anti-thyrotropin receptor antibody
label: Anti-thyrotropin receptor antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against thyrotropin receptor antibody.

name: Anti-angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against angiotensin-converting enzyme 2.

name: Anti-GM1 IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM1 IgM antibody positivity
