definition: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GM1.

name: Anti-GD1a IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1a IgG antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside D1a.

name: Anti-GD1a IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1a IgM antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside D1a.

name: Anti-GD1a antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1a antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside D1a.

name: Anti-GQ1b antibody positivity
label: Anti-GQ1b antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside Q1b.

name: Anti-GQ1b IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-GQ1b IgM antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside Q1b.

name: Anti-GD1b antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1b antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GD1b ganglioside.

name: Anti-GD1b IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1b IgM antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GD1b ganglioside.

name: Anti-GD1b IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-GD1b IgG antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against GD1b ganglioside.

name: Anti-GQ1b IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-GQ1b IgG antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside Q1b.

name: Anti-GT1a antibody positivity
label: Anti-GT1a antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against T1a ganglioside.

name: Anti-GT1a IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-GT1a IgM antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgM autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against T1a ganglioside.

name: Anti-GT1a IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-GT1a IgG antibody positivity
definition: The presence of IgG autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against T1a ganglioside.

name: Anti-GT1b antibody positivity
label: Anti-GT1b antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against T1b ganglioside.

name: Anti-GM2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside GM2.

name: Anti-GM3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside GM3.

name: Anti-GM4 antibody positivity
label: Anti-GM4 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against ganglioside GM4.

name: Anti-neurofascin-155 antibody positivity
label: Anti-neurofascin-155 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NF155.

name: Anti-neurofascin 186 antibody positivity
label: Anti-neurofascin 186 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NF186.

name: Anti-contactin-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-contactin-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CNTN1.

name: Anti-contactin-associated protein 1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-contactin-associated protein 1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-contactin-associated protein 1.

name: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme antibody positivity
label: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SAE.

name: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme subunit 1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme subunit 1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SAE 1.

name: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme subunit 2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-SUMO-activating enzyme subunit 2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SAE 2.

name: Anti-nuclear matrix protein-2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-nuclear matrix protein-2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against NXP-2.

name: Anti-threonyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-threonyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against threonyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-hY-RNA complex antibody positivity
label: Anti-hY-RNA complex antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ro60.

name: Anti-alanyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-alanyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against alanyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-glycyl tRNA-synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-glycyl tRNA-synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glycyl tRNA-synthetase.

name: Anti-aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against a tRNA synthetase enzyme.

name: Anti-isoleucyl tRNA-synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-isoleucyl tRNA-synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against isoleucyl tRNA-synthetase.

name: Anti-phenylalanyl tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-phenylalanyl tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against phenylalanyl tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against tyrosyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against asparaginyl-tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-histidyl tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
label: Anti-histidyl tRNA synthetase antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against histidyl tRNA synthetase.

name: Anti-cytosolic-5-nucleotidase-1A antibody positivity
label: Anti-cytosolic-5-nucleotidase-1A antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against cytosolic-5-nucleotidase-1A (cN1A).

name: Anti-Ki antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ki antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ki.

name: Anti-sp100 antibody positivity
label: Anti-sp100 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against sp100. Autoantibodies causing the MND pattern are directed against sp100, sp140, promyelocytic leukemia nuclear body proteins (PML) or ubiquitin-like modifier (SUMO) proteins, while in the punctate nuclear envelope pattern, the target antigens are gp210, nucleoporin-62 or laminin B receptor proteins.

name: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgG antibody positivity
label: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgG antibody positivity
definition: Presence of IgG antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome.

name: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgM antibody positivity
label: Anti-beta-2-Glycoprotein I IgM antibody positivity
definition: Presence of IgM antibodies against beta 2 glycoprotein I in the circulation. Beta-2 glycoprotein I (beta2GPI) is the principal target of autoantibodies in the antiphospholipid syndrome.

name: Anti-tyrosine phosphatase region of islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-tyrosine phosphatase region of islet antigen-2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the tyrosine phossphatase region of islet antigen 2A (this region is a specific part of IA-2). Usually IA-2A are measured using the intracellular portion of IA-2 (IA-2ic) made up of the protein tyrosine phosphatase (PTP) and juxtamembrane (JM) regions.

name: Paget disease of bone
label: Paget disease of bone
definition: A localized disorder of bone remodeling. Increased numbers of larger than normal osteoclasts initiate the process at affected skeletal sites, and the increase in bone resorption is followed by an increase in new bone formation, altering bone architecture.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 9 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 9 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 9 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 9 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 9 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 9 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 10 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 10 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 10 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 10 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 21 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 21 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 21 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 21 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 21 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 21 in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 21 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 21 concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of interleukin 21 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 22 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 22 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 22 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 22 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 22 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 22 in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 22 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 22 concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of interleukin 22 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 23 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 23 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 23 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 23 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 23 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 23 in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 23 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 23 concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of interleukin 23 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 27 concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 27 concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 27 in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 27 concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 27 concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 27 in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 27 concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 27 concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of interleukin 27 in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 17A concentration
label: Abnormal circulating interleukin 17A concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 17A in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced circulating interleukin 17A concentration
label: Reduced circulating interleukin 17A concentration
definition: An abnormally decreased concentration of interleukin 17A in the blood circulation.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 17A concentration
label: Increased circulating interleukin 17A concentration
definition: An abnormally increased concentration of interleukin 17A in the blood circulation.

name: Vertebral artery aneurysm
label: Vertebral artery aneurysm
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the vertebral artery .

name: Fusion of the caudate and putamen
label: Fusion of the caudate and putamen
definition: Abnormal joined appearance of the caudate and putamen with an absence of the anterior limb of the internal capsule.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the liver
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the liver
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the liver.

name: Segmental hypoplasia of liver
label: Segmental hypoplasia of liver
definition: Anatomically the liver is divided into right and left lobes based on the attachment of its peritoneal ligaments. This term refers to a developmental anomaly characterzied by the underdevelopment of one of the lobes of the liver. This is a rare and usually asymptomatic anomaly that can be detected incidentally on cross sectional imaging with computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging.

name: Spastic triplegia
label: Spastic triplegia
definition: Spastic weakness found in both lower extremities and one upper extremity.

name: Increased insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit concentration
label: Increased insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit concentration
definition: An abnormally elevated concentration of insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level in the blood circulation.

name: Median pseudocleft lip
label: Median pseudocleft lip
definition: A type of mild median cleft lip in which the central tubercle of the upper lip is replaced by a mucosal cleft in the midline.

name: Patella alta
label: Patella alta
definition: Patella alta is a patella that rides abnormally high in relation to the femur, the femoral trochlea, or the tibia, with decreased bony stability requiring increased knee flexion angles to engage the trochlea.

name: Clavicular pseudarthrosis
label: Clavicular pseudarthrosis
definition: A developmental defect in a the clavicule leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or false joint).

name: Midline liver
label: Midline liver
definition: Position of the liver across the middle of the body instead of being in its normal position to the right of the stomach.

name: Anti-thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor antibody positivity
label: Anti-thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against thyroid-stimulating hormone.

name: Abnormal fetal cardiovascular physiology
label: Abnormal fetal cardiovascular physiology
definition: Abnormal functionality of the fetal cardiovascular system.

name: Elevated fetal middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity
label: Elevated fetal middle cerebral artery peak systolic velocity
definition: Increased peak systolic velocity of the fetal middle cerebral artery (MCA) as evaluated by Doppler ultrasound.

name: Pulmonary thromboembolism
label: Pulmonary thromboembolism
definition: Pulmonary embolism is caused by emboli, which have originated from venous thrombi, travelling to and occluding the arteries of the lung.

name: Stratum basale cleavage
label: Stratum basale cleavage
definition: Cleavage within the epidermal keratinocytes, which is the innermost layer of the epidermis and consists of proliferating cells that give rise to the outer layers of the epidermis.

name: Suprabasal cleavage
label: Suprabasal cleavage
definition: Cleavage within the suprabasal cell layer of the epidermis, which lies directly above the basal layer and is composed of five to ten layers of cells.

name: Triggered by muscle relaxant
label: Triggered by muscle relaxant
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a muscle relaxant such as suxamethonium and mivacurium.

name: Ductus venosus agenesis
label: Ductus venosus agenesis
definition: A developmental defect characterized by lack of formation of the ductus venosus (a shunt that allows oxygenated blood in the umbilical vein to bypass the liver in the fetal circulation).

name: Third trimester onset
label: Third trimester onset
definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the third trimester, which is defined as 28 weeks and zero days (28+0) of gestation and beyond.

name: Second trimester onset
label: Second trimester onset
definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the second trimester, which comprises the range of gestational ages from 14 0/7 weeks to 21 6/7 (inclusive).

name: Late first trimester onset
label: Late first trimester onset
definition: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth in the first trimester during the early fetal period, which is defined as 11 0/7 to 13 6/7 weeks of gestation (inclusive).

name: Abnormal CSF homovanillic acid concentration
label: Abnormal CSF homovanillic acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

name: Increased CSF homovanillic acid concentration
label: Increased CSF homovanillic acid concentration
definition: Elevated concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

name: Decreased iduronate sulfatase level
label: Decreased iduronate sulfatase level
definition: An decreased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood circulation.

name: Decreased circulating C1-esterase inhibitor concentration
label: Decreased circulating C1-esterase inhibitor concentration
definition: Decreased concentration of C1-esterase inhibitor (C1INH) in the blood circulation.

name: Iniencephaly
label: Iniencephaly
definition: Iniencephaly is a rare neural tube defect involving dysmorphic spine and abnormal fusion of the portion of the occipital skull with the back. It results in extreme fixed head retroflexion.

name: Abnormal fetal nervous system morphology
label: Abnormal fetal nervous system morphology
definition: An anomlous structural finding of the fetal nervous system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Abnormal fetal gastrointestinal system morphology
label: Abnormal fetal gastrointestinal system morphology
definition: An anomlous structural finding of the fetal gastrointestinal system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Fetal intracranial hemorrhage
label: Fetal intracranial hemorrhage
definition: Abnormal bleeding inside the skull (cranium) of a fetus.

name: Fetal subependymal hemorrhage
label: Fetal subependymal hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage located in the subependymal germinal matrix below the frontal horns of the lateral ventricles in the caudothalamic notch.

name: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage
label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding into the ventricular system of the brain.

name: Fetal cerebral parenchymal hemorrhage
label: Fetal cerebral parenchymal hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding into the parenchyma (tissue) of the brain.

name: Fetal extra-axial hemorrhage
label: Fetal extra-axial hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage with bleeding that occurs within the skull but outside of the brain tissue itself (into the epidural, subdural, or arachnoid space).

name: Fetal posterior fossa hemorrhage
label: Fetal posterior fossa hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the posterior cranial fossa, which is the part of the cranial cavity that is located between the foramen magnum and tentorium cerebelli and contains the brainstem and cerebellum.

name: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage without ventriculomegaly
label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage without ventriculomegaly
definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage characterized by clear hemorrhage spillover to the ventricles filling less than 50% of the lateral ventricle and without ventriculomegaly of greater than 15 mm in the transverse diameter of the lateral ventricular atrium.

name: Fetal cerebellar hemisphere hemorrhage
label: Fetal cerebellar hemisphere hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the hemisphere of the cerebellum.

name: Fetal cerebellar vermis hemorrhage
label: Fetal cerebellar vermis hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intracranial hemorrhage that occurs in the vermis of the cerebellum.

name: Sonographic non-visualized fetal bladder
label: Sonographic non-visualized fetal bladder
definition: Inability to visualize the fetal bladder on targeted prenatal sonography examination. The fetal bladder can be visualized with sonography as a midline, fluid-filled structure in the pelvis as early as 10-12 weeks of gestation. The normal fetus voids at least once an hour but never completely empties the urinary bladder. The fetal bladdder should be consistently imaged after 13 weeks of gestation.

name: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with ventriculomegaly
label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with ventriculomegaly
definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH) characterized by spillover to ventricles with flooding of 50% or more of one or both lateral ventricles accrued accompanying ventriculomegaly, but with no apparent brain parenchymal injury. This type of IVH may be defined as a diameter exceeding 15 mm in the transverse diameter of the lateral ventricular atrium as visualiuzed by prenatal sonography.

name: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with periventricular hemorrhage
label: Fetal intraventricular hemorrhage with periventricular hemorrhage
definition: A type of fetal intraventricular hemorrhage that additionally includes hemorrhage in a large part of the periventricular parenchyma.

name: Temporal lobe megalencephaly
label: Temporal lobe megalencephaly
definition: Expansion of the temporal lobes of the brain along all axes, including rostrocaudal, superoinferior, and mediolateral, resulting in a globular appearance of the brain.

name: Abnormal temporal lobe morphology
label: Abnormal temporal lobe morphology
definition: An abnormal strcutural of the zone (lobe) of the cerebral cortex that is located inferior to the lateral fissure on other cerebral hemispheres.

name: Temporal lobe dysplasia
label: Temporal lobe dysplasia
definition: A developmental defect of the temporal lobe of the cerebral cortex that is characterized by prominent sulcations and radially directed gyrations.

name: Elevated umbilical artery pulsatility
label: Elevated umbilical artery pulsatility
definition: Human umbilical artery (UA) blood flow pulsatility measured by Doppler ultrasound is a widely used biomarker for the detection of elevated placental vascular resistance. Elevated UA pulsatility, which in the most extreme cases manifests as absent or even reversed end-diastolic velocity, is associated with intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) and still-birth.

name: Absent end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
label: Absent end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
definition: An anomaly that is visualized by umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry. Flow in the umbilical artery should be in the forward direction in normal circumstances. This anomaly is characterized by an absence of flow in the umbilical artery at the end of diastole.

name: Reversed end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
label: Reversed end-diastolic umbilical artery flow
definition: An anomaly that is visualized by umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry. Flow in the umbilical artery should be in the forward direction in normal circumstances. This anomaly is characterized by an reversal of flow in the umbilical artery at the end of diastole (i.e., backwards flow).

name: Champagne cork sign
label: Champagne cork sign
definition: Characteristic appearance of the chest and abdomen in the sagittal view on prenatal ultrasound when the chest is small and the abdomen protruding.

name: Aortic isthmus hypoplasia
label: Aortic isthmus hypoplasia
definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the isthmus (arch between the left subclavian and insertion of the patent ductus arteriosus/ligamentum arteriosum) has a diameter of less than 40% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

name: Proximal aortic arch hypoplasia
label: Proximal aortic arch hypoplasia
definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the proximal aortic arch (arch proximal to the origin of the left subclavian artery) has a diameter of less than 60% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

name: Distal aortic arch hypoplasia
label: Distal aortic arch hypoplasia
definition: A type of aortic arch hypoplasia whereby the distal aortic arch (arch distal to the ductus arteriosus) has a diameter of less than 60% of the diameter of the ascending aorta.

name: Inferior crossed fused renal ectopia
label: Inferior crossed fused renal ectopia
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia characterized by fusion between the upper pole of the cross-fused ectopic kidney (located more inferiorly relative to the other kidney) and the lower pole of the other orthotopic kidney (located in a more superior position).

name: Sigmoid kidney
label: Sigmoid kidney
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia where the normal side kidney is present superiorly and the direction of pelvic is medial, the kidney which crosses positioned inferiorly with direction of pelvic toward the lateral side. As kidneys fuse after complete rotation on the vertical axis, both renal pelves lie in correct orientation.

name: Unilateral lump kidney
label: Unilateral lump kidney
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia where fusion occurs over a wide margin, both renal pelves anteriorly directed and placed more inferiorly.

name: Disc kidney
label: Disc kidney
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which kidneys fuse along their medial borders.

name: L-shaped kidney
label: L-shaped kidney
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which the crossed kidney lies inferiorly and transversely, fused with the lower pole of the normal kidney.

name: Superior crossed-fused renal ectopia
label: Superior crossed-fused renal ectopia
definition: A type of cross fused renal ectopia in which the ectopic kidney lies superiorly and its lower pole fuses with the upper pole of the normal kidney. The renal pelvis of both kidneys lies anteriorly.

name: Apnea of prematurity
label: Apnea of prematurity
definition: Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring in infants born less than 37 weeks of gestation, defined specifically as a pause of breathing for more than 15-20 s, or accompanied by oxygen desaturation (SpO2 not more than 80% for at least 4 s) and bradycardia (heart rate less than 2/3 of baseline for at least 4 s), in infants born less than 37 weeks of gestation.

name: Open neural tube defect
label: Open neural tube defect
definition: A type of neural tube defect that is not covered by skin.

name: Closed neural tube defect
label: Closed neural tube defect
definition: A type of neural tube defect that is covered by skin.

name: Renal vein thrombosis
label: Renal vein thrombosis
definition: The presence of a thrombus (blood clot) in the major renal veins or its tributaries, generally leading to passive congestion that develops causes the affected kidney to swell and become engorged, leading to degeneration of nephrons and causing symptoms of flank pain, hematuria, and decreased urine output.

name: Fetal neck mass
label: Fetal neck mass
definition: An abnormal growth (lump) of tissue in the neck region of a fetus. Masses may be simple cystic,, cystic with a few simple septations (fewer than three septations and less than 3-mm thick), cystic with multiple or thick septations (greater than three septations or septations 3-mm-thick or more), a mass that is than is less than 50% solid, and a mass that is 50% solid or more.

name: Prenatal death
label: Prenatal death
definition: Death of a fetus in the uterus.

name: Abnormal fetal genitourinary system morphology
label: Abnormal fetal genitourinary system morphology
definition: An anomlous structural finding of the fetal genitourinary system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Abnormal fetal pulmonary morphology
label: Abnormal fetal pulmonary morphology
definition: An anomlous structural finding of the fetal lungs. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Gastric pseudomass
label: Gastric pseudomass
definition: At US examination from the second trimester onward, the fetal stomach appears as a uniformly anechoic, sharply circumscribed round structure in the left upper quadrant. However, debris is commonly visualized in the stomach, forming a pseudomass.

name: Fetal scalp mass
label: Fetal scalp mass
definition: An abnormal growth (lump) of tissue that projects from the fetal scalp.

name: Fetal lower urinary tract obstruction
label: Fetal lower urinary tract obstruction
definition: An obstruction in the ureter leading to bladder outlet obstruction. Special criteria are used for lower urinary tract obstruction (LUTO) in the fetus. Prenatal LUTO has classically been suspected on the basis of three ultrasonographic findings: megacystis, dilated posterior urethra (known as the keyhole sign) and hydronephrosis.

name: Increased fetal lens echogenicity
label: Increased fetal lens echogenicity
definition: Increased echogenicity (increased brightness in the gray-scale sonography image) of the lens of a fetus.

name: Severe influenza infection
label: Severe influenza infection
definition: An unusually severe infection by an influenza virus.

name: Fetal nuchal edema
label: Fetal nuchal edema
definition: Nuchal edema is considered present in a fetus at gestational week 14 or more if in the midsagittal plane of the neck, there is subcutaneous edema that produces a characteristic tremor on ballotment of the fetal head. This constitutes the severe end of the spectrum of increased nuchal fold thickness, which is defined as soft-tissue thickening of 6 mm or more, seen in the suboccipitobregmatic view of the fetal head. Nuchal edema may be confined to the neck or it may be generalized, as part of hydrops fetalis.

name: Abnormal corneal reflex
label: Abnormal corneal reflex
definition: An anomaly of the corneal reflex that normally induces involuntary blinking of the eyelids following contact of the cornea.

name: Absent corneal reflex
label: Absent corneal reflex
definition: Absence of the corneal blinking reflex, which normally induces involuntary blinking of the eyelids following contact of the cornea. The corneal blink reflex is caused by a loop between the trigeminal sensory nerves and the facial motor (VII) nerve innervation of the orbicularis oculi muscles.

name: Eosinophil nuclear hypersegmentation
label: Eosinophil nuclear hypersegmentation
definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of eosinophils. Eosinophils with more than two nuclear lobes are commonly regarded as hypersegmented, because seventy to ninety percent of peripheral blood eosinophils have two nuclear lobes.

name: Face of the giant panda sign
label: Face of the giant panda sign
definition: The face of the giant panda sign on T2-weighted MRI is characterized by preservation of normal signal intensity in the red nuclei and lateral portion of the pars reticulata of the substantia nigra, high signal in the tegmentum, and hypointensity of the superior colliculus. The findings are said to resemble the face of a giant panda.

name: Colovesicular fistula
label: Colovesicular fistula
definition: An aberrant, pathological communication between the colon and the bladder.

name: Absent dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
label: Absent dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
definition: Lack of demonstrable hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.

name: C4 nephritic factor positivity
label: C4 nephritic factor positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that recognize C4b2a, the C3 convertase of the classical pathway of complement.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the midbrain
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the midbrain
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the midbrain (mesencephalon).

name: Hypoplasia of the midbrain
label: Hypoplasia of the midbrain
definition: A developmental defect characterized by underdevelopment of the mesencephalon.

name: Aplastic zygomatic arch
label: Aplastic zygomatic arch
definition: Developmental defect characterized by the absence of the zygomatic arch.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of facial bones
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of facial bones
definition: A developmental defect characterized by absence or underdevelopment of one or more facial bone.

name: Absent lanugo
label: Absent lanugo
definition: Lack of development of lanugo, the fine, soft, unpigmented hair on the body of a fetus or newborn baby.

name: Abnormal vaginal bleeding
label: Abnormal vaginal bleeding
definition: Abnormal vaginal bleeding occurs between menstrual periods, after sex, or after menopause. Menstrual periods that are heavier or last longer than usual or last more than seven days also are considered abnormal.

name: Postcoital vaginal bleeding
label: Postcoital vaginal bleeding
definition: Postcoital bleeding (PCB) consists of spotting or bleeding after sexual intercourse that is not related to a person's menstrual cycle.

name: Mastalgia
label: Mastalgia
definition: Pain in the breast.

name: Vaginal bleeding during sex
label: Vaginal bleeding during sex
definition: Bleeding during sex.

name: Pelvic pain
label: Pelvic pain
definition: Pain perceived in the area of the pelvis, the lower part of the abdomen located between the hip bones.

name: Abnormal vaginal physiology
label: Abnormal vaginal physiology
definition: Any anomaly of vagina function.

name: Abnormal vaginal discharge
label: Abnormal vaginal discharge
definition: Anomalous amount, odor, or consistency of the fluid or mucus that comes from the vagina

name: Serrated incisors
label: Serrated incisors
definition: Incisor teeth with irregular edges said to resemble a saw.

name: Copper beaten skull
label: Copper beaten skull
definition: Diffuse prominent gyral impressions on the inner table of skull vault said to resemble beaten copper.

name: Perifoveal hypoautofluorescence
label: Perifoveal hypoautofluorescence
definition: Decreased amount of autofluorescence (emission of fluorescent light from ocular structures in the absence of sodium fluorescein) in the retina in the region surrounding the fovea.

name: Premature sagging cheeks
label: Premature sagging cheeks
definition: Drooping or sinking of tissues of the cheeks more than would be expected at a given age. Sagging can occur due to a relative excess of skin and/or lack of elastic recoil as well as fat accumulation.

name: Gastrointestinal ulcer
label: Gastrointestinal ulcer
definition: A deep defect in the esophageal, gastric, duodenal or intestinal wall involving the entire mucosal thickness and penetrating through the muscularis mucosae.

name: Verrucous epidermal nevus
label: Verrucous epidermal nevus
definition: A type of epidermal nevus (which represent Blaschkoid hamartomas of the skin that result from mosaic post-zygotic mutations) that appears as skin-colored-to-brown, sharply demarcated, papillomatous papules that coalesce into plaques. The majority of these nevi are either present at birth or occur within the first year of life.

name: Elevated circulating thymidine concentration
label: Elevated circulating thymidine concentration
definition: Concentration of thymidine in the blood circulation above the normal range.

name: Elevated circulating deoxyuridine concentration
label: Elevated circulating deoxyuridine concentration
definition: Concentration of 2-deoxyuridine in the blood circulation is above the normal range.

name: Multinucleated erythroblast
label: Multinucleated erythroblast
definition: Erythroblasts with multiple nuclei. Erythroblasts are nucleated precrusor cells of erythrocytes that are localized to the bone marrow. Normally, erythroblasts have a single nucleus. The abnormal finding of erythrocytes with two or more nuclei may be related to defects in cytokinesis.

name: 2,8-dihydroxyadenine crystalluria
label: 2,8-dihydroxyadenine crystalluria
definition: The presence of 2,8-dihydroxyadenine crystals in the urine. The crystals appear as round, yellow-brown crystals.

name: Target cells
label: Target cells
definition: Target cells (codocytes) have a centrally located disk of hemoglobin surrounded by an area of pallor with an outer rim of hemoglobin adjacent to the cell membrane giving the cell the appearance of a target.

name: Phalangeal cone-shaped epiphyses
label: Phalangeal cone-shaped epiphyses
definition: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hands or feet. Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.

name: Subcutaneous ossification
label: Subcutaneous ossification
definition: Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue in the soft tissue beneath the skin. Subcutaneous ossifications may be observed by radiography or by palpation.

name: Increased fecal protoporphyrin concentration
label: Increased fecal protoporphyrin concentration
definition: Abnormally high concentration of protoporphyrin (derivative of porphyrin with propionic acid groups) in feces.

name: Recurrent gingivitis
label: Recurrent gingivitis
definition: Repeated occurrences of inflammatory condition of the gums (gingival tissue), most commonly caused by bacterial infection.

name: Enteroviral encephalitis
label: Enteroviral encephalitis
definition: Inflamation of the brain related to infection by an enterovirus.

name: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia
label: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia
definition: Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia is an opportunistic infection that occurs in immunosuppressed populations.

name: Afibrinogenemia
label: Afibrinogenemia
definition: Lack of detectable fibrinogen in the blood circulation.

name: Absent pigmentation of chest
label: Absent pigmentation of chest
definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the chest.

name: Hyperparakeratosis
label: Hyperparakeratosis
definition: Abnormal keratinization of the epidermal stratum coreum (horny layer) with increased keratin formation, preservation of the nuclei in the superficial cells, and absence of the stratum granulosum.

name: Chromosome breakage
label: Chromosome breakage
definition: Elevated rate of chromosomal breakage or interchanges occurring either spontaneously or following exposure to various DNA-damaging agents. This feature may be assayed by treatment of cultured lymphocytes with agents such as chemical mutagens, irradiation, and alkylating agents.

name: Increased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
label: Increased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fifth metatarsal bone
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fifth metatarsal bone

name: Abnormality of the second metatarsal bone
label: Abnormality of the second metatarsal bone

name: Abnormality of the fourth metatarsal bone
label: Abnormality of the fourth metatarsal bone

name: Onychogryposis of fingernail
label: Onychogryposis of fingernail
definition: Thickened fingernails.

name: Toenail onycholysis
label: Toenail onycholysis
definition: Painless and spontaneous separation of a toenail from the nail bed.

name: Aplasia of the eccrine sweat glands
label: Aplasia of the eccrine sweat glands

name: Hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands
label: Hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands

name: obsolete Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
label: obsolete Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm

name: Macular edema
label: Macular edema
definition: Thickening of the retina that takes place due to accumulation of fluid in the macula as a nonspecific response to blood-retinal barrier breakdown. Macular edema is a common pathological response to a wide variety of ocular insults, most commonly after intraocular (e.g. cataract) surgery or in association with retinal vascular (e.g. diabetic eye disease, retinal vein occlusion) or inflammatory (e.g. uveitis) disease.

name: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs
label: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs

name: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs
label: obsolete Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs

name: obsolete Abnormal concentration of calcium in blood
label: obsolete Abnormal concentration of calcium in blood

name: Abnormal circulating creatine kinase concentration
label: Abnormal circulating creatine kinase concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal circulating creatine kinase concentration.

name: Happy demeanor
label: Happy demeanor
definition: A conspicuously happy disposition with frequent smiling and laughing that may be context-inappropriate or unrelated to context.

name: Abnormal circulating renin
label: Abnormal circulating renin
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of renin in the blood, a central hormone in the control of blood pressure and various other physiological functions.

name: Abnormal blood folate concentration
label: Abnormal blood folate concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of folate in the blood circulation.|Folate is an essential water-soluble vitamin (vitamin B9) that is found in green leafy vegetables, cereals, legumes, and  fruit. As a  major  methyl  group  donor, it plays an important role in one-carbon metabolism and is involved in DNA, RNA, and protein synthesis, in addition to its significant role in energy production and normal cell division. Low blood folate concentration is associated with an increased risk for neural tube defects during pregnancy.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte count
label: Abnormal lymphocyte count
definition: Any abnormality in the total number of lymphocytes in the blood.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell count
label: Abnormal natural killer cell count
definition: Any deviation from the normal overall count of natural killer (NK) cells in the circulation or a deviation from the normal distribution of NK cell subtypes.|In human peripheral blood, five NK cell subpopulations can be defined on the basis of the relative expression of the markers CD16 and CD56: (1) CD56bright CD16- (50-70% of CD56bright), (2) CD56bright CD16dim (30-50% of CD56bright), (3) CD56dim CD16-, (4) CD56dim CD16bright, and (5) CD56- CD16bright. In healthy individuals, populations (3) and (5) are numerically in the minority.

name: Abnormality of the tympanic membrane
label: Abnormality of the tympanic membrane
definition: An abnormality of the tympanic membrane|The tympanic membrane is considered to be the border of middle and outer ear.

name: Asymmetry of the size of ears
label: Asymmetry of the size of ears

name: Asymmetry of the shape of the ears
label: Asymmetry of the shape of the ears

name: Asymmetry of the position of the ears
label: Asymmetry of the position of the ears

name: Neoplasm of the outer ear
label: Neoplasm of the outer ear
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the outer ear.

name: Neoplasm of the inner ear
label: Neoplasm of the inner ear
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the inner ear.

name: Neoplasm of the ceruminal gland
label: Neoplasm of the ceruminal gland
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ceruminal gland.

name: Cutaneous atresia of the external auditory canal
label: Cutaneous atresia of the external auditory canal

name: Osseous atresia of the external auditory canal
label: Osseous atresia of the external auditory canal

name: Cutaneous stenosis of the external auditory canal
label: Cutaneous stenosis of the external auditory canal

name: Osseous stenosis of the external auditory canal
label: Osseous stenosis of the external auditory canal

name: Morphological abnormality of the lateral semicircular canal
label: Morphological abnormality of the lateral semicircular canal

name: Morphological abnormality of the posterior semicircular canal
label: Morphological abnormality of the posterior semicircular canal

name: Morphological abnormality of the anterior semicircular canal
label: Morphological abnormality of the anterior semicircular canal

name: Absence of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
label: Absence of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle

name: Abnormality of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
label: Abnormality of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle

name: Abnormality of the acoustic reflex
label: Abnormality of the acoustic reflex
definition: An abnormality in the reflexive contraction of the middle-ear muscles in response to sound stimulation.

name: Impairment of the the acoustic reflex
label: Impairment of the the acoustic reflex

name: Impairment of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle
label: Impairment of the reflex of the tensor tympani muscle

name: Abnormal vitamin B12 level
label: Abnormal vitamin B12 level
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of cobalamin (vitamin B12) in the blood. Vitamin B12 is one of the eight B vitamins.

name: Abnormal sweat homeostasis
label: Abnormal sweat homeostasis
definition: An abnormality of the composition of sweat or the levels of its components.

name: Abnormal serum ferritin
label: Abnormal serum ferritin
definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of ferritin. Ferritin concentration can be measured in serum or plasma.|Ferritin is an iron storage protein present in all cells of the organism. A small amount is found in plasma and serum, which is a reflection of iron stores in healthy individuals. A low serum ferritin concentration is usually regarded as an indicator of iron depletion, although the interpretation of normal or high serum ferritin values is challenging in the presence of acute or chronic inflammatory processes, as ferritin is increased in iron overload states and inflammation.

name: Abnormal transferrin saturation
label: Abnormal transferrin saturation
definition: Any abnormality in the serum transferrin saturation, which is calculated by dividing the serum iron level by total iron-binding capacity.

name: Comedonal acne
label: Comedonal acne
definition: A type of acne in which open and closed comedones comprise the majority of the lesions, with substantially fewer papules and pustules.

name: Mucinous histiocytosis
label: Mucinous histiocytosis
definition: Multiple subcutaneous non-fragile and skin-coloured papules characterized by interstitial infiltrate of spindle and epithelioid histiocytes, and mucin. There are well circumscribed aggregates of epithelioid histiocytes and mucin in the upper and middle dermis,with the histiocytes arranged between collagen bundles and separated from the epidermis by a Grenz zone.

name: Lipogranulomatosis
label: Lipogranulomatosis
definition: Yellow nodules of lipoid material are deposited in the skin and mucosae. This gives rise to granulomatous reactions.|Usually caused by a faulty lipid metabolism

name: Tardive dyskinesia
label: Tardive dyskinesia
definition: the involuntary movements are tardive, meaning they have a slow or belated onset

name: Reduced 5-oxoprolinase activity
label: Reduced 5-oxoprolinase activity
definition: Decreased activity of the reaction 5-oxo-L-proline + ATP + 2 H(2)O = L-glutamate + ADP + 2 H(+) + phosphate.

name: Dystopic os odontoideum
label: Dystopic os odontoideum
definition: Os odontoideum is classified into two anatomic types (orthotopic and dystopic). Os odontoideum is defined as an ossicle that consists of smooth and separate caudal portions of the odontoid process. With orthotopic os odontoideum, the ossicle moves with the anterior arch of the atlas, while the dystopic type consists of an ossicle near the basion, or one that is fused with the clivus

name: L-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
label: L-2-hydroxyglutaric aciduria
definition: An increase in the level of L-2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine.

name: Woolly scalp hair
label: Woolly scalp hair
definition: The presence of woolly hair on the scalp. The term woolly hair refers to an abnormal variant of hair that is fine, with tightly coiled curls, and often hypopigmented. Optical microscopy may reveal the presence of tight spirals and a clear diameter reduction as compared with normal hair. Electron microscopy may show flat, oval hair shafts with reduced transversal diameter.

name: Acne inversa
label: Acne inversa
definition: A chronic skin condition involving the inflammation of the apocrine sweat glands, forming pimple-like bumps known as abscesses.

name: Elevated urinary 3-hydroxybutyric acid
label: Elevated urinary 3-hydroxybutyric acid
definition: An increased amount of 3-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Elevated urinary carboxylic acid
label: Elevated urinary carboxylic acid
definition: An increased amount of carboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Orthokeratosis
label: Orthokeratosis
definition: Formation of an anuclear keratin layer

name: Lipomas of eyelids
label: Lipomas of eyelids
definition: Fatty tumors on the eyelids.|Eyelid lipomas

name: Periostitis
label: Periostitis
definition: Inflammation of the periosteum

name: Facial papilloma
label: Facial papilloma
definition: A very specific feature of Costello Syndrome

name: Abnormality of extrinsic muscle of tongue
label: Abnormality of extrinsic muscle of tongue

name: Abnormal circulating phospholipid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating phospholipid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a phospholipid in the blood circulation.

name: Chapped lip
label: Chapped lip
definition: Cracking, fissuring, and peeling of the skin of the lips.

name: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia
label: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia
definition: Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is a nonparoxysmal tachyarrhythmia characterized by an increased resting heart rate (HR) and/or an exaggerated HR response to minimal exertion or a change in body posture. HR is constantly above the physiological range with no appropriate relation to metabolic or physiological demands.

name: Maculopapular exanthema
label: Maculopapular exanthema
definition: A skin rash that is characterized by diffuse cutaneous erythema with areas of skin elevation. It may evolve to vesicles or papules as part of a more severe clinical entity. Different degrees of angioedema with involvement of subcutaneous tissue may also appear.

name: Neonatal sepsis
label: Neonatal sepsis
definition: Systemic inflammatory response to infection in newborn babies.

name: Osteochondrosis
label: Osteochondrosis
definition: Abnormal growth ossification centers in children. Initially a degeneration/ necrosis followed by regeneration or recalcification.

name: Scaling skin
label: Scaling skin
definition: Refers to the loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes.

name: APUdoma
label: APUdoma
definition: An endocrine tumor arising from an APUD cell.

name: Increased head circumference
label: Increased head circumference
definition: An abnormally increased head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart.

name: Decreased head circumference
label: Decreased head circumference
definition: An abnormally reduced head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart. Microcephaly is defined as a head circumference (HC) that is great than two standard deviations below the mean of age- and gender-matched population based samples. Severe microcephaly is defined with an HC that is three standard deviations below the mean.|Although HC measures skull size, it typically also reflects overall brain volume and has been described as a widely used proxy of neural growth and brain size. Brain size outside of normal values is an important risk factor for cognitive and motor delay. Microcephaly at birth has been termed primary microcephaly and that acquired after birth is secondary microcephaly.

name: Mild microcephaly
label: Mild microcephaly
definition: Decreased occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC). For the microcephaly OFC must be between -3 SD and -2 SD compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (i.e. -3 SD <= OFC < -2 SD).|See related discussion https://github.com/obophenotype/human-phenotype-ontology/issues/497

name: Encephalomalacia
label: Encephalomalacia
definition: Encephalomalacia is the softening or loss of brain tissue after cerebral infarction, cerebral ischemia, infection, craniocerebral trauma, or other injury.

name: Motor impersistence
label: Motor impersistence
definition: The inability to maintain postures or positions (such as keeping eyes closed, protruding the tongue, maintaining conjugate gaze steadily in a fixed direction, or making a prolonged 'ah' sound) without repeated prompts.|Damage to premotor and prefrontal regions results in motor-intentional disorders that disrupt initiation, maintenance, and termination of volitional movements. Motor impersistence (i.e., failure to maintain movement) more frequently develops following right than left hemisphere lesions.

name: Simultanapraxia
label: Simultanapraxia
definition: A subset of motor impersistence, defined as the inability to perform more than two of the simple voluntary acts simultaneously, such as closing the eyes and protruding the tongue.

name: Abnormal CSF neopterin level
label: Abnormal CSF neopterin level
definition: Abnormal concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Elevated CSF neopterin level
label: Elevated CSF neopterin level
definition: Increased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Decreased CSF neopterin level
label: Decreased CSF neopterin level
definition: Decreased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Abnormal circulating neopterin concentration
label: Abnormal circulating neopterin concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of neopterin in the blood circulation.|Neopterin can be found to have abnormal level in blood, CSF, or urine.

name: Abnormal CSF biopterin level
label: Abnormal CSF biopterin level
definition: Abnormal concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Elevated CSF biopterin level
label: Elevated CSF biopterin level
definition: Increased concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Decreased CSF biopterin level
label: Decreased CSF biopterin level
definition: Decreased concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Abnormal circulating biopterin concentration
label: Abnormal circulating biopterin concentration
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of biopterin in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of the skin of the palm
label: Abnormality of the skin of the palm
definition: An abnormality of the skin of the palm, that is, the skin of the front of the hand.

name: Risus sardonicus
label: Risus sardonicus
definition: Fixed sarcastic grimace and anxious expression. Caused by spasms of the masseter and other facial muscles.|Accompanied by rigidity of neck and trunk muscles and arching of back. Often observed as a sign of tetanus.

name: Hypopnea
label: Hypopnea
definition: Hypopnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally shallower and/or slow.|Not to be confused with Hypoventilation. Hypopnea is distinct from apnea in which there is no breathing.

name: Abnormal insulin level
label: Abnormal insulin level
definition: An abnormal concentration of insulin in the body.

name: Abnormal circulating insulin level
label: Abnormal circulating insulin level
definition: An abnormal concentration of insulin in the blood.

name: Hypoinsulinemia
label: Hypoinsulinemia
definition: A decreased concentration of insulin in the blood.

name: Elevated hemoglobin A1c
label: Elevated hemoglobin A1c
definition: An increased concentration of hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), which is the product of nonenzymatic attachment of a hexose molecule to the N-terminal amino acid of the hemoglobin molecule. This reaction is dependent on blood glucose concentration, and therefore reflects the mean glucose concentration over the previous 8 to 12 weeks. The HbA1c level provides a better indication of long-term glycemic control than one-time blood or urinary glucose measurements.

name: Reduced natural killer cell count
label: Reduced natural killer cell count
definition: Less than normal number of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system with an ability to mediate cytotoxicity and produce cytokines after the ligation of a germline-encoded activation receptor.

name: Absent natural killer cells
label: Absent natural killer cells
definition: Lack of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system that contains cytoplasmic granzymes, i.e., small granules with perforin and proteases that allow natural killer cells to form pores in the cell membrane of the target cell through which the granzymes and associated molecules can enter, inducing apoptosis.

name: Abnormal size of the dental root
label: Abnormal size of the dental root

name: Maternal thrombophilia
label: Maternal thrombophilia
definition: An increased tendency towards thrombosis in the mother during a pregnancy.|Maternal thrombophilia has been linked to an increased incidence of placental abruption, as well as other adverse pregnancy outcomes. It is believed that the increased obstetrical risk is mediated through placental vascular dysfunction. Placental thrombosis can then result in subsequent ischemic complications, such as fetal loss, preeclampsia, and fetal growth restriction. Placental abruption has been identified as being part of the spectrum of ischemic placental disease and is postulated to be a chronic disease process (PMID:25401392).

name: Pulmonary hemorrhage
label: Pulmonary hemorrhage
definition: A hemorrhage occurring within the lung.

name: Abnormality of fibrinolysis
label: Abnormality of fibrinolysis
definition: Clincial phenotype characterized by delayed bleeding accelerated break down of blood clot (fibrinolysis)|requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor Multimers
label: Decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor Multimers
definition: A decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor multimers.|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium.

name: Decreased level of heparin co-factor II
label: Decreased level of heparin co-factor II
definition: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of heparin co-factor II|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Decreased level of histidine-rich glycoprotein
label: Decreased level of histidine-rich glycoprotein
definition: Decrease of these levels result in increased inhibition of fibrinolysis and reduced inhibition of coagulation|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Decreased level of plasminogen
label: Decreased level of plasminogen
definition: A decreased level of Plasminogen|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Decreased level of thrombomodulin
label: Decreased level of thrombomodulin
definition: Thrombomodulin is a cofactor in the thrombin induced activation of Protein C. In the case of deficiency there will be less Protein C and tendency to clot|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Decreased level of tissue plasminogen activator
label: Decreased level of tissue plasminogen activator
definition: The tPA protein catalyzes the conversion of plasiminogen to plasmin, and thus break down of clots. When there is a deficiency there will be an increase of thrombosis|Requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Delayed onset bleeding
label: Delayed onset bleeding
definition: Abnormal bleeding related to a procedure or trauma which does not start at the time of the initial insult, but after delay by at least 24 hours.

name: Factor XIII subunit A deficiency
label: Factor XIII subunit A deficiency
definition: Deficiency of factor XIII subunit A, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.|Measurement of subunit A or B can be performed by Elisa kits. Adding the more granular term would facilitate mutation analysis as both subunits are encoded by different genes. This is not always performed in the diagnostic workup so 'Reduced factor XIII activity' would sufice. This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Factor XIII subunit B deficiency
label: Factor XIII subunit B deficiency
definition: Deficiency of factor XIII subunit B, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.|Measurement of subunit A or B can be performed by Elisa kits. Adding the more granular term would facilitate mutation analysis as both subunits are encoded by different genes. This is not always performed in the diagnostic workup so 'Reduced factor XIII activity' would sufice. This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Leukocyte inclusion bodies
label: Leukocyte inclusion bodies
definition: The presence of intraceullar inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in leukocytes.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Hyperfibrinolysis
label: Hyperfibrinolysis
definition: Increased degradation of fibrin, associated with clot instability and bleeding|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Impaired binding of factor VIII to VWF
label: Impaired binding of factor VIII to VWF
definition: Impaired binding of factor VIII to von Willebrand Factor. This is determined using a modified ELISA assay.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Impaired neutrophil chemotaxis
label: Impaired neutrophil chemotaxis
definition: An impairment of the migration of neutrophils towards chemoattractants as part of the innate immune response|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation
label: Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation
definition: Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation is present in VKCFD (vitamin K-dependent clotting factor deficiency) type 2, but not in VKCFD type 1.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Increased ratio of VWF propeptide to VWF antigen
label: Increased ratio of VWF propeptide to VWF antigen
definition: An increased VWF propeptide to VWF antigen indicates that deficiency of VWF is not due to impaired synthesis but due to rapid clearance. The VWF propeptide is measured by ELISA.|Some forms of von Willebrand Disease Type I (particularly those previously classified as type IC) and Acquired von Willebrand Disease. This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Increased RIPA
label: Increased RIPA
definition: Increased platelet agglutination in response to low-dose ristocetin|Characteristic of type 2B von Willebrand Disease or platelet-type (pseudo) VWD. (NB: this is not the same as enhanced ristocetin coafactor assay activity) This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Muscle hemorrhage
label: Muscle hemorrhage
definition: Bleeding occuring within a muscle

name: Prolonged euglobulin clot lysis time
label: Prolonged euglobulin clot lysis time
definition: Abnormally increased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Prolonged Russell's viper venom time
label: Prolonged Russell's viper venom time
definition: Increased time to coagulation in the Russell's viper venom assay|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced alpha-2-antiplasmin activity
label: Reduced alpha-2-antiplasmin activity
definition: Reduced activity of alpha-2-antiplasmin. This protein inactivates the protease plasmin that drives fibrinolysis.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced antithrombin antigen
label: Reduced antithrombin antigen
definition: Reduced antithrombin antigen. A reduced level of antithrombin may lead to an increased risk of thrombus formation.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced euglobulin clot lysis time
label: Reduced euglobulin clot lysis time
definition: Abnormally decreased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 activity
label: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 activity
definition: Reduced activity of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1. This protein down-regulates fibrinolysis in the circulation by inhibiting the two major plasminogen activators: tissue-plasminogen activator and urokinase-plasminogen activator.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen
label: Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen
definition: Reduced level of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen.|Added the antigen level as diagnosis with only activity levels is very difficult due to assay problems. Activity levels of control patients also include 0 within the normal limit. This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Reduced prothrombin antigen
label: Reduced prothrombin antigen
definition: Reduced prothrombin antigen as measured by ELISA assay. Prothrombin is a vitamin K-dependent coagulation factor that is proteolytically cleaved to form thrombin.|This term has been requested and created by members of the BRIDGE consortium

name: Hand dimple
label: Hand dimple
definition: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the hand.|Use case: PMC4498842

name: Aplastic/Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Aplastic/Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Abnormal size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Abnormal size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: A deviation in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Hypoplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: Underdevelopment of the nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Aplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Aplastic nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: Absence of the nasopharyngeal adenoids as a developmental defect.

name: Decreased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Decreased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: An abnormal decrease in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
label: Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids
definition: An abnormal increase in the size of nasopharyngeal adenoids.

name: Glue ear
label: Glue ear
definition: Middle ear is filled with glue-like fluid instead of air.|http://patient.info/health/glue-ear-leaflet

name: Jaw pain
label: Jaw pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the jaw.

name: Recurrent infections of the middle ear
label: Recurrent infections of the middle ear
definition: Increased susceptibility to middle ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of middle ear infections

name: Impaired glucose tolerance
label: Impaired glucose tolerance
definition: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral or intravenous administration of glucose.

name: Hyperintensity of MRI T2 signal of the spinal cord
label: Hyperintensity of MRI T2 signal of the spinal cord
definition: A region of high intensity (brightness) observed upon magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans of the spinal cord.|Seen in a wide-ranging variety of spinal cord processes including; simple MR artefacts, congenital anomalies etc. Characterization of the abnormal areas of T2 signal as well as their appearance on other MR imaging sequences, when combined with clinical context and laboratory investigations, will often allow a unique diagnosis, or at least aid in narrowing the differential diagnosis.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the intestines
label: Adenocarcinoma of the intestines
definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the intestines.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the small intestine
label: Adenocarcinoma of the small intestine
definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the small intestine.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the large intestine
label: Adenocarcinoma of the large intestine
definition: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the large intestine.

name: Prolactinoma
label: Prolactinoma
definition: A benign tumor (adenoma) of the pituitary gland|Associated with increased prolactin in the blood (hyperprolactinemia)

name: Frequency
label: Frequency
definition: Class to represent frequency of phenotypic abnormalities within a patient cohort.|Aligned with Orphanet

name: Obligate
label: Obligate
definition: Always present, i.e. in 100% of the cases.

name: Very frequent
label: Very frequent
definition: Present in 80% to 99% of the cases.

name: Frequent
label: Frequent
definition: Present in 30% to 79% of the cases.

name: Occasional
label: Occasional
definition: Present in 5% to 29% of the cases.

name: Very rare
label: Very rare
definition: Present in 1% to 4% of the cases.

name: Excluded
label: Excluded
definition: Present in 0% of the cases.

name: Abnormal axial muscle morphology
label: Abnormal axial muscle morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the muscles of the trunk and head.

name: Nasogastric tube feeding
label: Nasogastric tube feeding
definition: The condition of inability to eat normally treated by placement of a thin tube through the nose into the stomach that is then used to carry food.

name: Cyclic neutropenia
label: Cyclic neutropenia
definition: Recurrent episodes of abnormally low levels of neutrophils in the body (neutropenia).

name: Preauricular cyst
label: Preauricular cyst
definition: Preauricular sinus is an occasional finding and most frequently appears as a small pit close to the anterior margin of the ascending portion of the helix. The opening has also been reported along the postero superior margin of the helix, the tragus or the lobule. Preauricular sinus may lead to the formation of a subcutaneous cyst that is intimately related to the tragal cartilage and the anterior crus of the helix.

name: Decreased circulating free fatty acid level
label: Decreased circulating free fatty acid level

name: Abnormal circulating free fatty acid concentration
label: Abnormal circulating free fatty acid concentration
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a free fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Increased urinary glycerol
label: Increased urinary glycerol
definition: An increased concentration of glycerol in the urine.

name: Hyperglycerolemia
label: Hyperglycerolemia
definition: Increased concentration of glycerol in the blood.|In glycerol kinase deficiency, the increased glycerol concentration has been noted to cause false-positive results of hypertriglyceridemia, a phenomenon called pseudohypertriglyceridemia.

name: Increased male libido
label: Increased male libido
definition: Increased desire for sexual activity on the part of a male.

name: Decreased male libido
label: Decreased male libido
definition: Reduced desire for sexual activity on the part of a male.

name: Male sexual dysfunction
label: Male sexual dysfunction
definition: A problem occurring during any phase of the male sexual response cycle that prevents the individual from experiencing satisfaction from the sexual activity

name: Male anorgasmia
label: Male anorgasmia
definition: Inability of a male to reach orgasm.

name: Sterile arthritis
label: Sterile arthritis
definition: An inflammatory arthritis characterized by purulent synovial fluid with neutrophil accumulation, but with negative cultures.|This form of arthritis is termed 'sterile' because bacetriology returns negative results even though the clinical presentation resembles that of infectious arthritis.

name: Oligoarthritis
label: Oligoarthritis
definition: A type of arthritis that affects up to four joints in the first six months of disease.

name: Blind vagina
label: Blind vagina
definition: The vagina ends in a blind pouch or sac rather than being connected to the internal genitalia.

name: Tongue edema
label: Tongue edema
definition: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tongue.

name: Blue urine
label: Blue urine
definition: An abnormal blue color of the urine.|Blue or green urine coloration may be observed due to certain dyes used for tests of kidney and bladder function, some medications, and disorders including familial benign hypercalcemia and urinary tract infections caused by pseudomonas bacteria.

name: Red urine
label: Red urine
definition: An abnormal red color of the urine.|http://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/red-brown-green-urine-colors-and-what-they-might-mean

name: Dark urine
label: Dark urine
definition: An abnormal dark color of the urine.|http://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/red-brown-green-urine-colors-and-what-they-might-mean

name: Red-brown urine
label: Red-brown urine
definition: An abnormal red-brown color of the urine.|http://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/red-brown-green-urine-colors-and-what-they-might-mean

name: Dark yellow urine
label: Dark yellow urine
definition: An abnormal dark-yellow color of the urine.|http://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/red-brown-green-urine-colors-and-what-they-might-mean

name: Purple urine
label: Purple urine
definition: An abnormal purple color of the urine.|http://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/red-brown-green-urine-colors-and-what-they-might-mean

name: Erythema of the eyelids
label: Erythema of the eyelids
definition: Redness of the skin of the eyelids, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Heliotrope rash
label: Heliotrope rash
definition: In a heliotrope rash, the color of the skin turns to violet, which is the color of the heliotrope flower.|Heliotrope rash occurs during the initial phase of the idiopathic inflammatory myositis (particularly dermatomyositis). Heliotrope rash is a characteristic symptom of Dermatomyositis.

name: Bull's eye rash
label: Bull's eye rash
definition: A cutaneous eruption that consists of multiple (at least two) concentric erythematous rings.

name: Hypoplasia of the olfactory bulb
label: Hypoplasia of the olfactory bulb
definition: Underdevelopment of the olfactory bulb.

name: Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb
label: Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb
definition: An abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb (bulbus olfactorius), which is involved in olfaction, i.e. the sense of smell.

name: Focal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
