label: Focal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
definition: An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that is limited to one particular area.

name: Multifocal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Multifocal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
definition: An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that occurs in several distinct areas.

name: Confluent hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Confluent hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
definition: Areas of brighter than expected MRI signal in the white matter of the brain whereby individual patches run together.

name: Focal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Focal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI

name: Multifocal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Multifocal hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI

name: Confluent hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
label: Confluent hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI

name: Purulent rhinitis
label: Purulent rhinitis
definition: Chronic rhinitis accompanied by pus formation.|An infection of the nasal mucosa associated with pus formation. (Often secondary to a systemic infection, such as measles)

name: Absent neutrophil lactoferrin
label: Absent neutrophil lactoferrin
definition: The absence of lactoferrin in neutrophil granules, which could be caused by either an isolated failure of synthesis of this protein (or the production of an antigenically unrecognizable form of lactoferrin) or a complete deficiency of specific granule production.

name: Neutrophil nuclear clefts
label: Neutrophil nuclear clefts
definition: An abnormality of the nucleus of neutrophils, which presents as either a type I nuclear cleft, where the nuclear cleft may show a transition into a round/oval shape. The second type nuclear cleft, which runs perpendicular to the nuclear surface, and this type of cleft might be related to nuclear lobe formation.

name: Low neutrophil alkaline phosphatase
label: Low neutrophil alkaline phosphatase
definition: An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase in neutrophils, which could be due to absence of enzyme or the production of defective enzyme.

name: Increased neutrophil mitochondria
label: Increased neutrophil mitochondria
definition: An increased number of mitochondria detected in neutrophils.

name: Increased neutrophil ribosomes
label: Increased neutrophil ribosomes
definition: An increased number of ribosomes detected in neutrophils.

name: Bladder outlet obstruction
label: Bladder outlet obstruction
definition: A compression or resistance upon the bladder outflow channel at any location from the bladder neck to urethral meatus, which usually causes lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).

name: Decreased expression of GPI-anchored proteins on the cell surface
label: Decreased expression of GPI-anchored proteins on the cell surface
definition: A decrease in the protein expression fo GPI-anchor proteins, such as CD55 and CD59, at the cell surface, which suggests a defect in GPI-anchor biosynthesis.

name: Starch intolerance
label: Starch intolerance
definition: An inability to digest starch.

name: Renal tubular cyst
label: Renal tubular cyst
definition: Tubular lumnal dilatation/prominence lined by simple layer of cuboidal-to-flat tublar epihelial cells.

name: Ageusia
label: Ageusia
definition: A rare condition that is characterized by a complete loss of taste function of the tongue.

name: Agenesis of putamen
label: Agenesis of putamen
definition: A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the putamen owing to its failure to develop.

name: Fractured head
label: Fractured head
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the head.

name: obsolete Fractured thoracic segment of trunk
label: obsolete Fractured thoracic segment of trunk

name: Fractured humerus
label: Fractured humerus
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the humerus.

name: Hot cross bun sign
label: Hot cross bun sign
definition: A cruciform-shaped hyperintensity within the pons found on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

name: Transient decreased circulating IgG4
label: Transient decreased circulating IgG4
definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood circulation.

name: Chronic decreased circulating IgG4
label: Chronic decreased circulating IgG4
definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood.

name: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG4
label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG4
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG4 can be measured.

name: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG4
label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG4
definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G4 (IgG4) in the blood.

name: Fractured calcaneus
label: Fractured calcaneus
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the calcaneus.

name: Transient decreased circulating IgG2
label: Transient decreased circulating IgG2
definition: A temporary reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood circulation.

name: Chronic decreased cirulating IgG2
label: Chronic decreased cirulating IgG2
definition: A lasting decrease of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood.

name: Fractured knee
label: Fractured knee
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the knee.

name: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG2
label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG2
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG2 can be measured.

name: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG2
label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG2
definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G2 (IgG2) in the blood.

label: Transient decreased circulating IgG1

label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG1

name: Fractured thoracic vertebra
label: Fractured thoracic vertebra
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the thoracic vertebra.

name: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG3
label: Chronic (near) absent circulating IgG3
definition: A lasting absence of immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood, whereby at most trace quantities of IgG3 can be measured.

name: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG3
label: Chronic partially decreased circulating IgG3
definition: A lasting limited decrease of immunoglobulin G3 (IgG3) in the blood.

name: Abnormal immunoglobulin level in body fluid
label: Abnormal immunoglobulin level in body fluid
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

name: Increased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
label: Increased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
definition: An elevation from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

name: Decreased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
label: Decreased immunoglobulin level in body fluid
definition: An reduction from normal levels of immunoglobulins in body fluids, such as mucous.

name: Decreased body fat percentage
label: Decreased body fat percentage
definition: The percentage of fat as a part of total body weight below the norm, usually defined as less than 14% for females and less than 8% for males.

name: Abnormal proportion of exhausted T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of exhausted T cells
definition: A deviation from the normal proportion of exhausted T cell relative to T cell in the blood.

name: Fractured lower leg
label: Fractured lower leg
definition: Bone fracture anywhere in the tibia, fibula, or ankle.

name: Fractured skull
label: Fractured skull
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the skull.

name: Fractured phalanx
label: Fractured phalanx
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the phalanx.

name: Compression-fractured thoracic vertebra
label: Compression-fractured thoracic vertebra
definition: A fracture of the thoracic vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

name: Compression-fractured vertebra
label: Compression-fractured vertebra
definition: A fracture of the vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

name: Compression-fractured cervical vertebra
label: Compression-fractured cervical vertebra
definition: A fracture of the cervical vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

name: Compression-fractured lumbar vertebra
label: Compression-fractured lumbar vertebra
definition: A fracture of the lumbar vertebra that is caused by a loss of bone mass (osteoporosis) that occurs as part of aging.

name: Avulsion fractured humerus
label: Avulsion fractured humerus
definition: A fractured in which a fragment of the humerus tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

name: Avulsion fractured tibia
label: Avulsion fractured tibia
definition: A fractured in which a fragment of the tibia tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

name: obsolete Avulsion fractured pelvic region of trunk
label: obsolete Avulsion fractured pelvic region of trunk

name: Avulsion fractured epiphysis of femur
label: Avulsion fractured epiphysis of femur
definition: A fractured in which the fragment of the epiphysis of femur bone tears away from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

name: Emotional hypersensitivity
label: Emotional hypersensitivity
definition: Heightened emotional reactivity to environmental stimuli, including emotions of others.

name: Beau's lines
label: Beau's lines
definition: A nail dystrophy that is preseents as grooved lines that run from side to side on the fingernail or the toenail that may look like indentations or ridges on the nail plate. They are caused by temporary disruption in the growth of proximal nail matrix. Trauma is usually the initiating factor such as infections, severe medical illnesses, major surgery/anesthesia, medication side effects, and autoimmune disease.

name: Complete tracheal ring
label: Complete tracheal ring
definition: Continuous or nearly continuous configuration of the cartilaginous tracheal ring.

name: Decreased middle cerebral artery pulsatility index
label: Decreased middle cerebral artery pulsatility index
definition: Abnormally reduced blood flow pulsatility in in the middle cerebral artery (MCA). The pulsatility index (PI) is calculated using the following equation PI = (peak systolic velocity-end-diastolic velocity)/mean velocity.

label: Fractured metaphysis of femur

definition: A partial or complete breakage of the fibula.

name: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 5
label: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 5
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the metatarsal bone of digit 5.

name: Fractured manual digit bone
label: Fractured manual digit bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the manual digit bone.

name: Fractured metacarpal bone of digit 1
label: Fractured metacarpal bone of digit 1
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the metacarpal bone of digit 1.

name: Fractured distal tarsal bone
label: Fractured distal tarsal bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the distal tarsal bone.

name: Fractured distal tarsal bone 2
label: Fractured distal tarsal bone 2
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the distal tarsal bone 2.

name: Fractured distal tarsal bone 3
label: Fractured distal tarsal bone 3
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the distal tarsal bone 3.

name: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 4
label: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 4
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the metatarsal bone of digit 4.

name: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 1
label: Fractured metatarsal bone of digit 1
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the metatarsal bone of digit 1.

name: obsolete Fractured skeleton of manual acropodium
label: obsolete Fractured skeleton of manual acropodium

name: Fractured ilium
label: Fractured ilium
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the ilium.

name: Fractured bone of jaw
label: Fractured bone of jaw
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the bone of jaw.

name: Fractured hindlimb bone
label: Fractured hindlimb bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the hindlimb bone.

name: Fractured middle phalanx of manus
label: Fractured middle phalanx of manus
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the middle phalanx of manus.

name: Fractured patella
label: Fractured patella
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the patella.

name: Fractured manual digit 1 phalanx
label: Fractured manual digit 1 phalanx
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the manual digit 1 phalanx.

name: Fractured phalanx of pes
label: Fractured phalanx of pes
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the phalanx of pes.

name: Fractured phalanx of manus
label: Fractured phalanx of manus
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the phalanx of manus.

name: Fractured proximal phalanx of manus
label: Fractured proximal phalanx of manus
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the proximal phalanx of manus.

name: Fractured scapula
label: Fractured scapula
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the scapula.

name: Fractured shoulder bone
label: Fractured shoulder bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the shoulder bone.

name: Fractured sternum
label: Fractured sternum
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the sternum.

name: Fractured tarsal bone
label: Fractured tarsal bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the tarsal bone.

name: Fractured carpal bone
label: Fractured carpal bone
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the carpal bone.

name: Fractured nose
label: Fractured nose
definition: A partial or complete breakage of the nose.

name: Abnormal ossification of the trapezoid bone
label: Abnormal ossification of the trapezoid bone

name: Neural tube defect
label: Neural tube defect
definition: A neural tube defect arises when the neural tube, the embryonic precursor of the brain and spinal cord, fails to close during neurulation. The cranial region (anencephaly) or the low spine (open spina bifida; myelomeningocele) are most commonly affected although, in the severe NTD craniorachischisis, almost the entire neural tube remains open, from midbrain to low spine.

name: Aplasia of lymphatic vessels
label: Aplasia of lymphatic vessels
definition: Aplasia (absence) of the lymphatic vessels.

name: Decreased urine bicarbonate concentration
label: Decreased urine bicarbonate concentration
definition: Abnormally decreased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

name: obsolete Elevated serum long-chain fatty acids
label: obsolete Elevated serum long-chain fatty acids

name: Congenital malformation of the left heart
label: Congenital malformation of the left heart
definition: Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the left heart identifiable at birth.

name: Narrow palpebral fissure
label: Narrow palpebral fissure
definition: Reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids.

name: Microlissencephaly
label: Microlissencephaly
definition: Severe microcephaly and lissencephaly with granular surfaces with immature cortical plate, reduced in thickness, with focal polymicrogyria and immature small neurons with rare processes, intermingled with a considerable number of glial elements.|This is a severe phenotype that can be diagnosed at the fetopathological level, by which a diagnosis of lissencephaly can be made by the examination of the 6 layers of the cortex. Examination may show 3 layers or an extremely thin cortical plate consistent with the diagnosis of lissencephaly.

name: Eosinophilic fasciitis
label: Eosinophilic fasciitis
definition: Inflammation and thickening (localized fibrosis) of the fascia, the tissue under the skin and over the muscle, typically associated with a build up of eosinophils in the muscles and tissues.

name: Elevated urinary aminoisobutyric acid
label: Elevated urinary aminoisobutyric acid
definition: An increased amount of 3-aminoisobutyric acid in the urine.

name: Gastric lymphoma
label: Gastric lymphoma
definition: Lymphoma that originates in the stomach itself.|An uncommon condition, that accounts for less than 15% of gastric malignancies and about 2% of all lymphomas.

name: Osteolysis involving bones of the upper limbs
label: Osteolysis involving bones of the upper limbs

name: Abnormal lactate dehydrogenase activity
label: Abnormal lactate dehydrogenase activity
definition: A deviation from the normal serum concentration/activity of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), which catalyzes the reduction of pyruvate to form lactate.

name: Reduced lactate dehydrogenase B level
label: Reduced lactate dehydrogenase B level
definition: Lactate dehydrogenase catalyzes the interconversion of lactate and pyruvate. The B subunit of that enzyme is encoded by LDHB.

name: Decreased serum complement C4
label: Decreased serum complement C4
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C4 in the circulation.

name: Decreased serum complement C4a
label: Decreased serum complement C4a
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C4a in circulation.

name: Decreased serum complement C4b
label: Decreased serum complement C4b
definition: A reduced level of the complement component C4b in circulation.

name: Reduced insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level
label: Reduced insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level
definition: Blood concentration of insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level below normal limits.|Insulin-like growth factor binding protein, acid labile subunit, also known as IGFALS, is a protein which in humans is encoded by the IGFALS gene.

name: HbS hemoglobin
label: HbS hemoglobin
definition: Presence of an abnormal type of hemoglobin characterized by the subsitution of a glutamic acid residue at position 7 following the initial methionine residue by a valine (the mutation causative of sickle cell disease). The mutation promotes the polymerization of the HbS under conditions of low oxygen concentration. HbS can be identified by multiple methodologies including hemoglobin electrophoresis and high-performance liquid chromatography.

name: Increased HbA2 hemoglobin
label: Increased HbA2 hemoglobin
definition: An elevated concentration in the blood of hemoglobin A2 (HbA2), which is a normal variant of hemoglobin A that consists of two alpha and two delta chains and is normally present at low levels in adults but may be increased in beta thalassemia.

name: Abnormal DLCO
label: Abnormal DLCO
definition: An abnormal amount of oxygen passes into the blood from the lungs and/or an abnormal amount of carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the lungs.|A test of the diffusing capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide (DLCO) is one of the most clinically valuable tests of lung function.

name: Increased DLCO
label: Increased DLCO
definition: Factors that can increase the DLCO include polycythaemia, asthma (can also have normal DLCO) and increased pulmonary blood volume as occurs in exercise. Other factors are left to right intracardiac shunting, and alveolar hemorrhage.

name: Decreased DLCO
label: Decreased DLCO
definition: DLCO is decreased in any condition which affects the effective alveolar surface area

name: Abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus
label: Abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus
definition: Any abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus.

name: Abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus
label: Abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus
definition: Any abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus.

name: Brachial plexus neuropathy
label: Brachial plexus neuropathy
definition: Related to ticket: https://github.com/obophenotype/human-phenotype-ontology/issues/484

name: Tiger tail banding
label: Tiger tail banding
definition: An abnormal appearance of hair under polarizing microscopy (using crossed polarizers), whereby hair shafts show striking alternating bright and dark bands, often referred to as tiger tail banding.

name: Decreased levels of alpha-fetoprotein
label: Decreased levels of alpha-fetoprotein
definition: A decrease in the concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormality of the testis size
label: Abnormality of the testis size
definition: An anomaly of the size of the testicle (the male gonad).

name: Hyperkeratotic papule
label: Hyperkeratotic papule
definition: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point that is composed of localized hyperkeratosis (the latter may be demonstrated histopathologically).

name: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities
label: Aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities

name: Increased PIVKA-II
label: Increased PIVKA-II
definition: Des-gamma carboxyprothrombin (DCP) or pro-thrombin induced by vitamin K absence-II (PIVKA-II) is an abnormal prothrombin protein that is increased in the serum of patients with HCC. Generation of DCP is thought to be a result of an acquired defect in the post- translational carboxylation of the prothrombin precursor in malignant cells.|PIVKA-II can be measured by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

name: Serositis
label: Serositis
definition: Inflammation in any serous cavity.

name: Thin eyebrow
label: Thin eyebrow
definition: Decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

name: Sparse eyebrow
label: Sparse eyebrow
definition: Decreased density/number of eyebrow hairs.

name: Distal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
label: Distal femoral metaphyseal irregularity
definition: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the distal metaphysis of the femur.

name: Decreased proportion of CD3-positive T cells
label: Decreased proportion of CD3-positive T cells
definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of CD3-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Abnormality of body mass index
label: Abnormality of body mass index
definition: Anomaly in the weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of obesity and underweight compared to averages.

name: Decreased body mass index
label: Decreased body mass index
definition: Abnormally decreased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of underweight compared to averages.

name: Limb myoclonus
label: Limb myoclonus
definition: Limb myoclonus was noted in Early myoclonic encephalopathy. See PMID:27789573

name: Knee joint hypermobility
label: Knee joint hypermobility
definition: The ability of the knee to move past its normal range of motion, (knee hyperextension is greater than 10 degrees).

name: Clinical relevance
label: Clinical relevance
definition: Subontology for annotating phenotypic features as distinctive or minor findings in patients. The subontology is intended to be used to annotate subjective clinical impressions of whether a certain finding is important for the differential diagnosis.

name: Distinctive finding
label: Distinctive finding
definition: In clinical parlance, findings are occasionally interpreted as being distinctive or minor, reflecting a subjective clinical impression of the importance of a feature for the differential diagnosis. A minor finding is taken to be one that is likely to have high utility in distinguishing the correct diagnosis from other candidates in the differential.

name: Minor finding
label: Minor finding
definition: In clinical parlance, findings are occasionally interpreted as being distinctive or minor, reflecting a subjective clinical impression of the importance of a feature for the differential diagnosis. A minor finding is taken to be one that is unlikely to help distinguish the correct diagnosis from other candidates in the differential.

name: Anorgasmia
label: Anorgasmia
definition: Inability of individual to reach orgasm.

name: Increased libido
label: Increased libido
definition: Elevated sexual desire.

name: Decreased libido
label: Decreased libido
definition: Decreased sexual desire.

name: Hand pain
label: Hand pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort localized to the hand.

name: Pain in head and neck region
label: Pain in head and neck region

name: Bradypnea
label: Bradypnea
definition: Bradypnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally slow.

name: Abnormal cervical spine morphology
label: Abnormal cervical spine morphology
definition: Any morphological abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Early onset of sexual maturation
label: Early onset of sexual maturation
definition: An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious.

name: Malignant mesothelioma
label: Malignant mesothelioma
definition: Malignant mesothelioma is a form of cancer that originates from the cells of the mesothelium, a thin tissue layer surrounding the body's internal organs. Malignant mesothelioma is almost exclusively caused by asbestos exposure, pleural mesothelioma beeing the most common form, affecting the lining of the lungs called the pleura. Other forms such as perioneal-, percardial- or testicular- mesothelioma are much rarer.

name: Pleural mesothelioma
label: Pleural mesothelioma
definition: A malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pleura (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the lungs). Pleural mesothelioma is the most common form of mesothelioma.

name: Peritoneal mesothelioma
label: Peritoneal mesothelioma
definition: A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the peritoneum (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the abdomen). Peritoneal mesothelioma is the second most common form of mesothelioma after pleural mesothelioma.

name: Pericardial mesothelioma
label: Pericardial mesothelioma
definition: A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pericardium (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the heart).

name: Testicular mesothelioma
label: Testicular mesothelioma
definition: A Malignant mesothelioma of the testis.|Testicular mesothelioma originates from cells of the tunica vaginalis (the thin layer of mesothelium surrounding the testicles). Testicular mesothelioma is the rarest form of mesothelioma.

name: Neoplasm of the central nervous system
label: Neoplasm of the central nervous system
definition: A neoplasm of the central nervous system.

name: Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system
label: Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour) of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Schwannoma
label: Schwannoma
definition: A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.|Glial cells are cells that support nerve cells. Schwann cells wrap around the axon to form the myelin sheath. Schwann cells are involved in many important aspects of peripheral nerve biology; the conduction of nervous impulses along axons, nerve development and regeneration, trophic support for neurons, production of the nerve extracellular matrix and presentation of antigens to T-lymphocytes. Charcot-Marie-Tooth disease (CMT), Guillain-Barre syndrome (GBS), schwannomatosis and chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (CIDP) are all neuropathies involving Schwann cells.

name: Neoplasm of the eye
label: Neoplasm of the eye
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the eye.

name: Neoplasm of the breast
label: Neoplasm of the breast
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the breast.

name: Epiretinal membrane
label: Epiretinal membrane
definition: An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy.

name: Stahl ear
label: Stahl ear
definition: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e. third, crus of the helix in the helix, arising at or above the normal bifurcation of the antihelix.|The helix is often poorly formed. Four types have been recognized in the surgical literature [Yamada and Fukuda, 1980].

name: Abnormality of mesentery morphology
label: Abnormality of mesentery morphology
definition: Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).

name: Capsular cataract
label: Capsular cataract
definition: A cataract that affects the capsule of the lens.

name: Nuclear cataract
label: Nuclear cataract
definition: A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the lens nucleus. That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown.

name: Cortical cataract
label: Cortical cataract
definition: A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the lens cortex. It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance.

name: Posterior capsular cataract
label: Posterior capsular cataract
definition: A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly.

name: Cerebral palsy
label: Cerebral palsy
definition: Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behaviour, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.

name: Abnormality of movement
label: Abnormality of movement
definition: An abnormality of movement with a neurological basis characterized by changes in coordination and speed of voluntary movements.|Movement disorders are characterized by the phenotypic abnormalities including abnormal involuntary movements, akathisia, akinesia, athetosis, ataxia, ballismus, bradykinesia, chorea, dyskinesia, dystonia, and myoclonus tics, tremor, spasms, and stereotypy.

name: Recurrent hand flapping
label: Recurrent hand flapping
definition: A type of stereotypic behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands up and down.

name: Conspicuously happy disposition
label: Conspicuously happy disposition
definition: An unusually happy aspect over time which can also may be observed during inappropriate situations that should be causing for example distress, fear or anger.

name: Overfriendliness
label: Overfriendliness
definition: A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate people-orientation and friendliness towards others on an inadequate level which might go as far as being dangerous considering for example young children following strangers without restriction.

name: Arteriovenous malformation
label: Arteriovenous malformation
definition: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries.

name: Recurrent pancreatitis
label: Recurrent pancreatitis
definition: A recurrent form of pancreatitis.

name: Ectopic thyroid
label: Ectopic thyroid
definition: Mislocalised thyroid gland.|An aberrant or ectopic thyroid gland may occur anywhere along the path of initial descent of the thyroid. A total failure to descend contrasts with the incomplete descent of the thyroid, in which case the resulting final resting point of the gland may be high in the neck or just below the hyoid bone. Appart from an abnormal descent, accessory thyroid tissue can also occur, arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.

name: Lingual thyroid
label: Lingual thyroid
definition: An aberrant thyroid gland or Ectopic thyroid located at the base of the tongue, just posterior to the foramen cecum as a result of a failure of the thyroid to descend.|A lingual thyroid is the most common form of an aberrant thyroid gland.

name: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue
label: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue
definition: Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.|While the accessory thyroid tissue may be functional, it is generally insufficient for normal function if the main thyroid gland is entirely removed.

name: Neoplasm of the thyroid gland
label: Neoplasm of the thyroid gland
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thyroid gland.

name: Tics
label: Tics
definition: Repeated, individually recognizable, intermittent movements or movement fragments that are almost always briefly suppresable and are usually associated with awareness of an urge to perform the movement.|Tics can be invisible to the observer, such as abdominal tensing or toe crunching. Common motor and phonic tics are, respectively, eye blinking and throat clearing. Movements of other movement disorders (for example, chorea, dystonia, myoclonus) must be distinguished from tics. Other conditions, such as autism and stereotypic movement disorder, also include movements which may be confused with tics. Tics must also be distinguished from the compulsions of OCD and from seizure activity. Tics may increase as a result of stress, fatigue, boredom, or high-energy emotions, which can include negative emotions, such as anxiety, but positive emotions as well, such as excitement or anticipation. Relaxation may result in a tic increase (for instance, watching television or using a computer), while concentration on an absorbing activity often leads to a decrease in tics.

name: Motor tics
label: Motor tics
definition: Movement-based tics affecting discrete muscle groups.

name: Phonic tics
label: Phonic tics
definition: Involuntary sounds produced by moving air through the nose, mouth, or throat. The vocal cords are not involved in all tics that produce sound.

name: Pseudo-fractures
label: Pseudo-fractures
definition: A band of bone material of decreased density forming alongside the surface of the cortical bone with thickening of the periosteum. Callus formation in the affected area is common and gives the appearance of a false fracture.|Typical sites of involvement are the axillary margins of the scapula, ribs, pubic rami, proximal ends of the femur and ulna. On x-rays pseudo-fractures appear as a lucent line about 1 -2 cm wide, vertical to the cortex and are pathognomonic of osteomalacia, seen on the concave side and are also seen in Paget disease on the convex side of the bone.

name: Abnormality of the scalp hair
label: Abnormality of the scalp hair
definition: An abnormality of the hair of head.

name: Slow-growing scalp hair
label: Slow-growing scalp hair
definition: Scalp hair whose growth is slower than normal.

name: Thickened cortex of bones
label: Thickened cortex of bones
definition: An Abnormality of cortical bone leading to an abnormal thickness of the cortex of affected bones.

name: Broad 2nd toe
label: Broad 2nd toe
definition: A broad appearance of the second toe.|Note that an apparent broad appearance might be due to a hidden duplication.

name: Broad 3rd toe
label: Broad 3rd toe
definition: A broad appearance of the third toe.

name: Broad 4th toe
label: Broad 4th toe
definition: A broad appearance of the fourth toe.

name: Broad 5th toe
label: Broad 5th toe
definition: A broad appearance of the fifth toe.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 2nd toe
label: Ivory epiphyses of the 2nd toe
definition: Epiphyses of the 2nd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 2nd toe
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 2nd toe.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd toe
label: Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd toe
definition: Epiphyses of the 3rd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 3rd toe
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 3rd toe.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 4th toe
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 4th toe

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 4th toe
label: Ivory epiphyses of the 4th toe
definition: Epiphyses of the 4th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 4th toe
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 4th toe
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 4th toe.

name: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
label: Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the 5th toe

name: Ivory epiphyses of the 5th toe
label: Ivory epiphyses of the 5th toe
definition: Epiphyses of the 5th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

name: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
label: Stippling of the epiphyses of the 5th toe
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the 5th toe.

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe

label: Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
definition: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe.

label: Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

label: Absent epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

label: Bracket epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Synostosis involving bones of the toes
label: Synostosis involving bones of the toes

name: Synostosis involving bones of the upper limbs
label: Synostosis involving bones of the upper limbs
definition: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the upper limbs.

name: Synostosis of joints
label: Synostosis of joints
definition: The abnormal fusion of neighboring bones across a joint.|Note that contracture refers to a reduction of joint mobility due to permanent shortening of the soft parts around a joint, muscles, tendons, ligaments, fasciae, or skin. Ankylosis and contracture can occur together or alone. Fibrous ankylosis refers to adhesions between the opposing surface of a joint. Cartilaginous ankylosis implies the fusion of two apposed cartilaginous surfaces. Bony ankylosis or synostosis refers to an osseous union between articulating surfaces.

name: Ectopic respiratory mucosa
label: Ectopic respiratory mucosa
definition: Ectopic respiratory epithelium presenting as a superficial lesion in the skin usually localised unilateral in the skin of the forearm and associated with ipsilateral hand malformations.|Ectopic respiratory mucosa is a very rare finding and has been associated with unilateral skeletal malformation, most commonly with preaxial polydactyly which may be mirror-image like.

name: Sarcoma
label: Sarcoma
definition: A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells. Bone and soft tissue sarcomas are the main types of sarcoma. Sarcoma is usually highly malignant.|A sarcoma (from the Greek sarx meaning flesh) is a general term describing a malignant neoplasm, or cancer, that arises from transformed connective tissue cells such as bone, cartilage and fat cells, which originate from embryonic mesoderm. This is in contrast to carcinomas, which are of epithelial origin (breast, colon, pancreas, and others). However, due to an evolving understanding of tissue origin, the term sarcoma is sometimes applied to tumors now known to arise from epithelial tissue. The term soft tissue sarcoma is used to describe tumors of soft tissue, which includes elements that are in connective tissue, but not derived from it (such as muscles and blood vessels).

name: Leiomyosarcoma
label: Leiomyosarcoma
definition: A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.

name: Fibrosarcoma
label: Fibrosarcoma
definition: A fibroblastic sarcoma is a malignant tumor derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells.

name: Desmoid tumors
label: Desmoid tumors
definition:
Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.|Most cases are sporadic, but some are associated with familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP). Approximately 10% of individuals with Gardner's syndrome, a type of FAP with extracolonic features, have desmoid tumors.
Risk factors for desmoid disease amongst FAP patients include female gender, a 3' APC mutation, a positive family history and a history of previous abdominal surgery.

name: Osteoma
label: Osteoma
definition: Osteomas are bony growths found most commonly on the skull and mandible; however, they may occur in any bone of the body. Osteomas do not usually cause clinical problems and do not become malignant.

name: Recurrent singultus
label: Recurrent singultus
definition: A contraction of the diaphragm that repeats several times per minute. In humans, the abrupt rush of air into the lungs causes the epiglottis to close, creating a hic sound. Also known as synchronous diaphragmatic flutter (SDF), or singultus, from the Latin singult, the act of catching one's breath while sobbing. The hiccup is an involuntary action involving a reflex arc.|A bout of hiccups, in general, resolves itself without intervention, although many home remedies claim to shorten the duration, and medical treatment is occasionally necessary in cases of chronic hiccups. Hiccups are caused by many central and peripheral nervous system disorders, all from injury or irritation to the phrenic and vagus nerves, as well as toxic or metabolic disorders affecting the aforementioned systems. Hiccups often occur after consuming carbonated beverages, alcohol, dry breads, or spicy foods. Prolonged laughter or eating too fast are also known to cause hiccups. Persistent or intractable hiccups may be caused by any condition which irritates or damages the relevant nerves.

name: Hemiballismus
label: Hemiballismus
definition: Hemiballismus is a rare movement disorder that is caused primarily by damage to various areas in the basal ganglia. Hemiballismus is usually characterized by involuntary flinging motions of the extremities. The movements are often violent and have wide amplitudes of motion. They are continuous and random and can involve proximal and/or distal muscles on one side of the body, while some cases even include the facial muscles. The more a patient is active, the more the movements increase. With relaxation comes a decrease in movements.|Hemiballismus is a very rare movement disorder. It is five hundred times rarer than Parkinson disease. Its effects can sometimes be severe enough to prevent patients from being able to perform daily functions. It is usually associated with structural brain lesions but can occur with metabolic abnormalities. The symptoms can also decrease while the patient is asleep, unlike some movement disorders. Ballism refers to very large-amplitude choreic movements of the proximal parts of the limbs, causing flinging and flailing limb movements. Ballism is most frequently unilateral, in which case it is referred to as hemiballism

name: Calcification of muscles
label: Calcification of muscles
definition: Deposition of calcium salts in muscle tissue.

name: Meningeal calcification
label: Meningeal calcification
definition: Calcium deposition affecting the Meninges.|In general, meningeal calcifications are plaque-like and bilateral as seen on CT-scans.

name: Multiple central nervous system lipomas
label: Multiple central nervous system lipomas
definition: The presence of mulitple lipomas located in the central nervous system.

name: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
label: Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones
definition: An abnormality of the medullary cavity (medulla, innermost part), which is the central cavity of bone shafts where red bone marrow and/or yellow bone marrow (adipose tissue) is stored.

name: Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones
label: Stenosis of the medullary cavity of the long bones

name: Metaphyseal dysplasia
label: Metaphyseal dysplasia
definition: The presence of dysplastic regions in metaphyseal regions.

name: Senile plaques
label: Senile plaques
definition: Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.|Senile plaques can be found in human and animal brains. From an age of 60 years (10%) to an age of 80 years (60%) the proportion of people with plaques increases approximately linearly. A small number of plaques can be due to the physiological process of aging. Women are slightly more likely to have plaques than males. The plaques occur commonly in the amygdoid nucleus and the sulci of the cortex of brain. The deposits are associated with degenerative neural structures and an abundance of microglia and astrocytes. Large numbers of senile plaques and neurofibrillary tangles are characteristic features of Alzheimers disease, and some of the abnormal neurites in senile plaques are composed primarily of paired helical filaments, a component of neurofibrillary tangles. In Alzheimer's disease they are primarily composed of amyloid beta peptides. These polypeptides tend to aggregate and are believed to be neurotoxic.

name: Ectrodactyly
label: Ectrodactyly
definition: A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.|Hands and feet in one individual might be similarly affected or very diverse and the phenotype is very variable even within families. Penetrance is reduced and some idnividuals have been observed presenting only with unilateral smaller 2nd toe which may be overlooked till a much more severly affected family member is seen.

name: Preaxial polydactyly
label: Preaxial polydactyly
definition: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the thumb or great toe.

name: Postaxial polydactyly
label: Postaxial polydactyly
definition: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.

name: Mesoaxial polydactyly
label: Mesoaxial polydactyly
definition: The presence of a supernumerary finger or toe (not a thumb or hallux) involving the third or fourth metacarpal/tarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Abnormal tendon morphology
label: Abnormal tendon morphology
definition: An abnormality of the structure or form of the tendons, also often called sinews.|A tendon (or sinew) is a tough band of fibrous connective tissue that usually connects muscle to bone and is capable of withstanding tension. Tendons are similar to ligaments and fascia as they are all made of collagen except that ligaments join one bone to another bone, and fascia connect muscles to other muscles. Tendons and muscles work together and can only exert a pulling force.

name: Synostosis of carpals/tarsals
label: Synostosis of carpals/tarsals
definition: The carpus consists of the scaphoid, lunate, triquetal, pisiform, captitate, hamate, trapezoid, and trapezium bones. The tarsus consists of the talus, calcaneus, navicular, cuboid, cuneiform, and navicular bones. This term applies if there is any fusion among the bones of the carpus or tarsus.

name: Lip pit
label: Lip pit
definition: A depression located on a lip.

name: Upper lip pit
label: Upper lip pit
definition: Depression located on the vermilion of the upper lip, usually paramedian.|A lip pit may be connected by a fistula to mucous minor salivary glands in the upper lip. In addition, a lip pit may on occasion be seen with a surrounding tissue elevation (mound). Pits located at the labial commisure (cheilon) are distinct from lip pits (see Commissural pit).

name: Paramedian lip pit
label: Paramedian lip pit
definition: Depression located paramedially on the vermilion of a lip.|A lip pit may be connected by a fistula to mucous minor salivary glands in the upper or lower lip. In addition, a lip pit may on occasion be seen with a surrounding tissue elevation (mound). Pits located at the labial commisure (cheilon) are distinct from lip pits (see Commissural pit).

name: Abnormality of dorsoventral patterning of the limbs
label: Abnormality of dorsoventral patterning of the limbs
definition: An abnormality resulting from a defect or disruption of dorsoventral patterning that normally happens during early development of the limbs. A disruption of the normal development of the dorsoventral axis may lead to a variable spectrum of different phenotypic abnormalities that may affect the nails and or palmar and dorsal side of the hands and/or feet, ultimately changing the normal dorsoventral appearance of the affected limbs.

name: Hyponasal speech
label: Hyponasal speech
definition: Hyponasal speech is when there is an abnormally reduced nasal airflow during speech often in a setting of nasal obstruction or congestion.

name: Branchial sinus
label: Branchial sinus
definition: A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal.|Branchial sinuses have to be distinguished from the preauricular cysts and sinuses, which are ectodermal remnants from an aberrant development of the auditory tubercles, tend to be bilateral, and are localized anterior to the tragus of the ear.

name: Gustatory lacrimation
label: Gustatory lacrimation
definition: Gustatory lacrimation results from an aberrant innervation of fibres from the seventh cranial nerve to the pterygopalatine ganglion which are destined originally for the submandibular ganglion. This aberrant innervation leads to uncontrollable tearing while eating or in anticipation of a meal.|The aberrant innervation leading to this phenomenon may be seen for example as a hereditary trait in some patients with Branchio-oto-renal (BOR) syndrome in which case it may occur unilateral or bilateral, but it may also result from a secondary aberrant reinnervation following a peripheral facial palsy, in which case it is associated with uncontrollable ipsilateral tearing. In the past gustatory lacrimation was considered to be a very rare non-hereditary type of anomalous, cranial nerve-end organ innervation but rare occurences in patients with Branchio-oto-renal (BOR) syndrome have shown, that this feature may also appear as a hereditary condition.

name: Diffuse cerebellar atrophy
label: Diffuse cerebellar atrophy
definition: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebellum.

name: Skin pit
label: Skin pit
definition: A small, skin-lined tract that leads from the surface to deep within the tissues.

name: Periauricular skin pits
label: Periauricular skin pits
definition: Benign congenital lesions of the periauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

name: Ulcerative colitis
label: Ulcerative colitis
definition: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that includes characteristic ulcers, or open sores, in the colon. The main symptom of active disease is usually constant diarrhea mixed with blood, of gradual onset and intermittent periods of exacerbated symptoms contrasting with periods that are relatively symptom-free. In contrast to Crohn's disease this special form of colitis begins in the distal parts of the rectum, spreads continually upwards and affects only mucose and submucose tissue of the colon.

name: Crohn's disease
label: Crohn's disease
definition: A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation.

name: Chronic colitis
label: Chronic colitis
definition: A chronic inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).

name: Acute colitis
label: Acute colitis
definition: An acute and self-limited inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).

name: EMG: continuous motor unit activity at rest
label: EMG: continuous motor unit activity at rest
definition: Continuous electromyographic activity of motor units at rest, i.e., without voluntary movement of the muscles.|The motor unit contains an anterior horn cell, its axon, and all of the muscle fibers that it innervates via the neuromuscular junction. Note that a healthy relaxed muscle does not show significant EMG activity at rest.

name: EMG: myotonic discharges
label: EMG: myotonic discharges
definition: High frequency discharges in electromyography (EMG) that vary in amplitude and frequency, waxing and waning continuously with firing frequencies ranging from 150/second down to 20/second and producing a sound that has been referred to as a dive bomber sound.

name: EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission
label: EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission
definition: An electromyographic finding associated with erratic or absent neuromuscular transmission with erratic, moment-to-moment changes in the shape of the motor unit potential (MUP).

name: EMG: slow motor conduction
label: EMG: slow motor conduction
definition: The presence of reduced conduction velocity of motor nerves on electromyography.

name: EMG: myokymic discharges
label: EMG: myokymic discharges
definition: The presence of spontaneous bursts of rapidly firing potentials that recur at regular intervals of 2-10 per second and are unaffected by voluntary effort. This is an electromyographic (EMG) finding.

name: Abnormality of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials
label: Abnormality of pattern reversal visual evoked potentials

name: Abnormality of peripheral somatosensory evoked potentials
label: Abnormality of peripheral somatosensory evoked potentials

name: Abnormality of central somatosensory evoked potentials
label: Abnormality of central somatosensory evoked potentials

name: Amyloidosis of peripheral nerves
label: Amyloidosis of peripheral nerves
definition: The presence of amyloid deposition in the nerves of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Muscle fiber inclusion bodies
label: Muscle fiber inclusion bodies
definition: This should have logical def changed to reference a generic muscle fiber but this is not yet in CL.

name: Muscle fiber tubular inclusions
label: Muscle fiber tubular inclusions
definition: Unusual regions of densely packed membranous tubules known as tubular aggregates which present as membranous inclusions, derived from membranes of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria, containing miscellaneous proteins with a variety of enzymatic activities.

name: Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
label: Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

name: Muscle fiber intranuclear inclusion bodies
label: Muscle fiber intranuclear inclusion bodies
definition: The presence of inclusion bodies within the nucleus of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

name: Ring fibers
label: Ring fibers
definition: Ring fibers are formed by a bundle of peripheral myofibrils which are circumferentially oriented such that they encircle the internal portion of the sarcoplasm which is normal in structure and orientation.

name: Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy
label: Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy
definition: Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.

name: Subdural hemorrhage
label: Subdural hemorrhage
definition: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater.|Usually resulting from tears in veins that cross the subdural space, subdural hemorrhage may cause an increase in intracranial pressure, which can cause compression of and damage to delicate brain tissue. Subdural hematomas are often life-threatening when acute, but chronic subdural hematomas are usually not deadly if treated.

name: Epidural hemorrhage
label: Epidural hemorrhage
definition: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the skull.|Intracranial bleeding occuring between the dura mater (the tough outer membrane of the central nervous system) and the skull. The dura mater also covers the spine, so epidural bleeds may also occur in the spinal column.

name: Cerebral germinoma
label: Cerebral germinoma
definition: The presence of a germ cell tumor of the cerebrum.

name: Cerebral granulomatosis
label: Cerebral granulomatosis
definition: Cerebral inflammation involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.|A granuloma is a compact (organized) collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes (macrophages and/or epithelioid cells) which may or may not be accompanied by accessory features such as necrosis or the infiltration of other inflammatory leukocytes (Adams DO. The granulomatous inflammatory response. Am J Pathol 1976:84:163-192).

name: Cerebral inclusion bodies
label: Cerebral inclusion bodies
definition: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cells of the brain.|Inclusion bodies are usually derived from proteins.

name: Hirano bodies
label: Hirano bodies
definition: Intracellular aggregates of actin and actin-associated proteins within nerve cells.

name: Argyrophilic inclusion bodies
label: Argyrophilic inclusion bodies
definition: Presence of abundant argyrophilic grains and coiled bodies on microscopic examination of brain tissue.

name: Lafora bodies
label: Lafora bodies
definition: An intraneuronal inclusion body composed of acid mucopolysaccharides.

name: Cerebral hyaline bodies
label: Cerebral hyaline bodies
definition: Cerebral eosinophilic, discrete, intracytoplasmatic inclusions of unknown significance.

name: Rosenthal fibers
label: Rosenthal fibers
definition: Thick, elongated, worm-like or corkscrew eosinophilic bundle that are found on H&E staining of the brain in the presence of long standing gliosis, occasional tumors, and some metabolic disorders.

name: Abnormality of the dentate nucleus
label: Abnormality of the dentate nucleus
definition: An abnormality of the dentate nucleus.

name: Juvenile aseptic necrosis
label: Juvenile aseptic necrosis
definition: Juvenile aseptic necrosis comprises a group of orthopedic diseases characterized by interruption of the blood supply of a bone, followed by localized bony necrosis most often of the epiphyses of bones of children or teenagers.|Causes may be rapid growth, heredity, trauma or overuse and anatomic conformation.

name: Scleroderma
label: Scleroderma
definition: A chronic autoimmune phenomenon characterized by fibrosis (or hardening) and vascular alterations of the skin.|A chronic autoimmune disease characterized by fibrosis (or hardening), vascular alterations, and autoantibodies. Sclerosis of the skin occurs in association with disorders as diverse as dermatomyositis, Werner's syndrome, porphyria, muscle glycogenesis, primary systemic amyloidosis, melorheostosis, and malignancy including the carcinoid syndrome. This term is intended to represent the phenotypic feature scleroderma rather than a particular disease.

name: Immunologic hypersensitivity
label: Immunologic hypersensitivity
definition: Immunological states where the immune system produces harmful responses upon reexposure to sensitising antigens.

name: Cow milk allergy
label: Cow milk allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against cow milk protein.

name: Carpometacarpal synostosis
label: Carpometacarpal synostosis
definition: Fusion involving carpal and metacarpal bones.

name: Unilateral cleft lip
label: Unilateral cleft lip
definition: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on one side only.

name: Non-midline cleft lip
label: Non-midline cleft lip
definition: Clefting of the upper lip affecting the lateral portions of the upper lip rather than the midline/median region.

name: Bilateral cleft lip
label: Bilateral cleft lip
definition: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on the left and right sides.

name: Bilateral cleft palate
label: Bilateral cleft palate
definition: Nonmidline cleft palate on the left and right sides.

name: Abnormality of the os naviculare pedis
label: Abnormality of the os naviculare pedis

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
definition: The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
definition: The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe
label: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe
definition: The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contractures of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe
label: Contractures of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe
definition: The proximal interphalangeal joint of the fifth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

label: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contractures of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe
label: Contractures of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
label: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 2nd toe
definition: The joint between the second metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
label: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 3rd toe
definition: The joint between the second metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 4th toe
label: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 4th toe
definition: The joint between the second metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 5th toe
label: Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 5th toe
definition: The joint between the second metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

label: Contractures of the joints of the upper limbs

label: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe

label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
definition: Uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
definition: Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the middle phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Symphalangism affecting the distal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 3rd toe
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 3rd toe
definition: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 3rd toe.

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 4th toe
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 4th toe
definition: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 4th toe.

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th toe
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th toe
definition: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 5th toe.

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe with the 2nd metatarsal
label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe with the 2nd metatarsal

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe with the 3rd metatarsal
label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe with the 3rd metatarsal

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe with the 4th metatarsal
label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe with the 4th metatarsal

name: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe with the 5th metatarsal
label: Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe with the 5th metatarsal

name: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux with the 1st metatarsal
label: Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux with the 1st metatarsal

name: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 2nd toe
label: Proximal/middle symphalangism of 2nd toe
definition: Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe.

name: Camptodactyly of finger
label: Camptodactyly of finger
definition: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.|Note that some restrict the use of the term to inability to extend the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fifth finger. We do not restrict the term in this way. This term should not be used if the patient has Clenched hand. A similar effect can be created by radial angulation within the distal phalanx with thickening of the epiphysis, which is called Kirner deformity or dystelephalangy. The affected digits should be specified.

name: Joint contractures involving the joints of the feet
label: Joint contractures involving the joints of the feet
definition: Contractures of one ore more joints of the feet meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Hypoammonemia
label: Hypoammonemia
definition: A decreased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

name: Abnormal mast cell morphology
label: Abnormal mast cell morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of mast cells, which are found in almost all tissues and contain numerous basophilic granules and are capable of releasing large amounts of histamine and heparin upon activation.|Mast cells (or mastocytes) can be found in several types of tissues and contain many granules rich in histamine and heparin. Although best known for their role in allergy and anaphylaxis, mast cells play an important protective role as well, being intimately involved in wound healing and defense against pathogens. Mast cells possess a non-lobed nucleus and can work with basophils in the immune defense against worms. Their cell membrane is covered with Fc recepros that may be attached to class E antibodies.

name: Mastocytosis
label: Mastocytosis
definition: The presence of an increased number of mast cells and CD34+ mast cell precursors in the body.

name: Abnormality of the vitamin B3 metabolism
label: Abnormality of the vitamin B3 metabolism
definition: Vitamin B3 is also known as nicotinic acid, vitamin PP or Niacin and is one of the forty to eighty essential human nutrients.

name: Recurrent bronchiolitis
label: Recurrent bronchiolitis
definition: An increased susceptibility to bronchiolitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchiolitis.

name: Low levels of vitamin B1
label: Low levels of vitamin B1
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B1.

name: Low levels of vitamin B2
label: Low levels of vitamin B2
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B2.

name: Low levels of vitamin B5
label: Low levels of vitamin B5
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B5.

name: Low levels of vitamin B8
label: Low levels of vitamin B8
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin B8.

name: Reduced blood folate concentration
label: Reduced blood folate concentration
definition: A reduced circulating concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

name: Abnormality of vitamin metabolism
label: Abnormality of vitamin metabolism
definition: An anomaly in the metabolism of a vitamin.|Vitamins are organic substances that are essential in minute quantities and not produced within the body, instead being present in natural foodstuffs. Vitamins act as coenzymes or precursors of coenzymes in the regulation of metabolic processes.

name: Low levels of vitamin C
label: Low levels of vitamin C
definition: A reduced concentration of Vitamin C.

name: Low levels of vitamin D
label: Low levels of vitamin D
definition: A reduced concentration of Vitamin D.

name: Low levels of vitamin E
label: Low levels of vitamin E
definition: A reduced concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation. Vitamin E is a lipophilic vitamin that is also known as alpha-tocopherol.

name: Pollakisuria
label: Pollakisuria
definition: Increased frequency of urination.

name: Neoplasm of the ureter
label: Neoplasm of the ureter
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the ureter.

name: Neoplasm of the urethra
label: Neoplasm of the urethra
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the urethra.

name: Dysuria
label: Dysuria
definition: Painful or difficult urination.

name: Anuria
label: Anuria
definition: Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day.

name: Oliguria
label: Oliguria
definition: Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day.|The decreased output of urine may be a sign of dehydration, renal failure, hypovolemic shock, multiple organ dysfunction syndrome, or urinary obstruction/urinary retention.

name: Neoplasm of the thymus
label: Neoplasm of the thymus
