definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thymus.

name: Thymoma
label: Thymoma
definition: A tumor originating from the epithelial cells of the thymus.|Malignant lymphomas that involve the thymus, such as lymphoblastic lymphoma and Hodgkin lymphoma (erroneously termed "granulomatous thymoma" in the past), should not be regarded as thymomas. Thymoma is an uncommon tumor, best known for its association with the neuromuscular disorder myasthenia gravis. Thymoma is found in 15% of patients with myasthenia gravis.

name: Liver abscess
label: Liver abscess
definition: The presence of an abscess of the liver.

name: Limb duplication
label: Limb duplication
definition: Congenital duplication of all or part of a limb.

name: Urachus fistula
label: Urachus fistula
definition: Persistence of the urachal canal with drainage of urine from the bladder through the persistent allantois canal to the umbilicus.

name: Neoplasm of the lung
label: Neoplasm of the lung
definition: Tumor of the lung.

name: Pleuropulmonary blastoma
label: Pleuropulmonary blastoma
definition: A rare cancer originating in the lung or pleural cavity that occurs most often in infants and young children but also has been reported in adults. Pleuropulmonary blastoma is regarded as malignant.

name: Abnormal blood phosphate concentration
label: Abnormal blood phosphate concentration
definition: An abnormality of phosphate homeostasis or concentration in the body.

name: Abnormal calcium-phosphate regulating hormone level
label: Abnormal calcium-phosphate regulating hormone level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a hormone that is involved in the regulation of phosphate and calcium.

name: Wind-swept deformity of the knees
label: Wind-swept deformity of the knees
definition: The appearance of abnormal valgus deformity in one knee in association with varus deformity in the other.

name: Scleritis
label: Scleritis
definition: Inflammation of the sclera.|Scleritis may be accompanied by blurred vision, eye pain, redness of the (normally white) sclera, photophobia, and tearing.

name: Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
label: Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
definition: Inflammation of the eye, parts of the eye or the periorbital region.

name: Episcleritis
label: Episcleritis
definition: Inflammation of the episclera, a thin layer of tissue covering the white part (sclera) of the eye.|In contrast to conjunctivitis, with episcleritis the inflammation is generally limited to isolated parts of the sclera and is not diffuse.One can observe dilated episcleral blood vessels between regions of white sclera.

name: Abnormality of the fascia
label: Abnormality of the fascia
definition: An abnormality of fascia.

name: Fasciitis
label: Fasciitis
definition: Inflammation of fascia, the tissue under the skin and over the muscle.

name: Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
label: Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
definition: An anomaly of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

name: Periorbital edema
label: Periorbital edema
definition: Edema affecting the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

name: Palpebral edema
label: Palpebral edema
definition: Edema in the region of the eyelids.

name: Femoral hernia
label: Femoral hernia
definition: A hernia which occurs just below the inguinal ligament, where abdominal contents pass through a naturally occurring weakness called the femoral canal.|Femoral hernias are a relatively uncommon type, accounting for only 3% of all hernias. Femoral hernia appears as a bulge in the upper thigh.

name: Abnormal localization of kidney
label: Abnormal localization of kidney
definition: An abnormal site of the kidney.

name: Cognitive impairment
label: Cognitive impairment
definition: Abnormality in the process of thought including the ability to process information.

name: Neoplasm of the heart
label: Neoplasm of the heart
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the heart.

name: Arterial stenosis
label: Arterial stenosis
definition: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of an artery.

name: Carotid artery stenosis
label: Carotid artery stenosis
definition: Narrowing of the carotid arteries.|Carotid artery stenosis is usually caused by caused by atherosclerosis.

name: Abnormality of forebrain morphology
label: Abnormality of forebrain morphology
definition: An abnormality of the forebrain, which has as its parts the telencephalon, diencephalon, lateral ventricles and third ventricle.

name: Exstrophy
label: Exstrophy
definition: Eversion of a hollow organ and exposure, inside out, and protruded through the abdominal wall.

name: Tendon rupture
label: Tendon rupture
definition: Breakage (tear) of a tendon.|Tendon rupture is usually painful,and accompanied by swelling, inability to move, and bunching up of the muscle normally attached to the tendon.

name: Neoplasm of the trachea
label: Neoplasm of the trachea
definition: A neoplasm of the trachea.

name: Hemihypertrophy of lower limb
label: Hemihypertrophy of lower limb
definition: Overgrowth of only one leg.

name: Hemihypertrophy of upper limb
label: Hemihypertrophy of upper limb
definition: Overgrowth of only one arm.

name: Asymmetric growth
label: Asymmetric growth
definition: A growth pattern that displays an abnormal difference between the left and the right side.

name: Hemiatrophy
label: Hemiatrophy
definition: Undergrowth of the limbs that affects only one side.

name: Hemiatrophy of lower limb
label: Hemiatrophy of lower limb
definition: Unilateral atrophy (reduction in size) of a leg.

name: Hemiatrophy of upper limb
label: Hemiatrophy of upper limb
definition: Unilateral atrophy (reduction in size) of an arm.

name: Lower limb asymmetry
label: Lower limb asymmetry
definition: A difference in length or diameter between the left and right leg.

name: Upper limb asymmetry
label: Upper limb asymmetry
definition: Difference in length or size between the right and left arm.

name: Diplomyelia
label: Diplomyelia
definition: Duplication of the spinal cord.

name: Diastomatomyelia
label: Diastomatomyelia
definition: Coexistence of two hemicords, at variable levels, causing splaying of the posterior vertebral elements. Results in neurological deficits in lower limb or perineum.

name: Triplomyelia
label: Triplomyelia
definition: Triplication of the spinal cord - extremely rare.

name: Hydromyelia
label: Hydromyelia
definition: Dilation of central canal from incomplete fusion of the posterior columns or persistence of the primitive large canal of the embryo.

name: Amyelia
label: Amyelia
definition: Congenital absence of the spinal cord.

name: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
label: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the endocrine system.

name: Abnormally ossified vertebrae
label: Abnormally ossified vertebrae
definition: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of one or more vertebrae.

name: Carcinoid tumor
label: Carcinoid tumor
definition: A tumor formed from the endocrine (argentaffin) cells of the mucosal lining of a variety of organs including the stomach and intestine. These cells are from neuroectodermal origin.

name: Cardiac diverticulum
label: Cardiac diverticulum
definition: A cardiac diverticulum is a rare congenital malformation which is either fibrous or muscular.

name: Fibrous cardiac diverticulum
label: Fibrous cardiac diverticulum
definition: A fibrous cardiac diverticulum refers to an aneurysm and usually appears as an isolated congenital anomaly.

name: Biliary tract neoplasm
label: Biliary tract neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the biliary system.

name: Neoplasm of the gallbladder
label: Neoplasm of the gallbladder
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the gallbladder.

name: Amaurosis fugax
label: Amaurosis fugax
definition: A transient visual disturbance that is typically caused by a circulatory, ocular or neurological underlying condition.

name: Urinary bladder inflammation
label: Urinary bladder inflammation
definition: Inflammation of the urinary bladder.

name: Lipoatrophy
label: Lipoatrophy
definition: Localized loss of fat tissue.|This may occur as a result of subcutanous injections of insulin in the treatment of diabetes, from the use of human growth hormone or from subcutanous injections of Copaxone used for the treatment of multiple sclerosis. In the latter case, an injection may produce a small dent at the injection site. Lipoatrophy is also an adverse drug reaction that is associated with some antiretroviral drugs.

name: Mucosal telangiectasiae
label: Mucosal telangiectasiae
definition: Telangiectasia of the mucosa, the mucous membranes which are involved in absorption and secretion that line cavities that are exposed to the external environment and internal organs.

name: Barrett esophagus
label: Barrett esophagus
definition: An abnormal change (metaplasia) in the cells of the inferior portion of the esophagus. The normal squamous epithelium lining of the esophagus is replaced by metaplastic columnar epithelium. Columnar epithelium refers to a cell type that is typically found in more distal parts of the gastrointestinal system.|The medical significance of Barrett esophagus is its strong association with esophageal adenocarcinoma, a particularly lethal cancer.

name: Dilatation of renal calices
label: Dilatation of renal calices
definition: An abnormal enlargement of the renal calices, the system of ducts of the kidney that collect urine.

name: Nasal polyposis
label: Nasal polyposis
definition: Polypoidal masses arising mainly from the mucous membranes of the nose and paranasal sinuses. They are freely movable and nontender overgrowths of the mucosa that frequently accompany allergic rhinitis.

name: Corneal perforation
label: Corneal perforation
definition: A rupture of the cornea through which a portion of the iris protrudes.

name: Endocarditis
label: Endocarditis
definition: An inflammation of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.

name: Telangiectasia of the skin
label: Telangiectasia of the skin
definition: Presence of small, permanently dilated blood vessels near the surface of the skin, visible as small focal red lesions.

name: Sterile pyuria
label: Sterile pyuria
definition: Patients who routinely have greater than 20 leukocytes per microliter, but have abacterial urine, are said to have sterile pyuria.

name: Paraphimosis
label: Paraphimosis
definition: The foreskin becomes trapped behind the glans penis, and cannot be pulled back to its normal flaccid position covering the glans penis.

name: Urogenital fistula
label: Urogenital fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula affecting the genitourinary system.

name: Rectal fistula
label: Rectal fistula
definition: The presence of a fistula affecting the rectum.

name: Peritoneal abscess
label: Peritoneal abscess
definition: The presence of an abscess of the peritoneum.

name: Esophageal web
label: Esophageal web
definition: Thin (2-3mm) membranes of normal esophageal tissue consisting of mucosa and submucosa that can be congenital or acquired. Congenital webs commonly appear in the middle and inferior third of the esophagus, and they are more likely to be circumferential with a central or eccentric orifice. Acquired webs are much more common than congenital webs and typically appear in the cervical area (postcricoid). Clinical symptoms of this condition are selective (solid more than liquids) dysphagia, thoracic pain, nasopharyngeal reflux, aspiration, perforation and food impaction (the last two are very rare).

name: Camptocormia
label: Camptocormia
definition: An abnormal forward-flexed posture e.g. forward flexion of the spine, which is noticeable when standing or walking but disappears when lying down. It is becoming an increasingly recognized feature of Parkinson's disease and dystonic disorders.

name: Absent nares
label: Absent nares
definition: The nostrils (the paired channels of the nose) are not present.

name: Pulmonary edema
label: Pulmonary edema
definition: Fluid accumulation in the lungs.

name: Bifid penis
label: Bifid penis
definition: Two penile structures, separated from the tip to the base of the shaft.|In individuals with complete duplication often one will find Hypospadias, Epispadias, Bladder exstrophy, or Bifid scrotum, which should be coded separately, as well as urinary tract duplications, renal anomalies, and gastrointestinal duplications. The terms indicate the presence of (part of) two penises, but do not indicate whether they are caused by splitting or double formation.

name: Penoscrotal transposition
label: Penoscrotal transposition
definition: A partial or complete positional exchange between the penis and the scrotum, with positioning of the scrotum superior to the penis.

name: Eclampsia
label: Eclampsia
definition: An acute and life-threatening complication of pregnancy, which is characterized by the appearance of tonic-clonic seizures, usually in a patient who had developed pre-eclampsia. Eclampsia includes seizures and coma that happen during pregnancy but are not due to preexisting or organic brain disorders.

name: Preeclampsia
label: Preeclampsia
definition: Pregnancy-induced hypertension in association with significant amounts of protein in the urine.

name: Toxemia of pregnancy
label: Toxemia of pregnancy
definition: Pregnancy-induced toxic reactions of the mother that can be as harmless as slight Maternal hypertension or as life threatening as Eclampsia.

name: Neoplasm of the lip
label: Neoplasm of the lip
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the lip.

name: Neoplasm of the respiratory system
label: Neoplasm of the respiratory system
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the respiratory system.

name: Dysmenorrhea
label: Dysmenorrhea
definition: Pain during menstruation that interferes with daily activities.

name: Metrorrhagia
label: Metrorrhagia
definition: Bleeding at irregular intervals.

name: Maternal hyperphenylalaninemia
label: Maternal hyperphenylalaninemia
definition: A medical history of exposure during the fetal period to hyperphenylalaninemia because the mother had phenylketonuria with inadequate control during pregnancy.

name: Multiple glomerular cysts
label: Multiple glomerular cysts
definition: The presence of many cysts in the glomerulus of the kidney related to dilatation of the Bowman's capsule.|Glomerular cysts, defined as Bowman space dilatation greater than 2 to 3 times normal size, are found in disorders of diverse etiology and with a spectrum of clinical manifestations. The term glomerulocystic kidney refers to a kidney with greater than 5% cystic glomeruli.

name: Odontogenic neoplasm
label: Odontogenic neoplasm
definition: Neoplasm involving odontogenic cells, an odontogenic tumor.|Examples for odontogenic neoplasia are Adenomatoid odontogenic tumors, Ameloblastomas, Calcifying epithelial odontogenic tumors, Calcifying odontogenic cysts, Dentigerous cysts, Odontogenic keratocysts, Dontogenic myxomas, Odontomas.

name: Death in early adulthood
label: Death in early adulthood
definition: Death between the age of 16 and 40 years.

name: Myositis
label: Myositis
definition: A general term for inflammation of the muscles without respect to the underlying cause.|Many such conditions are considered likely to be caused by autoimmune conditions, rather than directly due to infection, although autoimmune conditions can be activated or exacerbated by infections. It is also a documented side effect of the lipid-lowering drugs such as statins and fibrates. Elevation of creatine kinase in blood is indicative of myositis.

name: Ovarian neoplasm
label: Ovarian neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ovary.

name: Testicular teratoma
label: Testicular teratoma
definition: The presence of a teratoma of the testis.|An encapsulated tumor of the testis with tissue or organ components resembling normal derivatives of all three germ layers.

name: Testicular seminoma
label: Testicular seminoma
definition: The presence of a seminoma, an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the testis.

name: Leydig cell neoplasia
label: Leydig cell neoplasia
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Leydig cell.

name: Sertoli cell neoplasm
label: Sertoli cell neoplasm
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Sertoli cell.

name: Germinoma
label: Germinoma
definition: A type of undifferentiated germ cell tumor that may be benign or malignant.

name: Dysgerminoma
label: Dysgerminoma
definition: The presence of a dysgerminoma, i.e., an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the ovary.

name: Displacement of the urethral meatus
label: Displacement of the urethral meatus
definition: A displacement of the external urethral orifice from its normal position (in males normally placed at the tip of glans penis, in females normally placed about 2.5 cm behind the glans clitoridis and immediately in front of that of the vagina).|Congenital misplacement of the urethral orifice is called hypospadias when it is located in the underside (ventral aspect) of the penis, and epispadias when located in the dorsum (upper aspect).

name: Esophageal diverticulum
label: Esophageal diverticulum
definition: The presence of a diverticulum of the esophagus.|A diverticulum is a blind ended outpouching through the wall of a tubular organ or bounded cavity.

name: Midline facial cleft
label: Midline facial cleft
definition: A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the midline of the face.|Midline facial clefts correspond to Tessier number 0,14, and 30.

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
label: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adrenal gland.

name: Pulmonary sequestration
label: Pulmonary sequestration
definition: The presence of a piece lung tissue which is not attached to the pulmonary blood supply and does not communicate with the other lung tissue (not connected to the standard bronchial airways and not performing a function in respiration).

name: Esophagitis
label: Esophagitis
definition: Inflammation of the esophagus.

name: Neuroendocrine neoplasm
label: Neuroendocrine neoplasm
definition: A tumor that originates from a neuroendocrine cell.|Neuroendocrine tumors are often diagnosed incidentally or when patients present with symptoms related to hormone production and/or tumor burden.

name: Carotid paraganglioma
label: Carotid paraganglioma
definition: A paraganglioma (a neuroendocrine neoplasm) originating in a carotid artery.

name: Pulmonary paraglioma
label: Pulmonary paraglioma
definition: A rare paranglioma of the lung, tumors that arise from extra-adrenal chromaffin cells.

name: Neoplasm of the pharynx
label: Neoplasm of the pharynx
definition: A neoplasm originating in the pharynx.|Tumors of pharynx may present with nonspecific findings such as otalgia or unilateral otitis media.

name: Erectile dysfunction
label: Erectile dysfunction
definition: A multidimensional but common male sexual dysfunction that involves an alteration in any of the components of the erectile response, including organic, relational and psychological.

name: Laryngeal cyst
label: Laryngeal cyst
definition: Presence of a cyst (sac-like structure) located in the larynx.

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
label: Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal cortex.

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal medulla
label: Neoplasm of the adrenal medulla
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal medulla.

name: Abnormality of nail color
label: Abnormality of nail color
definition: An anomaly of the color of the nail.

name: Melanonychia
label: Melanonychia
definition: Brown or black discoloration of the nails.

name: Cystocele
label: Cystocele
definition: Anterior vaginal wall prolapse with bulging of the bladder into the vagina.|Cystocele occurs owing to weakening and stretching of the suppoortive tissue between the bladder and the vaginal wall.

name: Thyroiditis
label: Thyroiditis
definition: Inflammation of the thyroid gland.

name: Graves disease
label: Graves disease
definition: An autoimmune disease where the thyroid is overactive, producing an excessive amount of thyroid hormones (a serious metabolic imbalance known as hyperthyroidism and thyrotoxicosis). This is caused by autoantibodies to the TSH-receptor (TSHR-Ab) that activate that TSH-receptor (TSHR), thereby stimulating thyroid hormone synthesis and secretion, and thyroid growth (causing a diffusely enlarged goiter). The resulting state of hyperthyroidism can cause a dramatic constellation of neuropsychological and physical signs and symptoms, which can severely compromise the patients.

name: Neoplasm of the tongue
label: Neoplasm of the tongue
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the tongue.

name: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
label: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the oral cavity.

name: Vaginal neoplasm
label: Vaginal neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the vagina.

name: Type I diabetes mellitus
label: Type I diabetes mellitus
definition: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. Type I diabetes mellitus is manifested by the sudden onset of severe hyperglycemia with rapid progression to diabetic ketoacidosis unless treated with insulin.|The onset of type 1 diabetes is typically during adolescence, but it can develop at any age.

name: Optic neuritis
label: Optic neuritis
definition: Inflammation of the optic nerve.|Optic neuritis can cause loss of vision because of swelling and destruction of the myelin sheath covering the optic nerve and/or direct axonal damage.

name: Retrobulbar optic neuritis
label: Retrobulbar optic neuritis
definition: Optic neuritis that occurs in the section of the optic nerve located behind the eyeball.

name: Thoracoabdominal wall defect
label: Thoracoabdominal wall defect
definition: Failure to close of the chest and abdominal wall likely caused by the failure of the ventral wall to close during week 4 of development.|May be accompanied by thoracic ectopia cordis and gastroschisis.

name: Thoracoabdominal eventration
label: Thoracoabdominal eventration
definition: Congenital protrusion of the abdominal or thoracic viscera, usually with a defect of the sternum and ribs as well as of the abdominal walls.

name: Cellulitis
label: Cellulitis
definition: A bacterial infection and inflammation of the skin und subcutaneous tissues.|In contrast to impetigo, which is a very superficial skin infection, cellulitis involves both the dermis and the underlying subcutaneous tissue.

name: Dyskinesia
label: Dyskinesia
definition: A movement disorder which consists of effects including diminished voluntary movements and the presence of involuntary movements.

name: Trigeminal neuralgia
label: Trigeminal neuralgia
definition: A neuropathic disorder characterized by episodes of intense pain in the face, originating from the trigeminal nerve. One, two, or all three branches of the nerve may be affected.

name: Chondritis
label: Chondritis
definition: Inflammation of cartilage.

name: Synotia
label: Synotia
definition: A congenital malformation characterized by the union or approximation of the ears in front of the neck, often accompanied by the absence or defective development of the lower jaw.

name: Angioedema
label: Angioedema
definition: Rapid swelling (edema) of the dermis, subcutaneous tissue, mucosa and submucosal tissues of the skin of the face, normally around the mouth, and the mucosa of the mouth and/or throat, as well as the tongue during a period of minutes to several hours. The swelling can also occur elsewhere, typically in the hands. Angioedema is similar to urticaria, but the swelling is subcutaneous rather than on the epidermis.|Apart from the common form, mediated by allergy, it has been reported as a side effect of some medications, in particular ACE inhibitors. Additionally, there are three autosomal dominant inherited forms known, due to mutations in the genes that control the clotting cascade, including the SERPING1 gene, which results in deficiency of the blood protein C1-inhibitor (type I HAE) and the F12 gene, which controls Factor XII (type III HAE). There is an additional type in which C1 levels are normal but C1 function is decreased (type II HAE). All three forms are called hereditary angioedema (HAE) or occasionally by the outdated term 'hereditary angioneurotic edema' (HANE). In all forms of HAE, swelling may also occur in the digestive tract and other organs. It is life-threatening when it involves the larynx due to the potential for asphyxiation.

name: Intestinal duplication
label: Intestinal duplication
definition: A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication the entire intestine or of a portion of the intestine.

name: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
label: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
definition: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the mucosa of the mouth.

name: Abnormal trabecular bone morphology
label: Abnormal trabecular bone morphology
definition: Abnormal structure or form of trabecular bone.

name: Vaginal hernia
label: Vaginal hernia
definition: The presence of a hernia of the vagina.

name: Vaginal hydrocele
label: Vaginal hydrocele
definition: "vaginal" refers to the tunica vaginalis of the testis, not to the vagina.

name: Vaginal hematocele
label: Vaginal hematocele
definition: "vaginal" refers to the tunica vaginalis of the testis, not to the vagina.

name: Vaginal pyocele
label: Vaginal pyocele
definition: "vaginal" refers to the tunica vaginalis of the testis, not to the vagina.

name: Vaginal lymphocele
label: Vaginal lymphocele
definition: "vaginal" refers to the tunica vaginalis of the testis, not to the vagina.

name: Vulval varicose vein
label: Vulval varicose vein
definition: Varicosity of veins in the vulval region.

name: Premature skin wrinkling
label: Premature skin wrinkling
definition: The presence of an increased degree of wrinkling (irregular folds and indentations) of the skin as compared with age-related norms.

name: Esophageal duplication
label: Esophageal duplication
definition: A developmental disorder in which there is a duplication of a portion of the muscle and submucosa of the esophagus without epithelial duplication.|Esophageal duplication is a rare cause of mediastinal mass. An esophageal duplication may be a simple epithelial cyst or duplication that contains muscle and submucosa but not epithelium. In most cases, the duplication is located in the lower thrid of the esophagus, and the most common associated symptom is difficulty in swallowing. Esophageal duplication occurs because of maldevelopment of the posterior division of embryonic foregut.

name: Tracheal atresia
label: Tracheal atresia
definition:
A congenital absence or considerable underdevelopment of the trachea such that communication between the larynx proximally and the alveoli of the lungs distally is lacking.|Diagnosis
can be made if the neonate presents with respiratory
distress at birth, unable to produce an audible cry in spite
of an obvious physical effort, and cannot be intubated but
shows some improvement when ventilated by bag and
mask.

name: Salivary gland neoplasm
label: Salivary gland neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a salivary gland.

name: Abnormal Sharpey fiber morphology
label: Abnormal Sharpey fiber morphology
definition: An abnormality of Sharpey's fibers (bone fibers, or perforating fibers), which are a matrix of connective tissue consisting of bundles of strong collagenous fibres connecting periosteum to bone.

name: Polyotia
label: Polyotia
definition: The presence of an extra auricle on one or both sides of the head.

name: Decreased corneal thickness
label: Decreased corneal thickness
definition: A decreased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

name: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
label: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea

name: Increased corneal curvature
label: Increased corneal curvature
definition: An increase in the degree of curvature of the cornea compared to normal.

name: Iridodonesis
label: Iridodonesis
definition: Tremulousness of the iris on movement of the eye, occurring in subluxation of the lens.

name: Tibial torsion
label: Tibial torsion
definition: Tibial torsion is inward twisting (medial rotation) (PATO:0002155) of the tibia.|Normally, lateral rotation of the tibia increases from approximately 5 degrees at birth to approximately 15 degrees at maturity. Tibial torsion is the most common cause of intoeing. In a study by Mullaji et al to determine tibial torsion norms, individuals in India were found to have less tibial torsion than Caucasians but about the same amount as the Japanese population. The differences in normal tibial torsion values are expected to be caused by the different lifestyles and postures of the different populations, such as cross-legged sitting positions.

name: Lipedema
label: Lipedema
definition: Excess deposit and expansion of adipose tissue in an unusual pattern which cannot be lost through diet and exercise .|The pattern of fat deposition is most often bilateral, symmetrical and usually from the waist to a distinct line just above the ankles.

name: Neurofibrosarcoma
label: Neurofibrosarcoma
definition: A form of malignant cancer of the connective tissue surrounding nerves. Given its origin and behavior, it is classified as a sarcoma.|About half the cases are diagnosed in people with neurofibromatosis.

name: Subcutaneous neurofibromas
label: Subcutaneous neurofibromas
definition: The presence of Neurofibromas in the subcutis.

name: Abnormal arachnoid mater morphology
label: Abnormal arachnoid mater morphology
definition: An abnormality of the Arachnoid mater.

name: Abnormal pia mater
label: Abnormal pia mater
definition: An abnormality of the pia mater.

name: Arachnoid cyst
label: Arachnoid cyst
definition: An extra-parenchymal and intra-arachnoidal collection of fluid with a composition similar to that of cerebrospinal fluid.|Arachnoid cysts can be found on the brain, or on the spine. Intracranial arachnoid cysts usually occur adjacent to the arachnoidal cistern. Spinal arachnoid cysts may be extradural, intradural, or perineural.

name: Cerebral visual impairment
label: Cerebral visual impairment
definition: A form of loss of vision caused by damage to the visual cortex rather than a defect in the eye.|The term cortical/cerebral visual impairment (CVI) was coined to describe damage to visual pathways and structures occurring during early perinatal development. The term cortical visual impairment was originally proposed to describe visual dysfunction in pediatric populations of non-ocular cause, and its presumed association with damage to early visual cortical areas. However, as further characterization of this condition progressed, it became evident that CVI was often associated with damage to sites beyond early visual cortex including subcortical structures, white matter pathways, as well as higher-order associative processing areas of the cortex. Thus, the word cortical has been viewed as somewhat of a misnomer, and there has been the suggestion that the term cerebral would be a more encompassing and appropriate term. Although there is still a debate in the community about the most appropriate nomenclature, the HPO will regard these terms as synonymous. It is recommended that more specific terms be used as appropriate for annotation.

name: Abnormality of the glial cells
label: Abnormality of the glial cells
definition: An abnormality of the glia cell.|Glia are nonneuronal cells of the nervous system that provide physical support, respond to injury, regulate the composition of the extracellular milieu, guide neuronal migration during development, and exchange metabolites with neurons.

name: Abnormality of the oligodendroglia
label: Abnormality of the oligodendroglia
definition: One of the three types of glia cells that, with the nerve cells, compose the central nervous system and are characterized by sheetlike processes that wrap around individual axons to form the myelin sheath of nerve fibers.

name: Abnormality of the astrocytes
label: Abnormality of the astrocytes
definition: An abnormality of astrocytes.|Astrocytes represent a class of large neuroglial (macroglial) cells in the central nervous system.

name: Abnormality of the microglia
label: Abnormality of the microglia
definition: An abnormality of the microglial cells. They are also known as brain-resident macrophages or hortega cells.|Microglial cells represent a central nervous system macrophage found in the parenchyma of the central nervous system.

name: Impulsivity
label: Impulsivity
definition: Acting on the spur of the moment in response to immediate stimuli; acting on a momentary basis without a plan or consideration of outcomes; difficulty establishing or following plans; a sense of urgency and self-harming behavior under emotional distress.

name: Abnormality of the thoracic spine
label: Abnormality of the thoracic spine
definition: An abnormality of the thoracic vertebral column.

name: Abnormality of the lumbar spine
label: Abnormality of the lumbar spine
definition: An abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.

name: Self-injurious behavior
label: Self-injurious behavior
definition: Aggression towards oneself.

name: Lens coloboma
label: Lens coloboma
definition: A sectoral indentation of the crystalline lens, usually due to zonular weakness or absence.

name: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy
label: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy
definition: Swelling of lymph nodes within the mediastinum, the central compartment of the thoracic cavities that contains the heart and the great vessels, the esophagus, and trachea and other structures including lymph nodes.

name: Hypercoagulability
label: Hypercoagulability
definition: An abnormality of coagulation associated with an increased risk of thrombosis.

name: Lichenification
label: Lichenification
definition: Thickening and hardening of the epidermis seen with exaggeration of normal skin lines.

name: Kaposi's sarcoma
label: Kaposi's sarcoma
definition: A systemic disease which can present with cutaneous lesions with or without internal involvement. Tumors are caused by Human herpesvirus 8 (HHV8), also known as Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpesvirus (KSHV).

name: Histiocytosis
label: Histiocytosis
definition: An excessive number of histiocytes (tissue macrophages).

name: Bronchogenic cyst
label: Bronchogenic cyst
definition: A rare congenital cystic lesion of the lungs in the mediastinum.|Bronchogenic cysts (BCs) are congenital lesions thought to result from abnormal budding of the embryonic foregut. The most frequent symptoms are pain, cough, fever, respiratory distress, or dyspnea. Intrapulmonary bronchogenic cysts are usually sharply defined, solitary, non-calcified, round, or oval opacities confined to a single lobe. These can present as a homogeneous water density, an air- filled cyst, or with an air-fluid level. The cyst can rupture into the trachea, pericardial cavity, or pleural cavity. Infection of the cyst may lead to surrounding acinar shadow. An air-filled cyst or one with an air-fluid level may be present if a complicating tracheo-bronchial connection develops.

name: Transverse facial cleft
label: Transverse facial cleft
definition: A horizontal cleft of the face, varying from slight widening of the mouth, to a cleft extending to the ear.|Usually, these clefts are unilateral and do not extend beyond the anterior border of the masseter. Transverse clefts are thought to develop either due to failure of the maxillary and mandibular processes to fuse or a disruption in the processes after fusing.

name: Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
label: Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the parathyroid gland.

name: Abnormality of vertebral epiphysis morphology
label: Abnormality of vertebral epiphysis morphology
definition: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or more vertebrae.

name: Abnormal soft palate morphology
label: Abnormal soft palate morphology
definition: An abnormality of the soft palate.

name: Abnormal eating behavior
label: Abnormal eating behavior
definition: Abnormal eating habit with excessive or insufficient consumption of food or any other abnormal pattern of food consumption.|Note that this HPO term refers to an abnormal eating habit but does not directly refer to an eating disorder, which is a psychological disorder that is characterized by one or more abnormal eating behaviors.

name: Bulimia
label: Bulimia
definition: A form of anomalous eating behavior characterized by binge eating is followed by self-induced vomiting or other compensatory behavior intended to prevent weight gain (purging, fasting or exercising or a combination of these).

name: Vascular neoplasm
label: Vascular neoplasm
definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumour) originating in the vascular system.

name: Abnormality of the humeroulnar joint
label: Abnormality of the humeroulnar joint
definition: An anomaly of the joint between the trochlear notch of ulna and the trochlea of humerus, which is part of the elbow joint.

name: Macrodactyly of finger
label: Macrodactyly of finger
definition: A type of Macrodactyly affecting one or several fingers.

name: Macrodactyly of toe
label: Macrodactyly of toe
definition: A type of Macrodactyly affecting one or several toes.

name: Chest pain
label: Chest pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the chest.

name: Atelectasis
label: Atelectasis
definition: Collapse of part of a lung associated with absence of inflation (air) of that part.

name: Esophageal neoplasm
label: Esophageal neoplasm
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the esophagus.

name: Abnormal liver lobulation
label: Abnormal liver lobulation
definition: Formation of abnormal lobules (small masses of tissue) in the liver.

name: Schizophrenia
label: Schizophrenia
definition: A mental disorder characterized by a disintegration of thought processes and of emotional responsiveness. It most commonly manifests as auditory hallucinations, paranoid or bizarre delusions, or disorganized speech and thinking, and it is accompanied by significant social or occupational dysfunction. The onset of symptoms typically occurs in young adulthood, with a global lifetime prevalence of about 0.3-0.7%.|Positive symptoms, such as delusions and hallucinations (especially of voices), are common, and any Schneiderian first-rank symptoms are particularly indicative of the illness. Negative symptoms include social withdrawal, impairment of ego boundaries, and loss of energy and initiative. Schizophrenia is diagnosed only if symptoms persist for at least one month. The illness can spontaneously remit, run a course with infrequent or frequent relapses, or become chronic. The prognosis has improved with antipsychotic drugs and with vigorous psychological and social management and rehabilitation. The many causes include genetic factors, environmental stress, and various triggering factors.

name: Mania
label: Mania
definition: A state of abnormally elevated or irritable mood, arousal, and or energy levels.

name: Pancreatoblastoma
label: Pancreatoblastoma
definition: A rare pediatric carcinoma of the pancreas.

name: Gangrene
label: Gangrene
definition: A serious and potentially life-threatening condition that arises when a considerable mass of body tissue dies (necrosis).|This may occur after an injury or infection, or in people suffering from any chronic health problem affecting blood circulation. The prime cause of gangrene is reduced blood supply to the affected tissues, which results in cell death. Diabetes and long-term smoking increase the risk of suffering from gangrene. There are different types of gangrene with different symptoms, such as dry gangrene, wet gangrene, gas gangrene, internal gangrene and necrotising fasciitis. Treatment options include debridement (or, in severe cases, amputation) of the affected body parts, antibiotics, vascular surgery, maggot therapy or hyperbaric oxygen therapy.

name: Clubbing of fingers
label: Clubbing of fingers
definition: Terminal broadening of the fingers (distal phalanges of the fingers).

name: Clubbing of toes
label: Clubbing of toes
definition: Terminal broadening of the toes (distal phalanges of the toes).

name: Hemobilia
label: Hemobilia
definition: Bleeding into the biliary tree.

name: Abnormality of the lymphatic system
label: Abnormality of the lymphatic system
definition: An anomaly of the lymphatic system, a network of lymphatic vessels that carry a clear fluid called lymph unidirectionally towards either the right lymphatic duct or the thoracic duct, which in turn drain into the right and left subclavian veins respectively.

name: Lymphangioma
label: Lymphangioma
definition: Lymphangiomas are rare congenital malformations consisting of focal proliferations of well-differentiated lymphatic tissue in multi cystic or sponge like structures. Lymphangioma is usually asymptomatic due to its soft consistency but compression of adjacent structures can be seen due to the mass effect of a large tumor.

name: Abnormality of the tonsils
label: Abnormality of the tonsils
definition: An abnormality of the tonsils.

name: Abnormal lymphatic vessel morphology
label: Abnormal lymphatic vessel morphology
definition: A structural anomaly of the vessel that contains or conveys lymph fluid.

name: Abnormality of the placenta
label: Abnormality of the placenta
definition: An abnormality of the placenta, the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall to enable nutrient uptake, waste elimination, and gas exchange.

name: Choriocarcinoma
label: Choriocarcinoma
definition: A malignant, trophoblastic and aggressive cancer, usually of the placenta. It is characterized by early hematogenous spread to the lungs and belongs to the far end of the spectrum of gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD), a subset of germ cell tumors.

name: Hyperperistalsis
label: Hyperperistalsis
definition: Excessively active peristalsis (wave of contraction of the tubular organs of the gastrointestinal tract) marked by excessive rapidity of the passage of food through the stomach and intestine.

name: Hypoperistalsis
label: Hypoperistalsis
definition: Reduced or inadequate peristalsis, with resultant slow passage of contents through the digestive tract.

name: Hyperostosis
label: Hyperostosis
definition: Excessive growth or abnormal thickening of bone tissue.|Hyperostosis refers to a localized bone overgrowth process (as opposed to sclerosis, which refers to a generalized disturbance with increased bone density).

name: Dural ectasia
label: Dural ectasia
definition: A widening or ballooning of the dural sac surrounding the spinal cord usually at the lumbosacral level.|Dural ectasia is one of the major manifestations of Marfan syndrome. It may cause low back pain, headaches and neurological signs such as weakness and loss of bowel and bladder function, but in many patients it is asymptomatic. It is also a cause of posterior vertebral scalloping present in radiographs in patients who are diagnosed with Neurofibromatosis. Dural ectasia may also manifest in Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome, cauda equina syndrome and in ankylosing spondylitis.

name: Recurrent pharyngitis
label: Recurrent pharyngitis
definition: An increased susceptibility to pharyngitis as manifested by a history of recurrent pharyngitis.

name: Exostoses
label: Exostoses
definition: An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Cryoglobulinemia
label: Cryoglobulinemia
definition: Increased level of cryoglobulins in the blood. Cryoglobulins are abnormal immunoglobulins, especially IGG or IGM, that precipitate spontaneously when serum is cooled below 37 degrees Celsius.

name: Urogenital sinus anomaly
label: Urogenital sinus anomaly
definition: A rare birth defect in women where the urethra and vagina both open into a common channel.

name: Conjunctival hamartoma
label: Conjunctival hamartoma
definition: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) of the conjunctiva.

name: Abnormality of the sacroiliac joint
label: Abnormality of the sacroiliac joint
definition: An anomaly of the sacroiliac joint, which connects the base of the spine (sacrum) to the ilium (a hip bone).|The sacroiliac joint (SIJ) is a true diarthrodial joint: matching articular surfaces separated by a joint space containing synovial fluid and enveloped by a fibrous capsule. It does, however, have unique characteristics not typically found in other diarthrodial joints. The SIJ has fibrocartilage in addition to hyaline cartilage. There is discontinuity of the posterior capsule. Rather than being smooth, the articular surfaces have many ridges and depressions that minimize movement and enhance stability. Primary stability, however, is attributed to the many adjacent ligaments.

name: Breast aplasia
label: Breast aplasia
definition: Failure to develop and congenital absence of the breast.

name: Fused lips
label: Fused lips
definition: Lack of separation of the upper and lower lips.

name: Torus palatinus
label: Torus palatinus
definition: A bony protrusion present on the midline of the hard palate.

name: Acantholysis
label: Acantholysis
definition: The loss of intercellular connections, such as desmosomes, resulting in loss of cohesion between keratinocytes.|Acantolysis results in a positive Nikolsky's sign in which slight rubbing of the skin results in exfoliation of the outermost layer.

name: Abnormally straight spine
label: Abnormally straight spine
definition: The absence of the normal curvature of the vertebral column.

name: Orchitis
label: Orchitis
definition: Testicular inflammation.

name: Toenail dysplasia
label: Toenail dysplasia
definition: An abnormality of the development of the toenails.

name: Fingernail dysplasia
label: Fingernail dysplasia
definition: An abnormality of the development of the fingernails.|If possible, a more precise term should be chosen for annotation.

name: Neoplasm of the middle ear
label: Neoplasm of the middle ear
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the middle ear.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pancreas
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pancreas
definition: A congenital underdevelopment (aplasia or hypoplasia) of the pancreas.

name: Pancreatic aplasia
label: Pancreatic aplasia
definition: Aplasia of the pancreas.

name: Malposition of the stomach
label: Malposition of the stomach
definition: Abnormal anatomical location of the stomach. This feature may be due to intestinal malrotation.

name: Abnormality of the periungual region
label: Abnormality of the periungual region
definition: An abnormality of the region around the nails of the fingers or toes.

name: Ungual fibroma
label: Ungual fibroma
definition: Flesh-colored papule in or around the nail bed. Ungual fibromas may be periungual (arising under the proximal nail fold ) or subungual (originating under the nail plate).|Ungual fibromas are characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.

name: Sepsis
label: Sepsis
definition: Systemic inflammatory response to infection.

name: Long fingers
label: Long fingers
definition: The middle finger is more than 2 SD above the mean for newborns 27 to 41 weeks EGA or above the 97th centile for children from birth to 16 years of age AND the five digits retain their normal length proportions relative to each other (i.e., it is not the case that the middle finger is the only lengthened digit), or, Fingers that appear disproportionately long compared to the palm of the hand.

name: Gastric diverticulum
label: Gastric diverticulum
definition: An outpouching of the gastric wall.|Gastric diverticulum may be asymptomatic or may present with a vague sensation of fullness or discomfort in the upper abdomen, or with acute upper gastrointestinal bleed or perforation.

name: Scalp tenderness
label: Scalp tenderness
definition: Pain or discomfort of the scalp elicited by palpation.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the colon
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the colon
definition: Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the colon.

name: Halitosis
label: Halitosis
definition: Noticeably unpleasant odors exhaled in breathing.

name: Testicular torsion
label: Testicular torsion
definition: Testicular torsion is when the spermatic cord to a testicle twists, cutting off the blood supply. The most common symptom is acute testicular pain.|Many of the symptoms of testicular torsion are similar to the infection epididymitis.

name: Renovascular hypertension
label: Renovascular hypertension
definition: The presence of hypertension related to stenosis of the renal artery.|Renal artery stenosis can lead to hypertension and chronic kidney disease (due to chronic renal ischemia). The hypertension is caused by activation of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.

name: Long thorax
label: Long thorax
definition: Increased inferior to superior extent of the thorax.

name: Intestinal fistula
label: Intestinal fistula
definition: An abnormal connection between the gut and another hollow organ, such as the bladder, urethra, vagina, or other regions of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Glomerulopathy
label: Glomerulopathy
definition: Inflammatory or noninflammatory diseases affecting the glomeruli of the nephron.

name: Urethrocele
label: Urethrocele
definition: The prolapse of the female urethra into the vagina.

name: Rectocele
label: Rectocele
definition: A Rectocele results from a tear in the rectovaginal septum (which is normally a tough, fibrous, sheet-like divider between the rectum and vagina). Rectal tissue bulges through this tear and into the vagina as a hernia. There are two main causes of this tear: childbirth, and hysterectomy.

name: Cheilitis
label: Cheilitis
definition: Inflammation of the lip.|It is associated with many conditions, including megaloblastic anemia from vitamin B12 deficiency, iron deficiency anemia (which in severe cases can lead to Plummer-Vinson syndrome) and oral candidiasis. It can also be a symptom of allergies, such as allergy to Balsam of Peru. Cheilitis can also be caused by taking the (retinoid) drug Isotretinoin. It may also be a pre-malignant lesion for squamous cell carcinoma.

name: Neoplasm of the nail
label: Neoplasm of the nail
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nail.

name: Lymphocytosis
label: Lymphocytosis
definition: Increase in the number or proportion of lymphocytes in the blood.

name: Increased T cell count
label: Increased T cell count
definition: An abnormal increase in the total number of T cells detected in the blood.

name: Galactorrhea
label: Galactorrhea
definition: Spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing.

name: Abnormality of vitamin K metabolism
label: Abnormality of vitamin K metabolism
definition: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble vitamin with a role in promoting the coagulation cascade.

name: Vitreous floaters
label: Vitreous floaters
definition: Deposits of various size, shape, consistency, refractive index, and motility within the eye's vitreous humour, which is normally transparent.|Vitreous floaters are described as vitreous condensations (or vitreous debris or vitreous opacities) as a finding upon ophthalmological examination. Floaters can take many forms from little dots, circles, lines, to clouds or cobwebs. The floaters are created by a shadow of the floating vitreal debris that is projected onto the retina, which is described as a veil.

name: Neoplasm of the small intestine
label: Neoplasm of the small intestine
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine.|An estimated 40% of small bowel cancers are adenocarcinomas, 40% are carcinoids, 15% are sarcomas (GI stromal tumors), and less than 5% are lymphomas.

name: Neoplasm of the large intestine
label: Neoplasm of the large intestine
definition: The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

name: Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system
label: Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system

name: Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
label: Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
definition: A tumor that originates in the pineal gland, has moderate cellularity and tends to form rosette patterns.

name: Atrophodermia vermiculata
label: Atrophodermia vermiculata
definition: Symmetrical vermiform facial atrophy that affects mainly the forehead, the chin, the ear lobes and helices. Atrophodermia vermiculata is characterized by erythema and follicular plugs on the cheeks, developing into painless reticular impressions.|The onset of atrophodermia vermiculata is usually between the ages of 5 and 12 years.

name: Recurrent cutaneous abscess formation
label: Recurrent cutaneous abscess formation
definition: An increased susceptibility to cutaneous abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent cutaneous abscesses.

name: Hepatic agenesis
label: Hepatic agenesis
definition: Absence of the liver owing to a failure of the liver to develop.

name: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the eyebrow
label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the eyebrow
definition: Absence or underdevelopment of the eyebrow.

name: Microgastria
label: Microgastria
definition: A developmental anomaly wtih a small tubular or saccular midline stomach.|Patients with microgastria usually have poor growth, inadequate food consumption, or a complication of the small gastric cavity and gastroesophageal reflux, including frequent vomiting or pneumonia.

name: Septo-optic dysplasia
label: Septo-optic dysplasia
definition: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum.

name: Anaphylactic shock
label: Anaphylactic shock
definition: An acute hypersensitivity reaction due to exposure to a previously encountered antigen.|Anaphylaxis may lead to rapidly progressing urticaria, respiratory distress, vascular collapse, systemic shock, and death if untreated.

name: Palmoplantar pustulosis
label: Palmoplantar pustulosis
definition: A chronic, relapsing, pustular eruption that is localized to the palms and soles.|There are recurrent and painful eruptions of pustules on the palms and the soles of feet that may resolve with red-brown discoloration.

name: Neoplasm of the male external genitalia
label: Neoplasm of the male external genitalia
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the male external genitalia.

name: Neoplasm of the scrotum
label: Neoplasm of the scrotum
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the scrotum.

name: Neoplasm of the penis
label: Neoplasm of the penis
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the penis.

name: Abnormal emotion/affect behavior
label: Abnormal emotion/affect behavior
definition: An abnormality of emotional behaviour.

name: Abnormal fear/anxiety-related behavior
label: Abnormal fear/anxiety-related behavior
definition: An abnormality of fear/anxiety-related behavior, which may relate to either abnormally reduced fear/anxiety-related response or increased fear/anxiety-related response.

name: Hypoplastic areola
label: Hypoplastic areola
definition: Underdevelopment of the areola, the circular area of pigmented skin surrounding the nipple.

name: Aplasia of the musculature
label: Aplasia of the musculature
definition: Absence of the musculature.

name: Triceps hypoplasia
label: Triceps hypoplasia
definition: Hypoplasia of the triceps muscle.

name: Poorly ossified vertebrae
label: Poorly ossified vertebrae
definition: Decreased ossification of the vertebral bodies.

name: Flat sella turcica
label: Flat sella turcica
definition: An abnormally flat sella turcica.

name: Dilatation of celiac artery
label: Dilatation of celiac artery
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the celiac artery.|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Dilatation of superior mesenteric artery
label: Dilatation of superior mesenteric artery
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the superior mesenteric artery .|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Dilatation of Inferior mesenteric artery
label: Dilatation of Inferior mesenteric artery
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery .|Aneurysm is considered a severe form of dilatation.

name: Sclerotic vertebral body
label: Sclerotic vertebral body
definition: Increase in bone density of the vertebral body.

name: Short femoral neck
label: Short femoral neck
definition: An abnormally short femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Broad ischia
label: Broad ischia
definition: Increased width of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Short iliac bones
label: Short iliac bones
definition: Underdevelopment of the iliac bones.

name: Duodenal stenosis
label: Duodenal stenosis
definition: The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the duodenum.

name: Palmar telangiectasia
label: Palmar telangiectasia
definition: The presence of telangiectases on the skin of palm of hand.

name: Plantar telangiectasia
label: Plantar telangiectasia
definition: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located on the skin of sole of foot.

name: Abnormality of the palm
label: Abnormality of the palm
definition: An abnormality of the palm, that is, of the front of the hand.

name: Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
label: Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
definition: An abnormality of the plantar part of foot, that is of the soles of the feet.

name: Thick hair
label: Thick hair
definition: Increased density of hairs, i.e., and elevated number of hairs per unit area.

name: Hemimacroglossia
label: Hemimacroglossia
definition: Increased length and width of one half of the tounge.

name: Infra-orbital crease
label: Infra-orbital crease
definition: Skin crease extending from below the inner canthus laterally along the malar process of the maxilla and zygoma.|This feature is often found in the presence of hypoplasia of the malar process of the maxilla or zygoma, but should be coded separately.

name: Renal diverticulum
label: Renal diverticulum
definition: Cystic, urine-containing intrarenal cavities lined with transitional cell epithelium that communicate through a narrow channel with the collecting system.

name: Nephrogenic rest
label: Nephrogenic rest
definition: Abnormally persistent clusters of embryonal cells, representing microscopic malformations (dysplasias) of the developing kidney.|Though NR are best known as precursors of Wilms tumor (WT), many alternative fates are observed, and most rests are destined for eventual atresia. Nephroblastomatosis refers to the presence of multifocal or diffuse nephrogenic rests.

name: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma
label: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma
definition: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is a type of kidney tumor that is usually found before birth by ultrasound or within the first 3 months of life. It contains fibroblastic cells (connective tissue cells), and may spread to the other kidney or to nearby tissue.|Congenital mesoblastic nephroma is more common in males.

name: Fibrous hamartoma
label: Fibrous hamartoma
definition: A rare, benign soft tissue tumor that typically occurs within the first two years of life.

name: Chorangioma
label: Chorangioma
definition: Hamartoma-like growth in the placenta consisting of blood vessels.|Chorioangiomas (also known as placental hemangiomas) are benign hamartomatous growth of the placenta comprising vascular tissue. The classification is controversial due to its pathologic features and clinical implications. Some authors call placental hemangiomas as true nontrophoblastic neoplastic tissues. As this abnormal vascular growth seems like the native placental tissue and it does not metastasize, some authors call it just as placental hamartoma. The general incidence is approximately 0.6 percent. Giant chorioangiomas with a diameter over 5 cm are very rare, with an incidence of one in 16-50 thousand pregnancies. Small tumors do not cause any adverse outcomes and they are asymptomatic. In contrast, tumors larger than 5 cm may lead to several complications.

name: Compensatory scoliosis
label: Compensatory scoliosis
definition: A scoliosis which is the results of a difference in leg length (which might be due to hemihypertrophy or hemihypotrophy of a leg) and the resulting tilting of the pelvis. If untreated this will lead to the development of scoliosis over time.

name: Lateral venous anomaly
label: Lateral venous anomaly
definition: Persistence of the embryonic dorsal or sciatic vein system that normally should have involuted around the tenth to twelfth week of intrauterine life.

name: Abnormality of globe location
label: Abnormality of globe location
definition: An abnormality in the placement of the ocular globe (eyeball).

name: Abnormality of globe size
label: Abnormality of globe size
definition: An abnormality in the size of the ocular globe (eyeball).

name: Abnormality of the ductus choledochus
label: Abnormality of the ductus choledochus
definition: An abnormality of the Common bile duct, a tube-like anatomic structure in the human gastrointestinal tract, formed by the union of the Common hepatic duct and the Cystic duct from the gall bladder.

name: Bifid xiphoid process
label: Bifid xiphoid process
definition: A cleft of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

name: Abnormality of the xiphoid process
label: Abnormality of the xiphoid process
definition: An abnormality of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

name: Prominent xiphoid process
label: Prominent xiphoid process
definition: Increased prominence of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

name: Broad xiphoid process
label: Broad xiphoid process
definition: Increased side-to-side width of the xiphoid process of the sternum.

name: Rectal polyposis
label: Rectal polyposis
definition: The presence of multiple rectal hyperplastic/adenomatous polyps.

name: Connective tissue nevi
label: Connective tissue nevi
definition: Connective tissue nevi are hamartomas in which one or several components of the dermis is altered.|Lesions in which collagen predominates are called collagenomas; lesions in which elastin predominates are called elastomas. A nevus mucinosis is a lesion in which an alteration in the amount of dermal glycosaminoglycan is present. The name nevus mucinosis is also used for lesions in which an alteration in more than one dermal component is present. Connective tissue nevi may be solitary or multiple, sporadic or inherited. They may occur as isolated skin lesions, or they may be associated with a number of syndromes.

name: Sclerosis of finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An elevation of bone density in the distal phalanx of the thumb.|Sclerosis can be identified on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
definition: An elevation of bone density in the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Sclerosis of distal finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of distal finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more distal phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of middle finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of middle finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of proximal finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of proximal finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more proximal phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 2nd finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 2nd finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the second finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 3rd finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 3rd finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the third finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 4th finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 4th finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 5th finger phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 5th finger phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fifth finger. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Clavicular sclerosis
label: Clavicular sclerosis
definition: An increase in bone density within the clavicle.

name: Sclerosis of toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of foot bone
label: Sclerosis of foot bone
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more foot bones. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the second toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 3rd toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 3rd toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fourth toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of 5th toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of 5th toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fifth toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of hallux phalanx
label: Sclerosis of hallux phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the big toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe
definition: An elevation in bone density in the proximal phalanx of the second toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe
definition: An elevation in bone density in the proximal phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe

label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe
definition: An elevation in bone density in the middle phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe
definition: An elevation in bone density in the distal phalanx of the third toe. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe

name: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
label: Sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux
label: Sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the hallux

name: Sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more proximal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of middle toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more middle phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
label: Sclerosis of distal toe phalanx
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more distal phalanges of the toes. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.

name: Decreased activity of 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase
label: Decreased activity of 3-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase
definition: Previously, 3-alpha-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase was referred to as short-chain 3-alpha-hydroxyacyl-CoA dehydrogenase as well as medium and short-chain L-3-hydroxyacyl-coenzyme A dehydrogenase.

name: Enlarged sylvian cistern
label: Enlarged sylvian cistern
definition: An increase in size of the subarachnoid space associated with the lateral cerebral sulcus (Sylvian fissure).

name: Open operculum
label: Open operculum
definition: Underdevelopment of the operculum.

name: Abnormal renal medulla morphology
label: Abnormal renal medulla morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of the medulla of the kidney.|The renal pyramids of the adult kidney resemble a cone with a broad base adjacent to the renal cortex and the narrow apex that is termed papilla. The adult renal medulla is made up of 10-18 pyramids. A pyramid consists of the medullary collecting ducts, loops of Henle, vasa recta (straight capillaries) and the interstitium. The main function of the medulla is to regulate concentration of the urine. The urine flows from the collecting ducts into the renal calyces and pelvis.

name: Narrow foramen obturatorium
label: Narrow foramen obturatorium
definition: Decreased width of the foramen obturatorium. The foramen obturatorium (also known as the obturator foramen) is a hole located between the ischium and pubis bones of the pelvis.

name: Dense metaphyseal bands
label: Dense metaphyseal bands
definition: Dense radiopaque bands of bone which are thicker than the adjacent diaphyseal cortex and may form at the metaphysis of growing bones. They appear on radiographs as bone that is more radiopaque that the adjacent diaphyseal cortex.

name: Enlarged hippocampus
label: Enlarged hippocampus
definition: Increase in size of the hippocampus.|The hippocampus is part of the limbic system and plays a role in long- and short-term memory.

name: Dysharmonic bone age
label: Dysharmonic bone age
definition:
Different levels of maturation of different bones.|Bone age is usually determined by using a radiograph of the left hand to compare with images in the Greulich-Pyle atlas and approximating the closest skeletal age. 
If the skeletal ages of individuals bones are different, i.e., different bones have (clearly) different levels of maturation, then it is referred to as dysharmonic skeletal maturation.

name: Dysharmonic accelerated bone age
label: Dysharmonic accelerated bone age
definition: A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is an acceleration in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.

name: Splayed epiphyses
label: Splayed epiphyses
definition: Flaring (widening) of the epiphysis.

name: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
label: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
definition: The presence of an abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure.

name: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
label: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
definition: An abnormal size of the palpebral fissures for example unusually long or short palpebral fissures.

name: Intestinal polyposis
label: Intestinal polyposis
definition: The presence of multiple polyps in the intestine.

name: Neoplasm of fatty tissue
label: Neoplasm of fatty tissue
definition: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of adipose tissue.

name: Acrokeratosis
label: Acrokeratosis
definition: Overgrowth of the stratum corneum characterized by flesh-coloured or slightly pigmented smooth or warty papules on the upper surface of hands and feet.

name: Cerebral white matter agenesis
label: Cerebral white matter agenesis
definition: Congenital defect with failure of the development of the cerebral white matter.

name: Protanomaly
label: Protanomaly
definition: A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with defective long-wavelength-sensitive (L) cones, causing the sensitivity spectrum to be shifted toward medium wavelengths. This leads to difficulties especially in distinguishing red and green.|Note that protanomaly and deuteranomaly are both associated with difficulties distinguishing red and green.

name: Corneal erosion
label: Corneal erosion
definition: An erosion or abrasion of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells.

name: Down-sloping shoulders
label: Down-sloping shoulders
definition: Low set, steeply sloping shoulders.

name: Choroid plexus papilloma
label: Choroid plexus papilloma
definition: Choroid plexus papilloma is a histologically benign neoplasm located in the ventricular system of the choroid plexus.

name: Priapism
label: Priapism
definition: A painful and harmful medical condition in which the erect penis doesn't return to its flaccid state, despite the absence of both physical and psychological stimulation, within four hours.

name: Premature chromatid separation
label: Premature chromatid separation
definition: The presence of premature sister chromatid segregation.

name: Mandibular pain
label: Mandibular pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the mandible.

name: Ocular pain
label: Ocular pain
definition: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye.

name: Pretibial myxedema
label: Pretibial myxedema
definition: A diffuse, non-pitting edema and thickening of the skin usually on the anterior aspect of the lower legs spreading to the dorsum of the feet.

name: Kayser-Fleischer ring
label: Kayser-Fleischer ring
definition: Grey-green or brownish-pigmented ring in the deep epithelial layers at the outer border of the cornea.

name: Papule
label: Papule
definition: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

name: Skin plaque
label: Skin plaque
definition: A plaque is a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter.

name: Skin nodule
label: Skin nodule
definition: Morphologically similar to a papule, but greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat.|A nodule is a palpable, solid, round lesion in the deep skin or subcuteaneous tissues that is larger and deeper than a papule. Nodules are solid circumscribed masses. A common definition is that a skin nodule has a diameter of more than 5 mm in infants and more than 10 mm in older children.

name: Skin vesicle
label: Skin vesicle
definition: A circumscribed, fluid-containing, epidermal elevation generally considered less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

name: Pustule
label: Pustule
definition: A small elevation of the skin containing cloudy or purulent material usually consisting of necrotic inflammatory cells.

name: Epidermoid cyst
label: Epidermoid cyst
definition: Nontender, round and firm, but slightly compressible, intradermal or subcutaneous cyst measuring 0.5-5 cm in diameter. Epidermal cysts are intradermal or subcutaneous tumors, grow slowly and occur on the face, neck, back and scrotum. They usually appear at or around puberty, and as a rule an affected individual has one solitary or a few cysts.|A cyst is a cavity containing liquid, semisolid, or solid material. An epidermoid cyst is a benign cyst that develops out of ectodermal tissue and consists of a thin layer of squamous epithelium. An epidermal cyst may or may not be painful or release pus, and are usually noticed as a bump on the skin. Epidermal cysts and trichilemmal cysts are clinically indistinguishable. The wall of the epidermal cyst conserves the epidermal layers, but the wall of the trichilemmal cysts, which arise from the external root sheath, shows palisading of unlayered epithelial cells. Homogeneous horny material that is further degraded to fat and cholesterol forms within both types of cysts.

name: Skin erosion
label: Skin erosion
definition: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting incomplete loss of the epidermis, a lesion that is moist, circumscribed, and usually depressed.

name: Skin ulcer
label: Skin ulcer
definition: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting complete loss of the epidermis and often portions of the dermis and even subcutaneous fat.

name: Verrucae
label: Verrucae
