definition: Warts, benign growths on the skin or mucous membranes that cause cosmetic problems as well as pain and discomfort. Warts most often occur on the hands, feet, and genital areas.|Cause is a virus called HPV (human papilloma virus), which infects the skin and causes the abnormal growth. There are many different varieties of the virus, which usually depends on the location of the lesion.

name: Porokeratosis
label: Porokeratosis
definition: A clonal disorder of keratinization with one or multiple atrophic patches surrounded by a clinically and histologically distinctive hyperkeratotic ridgelike border called the cornoid lamella.

name: Cat cry
label: Cat cry
definition: The presence of a characteristic high-pitched cry that sounds similar to the meowing of a kitten.|This unusual cry is characteristic of the cri du chat syndrome which results from a deletion on the p arm of chromosome 5. It is thought to be due to laryngeal hypoplasia, floppy epiglottis, small larynx, and asymmetric vocal cords, but is probably also related to dysfunction of the central nervous system. This sign occurs in infants and disappears with age.

name: Chondritis of pinna
label: Chondritis of pinna
definition: Inflammation of the cartilage of the external ear.

name: Hemihypotrophy of lower limb
label: Hemihypotrophy of lower limb
definition: Shortening of a leg affecting only one side.

name: Small hand
label: Small hand
definition: Disproportionately small hand.

name: Macular scar
label: Macular scar
definition: Scar tissue in the macula.

name: Marcus Gunn pupil
label: Marcus Gunn pupil
definition: Video description of how to test patients at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HSYo7LhfV3A .

name: Colorectal polyposis
label: Colorectal polyposis
definition: Multiple abnormal growths that arise from the lining of the large intestine (colon or rectum) and protrude into the intestinal lumen.

name: Asymmetry of iris pigmentation
label: Asymmetry of iris pigmentation
definition: Asymmetry between the two irides or asymmetry between different parts of one iris.

name: Recurrent spontaneous abortion
label: Recurrent spontaneous abortion
definition: Repeated episodes of abortion (Expulsion of the product of fertilization before completing the term of gestation) without deliberate interference.

name: Peripheral vitreoretinal degeneration
label: Peripheral vitreoretinal degeneration
definition: A type of vitreoretinal degeneration with manifestations that are concentrated at the periphery of the retina.

name: Episodic quadriplegia
label: Episodic quadriplegia
definition: Intermittent episodes of paralysis of all four limbs.

name: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance
label: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance

name: Giant cell hepatitis
label: Giant cell hepatitis
definition: Chronic hepatitis characterized by parenchymal inflammation with formation of large multinucleated hepatocytes in response to a variety of insults to the liver.

name: Triangular-shaped open mouth
label: Triangular-shaped open mouth
definition: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth, in which the upper lip is tented in a way that the opened mouth has the appearance of a triangle.

name: Oral mucosal blisters
label: Oral mucosal blisters
definition: Blisters arising in the mouth.

name: Absent skin pigmentation
label: Absent skin pigmentation
definition: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring).

name: Absent fifth fingernail
label: Absent fifth fingernail
definition: Absence of nail of little finger.

name: Recurrent upper and lower respiratory tract infections
label: Recurrent upper and lower respiratory tract infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to upper and lower respiratory tract infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of upper and lower respiratory tract infections.

name: Acute hepatitis
label: Acute hepatitis
definition: Acute hepatic injury resulting from inflammation typically accompanied by increased serum alanine transaminase activity. Etiologies include viral hepatitis, drugs, toxins, and autoimmune disorders.

name: Chronic active hepatitis
label: Chronic active hepatitis
definition: Chronic hepatitis associated with recurrent clinical exacerbations, extrahepatic manifestations, and progression to cirrhosis.

name: Chronic hepatitis
label: Chronic hepatitis
definition: Hepatitis that lasts for more than six months.

name: Chronic hepatitis due to cryptosporidium infection
label: Chronic hepatitis due to cryptosporidium infection
definition: Chronic hepatitis associated with infection by cryptosporidia, as demonstrated (for example) by immunohistochemistry of liver tissue.

name: Atrial cardiomyopathy
label: Atrial cardiomyopathy
definition: Any complex of structural, architectural, contractile or electrophysiological changes affecting the atria with the potential to produce clinically relevant manifestations.

name: Biventricular hypertrophy
label: Biventricular hypertrophy
definition: Thickening of the heart walls in both ventricles.

name: Epileptic encephalopathy
label: Epileptic encephalopathy
definition: A condition in which epileptiform abnormalities are believed to contribute to the progressive disturbance in cerebral function. Epileptic encephalaopathy is characterized by (1) electrographic EEG paroxysmal activity that is often aggressive, (2) seizures that are usually multiform and intractable, (3) cognitive, behavioral and neurological deficits that may be relentless, and (4) sometimes early death.|Seizures alone without any underlying neurologic or medical illness can be the sole cause of encephalopathy. Patients with seizures as a cause or consequence of encephalopathy present with a wide variety of neurologic symptoms from mild reduction or alteration of consciousness to coma. Findings on neurologic exam are often nonfocal, nonspecific, and not predictive of the presence of seizures. Patients may or may not have subtle motor findings accompanying the presentation of encephalopathy. Signs range from very focal findings, such as nystagmus, eye flutter, blinking, and eye deviation to more widespread signs, such as myoclonus, tremulousness, and autonomic instability.

name: Mucoid extracellular matrix accumulation
label: Mucoid extracellular matrix accumulation
definition: An increase of medial mucoid extracellular matrix creating translamellar and/or intralamellar expansions including extracellular pools as noted on an H&E stain and/or a stain to highlight extracellular matrix material (Movat's pentachrome, Alcian blue, etc.).|MEMA replaces a variety of terms used in the past such as cystic medial necrosis, cystonecrosis, cystic degeneration, mucoid degeneration which, while generally understood by pathologists, are inaccurate. This histopathology can be subclassified and graded according to distribution, severity, and/or whether it crosses over multiple lamellar units as described. The grading should be reported as mild/moderate/severe and the distribution should be reported as focal, multifocal, or extensive.

name: Neuronal loss in basal ganglia
label: Neuronal loss in basal ganglia
definition: A reduction in the number of nerve cells in the basal ganglia.|See Fig. 11 in PMID:13729575.

name: Abnormal liver function tests during pregnancy
label: Abnormal liver function tests during pregnancy

name: CSF lymphocytic pleiocytosis
label: CSF lymphocytic pleiocytosis
definition: An increased lymphocyte count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Increased serum bile acid concentration during pregnancy
label: Increased serum bile acid concentration during pregnancy

name: Cutaneous mastocytosis
label: Cutaneous mastocytosis
definition: Multifocal dense infiltrates of mast cells in cutaneous tissue.

name: Agenesis of permanent mandibular lateral incisor
label: Agenesis of permanent mandibular lateral incisor

name: Agenesis of primary mandibular lateral incisor
label: Agenesis of primary mandibular lateral incisor

name: Tall chin
label: Tall chin
definition: Increased vertical distance from the vermillion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.

name: Chin with vertical crease
label: Chin with vertical crease
definition: Vertical crease fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin with the face at rest.|The vertical shape must be distinguished from H-shaped crease of the chin.

name: Extra concha fold
label: Extra concha fold
definition: Folds or ridges within the concha that are distinct from the crus helix.

name: Focal absence of the external ear
label: Focal absence of the external ear
definition: Absence of a localized portion of the ear that cannot be described by a more precise term (e.g., absent ear lobe).

name: Long ear
label: Long ear
definition: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.|The commonly used term Macrotia is a bundled term comprising increased length and width (surface area).

name: Short ear
label: Short ear
definition: Median longitudinal ear length less than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.|The commonly used term Microtia is a bundled term comprising decreased length and width (surface area).

name: Polymenorrhea
label: Polymenorrhea
definition: Frequent menses; menstrual cycles lasting less than 21 days.

name: Menometrorrhagia
label: Menometrorrhagia
definition: Prolonged/excessive menses and bleeding at irregular intervals.

name: Abnormality of vomer
label: Abnormality of vomer
definition: An abnormality of the vomer.

name: Cleft maxillary alveolus
label: Cleft maxillary alveolus
definition: Alveolar cleft is a tornado-shaped bone defect in the maxillary arch. Alveolar cleft occurs in response to divergence from normal development during frontonasal prominence growth, contact, and fusion. The most common alveolar portion of the cleft is located between the lateral incisor and the canine.|The palate develops from the frontonasal and maxillary prominences between 4 and 12 weeks of gestation. During gestational weeks 4 to 7, the primary palate originates from the median palatine process, which itself originated from frontonasal prominence. The lip, alveolus, and hard palate anterior to the incisive foramen all share this origin in development. During this period, disruptions of palatal development process can result in primary palate clefting. The secondary palate develops from the lateral palatine processes originating from the maxillary prominences between 7 and 12 weeks, and the hard palate posterior to incisive foramen and the soft palate are developmental products of this process. As such, disruptions during this time will result in secondary palate clefts. The alveolus is a component of the primary palate, and alveolar cleft results from mal-development of the frontonasal prominence. As such, it is most closely related to cleft lip and cleft palate. Generally, alveolar clefts are located between the lateral incisor and canine

name: Abnormality of ophthalmic artery
label: Abnormality of ophthalmic artery
definition: Abnormality of the first branch of the internal carotid artery.|The ophthalmic artery (OA) is the first branch of the internal carotid artery distal to the cavernous sinus. Branches of the OA supply all the structures in the orbit as well as some structures in the nose, face and meninges.

name: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system
label: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system
definition: Any abnormality of the part of the nervous system that consists of the nerves and ganglia outside of the brain and spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of the somatic nervous system
label: Abnormality of the somatic nervous system
definition: Any abnormality of the part of the peripheral nervous system associated with sensation and skeletal muscle voluntary control of body movements.|The SoNS consists of afferent and efferent nerves. Afferent nerves are responsible for relaying sensation to the central nervous system; efferent nerves are responsible for stimulating muscle contraction, including all the non-sensory neurons connected with skeletal muscles and skin.

name: Abnormality of somatic nerve plexus
label: Abnormality of somatic nerve plexus
definition: Any abnormality of the somatic nerve plexus.

name: Abnormality of masticatory muscle
label: Abnormality of masticatory muscle
definition: Any abnormality of the masticatory muscle.

name: Abnormal mouth floor morphology
label: Abnormal mouth floor morphology
definition: Any abnormality of the mouth floor.

name: Abnormality of the submandibular region
label: Abnormality of the submandibular region
definition: Any abnormality of the submandibular region, the region between the mandible and the hyoid bone contains the submandibular and sublingual glands, suprahyoid muscles, submandibular ganglion, and lingual artery.

name: Abnormality of ganglion
label: Abnormality of ganglion
definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the autonomic nervous system.

name: Abnormality of ganglion of peripheral nervous system
label: Abnormality of ganglion of peripheral nervous system
definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the peripheral autonomic nervous system.

name: Abnormality of cranial ganglion
label: Abnormality of cranial ganglion
definition: An abnormality of nerve cell cluster or a group of nerve cell bodies located in the autonomic nervous system of the cranium.

name: Otitis externa
label: Otitis externa
definition: Inflammation or infection of the external auditory canal (EAC), the auricle, or both.

name: Recurrent ear infections
label: Recurrent ear infections
definition: Increased susceptibility to ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of ear infections.

name: Epigastric pain
label: Epigastric pain
definition: Pain that is localized to the region of the upper abdomen immediately below the ribs.

name: Fish odor
label: Fish odor
definition: Body odor characterized by an offensive body odor and the smell of rotting fish due to the excessive excretion of trimethylamine (TMA) in the urine, sweat, and breath of affected individuals.

name: Musty odor
label: Musty odor
definition: Pungent body odor.

name: Vaginal fish odor
label: Vaginal fish odor
definition: A fish odor in the vaginal area, that is characteristic of bacterial vaginosis (BV), and is due to trimethylamine (TMA).

name: Abnormal distribution of cell junction proteins in buccal mucosal cells
label: Abnormal distribution of cell junction proteins in buccal mucosal cells
definition: An anomalous amount or location of cell junction proteins such as plakoglobin or Cx43.|Buccal mucosal cells are harvested from the oral mucosa in the region of the cheek, and can be used as a surrogate tissue to measure cell junction proteins because it is difficult to obtain cells from a tissue of interest such as the myocardium. Cell junction proteins, such as plakoglobin and the major cardiac gap junction protein Cx43 may have an abnormal distribution in diseases such as arrhythmogenic cardiomyopathy.

name: Abnormality of the periodontium
label: Abnormality of the periodontium
definition: Any abnormality of the periodontium.

name: Alveolar bone loss around teeth
label: Alveolar bone loss around teeth
definition: A decrease in the amount of alveolar bone around the root of a tooth.

name: Recurrent oral herpes
label: Recurrent oral herpes
definition: Recurrent episodes of oral herpes, typically characterized by blisters or ulcers on the gums, lips and/or tongue caused by herpes virus.

name: Cleft lip
label: Cleft lip
definition: A gap in the lip or lips.

name: Submucous cleft of soft and hard palate
label: Submucous cleft of soft and hard palate
definition: Soft and hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the soft and hard palate that are covered by the lining (ie mucous membrane) of the roof of the mouth.

name: Unilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
label: Unilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
definition: One sided alveolar cleft of the maxilla.

name: Bilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
label: Bilateral alveolar cleft of maxilla
definition: Nonmidline alveolar cleft of the maxilla.

name: Abnormal T cell activation
label: Abnormal T cell activation
definition: Any abnormality in the activation of T cells, i.e. the change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

name: Abnormal liver morphology
label: Abnormal liver morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the bile-secreting organ that is important for detoxification, for fat, carbohydrate, and protein metabolism, and for glycogen storage.

name: Abnormal neural tube morphology
label: Abnormal neural tube morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the hollow epithelial tube found on the dorsal side of the vertebrate embryo that develops into the central nervous system (i.e. brain and spinal cord).

name: Abnormality of radial ray
label: Abnormality of radial ray
definition: An abnormality of the radial ray; the thumb bones and 1st meta carpel.

name: Decreased level of 1,5 anhydroglucitol in serum
label: Decreased level of 1,5 anhydroglucitol in serum
definition: A decrease in the level of 1,5 anhydroglucitol in the serum. 1,5-Anhydrosorbitol is a validated marker of short-term glycemic control. This substance is derived mainly from food, is well absorbed in the intestine, and is distributed to all organs and tissues.

name: Increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in urine
label: Increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in urine

name: Increased level of allantoin in serum
label: Increased level of allantoin in serum
definition: An increase in the level of allantoin in the serum.

name: Increased level of GABA in serum
label: Increased level of GABA in serum
definition: An increase in the level of GABA in the serum.

name: Decreased level of GABA in serum
label: Decreased level of GABA in serum
definition: A decrease in the level of GABA in the serum.

name: Decreased level of erythritol in urine
label: Decreased level of erythritol in urine
definition: A decrease in the level of erythritol in the urine.

name: Decreased level of erythritol in CSF
label: Decreased level of erythritol in CSF
definition: A decrease in the level of erythritol in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Increased level of D-threitol in plasma
label: Increased level of D-threitol in plasma
definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the plasma.|D-threitol, a C4-polyol, is the main end product of D-xylose metabolism in humans.

name: Increased level of D-threitol in CSF
label: Increased level of D-threitol in CSF
definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the cerebrospinal fluid.|D-threitol, a C4-polyol, is the main end product of D-xylose metabolism in humans.

name: Increased level of D-threitol in urine
label: Increased level of D-threitol in urine
definition: An increase in the level of D-threitol in the urine.|D-threitol, a C4-polyol, is the main end product of D-xylose metabolism in humans.

name: Decreased level of D-mannose in urine
label: Decreased level of D-mannose in urine
definition: A decrease in the level of D-mannose in the urine.|D-Mannose is the 2-epimer of glucose.

name: Increased level of galactitol in plasma
label: Increased level of galactitol in plasma
definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the plasma.

name: Increased level of galactitol in urine
label: Increased level of galactitol in urine
definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the urine.|Galactitol is the reduction product of galactose.

name: Increased level of galactonate in red blood cells
label: Increased level of galactonate in red blood cells
definition: An increase in the level of galactonate in the red blood cells.

name: Increased level of galactitol in red blood cells
label: Increased level of galactitol in red blood cells
definition: An increase in the level of galactitol in the red blood cells.

name: Increased level of hippuric acid in blood
label: Increased level of hippuric acid in blood
definition: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the blood.

name: Increased level of hippuric acid in urine
label: Increased level of hippuric acid in urine
definition: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the urine.

name: Increased level of L-fucose in urine
label: Increased level of L-fucose in urine
definition: An increase in the level of L-fucose in the urine.|Fucose is a hexose deoxy sugar with the chemical formula C6H12O5.

name: Increased level of L-glutamic acid in blood
label: Increased level of L-glutamic acid in blood
definition: An increase in the level of L-glutamic acid in the blood.

name: Increased level of propylene glycol in blood
label: Increased level of propylene glycol in blood
definition: An increase in the level of propylene glycol in the blood.

name: Increased level of ribitol in urine
label: Increased level of ribitol in urine
definition: An increase in the level of ribitol in the urine. Ribotol is a crystalline pentose alcohol (C5H12O5) and is a metabolic end product formed by the reduction of ribose.

name: Increased level of ribitol in CSF
label: Increased level of ribitol in CSF
definition: An increase in the level of ribitol in the cerebral spinal fluid.

name: Increased level of ribose in urine
label: Increased level of ribose in urine
definition: An increase in the level of ribose in the urine.|Ribose is a pentose monosaccharide.

name: Increased level of ribose in CSF
label: Increased level of ribose in CSF
definition: An increase in the level of ribose in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Increased level of xylitol in urine
label: Increased level of xylitol in urine
definition: An increase in the level of xylitol in the urine.

name: Increased level of xylitol in CSF
label: Increased level of xylitol in CSF
definition: An increase in the level of xylitol in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Increased level of L-pyroglutamic acid in urine
label: Increased level of L-pyroglutamic acid in urine
definition: An increase in the level of L-pyroglutamic acid in the urine.

name: Chronic idiopathic urticaria
label: Chronic idiopathic urticaria
definition: Urticaria characterized by spontaneously recurring hives for 6 weeks or longer.

name: Physical urticaria
label: Physical urticaria
definition: Urticaria caused by physical agents, such as heat, cold, light, friction.

name: Cold urticaria
label: Cold urticaria
definition: Urticaria may be caused by cold temperatures.

name: Aquagenic urticaria
label: Aquagenic urticaria
definition: A form of physical urticaria, in which contact with water, regardless of its temperature and source, evokes pruritic follicular wheals on the skin.

name: Solar urticaria
label: Solar urticaria
definition: Urticaria in response to exposure to ultraviolet-A (UVA), ultraviolet-B (UVB), visible and rarely infrared light.

name: Vibratory urticaria
label: Vibratory urticaria
definition: Urticaria in response to dermal vibration, with coincident degranulation of mast cells and increased histamine levels in serum.

name: Exercise induced anaphylaxis
label: Exercise induced anaphylaxis
definition: Anaphylaxis after physical activity.

name: Abnormal biotinidase activity
label: Abnormal biotinidase activity
definition: An abnormality in biotinidase activity, an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

name: Decreased biotinidase activity
label: Decreased biotinidase activity
definition: A decrease in biotinidase activity, an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

name: Increased biotinidase activity
label: Increased biotinidase activity
definition: An increase in biotinidase activity, an enzyme that releases biotin from biocytin, the product of biotin-dependent carboxylases degradation.

name: Eosinophilic infiltration in the stomach mucosa
label: Eosinophilic infiltration in the stomach mucosa
definition: Infiltration of eosinophils in the stomach mucosa, that is diagnosed by an upper endoscopy and microscopy that shows more than 20 eosinophils per high-power field in association with peripheral eosinophilia and the absence of secondary cause of eosinophilia.

name: Idiopathic anaphylaxis
label: Idiopathic anaphylaxis
definition: A rare form of anaphylaxis for which triggers cannot be identified despite a detailed history and careful diagnostic assessment.

name: Drug-induced anaphylaxis
label: Drug-induced anaphylaxis
definition: A form of anaphylaxis that is triggered by intake of drugs or medications.

name: Eosinophilic infiltration of the esophagus
label: Eosinophilic infiltration of the esophagus
definition: Infiltration of numerous eosinophils (usually greater than 15 per high power field) into the squamous epithelium of the esophagus, and layering of eosinophils on the surface layer of the esophagus.

name: Eosinophilic microabscess formation in the esophagus
label: Eosinophilic microabscess formation in the esophagus
definition: The formation of small localized collection of eosinophiles (an eosinophilic microabscess) in the esophagus. Usually clusters of greater than or equal to 4 eosinophils are seen, that appear as exudates or white spots or white plaques.

name: Increased level of methylsuccinic acid in urine
label: Increased level of methylsuccinic acid in urine
definition: An increase in the level of methylsuccinic acid in the urine.

name: Increased level of myristic acid in serum
label: Increased level of myristic acid in serum
definition: An increase in the level of myristic acid in the serum.

name: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in urine
label: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in urine
definition: An increase in the level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in the urine.

name: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in fibroblasts
label: Increased level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in fibroblasts
definition: An increase in the level of N-acetylneuraminic acid in cultured fibroblasts.

name: Increased level of O-phosphoethanolamine in urine
label: Increased level of O-phosphoethanolamine in urine
definition: An increase in the level of O-phosphoethanolamine in the urine.

name: Defective interstrand cross-link repair
label: Defective interstrand cross-link repair
definition: A defect in the of the process of interstrand cross-link repair: removal of a DNA interstrand crosslink (a covalent attachment of DNA bases on opposite strands of the DNA) and restoration of the DNA. DNA interstrand crosslinks occur when both strands of duplex DNA are covalently tethered together (e.g. by an exogenous or endogenous agent), thus preventing the strand unwinding necessary for essential DNA functions such as transcription and replication.

name: Abnormal morphology of the chest musculature
label: Abnormal morphology of the chest musculature
definition: Any abnormality of the chest muscles.

name: Abnormality of the back musculature
label: Abnormality of the back musculature
definition: Any abnormality of the back muscles.

name: Abnormal morphology of the shoulder musculature
label: Abnormal morphology of the shoulder musculature
definition: Any abnormality of the shoulder muscles.

name: Hippocampal atrophy
label: Hippocampal atrophy
definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of hippocampus tissue that was once present.

name: Increased cotinine level
label: Increased cotinine level
definition: Increased concentration of cotinine in urine.|Cotinine is the main metabolite of nicotine and accumulates in the body as a result of tobacco exposure. In humans, cotinine is excreted in the urine, mainly as trans-3[prime]-hydroxycotinine and glucuronide. This is used as a measure for exposure to tobacco smoke.

name: Blood xenobiotic
label: Blood xenobiotic
definition: The presence of a xenobiotic in blood.

name: Increased troponin I level in blood
label: Increased troponin I level in blood
definition: An increased concentration of tropnin I in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

name: Increased troponin T level in blood
label: Increased troponin T level in blood
definition: An increased concentration of tropnin T in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.

name: Hyperketonemia
label: Hyperketonemia
definition: An increase in the level of ketone bodies in the blood.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in blood
definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in the blood.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in dried blood spot
definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in a dried blood spot.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

name: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
label: Abnormal glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
definition: An anomaly in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in tissue
definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in tissue.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in red blood cells
definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in red blood cells.

name: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
label: Decreased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
definition: A decrease in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

name: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
label: Increased glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase level in leukocytes
definition: An increase in the level of glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase in leukocytes.

name: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity
label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity
definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity, an enzyme that catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
label: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
definition: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
label: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma
definition: A decrease in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in plasma. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
label: Abnormal uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
definition: An abnormality in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
label: Increased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
definition: An increase in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
label: Decreased uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells
definition: A decrease in uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase activity in red blood cells. Uridine diphosphate glucose-4-epimerase catalyzes the reaction: UDP-glucose = UDP-galactose.

name: Increased CSF urate concentration
label: Increased CSF urate concentration
definition: Increased concentration of urate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Positive meconium barbiturate test
label: Positive meconium barbiturate test
definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in meconium.

name: Positive hair barbiturate test
label: Positive hair barbiturate test
definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the hair.

name: Positive stool barbiturate test
label: Positive stool barbiturate test
definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the stool.

name: Positive gastric fluid barbiturate test
label: Positive gastric fluid barbiturate test
definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as phenobarbital in the gastric fluid.

name: Increased intestinal transit time
label: Increased intestinal transit time
definition: An increase in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines.

name: Abnormal circulating nicotinurate level
label: Abnormal circulating nicotinurate level
definition: Any deviation from the normal concentration of nicotinurate in the blood.|Nicotinuric acid is an acyl glycine, which are normally minor metabolites of fatty acids. However, the excretion of certain acyl glycines is increased in several inborn errors of metabolism. In certain cases the measurement of these metabolites in body fluids can be used to diagnose disorders associated with mitochondrial fatty acid beta-oxidation. Nicotinuric acid is the major detoxification product of nicotinic acid. It may serve as a simple quantitative index of hepatic biotransformation of nicotinic acid.

name: Increased circulating nicotinurate level
label: Increased circulating nicotinurate level
definition: An increased amount of nicotinurate in the blood.

name: Positive methadone plasma/serum test
label: Positive methadone plasma/serum test
definition: Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in plasma or serum.|Methadone is an opioid drug that is used to treat severe pain or in the treatment of individiuals with opioid dependency.

name: Positive plasma/serum cotinine test
label: Positive plasma/serum cotinine test
definition: Detection of cotinine, an alkaloid found in tobacco and the predominant metabolite of nicotine, in plasma or serum.|Cotinine is used as a biomarker for exposure to tobacco smoke.

name: Folate deficiency in CSF
label: Folate deficiency in CSF
definition: A reduced concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9 in the cerebrospinal fluid.|Cerebral folate deficiency is usually measured as low levels of folate in the CSF, in the presence of normal folate metabolism outside the nervous system.

name: Abnormal cord blood measurement
label: Abnormal cord blood measurement
definition: An abnormality in any umbilical cord measurement performed after birth, such as the blood gas level.

name: Abnormal blood gas level in cord blood
label: Abnormal blood gas level in cord blood

name: Hyperoxemia in cord blood
label: Hyperoxemia in cord blood
definition: An abnormally high level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.

name: Hypoxemia in cord blood
label: Hypoxemia in cord blood
definition: An abnormally low level of blood oxygen in the cord blood.

name: Hypercapnia in cord blood
label: Hypercapnia in cord blood
definition: Abnormally elevated blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.

name: Hypocapnia in cord blood
label: Hypocapnia in cord blood
definition: Abnormally decreased blood carbon dioxide (CO2) level in the cord blood.

name: Abnormal blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
label: Abnormal blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
definition: An abnormal concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

name: Reduced blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
label: Reduced blood 5-methyltetrahydrofolate level
definition: A decreased concentration of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate in the blood.

name: Hypoplasia of maxilla relative to mandible
label: Hypoplasia of maxilla relative to mandible
definition: Abnormally small dimension of the maxilla (upper jaw) relative to the mandible (lower jaw).

name: Hypoplasia of mandible relative to maxilla
label: Hypoplasia of mandible relative to maxilla
definition: Abnormally small dimension of the mandible (lower jaw) relative to the maxilla (upper jaw).

name: Increased anti-dairy protein IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-dairy protein IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dairy proteins, including casein, alpha-lactalbumin, beta-lactoglobulin or bovine serum albumin contained in cow, sheep or goat milk and milk products.

name: Increased anti-animal protein IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-animal protein IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal proteins, such as albumins that are present in animal hair, dander, shed skin, saliva and urine.|For animal dander annotations, there is a more specific subclass of this term.

name: Increased anti-seafood IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-seafood IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against seafood, including fish, shrimp, lobster, crab, squid and abalone.

name: Increased anti-dust mite IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-dust mite IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against dust mites, such as house dust mites.

name: Increased anti-bacteria IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-bacteria IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against bacteria.

name: Increased anti-drug IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-drug IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a drug or class of drugs, such as antibiotics.

name: Increased anti-feather IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-feather IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against feathers, which could be indicative of an allergy against feathers themselves, or mite allergens present in feathers.

name: Increased anti-food allergen IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-food allergen IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against proteins found in foods, such as milk, egg, soy, wheat, peanut, treenut, fish, and shellfish.

name: Increased anti-plant based food allergen IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-plant based food allergen IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against a plant based food allergen, including vegetables and fruits.

name: Increased anti-gluten IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-gluten IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

name: Increased anti-nut food product IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-nut food product IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against nut food products such as peanuts or tree nuts, such as hazelnuts, walnuts, cashews, and almonds.

name: Increased anti-egg IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-egg IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against eggs, including egg whites, egg yolks, and egg proteins such as ovoalbumin and ovomucoid.

name: Increased anti-fungi IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-fungi IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against fungus, such as molds like zygomycota, ascomycota and deuteromycota.

name: Increased anti-meat allergen IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-meat allergen IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against meat, such as mammalian meat, including beef or pork, or poultry, like duck or chicken.

name: Increased anti-parasite IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-parasite IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against parasites, such as helminths (parasitic worms, such as Ascaris lumbricoides, Trichuris trichiura, Ancylostoma duodenalis, Necator americanus, Strongyloides stercoralis) or parasites such as Toxoplasma gondii.

name: Increased anti-insect IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-insect IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from insects such as moths, mosquitos, or cockroaches.

name: Increased anti-venom IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-venom IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against venom from insects such as bees, wasps, hornets, yellowjackets.

name: Increased anti-plant product IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-plant product IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against antigens from plants and products derived from plants, such as wood or pollen.

name: Positive urine norcotinine test
label: Positive urine norcotinine test
definition: Detection of norcotinine, a metabolite of nicotine, in urine.

name: Abnormal IgA level
label: Abnormal IgA level
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgA immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Abnormal IgE level
label: Abnormal IgE level
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgE immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Abnormal IgG level
label: Abnormal IgG level
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgG immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Abnormal IgM level
label: Abnormal IgM level
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgM immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Abnormal IgD level
label: Abnormal IgD level
definition: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgD immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Decreased circulating total IgD
label: Decreased circulating total IgD
definition: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin D (IgD) in blood.

name: Increased circulating IgD level
label: Increased circulating IgD level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin D in blood.

name: Increased anti-animal dander IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-animal dander IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against animal dander, tiny scales shed from animal skin or hair, such as from pet dogs or cats.

name: Increased anti-house dust mite IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-house dust mite IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against house dust mites, a common allergen.

name: Increased anti-alpha-gal IgE antibody level
label: Increased anti-alpha-gal IgE antibody level
definition: Increased level of IgE antibody against galactose-alpha-1, 3 galactose (alpha-gal), a carbohydrate found in mammalian meat.

name: Abnormal L-selectin shedding
label: Abnormal L-selectin shedding
definition: An abnormality in the cleavage of L-selectin during the process of guiding neutrophils to the site of infection. Proteolytic cleavage of L-selectin results in rapid shedding from the cell surface, which has a role in neutrophil rolling and accumulation at the site of infection.

name: Chronic neutropenia
label: Chronic neutropenia
definition: Neutropenia with an absolute neutrophil count (ANC) less than 1,500,000,000/L lasting for more than 3 months.

name: Chronic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
label: Chronic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
definition: Chornic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

name: Cyclic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
label: Cyclic neutropenia in myeloid maturation arrest in bone marrow
definition: Cyclic neutropenia arising from an impaired proliferation and maturation of myeloid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

name: Transient neutropenia
label: Transient neutropenia
definition: A transient reduction in the number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood. Transient neutropenia is most commonly associated with viral infections, but other causes include drugs and autoimmunity.

name: Infection associated neutropenia
label: Infection associated neutropenia
definition: Transient neutropenia caused by an infection, such as with a virus, bacteria or protozoan.

name: Neutrophilia in presence of infection
label: Neutrophilia in presence of infection
definition: An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood during an infection, such as with a bacteria, virus or fungus.

name: Neutrophilia in absence of infection
label: Neutrophilia in absence of infection
definition: An increased number of neutrophils circulating in the blood in the absence of an infection. Factors contributing to neutrophilia could include inflammation or congenital disorders.

name: Hepatopulmonary fusion
label: Hepatopulmonary fusion
definition: Fusion of the liver with the lung.

name: Asymmetrical gluteal crease
label: Asymmetrical gluteal crease
definition: The presence of an asymmetrical gluteal crease, the horizontal crease formed by the inferior aspect of the buttocks and the posterior upper leg.

name: Wide space between 4th and 5th toe
label: Wide space between 4th and 5th toe
definition: A widely spaced gap between the fourth toe and the fifth (pinky) toe.

name: Lower cranial nerve dysfunction
label: Lower cranial nerve dysfunction
definition: A functional abnormality affecting the lower cranial nerves, which include the paired 9th (glossopharyngeal), 10th (vagal), 11th (accessory) and 12th (hypoglossal) cranial nerves.

name: Brain imaging abnormality
label: Brain imaging abnormality
definition: An anomaly of metabolism or structure of the brain identified by imaging.

name: Subglottic hemangioma
label: Subglottic hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the airway, typically below the vocal chords, that can cause severe obstruction of the airway.

name: Supraglottic hemangioma
label: Supraglottic hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the upper part of the larynx (voice box) including the epiglottis; the area above the vocal cords.

name: Visceral hemangioma
label: Visceral hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma arising from within visceral structures, the internal organs of the body.

name: Intestinal hemangioma
label: Intestinal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the intestines, which includes the bowel.

name: Spleen hemangioma
label: Spleen hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the spleen.

name: Labial hemangioma
label: Labial hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the upper lip.

name: Esophageal hemangioma
label: Esophageal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the esophagus.

name: Laryngeal hemangioma
label: Laryngeal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the glottic or supraglottic regions.

name: Vulvar hemangioma
label: Vulvar hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the vulva.

name: Retropharyngeal hemangioma
label: Retropharyngeal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the retropharyngeal space, the portion of the peripharyngeal space that is located posterior to the pharynx.

name: Paraspinal hemangioma
label: Paraspinal hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the paraspinal muscular region, the muscles next to the spine.

name: Lumbosacral hemangioma
label: Lumbosacral hemangioma
definition: A spinal cord hemangioma located in the lumbosacral spine region.

name: Supraumbilical raphe
label: Supraumbilical raphe
definition: An abnormality of the sternum that presents at birth as a ventral sternal non-union defect, due to an abnormality of the fusion of the layers of the skin. It presents as a scar-like line that extends upward from the umbilicus (belly button).

name: Sternal pit
label: Sternal pit
definition: A sternal pit is a small indentation or dimple in the skin overlying the sternum of the chest. In some cases, the skin defect can be linear, extending several inches over the sternum.

name: Pituitary gland cyst
label: Pituitary gland cyst
definition: A fluid-filled sacs that develop on or near the pituitary gland.

name: Atrophic pituitary gland
label: Atrophic pituitary gland
definition: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of the pituitary gland.

name: Pediatric onset
label: Pediatric onset
definition: Onset of disease manifestations before adulthood, defined here as before the age of 16 years, but excluding neonatal or congenital onset.

name: Dyspepsia
label: Dyspepsia
definition: A heterogeneous group of symptoms that are localized in the epigastric region. Typical dyspeptic symptoms include postprandial fullness, early satiation, epigastric pain and epigastric burning, but other upper gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, belching or abdominal bloating often occur.

name: Abnormal circulating amylase level
label: Abnormal circulating amylase level
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

name: Positive blood acetaminophen test
label: Positive blood acetaminophen test
definition: Detection of acetaminophen in the blood.

name: Positive norpropoxyphene blood test
label: Positive norpropoxyphene blood test
definition: Detection of norpropoxyphene in the blood, a major metabolite of the opioid analgesic drug dextropropoxyphene.

name: Positive meconium methadone test
label: Positive meconium methadone test
definition: Detection of methadone or its metabolite 2-ethylidene-1,5-dimethyl-3,3- diphenylpyrrolidine (EDDP) in meconium.

name: Positive blood molindone test
label: Positive blood molindone test
definition: Detection of molindone in the blood, an antipyschotic used for treatment of schizophrenia.

name: Intrathoracic hemangioma
label: Intrathoracic hemangioma
definition: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the intrathoracic or chest region.

name: Hyperamylasemia
label: Hyperamylasemia
definition: Increased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

name: Hypoamylasemia
label: Hypoamylasemia
definition: Decreased level of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

name: Positive urine norpropoxyphene test
label: Positive urine norpropoxyphene test
definition: Detection of norpropoxyphene in urine.

name: Negativism
label: Negativism
definition: Opposing or not responding to instructions or external stimuli.

name: Abnormal isohemagglutinin level
label: Abnormal isohemagglutinin level
definition: An abnormal level of isohemagglutinin in the blood. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).

name: Absent isohemagglutinin level
label: Absent isohemagglutinin level
definition: Absent or undetectable level of isohemagglutinin. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).

name: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
label: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against proteins in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatisis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to hepatitis B vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a hepatitis B antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
label: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to pneumococcus vaccine
label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to pneumococcus vaccine
definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to pneumococcus vaccine
label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to pneumococcus vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to protein-conjugated polysaccharide vaccine
label: Decreased specific antibody response to protein-conjugated polysaccharide vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against protein-conjugated polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
label: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
definition: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib) antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
label: Partial absence of specific antibody response to meningococcus vaccine
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a meningococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Positive stool methadone test
label: Positive stool methadone test
definition: Detection of methadone and its metabolites in the stool.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to infection
label: Decreased specific antibody response to infection
definition: A reduced ability to synthesize antibodies against antigens from an infectious agent or pathogen (such as bacteria, viruses, parasites, etc.), as measured by antibody titer determination following infection.

name: Alpha-aminoadipic aciduria
label: Alpha-aminoadipic aciduria
definition: A increased concentration of alpha-aminoadipic acid in the urine.

name: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology in CSF
label: Abnormality of neutrophil morphology in CSF
definition: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
label: Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
definition: Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
label: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in CSF
definition: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Abnormal urinary 1-methylhistidine concentration
label: Abnormal urinary 1-methylhistidine concentration
definition: Abnormal concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Decreased urinary 1-methylhistidine
label: Decreased urinary 1-methylhistidine
definition: Decreased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Increased urinary 1-methylhistidine
label: Increased urinary 1-methylhistidine
definition: Increased concentration of 1-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Abnormal urinary 3-methylhistidine concentration
label: Abnormal urinary 3-methylhistidine concentration
definition: Abnormal concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Increased urinary 3-methylhistidine
label: Increased urinary 3-methylhistidine
definition: Increased concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Decreased urinary 3-methylhistidine
label: Decreased urinary 3-methylhistidine
definition: Decreased concentration of 3-methylhistidine in the urine.

name: Alpha-gal allergy
label: Alpha-gal allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against alpha-gal.

name: Animal protein allergy
label: Animal protein allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against animal proteins.

name: Animal dander allergy
label: Animal dander allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against animal dander.

name: Bacteria allergy
label: Bacteria allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against bacteria.

name: Drug allergy
label: Drug allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against drugs.

name: Dust mite allergy
label: Dust mite allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against dust mites.

name: House dust mite allergy
label: House dust mite allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against house dust mites.

name: Feather allergy
label: Feather allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against feathers.

name: Dairy allergy
label: Dairy allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against dairy.

name: Egg allergy
label: Egg allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against eggs.

name: Gluten allergy
label: Gluten allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against gluten.|A gluten allergy is usually distinct from gluten sensitivity or Celiac disease.

name: Meat allergen allergy
label: Meat allergen allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against allergens contained in meat products.

name: Nut food product allergy
label: Nut food product allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against nut food products.

name: Plant based food allergy
label: Plant based food allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against plant based food allergens.

name: Seafood allergy
label: Seafood allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against seafood.

name: Fungi allergy
label: Fungi allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against fungus.

name: Insect allergy
label: Insect allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insects.

name: Venom allergy
label: Venom allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insect venom.

name: Parasite allergy
label: Parasite allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against parasites.

name: Plant product allergy
label: Plant product allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against plant products.

name: Insect bite allergy
label: Insect bite allergy
definition: Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against insect bites.

name: Focal epithelial hyperplasia of oral mucosa
label: Focal epithelial hyperplasia of oral mucosa
definition: The occurrence of multiple or unique whitish or normal in color small papules or nodules in oral cavity, especially on labial and buccal mucosa, lower lip and tongue, and less often on the upper lip, gingiva and palate.

name: Abnormal circulating heparan sulfate level
label: Abnormal circulating heparan sulfate level
definition: An abnormal level of heparan sulfate in the blood.

name: Increased circulating heparan sulfate level
label: Increased circulating heparan sulfate level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of heparan sulfate in the blood.

name: Decreased circulating heparan sulfate level
label: Decreased circulating heparan sulfate level
definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of heparan sulfate in the blood.

name: Shortened O-fucosylated glycan on properdin
label: Shortened O-fucosylated glycan on properdin
definition: Decreased length of O-fucosylated glycans present on properdin.

name: Increased urinary polyhexose
label: Increased urinary polyhexose
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of polyhexose in the urine.

name: Increased urinary galactosylated oligosaccharide
label: Increased urinary galactosylated oligosaccharide
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of galactosylated oligosaccharides in urine.

name: Increased urinary high-mannose-type oligosaccharide
label: Increased urinary high-mannose-type oligosaccharide
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose-type oligosaccharides in the urine.

name: Increased urinary multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharide
label: Increased urinary multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharide
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of multiantennary sialylated oligosaccharides in the urine.

name: Decreased glycosyltransferase O-Fucosylpeptide 3-Beta-N-Acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity
label: Decreased glycosyltransferase O-Fucosylpeptide 3-Beta-N-Acetylglucosaminyltransferase activity
definition: An abnormal decrease in glycosyltransferase O-fucosylpeptide 3-beta-N-acetylglucosaminyltransferase enzymatic activity.

name: Increased urinary fucosylated oligosaccharide
label: Increased urinary fucosylated oligosaccharide
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentrationl of small fucosylated oligosaccharides in the urine.

name: Abnormal complex N-glycan level
label: Abnormal complex N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased complex N-glycan level
label: Increased complex N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased complex N-glycan level
label: Decreased complex N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of complex N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased sialylated N-glycan level
label: Increased sialylated N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased sialylated N-glycan level
label: Decreased sialylated N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of sialylated N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Abnormal high-mannose N-glycan level
label: Abnormal high-mannose N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased high-mannose N-glycan level
label: Increased high-mannose N-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of high-mannose N-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Abnormal core 1 O-glycan level
label: Abnormal core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased core 1 O-glycan level
label: Increased core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased core 1 O-glycan level
label: Decreased core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased O-mannosyl glycans on alpha-dystroglycan
label: Decreased O-mannosyl glycans on alpha-dystroglycan
definition: Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan with O-mannosyl glycans. Alpha-dystroglycan is a functional target of O-mannosyl glycosylation and functional glycosylation of alpha-DG is essential in its interaction with the extracellular matrix.

name: Increased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
label: Increased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Decreased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
label: Decreased monosialylated core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal decrease in the concentration of monosialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased disialylated core 1 O-glycan level
label: Increased disialylated core 1 O-glycan level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of disialylated core 1 O-glycans on glycoproteins.

name: Increased globoside Gb4 level
label: Increased globoside Gb4 level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of globoside Gb4.

name: Increased hepatitis A virus antibody level
label: Increased hepatitis A virus antibody level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis A virus in the blood.

name: Increased globoside Gb3 level
label: Increased globoside Gb3 level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of glycolipid globoside Gb3.

name: Increased hepatitis B virus antibody level
label: Increased hepatitis B virus antibody level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis B virus in the blood.

name: Absence of ganglioside GM3
label: Absence of ganglioside GM3
definition: The absence of ganglioside GM3.

name: Increased hepatitis C virus antibody level
label: Increased hepatitis C virus antibody level
definition: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin against hepatitis C virus in the blood.

name: Increased Tn-antigen level
label: Increased Tn-antigen level
definition: An abnormal increase in the concentration of Tn antigen on glycoproteins.

name: Abnormal proportion of naive CD4 T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of naive CD4 T cells
definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Abnormal proportion of naive CD8 T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of naive CD8 T cells
definition: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Elevated proportion of naive CD4 T cells
label: Elevated proportion of naive CD4 T cells
definition: An abnormally increased proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Elevated proportion of naive CD8 T cells
label: Elevated proportion of naive CD8 T cells
definition: An abnormally increased proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells
label: Reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells
definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells
label: Reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells
definition: An abnormally reduced proportion of naive CD4 T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

name: Abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.|Human CD8+T cells are commonly classified into four subsets based on the surface expression of the leukocyte common antigen isoform CD45RA and the lymph node addressin CCR7. Thereby, naive TN cells (CD45RA+/CCR7+) are separated from central memory TCM (CD45RA-/CCR7+), effector memory TEM (CD45RA-/CCR7-) and TEMRA (CD45RA+/CCR7-) T cells.

name: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormal proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: Decreased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell with memory phenotype is CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Decreased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: Decresaed proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: A reduced proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Decreased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Decreased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: A reduced proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Decreased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Decreased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta central memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Decreased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: A reduced proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta effector memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Increased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Increased proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CD45RO-positive and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
label: Increased proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells
definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of CD8-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CD45RO and CD127-positive. This cell type is also described as being CD25-negative, CD44-high, and CD122-high.

name: Increased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Increased proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of central memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype of CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Increased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Increased proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An abnormally elevated proportion of effector memory CD4-positive, alpha-beta memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An increased proportion of effector memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-negative, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.
