name: Increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
label: Increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells
definition: An increased proportion of central memory CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. These cells have the phenotype CCR7-positive, CD127-positive, CD45RA-negative, CD45RO-positive, and CD25-negative.

name: Bronchiolectasis
label: Bronchiolectasis
definition: Saccular dilatation of the terminal bronchioles.

name: Positive blood lead test
label: Positive blood lead test
definition: Detection of lead in the blood.

name: Absent sebaceous glands
label: Absent sebaceous glands
definition: Absence of the sebaceous gland, the holocrine gland that secretes sebum into the hair follicles, or in hairless areas into ducts.

name: Worse in evening
label: Worse in evening
definition: Applies to a sign or symptom that is exacerbated in the evening as compared to the day.

name: Abnormality of the frontal bone
label: Abnormality of the frontal bone
definition: An abnormality of the frontal bone.

name: Abnormality of the lacrimal bone
label: Abnormality of the lacrimal bone
definition: An abnormality of the lacrimal bone.

name: Abnormality of the palatine bone
label: Abnormality of the palatine bone
definition: An abnormality of the palatine bone.

name: Abnormality of ethmoid bone
label: Abnormality of ethmoid bone
definition: An abnormality of the ethmoid bone

name: Ectopic cilia of eyelid
label: Ectopic cilia of eyelid
definition: An eyelash that emerges from the underside (conjunctiva) of the upper or lower eyelid.

name: Symblepharon
label: Symblepharon
definition: A partial or complete adhesion of the palpebral conjunctiva of the eyelid to the bulbar conjunctiva of the eyeball.

name: Accessory eyelid
label: Accessory eyelid
definition: The presence of more than the normal number of eyelids.

name: Hypoplasia of eyelid
label: Hypoplasia of eyelid
definition: Developmental hypoplasia of the eyelid.

name: Microblepharia
label: Microblepharia
definition: Abnormal shortness of the vertical dimensions of the eyelids.

name: Defect of palpebral conjunctiva
label: Defect of palpebral conjunctiva
definition: An abnormality of the palpebral conjunctiva.

name: Incomplete ossification of palatine bone
label: Incomplete ossification of palatine bone
definition: Failure to complete ossification (maturation and calcification) of the palatine bone.

name: Absent palatine bone ossification
label: Absent palatine bone ossification
definition: Lack of formation of the palatine bone.

name: Abnormality of musculature of soft palate
label: Abnormality of musculature of soft palate
definition: An abnormality of one or more of the five muscles of the soft palate.

name: Abnormal morphology of musculature of pharynx
label: Abnormal morphology of musculature of pharynx
definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of the pharynx.

name: Abnormality of tensor veli palatini muscle
label: Abnormality of tensor veli palatini muscle
definition: An abnormality of the tensor veli palatini muscle

name: Abnormality of uvular muscle
label: Abnormality of uvular muscle
definition: An abnormality of the uvular muscle

name: Abnormality of nasal musculature
label: Abnormality of nasal musculature
definition: An abnormality of the muscles of the structure of the nose.

name: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression
label: Abnormality of muscle of facial expression
definition: An abnormality of any of the muscles of facial expression, which are innervated by the seventh (VII) cranial nerve and control facial expression.

name: Abnormality of levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
label: Abnormality of levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle
definition: An abnormality of the levator labii superioris alaeque nasi muscle.

name: Abnormal common carotid artery morphology
label: Abnormal common carotid artery morphology
definition: An abnormality of the common carotid arteries, which provide the arterial supply to the head and neck and give rise to the internal carotid artery and the external carotid artery.

name: Abnormality of the sphenoid sinus
label: Abnormality of the sphenoid sinus
definition: An abnormality of the sphenoid sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The sphenoid sinus is located within the sphenoid bone.

name: Abnormality of the maxillary sinus
label: Abnormality of the maxillary sinus
definition: An abnormality of the maxillary sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The maxillary sinus is located within the skeleton of the midface, lateral to the nasal cavity.

name: Abnormality of external jugular vein
label: Abnormality of external jugular vein
definition: An abnormality of an external jugular vein of the neck.

name: Bilateral facial palsy
label: Bilateral facial palsy
definition: Two-sided or bilateral weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.

name: Abnormality of the shape of the midface
label: Abnormality of the shape of the midface
definition: An abnormal morphology (form) of the midface or its components, the cheeks, maxilla, zygomatic bone, malar region, and infraorbital rims.

name: Hyperplasia of the maxilla
label: Hyperplasia of the maxilla
definition: Abnormally increased dimension of the maxilla, especially relative to the mandible, resulting in a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or in anterior positioning of the nasal base, increased convexity of the face, increased nasolabial angle, or increased width (transverse dimension of the maxilla.

name: Hyperplasia of the premaxilla
label: Hyperplasia of the premaxilla
definition: An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively large in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.

name: Body odor
label: Body odor
definition: A perceived unpleasant smell given off by the body.

name: Anal pain
label: Anal pain
definition: Pain in and around the anus or rectum (perianal region).

name: Urethritis
label: Urethritis
definition: Inflammation of the urethra.|Urethritis is characterized by discharge, dysuria and/or urethral discomfort but may be asymptomatic. Common etiologies include gonococcal urethritis as well as infection by chlamydia trachomatis, mycoplasma genitalium, ureaplasma urealyticum, trichomonas vaginalis, anaerobes, herpes simplex virus, and adenovirus.

name: Iris flocculi
label: Iris flocculi
definition: Multiple cysts along the pupillary margin that appear as spherical or tear-drop-shaped pigmented lesions or wrinkled masses emerging from the pupillary border of the iris.|Iris flocculi cause little, if any, visual impairment in most cases. However, they are occasionally associated with dissecting aortic aneurysm due to a shared mutation in smooth muscle that affects both the iris and the aorta.

name: Cornea verticillata
label: Cornea verticillata
definition: Golden brown or gray deposits with a clockwise, whorl-like distribution in the inferior interpalpebal portion of the cornea.|Cornea verticillata can be a feature of Fabry disease and can occur as an adverse effect of mediciations including amiodarone.

name: Dysplastic gangliocytoma of the cerebellum
label: Dysplastic gangliocytoma of the cerebellum
definition: It is a rare, slowly growing tumor of the cerebellum, a gangliocytoma sometimes considered to be a hamartoma, characterized by diffuse hypertrophy of the granular layer of the cerebellum.|Often associated with Cowden syndrome.

name: Moon facies
label: Moon facies
definition: A rounded, puffy face with fat deposits in the temporal fossa and cheeks, a double chin.|Moon facies can occur in persons treated with high-dose corticosteroids or with Cushing disease.

name: Abnormality of gonadotropin-releasing hormone level
label: Abnormality of gonadotropin-releasing hormone level
definition: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of the normal gonadotropin-releasing hormone level secreted from the pituitary gland.

name: Lack of gonadotropin-releasing hormone pulsatility
label: Lack of gonadotropin-releasing hormone pulsatility
definition: Secretion of gonadotropin-releasing hormone that does not occur in a pulsatile fashion.|The decapeptide gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) is the master hormone regulating reproduction. GnRH is released from some 1000 neurons within the hypothalamus in a pulsatile manner. Hypothalamic GnRH gene expression occurs intermittently (in a pulsatile fashion). The primary target of hypothalamic GnRH is the anterior pituitary gonadotrope, which responds to stimulation by increasing the synthesis and secretion of the gonadotropins luteinzing hormone (LH) and follicle stimulating hormone (FSH), which in turn regulate gonadal development and function.

name: Abnormal cardiac test
label: Abnormal cardiac test
definition: Abnormal test result of cardiovascular physiology.

name: Abnormal cardiac MRI
label: Abnormal cardiac MRI
definition: Abnormal results of a MRI for the heart.

name: Abnormal cardiac catheterization
label: Abnormal cardiac catheterization
definition: Abnormal results from the diagnostic tests resulting from cardiac catheterization.

name: Abnormal cardiac exercise stress test
label: Abnormal cardiac exercise stress test
definition: Abnormal results of exercise on heart function.

name: Abnormal resting energy expenditure from metabolic cart test
label: Abnormal resting energy expenditure from metabolic cart test
definition: Resting energy expenditure (REE) can be measured with indirect calorimetry using a metabolic cart, which is used to measure the oxygen consumption (VO2) and carbon dioxide production (VCO2).

name: Abnormal cardiac biomarker test
label: Abnormal cardiac biomarker test
definition: Abnormal blood test results measuring creatine kinase (CK), CK-MB, troponin (TROPI), myoglobin, and/or cardiac enzymes.

name: Reduced brain gamma-aminobutyric acid level by MRS
label: Reduced brain gamma-aminobutyric acid level by MRS
definition: An decreased level of gamma-aminobutyric acid in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Abnormal serum dehydroepiandrosterone level
label: Abnormal serum dehydroepiandrosterone level
definition: A deviation from the normal concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone in the circulation.|Dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA), which is produced in the adrenal glands and the gonads, represents the most abundant circulating steroid hormone. It is a metabolic intermediate in the biosynthesis of the androgen and estrogen sex steroids.

name: Shoulder muscle aplasia
label: Shoulder muscle aplasia
definition: Absence of shoulder muscles.

name: Aplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
label: Aplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
definition: Absence of the musculature of the pelvis.

name: Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
label: Hypoplasia of the musculature of the pelvis
definition: Underdevelopment of the musculature of the pelvis.

name: Aplastic colon
label: Aplastic colon
definition: Congenital absence of the colon

name: Cotton wool plaques
label: Cotton wool plaques
definition: Deposition of large, diffuse cotton wool amyloid plaques (CWPs) lacking a dense core and associated neuritic changes.

name: Abnormal hepatic glycogen storage
label: Abnormal hepatic glycogen storage
definition: Change in normal glycogen storage content.

name: Sclerosis of the carpal bones
label: Sclerosis of the carpal bones
definition: An elevation in bone density in one or more carpal bones of the hand.

name: Abnormal neuron branching
label: Abnormal neuron branching
definition: Abnormality of the structure and branching of the dendrites of a neuron.

name: Abnormal natural killer subset distribution
label: Abnormal natural killer subset distribution
definition: Any abnormality in the proportion natural killer subsets relative to the total number of natural killer cells.

name: Nasolacrimal sac obstruction
label: Nasolacrimal sac obstruction
definition: Blockage of the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Nasolacrimal sac granuloma
label: Nasolacrimal sac granuloma
definition: A mass of granulation tissue in response to chronic dacryocystitis as polypoid formations or they follow accidental injury, from probing and as a reaction to retained foreign bodies in the sac.

name: Nasolacrimal sac papilloma
label: Nasolacrimal sac papilloma
definition: Benign tumor of the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Nasolacrimal sac epithelial papillary carcinoma
label: Nasolacrimal sac epithelial papillary carcinoma
definition: The malignant epithelial neoplasm with papillary growths in the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Conjunctival cicatrization
label: Conjunctival cicatrization
definition: An abnormality of the conjuctiva and ocular surface caused by conjunctival inflammation and associated with scarring.

name: Dermolipoma of the conjunctiva
label: Dermolipoma of the conjunctiva
definition: A benign tumor composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue usually located near the temporal fornix.

name: Myopic astigmatism
label: Myopic astigmatism
definition: A condition where one or both of the two principal meridians focus in the front of the retina when the eye is at rest.

name: Latent hypermetropia
label: Latent hypermetropia
definition: A term to describe when farsightedness is masked when the accommodative muscles are used to increase the focusing power of the eye.

name: Eyelid retraction
label: Eyelid retraction
definition: With the eyes in primary position, the sclera is visible above the superior corneal limbus.

name: Upper eyelid retraction
label: Upper eyelid retraction
definition: An elevation of the eyelid above the normal level in the primary position.

name: Collier's sign
label: Collier's sign
definition: A unilateral or bilateral eyelid retraction due to midbrain lesions.

name: Seborrhoeic blepharitis
label: Seborrhoeic blepharitis
definition: Inflamation of the eyelid due to overactivity of the sebaceous gland.|There is some suggestion that yeast bacterial strain called Malassezia furfur may cause seborrhoeic dermatitis. This yeast bacterial strain thrives in the oil of human skin especially in adults.

name: Nasolacrimal sac lymphoma
label: Nasolacrimal sac lymphoma
definition: A type of lymphoma that involves the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Delayed canalization of nasolacrimal duct
label: Delayed canalization of nasolacrimal duct
definition: A very common condition in which the extreme end of the nasolacrimal duct underneath the inferior turbinate fails to complete its canalization in the newborn period.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity
label: Retinopathy of prematurity
definition: An avascular or abnormally vascularized retina that occurs in premature infants and can lead to blindness.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 1
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 1
definition: The retinal vessels stop and then a linear flat white line is present that usually runs the circumference of the vascular retina.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 2
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 2
definition: The accumulating neovascularization thickens and manifests as a linear bump. The neovascularization remains along the surface of the retina and does not extend off the retina into the cortical vitreous.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 3
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 3
definition: The neovascularization accumulates at the edge of the vascularized retina and extends into the vitreous (also called extra retinal fibrosis proliferation). In cases of Zone 2 and Zone 3, this may be sausage shaped. In more posterior Zone 1 disease, the stage 3 can appear as a direct extension of the normal retinal vessels but extending tangentially over the avascular retina.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4
definition: Scar tissue that forms a continuous sheet coming up from the edge of the vascularized retina. This scar tissue can grow toward the vitreous base/posterior lens capsule resulting in traction, distortion, and even detachment.|Stage 4 can occur after treatment (unlike stages 1-3) and may be accelerated by the absence of vascular endothelial growth factor posttreatment leading to an accelerated cicatricial phase.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4a
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4a
definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that does not extend into the macula.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4b
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 4b
definition: A detachment that involves the peripheral retina that involves the macula itself. The detachment usually starts in the temporal periphery although can also involve the nasal retina as well.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5
definition: Funnel detachment from the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5a
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5a
definition: An open funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5b
label: Retinopathy of prematurity stage 5b
definition: A closed funnel detachment of the retina with generally traction in all four quadrants.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity zone I
label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone I
definition: Retinopathy which extends from the center of the optic disc to twice the distance from the center of the optic disc to the center of the macula.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity zone II
label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone II
definition: Retinopathy which extends centrifugally from the edge of zone I to the nasal ora serrata.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity zone III
label: Retinopathy of prematurity zone III
definition: Retinopathy which is a residual crescent of retina anterior to zone II.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity plus
label: Retinopathy of prematurity plus
definition: Venous dilatation and arteriolar tortuosity of the posterior retinal vessels and may later increase in severity to include iris vascular engorgement, poor pupillary dilatation (rigid pupil), and vitreous haze. This definition has been further refined in the later clinical trials in which the diagnosis of plus disease could be made if sufficient vascular dilatation and tortuosity are present in at least 2 quadrants of the eye.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity pre-plus
label: Retinopathy of prematurity pre-plus
definition: As vascular abnormalities of the posterior pole that are insufficient for the diagnosis of plus disease but that demonstrate more arterial tortuosity and more venous dilatation than normal.|Over time, the vessel abnormalities of pre-plus may progress to frank plus disease as the vessels dilate and become more tortuous.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity threshold
label: Retinopathy of prematurity threshold
definition: A retinopathy with a 50% likelihood of progressing to retinal detachment. Threshold disease is considered to be present when stage 3 retinopathy of prematurity (ROP) is present in either zone I or zone II, with at least 5 continuous or 8 total clock hours of disease, and the presence of plus disease.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity prethreshold
label: Retinopathy of prematurity prethreshold
definition: High risk patients who were in Zone 1 (no Plus or stage 3) or Zone 2 with Plus or stage 3 but not both.

name: Latent myopia
label: Latent myopia
definition: The difference between total and manifest myopia.

name: Paralytic ectropion
label: Paralytic ectropion
definition: A type of ectropion associated with orbicularis muscle weakness caused by cranial nerve VII palsy.

name: Conjunctival dermolipoma
label: Conjunctival dermolipoma
definition: A conjuctival lesion composed of adipose tissue and dense connective tissue. Such choristomas of dermal elements are normally found at the outer canthus, and have a gelatinous appearance. Classically, there is an indistinct posterior border (with the lesion frequently extending into the orbit) and a well-demarcated anterior border several millimetres posterior to the limbus.

name: Absolute eccentric fixation
label: Absolute eccentric fixation
definition: Eccentric fixation in which the angle of eccentricity equals the objective angle of deviation.

name: Abnormal ocular alignment
label: Abnormal ocular alignment
definition: Any deviation from the normal ocular alignment.

name: Dissociated vertical deviation
label: Dissociated vertical deviation
definition: An incomitant tendency for an occluded eye to elevate and extort which resolves on uncovering.|Dissociated vertical deviation (DVD ) occurs when the level of illumination received by either eye is reduced sufficiently and as a result eye deviates progressively upwards, but reverts to its original position when the level of illumination returns to normally acceptable levels. It may sometimes be so asymmetrical as to be virtually unilateral and is associated with heterotropia usually of early onset.

name: Dissociated horizontal deviation
label: Dissociated horizontal deviation
definition: A change in horizontal ocular alignment, unrelated to accommodation, that is brought about solely by a change in the balance of visual input from the two eyes.

name: Alternating hypertropia
label: Alternating hypertropia
definition: A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated upwards.

name: Alternating hyperphoria
label: Alternating hyperphoria
definition: A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates upwards.

name: Alternating hypotropia
label: Alternating hypotropia
definition: A type of vertical tropia in which, when one eye is fixing, the other eye is deviated downwards.

name: Alternating hypophoria
label: Alternating hypophoria
definition: A type of vertical phoria in which, in dissociation, the occluded eye deviates downwards.

name: Pseudophakia
label: Pseudophakia
definition: The term pseudophakia refers to having an artificial lens implanted after the natural eye lens has been removed. During cataract surgery the natural cloudy lens is replaced by an pseudophakia intraocular lens (IOL).

name: Optic nerve gray crescent
label: Optic nerve gray crescent
definition: Having a characteristic appearance of a slate gray area of pigmentation within the disc margins that commonly appears along the inferotemporal or temporal neuroretinal rim areas.|This type of disc rim pigmentation can create the impression of neuroretinal rim thinning, and thus lead to the misdiagnosis of glaucoma or "glaucoma suspect" with attendant implications for overtreatment or unnecessary close monitoring of such patients.

name: Peripapillary atrophy
label: Peripapillary atrophy
definition: Thinning in the layers of the retina and retinal pigment epithelium around the optic nerve.

name: Foveal depigmentation
label: Foveal depigmentation
definition: Loss of pigment in the fovea centralis.

name: Optic nerve sheath meningioma
label: Optic nerve sheath meningioma
definition: A benign tumour of meningothelial cells of the meninges that usually occurs in middle age. It is typically unilateral and there is an association with neurofibromatosis type 2.

name: Periocular capillary hemangioma
label: Periocular capillary hemangioma
definition: A capillary hemangioma surrounding the eyeball but within the orbit.

name: Lymphangioma of the orbit
label: Lymphangioma of the orbit
definition: A hamartoma of lymph vessels that usually presents in childhood. It tends to increase in size with head-down posture and with the Valsalva manoeuvre. Superficial lesions are visible as transilluminable cystic spaces of the lid or conjunctiva that may also contain blood. Deep lesions may cause gradual proptosis or present acutely with orbital pain and reduced vision due to haemorrhage.

name: Orbital rhabdomyosarcoma
label: Orbital rhabdomyosarcoma
definition: A mesenchymal tumour that is considered to be the commonest primary orbital malignancy in children. Histologically, it may be differentiated into embryonal, alveolar, and pleomorphic types. It is usually intraconal or within the superior orbit.

name: Food allergy
label: Food allergy
definition: Primary food allergies primarily occur as a result (most likely) of gastrointestinal sensitization to predominantly stable food allergens (glycoproteins). A secondary food allergy develops after primary sensitization to airborne allergens (e. g., pollen allergens) with subsequent reactions (due to cross-reactivity) to structurally related often labile allergens in (plant) foods.

name: Latex allergy
label: Latex allergy
definition: Latex allergy is an IgE-mediated immediate hypersensitivity response to natural rubber latex (NRL) protein with a variety of clinical signs ranging from contact urticaria, angioedema, asthma, and anaphylaxis.

name: Food-induced anaphylaxis
label: Food-induced anaphylaxis
definition: Food-induced anaphylaxis is a severe, potentially fatal, systemic allergic reaction that occurs suddenly after contact with an allergy-causing food.

name: Venom-induced anaphylaxis
label: Venom-induced anaphylaxis
definition: A form of anaphylaxis that is triggered by exposure to venom.

name: Stool xenobiotic
label: Stool xenobiotic
definition: Presence of xenobiotic in stool.

name: Meconium xenobiotic
label: Meconium xenobiotic
definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in meconium.

name: Hair xenobiotic
label: Hair xenobiotic
definition: Presence of xenobiotic in hair.

name: Plasma/serum xenobiotic
label: Plasma/serum xenobiotic
definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in plasma and/or serum.

name: Gastric fluid xenobiotic
label: Gastric fluid xenobiotic
definition: Presence of a xenobiotic in gastric fluid.

name: Decreased diastolic blood pressure
label: Decreased diastolic blood pressure
definition: Abnormal decrease in diastolic blood pressure.

name: Decreased systolic blood pressure
label: Decreased systolic blood pressure
definition: Abnormal decrease in systolic blood pressure.

name: Isolated systolic hypertension
label: Isolated systolic hypertension
definition: Elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated blood pressure.|Isolated systolic hypertension or an elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated diastolic blood pressure is a known risk factor for incident heart failure in older adults.

name: Isolated diastolic hypotension
label: Isolated diastolic hypotension
definition: A decrease in diastolic blood pressure (<60 mmHg) without a decrease in systolic blood pressure (> or = to 100 mmHg).|Isolated diastolic hypotension is a risk factor for incident heart failure.

name: Positive urine cocaine test
label: Positive urine cocaine test
definition: Detection of cocaine or its major metabolite, benzoylecgonine, in urine.|Cocaine is an illicit stimulant that has a high potential for abuse and addiction.

name: Positive urine barbiturate test
label: Positive urine barbiturate test
definition: Detection of barbiturate metabolites such as Phenobarbital in urine.|Barbiturates are central nervous depressants. They can reduce heart rate, breathing, and blood pressure.

name: Positive urine cannabinoid test
label: Positive urine cannabinoid test
definition: Detection of delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) or other cannabinoid metabolites in urine.|Cannabis (marijuana, hashish) is the most widely used illegal drug in the world. The primary psychoactive component in cannabis is delta9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), which is rapidly metabolized to equipotent 11-hydroxy-THC (11-OH-THC) and non-psychoactive 11-nor-9-carboxy- delta9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THCCOOH).

name: Positive urine benzodiazepines test
label: Positive urine benzodiazepines test
definition: Detection of benzodiazepine metabolites, primarily nordiazepam, oxazepam, and temazepam, in urine.

name: Positive urine amphetamine test
label: Positive urine amphetamine test
definition: Detection of amphetamine or its metabolites in urine.

name: Positive urine opioid test
label: Positive urine opioid test
definition: Detection of opioids or opioid metabolites in urine.|Opiates are the natural or synthetic drugs that have a morphine-like pharmacological action. Medically, opiates are used primarily for relief of pain. Opiates include morphine and drugs structurally similar to morphine (eg, codeine, hydrocodone, hydromorphone, oxycodone).

name: Increased stool urobilinogen concentration
label: Increased stool urobilinogen concentration

name: Abnormal CSF urate concentration

name: Abnormal great auricular nerve morphology
label: Abnormal great auricular nerve morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of a great auricular nerve.|The great auricular nerve originates from the cervical plexus and ascends to the posterior inferior region of the parotid gland, where it divides into several small branches. The nerve supplies sensation for an extensive area of the face including the skin over the parotid gland and the mastoid process and the surface of the external ear. The great auricular nerve winds around the posterior aspect of the sternocleidomastoid muscle. After perforating the deep fascia, it ascends upon the sternocleidomastoid muscle beneath the platysma to the parotid gland, where it divides into an anterior and a posterior branch. The anterior branch provides sensory innervation to the skin overlying the parotid gland and communicates with the facial nerve in the substance of the gland. The posterior branch innervates the skin over the mastoid and the posterior surface of the auricle except at its upper part.

name: Abnormal greater palatine artery morphology
label: Abnormal greater palatine artery morphology
definition: An abnormality of a greater palatine artery.|The greater palatine artery is a terminal branch of the maxillary artery that supplies blood to the hard palate and nasal septum.

name: Abnormality of odontoid tissue
label: Abnormality of odontoid tissue
definition: An abnormality of an odontoid tissue.

name: Abnormal hyoglossus muscle morphology
label: Abnormal hyoglossus muscle morphology
definition: An abnormality of a hyoglossus muscle.

name: Abnormality of hyoid bone
label: Abnormality of hyoid bone
definition: An abnormality of a hyoid bone.

name: Abnormality of hypopharynx
label: Abnormality of hypopharynx
definition: An abnormality of a hypopharynx.

name: Abnormality of inferior alveolar artery
label: Abnormality of inferior alveolar artery
definition: An abnormality of an inferior alveolar artery.

name: Abnormality of inferior alveolar nerve
label: Abnormality of inferior alveolar nerve
definition: An abnormality of an inferior alveolar nerve.

name: Abnormality of artery of lower lip
label: Abnormality of artery of lower lip
definition: An abnormality of an artery of lower lip.

name: Abnormality of inferior oblique extraocular muscle
label: Abnormality of inferior oblique extraocular muscle
definition: An abnormality of an inferior oblique extraocular muscle.

name: Abnormality of inferior rectus extraocular muscle
label: Abnormality of inferior rectus extraocular muscle
definition: An abnormality of an inferior rectus extraocular muscle.

name: Abnormal inferior thyroid vein morphology
label: Abnormal inferior thyroid vein morphology
definition: An abnormality of an inferior thyroid vein.

name: Abnormality of infraorbital artery
label: Abnormality of infraorbital artery
definition: An abnormality of an infraorbital artery.

name: Abnormality of infra-orbital nerve
label: Abnormality of infra-orbital nerve
definition: A structural abnormality of an infra-orbital nerve. The infraorbital nerve arises from the maxillary branch of the trigeminal nerve and normally traverses the orbital floor in the infraorbital canal.

name: Abnormal internal carotid artery morphology
label: Abnormal internal carotid artery morphology
definition: An abnormality of an internal carotid artery.

name: Abnormality of internal jugular vein
label: Abnormality of internal jugular vein
definition: An abnormality of an internal jugular vein.

name: Abnormality of intrinsic muscle of tongue
label: Abnormality of intrinsic muscle of tongue
definition: An abnormality of an intrinsic muscle of tongue.

name: Abnormal lacrimal artery morphology
label: Abnormal lacrimal artery morphology
definition: An abnormality of a lacrimal artery.

name: Abnormal lacrimal sac morphology
label: Abnormal lacrimal sac morphology
definition: An abnormality of a lacrimal sac.

name: Abnormal lateral cricoarytenoid muscle morphology
label: Abnormal lateral cricoarytenoid muscle morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of a lateral crico-arytenoid muscle, which extends from the lateral cricoid cartilage to the muscular process of the arytenoid cartilage, and can adduct the vocal cords, which closes the rima glottidis and thereby protects the airway.

name: Abnormality of lateral pterygoid muscle
label: Abnormality of lateral pterygoid muscle
definition: An abnormality of a lateral pterygoid muscle.

name: Abnormality of lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle
label: Abnormality of lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle
definition: An abnormality of a lateral rectus extra-ocular muscle.

name: Abnormality of levator anguli oris
label: Abnormality of levator anguli oris
definition: An abnormality of a levator anguli oris.

name: Abnormality of levator labii superioris
label: Abnormality of levator labii superioris
definition: An abnormality of a levator labii superioris.

name: Abnormal levator palpebrae superioris morphology
label: Abnormal levator palpebrae superioris morphology
definition: An abnormality of a levator palpebrae superioris.

name: Abnormality of levator veli palatini muscle
label: Abnormality of levator veli palatini muscle
definition: An abnormality of a levator veli palatini.

name: Abnormal lingual artery morphology
label: Abnormal lingual artery morphology
definition: Any structural abnormality of a lingual artery.

name: Abnormal lingual nerve morphology
label: Abnormal lingual nerve morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of a lingual nerve.|The lingual nerve (LN) is one of the two terminal branches of the posterior division of the mandibular nerve. It supplies the general sensation to the mucosa of the anterior two-thirds of the tongue, the sublingual mucosa, the mandibular lingual gingiva and the floor of the mouth.The chorda tympani nerve, a branch of the facial nerve joins this nerve carrying taste fibers from the anterior two third of the tongue and parasympathetic fibers to the submandibular ganglion.

name: Abnormality of lingual tonsil
label: Abnormality of lingual tonsil
definition: An abnormality of a lingual tonsil.

name: Abnormal mandible condylar process morphology
label: Abnormal mandible condylar process morphology
definition: An abnormality of a mandible condylar process.

name: Abnormal mandible coronoid process morphology
label: Abnormal mandible coronoid process morphology
definition: An abnormality of a mandible coronoid process.

name: Abnormality of mandibular symphysis
label: Abnormality of mandibular symphysis
definition: A structural abnormality of a mandibular symphysis.

name: Abnormal cardiac magnetic resonance imaging finding
label: Abnormal cardiac magnetic resonance imaging finding
definition: Abnormal finding by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), which uses non-ionizing radiation via a strong magnetic field and radio frequency energy to generate three dimensional images. This term comprises findings that are specific to MRI. Findings such as ventricular spetum defect that can be detected by multiple modalities should be coded separately.

name: Elevated myocardial native T2
label: Elevated myocardial native T2
definition: Increased duration of myocardial T2 time without gadolinium contrast. Elevated T2, which can detect myocardial edema.

name: Myocardial late gadolinium enhancement
label: Myocardial late gadolinium enhancement
definition: Areas of high signal intensity in magnetic resonance imaging of the heart appearing 10 to 15 minutes after injection of the intercellular contrast agent gadolinium.

name: Pericardial late gadolinium enhancement
label: Pericardial late gadolinium enhancement
definition: Areas of high signal intensity in magnetic resonance imaging of the pericardium appearing around 10 minutes after injection of the intercellular contrast agent gadolinium.

name: Elevated myocardial native T1
label: Elevated myocardial native T1
definition: Increased duration of myocardial T1 time without gadolinium contrast. T1 mapping consists of quantifying the T1 relaxation time of a tissue by using analytical expressions of image-based signal intensities. A fundamental principle of MR imaging is that the signal intensity of pixels is based on the relaxation of hydrogen nuclei protons in a static magnetic field. The T1 relaxation times between two tissues vary substantially. Edema, fat infiltration, and fibrosis also cause differences in T1 relaxivity.

name: Bronchoconstriction
label: Bronchoconstriction
definition: Tightening of smooth muscle surrounding the bronchi and bronchioles with consequent wheezing and shortness of breath.

name: Formation of multiple pronuclei during fertilization
label: Formation of multiple pronuclei during fertilization
definition: Pronuclei formation is a critical process during fertilisation. Normally, there are two pronuclei (2PN), including the paternal pronucleus and the maternal pronucleus, in the zygote after fertilisation. It is generally accepted that multiple pronuclei (MPN) formation is due to the abnormal extrusion of the second polar body or to abnormal fertilisation with multiple sperm. The MPN therefore can cause infertility and recurrent failure of IVF/ICSI.

name: Kinesiophobia
label: Kinesiophobia
definition: An excessive, irrational and debilitating fear to carry out a physical movement, due to a feeling of vulnerability to a painful injury or reinjury.

name: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of bicarbonate
label: Impaired renal tubular reabsorption of bicarbonate
definition: Decreased renal tubular reabsorption of bicarbonate.

name: History of congenital HPV infection
label: History of congenital HPV infection
definition: A congenital human papillomavirus (HPV) infection of the newborn. Congential HPV infection can manifest as condyloma cuminata in the newborn.

name: Anti-desmoglein-1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-desmoglein-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoglein-1, a dermal cell adhesion molecule.

name: Anti-desmoglein-3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-desmoglein-3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoglein-3, a dermal cell adhesion molecule.

name: Anti-envoplakin antibody positivity
label: Anti-envoplakin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against envoplakin, a cytoskeletal linker protein that links intermediate filaments to cellular junctions.

name: Anti-periplakin antibody positivity
label: Anti-periplakin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against periplakin.

name: Anti-desmoplakin I antibody positivity
label: Anti-desmoplakin I antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoplakin-1.

name: Anti-desmoplakin II antibody positivity
label: Anti-desmoplakin II antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against desmoplakin-II.

name: Anti-BP230 antibody positivity
label: Anti-BP230 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against BP230.

name: Anti-BP180 antibody positivity
label: Anti-BP180 antibody positivity
definition: Bullous pemphigoid (BP) is an autoimmune disease associated with subepidermal blistering due to autoantibodies directed against BP180 and BP230. BP180 is currently considered as the major pathogenic autoantigen.

name: Anti-laminin 332 antibody positivity
label: Anti-laminin 332 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-332.

name: Anti-laminin 6 antibody positivity
label: Anti-laminin 6 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin-6.

name: Anti-laminin gamma1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-laminin gamma1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against laminin gamma-1.

name: Anti-laminin antibody positivity
label: Anti-laminin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a laminin. Laminins are major components of the basement membrane.

name: Anti-integrin antibody positivity
label: Anti-integrin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against an integrin. Integrins are a family of cell adhesion moleculeswith 24 known integrin heterodimers. Integrins transduce mechanical and biochemical signals from fibrotic extracellular matrix into the cell, activate latent TGFbeta, and subsequently modulate fibroblast adhesion, migration, and growth.

name: Anti-transglutaminase 6 antibody
label: Anti-transglutaminase 6 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against transglutaminase 6.

name: anti-LAD-1 antibody positivity
label: anti-LAD-1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against LAD-1, which is the soluble 120 kDa ectodomain of BP180.

name: Anti-LABD97 antibody positivity
label: Anti-LABD97 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against LABD97, which is structurally identical to a portion of the extracellular domain of BPAg2. BPAg2, a 180 kDa bullous pemphigoid antigen, is a transmembrane protein important for basement membrane cohesion.

name: Antigliadin antibody positivity
label: Antigliadin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against gliadin.

name: Anti-reticulin antibody positivity
label: Anti-reticulin antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against reticulin.

name: Anti-type VII collagen antibody
label: Anti-type VII collagen antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against collagen type VII.

name: False perception of self-motion
label: False perception of self-motion
definition: A perception that one's body is moving or swaying despite lack of motion of the body.

name: Non-spinning vertigo
label: Non-spinning vertigo
definition: A perception of unsteadiness of dizziness that is not characterized bythe spinning sensation of classic vertigo, but rather by an oscillatory perception (rocking, bobbing, or swaying despite the fact that the subject is not moving).

name: Infection-ssociated lymphopenia
label: Infection-ssociated lymphopenia
definition: Decreased lymphocyte count during infections.

name: Primary obstructive megaureter
label: Primary obstructive megaureter
definition: Megaurater associated with obstruction or an adynamic ureteral segment in the ureterovesical junction.

name: Encysted hydrocele of the cord
label: Encysted hydrocele of the cord
definition: A type of hydrocele testis in which both the proximal and distal portions of processus vaginalis get obliterated while the central portion remains patent and fluid accumulates within it.

name: Congenital hydrocele
label: Congenital hydrocele
definition: Congenital hydrocele occurs when processus vaginalis is patent and communicates with the peritoneal cavity. This communication allows the movement of peritoneal fluid but is too small to allow the intra-abdominal contents to herniate through.

name: Infantile hydrocele
label: Infantile hydrocele
definition: Infantile Hydrocele is a type pf hydrocele in which the processus vaginalis gets obliterated at the level of the deep inguinal ring. However, the portion distal to it remains patent and allows fluid accumulation.

name: Reduced proportion of mucosal-associated invariant T cells
label: Reduced proportion of mucosal-associated invariant T cells
definition: A decreased proportion of circulating mucosal-associated invariant T (MAIT) cells relative to total T cell count.

name: Puerpural onset
label: Puerpural onset
definition: Onset of a phenotypic abnormality or a disease during childbirth or in the period immediately following.

name: AA amyloidosis
label: AA amyloidosis
definition: Extracellular tissue deposition of fibrils that are composed of fragments of and/or intact serum amyloid A protein, a hepatic acute phase reactant.

name: Fracture type
label: Fracture type
definition: Category of fracture. Terms from this subontology can be used together with terms in the subontology that descends from Bone fracture (HP:0020110).

name: Greenstick fracture
label: Greenstick fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the broken bone is not completely separated.

name: Transverse fracture
label: Transverse fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the break is in a straight line across the bone.

name: Spiral fracture
label: Spiral fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the break spirals around the bone.

name: Oblique fracture
label: Oblique fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which there is a diagonal break across the bone.

name: Compression fracture
label: Compression fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the bone is crushed, causing the broken bone to be wider or flatter in appearance.

name: Comminuted fracture
label: Comminuted fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the break is in three or more pieces and fragments are present at the fracture site.

name: Segmental fracture
label: Segmental fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the same bone is fractured in two places, so there is a floating segment of bone.

name: Open fracture
label: Open fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which there is an open wound or break in the skin near the site of the broken bone.

name: Closed fracture
label: Closed fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the broken bone that does not penetrate the skin.

name: Avulsion fracture
label: Avulsion fracture
definition: A type of fracture that is localied near to a a tendon or ligament and a small fragment of bone is separated from the main mass of bone as a result of physical trauma.

name: Displaced fracture
label: Displaced fracture
definition: A type of fracture in which the ends of the fractured bone are no longer aligned.

name: Exanthem
label: Exanthem
definition: A widespread rash.

name: Intestinal inflammation
label: Intestinal inflammation
definition: A reaction characterizeds by capillary dilatation, leukocytic infiltration, redness, heat, pain, swelling localized to the in the intestinal tract.

name: Abnormal apoptosis
label: Abnormal apoptosis
definition: Any abnormality of programmed cell death (apoptosis), which is defined as the orchestrated collapse of a cell characterised by membrane blebbing, cell shrinkage, condensation of chromatin, and fragmentation of DNA followed by rapid engulfment of the corpse by neighbouring cells. Apoptosis is distinguished from death by necrosis by the absence of an associated inflammatory response.

name: Decreased FasL-mediated apoptosis
label: Decreased FasL-mediated apoptosis
definition: A reduced amount of programmed cell death upon stimulation of the FAS receptor, which normally induces caspase-8 dependent apoptosis.

name: Glomerular proteinuria
label: Glomerular proteinuria
definition:
A type of proteinuria characterized by increased permeability of the glomerular capillary wall to macromolecules (particularly albumin), whereby protein excretion can reach 20 g/24 h and consists mainly of albumin. 
PMID: 19634399

name: Abnormal lung development
label: Abnormal lung development
definition: A structural defect associated with abnormal development of the lung.

name: Pancreatic alpha-cell hyperplasia
label: Pancreatic alpha-cell hyperplasia
definition: A diffuse and specific increase in the number of alpha-cells.

name: 3-4 metacarpal synostosis
label: 3-4 metacarpal synostosis
definition: A congenital hand malformation characterized by the coalescence of the coalescence of third and fourth metacarpals (i.e., those corresponding to the middle and ring fingers).

name: Abnormal iliac artery morphology
label: Abnormal iliac artery morphology
definition: Any structural anomaly of the iliac artery.

name: Iliac artery aneurysm
label: Iliac artery aneurysm
definition: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the iliac artery.

name: Abnormal interest
label: Abnormal interest
definition: Any deviation from normal intensity or subject of a person's interests, which can be defined as a state of giving selective attention to something.

name: Persistent preoccupation with parts of objects
label: Persistent preoccupation with parts of objects
definition: A type of abnormal interest characterized by a persistent and intense focus in parts of a toy/object. For examples, affected individuals may spin the wheels on a toy car rather than driving the toy car.

name: Circumscribed interests
label: Circumscribed interests
definition: Highly restricted, fixated interests that are abnormal in intensity or focus (e.g., strong attachment to or preoccupation with unusual objects, excessively circumscribed or perseverative interests).

name: Abnormal verbal communicative behavior
label: Abnormal verbal communicative behavior
definition: Any abnormal behavior related to communication with language.

name: Pronoun reversal
label: Pronoun reversal
definition: A type of language impairment in which incorrect pronouns are used; i.e., using 'I' for 'you' and/or 'you' for 'I' (e.g., a child saying 'You want some more milk' meaning 'I want some more milk'). Reversal errors involve the person component, such that 'I' and 'you' become confused.

name: Idiosyncratic language
label: Idiosyncratic language
definition: Inappropriate use of words that have no phonological or semantic similarity to the intended word.

name: Abnormal production of facial expressions
label: Abnormal production of facial expressions
definition: An abnormality in the subdomain of nonverbal communication which involves a reduction in or atypical production of emotional facial expressions.

name: Hand-leading gestures
label: Hand-leading gestures
definition: Taking other people by the hand to places they wish them to move to or taking someone's hand to objects they want them to manipulate.

name: Fixated interest with abnormal focus
label: Fixated interest with abnormal focus
definition: A fixated interest in a specific topic that is atypical for the social context of the individual, such as topics of a non-social nature like fossils or vacuum cleaners.

name: Fixated interest with abnormal intensity
label: Fixated interest with abnormal intensity
definition: An abnormally intense interest in a topic or object that is not atypical for the social context of the affected person.

name: Sensory seeking
label: Sensory seeking
definition: Unusual interest in sensory aspects of the environment.

name: Lack of social initiations
label: Lack of social initiations
definition: Failure of a person to initiate social interactions with others. For a social interaction to have been initiated by someone, there must have been an absence of social interactions from either party for a period. The interaction must also be unprompted from another party.

name: Reduced use of typical gestures
label: Reduced use of typical gestures
definition: A diminished use of typical non-verbal conversational gestures such as shaing the head to indicate no or nodding the head to indicate yes.

name: Reduced collaborative play
label: Reduced collaborative play
definition: Impairment in a child's ability to be able to play in a way that involves peer collaboration. Collaborative play involves things such as verbal and non-verbal communication (e.g., self-initiated interactions), turn-taking, sharing, reciprocity, and collaborative problem-solving. It is often contrasted to parallel play, which involves a form of social play in which two children do similar activities near each other and often mimic each other. Typically developing children develop collaborative play between the ages of 4 and 5.

name: Absence of interest in peers
label: Absence of interest in peers
definition: Lack of interest of an individual for peers of comparable age and social groups.

name: Reduced sharing of interests
label: Reduced sharing of interests
definition: Decreased sharing of interests with others.

name: Reduced object sharing
label: Reduced object sharing
definition: An absence or reduction in object sharing. Object sharing is an early emerging social skill in which a child will share objects with parents or peers during object play. Object sharing typically develops within the first two years of life.

name: Anti-AK5 antibody positivity
label: Anti-AK5 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-adenylate kinase 5 (AK5).

name: Anti-AMPAR antibody positivity
label: Anti-AMPAR antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against anti-alpha-amino-3-hydroxy-5-methyl-4-isoxazolepropionic acid receptor (AMPAR).

name: Anti-Amphiphysin antibody
label: Anti-Amphiphysin antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Amphiphysin.

name: Anti-ARHGAP26 antibody
label: Anti-ARHGAP26 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Rho GTPase-activating protein 26 (ARHGAP26).

name: Anti-CARP VIII antibody
label: Anti-CARP VIII antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Carbonic anhydrase-related protein VIII (CARPVIII).

name: Anti-CASPR2
label: Anti-CASPR2
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against contactin-associated protein-like 2 (CASPR2).

name: Anti-CV2/CRMP5 antibody
label: Anti-CV2/CRMP5 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against CV2/CRMP5. Anti-CV2/CRMP5 autoantibody is the most commonly detected anti-neuronal autoantibody. Patients with typical paraneoplastic chorea show fully developed chorea in the course of weeks to months with acute inflammation in the striatum.

name: Anti-DPPX antibody
label: Anti-DPPX antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against dipeptidyl-peptidase-like protein 6 (DPPX).

name: Anti-FGFR3 antibody positivity
label: Anti-FGFR3 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against FGFR3.

name: Anti-GABA(A)R antibody
label: Anti-GABA(A)R antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against gamma-aminobutyric acid A receptor, i.e., GABA(A)R.

name: Anti-GABA(B)R antibody
label: Anti-GABA(B)R antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against gamma-aminobutyric acid B receptor, i.e., GABA(B)R.

name: Anti-GAD65 antibody
label: Anti-GAD65 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glutamic acid decarboxylase 65 (GAD65).

name: Anti-Gephyrin antibody
label: Anti-Gephyrin antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Gephyrin.

name: Anti-GFAP antibody
label: Anti-GFAP antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against glial fibrillary acidic protein (GFAP).

name: Anti-GlyR antibody
label: Anti-GlyR antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Glycine receptor (GlyR).

name: Anti-Homer-3 antibody
label: Anti-Homer-3 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Homer-3.

name: Anti-Hu antibody positivity
label: Anti-Hu antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Hu.

name: Anti-Iglon5 antibody
label: Anti-Iglon5 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against immunoglobulin-like cell adhesion molecule 5 (IgLON5).

name: Anti-ITPR1 antibody
label: Anti-ITPR1 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against inositol 1,4,5-trisphosphate receptor 1 (ITPR1).

name: Anti-Kelch like protein 11 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Kelch like protein 11 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against kelch-like protein 11 (KLHL11).

name: Anti-LGI1 antibody
label: Anti-LGI1 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against leucine-rich glioma-inactivated 1 (LGI1).

name: Anti-Ma antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ma antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma.

name: Anti-Ma2 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ma2 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma2.

name: Anti-Ma1 antibody positivity
label: Anti-Ma1 antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ma1.

name: Anti-mGluR1 antibody
label: Anti-mGluR1 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against metabotropic glutamate receptor 1 (mGluR1).

name: Anti-mGluR5 antibody
label: Anti-mGluR5 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 (mGluR5).

name: Anti-neurexin-3alpha antibody
label: Anti-neurexin-3alpha antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against neurexin-3alpha.

name: Anti-P/Q-type VGCC antibody positivity
label: Anti-P/Q-type VGCC antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against P/Q-type voltage-gated calcium channels (VGCCs).

name: Anti-MAP1B antibody
label: Anti-MAP1B antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against microtubule-associated protein 1B (MAP1B).

name: Anti-PKCgamma antibody
label: Anti-PKCgamma antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against protein kinase Cgamma.

name: Anti-Ri antibody
label: Anti-Ri antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ri, ,an antineuronal antibody.

name: Anti-Septin-5 antibody
label: Anti-Septin-5 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Septin-5.

name: Anti-SEZ6L2 antibody
label: Anti-SEZ6L2 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against seizure-related 6 homolog like 2 (SEZ6L2).

name: Anti-SOX1 antibody
label: Anti-SOX1 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against SOX1. Anti-SOX1 antibodies, also known as antiglial nuclear antibody (AGNA), are specifically found in paraneoplastic neurological disorders. Since SOX1 is expressed in neuronal precursor cells in the developing central nervous system, it has been used as an early marker of neural stem cells.

name: Anti-Tr/DNER antibody
label: Anti-Tr/DNER antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Tr/DNER. Anti-Tr antibodies are directed against cerebellar Purkinje cells (termed anti-Tr or PCA-Tr). Anti-Tr autoantibodies are frequently associated with Hodgkin lymphoma (HL). Anti-Tr antibodies are defined by a specific staining pattern in cerebellar tissue that is characterized by punctate immunoreactivity in both the dendritic tree and soma of Purkinje cells but not in their axons. This characteristic pattern is indicative of the presence of anti-Tr antibodies. The Delta/Notch-like epidermal growth factor-related receptor (DNER) was identified as the target antigen of anti-Tr.

name: Anti-TRIM46 antibody
label: Anti-TRIM46 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against the axon initial segment protein tripartite motif 46 (TRIM46).

name: Anti-TRIM9/TRIM67 antibody
label: Anti-TRIM9/TRIM67 antibody
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against TRIM9/TRIM67.

name: Anti-Yo antibody positivity
label: Anti-Yo antibody positivity
definition: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Yo.
